column13: Halloween was efficient with many on the line. The week before that many were waiting several times (just when we were there) because the cashier would casually take breaks to change out garbage cans (then wash her hands!) and whatever else she decided to do. Maybe they were short staffed that day, but it seems like someone needed a lesson in priorities.

Food quality was good. I eat at chipotle in Chicago and Naperville daily and never have I been told they do not have salad dressing for the salad I ordered. Not only do they not have any, but they weren't going to make any. I think this is completely unacceptable especially since I wasn't warned as I ordered my salad. Furthermore, I wasn't offered a replacement meal and was left with no other choice but to eat a dry mundane salad. Very poor customer service and operations at this location.
Dear Chipotle, I get the cost control thing...but when you set certain expectations and then start to skimp on portions to save a buck. I won't come back. Be consistent. I won't be back.

Idk but I got one of the best services from chipotle so far 
I walked in almost closing time n this lady n I don mind to sound racist but I'm really bad with names  but this Chinese looking lady :( (sorry if she's not Chinese) she's wonderful!!
I was there (4-5-16) closing time n wow 
The way she served me was one of the best

This location needs help! The food is NOT persistent!! The meat is usually over done, not fresh, burned! The rice today tasted horrible(too salty), the quac wasnt fresh and they are so cheap with the ingredients. No joke. On top of this, the staff is super rude, not friendly. Kind of like " what the heck do you want" type of attitude. I hope this location gets help because this is the closest location to my house

Is it just me or are the meet portions getting smaller and smaller everytime I come here. Also I think the guac recipe changed because its not as refreshing as i remember (or maybe it is just this location). The staff was very fast and courteous. Great location. The food was less desireable as the chicken / steak was dry even though it came straight from the oven top. This is the location closest to me so i will give it another try. I still love chipotle
Getting skimpy on the servings I see....not cool. Especially when I'm paying extra for guacamole and you give me less than half of the serving spoon. Not cool!

Update:- 
I am writing an updated review here as I thought a one liner was not fair enough. I have been to multiple Chipotle, though the quantity was always a question, I liked the food. This one is closer to my home so been there like many times. But 11/25 me and my wife were here and we wouldn't go back to this location anymore. Rude server, like she was in a hurry or something, my tacos had 3 cubes of grilled chicken and she moved on!! Why do i pay 6.50? My wife asked for extra guacamole and there she shows a smirk and nod like she was tired of scoooing it out. Didn't see the name but was an asian lady. 

Anyway that wasn't the point.

This has happened before. They are rude except just 2 people I think, they are cheerful youngsters. And the quantity they put on is like "hey if I give you theres nothing left for us or something". Degraded quality of service.

So we tried Qdoba yesterday night, which made me rewrite my review and we are not coming back Chipotle, save all that guacamole that you can.

Original:-
Very bad service. Quantity is way too less. Do not deserve even a single star. Never gonna go again. Better to grab from Qudoba or taco bells.

Let me start off by saying I love Chipotle. I easily eat at a Chipotle location 1-3 times per week, I have to say that this visit was exceptionally bad. Terrible, cannot express today's events.  My food was absolutely DISGUSTING and the service was beyond ATROCIOUS. Moreover, they made me look like a fool when I gave rancid food to my family. The order number is 275 for reference.

What a DISGUSTING restaurant (I can't stress that enough). I came in on Sunday and was served guacamole which was nearly black in color. I asked the person serving the food for a new batch and they replied it was was made today.To make matters worse, I overheard the two employees who had served my dish state that it didn't look right, and asked each other if the avocados were from yesterday. Of course, this came up after my food had been made.  

Secondly, after my food was made I waited several minutes to get rang up. The two people that served me spoke with one another for a few minuets and only asked for someone to find the cashier when another customer complained. People in line behind me started to question when they would get rang up. At one point, I was the only person waiting in line, but it soon swell to 4 or 5 people.  No one could find the cashier and ultimately someone opened the bathroom door and shouted her name. Sure enough she was in the bathroom. No big deal, but she came back and hadn't washed her hands. I was in disbelief. 
  
Soon after arriving home, my father tasted the guacamole and commented that the color wasn't right and that it tasted odd. I then proceeded to taste the guacamole and found it to be bitter and almost putrid. It was beyond disgusting. I had to rinse my mouth out. 

I then called the store and asked to speak with the manager. The gentleman who answered was somewhat understanding, but did not resolve the issue. I explained that the guacamole was rancid and also expressed my concerns about the service. He asked me to drive back and they could give me a refund. He stated that other stores were experiencing the same quality issues with their avocados,  I don't find this to be a satisfactory response. He should have decided to 86 the item or remake the guacamole. It's not okay to serve food that is substandard. This is how people get sick. Driving back to the store was not worth the trip, so I told him I would contact corporate rather than drive back for a 10 dollar refund. Going forward, I will not be visiting this location and may reevaluate going to other Chipotle/Shophouse restaurants for lunch.

I had chicken bowl at this place, fell sick immediately within 3hrs. 
Beware! 
Will inform Health Dept.

I've been to this location several times and don't think I'll ever go back again.

It used to be decent but maybe the management changed or Chipotle changed how they do things. The employees seemed disgruntled, unhappy, and careless about their job.

I gave them one last try and the food was terrible...

The lettuce was old and had brown edges. It didn't taste right.
The rice was hard and half-cooked.
The meat was tough and wasn't seasoned well.
The mild salsa was like water

0 stars for service
0 stars for food
5 stars for wait time. there was no one there at dinner time on a weekend. I guess word spreads fast.

This place used to be good.  With all the problems that Chipotle is experiencing I think it is beginning to affect all restaurants.  I never had a problem here till recently.  on 3/22/16 we ordered two steak bowls with brown rice and the steak was real dry and grizzly.  Guacamole is getting ridiculously expensive and the chips were stale.  Not what I had expected for dinner that night.  A real disappointment. I guess it will be vege from now on or nothing as I am very disappointed!  Dont know how long the chain will last at this point.
Good food. Expensive for what you get. Won't mix up burrito if you ask. Service is fast. A solid place for decent mexican food at a fast causal place.

Hoped to have a much better experience and could have if the customer service was better.  I was asked to wait for 7 minutes to chicken while they finished cooking the chicken.  They asked if I wanted a drink while I wait, which is why there are two stars instead of one.  Kind gesture. 

When I went to order 3 bowls (two chicken and one veggie), they asked if I wanted white or brown rice, when I said brown in all three she indicated "this is all we have left", both brown AND white rice didn't not even a spoonful.  She asked if a guy cutting the chicken could make more and he said no because they didn't have any cilantro.  So, no rice.  

As they put the chicken in two, I reminded her the third was to be a Veggie bowl.  "We're out of veggies".  Really?!  Mind you, it was 1:30 on a Wednesday. 

As I was checking out, I let the woman know how disappointed I was that the rice and veggies were out and not being restocked.  She listened and charged me the full price and sent me on my way.    When I opened it up, all three bowls were basically soup from the salsa and black beans.  Disgusting.  I'm glad I asked for extra lettuce, but all three bowls were still only half full.  I understand if restaurants run out of items but not making accommodations with substitutes or discounts devalues the entire brand.  Two days ago they did a promotion giving away a free burrito/bowl which I did not participate in. Today I was IN the restaurant, PURCHASING 3.  They probably should have closed while they restocked rather than carry on so ill prepared.  Rice, after all, is a staple there for ALL orders.

Worst service ever. There's an asian lady working there that was, by far, the worst food service worker that I have ever had the displeasure of meeting. First she snapped at me because I wasn't speaking loud enough, then asked me multiple times what I wanted next even though I was almost shouting. And when I asked for more cheese she literally made a show picking exactly three strands of cheese to put in my bowl. Never, ever going back there even though it's the closet Chipotle to my house and I am a die hard Chipotle fan. They couldn't keep me away even during the food poisoning scare but this lady is worse than any food borne pathogen that exists in this world.

I got a big chunk of pork in my vegan sofrita bowl.I don't eat animals for spiritual reasons and this really pisses me off.Im just furious you guys have this level of disregard for people's food choices.I will never go to chipotle again and will always talk down about chipotle to anyone I know.You guys make me sick.Its insane how a place like this with so many food issues in the past is allowed to run.Despicable...

Great service, staff was very concerned about our happiness. That asked us if we liked our margaritas. Glad the margaritas didn't have too much ice like the other locations,The steak was not over cooked. Place was kept clean and the bathroom was clean too.

Well this place has started putting out some fierce burrito competition to the Streets of Woodfield location.

I've had a few mediocre burritos from here, but they have been consistently good size and flavor within the last couple of visits.  I used to strictly avoid this one and go to the Streets of Woodfield location.

I've enjoyed my last few visits and have devoured the burritos with ferocity.

 This location has really come around and are putting out some quality burritos.
Better than the one at the streets. Nicer staff and bigger portions. Don't know why it has such a low rating. Keep up the good work chipotle team
Standard Chipotle, great food, staff did not really shine on this visit. Lots of goofing around behind the counter, even with about 6 people in line.

I ordered online wanting to pick up and asked if it was okay to pay in three different ways. LOL at that guy working telling me not to pay separate orders on a take out because he "has customers" and points to the line... What do i look like bozo? Am i not a customer?  Is an hour notice too short? I used my chipotle app how it is suppose to be used so i dont need goofy side remarks. Salad  had to been sitting and wasn't made fresh ... This chipotle slacking

I find this Chipotle to have the friendliest employees (ahem, the one at Streets... Boo.). It gets surprisingly busy, given the somewhat odd location, but we're always through the line in no-time when there is one. There's a guy who works there with a map tattooed on his wrist, and he is always so cheerful. Make sure to exchange at least one sentence with him if you spot him. It'll make your day!

The worst experience I have ever had at a Chipotle...we waited almost 10 mintues before anyone bothered helping us. As I watch the 10 employees around the store only one lady was actually willing to help customers. Five different employees actually came to the food preparing area but not one asked if they could help us. There was chicken on the grill burning and no one even bother to watch it, the employee who finally checked it saw it was burned but went to the back and cut it up anyway!  It was a high school social club in back....the only reason I am giving two stars is because the food was good. However I will no longer be visiting this location as the customer service was horrible.

Food is the same at every Chipotle. This location almost never gets a pick-up order correct. EZ guac, EZ cheese; not hard to imagine that means go easy on those items. Don't ask me to name each item with the person who ordered it and then number the items with no sense of purpose or according to the listing on the receipt. In addition, make sure the order is correct before giving it to me. As much as you think that's my job, it's actually yours. I've worked in food service for several years and their customer service, prep and delivery is horrid. We are right across the street from this location and have had to go to the one at Streets of Woodfield numerous times to get an order correct. That's ridiculous.

My least favorite Chipotle location, seriously, we have given them several 2nd chances and it always sucks, and the employees act like they would rather be absolutely anywhere else.  

Skip this one, and drive a bit East to the Streets of Woodfield location, and save yourself wasted time, money and energy.

The tortillas are usually warm and moist ...sometimes, and the staff is majority of the time, grumpy grumperkins.

If you're a Chipotle virgin, it's easy to catch on, and a new take on "fast food".  You approach the starting point and decide if you want your goodness wrapped up in a warm tortilla (or in some beefy cases double wrapped), or if you want to go with the burrito bowl option, or 3 tiny tacos.  I don't know much for the taco choice, I have seen others in my party make that choice, but it just seems like you get way less food, and meh, not my style.  I usually get a burrito bowl, with a to-go lid option incase I can't finish the whole thing in the restaurant...which is the majority of the time, as the portions are massive...massively delicious!  My husband always gets a double wrapped tortilla, because it is usually a huge burrito baby.  

After choosing your food holder, you get your pick of:
-Rice: white or brown ,
-Beans: Pinto or Black
-Grilled Veggie mix of onions + peppers sauteed together (can't get them separate, unless you ask for them to tediously pick out which pieces you do/don't want...but I've never seen that done... I would like to have just the onions, as my tummy is sensitive to peppers, so I wish they were separated, but they aren't so i avoid this step altogether because usually it is hella busy & basically always a steady stream of hungry hungry customers, so speed is essential as patron and burrito crafter)
-Meat: Spicy Barbacoa (steak), Medium-Spicy Chicken, and pulled apart pork (least spicy), and maybe another option, not sure, and they may or may not have/are introducing a tofu option?  But for vegetarian options, you can choose to go meatless, and get guacamole at NO EXTRA CHARGE, when if you DO get meat, adding guac is like 1.80 extra... I think... Not exactly sure, as the hubbs & I have been trying to severely minimize our animal products so we always get guac in place of a meat, and don't get charged extra for it anymore.
-Salsa choices...spicy, and medium? Not sure, I don't get the liquidy salsa, I just move on to the tomato mixture, and the corn mix...
-Sour Cream (when I used to get it, before going Vegan-ish, I would get the sour cream and it would always be... kind of rauncy, and tummy pain, it was tangy and not good, sketchy...
-Cheese: shredded
-Chopped Romaine lettuce
-and guac... FOR EXTRA! They will always ask you, "the guacamole is extra, is that ok?" **Unless you did NOT get any meat, then guac is NOT extra**

Then you're done assembling your mexican grill creation before your very eyes!  You can then choose the ever popular Chips + Guac side dish, and they have a fridge behind the cashier with a variety of juices, Horizon Milk boxes, Coronas, and possibly margaritas, but I think that's new...and the different variety of soda dispension and lemonade.

There is some seating inside, not sure if any outside... not very memorable

I go to this chipotle at least once a week, if I had unlimited money I'd probably be here almost every day.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  Every time I place an online or fax order they give me a call after to make sure everything was right.  Once my food wasn't ready for pick up so they gave me a pop for free while I waited which was nice.  I assumed chipotle would be standard across the board, yet I was proven wrong when I've gone to other Chipotles and thought the food just wasn't as good and I ended up tossing it out instead of finishing it.  Never had that happen here.  See you guys next week! (and the week after...and the week after that...)

I come from the city, where most places have pretty bad customer service. This Chipotle has every other place I've been to beat, by far. 

For starters, they literally put 4 little pieces of chicken on each of my tacos. As I moved down the line, the girl adding ingredients seemed to be bothered by something, as she had an attitude. Then the next young lady serving up the guacamole began speaking in spanish with the girl who had the attitude. Little did they know I am also fluent in spanish, and did not find it tasteful that they were talking badly about a few of the customers. 

Don't even bother asking for extra ANYTHING, you'll get so little it's not even worth the breath it would take to ask for extra. 

This is my third time here and it's sad to admit it has been just as bad of an experience each time. 

I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CHIPOTLE.

Well, it's a Chipotle. It serves its purpose. 

The service is efficient and friendly, with smiles and "thank you"s in abundance. 

The dining room and beverage stations are very clean; as soon as a customer leaves any mess, a staff member immediately comes to clean things up. 

I don't dig the communal seating. It has a weird, Oliver Twist vibe, at least to me.   I felt closed-in and uncomfortable. I don't like to be shoulder-to-shoulder against strangers when eating, kthx. Eating outside is an option sometimes, but (a) I don't eat outside in the rain, and (b) I don't like bugs flying around me and my food while I eat. Which is why I park my sweet little butt indoors to eat. 

In the end, Chipotle is Chipotle, which pleases me. I'd come back. :-)
I am sorry to say but everyone of their establishments that I have eaten at the meat is ice cold - I think people get sick from their meat that is not being tempted

Somewhat busy... the wait is at least ten minutes long. Few of the people behind us just bailed out of the restaurant at once. I cant recommend this as one of their faster establishments. Their portions are generous tho. And the staff seem friendly enough.

Every time I go to this Chipotle location I am disappointed. They mess up our online orders, the tomatoes are green or practically white. The mild and medium salsa tastes like nothing, or sweet. Its just bland and not good quality. I should go to the Chipotle in Bloomingdale and bring that to work rather than running out on my lunch break to get fresh food here. Bloomingdale's ingredients are always so fresh and flavorful! You would think when the line in Hoffman Estates is out the door at lunch the food would taste fresher and better but that is so not true!

My First day in Schaumburg and we went to this place for lunch. First of all they give small quantity compere to other chipotle. I don't kw why?... We did nt go this particular chipotle after thid experience even though it is walking distance from my place

This is the first poorly run Chipolte I have visited.  Terrible service - inattentive workers who laugh when they mess up an order.  Management seems non-existent.  I would not come back to this place.
Went in on a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't busy, there were at least 8 employees standing around yet this place was filthy!! Wow

There is no doubt that Chipotle restaurants are basically all the same in terms of food quality.  The food at this location is always good and I have never had a concern about what I was consuming.  

My concern lies within the service that is provided.  Twice now, I have ordered from a girl who seemed to hate the fact that she was working there, especially when it came to interacting with customers.  During my most recent visit, this is what happened- I am a vegetarian, so I ordered a veggie bowl.  Simple enough, right?  The girl I placed my initial order with said "okay", then proceeded to put steak onto the bowl.  I asked her if she could remove the steak, because I wanted a veggie bowl and had ordered a veggie bowl.  I don't think I was rude or short with her in any fashion, but she proceeded to roll her eyes, stomp over to a garbage can and forcibly throw the steak bowl away.  She then came back and started making a veggie bowl and said "there, you have a veggie bowl".  Now I know that people can get tired at work and customers can be demanding, but I feel as though my request was a normal and simple one.  I really don't think it is appropriate to react in this manner toward anyone, let alone a customer while you are working.  This was disappointing.

I do recommend this location as it has good food and is in a good area.  However, I do think that the actions this employee displayed should be addressed.

My big complaint with this place is that my burritos always explode, even when I don't get a lot on them. The food is good, the staff is friendly and quick, but they can't wrap a burrito. This is the only Chipotle I have been to where burrito explosions have been a consistent  problem. Therefore I would have to recommend getting a burrito bowl instead of a burrito.
Generally this is a very busy location.  The staff is usually very quick and generous with their portions.  This is my favorite Chipotle in the area!
No matter where, I love Chipotle! ;0)

A third Chipotle in Schaumburg, (technically this is in hoffman estates) wow we are really lucky.  This one is very good just like the others, same high quality food.  Now it's just a matter of the insides compared to the other ones and the service.

They have weird lighting in there and I'm not really sure why each table is individually lit instead of using overhead lighting.  The ambient lighting (at lunch time) was good enough but the overhead washes that all out.

The washroom for the men is a waste of space, it's far too big for a 1 person bathroom, it really should have been made smaller because there are too few seats in this place.

The service was great as I have come to expect out of my lunch place of choice.  I go between 2-5x a week and I expect that any Chipotle I go to has great food and service.  Both were met here.  There was just one catch, the person that wrote on my burrito, I think she was new so this is forgivable, wrote so hard she punctured the foil and wrote on the burrito shell itself.  I did not notice until I was halfway done with my food since the C was in the middle.  I ate it, no big, but really should be more careful about it.  I must say she was the only person not smiling and enjoying her job.

Depending on how bad the lines keep up (there was about 10 people in line when we showed up, I may continue to return to the Barrington rd location.

This particular location is awesome! Food is always top notch and the service is fast and friendly. I've never been ignored and even if there's a line, I'm out of there in 10 minutes. If you want Chipotle, go to this location. I've been to several others that have had terrible service and one time I bit into my burrito only to pull a piece of metal that fell off of a cleaning brush out of my mouth!

This Chipotle is so horrible it cant even be found on their website. Its there, but is not listed on anything, not even Google Maps.

Here is the major thing that is wrong with this location: THE MUSIC IS TOO DAMN LOUD. The staff cannot hear you when you order, also the 6 foot tall sneeze guard does not help. In additional combination of having a high turn over rates for employes, my order almost always starts wrong. 

Here is a typical order from this location:
Approach counter, get on your tip toes so your mouth is over the edge the sneeze guard, talk loudly over the music. Ask for a Burrito Bowl with white rice and no beans. Server proceeds to make a regular burrito with white rice and black beans. They cannot hear you interrupt them while they make the wrong order, but when they finally hear what you want, they start over and on the 2nd attempt, maybe make the write thing.
This does not stop here, they proceed to mishear you on the type of meat and additional ingredient. 
They know very well that they cant hear you clearly and yet the music is playing oh so loud.

As far as a high turn over rate for employees, I see fresh faces everytime I visit, all this means is that no one can roll a burrito. I dont even order one here anymore. The few times I did, it was a straight up chode, each time. 
But this is right next to where I work and whenever I crave it, I go here. I would give them maybe 2 stars but just earlier today they screwed up a simple order and another coworker who's order was placed over the phone that I picked up was completely wrong.

Turn down the music and remove that stupid sneeze guard, customers cant be heard over it.

I've been a fan of chipotle for awhile now, been good at avoiding it since I could be easily talked into eating there once a week!  This location is very easy to get to on the way home too.  So in the first two months I visited three times, thanks to the free coupon they sent!  It is now my quick, guilty pleasure of choice!

Service is good and fast.  I like the decor, it's different than other Chipotle locations I've been to in a good way.

Music is always way to damn loud, can barely hear myself think when eating there. Employees usually rush you through to fast to even try and get the order correct. I might take the extra ten minutes to drive up to streets for a better experience.
Best Chipotle in Schaumburg. Never had an issue with their burritos or burrito bowls.

I was so excited when I saw there was going to be a Chipotle on my way home from work- I couldn't wait for it to open!  The food is great, as it is in all Chipotles. But the service is TERRIBLE!  
I have been here 3 times around 8:30pm and each time the service got progressively worse. The last time I was there, I stood at the counter for almost 5 minutes before I was helped, it took about 2 minutes before I was even acknowledged. There was one employee helping another customer while another employee just stood by the register looking at receipts. Another employee walked up to the filthy grill as if to clean it, but just stood there and looked at it for a few moments, moved it away from the wall then walked away. 
When I finally got helped, the employee was completely distracted and took way too long to do simple tasks (I asked for a burrito on the side, she had to open a new package & it took almost 30 seconds just to open it & place a tortilla in the warmer). I ordered a burrito bowl & had to repeat what I wanted on it at least 3 times before the employee finally did it right. After I paid & looked in my bag to make sure it was all there, the tortilla wasn't there, I walked right back up to the register to ask about the tortilla & the employee looked confused. The man who was in line behind me (and now paying for his food) reached into his bag & said I think this is it, and handed me my tortilla. The employee just stood there, confused. The restaurat was not busy at all, but it took over 10 minutes to get my food. And the grill was still a filthy mess when I left. 
That was the worst service I have ever had. I'll give it another try because I love the food, but I sure hope service is better!!!!

Food is normally good, find out what has been cooked most recently, the chicken or steak and go with that option, how fresh the meat tastes makes the meal. I have found at this location the service is fair at best.
Monday, 9/26/16.  I wish I was there to see Joe Walsh tonight.  Three full hours!  Wow!  I'm listening on www.560theanswer.com.  Sounds like everyone is having a great time!

Went in for trivia night, the guy was a no show. 
The owner came out and totally made up for it with his own trivia contest. So it kind of salvaged the evening but it didn't entirely resolve the disappointment.
The service was nice, but the food was really blah at best. But its a bar so I shouldn't expect anything better. 
I'll try to come for trivia again and let them redeem themselves

This is a solid bar with great bar specials. It's large and spacious with friendly staff and decent food. They have live bands at times and a small outdoor area to chill. You can play darts, pool, and bags among the many upsides.

I love America's Bar. We come for trivia every Tuesday and absolutely love it. The waitress they have working Tuesday nights is fantastic. There's 30% off on Tuesdays which is really nice. The food isn't great which is why it loses one star. The onion rings are delicious but everything else is hit or miss. I love the atmosphere here any night of the week.

Firecracker salad to go was okay. I was craving a hearty buffalo chicken salad, so this was a good option. I got it to go and had it with a cold goose island, which helped wash it down. The popcorn chicken was probably just defrosted and pre made, because that's what it tasted like. Hearty for sure, and probably equivalent to what a microwave popcorn chicken on top of a bed of old lettuce would have tasted like.

We would not typically go to a bar like this at all but there was a pet rescue benefit so we did it for the pups. It's is nice that they would host an event like this so that might be worth some of the two stars. Lots of parking and ok location. The event itself was nicely organized but the service in the empty bar was substandard. We had to order several times from a very limited menu (which had a percentage going to the pet rescue) The waitress kept "forgetting". Very slow and sparse and again...this was early Friday evening and the bar was basically empty except for the thirty-50 or so people that came for the event. If you like this type of atmosphere then it's probably a great place to hang out. Not my style and not worth the slow service to go there again.
Love this place nice local spot to hang out and there big ass Long Island drinks are the bomb!

I stopped in here on Friday after work with some coworkers to unwind after a long week to blow off some steam. As per normal when I go out with people from work, I did not pick this place but it did the job for our needs (mostly medicinal drinking) quite nicely. I actually drive by this place all the time and had never even noticed it before for some odd reason. It's basically your garden variety sports/neighborhood bar, but that is not necessarily a bad thing. You do not have to bleed creativity and thematic brilliance to impress me, just cater to my "typical guy" needs and we are all good. It does the job in that regard brilliantly. 

The interior is pretty standard and what you would expect, with lots of flat screen TV's, random sports memorabilia, and one wall in particular that is a shrine of sorts with lots of pictures of the owner with celebs. For a guy that owns a bar in Hoffman Estates, he sure does seem to get around quite a bit. Play on playa. They also have especially trashily dressed bartenders and cocktail waitresses, which again, is far from uncommon in places like this. As a guy, it's not like you are going to find me complaining about gratuitous cleavage everywhere. Bring on the boobs. Naturally the other girls that were in our group were talking smack about this, which was somewhat amusing in it's own right. 

We posted up at one of the larger tables over near the dance floor (that I saw maybe 5 people on all night), and proceeded to order round after round in systematic fashion. Service was quick too! Even a little later when they got pretty busy, boobs girl was on point. Also watching her navigate around people with a full tray of drinks in her hand was pretty impressive. It was sort of like watching a professional baton twirler. 

The value here is fantastic compared to other places in the area for drinks. You will easily pay double for cocktails if you drive down the road into Schaumburg to a bar. The bartender also made the drinks STRONG. My Long Island could of been used to degrease engines. If it's to the point that I am making one of those grimace faces after taking a sip, then you know it is a frat house level drink. I was half twisted after only my second cocktail. 

This leads me to food. Just like on many other previous nights that I was not hungry initially, intoxication brings out the munchies so I ordered some appetizers for all of us to share. Most of the items on the menu are of the typical bar food variety (chicken tenders, potato skins, motz sticks, etc) but at least this place makes their own stuff from scratch instead of buying frozen. This is a quality that is as easy to identify as a girl with fake breasts when you eat out as much as I do.  The hand battered chicken tenders were sensational! Very crispy and they hook you up with a variety of dipping sauces. The other highlight was the nacho platter. It seems expensive at over 22 bucks, but wait til they bring it out. It is friggin gargantuan. You could feed half the population of a third world country with it. The food here is actually decent enough that I could even see stopping in when I am not drinking, which speaks volumes for places like this. 

Later on in the evening they had a DJ come in to play mostly top 40, dance and hip-hop songs. This made conversation somewhat difficult without going outside, but by this juncture in the evening I was pretty much over talking shop anyway. 

Overall, this is a great place to hang out on the weekends if you are local to the area. They offer decent food, cheap drinks, good service (with boobs) and a pretty cozy atmosphere. I am sure I will be back.

I can't believe this is my first time writing a review for this place after going here for years! I guess I will follow the lead of Yelpers who have written reviews and do a pros and cons list. 

Pros:
-The best karaoke in the burbs. Seriously. I've been several other places and this place has the best selection of songs and a cool DJ who isn't shitty to women. The DJ they used to have was totally lame, the new guy they have is way better. He can actually sing and he has fun with the crowd and does not think he is cooler than everyone else. 

-Drinks are pretty on point. You can't go wrong with the Big-Ass Tropical Long Island. It's a huge drink and is $10 on the weekends. Gets you drunk pretty quickly, I like it. 

-Food is not terrible. I have pretty much only had appetizers, but they are all pretty good. This is not a place for foodie freaks who want gluten-free, fat free nonsense. Just good old-fashioned bar fare. It is called AMERICA'S bar, you know ;)

Cons:
-Service can be pretty slow. I went lasts night and I was surprised they only had two or three bartenders and the bar was packed! We sat in the back room by the bags and darts and we definitely could have left without paying the tab. I think this is more of a staffing issue than anything else. 

-Dancing area is pretty small. For the most part, you can dance on the stage and it is fun, but if you want to just be low-key, it is pretty small. I want to say they could take out some tables in front, but they are already pressed for table space. My suggestion would be to take out the bags from the back room on busy nights and have a second DJ spinning in there, because there is definitely room for dancing back there. 

-CROWDED. I started coming a few years ago and It was nowhere near as crowded as it is now. I do think they might be a little lax on carding as well, because there are some people I see there that do not look 21 by any means. I think this would definitely thin the crowds, or maybe have some sort of capacity? I have never seen it as crowded as it was last night, maybe that has to do with it being the weekend of the 4th? Also, they have to move the smoking area or something, because you walk outside and it is like BOOOOM CIGARETTE SMOKE! 

Overall, not a bad place to spend an evening. I try to go on Thursdays because I am a karaoke nut and it is tons of fun. I don't think it is all that expensive, I paid $19.50 for a Big-Ass Tropical ($10), a beer, and a double Manhattan. Portions on food are good, music is always good, and it's generally an ok crowd. There are going to be jerks at any bar, so to insult this bar for their clientele is pretty stupid. I'd say give it a chance if you live in the area, it's a lot of fun.

i came here with incredibly low expectations - and because of that, i love this place! don't come here if you're looking for anything fancy. and don't be expecting stellar service or artisan cocktails either. but if you're in the mood for a good bar with decent food and cheapppppp drink specials, this is the spot!

there's lot of bar games - corn hole, darts, pool tables and slot machines. they have a TON of daily drink specials, i came here wednesday with some coworkers and they had $5 pitchers of shock top - um yes please. I also got the wings, which were pretty standard bar wings. moral of the story, come with low expectations and you'll have a lot of fun.

Total dive that likes to think its something its not. It wants to be a club but really comes off as a sports bar. The servers were rude, and got our oder wrong. The bouncers were heckling people as they came in, making fun of people for the clothes they're wearing. Not recommended.

Our waitress was not polite at all. I had high expectations coming in and i was dissapointed. May have been because it was on a Friday and their "it" day is on Thursdays. I would definitely come here again but i would try to on a Thursday.

Honestly for a cheap night out this place is perfect. 

The pros: 

- clean 
- new (or at least feels new) 
- open floor plan 
- lots of bar games (pools, darts, bags, etc.) 
- drink specials!! 


The cons: 

- some of the clientele is shady 
- the food is basic 
- the food is over priced for what it is 
- the service can be sloooooow if you aren't at the bar 

So decent bar with sub par food. What else is new? At least it's close to a garibaldis! 

The one thing that is inexcusable and should be worked on is the table service. Don't let people sit there with empty glasses. At least you're not paying and arm and a leg.
Fun evening, crowd can be a little too young.  Food was really good for the price. Check out the calendar for the dueling pianos, a guaranteed fun night!

What would normally be a good night was ruined by the dj playing ne-yo's "closer"  and usher's " baby tonight" and what ever that good feeling song is.  You weren't able to dance and it's such a shame because they have 2 stages that just go to waste.  It'd be a lot more fun with more danceable music.

**Note that my review is based on one visit on a Monday night.

I went here for a friend's birthday. They checked IDs at the door. The bartender was really nice. I got a Not Your Father's Root Beer and it was cheaper than usual (just over $5). 

The bar is spacious, and not crammed with tables, which is nice. We played bags for free. The place was mostly empty. Didn't really notice the music much. It's a pretty average place.

VERY expensive bar with easily the most greedy and least-accommodating owner of a bar that I've ever encountered in my life. A hangout for law enforcement and snobby suburbanites who think that they are better than everybody else simply because they are at a piano bar which is, in any case, located in an area of questionable repute in Hoffman Estates. 

Elitism and racism have always been problems here as well. Good thing I myself am Caucasian, and did not have to put up with anything over than over-priced drinks, pretentious snobbery, and uptight patrons. In short, it's entirely the wrong crowd conducive for having a good time without fears of being looked down upon and discriminated against.
I love this place! They have karaoke, baggo, pool, darts... My only problem is that they're expensive. Nice atmosphere though.

Beer Selection - (7/10)
Liquor Selection - (9/10)
Sports - (8/10)
Ambiance - (10/10)
Value - (10/10)
Service - (10/10)

'Merrka's! 
K...well, I've been putting off this review for a looong time! I'm a meticulous guy, and I just couldn't figure out how to rate a bar. Well, I've only had one practice review so far, but I think I got it...

I came here with a friend of mine sometime in early 2007 I think. It was just some random bar that opened, so we gave it a try after a particularly tortuous day. We sat at the bar and met Anthony and Kelli, our bartenders, and had one of the greatest nights ever! They were f'in awesome, so it prompted us to come the next Friday, and the next, and so on. Over the years, we have met and befriended just about everyone who works there, including Bill, the GM, and Richard Garcia, the owner of the place. For the sake of this 5,000 character limit, I need to get started with this review of The Classiest Bar In Hoffman Estates!

BEER
In 2007, they had the bare essentials. Maybe 3 doms on tap and about 3-4 standard imports in bottles. Since then, AB bought the lot next door and doubled the size of the bar, and likewise, they more than doubled their beer offering. To compliment the 3, they now have Shiner, Stella, 2 Gooses, Sam, Shock Top, and Guinness on tap, and they've about doubled their bottle selection. You may not find your brewery of choice, but it shouldn't be hard to find a comparable brew.

LIQUOR
They got it all! Van Gough Vodka is sorta their little display, and they have just about every flavor of it too, so there's nothing they can't make. One night, I made it my mission to have a Cranberry & Vodka with all 14+ flavors, you know, for the advancement of...research. So, outside of Vodkas, they have plenty of liqueurs, like Godiva, Kahlua, Grand Marnier, etc. They have top shelf Vodkas, Gins, and upper shelf(?)  whiskey/scotches. You won't find Johnny Blue, but they have Glenfiddich and Gentlemen's Jack, etc. I hate all whiskeys and their cousins, so that don't bother me at all. 

SPORTS
It IS a sports bar after all. They have LCDs pretty much strewn all across the walls. Because of the # of TVs, technically, no matter where you sit, you will have a TV with a decent view. For Bears games, they have a projector and a screen, so it pretty much encompasses all you need. They've got plenty to feed your sports fix, and while not a 10-score, I don't think I want them to, because it'd take away from their other more important features...

AMBIANCE
I haven't been to AB in the daytime much at all, because I'm too busy working my tail off working up the need to come to AB at night, but in the weird instances where I've been here early, the place is very cool. Blue bar, Lady Liberty spinning, and fairly quiet so you can have a drink and relax in peace. Come nighttime, though, the place is rockin! It's a ton of fun. There're pool tables, darts, indoor bags, and when the weather's nice, an outdoor patio and bags too. AB is good at any time! Music can be loud on Friday nights, but if you want quiet, you can by the pool tables. If you want to get blitzed and have crazy fun, AB's your stage! And if you get really blitzed, there're 2 stages you can go up on and dance like a fool, and spend the rest of the week regretting! In addition, they have regular live bands, karaoke night, dueling pianos, and stand up open mic regularly in their calendar.

SERVICE
Their bartenders and servers are the best! They're all awesome and friendly, and even more, they know their stuff! They can tell you what beers they have, and if you mention what kind of flavor you're looking for, they can suggest one for you. Lookin' for a crazy drink? They're more than happy to whip up any concoction you can dream of...trust me on this! All the while striking up conversation and joking around with you. 

Also, Rich, the owner, is not only funny as hell, but he uses his bar to make a difference in the community! He's hosted several fundraisers like St. Baldrick's and Toys for Tots and also hosted them for various individuals and teams for breast cancer, cancer walks, etc. On top of all that, he also hosts customer appreciation parties every now and then, plus AB's one of the bars that raffles off 
Bud Light cruise tickets! Great party pkgs too! 

VALUE
I'm running outta room. Great daily specials, check website!

GOD BLESS AMERICA'S BAR!
Let me tell you, it's awesome to have a bar that actually cares about you! I've been to plenty of other bars, and some of the "petite" ones are friendly, but don't have the ability to entertain and host events like AB. Giant ones may have big parties, but it's like you don't exist! AB is a perfect balance. If you look at how much $$ I've "invested" into AB over the years, it may come a surprise to you that I actually HATE liquor, but because the place is so fun and the people are so great, I look forward to Friday every week! 
PINAWINE!
BILL, THE MANAGER, IS SHADY!!!!!!!!  Long story short... He literally stole $$$ from my credit card without my authority.  BEWARE.

America's Bar is an...odd place? I'm torn. 

Pros: Good drinks. Bags. Stage for live bands. Room to dance. I've heard it's good on Saturdays...haven't experienced that yet. Good food at good prices. Clean bathrooms. The staff was attentive and made sure we were taken care of. No cover on Fridays. Good background music.

Cons: Skankily dressed waitresses. Odd pictures of the owner with every celebrity ever known around the entire bar. DJs that show up but don't actually play music. Friday...no one was there. Bouncers that are there for absolutely no reason. Looks shady from the outside.

We had a good time, especially playing bags. I'm just not sure how many times I would come back. I think I would try a different bar before returning. I would definitely come back on a Saturday next time since I heard it's more crowded and people actually dance.

Excellent staff, great menu, fun times every time I'm here. Free Buffet and/or giveaways for sports games, Bags, Darts, Pool, and great live music, karaoke on Thurs/Sun, Open Jam & Trivia Tues. CHECK IT OUT!!

very large bar. Service is a hit or miss depending on the night and time of day you go. Drinks are always good. I usually go here for more the atmosphere. There is a large outdoor patio area. As well as an area inside for darts and bags games. I enjoy coming here for Karaoke nights, as there is an actual stage you go on to sing. Ya know, got to live it up to have your 2 minutes with lights and on stage from time to time. They usually have one of two drink specials each night but nothing super great. I'll be sure next time I go to update this review with a little more info. Overall it is a large bar that has areas both with quiet and louder areas to hang out or play games with friends.

Came here after a hockey game on a Friday night... Every aspect had a good thing and a negative thing

Waitress was very, VERY accomodating, literally asking us if we needed anything almost every 10 minutes (it almost got annoying, but whatev..)
Apps were decent--we got the artichoke dip and nachos--it was literally a chip overload and the meat in the nachos had no flavor at all.  The artichoke dip was good, nothing fab, but not terrible.
Some of my drinks were strong, some were watered down--whats up with that?!?
Music was insanely loud--we couldn't even hear each other and we were about 2 feet apart.  They did play, however, an awesome mix of songs, almost felt like I was at a wedding and ready to get my groove on.

Service - 10/10
Atmosphere - 10/10
Price - 10/10

What can I say about America's, except for the fact that it's the Classiest Bar in Hoffman Estates! I heard many good things about this bar so I decided to go here on my 21st and I have been frequenting ever since! I love it when I can walk in and have a cold beer waiting at the bar for me by the time I sit down. Both Rich Garcia, the owner of the bar, and Bill, the General Manager, make their rounds and say hello to everyone. It's extremely personable and that's what keeps me coming back. The bartenders and waitresses are all really cool, down-to-earth people that will strike up a conversation with you, given they have a moment and they're not busy. If you're on the fence about what drink to order, tell them what you have a taste for and they'll whip something up and you WON'T be disappointed. They raffle off Hawks jerseys when the Hawks win. You really can't go wrong here!

Fun, spacious place with lots to do, good music (though perhaps a little too loud sometimes), dance space, karaoke some nights, dueling pianos some nights, live bands some nights.  Good people hanging out; friendly bartenders, wait staff, and owner.  The owner, Richard, is cool.  Reasonable drink prices.  Good food -- especially love the jumbo chicken wings and the massive nacho platter.  Also like the outdoor tables in the warmer months, and the bags play out there too! Great place to get together with a group.
Great place to go if you love karaoke which they have on Thursdays and a place to have fun. Definitely a hangout spot for the 20's and 30's crowd.

This bar has the worst service in the world.  On a slow night the waitress takes at least 10 minutes to get your drink to you.  You could easily walk out of this bar with how little the staff pays attention to you.  The only redeemable thing about this bar is having bags indoors.

This bar is a joke and the owner is a tool he bought my girl friend a drink and started hitting on her.  If you would like to see the latest Jersey Shore rerun this is your place, fist pumps all around.

I am so sad to have to change my review, but America's bar, you've earned the downgrade...

We came here for my friends' party the other night, and even though she had reservations for MANY people, they said that they warned her she could only reserve two tables.  There were over 22 people coming, and they knew this.  Crappy.

So we considered leaving at that point, and to be honest, we probably should have...  But the food was meh and the drinks were watered down.  My friend and her family got treated like crap by the staff.

Our waitress was great and the music was good.  Hence the two stars.  I am not impressed!

Service is slow depending on the bartender...music is on repeat...need to play more videos on the screens...food is ok...drinks are strong...parking is ample...bathrooms are nice...I like the look of the bar...crowd is different...the owner is sweet and accomodating...

Good afterwork starter bar.

We went here on a Saturday at around 11:30 for lunch.  At first it was just my wife and I.  Eventually two other guys came in.  

Since we don't drink alcohol much anymore, we both had an iced tea.  DON'T get their iced tea.  My wife describes it as nearly undrinkable.  I think it's merely terrible.  We both got the mini filet burgers.  Little pieces of filet mignon on little buns.  It came with a horseradish sauce and au jus.  They mini filets were very good.  Fries were about average.  We sat at the bar.  The bartender was decent and didn't bother us too much but was around when we needed her.  Prices were a little high but I didn't think they were too far out of line.

We saw flyers on the wall about their karaoke nights and the DJ's they have there.  Haven't been there for either but some night we may wander over to check it out some night since it isn't too far from our house.  It is in a strip mall so there is a lot of parking available in the lot.

Overall everything was good.  Nothing fantastic, but we'll go back again.

Well,  this one goes to customer service.  When you call to make a dinner reservation and make it for 7pm and confirm it ok done right?  NO!   We get there on time and are told we are not seating until 8,   Well,  to quote a movie. Information that should have been brought to my attention YESTERDAY!    The person on the phone should have said that.  Very long hour to wait to eat.   I fault the management for lack of training and communication.

I've been here twice now, with my fiance's coworkers, and had a good time both nights. Both nights were crowded, with good music, and a lot of people dancing. 

I tend to avoid places that are loud and have dancing, because I can't risk getting knocked over. But the dancing was all up on a stage area, away from the rest of the crowd. So it was ok. When we arrived at 830p, there were only a few people.  The crowd grew throughout the night, and it was completely packed when we left at 2am. 

The owner is nice. This past Saturday night, when he heard we were there because we'd just gotten engaged, he did a quick head count, and sent over a bunch of red and blue shots (the red ones smelled like red velvet cupcakes and were sugary goodness, the blues smelled like blue curacao and were a little stronger - but cute for the American theme of the place). 

Our waitress was very attentive for our large group.  A birthday party had reserved half of a sectioned off area, but we were told we could take over the other half - and we did!  The crowd was a good mix of ages, mostly mid 20s to mid 30s, with a few younger and a few older (the older looked to be relatives there for the bday party).  

The music was interesting, sort of an odd mix. There were some remixes that just made us say "what? am i really hearing this?" like Nirvana remixed with 'Play That Funky Music White Boy.'  When friends went up to the dj with requests, he 'couldn't find the songs.'  Not sure if I buy that. But whatevs.

The bathrooms were mostly clean. But everything in the ladies room is automatic. The sink, the soap, the paper towels, and the flush.  And auto-stuff like that will sometimes not work properly.  

It's also a very large place. They opened up a second area since the first time I went last year.  There's now another room with bags and pool tables.  

Don't know what smoking lounge other reviewers talked about, but it's unfortunately gone. We are subjected to smoke out in the freezing cold.  And if you think this place is a dive bar, then you've obviously never been to a real dive.

I've been here atleast a dozen times since they opened. & honestly I only returned because I live so close. Had I written a review based on the 1st couple times I went they would've only earned a star, maybe 2 cause the place looked fabulous. But now I don't hesitate to give America's bar the 5 stars they earned. 

Overall it is a classy-looking bar in the suburbs with great drinks (martini's!) & fantastic food that's very affordable.. 

Service is a little on the slower side BUT the food is absolutely delicious so it far outweighs the wait. Between my friends & I, we've tried almost everything on the menu & I've never heard any complaints. Actually I think their mini filet steak sandwiches are definitely award worthy..highly recommended.

From from the average local suburb bar. The bar top has specs of blue glitter and surrounds a one of a kind statue of a Marilyn Monroe/statue of liberty mix. She rotates on display in the center of the bar. The dance floor is up on a stage which also makes the perfect spot for the dueling pianos. There is plenty of seating at hightops scattered around the bar & the bar itself has stools all around and hooks underneath for purses and what not. There's not a seat in the place that doesn't have a great view of one of their TVs. Bathrooms are very clean and I think it helps that everything is automatic; toilet, sink, paper towel dispenser. For the ladies bathroom has a full-length floor to ceiling, wall-to-wall mirror. 

They also recently almost doubled in size..adding another large room where they have a couple pool tables, darts, bags games(yes indoor!) & more. America's bar has got it all (except frontage road access since they're located in a strip mall;)
Drinks are VERY reasonable, decent selection.  Thursday night karaoke is fun  The twirling Lady Liberty statue is a centerpiece not to be overlooked.  Nice neighborhood watering hole.

This bar is a hole in the wall!

I am way too used to going out in the city of Chicago.  It's old, poorly decorated, cheesy, and had a huge statue of liberty with her skirt up in the middle.

Definitely not a place for happening 20-somethings.  Older crowd.  TV's everywhere.  I went there for a 1920's party and left within an hour because the place was not my style.  I would not go back.  If I'm going to a hole in the wall, I will go to a hole in the wall within stumbling distance of my house!

Never again!

Been here many times for live trivia. They offer half off 98% of the menu during live trivia for those guests playing the game. I always get the fire cracker salad. My wife always sets a plai n hamburger. 
Unfortunately on this visit the popcorn chicken which is tossed in buffalo sauce (read: fire cracker) was cold. I brought it to the server's attention and after several minutes asked her if he mentioned it to management which she said she had. He hadn't made it over to the table yet which caused me concern. I asked er to send the owner over if he was still available. Apparently he was not as Bill appeared and when I asked Bill who he was I learned he was the GM. 
I told him I've had this particular salad several times and the chicken was always hot. Today it was cold. He offered to take it off the bill, which is fine but my complaint regards the callous method in which he responded to the complaint. 
I feel that if a server tells a member of management that there's a problem that manager should make haste and get over and diffuse the problem with a little more than a shred of customer service and at least leave the guest with the perception that he cared about the issue.
When I offered that maybe the salad had been left in the widow a little too long I was told that in fact it had not. ...I guess they just serve cold chicken sometimes.
RACHEL is a a fantastic server and is in touch with the needs of her guests, or she gives the perception thereof.
To complete the evening, Bill didn't actually remove the salad from the check as he indicated he would. Thanks for the $4 salad.

Well last year for my 50th birthday we went for dueling pianos, I and my guests had a great time and were treated very well, so when my niece said let's go there for my birthday last Saturday I thought nice.  Only it wasn't:(  Other than our waitress who was super nice and ourselves (who can manage to have a good time no matter where we go) it was horrible.  I usually don't post negative reviews, but I have to.  The food was all wrong, I had a California Chicken sandwih which came with no avacado and no basil mayo.  The fries were good.  Night goes on time to leave we are out the door the birthday girl goes back in to pay her bar tap and we are standing waiting for her not being loud just waiting.  First the bouncer comes and says move on, I explain we are waiting for the birthday girl, I am her ride home.  Then the owner/manager ,not really sure what he was ther than there are picures of himself all over the walls, tells the bouncer to come over and tell us to leave.  At this point I am not very happy with either one of them considering the smoking section was about 5ft from us, so if I wanted to smoke a cigarette and still drink their booze I can be outside nice......................  I did not appreciate being treating like a thug and being asked to leave their property without my niece and told them in a few choice words that I would never be back.

I am not sure what went on in the last year with management but it shows they have had changes, which is sad because it is a nice place with alot of space:(
I love Americas ,  best service, best bartenders ever.  Amazing food!!!  Check it out!!!!

O America's Bar, im soooo disappointed in you. My birthday was coming up and my first thought was to have my party here....I should have gave it a second thought!!! I called 3 weeks in advance to hold tables for the 25 people I had coming, the person on the phone said no problem just had to give a credit card number incase we didnt show and I would get charged a fee.....ummm ok....whatever.....
So the big night has arrived and im super excited, we get there at 6:30 and the place is EMPTY!!!! i talk to the hostess and tell her we are here for the party and she brings us to our section....with 8 chairs and 2 tables....UMMM WHAT???? 
since the place was so empty we move to a different section where there was more tables for the 25 people I had coming! the manager then comes over to us and says we cant take up that many tables and they had told me on the phone that I could only have 2 tables the HUGE dinner rush was going to be coming in soon.....Im sorry Im pretty sure if i had a large party coming i wouldnt have booked two tables for all those people...but thanks AND let me tell you we didnt order food until 7:30ish and it was still EMPTY...so one might ask what dinner rush!!! 
SO yeah, I was THAT person who didnt listen and we sat where we wanted and he left us alone about it finally. 
 
We started having a good time after that, our waitress was super nice and very quick with our drink and food orders.....then we found out maybe why she was so quick with our orders...they were all wrong. Every single one of our meals where wrong in one way, shape or form. The food we good wasnt bad, typical bar food(except the crinkle fries were REALLY YUMMY!!!) we all finished eating and started moving around talking, dancing and having fun then, our waitress was with us all night and took very good care of our drink orders for the night. Then we went to pay.....sigh....my friend had a groupon for the food....which the manager came over very rudely and said he couldnt use it cause they were going to have music LATER on that night....umm excuse me....what would music later have to do with using a groupon now. Finally after MUCH fighting he was able to use the groupon. We were walking out and the waitress came out to get me cause I forgot to pay my tab...OOPS. SO i went back in to pay and the bouncer told my aunt and cousin they could not stand outside and wait for me, they had to move on. My aunt told him that they were just waiting for me to pay my bill and we were going to be leaving, they bouncer left them alone then but the manager came over to them and said they needed to move on and they couldnt stand outside to wait for me...this is were my aunt got a little heated and started yelling because what did he want her to do, leave me at the bar!?!

So all in all I had a horrible experience at this place and WILL NOT BE GOING BACK!!!!

Oh good Lord, America's Bar.  On a good note, you would assume this to be filled with right winged, Budweiser loving, gun carrying, obese Americans, but, instead, it is just 20 somethings from the suburbs of Chicago that would shit a brick if a minority walked in.  These are the rich kids from all of those high schools with the highest ACT scores in Illinois who went on to U of I and ended up right back where they started in the same bars their non-smart friends have been drinking for years while they were racking up college debt.  Just kidding, their parents paid for college. Anyways, the drinks are cheap but that is obvious once you spend a night here.  They have indoor bags, loud music, and darts just like the best of them but do not ever plan on meeting someone here;  Everyone is too busy talking about supping up their infinity than to actually worry about the other sex, or getting any.  The servers here are cute little ditzy things just like any other 'sports' bar, so do not expect good service.  To conclude, it is a typical suburbs bar.
I love this place.  It has a lot of space, always has great events going on, the menu has great bar food.

I like this place.  I have been here about 4 times and never had a problem with service.  Dueling pianos are good and play every first Saturday of every month.  They usually have good bands.  I only ate here once.  The pepper soup is okay and I liked the Filet sliders dipped in the au jus.

I can't say that I agree with earlier reviews. I went for the dueling pianos on a saturday night (OCT 6th). We had called a week before to make a reservation and were beautifully accommodated. The reservation was re-confirmed the day before which was a good thing because we added 2 more guests. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very polite door guy.  We were escorted to our table immediately that had a reserved sign with our name on it! (maybe the solution is to call ahead of time to make your reservation).  Anyway... the atmosphere is casual with a comfortable neighborhood feel and a cute marilyn / statue of liberty spinning above your head in a well lit spacious room. We were served by a waitress named Tracy and to say she was awesome is an understatement!  My brother has some food allergies which can be difficult & she was more than patient with us. She listed all the food & drink specials and being a wine drinker I was more than happy to find out that Merlot was only $3 a glass... Yippee! (don't judge!)
Food... we ordered some appetizers Cheddar cheese cubes, Nachos and wings. The wings were hot (buffalo style) but I think i enjoyed the ranch just as much as the wings! The Nachos were just what you would expect - we ordered chicken on them and the plate was cleaned.... The only bad thing I can say is the cheddar cheese cubes could have been bigger.. they were DELICIOUS but also gone with our group on about 3 minutes.  My brother had ordered a plain chicken breast with a salad &  im sorry to say I didn't catch his opinion. The Pianos were very fun & interactive, a great way to spend a Saturday night out with a diverse crowd!  We have already made reservations for next month!  

They also promote karaoke & live bands which may entice us to come on another night but we have yet to experience them. 

Try the Cheddar Cheese Cubes!

The interior glows as soft blue light showers down on you. There is a massive bar that fills the floor with a five foot Statue of Liberty twirling in the center. On the opposite side there is a miniature dance floor surrounded by the DJ area & tables with chairs. There are flat screen TV's so DJ's can play videos while they spin. During my after work visit there seemed to be very little variety. It started off with your basic Top 40 but then gradually went into a lot of 80's with some late 90's pop tunes. When the DJ started at 10pm we went through it all over again. All the Top 40 songs we just listened to at six o'clock were in rotation again. It was like listening to the radio.

Service: The service was slow and unhelpful. After finishing my first drink it took the bartender 15 minutes to come by and ask me if I wanted another. There were countless times she came over to serve others and completely looked past me. Even when I tried getting her attention there was no such luck. Me and my two friends decided to order some food while sitting up at the bar. We each ordered an appetizer to share; popcorn shrimp, popcorn chicken, & an order of spinach artichoke dip. Now I know their food is fresh & made to order but goodness it took 45 minutes before we got served. And when we did only one order came out. We told the bartender that we were still waiting on our popcorn shrimp & chicken, she said "food comes out as its ready" instead of "oh let me go check on that for you" or something to be a little accommodating.

Parking: There is plenty of parking in this shopping mall lot.

Overall: This is a starter bar, it gets empty the later it gets. Getting a drink or some chow at Americas Bar is a long lasting wait. The food was tasty & worth the wait at a reasonable price. The crowd and atmosphere is welcoming and parties til 3am every morning. Majority of the drinks seem a little much for a suburban bar but if you pay attention to the weekly specials you can find a good deal.

I LOVE this bar. It's a great place and pretty classy without being over pretentious. The bathrooms are glorious! The waitresses are all fantastically nice and I really enjoyed talking to them. I went last summer and they have bags and tables outside which gives you a beer garden feel in their strip mall location. I'm comfortable there in anything from jeans to a nice dress. They have a lot of cool themed nights and charity events as well which changes the atmosphere a bit so it's not the same crowd all the time. The food? O.M.G. Try the mini steak sandwiches. They rock. Or ask for a grilled cheese with bacon. All the cool kids do. ;)

All around a fun, comfortable setting - affordable and tasty too!

I will never go back to America's Bar:

I used to come to America's Bar with a group of friends every week for team trivia (which is great!) for over a year. If you win trivia, your team gets a coupon for $25 to use at America's bar. Then they made a rule saying that you can't redeem the coupons during trivia, so you have to come in at a separate time to use them.

I went with a group of friends on a Friday night to use multiple coupons that we had from winning trivia. They were all about to expire and we asked the manager if we could extend some of them since we come here every week. The manager said, "No, you'll have to use them all tonight." The bartender was part of this conversation, and she said that she would let us know when we were getting close to the amount of our coupons so we wouldn't go over. 

So we order drinks and hang out. When we go to leave my friend gets the tab and gives our coupons to the manager. Now he says that he can only accept two coupons on one bill. We said okay then can you split the bill because there were about six of us and we only got one bill to make it easier. The manager said no he couldn't split the bill and couldn't accept more than two coupons a night. It was ridiculous that he told us we needed to use all our coupons and then wouldn't accept them a few hours later. If that was the rule, why didn't he explain that at the beginning of the night when he knew we were planning on using all of our coupons. We continued the conversation and the manager would not change his mind. My friend called the police because he thought we were being charged unfairly. The police came and heard what happened from us and the manager. Then the officer said that they should honor the coupons they issued, the tab was settled, and we were fine to leave.

My friend just got his credit cart bill and he was charged $91 by America's bar even though the police came and settled the issue. We are now disputing the charge and getting a statement from the police.

The bartenders and wait staff at America's bar are great. They were very helpful to us and tried to make the situation better. The management made a bad situation worse and permanently lost about 10 regular customers.

I will never go back to America's Bar. Reading other people's comments, this is not the first time people have been ripped off or treated poorly and I'm sure it won't be the last.

One of my friends is friends with the owner of America's Bar, but that in no way has impacted my review.  I have to say, they make the best veggie wraps, ever!  I don't know what they put in those things, but oh my god.  A bar should not make sandwiches this good!  The staff is super nice and very attentive.  They have a wonderful smoking area for us smokers!  It's heated with chairs, very nice. 

They have all kinds of fun things going on I think almost everynight of the week.  The dueling pianos are always fun.

I went here because 2 of my friends work here. ( this does not reflect my review at all). When I got there it was around maybe 1a.m. I saw a lot of people inside and outside but within about 30 mins everyone kind of vanished. I guess this is a pre gaming spot? I'm not sure. The inside is pretty big, the music was pretty jumping and the crowd was just a normal crowd. I def would go back here again maybe at an earlier time.

America's Bar is a nice neighborhood bar. They are in a great location (tons of places for food nearby when you are drunk and need McDonalds). They also serve great food for cheap prices. The food is standard bar food but has great prices and there quality is a little higher than most bars. They also have great drink specials every night of the week and last year they had a free buffet during halftime during Bears games. Overall, this is a nice bar with an okay crowd. The music is always great though!

All I have to say is just another suburban bar that lacks anything all too exciting.

The one thing that is nice is that they have a pretty spacious outdoor area, which is a rare find in the suburbs.

Seven of us came here after an 80's themed Spa Birthday Party for my friend. We called ahead: 
No cover, check 
Tropical Long Islands $4, check 
80's music, check... 
and out we went. 
We arrived at eleven, the music was not 80's and the dance floor empty. Not a whole lot of party vibe at that time to get our easily buzzed off of the Tropical Long Island asses out on the floor. 

The smokers of the group said the smoking area was really smoky, even for them, but warm. 

The bathroom was really nice. It had a floor to ceiling mirror, stained concrete floors, more sparkly counter tops and roomy stalls. Lovely for what seemed to be mostly a sports bar. 

We admired the Marilyn Monroe trying Statue of Lady Liberty, the sparkly yet sticky bar and entertained ourselves with stories about, of course, ourselves. A gentleman ac cross the way bought us all shots, nice. We bored quickly, however, and left for Cadillac Ranch.
Went for my 21st birthday and loved it! Great bar!

Went here twice for Happy Hour with co-workers during the holidays. First in 2009 and again just last night. Met the owner both times. The bar has expanded and they now have a very nice pool table area. Ladies' bathroom was clean, but it was early in the evening.

Pros: plenty of parking and very reasonable drink specials. Plenty of TVs to catch sports. They also had music videos playing when we were there in 2009. Don't know if they stopped. Clean. Good decor. Very open floor plan. Bar has really neat tile and Statue of Liberty posed like Marilyn Monroe that rotates. I think it's pretty cool and distinctive.

Cons: It's tucked away in a strip mall far from the road, so unless you know exactly where it is, it's easy to miss. The mall has a lot of vacant shops, so it's a bit desolated. Don't know how he expects to draw traffic. No Happy Hour specials. He has daily drink specials, but nothing just for Happy Hour. Not too smart, considering there's a lot of businesses in the area. The food menu is extremely limited, but everything we've tried, we've liked. They do make everything from scratch. Hot wings are awesome. But be sure to ask for bleu cheese - it costs extra, but they won't tell you that. Since we were there last, he's added an all-girl staff that wear skimpy black costumes. The girls ranged in age from 45-plus to 22-something, and are every SIZE in between. Not too flattering for the costumes he chose them to wear. Definitely no eye candy there. Last year, they had a great male bartender. He left. I don't know why, but he was super personable and I thought a real asset to the bar.  The old bartender with the plastic jugs is eh. Service is horrible. There were maybe 7 people in the place, and he had 3 girls working. Way too many. The bartender could have easily covered all of us, but it was so beneath her to even bring us the menus. The waitress we had has zero personality and NOT a good bar waitress.

All in all, we're looking for a good Happy Hour place, and he made some good moves, and some not so good moves. HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS!! Bring back the first bartender!! Friendlier staff!! Get rid of the cheesy costumes or hire models to pull them off. I think cute tank tops with the bar logo on the chest and skinny jeans would be perfect. It's like he's trying too hard to please everyone and can't decide which way he wants to go - Hooters style, or nice lounge/bar and grill. I'm interested to see if he makes it.

I swear I don't spend all of my free time in strip malls. It's just a hazard of suburban life. Located in the Barrington Square shopping mall, America's Bar is a hidden little gem. Not visible from the street, or even the parking lot for that matter, you may want to leave a bread crumb trail to find your way back to your vehicle. 

The first thing I noticed was the decorating. The bright blue quartz bar takes up 50% of the entire establishment and is under the constant gaze of a five foot tall rotating Statue of Liberty holding a martini glass perched on a pedestal in its midst. There are plenty of high top tables and a small stage that is taken by the occasional dueling piano act. Not quite "Howl at the Moon" caliber but fun none the less. 

There is one very good bartender that I met and one very bad. I also sat at a table another time and received competent albeit slowish service for a less than busy night. 

There is a dedicated outdoor smoking lounge with easy access, tables and cocktail service. For a smoker that is a nice touch. 

The clientele is another story. The idea it seems is to attract a 30-something crowd judging by the constant stream of 80's videos on the flat-screens. OK, but it's never been crowded in there, which isn't necessarily a bad thing...I guess what I'm saying is that it just doesn't feel very cool to be there. It's a cool place without enough cool people. Maybe if you show up...

America's Bar is a suburban joint that would very much like to be a cool city joint. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

Used to love this place not so much now. 

Lets start at the beginning. Call ahead of time to see if I can get a reservation for pianos. Sure probably not going to get it but ill try. I talk to a bartender who said a manager would give me a call back later. Three hours later no call so I call back. Talked to the same guy who said he didn't forget about me. Great! Well no phone call back. I bet it was the bartender. Or maybe the manager who dropped the ball. Get there at 8 pm in order to score an unclaimed table since this is the policy on their website as well as the policy thr I have been told previously when making reservations. Apparently the bouncer thinks they hold it until 9 but I can wait to talk to a manager. Great! I wait and have been waiting over 40 minutes to speak to this manager. While I sit here I hear the bouncer ask the bartender about getting free cover if you checkin on Facebook.
