They both laugh and I proceed to pull out my phone and prove to the bouncer that not only was I correct on the table policy but the other customer was right about the Facebook checkin. Still haven't seen a manager. 

I'm staying for pianos tonight. But I'm going to think twice before coming back again and you should definitely do the same. 

I welcome comments and the chance to speak with management when they are ready to finally speak to me. 

America's bar is definitely failing on customer service and is quickly losing my business.
the owner is a suburban billy dec because as soon as you walk in the doors you are greeted with photos of the owner with different celebrities. kinda presumptuous for a place out in the burbs.

good place to watch the game, but everything is very expensive. very easy to run up a big tab is you're hungry. don't recall any beer specials, as I usually drink Guinness. lots of screens, and the sound quality is good. better than watching at home, for sure.

We went for dueling pianos.  We made a reservation and were told that we had to be there by 8 PM or else we'd be charged a $100 no-show fee per table.  We got there before 8 and they wouldn't seat us until after 8!  That's just silly and greedy.  They charged a $15 per 4-top table reservation fee.  We didn't eat there or drink as much as we normally would because we were already out $30 for two tables.  That said, the waitress was really attentive.  The dueling pianos were okay.  The crowd was only moderately into it, and the place was not that crowded.  When we left our table, no one rushed to grab it.  A big difference from Howl at the Moon, where you can barely move around.

interesting visit here last night. hard to say if i like the place or not.. the bar is a pretty good size. lighting is dim and music was kinda new-ish. it had a faux-club feel to it, for the people in the burbs who don't go to real ones that often. i went with a good group of friends, and had a good time. met some new people along the way too, so that's always a plus. the name of the place is a little odd and the center piece is quite.. different. almost, cheesy.

Nice place enjoy the food and the staff., they have a nice rewards program you get points for purchases and they offer bonus points regularly, I go for the bonus points, here is the problem often times they do not get recorded, then it is talking to staff they call it in, you can call as well and fill  out a form but result is often the same no response last visit was almost a week ago never got points still waiting!

Frustrating & who the time to keep checking!

rating would be higher if not for the points issue

Yeah after phone calls and several emails finally got my points!

Nice quick service. They have a rewards card. My unsweat tea was fresh and yummy. My crispy chicken salad was good until i found a hair in it. Then I was so grossed out I barfed. But the tea was good.

Swung by tonight for a chocolate shake (dinner, hah) and a Portobello Mushroom Panini (lunch tomorrow).

The guy who took my order (Branden) was friendly and efficient and, quite frankly, multitasking like a boss. Aside from register duty, he was running out orders to waiting cars, including mine.

The shake was soooo goood. $3.25 for a small and tasted like homemade, but with better whipped cream - no RediWhip. Totally worth it.

I ate the sammy (cold) the next day and it was satisfying.  The veggies - artichoke, peppers, spinach, mushrooms - were so good.  My only gripe would be that they didn't cut it in half, but it's probably less messy that way.

Went through the drive thru today. Most terrible drive thru ever. Guy who is on the line talks to customers with a rude child like attitude. Food is gross, like it was dropped on the floor and old, it's ok guys I have a tough stomach.. You didn't hurt me. Oh and it took them like 10 minutes to give me my turkey sandwich that was plain and gross. I hate this establishment. McDonald's next door is a better choice. Buona beef is comparable to me as bad as the most terrible fast food you can think of.. Also the people that work here are rude and have no manners.

I attended a business meeting that was catered by Buona and it was fantastic! The Chicago beef sandwiches were amazing, especially when topped with the giardiniera they provided. We also had cheese ravioli and a nice green salad with wonderful dressings and fresh bleu cheese crumbles.
Everything was excellent and I would highly recommend this place for your catering needs.
The worst made most disgusting chicken sandwich I've ever had. I should have just went to nasty McDonald's.
Good food, service and prices. Got my beef sandwich within a couple minutes of ordering it and was very tasty. Place is very clean and people working there were very nice.

This place used to have great beef sandwiches.  Stopped today and pick up a couple of sandwiches -- not good at all!  The bread was stale and the beef had a metallic taste.  
Very disappointing.

My favorite place for Italian beef. Much better than Portillos! The kind of sandwich you think about for the rest of the day after you eat it!
Skip the fries and get their homemade chips. I'm getting hungry now just thinking about it. This place has a good thing going on. Come during lunch hour to see the rush.

Thursdays are their pizza day. $6 dollar pizzas that are pretty good. But as I'm eating it I regret not getting the beef sandwich.

What can I say, the best Italian beef. Get the original and double dip it so it'll drip down your sleeves. Don't forget the giardinera condiment. ISO good that I bought 2lbs with au jus to bring on the plane with me to California....,Merry Christmas to me!!!!
Great place! The beef is so good! I got the Beef w/ Motz cheese and it was the best Italian beef I've had around this area

Had a late lunch on Saturday, ordered a chicken sandwich with fries. Unfortunately the chicken tasted like it was undercooked. Didn't want to chance it. Didn't want to get sick. Place used to be very good but has gone downhill lately. Most of the tables were dirty. 
Used to be a good alternative to Portillos, not anymore.

To give you a little background I have ordered catering and food to go from Buona. 
There is some competition for a good Italian beef in the northwest burbia area and I feel Buona does a good job. The staff have always made my orders right and are friendly.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the immediate area. From their pizzas to their hot dogs, everything they serve is near-perfect. I especially recommend their buffalo chicken pizza. Ask for a side of barbecue sauce and dip the slices in. It's simply phenomenal.

My husband wanted to try this place out so we carried out for dinner.

We got the burger and beef with fries on the side.

The burger was good, it was probably a 4 star except that the bun was hard as if it was sitting out for too long. Plus side is that it was huge and definitely hit the spot.

The beef was great, the bread wasn't too soggy by the time my husband got home and we opened it up to eat. The spicy peppers were exactly that, spicy - I loved how spicy they were. The beef was a bit salty but I haven't had any Italian beef that wasn't salty. We didn't have cheese on it but I'll have to try that next time.

The fries were thicker cut fries with lots of potato with each bite. Perfectly cooked and fresh. The only down side was that they were pretty salty. 

We will definitely try this place again and try some other things on the menu, overall this place was alright.

Meats are flavorful. Food comes out a little slow. 

The bread on my beef sandwich once was hard, dried out, and definitely not fresh. 

Their lot gets very icy in the winter. Be careful.

Coupons arrived in the mailer the other day. I think we were first to redeem one. The teen behind the counter had a lot of questions about processing it on his register. 

For $6.50, it included a 7" beef, a choice of side (fries, cheese fries, parmesan chips, cup of soup, small Caesar, house, pasta or fresh fruit salad) and a refillable Pepsi drink. LImit 2 worked in our favor! A 7" just about costs this much on its own.

It's a notch up from Portillos. The ambience is a bit more grown up too.

Introduced by a customer. Now I have to stop every trip to Chicago. The original sandwich is amazing.  This is nothing like a French Dip or Philly Cheese steak. The beef is so tender. Get it "wet" and enjoy the sandwich of the Gods.

Chicken Soup: Really delicious with nice looking chunks of chicken and cauliflower, carrots, celery, noodles, ect. But what bothered me was the fact that the soup wasn't very warm when it was served to us and it got cold fast...not ideal for a cold day!

Chicken Fingers: mediocre and Luke warm...barf. the ranch covered it up.

Chips: I always look forward to when somewhere has the hand sliced chips like the have at fairs and such! When I got them they had parmesan cheese powered all over them which it never said they put on the menu and I don't like chips dusted with parmesan...so that was annoying. They were also over cooked and dark but whatever kind of oil they fry them in is really light and tasty of the chips I got that were over cooked. 

Over all I didn't like my dining experience on the fact that all of my food was cold or over cooked, if it wasn't cold or over cooked I probably would come back to try another menu item. It's a deal breaker....
Have always had good food here. While I've only been to this location a couple of times, the food was always good.

After my first run in with Buona Beef, I was hesitant to give them a second chance. However, seeing as we are now new neighbors since I have recently moved to Hoffman Estates, their location was extremely convenient for a 9PM food run on a Sunday.

I ordered the turkey club panini... it was large and in charge and filled with delicious amounts of meats and veggies. The sauce they use in the panini was very flavorful.

However, the other items were slightly less than average. I ordered the pasta salad and instantly remembered why I wasn't a fan. The noodles had a weird flavor, and the dressing was tart. The fries did not seem fresh since they had no crisp to the bite.

I would try them again for their burgers or other sandwiches.

This is a nice location to come with the family or even for business. If you are a fan of their beef then you know what to expect. The thing about Buona is that they have very good individual pizzas (10 kinds) and a lesser known "Chicago Style" hot dog...out of this world.

Synopsis: beef a step below Portillo's; fries two steps below Portillo's;  Buona Hot dog 1 step above (Jumbo vs. Chicago) Portillo's.

But Buona has good individual pizzas...who's better? You decide.

I'll give this place a nod over their store that I typically visit on North Ave in Oak Park. Nice ambiance for a fast food place and it seemed to be setup in a way that was very organized. 

Had a 10" combo, fries and a drink for $10 - OK price I guess. I do feel that Portillo's Italian Sausage might have a little more flavor to it though. 

The place is close to a food pantry where I volunteer, so I'm sure I'll be back. Overall, pretty good.

Went for lunch today over the years found to be good and food consistent. Today was not the case. My sausage sandwich bun was hard almost stale and sausage only filled 3/4 of bun. My wife had a cheese burger, the cheese was not melted appeared laid on a warmed up beef patty, no quality control here. 

The worst issue taken was when my wife went to use bathroom. Found facility was filthy and did not use. Said the equipment inside needed a good cleaning and floors were terrible. Makes me question kitchen cleanness after bathroom condition observation. Hopefully improvements will be made, but we do not plan on return.

Not my kind of place. I prefer restaurants where there is at least a little bit of effort to offer healthier options. Not here - even the salads are loaded with crap.  I ordered what I thought would be healthy - chopped salad - Not. Three stars because the salad tasted good.  I just did my best to work around the fried chips and pasta in it.

Beef was excellent ! Full sandwich unlike portillos ! Hospitality was amazing at register and the guy who brought me my food . Only opportunity the iced tea was a little bitter . Otherwise GREAT JOB team !!!

I go there at least couple times per month for lunches because it's one of the few places that are located within a couple minutes away from my office. And almost every other time when I order food from them something goes wrong. I wouldn't write this review if it was just one time issue, but talking to their manager and seeing that nothing was done makes me unhappy. So, here is some stories: two times in a raw my order came without French fries, when it happened first time I mentioned it the guy who brought our food and he never got back with the rest of my order, so talked to the manager and he gave me my money back for the fries. Second time when it happened, it took them like 10 min to get me the fries. Just last week I ordered their BLT sandwich which supposed to be served with avocado, it wasn't there. 
If I ask for something extra like mustard, every other time I don't get it or I would have to go to the cashier and ask them for mustard. Last week, i went to get some napkins at the station where they keep all silverware and there was none left, so I asked of the guys if he can get some napkins into that station, the guy said that its not his job and left off without saying anything else. So, I went to another station to get napkins and a few minutes after that I saw someone from Bona filling up the station with napkins. 
Bottom line is, the food is good but service .....

WOW! I've been driving by these things for a year and never realized the great value they had! I went a bit looser on the wallet so that might explain why, but the food is awesome! First off, in a taste scale, I like things generally more plain and not too saucy. So what did I try...

The soup. It was a potato soup that was the special for the day. I got a small bowl while I had a cold and it definitely hit the spot! It wasn't TOO creamy, but there were a lot of good potato chunks and a couple of pieces of either chicken or bacon in there. It's one of those nice (not too chunky) soups that you'd eat during a cold rainy day and you want to offset a bad mood.

The Italian beef (I already forgot what it was called) but it was fantastic! I got the largest size thinking (go big or go home!) and the 9" sandwich really hit the spot. I asked for mozarella cheese on it and for sweet peppers because I don't like spicy peppers. The sweet peppers were slightly overcooked but they provided enough texture in the sandwich that it wasn't just a beef tasting Italian Beef. I love their bread as it's soft but not too soggy. It's definitely something you want to eat immediately because I can see the bread getting soggy after awhile. The mozarella cheese definitely gives it a cheesy flavor which I loved! The beef is so tender and juicy that it goes so well with the bread, peppers, and cheese!!

The location itself is very busy during the lunch hour. It's even difficult to find a good table to eat at. But they are pretty good at getting your food within ten minutes and it's a hustling and bustling place that there are all sorts of conversations going on.

I'd recommend going here. I remember Portillo's Italian beef having tougher beef and tougher bread which I wasn't a fan of. But it's been awhile. Give it a shot!

Robert, the GM, is awesome! He's very accommodating and personable. They've forgotten my fries 3 times now, but I still think he's a nice addition to their crew. It was my choice to not go back and pick up the forgotten fries, but still a bummer, especially to my 10 year old son. Also, the new gluten free bread is yummy! Thanks for offering it!
I ordered soup from here and it was cold and tasted kind of gross. Won't come here again.

It's in my neighborhood. I hadn't visited in a long while and then have gone there twice in the last 3 weeks. Both times purchased the 10" beef and a full salad. The salads are fine, but I couldn't taste the beef due to it being loaded with salt. On the 1st disappointment, I figured the staff had salted the sandwich. The 2nd time I specified no salt. So it seems a heavy amount of salt is inherent in the recipe and/or there is no quality control. 

I'll not return for another beef of salt, and other places have better salads for the money. Too bad Zippy's closed... after doing a beef crawl I knew it was my favorite. Now I'll have to drive farther to go to Portillo's for a fast beef pickup.

Food sucks. We had italian beef, nothing special, jumbo hot dog, below average and breaded chicken, yuck frozen patty.  The fries had no taste and everything was soggy.  Better off going to Portello's
Very good food and had a great experience with their staff they made us feel at hime. The inside dinning is very nice for a fast food beef place.
So so. Nothing special. Not bad but not good either. Nice restaurant environment though.

Never been here until today and oh boy... It was just awesome! The cashier was just great, I believe her name was thiary.. But she was great about recommendations and she just seemed to be so happy to be working.  The food was awesome, I just ordered an original beef and it was very filling and delicious at the same time.  There was another person named Geri that offered me a free drink as a first time customer, she was very helpful as well.  Both employees deserve to be recognized for their firm work ethics and enthusiasm! 5 star food and 5 star customer service

Pretty good for a local chain. Great for a quick dinner or drive-thru meal. Best of all, it's reliable. You never have to question the quality. You know what you're getting each time, and that's pretty important. 

Can't go wrong with an Italian beef.

The food here is very good we had beef sandwiches, sausage and a kids hot dog. My only drawback was the expense. Three of us dined for $28 and one of those meals was a $5 kids meal. They charged extra for every little thing. For example the hot and sweet peppers were extra. But still, it added up fast. Even the cashier agreed with me about the expense.  I'm glad the whole family wasn't there it would've cost me an arm and a leg.
I generally like their food,  but their restaurants seem to be few and far between.  Don't know of any near Crystal Lake.

Very good. Meatball sandwich, beef sandwich, chicago hot dog and bacon BBQ hot dog are my favorites on the menu. Never had an issue here with the drive-thru even when it is busy it moves along at a decent speed. I always hate that my lunch ends up over $10 but I won't dock them for that since it's easy to do that at your typical fast food places now.

Their jumbo hot dog was really good. It was so juicy and all the toppings added were perfect.

I also tried their thin crust pizza before which was delightful as well. I am a big fan of thin crust when done right like Pizano's or Viccino's are two of my favs.

Always got friendly and prompt service. Seating usually plentiful when we would go on a Sunday lunchtime. They have high chairs and kids menus/crayons for those with kids. This location is clean but in quite a bit of a deserted area, that's just the feel I get with the vast spans of empty asphalt space even though there are a few restaurants nearby.

I've eaten at Buona Beef several times throughout the years it has been here. However, on Tuesday night I ate there with a friend and everything tasted good and we were satisfied. However, yesterday my friend texted me in the morning asking me if I felt sick too because after eating at Buona Beef, she felt extremely nauseous and had to take a day off of work. Her stomach hurt and she thought she had food poisoning. She was feeling great during our dinner. I told her no and maybe it was something else. Then today, I warmed up my leftover beef sandwich for lunch at work and I took a bite and it tasted fine. Then I went to take another and noticed there was a little green on the piece of meat. I opened up my sandwich and there were several pieces of meat with green on it. A bright, disgusting green. I ate there less than forty eight hours ago. The meat should not have gone bad in such a short amount of time. I will not be going back to a Buona Beef.

I went here for dinner tonight with my family. This place is for fatasses; the portions are very big. As a side dish, I ordered the parmesan chips with my Buona Beef and Italian Sausage Sandwich. The sandwich was ok and the chips were not very good. In fact, I ended up asking the waitress if it was possible for me to switch out the chips for french fries. Service-wise, this restaurant is very good. The staff is friendly and attends to your concerns pretty well. One offputting thing about this restaurant is that you have to clean up after yourself! Please beware -- come to this restaurant very hungry and with the desire to clean your own dishes!
Great beef sandwiches and the best combos around bar none!

This is simply the best Italian Beef sandwich in the suburbs, providing you order it with Giardiniera.  The sides are somtimes imaginative - try the Pasta Salad.  Sometimes, though, the "Chips" can be a letdown.  Salads and individual Pizzas are also surprisingly creative and great values at about $7.50 each.

What happens when your coworkers make you go to an Italian beef restaurant when you really don't eat red meat?  You get the margherita pizza.  Mouthwatering.  Huge chunks of mozzarella and tomatoes, real basil, piping fresh from the oven, so crispy and gooey you want to abscond with it and go off to a tropical island together.  That's what I'm talking about!

The beef & giardiniera pizza is the most crucial item on the menu.  I haven't tried most items, but this pizza is the bomb!  It's topped with the gooey type of cheese that stretches and forces you to cut the cheese rope.  Between that and the crispy thin crust are thin slices of italian beef and fresh giardiniera (w/ green olives).  All the gardeniere oil does make eating the pizza a bit messy, but it's definitely worth all the napkins.  The 9" pizza is more than enough for one person and well worth the money.  I always tell myself I'll try something new the next time, but I can't resist the beef & giardiniera.

I really wanted to like this place.  I have driven past this place for years and finally decided to stop in.   Walking in its your typical I really lunch joint, nothing to impressive.  Average lunch crowd.  The line moved pretty quick which was nice because the line was just about out the door when i got there.  
One thing that bugs me is that most joints like this all of there food is ala carte.  You can make any sandwich a meal for 3.25 but i would still like the option for some lunch specials.  
I thought for sure i would be blown away by the beef, since that is what they are known for.  I did not think it was anything special.  I ordered the BBQ beef sandwich combo with a fry.  I was definitely not impressed with the BBQ sauce.  In fact, i prefer the sauce on the mcrib over buona's.  
I do not want to completely bad mouth the place, because i am sure other things on the menu are very good.   A guy sitting next to me had a salad that looked pretty good.

They have a pretty large menu, but stick to the Italian Beef sandwiches, Vienna hot dogs, and Maxwell St. Polish sausages.  I like this location, although it does get crowded with families on weekends.  Yeah... whenever I see an insane amount of kids in there, I just take my order to-go.

Like any good Italian Beef restaurant, they offer the beef & sausage combo and even pepper & egg sandwiches on Fridays.  And I'm always a fan of a place that serves double dogs, because apparently I can't have too much MEAT.  

Buona Beef is a small, 11-store chain found soley in the 'burbs.  I've been to a couple locations, but the one in Hoffman Estates is a decent store.

Good food at a good price. Being from Seattle, we don't have anything like this. I like the different size beef sandwiches so I can eat light, if I want. Would eat here again and recommend the beef sandwich with spicy peppers!

WHERE'S THE BEEF?

Right here my friend...and it's pretty damn tasty.  I usually stick with the Italian beef which is piled high on crusty bread and topped with hot giardiniera peppers.  The salads are also good, but I have to admit that in the Italian beef vs. salad showdown, the salad doesn't often win.

A soggy rather expensive sandwich served in a place that got three of four orders wrong in some small way. Extra charge for everything put on the sandwich was irritating. The beef itself was ok, I can imagine a quite good version of this sandwich. This wasn't it.

My first taste of an Italian Beef sandwich and I'm hooked!  This is so much better than a French dip sandwich... it's lean, hot, and tasty!  I had a lunch special which consisted of 1/2 of an Italian beef sandwich with Swiss cheese and jalapenos, a side (I had the homemade chips), and a soda - all for $8.54 - or something like that.
Can't wait to return to Chicago to try the 'dawgs'!

BB has some great dishes, and they all taste pretty freakin great. I did not give 4 star rating becuase the service was sub-par and it seemed like they really didn't care about their jobs. However, it wasn't totally portrayed in the food, so a 3 star is appropriate. T

he dogs and the beef sandwiches are awesome, though they dont' compare with Al's, they have given a valiant effort.

I've been to Buona several times in the past & have enjoyed myself each time.  It's not on my top 5 list of go-to places for some grub but it hasn't disappointed yet.  I was in the area & was on my way to Garibaldi's but decided against it as soon as I saw Buona.  Their menu is very extensive & has something for everyone so it took a minute to figure out what I wanted, but I went with an angus cheeseburger with fries.  Surprisingly, they don't have any meal deals, I swore they used to but now everything is a la carte so you need to order everything separately.  When I ordered a cup of water, I was given the largest free water cup ever, must've been at least 12oz, so bonus points for that.  The burger tasted a lot better than the last time I had one, which was more than a year ago, but the fries could've been hotter.  My previous visit, I had the Quattro Formaggi pizza & it was one of the best personal pizza's I've ever had, so fresh, so good & so much to eat, just go already!
Better then Portillos! Italian beef and a canoli, awesome fries

This place understandably gets a bit crowded during lunch. It's conveniently located to many businesses and has a drive-thru. The individual pan pizza with a buttery, yellow is tasty, but I very much recommend the beef. If you are on a budget or not extremely hungry, the kids Italian beef meal is actually very good. You get a much smaller beef sandwich and portion of fries with a drink. After that, you might even have saved room for their gelato. I recommend the spumoni.

I come here on my way from O'Hare to Elgin every time I come.  I actually choose my flight time so I can get there for lunch or dinner.  I LOVE their ceasar side salad - oh man...my mouth is watering just thinking about it.  Nowadays I always do the Italian beef (feeding my inner Midwestern child). But man-oh-man - the beef with a ceasar side is freakin awesome.  They have a good variety of food and multiple side dishes to choose from.  I'm not too keen on the desserts but by the time I've had a beef, salad and soda, I'm good.  I had their lemon cookies last time and they were aweful.  They offer wine but I thought it was a little pricey considering what I'm eating with it.  It's a very casual place, kid friendly and good for groups.  It's my favorite Italian Beef place.

I always enjoy eating at Buona Beef.  There's a good variey of items on the menu and I haven't come close to trying them all, but what I've had have been quite good.   The Italian Beef is good.  Different than Portillo's, but just as good, although not quite as good as Galto's.   I also like their "Italiano" sandwich.   What I really like here is their Angus beef hamburger.  I think I'm going to step out on a limb and say it's my favorite hamburger in the area.

Been going to this place for 3 years now because its just a hop, skip, and a jump from my place of work. Their little miniature pizzas are excellent-- specifically the Margherita pizza! But what you really need to get is their version of italian beef... entitled so appropriately: Buona Beef. And of course add mozz! Oh and their fries are oh so good too... Definitely recommend this place if you want some great food with a nice atmosphere... Basically an upscale fastfood place similar to Portillo's.
Good place to get some beefs. Very delicious array to choose from menu. It's also good to give coupons every time you go there as well.
AWESOME! I really love this place and the Pork Kabobs were out of this world. The Greek Sauce on the Pork and vegetables was outstanding. Lemon on the potatoes and great value at just 12 bucks!

Am I glad for johnny's!!!! I just bought a house in the are and this place is in walking distance. Ordered their 1/2 pound cheeseburger. It came with fries. The fries were well done. Thick fries too. And they were all crispy. I love me some crispy fries. A nice deep golden color too. The burger was pretty good. The cheese was incredible. Huge slice of cheese, perfectly melted. I can eat a few of them. Their buns are fresh. The meat is juicy. A very nice combo. I can't wait to try their other items. I did order their soup of the day which was cream of chicken rice soup. And it was good. Johnny's seems like an overall solid spot for good food for a good price. Even if I hate everything else on their menu, their burgers and fries are enough for me.

Johnny's Place has the very, very BEST Italian beef in the area! FUGGET ABOUT Portillo's, Buona and (ick! ick! ICK!) Johnnie's Beef. None of them can compare to the wonderful taste of Johnny's. From the first bite you can tell this beef is prepared fresh every day. It's not mealy, overcooked, flat tasting. It doesn't need scads of spices to cover up the bland flavor that has been boiled/frozen out of it (shame on you Johnnie's and Buona!)

The breaded mushrooms are fabulous too.

I don't like giving places with such nice customer service bad reviews, but the food I got here was just so meh. The burgers are bland and the buns are dry and the fries are really mediocre, especially for the price. The next time went I got a hot dog and I can't even understand how they messed it up, but it was just gross. This place could be great greasy drunk food, but it just does not deliver and suffers from a way too large menu. That being said, the inside was clean and it's a really nice looking place. Some people seem to like it here on Yelp, but honestly I live like a block away and I never see more than 2 cars there, so it can't be that many. I could walk there so easily, I wish it was decent. Two stars because the staff does a nice job.
Never had a bad meal from this place. The food is extremely good and very reasonable. The portions are large and the service is fast and friendly.

You want grease. You want Chicago. Here it is.
Johnny's couldn't get anymore Chicago. You've got your gyros, your beef, your dogs, your fries. There's not much to the decor. The woman at the counter got us in and out as quick as possible. The place is clean and they had a lot of specials. I tried the gyro with everything. It wasn't too bad, but I felt like I had to wash my face when I was done. I can see it being a novelty to someone from out of town. To a Chicago girl, I know there's better out there.

my son son Dylan wanted to review the restaurant:

good costumer survise.  these people are very nice. the food is a little bit greacy but what do you expect on a fast food place. they have really good food. they had a really big menu. they had a lot of drinks there. all of them had cafine free.  you should try this place out

It's really slipped.  Prices are WAY up, counter service is indifferent.  Food isn't all that great after all.  Better places around.  $6 chicken went to $8.  $15 for shish-ke-bob at a fast food place?  Also I noticed, they make prolific use of the microwave.  No more.

Big, clean restaurant. Menu is large, so I'm not sure how much of the food is actually homemade. The fish my FIL ordered looked like it came from a bag, as well as the onion rings and fries. My soup tasted homemade and my husband liked his gyro. My MILs pasta looked good, but not great. Staff was very friendly. Service wasn't fast like a fast food drive thru, but it was on the quicker side. We will probably be back as we live so close to this location.

Surprised by low reviews. I had a Philly steak sandwich and it was s good as any place in Philadelphia and the order came out quick. The fries were big potatoy and they gave avert healthy portion with the order. I was more than satisfied with the amount given with this cheese steak at Johnny's and surprised so any dissed this nice Greek joint it is way better than where you angry other things in surrounding Re

Best thing was customer service.  They were friendly and helpful.  Then there was the food.  Mediocre at best.  Gyros was the blandest I have ever had.  Pita was doughy and flavorless.  Also, for the small amount of food and low quality, very overpriced.  Sorry, but won't be back.

Being that this place seems to have a steady stream of customers lately, I decided to give it another shot. I was pleasantly surprised.

Again, I ordered a gyro. It was a vast improvement from the first experience. The meat tasted much better, the toppings were all there (minus tomatoes, which I asked them to hold). I had a side of onion rings. They were crisp and hot. I also ordered a tamale because I've been on a kick recently. It's pre-packaged, so there isn't much to say there except that I knew exactly what I was getting.

The only gripe this time around is that the service was really slow.

I love Johnny's Place.  My husband and I are regulars of Johnny's.  Best greek chicken hands down. Last Saturday I had the gyro greek salad and it was delicious. The owners are the most down to earth good people you will meet, enjoy chatting with them every time we come in.  We are always greeted by name when we walk in the door which not only makes you feel appreciated as a customer but as a friend.  The restaurant is ALWAYS clean, bathroom is kept up.  Id recommend this place to anyone.
Clean, nice, and good burgers. Just moved here and was looking for the best neighborhood burgers. Here for fast food style. Give it a shot.

I ordered the gyro dinner which includes a salad and fries.  The fries are crunchy good.  The salad is a some chopped tomatoes, cucumbers soaking in a puddle of Greek dressing but somewhat decent.  The gyro meat is kind of flavorless though.  I have had a better gyros. The gyro meat was dry and flavorless.  Definitely a filling meal though.

I decided to try this place since I was passing it and was  somewhat hungry. I purchased a beef and fries. Upon unwrapping the beef, I couldn't help but notice that the beef was completely covered with grease - not juice, GREASE - and also that the bun was saturated with it - very soggy. I assume that the cook behind the counter was too lazy to stir the pot, prior to putting the sandwich together. So he just scraped the grease off the surface. He also didn't fill the bun with beef ( only about two thirds covered ). As for the fries, they were over baked and way too salty for me. All around, a bad meaI. I would have complained to the cashier behind the counter, but I drove home and opened the bag up there. It was too nasty to eat all of it. To say the least , I will never be stopping again at Johnny's Place. Yuch !!

We had a chicken gyro and baked mostaciolli--both were just okay.

Chicken gyro was not actual chicken gyro meat, it was just sliced chicken breast on a pita! The "marinara" sauce on the pasta reminded me of oniony sloppy joe mix without meat in it. 

So close to our house....too bad it wasn't great. Maybe I'd go back and try something else...

Johnny's place is so good and the service is great! I have tried their euros and they are so good and the hotdogs are fantastic and if you're a fry person you need to get their fries they are so freaking good! Great place to hang and chat!
I like their location; close to my house. The food is not bad. But I think it was better when they were in Park Ridge.

This place has been "Opening soon" for what seems like years.  Today, it was actually open for real.

My husband and I stop in for a late lunch, and find the place to be hoppin'.  Good for them, I thought. The menu is standard "hot dog joint" with a few extras like gyros, pasta, and BLT's.  

We ordered some hot dogs and sat down near the pop machine.  I could not help but notice some odd articles framed, and hung on the wall about dirty resturants and how places should really step up and be extra clean.......then I looked at the floor and saw enough crumbs to put a meal together.  What the???

Our food comes out, and they went overboard on the condiments.  It was the first messy hot dog I had ever eaten.  Good, and timely, but mess-E! 

Then, just as we are finishing, and employee comes out to the dining room, looks at the TV and says "UGG! Let's get some f---ing football on in here!"


Sorry to say, but Johnny's was a Hello, Goodbye for me.

Ordered a 1/4 burger with lettuce, onions tomatoes and an order of fries. The bread was nothing special and the meat was flavorless and most likely was frozen and not fresh ground meat. The onions, lettuce and tomato were tasty, maybe will try a salad next time! The fries were lightly battered and remind me of fries from Wendy's. I had high hopes, classy and clean interior, too bad the food is Meh at best. I have had a better burger and Mc Donalds and I am no fan of Mc Donalds.

Just moved into the area, and they have provided some solid "to-go" options. The 1/2 Greek chicken is really good - a highlight for not only my family, but for the friends who have been here chipping in with the move. Gyro is standard Greek restaurant gyro. The cheesy beef is solid, and the rest of the items we have had have been right on. 

The staff is friendly, and there are enough options for most to be satisfied with an option or two.

Our favorite place in Park Ridge has closed! Rent has gone up for them so much that they can't afford to be in business anymore. Johnny's will reopen at Golf & Mt. Prospect Road in Des Plaines, where Jay's Beef used to be. As of this weekend, they are already closed at their PR location on Touhy & Greenwood and the new place isn't open yet. I know we'll be coming back there after gymnastics classes.

A group of us from work visit here weekly and I can say I have yet to get anything bad on the menu.  The service is also very friendly lots of laughs with the kitchen staff and counter lady.  One of these days I am going to ask her what her name is.  The food is always hot and the soup is excellent.  Prices are good and so are the portions.

This is a pretty solid, but typical burger-gyro-ribs-chicken-etc diner. I've been there probably 5 or 6 times from lunch to dinner to late night, and it's always clean and bright, and the staff is pretty friendly, so I enjoy coming back and don't hesitate to bring others when we need something tasty and cheap. I'd like to say this is a 3.5 star place more than a 4 though, mostly because it just doesn't stand out from the crowd among diners, not much character to be had here.

The first time I went, I ordered a pork souvlaki sandwich (I'm always on the hunt for a good one!) and it was AMAZING. I don't know what cut of pork they used, but it was nice and fatty, making a flavorful, chewy, tender, greasy souvlaki, just the way it should be. I don't know if someone complained about the pork's fat content, because the next couple times I went, I got much leaner cuts of pork, and while healthy and still tasty, just wasn't the same. Maybe I'll try asking them for the fatty pork next time, eh?

I also had ordered the rib dinner once and that was fantastic. Fall off the bone ribs, so tasty. I'm salivating right now as I'm writing this.

Anyway, I did mention that there wasn't much character to this place, but I totally forgot to mention the stony-looking Yaya that sits in the corner of the restaurant (maybe the owner's mother? never asked) and makes sure the place stays clean. She totally looks like she stepped out of "My Big Fat Greek Wedding" and I never talked to her, but I love her.
Very mediocre. Not worth the trip. Salad dressing is good though.

We went here with hopes of another great place to find all of the regular greek fast food type items.
Our orders went like this:
Mine-pork kabob plate with greek potatoes and drink
Wife-chicken kabob sandwich,no onions
Kid-chicken finger meal with fries and drink

The kid liked the meal (a hard meal to mess up unless the chicken is too greasy)
Wife said the sandwich was so,so and nothing remarkable, not a lot of flavor
Mine-I asked for no onions and extra tomatoes. I was told by the lady that it didn't come with tomatoes and was not offered them 
I received the meal with a grilled french bread on the side. Have to say I really expected a pita for a kabob plate which is the norm.
There was no tzatziki with my meal. When I asked I was told it did not come with the meal. I asked if I could buy one.
The lady told me it was $.50. I forked over a dollar and received my change.
The pork was not a traditional kabob and was more like a chopped up fatty pork chop, grilled with green peppers.
There was not a lot of flavor to it so I'm glad I paid for a sauce.
All in all, not a place we will frequent as although the food was mediocre, the lady's (maybe owner?) didn't set my or my wife's world on fire.
Brandy's on Wolf & Oakton is much better than this place. Maybe we should have tried the gyros, but with the way the lady treated us, I felt like she felt as though we were bothering her. We are not very demanding or picky customers so I'm kind of at a loss.

I've seen this place being remodeled for the past year and have been looking forward to it opening.  I have to say that I was disappointed when I finally tried it.  Sure it looks a lot better than it did when the location was Jay's Beef, but I guess when you have a year to remodel it should.  But the food paled in comparision.  I had a cheesy beef and fries.  The beef was smallish for the price and dry and a bit tough and the cheese was not even melted.  The fries were plentifull but just OK.  They have a large menu but I dont know if I will be in a rush to give them another try.
I've been there 3 times. Just terrible. I will never ever go back!
I believe this is under new management and I think the Italian beef is much better. I will definitely revisit every chance I get.

I tried going here one time after work, but it said closed due to family matter.  So said I would try again eventually...  So this past week, I wanted an italian beef and some onion rings.  Italian Beef is automatically wet/dipped and you have to request if you want it dry.  I also got french fries for my daughter.  She loved the onion rings!  So yes I would stop there again!

I don't usually go out of my way to review chain restaurants but this place is a step above the rest. 

The food is just as good as any other Chipotle, but what sets them apart is their service. The staff is friendly and attentive!

I'm in here pretty regular and the regular staff makes an effort to remember you and make you feel like they appreciate your business. I like having somewhere like that in my town.

I've asked for double meat and have gotten single-meat portions, other times I ask for single-meat and my bowl comes over-filled. 

Inconsistent portion sizes, service is awful and disrespectful.

On THREE separate occasions I've had to wait five minutes because they were out of chicken... that's the meat everyone gets, wouldn't they know to be prepared?

At least the good folks at McDonald's know a thing or two about portions and being prepared LOL.
Oh dear. I was going to try this location but after reading the reviews, will try some other place for dinner tonight.

Huge Chipotle lover here!  This location in Elk Grove has to be one of the worst.  You owe it to yourself to witness this place firsthand.  Well, maybe you should read some reviews first.
 
1. Terribly skimpy portions.  Where else can you order a burrito and still be hungry?  2. Dirty tables and floors.  3. Tables outside in summer are never cleaned.  4. Constantly out of iced tea.  5. Condiment area not stocked-- frequently have to ask for forks, straws, lids, etc.  

Altogether a poorly managed/ maintained/ run restaurant.

2nd time in a row I was given barely any meat. I'm not the type to ask for a full scoop of meat after its already been scooped , I'd rather just come on here and let people know to watch out for this treatment. I was literally given half a scoop of meat. I think it's wrong and I feel they are taking advantage of the customer. It seems as if some of the workers can not handle the lunch rush and this is a major source of decline in customer satisfaction.

I've been to this location several times hoping for something better and always walk away disappointed. I always seem to get the last of the dried out steak and there's always too much rice. When I ask for double meat, they add less than half a scoop. Even the veggie bowl feels light.  Everyone is friendly enough, but they actively provide smaller portions than any other location I've visited.
Terrible service. Food was cold and they forgot part of the order. My fault I guess I shouldn't expect them to be intelligent. This is why I go to Qdoba. Never again.
Friendly location.  Food is fresh and delicious. Chipotle is one of those places I can eat at 2x/week if not more and enjoy it every time.

I love Chipotle. I like to think I'm a chipotle "expert" and anyone that knows me, knows we eat at chipotle about twice a week. 

I know they sometimes undercook their rice. I often end up with stale chips. The barbacoa can be fatty at times. The salsa sometimes is made with underripe tomatoes. 

This particular location is almost always the culprit of these issues. I eat at many locations and the Elk Grove location continues to let myself and my coworkers down. 

We don't know why we keep going...perhaps it's because we think maybe one day they will get it together but sadly, this day hasn't come. 

I regret to say that I will no longer be spending me hard earned money at this location. Check out Talpalpa down the street!

I generally try not to post reviews on chain restaurants, but this chipotle is stellar & something needed to be said! 

A friend and I came here about a month ago on a Monday night, a few hours before closing. Walking in all the guys behind the counter greeted us with fabulous enthusiasm. They made our food perfectly, and loaded our tacos with cheese.. Chipotle cheese is the way to our hearts! The guys had great attitudes, which you don't always find at the end of the day in restaurants!

This particular Chipotle has gotten so much worse in the recent years. The only reason I'm even bothering in writing this review is because I noticed that this particular review page has reviews that have been deleted. Particularly: bad ones. Whether it is this Chipotle location or Yelp administration, that is unacceptable and down right insulting. Reviews should be used to HELP the business improve, or let them know what they're doing right. You can't just throw them under the rug. Despite that, on to the actual review.

This place was the first Chipotle I've ever been to and I've had some fond memories of it. I used to go here every Monday in my senior year of high school back in 2010-2011. Me and my friends loved going here. I slowed down on going there since I graduated and went to Aurora University. But back then, I remember their chicken and their steak being perfectly cooked. Their rice was just as perfectly cooked, not at all crunchy. Even the peppers you can get as an option were very nicely cooked. Not only that, but the employees looked like they seemed to enjoy their job and were very kind.

Now lets cut to about 3 years later; November of 2014, which will be my last visit to this Chipotle. I went in around 4 pm after getting home from a long trip. I go inside and the line and customers are non-existent. I approach the front and tell the employee I want a steak burrito. The employee goes off in the back after asking this and doesn't come back. I was there for about 3 minutes before someone came over and actually helped me out. While I was waiting I decide to look at the actual food. It looks like the counter was splattered with salsa, steak, chicken, guacamole. It looked like the kids table at Thanksgiving dinner. A lot of the food was also mixing in with other stuff, which is rather risky for people with allergies. It looked as if the salsa was mixed with the others. There was quite a bit of medium salsa in the hot salsa and guacamole in the mild.

Once another employee replaced the other employee, she asks me what I want. Once again, I tell her I wanted a steak burrito. She begins to prepare it. It was a generic deal. She asked me what rice, what beans, and what meat I wanted. To be fair on the meat part, its good that she wanted to be sure she heard the right order. So I 'll give the employee that much. The entire time she was asking me what I wanted though, she just sounded so miserable. Like she didn't want to be there and was acting like I was just wasting her time. I decided that I would like a little more meat and so I ask for it. She literally puts two extra pieces of steak on the burrito. At that point I just knew it was going to be bad. I just told her "never mind. If you're just going to ration it out so poorly, just take it off." She just scoffs, groans, and scrapes off the two extra pieces she put on.

The rest of the preparation went without much problem. nothing that was mixed in with the other stuff on the counter got into what I got. So that was pretty nice of her to do. She rings me up, I pay and I get home. Overall the experience at this chipotle was horrible enough to make me give this Chipotle a low review.

Then I took a bite of the burrito. My mouth was filled with an over cooked tortilla, crunchy rice, and chewy dry and over cooked steak. It was by far the worst burrito I've ever gotten from Chipotle. It was like I was eating something from taco bell it was that bad.

I haven't been back since and that's definitely for the better. It's not like they were the only Chipotle within a 20 mile radius. There are two that are just as close to me as that one was. I will be doing my business at those locations from now on. Unless I hear this place actually improves or start to take reviews seriously instead of deleting them. Advice to the people who actually read these reviews before going to a restaurant: Go to either the Rolling Meadows, Schaumburg, or Randhurst location. You will get a significantly better experience overall. The employees are happy there, and the food is fantastic at each of those locations. Go there. Don't go to the elk grove location.

This is the first review I've ever posted on Yelp, and I only do so because I felt it was absolutely necessary. Today I placed an online order around 11:30am to be picked up at 12:15pm. A lot of times I do rapid pickup at the Panera across the street and am thrilled with their service which is always ready to go when I arrive, so I was hoping for a similar experience from Chipotle. 

I was meeting my parents there for lunch since they are headed to Florida for vacation and said I would meet them there and grab us a table since all I had to do was walk in and grab my food. I had paid for my meal online already, so if it was ready on time I should have been able to just walk in, show them my ID, and grab us a table. When I arrived my parents were still in line (about halfway back) so I gestured to them that I would get my food and get us somewhere to sit. There was one pick-up order in front of me that still needed to pay so I was patient and understanding with the staff. However, even after she left with her order, I continued to wait so long for my small order (a burrito bowl and a drink) that my parents actually made it through the line and were able to sit down and start eating before I ever got my food. 

I arrived there at 12:12pm and didn't get my food until 12:23pm (yes, I watched the clock because the food should have been ready on time). I know 8 minutes shouldn't seem like a long time and that they are super busy at lunch, but when you place an online order it's usually because you are in a hurry and only have a certain amount of time for lunch. That 8 minutes seemed super long as I watched like 20 people in line get their food before me, while I had placed my order 45 minutes before them...And to top it off, the only thing I received for the long wait on my food was a "Sorry for the wait." I feel like if you don't have an order ready ON TIME (like you are agreeing to for online orders) that there should be some sort of system in place to get your customer satisfaction back after you don't fulfill your requirements as a company (like a voucher or gift card or something to say sorry we didn't come through for you as we should have). 

Anyways, I wish I could have given this a better review but this was super poor service in my opinion. When you have an online ordering service as a company, you should have those orders ready to go when promised. End of story.
Not sure what her name is because no one here has a badge or anything to identify them by, but the Woman with the blue hair is by far the fastest and friendliest person here!

For me, Chipotle is about a once a year thing. I love the taste of the food. Typically, I'll get a burrito with either steak or chicken, but I chose carnitas this time. 

Chipotle serves enormous burritos. The portions are really huge - gluttony at it's finest. When I do go there, I typically eat about 1/2 of the meal, then eat the rest for lunch the next day. This time, I had a business meeting over lunch and without really thinking about it, I ate the whole thing.

This was a problem. I'm a small person with a small stomach. Eating an entire Chipotle burrito is way too much for me. I'm afraid I suffered for the rest of the day teetering between wanting to fall asleep and from the discomfort of over eating.

So, this is why I only go to Chipotle infrequently. I love the taste, but my eyes are bigger than my stomach and I leave in pain. This was certainly the case for this visit.

Food is good. Portions suck! You get 5 bites for 12.00. Don't even get me started on the guac. 1.95 for a tiny drop and they give you attitude if you ask for more. Don't go after 6 because they are always out of chips.

This location is the most often store I go too, but this time I have to write a review because of how poor they do not know how to rap their food. So...I ordered two burritos, one chicken and one steak. For the chicken one, when they first rap it, 1/3 of the stuff fly out from the burrito rapping. That was fine, but when they rap the steak one. I really don't know how they could break the rapping and they just double rap it for me. Therefore I was not that pleasant and I had to write a review for this location to see them improve overtime.

went there yesterday --- my kid kid drops his taco on the floor so i went back in line to buy him another one --- cashier asked if all was OK, i told her the story --- she made another taco and insisted that i don't pay --- now that deserves a better updated review.

To start, this is a review of this particular Chipotle location....

Overall, love Chipotle! Their food is fresh and I can get a Chicken bowl and not carry guilt with me all day because I splurged.  Love the seasoning on their chicken and that their salsas have a nice kick. (On that note, I've stopped going to Qdoba for that reason...not enough spice!)

Here's my deal though: the portioning here is always SO inconsistent!!!  Some days I walk out with a nice, heaped bowl and other days it seems like it's hardly half full.  I have no idea what the true portion is supposed to be at this point and it's incredibly frustrating.  I have to ask myself most of the time if I've gotten my money's worth or if I've just gotten a great deal.  

There are other little things that are concerning....employees eating chips out of the bin in the backbar area right in front of customers and I also once witnessed an employee take the garbage out with his food prep gloves on and then proceed to come in and work the food bar without washing his hands or changing his gloves. Ew.

OMG I LOVE CHIPOTLE. CHIPOTLE IS MY LIFE  the resturant always clean the staff always greets whenever i roll in i have neve been upset with chipotle except for when they skimp on the meat the bathrooms always clean drink station always stocked i love the tunes the line can get a little long but its deff worth the wait melisa kokobe is an exceptional manager

Go to this chitpole only because it's very near where I live ... Come here pretty often and the first few times were alright....but the quality worsen . Poorly wrapped and even broke. If I have time I would rather drive to another location.

Only this location: They forgot to pack in my salsa. The chips were very old and not crunchy at all. And there was a piece of chicken in my guacamole cup for the chips. Extremely disgusting. Not going back.

I do love chipotle.  This location seems to have a high turnover for employees.  I come here for lunch and typically take to go.  I have never had a quality problem, but a consistency problem.  Sometimes I get a GRANDE size and sometimes a piqueno size.  Just depends on the employee.   Always someone different.
These guys can get jammed for lunch, and there is a HS down the street.  Not bad, but not the best service.   
A smile might help.  :)
Love chipotle, don't like this location. Chicken was very fatty, people behind the counter are rude-one in particular was very condescending.

Management in this location is obviously VERY VERY poor. Communication is terrible, organization is horrendous. Family member went through four interviews and called multiple times to follow up. Dealt with three different managers and multiple employees. Was disconnected on the phone multiple times, and on the final call (after being told repeatedly a manager would call back) was told "we went with someone else have a good day" and hung up. 

Seriously?

Get some new management. Despicable.
Friendly staff and they don't skimp on the ingredients. Clean store and nice outside dining area for sunny days.

This Chipotle is HORRIBLE... I mean HORRIBLE. Everything about it. I will never come back here again! It needs to be shut down for training and new management. But I will be going to Streets because I do love Chipotle.

Terrible lunch today!  Came @ 1:30 no chicken no brown rice credit card machine not working.  Service slow, all tables dirty.  Plenty of staff but they don't seem to be doing anything productive.  Will not be back.  Too bad since my office is 5 minutes away!

Reasonable burrito bowl with minimal wait time in line. Chipotle's are a dime a dozen around here, but I am thankful that this one is near my office. There are so many people on staff during the lunch rush!  And they run like a well oiled machine. The gal at the register is super efficient which makes me a happy customer. My only real complaint...they are a little light on their pre-packed bags of chips.
Friendliest staff ever. Seriously what do they put in the water here. I love this chipotle and only this one.

I have been here a few times and I had to try out different things before I could really get something I enjoyed.  At first I went for the grilled steak burrito.  OK well that is some of the chewiest steak I have ever had.  My friends and I call it bubble gum steak.  I don't recommend it. Next I tried the chicken burrito and it was not bad.  My favorite though is the carnitas (pork).  I like the pork because it was really tender and juicy so I think I will stick with that from now on.  

I usually get the Burrito Bowl which is everything you can get in a regular burrito without the shell. You can choose from the type of salsa and rice, to the sour cream and guacamole. (the guacamole is extra).

Overall it's an OK place to have a meal and I like the chips and salsa.  I would say you just have to do the trail and error here to get it right.

A suggestion to everyone, Chipotle has two kitchens.  One for to go orders and the front.  We pre-order our food in the office online and pay online.  Then we pick up at the side of the register, either bring it back or sit down and eat.  This may be easier for some of you going in groups. 

I've only ever ordered the bowls so can't comment on the burritos but the food portions are pretty consistent for me.

This location is really close to lunch and they do a good job of getting you in and out. I find this location to be similar to all other Chipotles. The only difference is the sales tax. It is a little higher in this county.

I have been to probably a dozen Chipotles and this one is by far the worst. They are always out of a meat, or rice, or beans. They have a terrible time wrapping burritos for some reason. Every time I'm there they either have to re-wrap someone's burrito or they just wrap a second tortilla around the first one.

Chipotle is usually such a consistant experience and this one doesn't live up to the standards of other Chipotles.

I eat chipotle all the time. I have been to this store in Elk Grove 4 times. I almost always go to the Schaumburg location which is flawless. The Elk Grove village location is a nightmare. I am writing this as I eat my bowl, which tells you that I am
Not enjoying my meal as its sits and I write a review. Here are my issues with this location. They are always BLASTING THE MUSIC in here, it hurts my head. The last time I was here I waited 15 minutes in line standing there with my burrito to go while the manager and cashier fix the price and order for a lady who's pre called
Order was never filled when she came to pick it up ( so frustrated as I was on my lunch break and 15 was wasted standing in line.( shaburg location hands out free drinks for this inconvenience) here, nothing, not a sorry. Today I came in and was feigning for my favorite Barbacoa. When I saw the dried up not even submerged in the glorious Barbacoa juice, I cringed. When I say dry I mean dry, no liquid surrounding it at all. I asked them about it and they looked confused as if this is normal. Usually the Barbacoa is submerged in the heavenly spice juice, not here.I always order the peppers and onions which are usually soft and tender, today they may have just served me a raw green pepper and onion. The cashier was the same person who was confused the last time. She rang me up and didn't charge me for quac, not cuz she was being nice but because she was careless and didn't notice. After today I will be avoiding this location. Oh ya the mens bathroom only has one handle on the sink and its for
Cold water, no hot water available to wash your hands with, yuck!

Used to love Chipotle but this locations is absolutely the worst! 

Here are My reasons:

1.)They never smile
2.) They rush you through your order, to the point where you need to tell them to slow down so you can make sure their getting it right.
3.) He portion sizes vary immensely at each visit. There is no consistency at all. One time you get too much meat and then other times you get 4-5 pieces of meat...
4.) As of late, their steak is inedible... The last visit, I paid for extra meat b/c they literally were refusing to put more than 4 pieces of steak on the taco and when I got home, I had to throw away almost all of the steak because it was all fat... Disgusting and disappointing!
5.) Chips seem to always be stale... Used to love the chips but they are stale everything I get them.

I can go on about other reasons but it is clear that this is a Management problem at this location as this was never the norm at other locations of theirs. 

I will never go back and waste my money at this location and I suggest you do the same. I'm tired to complaining to a manager and having the same issue happen each visit.

Chipotle needs to clean house at this store. I cannot be the only one who feels this way.

I go to this location for lunch because it's the closest to my work.  They don't seem to be very organized, but the food is still really good. I don't recommend pre ordering online because you will wait longer for your food than just waiting in line.

Was getting lunch at this location but I'm done!!!! If you want your day ruined and be pissed off please come to Chipotle in Elk Grove and have the manager argue with you when you get over charged. Decided to walk away because there was a line of hungry people. Will definitely be calling corporate! Grrrrrrrr!!!!!

The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars: 
1) They could do a better job wrapping the burritos. The burrito wasn't wrapped properly, so once I was at the end of the burrito, everything started falling out. I could not take the foil off without ingredients falling. This has happened most of the times that I've gotten a burrito from this location. I typically get burrito bowl. and yes! I have come here many-a-times! 


The next thing is not related or is not why I lowered and gave them a "meh" with two stars. The 2 stars was solely based on the above. I think that burritos should be wrapped properly and with care! especially when the joint is a burrito joint. Can't have the ingredients falling all over at the ends because of improper wrapping.... that's just my opinion, though.

Another thing to note: 
There was a dead fly in my husbands burrito bowl in the evening. Sometimes, you can't help dead flies, I understand. This was found when we went in the evening and it's not as busy and hustling as it may be during lunch. Since the meat, ingredients aren't covered or weren't covered, I'm sure it was easy for a fly to get in. My husband found his fly in the midst of the lettuce. It happens, I totally understand. He let them know, and they just made him a new bowl. We weren't necessarily expecting a refund or anything, but it didn't seem to be a very big deal... 

If the manager reads this, I suggest covering the food especially during non-busy hours to protect the food from unwanted bugs! =)

I come here all the time, unfortunately this is the closest chipotle to my house.  This review is based off of this particular chipotle.  Every time I come here nothing is the same, either the chicken is burnt, the rice changes flavor, the steak is undercooked and fatty.  They don't understand the concept of just a little hot sauce, they ALWAYS overload it, the servings are always different.  50% of the time I come here one of the employees are either eating the chips out of the big bowl they serve to customers, or chewing down on cookies.  I also don't like seeing them handle the food without gloves.  What mostly made me write this review is the fact that anyone that has some seniority always is very rude to the new guy/girl, especially in front of the customer to show that they know more, get off your high horse buddy...you work at chipotle, in-conclusion, go to the one at The Streets of Woodfield.

I was shocked that nobody added this to yelp..! 

it was a ghost town when i arrived and was jammin when i left.. i guess i bring the party..

everything was copacetic as you would expect it.  

not the MOST desirable meal, but if at the minimum i want good ingredients in my belly and some flavors intertwined in there.. 

chipotle it is
I love Chipotle and this location is great for pickup. I recommend the food not so much the ambient.

Never had been to Chipotle before coming to this one on 9/14/13.  Got 3 steak tacos to go and brought them back to work.  Maybe about 10 minutes from the restaurant to my desk.  The steak was totally cold.  Not even a little warm, and it was like chewing gum.  I don't intend to return.

The al pastor tacos were quite possibly the single greatest thing I have ever eaten in my entire life. It's been weeks and I can still remember the amazing flavor of the pork and perfectly toasted corn tortillas. I cannot wait to eat this again. 

The burritos are enormous. The steak is awesome, it has a unique flavor, I can't describe it but it is so delicious!! Get it suiza style, you will not be disappointed.

First time dining in and at first I was not impressed with the looks but my dad invited me. Plus my boyfriend said the tacos were amazing when he came. 

  The service has been great so far the waitress is working alone and she seems to handle it very well. I ordered nachos with meat. My son got French fries b chicken tenders. 

 The nachos were amazing very authentic! They had just the right flavors and it was not heavy at all for Mexican food lol. The meat was delicious I like mine cooked all the way n this one was cooked just right with so much juice. My dad said their cal do de Rez is even better. 

 I will for sure be returning to this little joint if I come close to the area it was very good! I'm also getting a flan when I leave they look yummy!

Their Horchata is THE BEST I've ever had. I've had many and some are gritty, some are too watery, some are just nasty. This one is fabulous. 

I had the burrito dinner meal with a HUGE steak burrito with everything, refried beans, and rice. The beans were good and the rice was nothing special. The steak was actual steak but tasted like it had been boiled before or cooked in its own grease. Something was off on the taste. The tortilla and fillings were good and everything seemed fresh but not the BEST  I've ever had.  Everything cost about $10-$11 bucks. 

I went at about 12:30ish on a friday afternoon and it wasn't busy but there were several tables inside occupied by patrons. The restaurant was clean and the woman who took my order was friendly. 

Might try something else in the future. 

The quest for the best horchata has found its home here, but sadly, the best burrito quest continues.

I wanted to sample a few of their meats, before ordering a big burrito's worth of any one of them. So I got 4 different tacos.

Steak was cut into small cubes... most of it was chewy and not that flavorful.

Spicy pork was not hot-spicy.. but definitely had an exotic spice of some sort. Tasted like cloves to me.. which is not my cup of tea.

Chile relleno was decent.. on the mild side, pepper-wise. But not worth ordering again.

Chicken was the sole winner for me. It had both shredded & cut meat in a paprika sauce.. yum ! That will definitely be my burrito of choice, the next time I visit here. And I *will* visit again, especially after reading favorable reviews of their horchatas :-)

BTW... the onions & cilantro on the tacos were very fresh & tasty. They made enough of a good impression on me to mention here !

Salsa rocho (red) had a good charred taste with mild to no heat. Salsa verde (green) had an almost-spoiled taste (?!) with moderate heat.

The cashier & waitress girls (late night) were also *very* polite.

I don't know where all the negative reviews come from, this is the only place ill get mexican food. their prices are great and they give you huge servings here. i literally will drive from wherever i am to get their food. the steak is always tender and flavorful, plus never any gristle. the nachos are amazing and sometimes i can't finish them all, and i can eat. the horchata is always consistent and yummy. you can even get a chile rellenos taco here! definitely give this place a shot, you won't be sorry.
This place always hits the spot. One of the few Mexican restaurants in Addison that offer home made tamales. The giant burrito is no joke! It's literally the size of your head. Come hungry.

Love the food here. The giant steak burrito is my usual go to but all of it is very good for the price.  The people that run the place are always generous and helpful if you stay in to eat. Authentic mexican food and environment experience.

I am 100% Mexican, and have traveled to a few different parts of Mexico numerous times. This place has THE BEST Mexican food I've ever had. The taco meat is tender and not too dry. Not to mention, the portions are insane!

If you happen to stop by, I STRONGLY recommend you try their carne asada nachos, or carne asada burrito with french fries. OMG to die! 

Another thing you MUST try is their horchata...so yummy! The service is also great. I usually go late at night so I always see the same waitress there by herself. Sometimes it is very busy, but she's super sweet and fast.

This place has the best Mexican food I have ever had. Always fresh good food. Employees are very nice. And you can't beat the prices. I work the late shift and it's hard to get fresh food late at night.

wow what a joke this place is.  Absolutely one of the worse places around.  the burritos are super small, the steak was dry., and the little amount of cheese they put on turned orange from the grease.  I am not sure where these pictures are coming from that show the burrito being as big as the persons hand, so I am guessing he is a small midget jockey, and any burrito would be giant to him.  this place sucks ass.
Phenomenal Mexican food and the best horchata .... They are also extremely nice and fast
This is hands down one of the best burritos in the area!! The steak is really fantastic!!

For a strip mall burrito joint it passes mustard, but it's not a destination type of a place.  If you are driving by, or in the area, by all means try it.  But don't go too far out of your way.

The steak is NOT the best around.  Maybe the best on Lake St in Addison, but not worthy of lofty praises some bestow upon it.  If you think it's the best, take a fifteen minute ride west to Hacienda de Roselle and try that.  Then, come back here and tell me this is benchmark quality (there are better places than Hacienda de Roselle, but I can't think of one in this area).

Slightly better than average taco stand fare in big porttions at average prices served by nice people in a place clean enough to pass inspection.  That just about sums it up.

Fantastic Mexican food! Got a burrito with carne asada and an horchata and it was so yummy. Meat was perfectly cooked and their horchatas are always on point. Walked in when it was lunch hour but their service was so fast there was barely any waiting for my food. Service was great and they are really friendly. One of the best Mexican restaurants in that area.
The food was the closest thing to Taco Bell Yet. Located in a strip mall this place is impossible to see from the street. Worth a stop plenty of parking.

We wanted tacos and the usual local place was closed, so we thought we'd try a new place.  We were in route to a random place we pulled up on yelp but saw this place and stopped instead. Maybe we should have kept driving. They were very nice here but the steak tacos weren't anything to write home about. The meat was dry and in big chunks. I like my tomatoes smaller and they also were in big chunks. The fries weren't what I like but that's a personal preference, not to say that they were bad. Salsa was alright. Next time id check out another location.

My favorite place around for mexican food.  Better than the fancier places in the area.  I've ordered many different things and they were all good.  Every place has an off night here and there if go enough times but not here.  Their steak is of better quality than most football burrito joints you'll find.  Hard to spot if your not paying attention, just look for Caputos and pull in.  The steak is great as well as their tamales and stuffed peppers.

The food is always consistently excellent. The Carne Asada con Cebolla is only $8.95 on special. Very basic atmosphere, but don't let it fool you. Some of the best Mexican food around at a very reasonable price. They also do a great breakfast burrito, too.

Had good expectations because of times reviews. Especially after reading a review from the girl who is 100% Mexican and traveled to Mexico. She claims this is the best place ever. Idk what part of Mexico she went to or where else she ate but this is definitely not the best place ever. You don't have to be Mexican to know that this place is not the greatest. Seriously this place is worse than taco bell. In fact I prefer taco bell over this place. The chips and salsa were good I give them that. The Carne Asada taco was decent. Everything else sucked. The spicy pork should be called salty pork. Couldn't even finish it because it was so salty. The chicken taco was just OK. The staff was really friendly though so I'll  give then that. Otherwise it's not worth for me to come back. Im from San Diego and also have traveled to Mexico many times. It doesn't qualify me to be the commissioner of Mexican food. But I've only found one place that has great Mexican food out here and this is not it.

Holy guacamole batman.
Steak ranchero with red sauce!
This is Tasty as hell, im talkin walk on broken glass, betray your friends,
live in the basement of your moms house awesome!
If you dont like this dish, your a lost soul wandering the world with taste buds made of sawdust....
and there open til 1am!!!! nothing tastes good at that hour...
EAT HERE

I'm so gald I found this place on here. All of the other places in the area don't compare. Their chilaquiles with green sauce are AMAZING...... My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!!! The portions are large for the price, and the service is very pleasent.

Where I have been as I've missed out on this place for so long! 

Food was soooo delicious and not heavy but still filling with great flavor

Sooooo thrilled to get my Noodles & Company fix today! It's been what seems like ages since I ate at one of their locations (I currently live in a small town miles away from places like this). While in Chicagoland for a super short weekend, I really wanted to satisfy my Noodle craving... so we came here. 

I am glad the prices haven't gone up ($5.99 for a regular bowl) in the last several years and the meal portions are still reasonable. My Pesto Cavatappi was just as wonderful as I remembered; the size of the Caesar salad disappointed me, but whatever. If you do decide to add meat or sides to your meal, the price does add up, but it's fine if you stay simple.

I just have two complaints about this place. 1) The cashier that took my order barely greeted me or smiled. Blah. 2) Too many of the empty tables were still dirty. Blah.

But.... Food was good, and my craving was satisfied. That's all I asked for today.

One of the best Noodles locations that I've been to. My sister lives nearby, but we drove out of the way to visit the Meacham restaurant because she said it was much better than the other locations in her area. She was right!

(This never happens). 

Everything was clean, the service was friendly, and our food came out quickly.
