We ordered the Pad Thai, Japanese Pan Noodles, and the Pesto Cavatappi, which we usually pick up from the Geneva Commons location, and they didn't disappoint. Our noodles were perfectly cooked and had just the right amount of sauce and seasoning. Not bad for under $35.  

As a side note, I think the new dishes really help to class up the food. At the end of the day, we're all paying $10 for a bowl of noodles, but somehow I feel better about that when it comes in a fancy bowl.  

Keep on doing you, Noodles & Co. You're not exactly one in a million, but you're definitely one in ten(ish).
It's your typical noodles!! The staff is very friendly and the food is good enough to eat.. Perfect for lunch with co-workers

Probably about the best way I can describe this place is that it is essentially a noodles version of Chipotle. They use very fresh and appetizing ingredients, which is a variable that makes all the difference in the world to a (I admit, highly Americanized) Thai noodle joint. Also like Chipotle, they kick out food in very rapid succession in an assembly line type of fashion. So no need to feel intimidated if the line is long and you are on your lunch hour, as they kick out product lightning quick. From the time to place your order until the time you are paying for it will be 2-3 min tops. 

As for the food itself, it is pretty spectacular for it's type. I have been here several times since it is so close to my office and handy for a quick lunch. I have yet to get a bad bowl. Consistency is an important variable to places like this, and thus far they have held up their end of the bargain. If you want to throw caution into the wind as far as nutrition, go for the mac and cheese bowl with parmesan chicken. It is creamy and fantastic, and with a little Sriracha it's absolutely heavenly and worth a little extra time of cardio. Trust me! 

On my most recent visit I decided to go more traditional and opted for the Tomato Bisque and Bangkok Curry with shrimp. The soup was amazingly good, with a tangy like zip of flavor that was very satisfying. On my previous visit, the chicken noodle was not as good. It was loaded with great ingredients, but the broth was somewhat bland. Not the case with the bisque, as it was phe-nom-nom-inal! 

The Bangkok curry dish was also fantastic, and they did not overdo it on the curry either. This tends to be the case at many places that serve a similar dish. Don't get me wrong, I love the flavor of curry, but when they go overboard to the point that I need to take a half hour shower and gargle bleach before even attempting to come near my GF, I would call that problematic. Cheap Indian joints are notorious for this. I envision kitchen exchanges in places like those to be something to the effect of: 

Cook 1- "Oh, the flavor is a bit off, you say...?" 

Cook 2- "No problem, just add 12 cups of curry powder to the sauce and it should fix it right up". 

Yeah, lame! 


The noodles themselves were not sticking together and tasted very fresh and the vegetables were also a cut above average. I like my vegetables to still maintain a minor amount of firmness, not be cooked to mush like you get at a Mongolian BBQ, so good marks there. 

Lastly, service from the staff here has always been friendly during my visits and the restaurant has always been clean. 

Overall, this is a great option if you are in the area and want to grab a bite. Not worth traveling a great distance for, but the food is quite good and it's inexpensive enough that it's not going to be a problem if you stick to a budget. Yes, it's a chain, which tends to bring out harshness by those with a pretentiousness complex, but I can assure you that the food stands well on it's own merits.

For whatever reason we tend to end up at noodles & co. for lunch a lot?

This location is typically clean and they have friendly service.

I've tried a lot of different menu items here now including: the Japanese pan noodles, steak stroganoff, Mac n cheese, and the Indonesian saut.  Generally the food is decent, the portions are decent, and the price is decent.  There is not really a wow factor here but consistency does have its merit.  

I noticed they have a lot of baked dessert goods (rice crispy treats, cookies, and brownies) that look good but I have not indulged to date.  

Overall noodles & co. is a good place for a quick lunch.  You will get a decent amount of food for a decent price in a generally clean environment from generally friendly people.

Ordered Pad Thai. Paid over $13: $1.50 for each vegetable to add extra carrots, broccoli and mushrooms. Look at the photo: expectations vs. reality. Literally had 3 tiniest pieces of chopped carrot, 2-3 pieces of broccoli and mushrooms were nowhere to be found. No sauce either. Disgusting!

Paid extra $2 for more Pesto Sauce on the side and I literally got 2 spoons of it. It was so low, you could barely see the difference between the extra pesto sauce or sauce they put in. Worst Noodles and Company I've been too and never will go here again.

The food was quite tasty and the service was excellent. I like the variety of food types available. Great choice if you can't pick what to eat or if you have a group that all wants different things. We ordered a macaroni kids meal, though the apples "tasted like bug spray" to my daughter, probably due to whatever lemon type stuff they put on the slices to keep them fresh (it did not taste like plain lemon juice). I had the pad Thai, hubby had stroganoff, and my son had the Japanese noodles with meatballs.

During lunch time, this place is almost ALWAYS busy, with a long line to the door. Surprisingly, today, we walked in, and were able to place our order within minutes, AND there was actual seating this time. That hardly ever happens.

N&C is a always a good alternative to the usual.

I ordered the Pesto Cavatappi, and added a grilled chicken to it (added cost). Second time ordering it and it's just fantastic. Best part about this place is they have Sriracha sauce on hand, and well, everything is always better with Sriracha on it!!

The service was quick today and our food only took a few minutes to come out, and I must say, it was pretty good.

Service was extremely slow as a rookie struggled through taking our order and making most of our food while a veteran employee sat in the back (visible to us) doing nada.  We took our order to go and were missing the milk we ordered. Food was Ok, no real complaints there, but with tons of other options in the immediate area the poor service left me not wanting to come back.

First time checking out this chain.  Could we call it the noodles version of Pei Wei? It has more variety in terms of cuisine, but when you are presented the menu it works the same way.  You pick a flavor - different cuisines like Asian (Bangkok Curry was very good, Pad Thai was pretty good) to Italian (Pesto Cavatappi) to American (Mac'n'Cheese) - and then protein (Pork was great, shrimp was OK).  There is a gluten-free/carb-watcher options where you can order 'in the buff' by swapping out the noodles for a bed of spinach and an included protein and extra veg.  (I wanted to go 'buff' but with noodles also, but didn't try on my first visit).

The people at the front were great helping us navigate the menu and options our first time.  And also making sure we enjoyed our dish as we ate.  The regular sized order is plenty enough food for the price with the protein, has a good mix of veggies to noodles to protein.

There was no way to have them make a dish spicy in the kitchen, but they do have a sriracha sauce and slammin' spice blend that adds enough to your dish to get the job done.  (For real, that 'Smoulder From Boulder' blend of just red chili/black pepper/cayenne and paprika was great).

We'll be back.

I was really hoping the reviews about the Mac & Cheese were wrong; they were not. My best friend and I both got a small bowl of the Wisconsin Mac, and it just wasn't anything to write home about. It certainly helped that it costs less than $5, but that doesn't excuse getting elbow noodles with a pinch of shredded cheddar, plus a few drops of liquid cheese below, but not enough to balance the noodles. I was really excited when the bowl landed, because the noodles are cheese-colored... then I realized they were bare, apart from the few shredded pieces, haha. Honestly, given the choice, I would rather make boxed mac & cheese.

That said, service was prompt, price was right for eating out, and I was just thrilled to be with my best friend. If/when we come back, I'm ordering something else.

My daughter chose Noodles and Company. Typically, if I want noodles, I'll go to an Asian noodle house. But, since Sarah counts macros, everything is available here.

This is the newer location in Schaumburg across from Costco. It was not particularly crowded. I ordered Pad Thai. It was okay - not as good as I would expect to get from a real Thai restaurant. But, it was certainly fresh and filling.

Here, you order at the counter and they deliver it to you when it's ready. At least you know it is freshly made. This is not my favorite way of being served at a restaurant, which probably accounts for the three stars more than anything. 

Food = okay, prices = fair, service = eh.

I treated myself to Indonesian peanut saute with chicken for my first visit to Noodles & Co. Service was fast, and I seated myself by the window. 

I had water, but I noticed they had one of those new Coke Freestyle machines for those that are fans. (I like 'em but it takes too long when somebody doesn't know what they want.)

Got my dish of noodles but immediately surprised by the amount of bean sprouts littered atop my meal. Not cooked, but I guess it works. Mixed in with the noodles, the crispness came down making it more manageable to eat. I didn't realize this was a spicy dish, but that's ok. I can scarf down kimchi like nobody's business. Noodles were good but tasted a bit too close to pad thai for my liking. Chicken was cut flat, and was dry.

Will I come again? Given the choice of an authentic Thai/Indonesian restaurant or Noodles & Co., probably not. Was the food bad? Not really, but it wasn't great either.

Very unorganized pick up line. I kept getting sent back and forth until I was finally like I have been sent back and forth five times. Finally the workers communicated with each other and I was finally able to get my food...

Well it's clearly stated they are open until 10 p.m. but try showing up at 9 and they tell you the grill has already been cleaned up. Talk about a guilt trip. But hey, I want a little protein on my pasta. It's on the menu, you are open until 10....open the grill back up. No need for the snot look, honey, we are simply looking for a decent meal after work. Keep your grill open until the store closes. Period. While the food is tasty and deserves more than a single star, I am obliged to deduct 4 stars for the smug look and thought of the griller spitting in my food.

Oh, look, more customers! You are open for another 45 minutes. Deal with it kiddos!!

Whatever that fell soup was, it most certainly was not "yellow curry." Just nasty. Cheap vegetables that also happen not to be nutritious. 

Horrid customer service and our orders took forever to arrive. Staff isn't the brightest.

My low rating is for the staff. I LOVE Noodles & Company. I eat there probably more than is good for me. Emerytur i order my dish, i ask for extra sauce. My previous visit I received my extra sauce and it was laughable! I had to scrape whatever it was out of the container with a piece of shrimp!! I'm paying money for air?! When I went back another time, I mentioned this to an employee and the girl rudely stated "well one extra order is one ounce." This time I ordered 2 extra sides of sauce thinking the amount would be different. It was the SAME amount as 1 ounce!! Now I'm stuck eating DRY noodles. Don't pay for anything extra at this location. Thieves.

I have no problem with this place except the price/portion size.  When a small does not even fill up my four year old (think stomach the size of your fist) who had been snacking til lunch...that to me is a problem.  Their profit margin must be awesome though.
People working there were nice.  Food came out quick.  Food was good.

I've been to this Noodles & Company located on multiple occasions.  The staff is generally very welcoming and one employee even let me sample a couple of the soups when I was unsure of what to choose! 

For Starters:  I'm a big fan of the Potstickers.  They are always cooked perfectly and goes with whatever pasta I decide to order. 

My Standard Order: Penne Rosa w/Parmesan crusted chicken.  Amazing combination.  Penne Rosa is a tiny bit spicy but with a whole lot of flavor.  I could eat this for dinner every night. 

Spice it up: Indonesian Peanut Sautee. I'm not a HUGE fan of this one, however my boyfriend loves it.  It's enough heat with a bunch of noodles!

Desert: Hands down, get the Rice Krispie Treat

Food is great but the service at this location is a joke!  On the door it states they are open until 10pm. We get here at 9pm. Order a dish that has chicken in it and the woman behind the counter gives me a look then turns toward the grill - turns back to me and says it's going to be lot longer wait because they are shutting down the grills!  

What??? An hour before close they are shutting down the grills???   NOODLES!  KEEP YOUR BUSINESS OPEN UNTIL CLOSE!  After you close THEN start cleaning the place up in the kitchen! Business 101!
The food is good but last two times I went to carry out they forgot my salad dressing and the second time they gave me the wrong order arggggf

Poor service, food is mediocre.  We asked for chicken noodle soup, and they brought tomato basil soup.  When we asked about it, they made a big deal out of it that they are replacing it without changing extra.  Do not recommend this location at all.
Loves the noodles here. Always great service and friendly people too.

I have been coming to this Noodles and Company for years and they always have a consistently fast and flavorful product. I also like how you get a really big portion for 5-6 dollars.

I also like how there is enough variety to get something for everyone.

Wanted something different from the usual panera, so this felt like a good option. Walked in on a busy New Year's Eve lunch hour... Kid off school, work people crowd. They took only 5 mins to make my food seemed less than that even. I've been here before with no crowd and waited almost 10 mins for food. Not sure if depends on what you order but I'm not complaining. I love there Chinese chx salad!!!! Would give 5 stars but potstickers are a hit or miss. They were flattened and the sauce that comes with which is usually amazing tasted stale. I've had potstickers here before that aren't flat its kind of weird. Host Annmarie was sooo friendly she was awesome!

I can't remember ever trying Noodles & Co before but I really liked it when I grabbed it for lunch yesterday. The service was super fast, the location is very convenient to my work, and the dish I had was quite good. I can't believe I'm doing this but I'm about to give a chain noodles place 5 stars.

I was sent a coupon because it was my birthday so I ended up getting my dish for free. However, for a regular sized portion of pad thai with no meat or tofu it's $5.25. For me, that is perfect because I prefer my pad thai without any meat. So in the end, I would end up getting a cheaper pad thai then if I ordered from any other Thai place. For those meat eaters out there, it's $2 extra though! And veggies can run $1 extra! This could really add up. So my big, bargain lunch at $5.25 could be your more expensive $8.25 dish and you probably wouldn't feel like you're getting such a good deal at lunch. Got all that? :P

I was skeptical getting pad thai from a non-Thai place but was pleasantly surprised. I absolutely loved it! The portion was big, the flavor was spot on for me. It had less calories then other items on the menu, as well. I'm super weak with spicy stuff and this had a kick to it for me. However, it was the perfect amount...a little kick but it truly enhanced the flavor. My mouth was on fire when I finished eating! I'm such a weak sauce.

All in all, I'm glad I got the coupon for the free lunch because I see myself coming back here a lot of lunch!

Such bad quality food. Got the Pad Thai. Did not taste like Pad Thai. Noodles weren't thoroughly cooked, for instance still stuck together. Barely any chicken in my Pad Thai that I paid $2.59 for. Never going here again..bad experience.

Picked up food here. Whole grain linguini. Unbelievably all the tofu in it was totally burned... They still proceeded to feed this to a customer, is this a joke? Attached it the picture of what I got. I guess we are never going back there. Eww...

Food was pretty good. I had the Indonesian Peanut Saute with Shrimp. It was good. Large Portion was good enough for one person if you are hungry. I felt as though it could have been more spicy. Guys who came with me had soup and pasta to go with it, so I think it is definitely a good place if you like pasta, noodles and soup. Service was good. I give bonus points since they handed out rice krispies for free since we were there till the closing time. Woohoo :D (Good rice Krispies btw :) ). I had a snicker-doodle cookie too - which was Ok.

I like noodles.  I like them even more when there is an entire chain dedicated to making noodles from several cuisines so my husband can like noodles too.  I have been to a Noodles & Co. before and thoroughly enjoyed the Mac and Cheese (and a GIANT rice crispy treat) so I thought I'd give the Pad Thai a try this round.  (Meh.  See below.)   

We came here for lunch on a ridiculously busy Saturday.  So busy, in fact, there was a long line, a long wait, and almost nowhere to sit.  The restaurant is decent, the initial customer service was okay, but once we got our food and simultaneously received two free meals because of the craziness, my initial weariness dissipated.  Funny how free things can do that to a person.  Even though there were noodles galore, my man got a meatball sandwich and chicken noodle soup (Said chain and The Noodle Gods did not smile upon him this day as planned.  Oh well.)  I got the Pad Thai 86 everything but noodles pretty much.  I done messed that up.  Everything else was good though.

We will be back with our free bowl cards in tow.  Next time though, I will get what Noodles tells me to...I mean, they ARE the experts.
Excellent service but the meat quality is very low for the money you pay.. I will think twice before stepping in with the budget...

Admittedly, a more Americanized version of just about everything on their menu, they're pretty good in a fix after a long day at work and a short time before the desire to collapse into the couch and veg out for the night is absolutely overwhelming. Mostly because they don't hide the fact that what you're getting is about as far away from authentic Thai cuisine as Earth is from the sun. They don't argue the distance, they just do their best to make up the lost ground in a pinch.

Pad Thai, Japanese Pan Noodles and Indonesian Peanut Saute are all fantastic choices for someone looking for a comparable dish to appease cravings for Southeast Asian cuisine when the real thing isn't available, a bit pricier or your preferred locale is closed. The important thing to remember is setting expectations within appropriate bounds and still relishing that, all things considered, it isn't perfect, but it's something. 

The location is great without ever feeling cramped and is ultimately inviting. The staff is awesome and is more than happy to accommodate even exceptionally outlandish requests, within reason of course, regardless of how far it may deviate off the menu. For a place that serves off-shoot cuisine, it's my preferable locale, hands down.

That being said, my favorite is the Pad Thai, without a doubt. Be sure to have them add extra shrimp, twice. Trust me, you won't regret it. If you enjoy a bit of variety, which is the spice of life, be sure to nab a bottle of sriracha and give it a bit more of kick. You might enjoy it a lot more than you think.

I think if there is one thing I can really complain about is the cost, which can spiral above $30 for two to have a satisfying meal. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, after all you're paying for this food in a pinch, but at the same time - not being a monopoly guy and all - it is certainly a back alley knock to the gut for anyone's wallet when looking for Thai on a budget.

Ultimately, despite invariably countless Noodles & Co scattered about the area, this one sticks out in my mind. Not necessarily for the food, but for the service, which has proven to consistently be spot on when my wife and I step in. If you're looking for authentic though, it still bears mentioning, there are plenty of alternatives.

I just wanted to quickly say that last week, my mother and I came in to pick up food for the family to-go and Matt is the employee that helped us. He was extraordinarily helpful and I noticed after we left that he wrote on the receipt "Thanks! -Matt" I thought it was the nicest gesture and he definitely deserves some recognition. That's all! Food was decent, noodles as usual -very consistent.

I do like their meatball sandwich here.  The chicken noodle soup was pretty decent as well.  I'm not sure as to why everyone thinks this place is top notch tho.  Just because you pay alot for food doesnt always mean its that good.

Dont get me wrong, its not a bad place to go by any means, but cmon, 5 star restaurant?   Hellz nah.

Pad Thai was ok. There was plenty of shrimp and noodles but it just didn't have any flavor to the dish. Everything tasted fresh, it was just bland to say the least. I'll try a different meal next time and give them the benefit of the doubt

I can never get a bad dish here. Everything is so delicious and fresh! 
So many options to mix and match foods and flavors you like. 

I always switch it up but this last visit I got a combo dish. The buttered noodles (my all time favorite) with a side of Med salad. Warning: the Med salad comes with a spicy yogurt dressing but it is killer. It has so much flavor. That's the punch you feel in your mouth when you go for every bite. 

Service is great. Staff is friendly. Nice atmosphere. It's not a place you take a first date to impress but an awesome place for lunch and quick and easy for dinner.

I haven't eaten at a Noodles in many years, and was craving a big bowl of pasta.
While it isn't necessarily gourmet, it certainly fits the comfort food category.
I love that their offerings spread across a wide swath of ethnicities.  
On this trip I had the Penne Rosa, and added pork.  very tasty, with a just a little bit of spice to it.
I remember always loving their japanese pan noodles, pad thai, & stroganoff.
I need to get back to a Noodles more often.

This location slipping on the little things. Only one of three registers ever manned. Coke Freestyle machine always out of something and today they didn't even have the refills. Did offer something similar from the cooler.

I don't normally right reviews for chains or fast food... but I had an amazing experience here yesterday that warrants a review.

I am a vegan and have lots of dietary restrictions. But we were in the area and desperate to find something to eat. Thought it was going to be really difficult. But the woman at the counter understood all my restrictions and recommended something and exactly how to substitute to fit my needs. When I asked about certain menu items, she knew EXACTLY what was in each thing that i might not be able to eat.

I chose my dinner based on her recommendation, AND IT WAS FABULOUS. If it was not a fast food atmosphere, I would never have guessed this dish didn't come from a fancy 3x as expensive restaurant.

It was my first time here, and i will definitely go there again. She also later showed me they have a menu that even shows what is in everything... so I should be able to find lots of options and modifications using that alone.

This location is just really inconsistent.  Overall good....but I almost always notice random bits of the wrong food in my dish and today the cashier had a terrible, snotty attitude...not appreciated when I was coming in to redeem my birthday coupon.

Eat here regularly.  I tend to like the items from the Asian part of the menu the most, but so far everything I've tried has been good.

Avoid getting there at noon - lineups get long and seats scarce.  Typically service is good, though there were a few bumps when they first opened up  - very normal.

I usually order small with meat and a rice-krispie square and it ends up being around $7 to $8 if memory serves.  (Did I mention?  Great rice krispie squares, one of my favorites).

Would I recommend:  Yes
Would I return:  Yes

How would you like to order take out, get to the counter and watch your food sit helplessly waiting for someone to pick it up so you can leave? How about waiting for about 10 minutes and after having waived to everybody  including the people who clean tables, feel like making an attempt to jump over the counter, grab your food and run?

That's almost what I did at this restaurant. The army of clueless people running into each other behind the counter did everything possible other than handing me my food until someone decided to finally hand me my bag with pasta that had been sitting there for almost 15 min. I was trying to eat before a meeting and by the time I got back to the office, I was hungrier, angrier and late. When I opened the container with my Caesar Salad, a surprise!!!! NO DRESSING! Yay!

So here's where I stand: I love Noodles and will keep going to all of their stores. But the one in Schaumburg will not see my pretty little face ever again!

Love the concept.  You pick your noodles, sauce, toppings and size.  Got the Indonesian peanut sauce .  Initially I thought they put too much beansprouts, but the crunch is good with the sauce.  The decor reminds me of chipotle.

I ate here one time...and my response it that it is mediocre. It seems like the stuff they make is something I could make at home for cheaper. They are overpriced for what you get, and what you get doesn't even taste that great. I had soup (which is hard to mess up), and that wasn't even that impressive. I never really had the desire or craving to go back.

Great food and even better service! Been coming here for years with the kids and they always have a good meal and fun experience (chopsticks!). Recently, I've coaxed the GF to join us and she ordered the BBQ Pork Mac (loved it) and the hot Edamame, which was really tasty. My only wish is that there was one closer to me; I would find myself eating here much more often.
all noodles and co get 5 stars.  this is probably my favorite restaurant in the entire world. great prices, great ingredients. i will be obsessed for my entire life.  pasta fresca 4 lyfe.

Tried the Pesto Cavatappi (sans mushrooms) a few weeks ago for the first time and really enjoyed it. It's going to be tough choosing between it and my old standby, buttered noodles, the next time I eat here. 

My coworker really loves the "homemade" rice krispie treats they sell at the register which she generously shared with me but I didn't really care for them.

I've eaten at Noodles and Co. plenty of times and never really been a fan.  Curse my evil friend for making me go again!  Well it has been a few years so I forgot what was okay and not so great.  I must've picked the wrong dish:  Mushroom Stroganoff with braised beef.  The pasta was bland and the braised beef was too salty, yet it was in fact braised and very tender.

I went during lunchtime and the service was super fast.  They also had a carry-out register.  My order took about a minute to cook and I was on my way.  But I didn't enjoy my lunch very much, so I'm not sure about coming back.

I like this place. The staff is friendly and the food is always good. I've tried many things on the menu but my fav would have to be the pesto cavatopi with the parmesan crusted chicken on top with a side of flatbread. Most of time I'll get a trio which is a small noodle, side soup or salad, and choice of protein I think...I'm kinda on auto-pilot when I order there.

Overall, good eats

So, I literally just visited here and I'm still eating my food and I can't help but wonder if I was over-charged. I ordered a regular size mac & cheese with meatballs and a drink and it came to $10-something. The cashier failed to give me a receipt (and almost forgot to give me a cup for my drink...had to ask for a cup) and I felt silly for getting back in line and asking for it (ridiculous, I know). I've ordered from this location before (similar order) and it never came to that much. I understand Schaumburg has a high tax but not that high...a $2-4 increase since end of December???  Rats, I wish I asked for my receipt. 

The food at this location is of the same consistency/quality as other locations so no complaints there. My only suggestion would be to have a bench or something where to-go patrons can sit while waiting for their order. This location gets busy during lunch due to the location and I am always awkwardly standing around trying not to get in anyone's way.
I had the pad Thai with shrimp. It was not bad, but would be nice if they offered chicken. I also got a piece of pasta that didn't belong with my Thai noodles.

The customer service here was freaking AWESOME!
They lost 2 stars because I didn't like what I ordered- because I ordered based on the employees suggestion that I would LOVE the dish she had in mind... It wasn't packed full of spicy flavors as I expected per the cashier's insistence so I was sorta bummed...They gained a star back because when I left the manager gave me a free dish card due to the fact that she watched me struggle to pick through my dish and eat only certain parts of it! 

The restaurant was very clean on the inside. I went right at opening time, my food was prepared hot and fresh to order. This place filled up fast... For a fast food restaurant I was served on real dishes with real silverware. I almost felt obligated to TIP! 

They also served wine and beer here, I have been to Noodles & Co. only one other time- in Michigan and I don't recall the dishes or the alcoholic beverages. 

The staff here was very friendly.

I am not in S-Burg alot- but I would def go back here again if I'm ever in the area.
Great food!   This location is consistent in quality and the food is always excellent.   The management here is also helpful and cooperative, and goes out of their way to be helpful.

My husband and I were starving on a Saturday evening after a full day of shopping and decided to try Noodles. We had been to a Noodles many years ago, but wanted to give it another try. We got the Japanese Noodles and Pad Thai. We waited a few minutes while our food was being prepared and one of the women working there handed a full try to another woman and said "here, you take this." The woman was already helping another customer, but took the tray from her anyways. then the first woman laughed and said "she doesn't do anything anyways!" It was sickening to watch it! 
Once we brought the food home, we kept sniffing around thinking our dog had an accident near by, only to find that it was the smell of the food! So horrible! Th cucumber tomato salad is not a salad, just chopped tomatoes and cucumbers, not even any seasoning or dressing! We were so disappointed!
We probably won't go back even to try other entrees due to there being so many other great places to get carry out in the area.
Very standard.  Friendly staff, decent food, but nothing to write home about.

My first bite of Pad Thai tells me a lot about any place daring to serve it.  Am I immediately going for that second bite because the yumminess is already there or am I reaching for the Sriracha?
With N&C I was reaching for the sauce. Of course it's not traditional Thai but I thought it would intrigue me. All in all a little bland, noodles slightly over cooked but otherwise fresh. 
Service and prices were great. Next time I'll go with a favorites recommendation, the Japanese Pan Noodles
Always love it every time:)...I get the pad Thai meal and its delicious each time I order it, and much less expensive than Big Bowl!!
Love love love the Penne Rosa with parmesan crusted chicken! Great food and friendly employees.

I went for the first time this past Sunday after returning from ATL, where the playas play.... =P 

We were traveling all day. unpacking. cleaning. btw, did I mention that we skipped lunch? I was starved.

Anyway, the food was awesome - totally not expecting that for a chain restaurant. But yup! 

I got the Japanese Noodles with Thai Soup. My husband got the Red-based American pasta with basil tomato soup. (Please excuse my lack of knowledge on names. I do not have the menu in front of me and honestly, I'm too lazy to look it up.) 

I was pleased.

Stopped in for dinner with the family last week and expected the usual great experience as we've had in many other Noodle&Co locations but it wasn't to be.

The dining room was messy and dirty.  We moved 2 tables until we found one that wasn't sticky. The restrooms were DISGUTING and smelled of urine even in the hallways. I don't think they were tended to all weekend.

The food was as good as usual but we left there saying to each other that we would NEVER go there again and would stick to our ParkRidge location in future. No comparison. It was late and we were too hungry to go somewhere else. I'm not sure how they keep their franchise licence. If the Health Dept. came in they would be fined at the least. I wonder now about the kitchen....yuck. 

The worst part...

I broke out with a cold sore on my lip in the following next few days..and I've never had one in my life. I've read it could be transferred from silverware....and suspect it was from the Noodle & Co. 

Save yourself and DON'T go there!!!!!!!

It is a decent place to have quick lunch and dinner. Not all dishes are good. I find this joint have better cooks at lunch. The pasta at dinner time is not as great. 

I usually have pasta, sometime Pad Thai as well.

I love noodles, and when I saw this place, I was intrigued.  I'd never been to one of these places, but the pricing seemed very affordable and like I said, I love noodles.

The place is pleasant enough, but kind of has a "Marriott" vibe to it, if that makes any sense.  Very commercial fabrics, lighting, etc.  I ordered a spicy asian noodle dish with tofu, and sat down.  The noodles were pretty tasty, albeit a bit greasy for my liking.  But the tofu sucked.  Seriously, it was so over-cooked it made squeeky noises between my teeth.  Would I be back?  Maybe, if someone else was choosing the restaurant.  Just stay away from the tofu...

Arrived at 11am- door stated they opened at 10:30. Had to ring the doorbell and knock before someone came and opened the door, claiming the lock is broken. Once inside I went to the register to order, where the cashier said hi and walked away from me, returning a minute later to take my order. She then proceeded to over charge me. When I pointed it out to her she went to ask the manager about it (who was on the phone) and came back to ask me of I wanted a refund. If course I wanted a refund!  I waited about 5 minutes for the manager( at this point my food was already ready) for the manger to come to the register and refund me without getting off the phone or without an apology. I will not be returning to this location. The food was decent but not worth it due to the horrible customer service!

Ahhhhh, Noodles and Co! Why doesn't Yelp let us give 6 or 7 stars for our ALL TIME FAVORITES?!?!?!?! Anyways:

This is my favorite fast food place EVER, hands down. 

I LOVE the penne rosa! I could eat it every single day and never get sick of it. ORDER THE PENNE ROSA! I promise, you will not be disappointed. I get it sometimes with feta, sometimes with plain grilled chicken, sometimes with parmigiana crusted chicken....sometimes I get it with a flat bread...sometimes with a rustic roll. No matter what I get it with, it is my favorite pasta dish in the ENTIRE WORLD! No exaggeration. 

Other dishes that are good (like...if I'm eating a bite of my family's lunch because I'm eating the PENNE ROSA) are the mac & cheese, butter noodles and Mediterranean salad. 

Friendly cashiers...(sometimes slow service, but whatever, it tastes SO good)

I'm a huge fan of Noodles & Co -- it's quick, made to order, and really tasty.  There's tons of ways to customize your dish (adding meat, extra veggies, or removing anything that you don't like), and super accommodating with allergies too.  Whenever I go there and order my dish with rice pasta instead, a manager swipes a card to alert the people making the food that there's an allergy.  I've never had a reaction when they do the allergy alert card swipe thing, and their mac 'n cheese with rice noodles is really good.  Back before I found out I had allergies, I loved their pesto cavatappi! The noodles were always perfectly done, and their pesto sauce mixed with the chopped tomatoes was always a good combination.  They recently introduced family size dishes, so if everyone is getting the same thing, it's a good option to cut down on costs.  I've heard the location in Deer Park has better service, more space, and overall better food, but this one is convenient for me, so i'll continue to frequent it when i'm in the area.
Food is pretty good if you ask and pay for extra sauce when they are cooking your food, ex. Mac and cheese and beef stroganoff go from a rating of a 3-4 to 7-8 with extra sauce.

I don't know if a 3 is really fair because we showed up right before closing, and so I really wanted to make things as easy as possible on the staff. As such, I went for a small mac 'n' cheese, which was very plain and uninteresting. It was ok, and I suppose it did the trick, but in general I was kind of disappointed and was still hungry afterwards. My coworker had Bangkok Curry with chicken. He seemed to enjoy it. The staff was nice, despite the fact that we literally showed up as they were getting ready to close, and then ate in the restaurant instead of taking it to go. The town closes early, and we had just gotten into town from California. So we appreciated that they were still friendly. It is bordering on a fast food type restaurant. So we ordered at the counter and then they brought our food to us. It was ok, but I would not eat there again unless in a pinch.

I've been here for lunch twice now - both times the service is pretty good and fairly quick. Last time I had the tomato soup which was great. This time I ordered the Bangkok Curry and the Spicy peanut noodle and they were just OK. Nothing special about either dish except I spent the rest of the day burping it up. Overall it wasn't horrible but its nothing to brag about.

Boy HOWDY, do I love Noodles and Company.


I mean I LOVE Noodles and Company. The Japanese Pan Noodles are very light for a carb-heavy dish and the Wisconsin Mac and Cheese make me miss WIsconsin. 

I love Noodles so much. Once, I was like, "where should we go for dinner?" My girlfriend at the time was like, "Anywhere but Noodles and Company." See, she Hates Noodles and Company. After heavy thought, I drove us there anyway. Cause I love Noodles and Company. The Pesto thing was calling me. We broke up because of it, but at least I got noodles.

Actually, that I never did that. It would be a really dick thing to do. I just eat at Noodles and Co alone.

A fine example of great customer service. One of my friends ordered the Pesto Cavatappi with chicken. When her order came to the table, it was missing the chicken. The cashier, who took our order, came a few short minutes later with a small plate of chicken. She genuinely apologized to my friend, and offered the whole table free rice krispies!

I love Noodles & Co, and this location is the best. The food is prepared perfectly every time and the place is always clean and organized. That's saying alot for as busy as it gets at lunchtime. And no matter how busy it is, the staff is always super friendly and awesome, which keeps me coming back often. I love this place!

This is just a quick review...

Pretty good place for lunch or a quick snack.  If you work in the area, you can eat in and get back to work fairly quickly.

Bonus: it is easy to get fresh and healthy low calorie meals here.

I went here for lunch placed a to go order. i waited 25 minutes to get my food. The lady in the front was  screming at everyone (red head)... It was a little rediculous inside. All the workers were working extra hard, and if she is any type of manager she needs to be checked. i would have hit her in the face and left with a big fu. Also watched her poor crouton crumbs on my salad one crouton and crumbs... thanks!! I will not b back. This restraunt gets two stars only because the workers all kept there cool and tried helping eachother but ms red head.....

Service is Great! Food is ok. Not a whole lot of flavor in the spicy chicken Caesar and chicken noodle soup. The cashier gave me a free cookie because of it. Mac and cheese was ok although it could have been a bit cheesier.

I had driven by this place about 100 times and finally decided to stop in.  My girlfriend and I went there last night for dinner.  Place was busy but not crowded.  Staff was friendly and food was served quickly.  I ordered the Japanses Noodles with sauteed beef and my g/f got the pad thai.  I won that food war.  hands down.  no ...really

Pad thai sauce was good but noodles werent great.  Japanese pan fried noodles were great!  For less than $20 we had a meal and a drink (we ordered the "regular" sized entrees).  You could economize by ordering a salad and a regular and split between two people.

This isn't 5-star high cuisine but it is good, inexpensive, quick and tasty!  I will go back - probably not every week but 1-2 times a month when i need a quick noodle fix.

Went in on Saturday and got the Japanese pan noodles with shrimp.  Not great.  I have always loved Noodles & Co but I think they definitely aren't as good as they used to be a few years ago.  My food was overcooked, some of the noodles were bordering on being burnt and I had to ask someone to clear off one of the tables because all of the booths were filled with dishes.  Not a good experience, I will definitely be looking elsewhere for a new go to casual dining spot.

I d never go to a Noodles and Compny again, let alone this location again. Got a couple of take outs(indo peanut saute and bangkok curry) and both tasted awful like plain noodles without any taste. The chicken was dry and not warmed. 0/5
Why don't they open up in az???? Japanese pan noodles and Mediterranean salad!!!! So fresh and great tasting!!!! Yummmmmm

2 star - C'mon man

I usually have fared well at this place but they drop the ball a little on this one. I got the usual penne rosa w/ parmesean chicken crusted, which is usually out of  control (chicken was dry and food was little cold ??? How I do not know). Every boxer has his or her bad day. 

This was Noodles bad day. Walking into the place the tables were dirty, we had to ask some one to clean a table. Why are there like 6 employees walking around but everyone is trying to avoid cleaning the tables.

It was like a dance contest to see who could go the longest without cleaning the table. The competition was fierce. I will have to really give it a strong thought before I head BACK TO THIS SPOT AGAIN.
Although this place ALWAYS smells like a wet dog or cat when I go in, which is a major turn off.  The food is AWESOME!  I really like it.
Their chicken soup is outstanding when you aren't feeling well.  Very good, filling and yet light on an upset stomach.

I've been to Noodles & Co before but decided to write a review after my recent visit.  Much of the menu I wouldn't order because I'm a picky eater, but the mac & cheese here is really good so I usually order that.  I don't come to Noodles & Co very often since it's hard to justify spending $9 for a single serving of mac & cheese when I can easily make 9 times as much at home for the same price.  I wanted to try the parmesan crusted chicken with my mac since it came so highly recommended, but when I ordered it, the girl at the register said that they were out, super weak for a Saturday afternoon.  A little distraught, I just ordered the pasta with no add-ons & a water to drink.  The girl told me I could have soda for free since they were out of the chicken, I didn't think much of it until I saw the Coke Freestyle machine.  I heard all about these but never actually used one first hand.  As cool as these machines are, this location has 1, which can only be used by 1 person at a time, so during busy times, there will almost certainly be a line of people trying to figure out which flavor to choose let alone how to work said machine.  My pasta was brought out just after I sat down which was uber quick & even though it was sans chicken, it was delicious & only cost me the equivalent of 5 servings instead of the usual 9.

I passed by this place several times and always thought about trying it. I finally got to try it recently and made a second trip today. So far I have tried their Indonesian Peanut Saute and Thair curry soup. I am aready salivating thinking about the food. Service is fast, food is affordable and no compromise on taste.

This location is often very busy during the lunch rush, so I phone my to-go orders in ahead of time.  

Staff here are friendly, and despite the chaos that results during busy times, treat you like an individual instead of just another face in the crowd.  They also pack take-out orders thoughtfully; my soup gets bagged to reduce damage if it spills, and the number of cutlery packets are equal to the number of items ordered.  Hooray.   

Seating & parking always seem to be tight, but then again, I only go here on my lunch, so timing might be everything. 

The food is as it is at every other Noodles & Co. I have been to, but if its good, consistency is highly-prized, and here, it is.
Awesome pasta.  Prepared just the way I like it.  I had the pesto pasta which was amazing and it didn't take that long to prepare either.  It's good for a quick date lunch.

For a noodle place, the noodles this place serves are terrible.  I guess I'm not really suprised since noodles really are best served fresh. Preparing pounds of noodles in anticipation of a lunch crowd that needs to be served in less than 5 minutes, probably compromises the quality of the noodles.  Oh well.  The sad thing is that the other ingredients are so good!   I had their mushroom stroganoff, and everything but the noodles (once again) was delish!  They do have fresh bread, which is quite tasty.  The staff is nice and efficiant.  Overall, not a terrible experience, but  don't come in expecting a great noodle dish.

I used to work at Pepe's in Oswego and I loved it! I was excited to see a Pepe's nearby (rolling meadows)  when I moved to the area last year. Great food and friendly service every time! Forever one of my fav "go to" places.

LOVE this neighborhood staple. It's been my go-to birthday choice for nearly 20 years. Though owners changed it's been pretty consistent and no price gouging. The staff seems to be retained long term which is always indicative of how the owners run their business. The waitstaff is attentive and keep the chips n salsa coming :) is it the most authentic Mexican? No but it's what I've come to live and count on. I've been here hundreds of times and never left disappointed.

The three stars are for the pina colada and food. The service is not good. The waiter was not friendly at all. The food took forever!!!! For a couple of tacos and an appetizer is took over 30 mins. I sure miss the location in Norridge, but we moved out here.

Great place to eat Mexican food! Service is always fast and friendly. They go out of their way to make sure everything is served just right. The steak quesadillas and enchiladas suiza are my favorites! This family-type restaurant does not feel like a chain and  I highly recommend it for anyone!!
Rock solid service and food. Even when busy they move quick. I know chain Mexican has a certain stigma but I've never had a bad experience here. It's definitely worth a try, you'll be back.

I don't live far from Pepe's tacos I probably stop  here at least once a month it's authentic Mexican  food  traditional Mexican dishes it's not the best Mexican food in town if your and  the area if you have a taste for Mexican food  you won't  be disappointed the steak tacos Are really good the guacamole chips and salsa is always yumy

Have been coming to this location for years and it has never failed me once. The food is always fresh and delicious and the margaritas are to die for. Just left tonight with a group of friends who were equally impressed.The staff has been there for years and are always warm, welcoming and efficient. Have tried many new Mexican restaurants that pop up but always come back to our favorite, Pepe's!  Thank you for keeping the tradition the same!
We rediscovered Pepe's, and I must say that it was such a great experience. Many years ago we made it a regular for us but they closed and we accidentally ran across it again and we are so pleased.

Ate there Saturday afternoon and had the FIESTA Combo, which was really good!
My husband had the chicken QUESADILLAS and was very good.
The service was very good & the food came very quickly after ordered & hot.
They NEED to DUST the plastic flowers sitting on the ledge near the booths.
Looked like they haven't been been cleaned in years! So please do that.
Would go back.
Our Food came out about 4 minutes after we ordered it which tells me most of the food isn't made to order. Long story short, my roommate got food poisoning later that night.......

It kind of makes me sad (and confused) that their Yelp rating is so low! My family and I have been going to Pepe's ever since my mom and I moved to the area (my stepdad and stepbrothers have been regulars all their lives, I believe). But, it's always been consistently good every time we've gone! I it's still just as good nowadays when I visit my parents as it was back in high school.

Most recently, I went there with my parents about a week ago when i was in town. The salsa is still amazing (I downed I think 3 bowlfuls myself!!) and the chips are plentiful, warm, and fresh. I ordered the fajitas, my stepdad ordered the veggie burrito suizas, and my mom got enchiladas suizas, as usual. We all really enjoyed our meals. My fajitas did have an unusually large amount of onions, but I just pushed whatever I didn't want to the side. the quantity was STILL enough that I had PLENTY of leftovers to take home. 

Service was great as usual. My parents love Leo and always ask for him as a server when we go in, so he definitely took care of us! And the busboys were always on top of keeping our salsa bowls and waters full :) 

In the past I've had enchiladas, their burrito suiza, chile rellanos, quesadillas, and tacos and honestly I've never really had a complaint about any of their food. For birthdays, they bring out a complimentary sopapilla which is always SUPER delicious. I think they automaticaly put strawberry sauce on this, so if we're there for a birthday, we'll request them to change it to chocolate (our preference).

I always look forward to visiting pepe's when I'm back in the Chicago area and I can't wait until I'm there again! :)

Eh decent Mexican food here. It is definitely a more Americanized Mexican food. The place is not a big place but plenty for a small family or friends. I noticed a lot of people having different kind of drinks on their table so I'm sure they must be good. Everyone that was in there had some sort of margarita so that was good and would probably be the only reason to eat there. If your going to just eat food I would suggest saving your money and going to Taco Bell across the street. The waiter was nice as well as the restraint itself. There was one waiter for like 10+tables so the service was a Little slow.

The $10 burritos were smaller than my fork and the rice portions were so small. It was not worth what we paid! It did not taste very good! I complained to the manager and he said well we are a franchise. I told him I love the pepes in Tinley park so much I recently had my wedding rehearsal dinner there, ever other pepes has much larger burritos! I've never finished one until today! I won't be back to this one!!! I'll go across the street to the salsa bar :)

Great food! My girlfriend, who is Mexican, says the food is authentic. Service was good. I always wanted to come here since I saw the commercials for it during Cub games during the 80's with Leon Durham (He was the Cubs 1st baseman). I finally came! If u like Mexican then u should come here. Inexpensive too. 11.00 for my frito burrito with rice and beans for 10.00 or 11.00. Free refills for ice tea. Also flan is 4.95.

I was craving nachos and came here during my lunch break.  It was definitely worth the trip!  The staff was friendly and the service was speedy enough for an hour-long lunch break.  I've had better Mexican food but I've also had worse.  I ordered their beef nacho platter which came with guac, sour cream & refried beans.  The beans & guac were not the best and the beef had a slight chilli taste, but overall the food satisfied my craving.  The cheese and soda were the meal highlights - as was the service & general atmosphere. Compared to other Pepe's locations I've visited, I liked the decor, layout & service here best.  The food was meh & I probably wouldn't think to come back here for a meal unless someone else wanted to, other places were crowded or I craved nachos again.

I wish I could give NO stars, but unfortunately there is no option...

My family and I have been coming here and are repeat customers. However, this was by far the WORST service I have ever received; lets just say, I could have gotten better service at TACOBELL down the street. We all sat down, waiter (very rude and had an attitude) took drink orders. Clearly, he wasn't using his memory- he forgot half of the tables drinks and we had to re-order our WATER. Next, it took 30 min just to put in our order for food. Come on, 30 mins? I understand you are busy and the place is packed, but 30 mins to just take our order?

He takes our orders, rolls his eyes, and then goes. Our food came and everything was fine. NEVER did he come by to check on us or on our food. He came 30 min later to see if we were done. We requested the bill. We were all walking out, and he came outside to flag us down. He said "you only tipped me that much? I did you a favor when one of your members made a ordering mistake. You need to tip more". WHAT! SERIOUSLY? YOU WANT ME TO TIP MORE JUST BECAUSE YOU TELL ME TO? IS THAT HOW TIPPING WORKS? 

This guy made me come back inside and he tried to get more money out of me. Obviously SERVICE was horrible and I was not about to tip him more money. Haha best thing yet, the dumb front desk lady then comments "Oh you are only tipping that much of that bill? you need to put more" WTF

AND then the guy starts slamming shit infront of us. Are you kidding me?

I wish I went to TACOBELL instead of this disrespectful place. DO NOT teach me how to tip. I know good service from bad, NOT YOU. THANK GOD i didn't use my credit card. Also, STOP SERVING ALCOHOL TO MINORS! I hope this place runs out of business. NEVER WILL COME BACK HERE IN MY LIFE!

Laura takes care of my order to perfection. She has a nice calm voice on the phone! Thanks for the great service. The 5 for $5 special for tacos is a killer. My dine in favorite is Tameles and any Steak dish. Stop in to this location and you will get great food and great service.
Love this place! Chicken tamales, stuffed tacos, salsa and chips and everything else! Not to mention the extremely quick and polite wait staff!

I like this place because of the different dishes- some lean closer to the authentic, others towards tex-mex.  It was very comfortable, adobe style design.  I can not remember what dishes I had, too long ago.  I just know the guacamole was great, it had tomatoes and just enough seasoning.

The. Best. Chips and salsa! Great service, amazing food! My family and I have been going here for decades; the food and service have been consistently great! I live a long distance from here, but it is always worth the drive. Have literally never had anything bad here. Love, love, love this place!

Not authentic Mexican, but not tex-mex either. It sits in between with deliciously consistent and inexpensive food. The service is friendly and on top of everything. The salsa tastes great, but the consistency differs quite a bit. Sometimes it will be extremely watery, and other times it is closer to pico de gallo. Either way, it is still good.

GREAT EXPERIENCE!

After living in the area for years, the boyfriend and I finally decided to go to Pepe's (after also getting a coupon in the mail)...

First and foremost, our waiter was awesome. Made friendly side chit-chat with us - super personable! Immediately would refill our drinks and are chips and salsa without us having to ask. Definitely above and beyond expectations...

We both ordered the Mayan - rice and beans, enchilada, tostada, and a taco. It was delicious and filling! Came in a reasonable time too. 

CHIPS AND SALSA - we definitely read the Yelp reviews of the "ketchup" salsa before we left - we have NO IDEA what people are talking about......it was good, and the chips were better than other mexican restaurant "leftover" chips that I am use to.

We also ordered the 60 ounce pitcher of the on the rocks, strawberry margarita - wasn't the strongest in comparison to other restaurants I've been to, but definitely did the job. :D

We definitely plan on going back their again - coupon or not!

Surprisingly better than I expected! I am a bit of a Mexican food junkie. 
The guacamole was on par, but the margaritas were out of this world. I'm saddened to see the ratings are so low.
The food isn't great but isn't bad either with your usual selection of Mexican dishes. I just wish that the presentation would be more attractive.

Thirty some years ago when the only Mexican restaurants in Chicago were La Margarita, Su Casa and this place, Pepe's was an oasis of Mexican delights in a city void of the cuisine. 

Unfortunately, Pepe's hasn't kept up with the times. While most Mexican restaurants nowadays offer the standard tacos, enchiladas and burritos infused with flavor and/or regional Mexican fare that is out of this world, Pepe's remains mired in the 70's. 

A trip to Pepe's nowadays consists of what looks like a dish from "your grocer's freezer" that's been in the oven for 40 minutes and placed on your plate. That's how I felt after the last time I left this place. Really disappointing to see that a place that was a forerunner of Mexican eats in Chicago hasn't done squat to keep up with the times. Any taqueria, Taco Bell or Chipotle will do better. 

Hasta la bye-bye, Pepe's.

I was crazy enough to go here alone with my 2 year old and 4 month old twin girls. I believe Leo was our server ( really tall, super nice guy). When the food came I didn't have hands to help my 2 year old. Our server was nice enough to make her a plate as we were sharing my platter. Sooooo nice. Then my baby spit up all over my shoulder while I was holding both babies. He surprised me when he actually started cleaning the mess off my shoulder. I have been coming to this location for over 10 years. I can confidently say I am a customer for life! The food always hits the spot!
Best Mexican I've had in a long time.  Good margarita, great chips and salsa. Great tacos.  Rosie was a fabulous waitress - as i was knitting!!
We had several families in our party and wanted separate checks. We we're told we could only have separate checks per table.  Our server, however, was very accommodating.

Still looking for Sonoran style Mexican food. Alas, Pepe's is not it.
Chips were tasty and plentiful but the salsa was watery and flavorless. No machaca beef for tacos or burritos- ground beef or skirt steak; beans were pured and rice was bland.

I don't understand the poor reviews. Each time we have gone there, the food has been great. Yes, it is served quickly but I never had the impression that we were having warmed over food. The service is great; Leo is a wonderful example of what a server should be - friendly and, attentive - unfailingly cheerful too. When it is not busy we chat about families, etc.....he is just a great guy. The other servers are great too. So, good food, great value (esp at lunch!) and top notch service make this a place we return to again and again.

Pepe's is a great little Mexican restaurant that has been around for quite some time. My wife used to dine here when she was in High School, and continues to do the same today. The service here is impeccable. The are polite, attentive, and want to ensure you enjoy your experience. The food is prepared promptly, and always tastes delicious. If you are looking for an authentic experience for a reasonable price, I highly recommend here.
We have been going here since I was little and the Burrito Suizo, Tostadas and Enchiladas are great. Fried ice cream is a good finish to the meal.

Pepe's is awesome.  My friend took me there for the first time over 12 years ago.  I get the burrito suizo almost every time.  I have also had the Mayan which is delicious.  The fried ice cream is great as well as the margaritas.  It is the best Mexican restaurant I have been to and the service there is fantastic.  This restaurant has been my favorite since I went there the first time.  Besides the food just being wonderful, the customer service goes far beyond what I would expect at todays establishments.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  I am going back today for my birthday!!!

This Pepe's is the only one in all of Chicagoland that is any good. I've been to other ones and the food is not as good. My whole family has been going to this place for as long as I can remember. Never once have I had bad service here. You just have to know when to go - eariler in the week when it is not completely packed.

I love mexican food but this place was not even worth the gas it cost to drive there.

the chips and salsa had no taste, the salsa tasted like ketchup, lacked any real flavor.

the food came out suspiciously fast, the cheese looked like they melted a cheap slice of american cheese. i ordered the mayan (taco, tostada, enchilada) and everything was bland and the cheese was fake plastic tasting.

last time i went to pepe's was probably 4 years ago but this last visit convinced me to never eat pepe's again.

also, if you want spicy more flavorful salsa with your chips they charge you extra for it, and even that wasn't good!

ridic. like in a bad way.

I love Mexican food and my husband and I went here one night not having high expectations. We were pleasantly surprised however. I had the Carne Asada Tampequina (sp?) with a Carnita taco. The meal comes with ranchero sauce, a taco, tosada or enchilada on the side, rice & beans, guacamole and chips. My husband had the burrito. We have been back a few times now and both get the Carne Asada. One negative is the  Margaritas are very weak. Service is great though. Give this place a try.

I have been going here since I was a little girl. I'm now 24! I love this place!! I highly recommend the cheese enchiladas, ground beef tacos, rice, tamales, or fried ice cream!!!! Good price and AMAZING food! Request Leo for your server - hes good!

The food is not bad. So far everything i have had from there has been pretty good.The chile rellenos where very comparable to a GREAT mexican place i go to in Chicago. It satisfies my Mexican food craving while I am in Rolling Meadows.

I brought the kids here on a night where they ate for free. We were seated right away and the chips and salsa came quickly. The waiter was really friendly but seemed to be the only one working the whole place. The food came out and was ok. There wasn't much flavor but it was hot and the portion size was large. It was difficult to get our drinks refilled. We actually walked up to the carry out area to get our drinks refilled. The dining experience was ok. It was better then taco bell.

OMG.  Do not even THINK about going to this place.  Go to Taco Bell...food is 10 times better and you will spend less.  I've been to Pepe's once (oh about 7 years ago), my grandma used to always rave about it from when her and her girlfriends went back in the 80's(?).  So, I wanted to take my daughters out to eat last Saturday night.  I wanted Mexican and thought, what the heck?  Haven't been to Pepe's in forever, it's right down the street...SURE WHY NOT?  Well, upon turning onto New Wilke, I'm reminded that a Grande Jakes recently (a year and a half maybe?) opened kiddy-corner from Pepe's.  Should we go to Grande Jakes?  I've been to the one in Buffalo Grove...not earth shattering, but still good food.  Nah, I want to go to a 'restaurant'.  We pull into the parking lot...VERY empty.  Well, it is only about 5:15...a little early for Saturday night 'dinner rush'.  We go in, are seated on the 'homely' side (I think this is where you get put if you have children with you (mine are 2 and 6)..it seems distant and lonely...plus one of the bus boys phones was literally on the windowsill right next to my seat.  Anyway, we get our drinks.  Me a diet coke (wtf...tastes like it was from the soda box they opened when they maybe opened this restaurant), 6 y/o gets lemonade (um, pretty much water with a splash of lemon), 2 y/o gets apple juice (thankfully that is decent).  Chips and TOMATO FLAVORED WATER???!  Basket of tortilla chips and two bowls of 'salsa' were placed on the table.  The waiter said this one is mild, this one is spicy.  Ummm, they both taste like water with a hint of tomato.  I ask for something spicy...I'm given a orangish version with green onions.  A TEENY bit spicier...but still tastes like water.  No point in eating this.  My 6 y/o got cheese quesadilla and fries, 2 y/o got cheese quesadillas and rice and I got ground beef burrito dinner (rice and beans).  6 year old would not eat quesadillas after one bite.  Her fries were edible (no salt, but ketchup helps).  Baby was pretty good with her food..well, for a 2 year old.  I will admit rice and beans were pretty good.  The burrito however...first of all, was not ground beef.  You know that 'chili' you buy in a can (Hormel?)..yea, that chili that is in a nut shell a mix of 'beef' and textured soy protein??  THAT is what the 'ground beef' in my burrito was.  It was that chili mixed with beans, thrown in a tortilla and topped with orange cheddar(?) cheese.  I took two bites and couldn't handle it.  Oh and this burrito was only slightly larger than the cheap yumminess of a Taco Bell burrito.  As 'garnishment' on the plate there was lettuce and a dollop of sour cream.  I didn't sour cream is sweet???  Yuck.  Lettuce was good though :)  Me and the kids were not asked how our meal was or if we needed anything...NOT ONCE.  Finally I got the waiters attention and asked for to go containers (we had no intention of eating this slop, but I'm not one to make a scene unfortunately).  I had no intention of leaving a tip (terrible service, terrible food)...but I'm a softy.  When the waiter brought the bill, he brought my girls each a snack bag of Teddy Grahams.  DAMN.  Bill came out to 25...I paid 30 and said keep the change.  I fumed the whole way home about this experience.  I could've gone to Taco Bell for HALF the price and would have been EXTREMELY satisfied.  Instead I spent $30 on basically one of the worst meals of my life when I could've spent that at a different place for 10 times better quality.  Don't waste your money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I go to Pepe's at least once a week the waiters there are the best and the food is always great and fast!  I always have to order to go a bag of chips n salsa after I eat there. Salsa is definately 5 stars.

We used to love Pepe's but not anymore. The portion sizes are so small now for the price. I went ordered the Carne Asada. They brought me a pack of cards size steak, only not that thick. The thickness was about a half an inch, and burnt. 

They changed their beans, yuck.

Now, we started going to Good Tequila's in Elk Grove Village. Excellent food and prices. Don't waste your money on Pepe's anymore. Never going back again.

After reading the other reviews (including the filtered ones) I am glad to agree that this particular Pepe's does not represent the chain at all.  In my opinion it's much better than all the rest.  Here's why:

1. Many of the poor reviewers are expecting authentic Mexican cuisine.  You will not get that here.  This is "Americanized" Mexican food.  I have to ask for my order to be "extra spicy".  The American "bland" flavor makes it so I can still take my wife and grandma here without them having nothing to eat.

2. You know what? The Carne Asada sucks here, the same as it does at the Orland Park location and every other location.  I have tried other locations and they are terrible.  In fact, this is the only Pepe's I will go to in Chicagoland.  If you want a good Mexican steak, try a Mexican steakhouse like La Magdalena in Schaumburg.  If you're not ordering an actual steak I hope you enjoy your $15 filet mignon tacos - after La Magdalena overcooks the meat they taste similar to the steak tacos for $7.50 here.  But whatever, pay for what you like!

3. Speaking of tacos, this is the only place I've ever had "stuffed" tacos other than taco bell.  That's right: it's a real taco, from a restaurant, not fast food garbage, that puts real chihuahua cheese between 2 tortillas.  For an extra 50 cents per taco.  Yes they are twice as delicious.  Yes they are twice as filling.  Yes you only need to order half as many.  Yes, I am a large man with a huge appetite and I get full with 3 stuffed instead of 6 regular (or 12 regular at taco bell, which are kind of gross/fast food-y anyway).  Yes, the option is barely noticeable on the menu and they only offer it if you know to ask for it.  I skip the rice & beans sides (3 taco "dinner") and just order 5 individual tacos at the 3 taco dinner price so I have 2 left over for lunch the next day.  They reheat perfect, so you can't over order them in case you're worried.  Get 5 or 10, they'll be perfect for a couple days in your fridge and almost as good microwaved as they were fresh.  You're welcome.

 4. The Queso Fundito appetizer is fantastic.  It's Mexican fondue.  It's slightly better in multiple places in Chicago proper (better Mexican cheese ratio?) but will cost twice as much for half as much food.  This appetizer goes great with:

5: The giant F-ing margarita!  Get the La Siesta.  For 1 person it is aptly named.  Split it between 2 people or order it for your date if you're under 30 and want a fun night (my wife has convinced me to order it many times because she prefers to drive!).  It's like half a pitcher.  It costs about $12.  It comes in a giant glass you can take home for an extra 5 bucks if you want.  What's not to love?

6. The shrimp.  Sure, it's a grandma dish - my grandma loves the shrimp quesadillas.  But I've tried them.  They're huge shrimp they put in those things, and it's still only about $9.00.  Sometimes old people have good taste!

7. The salad.  Yeah, it's stupid to care about taco salad at a Mexican restaurant, but a lot of people do.  My wife orders it, and it's great for someone who isn't sure they like Mexican food at all or anyone who just wants a really good, giant salad.  It comes with the best shell I've ever seen and fresh fruit (fresh melon slices, strawberries, pinnapple, etc.). Total waste of $ compared to a grocery store except for the homemade shell (just like taco bell but huge and not lousy).  Still a great deal at about $9.00 when you consider how big it is/fancy it looks and the possible combination with the $12 giant margarita (why didn't I remember this stuff when I was in college?!?)

8. The waitstaff.  They're the best.  They'll bring you extra chips without asking.  They'll bring you the super-hot sauce for free if you request it (it's American-Mexican remember -- most flavor is cheese, not spicy).  One guy worked his way up from busboy to waiter and now basically runs the place.  I forget his name, but if you get him you'll know it because the service will be perfect.  The other waitstaff... well, they change over the years, so it's a crap shoot.  Just look for the 6 foot +, dark haired (short hair), clean shaven, clean, light skinned Mexican guy and ask for him specifically to serve you.  He's also the host and the defacto manager, but if you request him he'll do it and everything will be PERFECT.

9. Yeah, the decor is stuck in the 70's as is the food.  If you don't like it, eat somewhere that's more trendy.  La Magdalena (expensive) or Fuego (also excellent, though much more authentic & expensive).  Hell, if you're under 25 try Salsa 17: you might like it if you also like TGI Fridays.  However:

If you just want a reasonable night out that might actually impress someone, try this particular Pepe's.  In the race of chains it beats its' sister restaurants like a fully fueled Corvette beats a malnourished turtle.  Like always, just make sure you know how to order and which wait staff to ask for.

Happy dining!
John

If you've been to authentic (that's the key word here) Mexican restaurants, then do not go here. First off, I was in Rolling Meadows for a job fair and decided to stop by here after it had been over. We were greeted and brought to our tables and given the salsa and tortilla chips, as every Mexican place has ever done. I ordered a beer and a friend of mine ordered a margarita. I also ordered the steak taco dinner meal with cilantro and onions. This is why it gets 1 star. The tacos I was given were in a wrapper and you can tell that the tacos had been reheated and not cooked. How could I tell? Well for one, the wrapper was stuck to the taco and the steak I bit into wasn't even hot. It was lukewarm! You could tell they just warmed it up followed by dumping the onions and cilantro on. Not to mention that for a non authentic Mexican restaurant, the place is pretty expensive for low quality food.

I think Pepe's food is lousy! 

I had crisp corn tortilla beef tacos, and the crisp tortilla looked and tasted like the ones from the "taco kits" you can buy in the grocery store, which suck.  Too much lettuce, and not much else as far as the normal garnish that you find in a decent Mexican restaurant.

The place was pretty good a number of years ago, but it has gone down-hill with respect to the food.  The service was good, but I will not go back there again

My family has been going there for at least 25 years, nothing has changed: the food and the decor are the same, and the waitstaff has been the same for at least 10 years. The food may not be the most "authentic", but this is what I grew up on. This is our constant and we're all really happy with it. The busboys know who we are and they always bring us extra salsa because they'd end up wearing out the carpet bringing us more while we wait for our food. I literally could eat a gallon of their salsa everyday, no chips needed just a big spoon.

this is better mexican food than your average fast-food mexican place, but it's a little on the greasy side. If you remember Chi-Chi's, think food similar to that,  with a little more spice.    There's never a long wait, and the food is pretty decently priced. If you're a margarita person, they're very good and large for the price.
If you're feelilng adenturous, try the chorizo.  it'sa spicy change from your regular ground-beef and quite good.

I would give this place negative stars if it let me.  This place had some garbage Mexican food, seriously.  I would have been better off at Taco Bell.  Anyway, I had one of their combo platters that came with a little of everything.  To my big surprise, I didn't like any of it.  The only thing I did kind of enjoy was the free chips and salsa, which was just sad.

I am not going back....the food was really bad, like bad. Everything tasted like it came from a can. It basically had no taste and was just a gloppy mess on the plate.The margartitas tasted like they had old beer mixed in them.

What a waste of a drive.....first off, waited 15 minues (!?!?!) before anyone came over, he said they were "too busy".....brought no chips & salsa, had to ask for it----food came quick but had hair in it, waited 20 mintues, nobody came, the bill came and I was overcharged, couldn't eat food with hair in it....waited also 20 minutes for more drink. Wouldn't go back for this kind of drive. Food was bad. Kids loved theirs though.

This place is my favorite. 
I'm a Japanese American, and I have lived in NY LA and even Tokyo. I've gone to many great Japanese restaurants, but this place is the best. 
Omakase always surprises us with new ideas and perfect balance that stimulates your taste buds. 
They also have Izakaya menu that's always cheap and great. 
Keisuke, the owner/chef, always challenges his limits to make his customers happy.

I have no idea what's up with this place..
Owner behind counter, SO not friendly.
Waitress, so quiet can't hear what she's sayin' AND slow. The sushi there tasted " ok"...
overpriced for the size. (comparing with Daruma JPN rest, who's close by)

I used to like coming to this restaurant but the past couple of times the food was okay, nothing special. I usually do not focus on service so much but I have to agree with another Yelper. The owner and chef is aloof towards non-Asian customers. We sat at the sushi bar and were completely ignored. No hello, no how's your food, nothing. We spent $80.00 and when we left we got a mumbled bye.  The restaurant was empty. There are plenty of other sushi choices.

Visiting the Sakuma's Restaurant was certainly an experience to remember! Amazing quality food with very friendly atmosphere. The presentation of the dinner added to the enjoyment of the meal.I'll certainly be returning soon!

TURN AWAY FROM THIS PLACE UNTIL THINGS CHANGE; TRY SUSHIYA OR JC SAKE PLEASE I DID NOT KNOW YOU CAN GET WORSE SUSHI THAN SUSHI STATION BUT IT'S POSSIBLE!

This place should have 0 stars. That's as simple as I can put it. Please listen to all the other reviews with one or two stars, this place is not worth your money, time, or patience. 

We arrived and we were the only table around 7:30PM Sunday night, and were greeted by a server that was not so inviting or happy. I'm not over exaggerating my experience, I had to write a review so you guys stay clear of this restaurant until things start to turn around. The sushi was kid sized and I'm not kidding, the time we waited for our rolls was around 30 minutes, remember, we were the only table. Our waters were barely refilled, we had to ask for our tea to be refilled, when again, we were the only table there. The proportion is just not worth it, and I know I had to write a review to warn everyone about this place, it's honestly not worth it and please don't go.

DON'T COME HERE IF YOU LIKE GOOD SUSHI, REGULAR PORTIONS, AND GOOD SERVICE.
