Best pizza in the Northwest Suburbs

Went there one night to see Dave Mazzie perform.  Pleasantly surprised at how cool this place is.  Reasonable drink prices and great food, nice mix of people too.  Wish they had places this cool when I lived in Barrington!

We order the short ribs!!!   there very much like Korean/Hawaiian short
 Ribs/Kalbi.  We love them!   Big pile of rice with salad comes with.  Pricey but so worth it!

Just stopped by here for what I hoped would be a quick lunch. I didn't realize this restaurant was going to be so popular! There was a line and it took about 20 minutes to wait in line, order and get my food. So call ahead and place your order if you are in a rush!  The dining area is small
And less than desirable so I would suggest carry out anyways. 

Everything I ate was fabulous. I ordered the Spicy Pork lunch special. It came with a side salad and they didn't skimp on the spicy part. I actually added some teriyaki into it to cool it down a bit. I also ordered a side of gyoza (potstickers) since I didn't realize how huge the portions would be and I had a craving. For only $3 I had five delicious fried gyoza!

I definitely left with leftovers today!!

I like the spicy pork lunch special. I've had that and the teriyaki chicken. Both were tasty. The chicken had a good grilled flavor. It's a quaint and unassuming place with good food. I'll eventually try everything on the lunch menu.

Enjoyed my meal here. Came here for a quick dinner a few evenings ago. I got the spicy pork teriyaki. It had a nice little kick to it but not overwhelming. It had a good flavor to it and they had a nice portion size. I had enough for leftovers the next day.

My wife got the pineapple chicken teriyaki which was also tasty. Good flavors, nice portion size. They also have a free complementary salad with our dinners. This place is well enough to warrant a return.

I was looking for a place to eat, ended up reading my old review and selling myself to come back here to eat. 
This place needs to open more locations!

I went here for our work Friday ritual, which was to eat out with my coworkers. We decided I try this new place and they were well known for their chicken teriyaki. I usually don't like teriyaki because the sauce an be overly salty. I went for it anyways because when in Rome, do as the Romans. The chicken came out on a giant plate. There were rice, the chicken and a side of salad. It was delicious and big. I brought Hal the meat back to work but there really was not point. I ate it right away at my desk. It was so tasty. I was so full that I didn't have room for dinner.

I'm so lucky to live so close to this place. I love their food (especially chicken katsu) and huge portions! I usually save the left overs and take them for lunch at work next day. There was a rumor that they might be closing but I hope it's not true!  Oh and there is a cute boyy working there occasionally and he is so nice ;)
I visited this place a couple of weeks ago. I had the spicy pork and teriyaki beef combo. Sooooo delicious! And huge portions! Totally worth it and would definitely go there again!

After reading all the rave reviews about Joy Teriyaki, I finally went despite living in the area for quiet some time. Being that this was my first time here, I didn't have a menu nor could I find one online. When I got there, I was able to order right away, no lines. I did have to wait a good 20 minutes for my food. While sitting there, there was good amount of carry out orders coming and going. There are several tables you can sit and eat at and/or wait for your food. The food was pretty good and portions are large. I highly recommend this place!

I miss this place! This location is located next to Aldi in Glendale Heights and parking is never a problem here.

The food here is fantastic!!! I used to always get the beef teriyaki or the chicken teriyaki and my husband would try different things everytime we'd go and he was always a happy camper. I lived close by so I used to go here a lot. Their portions are HUGE and their prices are reasonable. My husband and I would sometimes share one plate of beef teriyaki and both be stuffed by the end of the meal. The meal comes with rice, salad and extra teriyaki sauce in a cup and comes up to about $9. 

They make your food pretty fast. They have an eat-in area but it isn't very big. 

 I try to go to Joy Teriyaki to get a bite to eat anytime I visit Chicago!
Lunch special with fried rice is the way to go.

Stopped in for a quick lunch at Joy Teryaki. It's really more of a korean joint than a Japanese place. Seems like they raised their prices as they don't have a $5.99 chicken lunch special anymore. The Chicken teryaki lunch is now $8.99.  Aside from the prices going up the food is always good. Nice little take out joint with limited seating (around 9 tables). Will definitely come back again.

Went to this place last night and was very pleased with the food quality and service! Teriyaki sauce is 1) homemade 2) delicious, very very delicious. Its not overly salty, but instead has a nice balance of flavors that go well with smoky flavors from the grilled meat. Service was smooth and the cashier lady was very nice and accommodating not just towards my group but to all other patrons as well. We'll definitely be coming back. 

Honestly, if this place was in downtown chicago, it would have a very very good chance of succeeding. Nothing outlandish, just great quality food you can taste and very large portions for reasonable prices.

Good but expensive. Alot of meat and needs more rice. I got chicken and and egg roll it was 13.06. Try sarku japan in stratford mall for the same thing except they charge 6$. Good service large portions too much $

Lived in Bloomingdale and passed this restaurant but never went in. Well today we went in! The lunch special is huge and so tasty. I ordered the spicy pork with fried rice. It was amazing! The salad they give give has this home made dressing... Incredible. The prices are so reasonable. You will have to take the food home they give you so much.
Spicy chicken teriyaki and fried rice is so freakin' good.  If they toned down the price a bit I think I could eat here everyday. Stir fried vegetables are great too!

Fact 1: A Joy Teriyaki meal feeds one giant or two regular sized people.

Fact 2: It's so reasonably priced, I always feel like I'm getting a bargain. 

Fact 3: Spicy Pork is a must. But the rest of the menu, I'm quickly learning, is solid. 

Fact 4: All the hot meals are made fresh. If you stop by, it takes about 10 minutes for them to cook it.  If you want a to-go order I would suggest to call in first if you don't want to wait.

The food in this place is unbelievably good. My daughters is allergic to dairy and peanuts and she could have the chicken teriyaki with no problems. The only complaint I have is that it takes long so order in the food before picking it up since they make it when you order it so it's always hot and delicious.

Tried this place 3 years ago, been going since & haven't found anything bad to say about it.
The chicken teriyaki is my go to - super large portions
Great food, large portions! I'd definitely recommend their Chicken Teriyaki or the Chicken Katsu. Their Fried Rice is really good too! Definitely a must try! :)

Sometimes you just want quick, good teriyaki, and I'm happy to say that Joy Teriyaki delivers on this promise. 

I had always wondered if there was anywhere to sit in this space. Yes, there is, and they have high chairs too. Entrees are, in general, around the $9 mark, but they give you enough for two meals, so that's not a big deal. 

Ah, the rice. They must have rinsed the rice a hundred times, because I've never had rice so clumpy yet not starchy. Perfect chopstick-compatible texture. 

Me and the baby split a standard chicken teriyaki, as well as a pineapple chicken teriyaki plate. The pineapple chicken teriyaki wasn't bad, although next time I would stick with the standard teriyaki plate--teriyaki sauce + sweet and sour sauce doesn't taste quite right. 

Happily, the teriyaki sauce they do have is quite good. Nice and simple, not too mirin-y, not too sweet.  The chicken was cooked nice and tender, and just the right bite size for everyone at the table.

I also appreciated the house salad, which was fresh, though I couldn't tell you much more about the dressing.

Definitely give this place a shot!

The quality of the food is still great. Portions still large. The price has definitely gone up which I totally understand since the economy is bad. But anyways dinner was good. I ordered to go: spicy pork and kbbq short ribs. Total was $31
This place is amazing! Everything here is absolutly delicious. My favorite is either the chicken breat or the shrimp. I love how you can buy the salad dressing and sauce to take home!

I'm a fan of their shrimp stir fry, veggies are fresh and crunchy as they should be, very generous portion and delicious! The didn't get 5 starts because they overload it with onions, even though you ask for easy onion and the price could be a bit more reasonable but other than that, I think it's a great spot!

Located in a strip mall, this mom and pop is no frills on aesthetics. It's a very basic look and feel, but what they lack in ambiance, they make up for in taste. I ordered the chicken and beef combo, but substituted fried rice in the place of white rice. It was very good. I would eat here again.

Really love the food from this restaurant. We've tried chicken fried rice and teriyaki chicken. Both great!  Teriyaki chicken has tons of chicken and you can taste the BBQ. Have had a few other things that were just as good. We have always taken out.
Excellent. Had the chicken teriyaki lunch special. Ample food with excellent flavor. Subway, no thanks!

I'm a fan.
They have good food, a little pricey if you ask me but if you want quality food, this is the place to go.
It usually takes 15-20 minutes for a take out order, sometimes longer because they do get busy.
My recommendation- Chicken teriyaki, it comes with rice and a side salad and it's delicious!
Service is good too.

Excellent food very tasty and homemade! Great for lunch! Big portions and good prices !! The place is a little run down could use a paint Job and updating a little dingy but the good is excellent  great option for carry out !

Personally I don't know crap about teriyaki. I don't know the difference between great teriyaki and bad teriyaki. All I know is that its suppose to be like a sweet soy sauce. 

Located next to an Aldi and a Chinese Buffet, this place is a small little eatery in a strip mall. 

Their claim to fame is their teriyaki sauce which I found to be tasty. I got the:

Chicken Teriyaki: (8.99) Chicken was juicy, it comes with salad and rice. It was sweet and salty and tangy. The salad had some sort of sweet creamy dressing which I like and the rice was a shorter grain than most Asian take out places which was a nice touch. 

What really stands out about this place is the HUGE portion. (See Picture), I got like half a chicken's worth of meat and a pound of rice. It all comes on a gigantic plate.

They also have extra teriyaki sauce bottles everywhere just in case you wanted more.  

Overall I would say if you're a teriyaki lover, this is the spot for you. I'm pretty indifferent about it but I do recognize good quality and clean service which this place certainly does have. 

Keep in mind the food takes some time to come out because its cooked to order. 

Will definitely return.

$7.99 for their spicy pork lunch special, which comes with white rice and a small salad.

The spicy pork was more sweet than spicy, and I liked the portions to this because I was full after half. There was a slight smokiness to it too, which I enjoyed, but it was too weak for me in spiciness. However, my tolerance for spicy foods is higher than average so.. haha.

Fast, efficient service. I had called in my order 30 minutes ahead. Google's navi directed me over to this pizza place on the other side of the street (-.-); thankfully a yelper posted tips on how to get there correctly hehe.

I've had better spicy pork so I don't think I would order it again, but I enjoyed it nonetheless so taking into account the price, portions, and no-frills service, it would be a solid 4 from me.

I've driven past here a bazillion times, since I live in the area and it's been here awhile. I've visited other businesses in this strip mall. But until yesterday, I never stopped here. 

I had a pounding hunger headache and I needed to hit the auto parts stores over in this area to look for some parts. Yelp reviews told me about how this place had fantastic homemade teriyaki sauce. As a longtime Japanese food fan, I'm usually not the biggest fan of teriyaki -- mainly because a lot of people get lazy with it and just use store-bought sauce. If you're going to do it in a restaurant, make it your own. I don't think that's too much to ask. 

This place does. Also, as soon as you walk in, you see that they have two things on every table: a bottle of their homemade teriyaki sauce (so you don't have to ask for extra if you eat in), and a bottle of Sriracha. (Proper Sriracha -- no Lee Kum Kee bootleg cocksauce here!) 

Lunch special is great. You get a little salad with a nice homemade creamy dressing, fluffy rice (white rice is included, but you can substitute fried for an additional charge), and your meat of choice. I had chicken. I'll upload photos in a moment. 

Drinks selection is your typical fountain stuff augmented by a cooler full of iced tea/energy drinks/Vitamin Water/Sobe. I wish they offered hot tea, but that's a minor quibble. 

Their homemade teriyaki sauce is great. Add Sriracha to the fluffy white rice and contrast the layered spiciness with the sweet/salty teriyaki and have a very happy party. In your mouth. I heard what I said. 

They also offer free samples if you're not sure. Stop in and give it a try. I want to try the spicy pork next time. :9

Absolutely excellent lunch specials!!!  The place looks like a total hole in the wall but the food and service are truly 5 star.  Huge portions, excellent quality of meat, cooked and flavored perfectly every time.  Healthy but delicious and not greasy whatsoever.  Can't say enough good things about this place.  Once you try it, you will have to stop yourself from coming back every day!

I really like this place. The food is good, the prices are decent & the customer service is good as well. When I don't feel like cooking, I grab this on my way home & they haven't disappointed us yet!

This place is great. Came here on a date- who was really sweet by the way- and had lots of fun. I got the chicken teriyaki and you get the chicken a side of white rice and a salad with there own sauce. Its a really good portion for a really good price. The place itself might not look like a whole lot but don't let it fool you. You can also use chopsticks. The food is really good. The rice wasn't bland at all and I was able to use my chopsticks which is a plus overall. The chicken is also really good. For the first time going I will definitely come back for sure.
This place is my absolute favorite! Been coming here for years and the food has always been amazing

don't really care about the portion sizes, what I care about is the quality of food which has seem to gone way down since their opening. The chicken seems to now be processed judging about how it is pressed and small. Also it looks like instead of buying bulk sriracha and refilling the bottles; they add water to the bottles making the consistency noticeably watery. wack

Joy Terayaki is a small hole in the wall of a Japanese food joint located right off of Army Trail Road in Glendale Heights. I've driven by many times and noticed it out of the corner of my eye, however I've never been motivated to stop in and try it until today. 

Having seen some raves reviews here on Yelp and some good buzz around my office from co-workers I decided to try a few things on the menu. I ordered a spicy chicken teriyaki meal, an order of fried rice and a five piece side order of gyoza.

First off let's touch on the chicken teriyaki. The foam container had the chicken and some sauce in two pockets and a main pocket of white rice. The chicken itself was well grilled while still retaining a tender texture and the sauce was a very nice compliment. The overall taste was excellent and the portion size was very reasonable for the money. The white rice included was just regular white rice so there's not much to note there. 

The gyoza's included were pretty good as well but a little on the small side. For those unfamiliar with gyoza, it's a variation on the pot sticker. These seemed to include a seasoned white meat of some type (possibly pork). These were nice as an appetizer but I've had better.

Finally to comment on the fried rice. The fried rice I had was pretty good there were chopped up vegatables and a lot of egg mixed in. I liked the overall taste though I would probably not order it as a standalone side again, but would instead upgrade the white rice bundled with the entree to the fried rice if possible. 

Overall I liked my food and will definitely be coming again. I'll give this place five stars for being great food at a great value.

Great fast Korean style bbq. The bulgogi pork is right and have a lot of flavor. I cant comment on up charges, i always get white rice. The rice is good, not too sticky not too wet. Homemade salad dressing is tasty. I can usually make two meals out of one plate. Great left overs. The chicken breast is tender too.

A +1 and I went here for a lunch special when I moved into town.  The chicken teriyaki plate was good, and he enjoyed the chicken katsu plate.  The salad came out from the kitchen with a delicious dressing on it.  We decided to try the variety of sauces they had bottled near the kitchen.  We identified one of the bottled sauces as the salad dressing and I added some more to my salad.  WHOA, bad idea!  It's apparently a dairy-based sauce and is NOT good after it's been sitting out and fermenting.  Gross.  Please, PLEASE Joy Teriyaki - refrigerate your dairy-based sauces so they don't sit out and get rank.  That's a tummy issue waiting to happen!  I ended up having some tummy gurgles afterward. :( 

Aside from the foul-taste of the Sitting Out Sauce, the rest of the dining experience was good.  Joy Teriyaki was a no-frills place with fair-priced lunch specials.  I'll be back, but if I want any more salad dressing, it won't be from the bottle sitting out on the counter!

What can you say about a place whose portions haven't gotten any larger since their opening yet their prices seem to increase 1.00-2.00 annually.... Boycott!!

Food - Wonderful.  The best teriyaki place I've ever eaten.  Their spicy chicken teriyaki makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside its so good.  The perfect blend of sweet and spice.

Service - Sub par.  The latest complaint comes from my experience at lunch this afternoon.  I called an order in as I typically do at noon.  The woman on the phone struggled to comprehend what I was telling her and didn't understand my name even after providing it to her a 3rd time.  Once the order was placed I was told 15-20 mins for pickup, which pleased me since I work 15 mins away from their location.  Upon arrival at 12:15-12:20 the food was not ready so a coworker and myself paid at the register and found a seat to wait for our order.  12:30 rolls around and still nothing.  12:40, still waiting.... 12:55 was the final straw.  I went back up to the counter and kindly asked what was the reason for the delay.  You could tell by the shocked look in her eye that our order had either been given to someone else or forgotten, keep in mind several other people that came in after us who had not called in orders had already gotten their food and almost finished.  1:00 and our food was finally up!  Thinking they might offer us a discount or a credit on our next meal I was immediately overwhelmed with disappointment when she placed an order of egg rolls in front of us as compensation for the inconvenience.  Some of you are saying to yourself, "I don't know, that seems fair."  If you have ever had the egg rolls from Joy Teriyaki you would have been just as disappointed as we were, especially after this last price increase cost us 15.00 an order for a plate of fried rice, chicken, salad, and a fountain drink.  I am not one to complain but I have had this happen to me several times in the past and nothing seems to change except for the price, which is now higher than ever.

To sum all of this up.  Joy Teriyaki has always been a favorite but I will no longer continue to give them my business given the current prices.  There is a great chinese restaurant in Glendale Hts off of North Ave called China Chef where the food quality is just as good if not better and the portions are larger for half the price, its not the same food but similar cuisine.  If you have had a similar story or are just fed up with prices like myself please join me in boycotting this establishment.

I've only been to Joy Teriyaki twice, but both times have been a good experience! 
I love the hole-in-the-wall feel of the place.

Their teriyaki is very good, I love that there's a bottle at every table and also several other bottles of various sauces available for your dish. 

I'm glad they don't have too many choices, because I would never be able to make up my mind. But one day, I decided on the simple chicken teriyaki and I was very surprised at the portion I got...HUGE! When I was paying, I was thinking it was a little pricey but I then saw the amount of food I payed for and it made it that much better. 

All of the chicken in my dish tasted fresh and not very fatty, which is what I like.
The woman at the register was pretty friendly, which is always a plus.

I'll be returning! :)

I just moved out here from california and hadnt really looked for a teriyaki spot, on my lunch today i looked one up and found this spot with some pretty good reviews so i decided to stop by.

I had the 7.99 teriyaki chicken lunch special. Came with a big portion of chicken, white rice and a side salad with what i want to call a sesame, rice vinegar dressing. Not a fan of vinagrette dressings but this one was really good. The chicken was tender but had a nice carmelized char from the sauce, the sauce itself was amazing. Each table had a bottle of teriyaki sauce and a bottle of sriracha, two very essential things to me when i eat teriyaki, so you have controll over the heat or sweetness. 

The portion size is pretty big for the price..i ended up boxing up almost half of it because i got full. One negative thing is they take a bit of time to get your order out, my lunch break is an hour long, it took me 15 minutes to get there around 15 minutes for my food to come out, 15 minutes to eat and 15 to get back. This being my first time it really isnt a big deal, next time ill call ahead, as i suggest anyone on a time frame to do so. Other than that, it was a great meal, the only thing id add is some sliced avocado, i dont know if thats just a california thing, but it makes a huge difference, also lookong forward to trying the teriyaki beef and spicy pork. Will be a returning 100%

So, my first visit here, I'm sitting at a table enjoying my food and a woman walks in and indicates that she doesn't like teriyaki because its usually too sweet, too much sugar. So she asks if she can get everything without sauce.  I think she missed the whole point of this place, uh derp? I believe they were willing to accommodate her.
Anyway, even though I pass this place several times a day, I've been avoiding this place, as a typical Chinese cuisine place.  I remember, and liked when this location was a Caribbean(?) cuisine joint, which I liked, but didn't last. I figured this place wasn't going to last either.  Finally I took a look at the reviews and was intrigued, especially since it has lasted so long.  
I had the spicy pork, based on the recommendations here, and it did not disappoint!  The lunch special was a little pricey, but the portion was huge.  Another reviewer indicated they make their own sauces, which is a plus in my book; it all tasted freshly made.  
I am glad I decided to try this place.  A local hidden gem.  Will quickly become a go-to spot for a quick meal out.  I will be back.

Amazing spicy chicken, definitely my go to lunch spot. More on the expensive side but the portion is well worth the $$$ never leave hungry that's for sure,..I've also tried the short ribs and beef Both very tasty as well, but overall solid service and average wait time on food, il definitely visit again

Pro: Good food. 
Cons: cashiers not horribly nice and their price keeps going up and up and up. What was once a $5.99 lunch special is now $8.99. This is not so special anymore.

Avoid the shrimp. Just not worth it. Wasnt fantastic. Loved the katsu chicken and teriyaki beef. Egg rolls were about average. Sweet n sour sause with the katsu chicken (though I LOVED the katsu sause it comes with) was fun too. Delicious. Id go back. For 4 full meals (whatever meat, rice, and a side salad) and two egg rolls it was $50. We took it home and ate so we didnt order drinks.

Fantastic little teriyaki spot. Fair lunch specials, dinner is a little pricey, but portions to match. Quick and friendly service. Always polite and accommodating. Food is flavorful and fresh. An instant favorite for teriyaki lovers.

My work turf brings me in and out of Joy's wheelhouse, so on the days I'm somewhere near Army Trail rd, the call goes out to co-workers. " Joy?" 
" yup, call in a spicy for me " 
It's about the best lunch around and since I've been there often, I can say it's consistently good. 
The "call in" part is key, as it appears all orders are made on the spot and not just scooped out of some vat in back . At lunch time, the wait can burn up a lot of your git ta' et'n time, also the place fills up quick. I'm unfortunately creature of habit, so the chicken Teriyaki lunch deal is my thing- but I have dabbled in the spicy. And it's spicy spicy. Not OMG spicy, but just enough heat to remind you what you got with every bite. 
If you are dining in, lunch is served on a china plate, or a foam box if you get it to go. Bottles of teriyaki and Sriracha  are on the tables and real silverware is available. Unless you are one of those fancy know it all metro scooter riding types, then chopsticks are available to fumble with before grabbing a damn fork and eating like the rest of us. 
Not that I've ever done that. 
Ok it was me. 
Tips: they like cash, and reward cash payments with a punch card, although I'm not in the club so I'm not sure what it gets ya. 
Enjoy Joy!
Love love love the teriyaki but the prices seem to keep going up and portions and decent but it is the best I have had. I also buy the teriyaki sauce from them to use at home :)

I don't think you're happy enough.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lwESraWEpSU

This place should be called Happy Happy Joy Joy Teriyaki.  Located in the weirdly unholy Bermuda Triangle of good Asian food near Army Trail and Bloomingdale Road which has Pho Ha, Hong Ning and Joy Teriyaki within a 1 mile radius of each other,  this place managed to break a couple of my resolutions, nay three of them, thus keeping with the tri-themed review. 

First of all, as with 80% of the country, I resolved to eat healthier in 2013.  Less red meat, namely pork, which is the best meat in the galaxy.  I also resolved to exercise more in what free time I have, and to eat less, as in, eat until satiated.  Not, "Eat until food bypasses digestion phase and escapes oral-gastric tract by means of nostrils."  Yes, eating until food comes out the nose is NOT the plan.   
So how did I come to squash these resolutions?  A fateful Friday where I dropped the wife off to visit a friend, and I was to kill a couple of hours in whatever way I imagined.  Go to the gym?  I could have, but I didn't bring my bag.  I suppose that couldn't stop me from finding a trail, or even a sidewalk to just walk off a few calories.  But no. I contemplated going to the Avalanche to have a drink and catch the Bulls game, but I thought I might get thrashed if I walked in there with tall Hunters on my feet.  SO, I went to Half Price, picked up a stack of 50 cent Cook's Illustrated issues and read some in the car while waiting for the call to pick up the wife.  When the approximate time came, and the call didn't come through, the hunger buzzer in my belly alarmed.  

Deciding on Joy Teriyaki out of the three restaurants named above, I opted for the Spicy Pork and Chicken Breast Plate.  It took about 15 minutes for the food to be ready, but good things come to those who wait. Time food was ready - 08:11pm.  Time wife called for car service - 08:13pm.  Went to retrieve her and ended up going to Target before heading home.  Ate salad portion of meal while walking around Target.  Home at 10:20pm.  Watched Netflix while eating my delicious Spicy Pork and Chicken.  From what I remembered, the pork was tender, with minimal fat.  And it was my favorite cut of pork - SHOULDER.  The Crash Test Dummies comes to mind.  Mmm mmm mmm mmm.   Wasn't too spicy, but it tasted great and the chicken was also very clean tasting.  The rice, I could have used more of it, but it was cooked well.  The best part of it all?  The teriyaki.  Holy shabazz.  Talk about unctuous in a good way, this stuff had mouth-feel galore.  I mixed a little sriracha into mine and fell asleep while eating.  Kind of sad, no?  I woke up rip-roaring full, and sad, because I had to admit defeat and put it away in the fridge until the next morning.  

2 days later, I'm still saving it in order to prolong the joy.

Love this place... Have only tried the spicy chicken & the teriyaki chicken but both were excellent !  Fried rice is awesome as well. Try to go during lunch because it's cheaper & you get the same quantity.
This place is great. I love their chicken teriyaki and their portions are large and the staff are friendly. I'm looking forward to trying the Korean short ribs next.

This place surprisingly wasn't all that bad. From the outside you would think that it was like some low quality restaurant since the sign is so plain and the parking lot in front of it it getting pretty poor. But yeah, not too shabby.

I thought at first the prices were a little high, but then after getting the food I was just like, WHOA! I ordered the beef and they seriously give you about two handfuls of beef. It wasn't like amazingly  tasting beef teriyaki but it wasn't horrible either. 

Went here once and it was packed but I guess it all depends on the time of day because this last time I went, it was afternoon and it was like dead. Guy at the register was literally staring at the window. Good place to go if you want quick Asian style food with rice that's not americanized yet.
Good stuff! Big portions but you pay for it. Perfect for a take-home meal. Will definitely be back when I have a teriyaki craving. In fact... I think I may be having one right now...

I had to go there again today and this time I ordered the Katsu Chicken.  Its was excellent.  I went for the fried rice instead of the white rice this time as well.  All around good food.  The eating area does need work though as the walls in some places look like they might have small holes in them.  Kind of gives the saying "hole in the wall" a whole new meaning LOL.  It's really not bad and the place is pretty clean.  Other then the simple seating area, the place has good food.  You can see the kitchen area and it looks clean and organized which is the most important. They make their own teriyaki sauce and its very good.  I did see an small sign that said they were going to raise the prices on the menu in January 2013, I was bummed but if its only a buck or two, its still a great deal.  Overall good food! Thanks yelpers for helping me give this place a try!  Good food good price!

The teriyaki here is hands down the best I've ever had. My husband always gets the pork and substitutes the side of steamed rice with noodles, and I always get the spicy chicken teriyaki. We've also had the egg rolls, chicken katsu, and yakisoba bowl- all great dishes as well. 
Just recently the prices went up, but the portions that are given are fairly large- we always have leftovers!
Best around!! Love the chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu. I also so the vegetable fried rice and top it with the salad dressing. So good. Huge portion size.
Very good for lunch.   Quick,  big portions,  tasty and fresh ingredients are the biggest reasons I will now eat here often.

Delicious Chicken Teriyaki and chicken Katsu entrees. I went here based on my love of chicken teriyaki and the good Yelp reviews. I came for a Saturday lunch and so it was not crowded and we had no trouble getting a table.  The chicken teriyaki is so tender.  The chicken Katsu is like very crunchy chicken tenders.  It comes with a side of good tasting barbeque sauce.  Portions are large, service was friendly.  There are signs asking you to bus your own table so just be aware of that.  I will definitely return.

I simply love this place. Family Meal every time... probably the best deal around. 
I once visited Seattle and scouted the original location. It was like the Mecca of Teriyaki.

PLEASE open one in Chicago!

Major. Gut. Bomb. 
After eating at Joy Teriyaki you will feel fat and you will feel full. 

You definitely get what you pay for here...in food and in flavor, especially for a "fast food" type of joint. I always go for their specialty, the chicken teriyaki. The chicken is always tender and you probably get about 10 ounces worth. I opt to either split the dish with someone, or else I find myself with lunch for the next day.

Yays: 
- Massive portions. When I say massive, 2 people could easily share a dish.
- Killer teriyaki sauce. And bottle of it at each table.
- Love the fried rice & veggie egg rolls. And the gyoza.
- Spicy pork. It has just the right kick. 
- Salad comes with every plate. I suppose that's their effort to make you feel like you're eating somewhat healthy.

Nays:
- Service blows. It's not fast, and it's not friendly.
- I question where the chicken comes from. It tastes good, and it's tender. However,  I often wonder how much of  "real chicken" it is. ((I think I'm jaded after watching "Food Inc."))
- Kinda grimy inside.
- Gets very busy during peak hours. Expect a 15 minute wait for "fast" food. 

Overall, Joy Teriyaki isn't bad. It's not the best I've eaten, but for a quick bite, it definitely does the job!
Excellent yakisoba noodles for vegeterians and they do make it really spicy if u want it. Price is fair, however service is a bit slow.  Must go place if u like japanese style food!

Go well out of your way to give this bombshell of a hole-in-the-wall a try. Everything from Chicken Katsu to the fried rice is just jaw dropping, belly bopping and if you are a food aficionado worth their weight in Sriracha, you have to take a ride to Glendale Heights for this treat!

I've been here on three occasions.  I've always tried the Lunch Specials (Beef Teriyaki, Spicy Pork, and Chicken Teriyaki).  All were great for the price.  The plates they use for dine-in are basically a serving platter in size and the food servings consume the majority of the plate surface.  I enjoyed the Spicy Pork the most, but it wasn't really that spicy it was more of a savory type sauce.  Pork was just the perfect texture.  It was cooked just right to still be tender.  This place can be busy so keep that in mind if you're in a rush.

I drive far out of my way to get Joy Teriyaki. Their teriyaki sauce is absolutely the best. Drench everything in that stuff. I've mostly just tried their grilled chicken and chicken katsu, but I have tried a mouthful or two of their shrimp and it was also not bad.

So I've told you how good their teriyaki sauce is- but let me tell you- their fried rice is AMAZING. It is quite different than your typical asian fried rice. Especially good if you squirt some of their teriyaki sauce on it. I highly recommend Joy. If you live anywhere in the 30 minute radius, it's going to be worth the trip.

Love this place. Its a little pricey but they give you a LARGE portion enough for two to share and both be full. Its so good. deffinitly a place i will miss when i move. They only take acsh under $10 though! But the staff is super friendly if you didn't know sometimes theyll let you slide. :)

Wonderful place for Teriyaki, I was completely taken off guard when my food came out with epic portions!

Food:

Portions were very generous and MSG FREE! I was very full and probably should have taken leftovers home, but it was too good to refrigerate. They literally give you a gigantic plate for dine in lol. It was my first visit and I had a mixed combo of Chicken Breast and Chicken Teriyaki. The dish came with Fried Rice and Salad. The chicken was hot, fresh, and so god damn TENDER.... It was complemented perfectly by their homemade Teriyaki sauce. The sauce wasn't too sweet either which is a problem most Teriyaki dishes have. Not too strong either... Just right and they hand you a whole bottle for dine in! The Fried Rice and White Rice deserve a special mention as well. They don't use the typical bulk cheap rice. They use legit Japanese rice that is more pricey and has that hearty texture. You can taste the freshness of the steamed vegetables in the Fried Rice. The Rice and Teriyaki go so well hand in hand! The Salad is okay. It's just there. It's not bad. I am definitely coming back for the food!

Service:

Nice Counter lady. Food came out under 7 minutes when I came in while it had a decent amount of people in which was nice. Can't really say much else, it's a Walk in food place. The lady gave me good directions to find the place as well. 

Atmosphere:

Hole in the wall place. Not going to lie, the place is kind of depressing. It looks like it hasn't been renovated since the 80's. The walls literally have 80's convenience store wallpaper that is peeling off. You get used to it fast, but I would not take any girls on dates here. Good for groups of hungry college students for sure lol. It's also kind of hard to spot. It's located in the Walter E. Smite parking lot area and right next to Subway.

Overall, I will go here for the epic food! I was really satisfied on my first visit, I hope to update my review when I try out the other menu items.

Wow! It's worth the good rating! I had the chicken and beef teriyaki combo ($10.50) and everything was excellent! I will say that I'm not comfortable spending $8+ on work lunch usually so I probably won't make it habit, but I'd spend $20 on this at a restaurant dinner and leave with a smile on my face.  Overall the price IS fair (most plates are $9 or more), but it's a bit high for my daily work lunch budget.
Awesome food, huge portions.  I moved 30 minutes away and we still make the trip to get our Joy Teryaki fix.  Highly recommend calling ahead.
This place is a hidden gem. I've been coming here since they opened and I absolutely love the food. To be honest, there is not a single bad food dish. This is a must try!
Very yummy fresh food. I tried it for the first time today and I know I'll be back! I had the lunch special chicken breast and my husband had the lunch special chicken katsu. Both were delicious.

The food was very good. The biggest problem I had was how much everything costs. They nickel and dime you on everything. My girlfriend and I ordered two lunch specials, chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu at $7.99 a piece. We wanted to get it spicy at .50 cents more for each meal. A fried rice substitution was $1.75 more per plate. Egg rolls were $1.99 each. Plus the two drinks ran for a total of $30.09. For that price we could have had better lunch somewhere else.

Wow, omg, and yes that was amazing! For small dine and quick take out this place is amazing! The free samples allow you to try each flavor and decide if it is a pork chicken or beef day!
Prices, about average at $8 a plate, but there is so much food you'll be stuffed the rest of the day. Friendly service and fresh food. Couldn't ask for much more!

Yum!! This place was good! The portions were huge! My sister, my cousin and I shared chicken katsu and spicy chicken teriyaki. Both came with a small side salad (yummy dressing) and a big portion of rice. The chicken katsu was good but the sauce tasted more like barbeque sauce than katsu, on the table there is teriyaki sauce use that instead with the katsu, the spicy chicken was so good! I wish I couldve asked what that sauce was it was delicious! We also got fried dumplings, I forgot what they're called but those were good too! If I'm in the area I would definetly want to go there again!

With all the stories of illicit narcotics in Naperville, you'd think the most addictive drugs in the west surburbs were a little further south. Surprise, it's actually the crack-like teriyaki sauce at Joy Teriyaki that defines modern addiction. (full disclosure: i do not know what crack is like).

I really wish I were kidding about this, but I've been to this restaurant nearly three times weekly for the last six months. It is a running standard for my office, friends from the city, nearly anyone if they are hungry and within twenty miles of this location. The service is pleasant, the menu diverse (even though I always order the same damn thing), and they don't mind if you use an entire bottle of sauce, which my boss and I are prone to doing.

The food... After comparing it to drugs and addiction earlier in the review, it's hard to go up from there, but put simply, it's massive, massive portions, cooked perfectly, with a boatload of sauces and seasonings to tickle any palette. The store is not really all that much to look at, but if you're looking at anything other than the food, something is horribly wrong with your brain and it needs a checkup.

If you're remotely close to Glendale Heights, for any reason, this should be a top priority to visit. Drugs are bad. Joy Teriyaki is good.

PRO TIPZ:
* Call ahead. The wait isn't bad, but since they make everything fresh, if you let them know when you'll arrive for dine-in it can shrink the delay between you and your saucedrugs.
* The salad is fine, but I recommend opting for extra rice instead.
* If there's a big group, the quality does start to suffer as their small kitchen fights to keep ahead of the orders.
* There's nothing wrong with the standard Chicken Teriyaki, but I prefer the Chicken Breast, which is cents more and all white meat.
* Seriously, about the whole addiction thing. I've had people tell me, after one visit, that they've been craving Joy months after the fact. There is something really really unusually amazingly addictive about this place.

When i lived in Glendale Heights, i was going here at least 2-3 times a week! 

I absolutely love love love this place! the food is always delicious, hot, and the portions are huge! i love the staff, always so friendly and helpful! I met the owner once, he's really really nice, and all the girls there are sweethearts.

okay, enough about the amazing staff, now the food is to die for! you must try the fried rice with the chicken, the pieces of chicken that come in the fried rice are huge!

the teriyaki anything is delicious and the spicy chicken is out of this world.

As expected, the teriyaki sauce and the grilled chicken are phenomenal. I'm also a fan is the salad dressing and enjoy the large portions. 

A bottle of the teriyaki sauce is on every table so you can drench the dish and rice (and I recommend you do).

The only downsides are that it can get quite crowded at lunch time and during the winter it stays pretty chilly with the door always opening and closing.

Joy Teriyaki is amazing!  Good, quick food and a great price.

My dad recommended this to me and my family, so we went together for dinner.  I have to rave about that salad dressing like everyone else.  What is it that makes it taste sooo good????  I could eat salad all day with that dressing!  We usually bring some home with us.  My kids (1 and 3) love it too and I'm thrilled that it helps me get them to eat veggies.

I definitely recommend the fried rice, gyoza, katsu, and their fried chicken (wings) platter.  My husband likes their teriyaki and kalbi.

A treasure of a restaurant in a small strip mall...definitely a great find.  We are now frequent customers : )

Great food! The beef teriyaki is always a good choice, but I would also recommend the Korean short ribs and vegetable yakisoba. My only complaint is that they're no longer open on Sundays AND I can't believe that they don't have hot tea!

This place has potential to be greater then what it is. I ordered the chicken bowl. The pictures in the restaurant are smaller then what you actually get. The chicken bowl had alot of vegetables as well as plenty chicken. It comes w/a salad that is quite plain but the quality of food makes up for a dismal salad. Great place! I would definitly go again.

Joy Teriyaki is definitely a great find!  It is just one of those restaurants that you would want around your neighborhood.  I love how simple the menu is and how much food you get for the price!  You get a generous portion whatever delicious meat you choose, and a generous amount of rice with a nice fresh cool salad (dunno what that dressing is but it is delicious).  

I normally get the spicy pork!  Wow it has a smoky flavor to it, tender and stir-fried in a spicy sauce.  I love it!  The chicken is good as well, very tender and grilled.  The teriyaki sauce is sweet but not too sweet and flavorful.  The beef is bulgogi and was good as well but not as great as I thought.  Stick with the chicken or spicy pork.

Also their gyozas are amazing.  Its fried and crispy with nice flavorful pork and veggies inside.  I love those as well.

You will not get this type of food anywhere else so enjoy!
Food is fantastic, everytime. Gotta get the lunch specials here. Only downside is the $10 credit card minimum.
My new favorite spot.  Loved it.

Very good food, a meal comes with a generous portion of rice, meat, and salad.  I love the food here, it's always fresh and made to order.  My favorite is their chicken teriyaki.  The rice is cooked per asian taste so it never goes to waste :)

Love this place. The menu is so simple... it's just teriyaki everything. I usually just go for the chicken. Their sauce is delicious, easily the best teriyaki sauce I've tasted. If you eat in there's a bottle of sauce at your table for liberal dousing. 
Their portions are also pretty large. I'm a big rice eater and I've never finished all of it here. 

They also offer free green tea and there's a huge assortment of other beverages.

Delicious Japanese food at decent prices. It's better to call ahead since it is all cooked fresh if you're doing carry out. The staff is always polite. My boyfriend and I LOVE this place for the freshness of the food, and we don't feel like bloated whales after eating it.

They are another hole in the wall joint with good food. Me and my friend took our children here to eat lunch and it was pretty good. The lunch serving was huge and can be split between 2 people and the price is cheap! The teriyaki chicken is the best so far.
What can you say!? Delicious chicken dishes, plenty of food, not much on atmosphere, but when a place like this is I always feel a little suspicious. Try it out!

I went to Joy Teriyaki for a second time.  The Teriyaki sauce is good and the portion size is large (since I got the complete order this time).  I had the Pineapple Chicken Teriyaki to go.  It was still hot when I got home and it was enjoyable.  

I will go back, but I will always check my order before leaving.

This place is sooo under rated!  I would hate to see them go out of business for their crappy location!
They're located right by a subway, an aldi, a currency exchange and an abandoned Baker's Square.  I had no idea what to expect when we first went there.
My first impression was that it was very clean!  The cashier greeted me warmly and the menu was very straightforward.   They had chicken teriyaki on special, like $5 or so.  We had our 2-year-old son, so I was relieved to see that they had high chairs.  The Beatles were playing non-stop, and it was a happy little detail for me.  Our food arrived on big white platters, arranged beautifully in ample portions.  From first bite to last, the food was amazing.  The rice was cooked perfectly, the teriyaki was just right.  My son gobbled it up with both hands, he loved it.  The salad dressing is to die for!  We have since gotten their food to-go as well, with nothing lacking in portion size or quality.  And everytime we go back, the Beatles are playing.  ;)
Got to go with the Spicy Chicken Teriyaki. Place has awesome food, good place to get lunch. You get huge portions.

Joy Teriyaki taught me not to judge a book by its cover - or in this case, not to judge a restaurant by its outside appearance. Located in some strip mall next to Aldi and Subway, this place didn't really stand out too much at first. Not inviting, to be honest. My friend took me here one time and now after more than 2 years later, I still come here regularly with my husband. We are devoted customers - we have brought friends to this place. We even ordered their catering plates when we had a gathering once. The husband always get the spicy pork, I sometimes switch around between chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu. DELICIOUS. Salad is fresh, the dressing makes it super yummy. We always try to grab the salad dressing and sweet & sour sauce bottles from the counter but sometimes, no luck. If you do have those, mix these sauces together with the teriyaki sauce and sriracha (they are at every table), and you are set. Great price too! I always have some leftovers to take home. Can't get enough of Joy Teriyaki!

I luv this place. I can never go too long without having the lunch specials( beef, chicken, or pork teriyaki). For  $5.40, you get the teriyaki and the salad, with very good dressing!! Large portion too. You can't find a better lunch deal for an asian lunch !! The lady at the counter could be friendlier though...

I've only eaten take out here and have never had a problem with them forgetting to pack my order right.  The teriyaki sauce is yumm and you don't really expect much from a fast-food japanese joint.  I always get the beef teriyaki.  The salad dressing is very good, not heavy, and not too light and has a bit of a tang.  I've tried the chicken and its a bit on the dry side.

Good food, very good service, and nice ambience. Accidental discovery, as we were headed to the nearest Walgreens while we were headed to our hotel. Weren't really hungry initially, but once we went in, we couldn't resist trying out some of the items on their menu. Tried South Indian cuisine, chettinad dosa was amazing, so was rava masala, which we ordered twice. 
Best part was the food was really fresh, the vada sambhar we ordered were nice and crispy. Loved the hospitality as well. They offered us a complimentary mango lassi, which was not their prerogative at all. 
Will try to come here again when I visit Elk Grove village again.

The food is good and we used to be regular customer. But that one night when we saw a big fat mouse in their restaurant running towards the kitchen that was our last day there.
And on our way back home my baby puked all her food out.
So be careful guys before you go there.

I use to love eating at this place, but ever since the ownership is changed, the quality of food is gone down from 4* to 1*
Sambar had old lentil taste. Very pricy, no wonder we were only two people in whole restaurant
Restaurant is very competitive business. Every body wants good food and good price. This had none.....sorry you lost me and my whole lunch group

Awesome food, my husband and I are regulars now. Very friendly staff, food is delicious, specially their masala boondi is a signature. The service is fast too, I also like their sambhar and neyi idli. :D This place is our go to when we don't feel like cooking and also like eating Indian food.

Definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Needed to grab something from Walgreens and saw this Indian restaurant, sankalp and decided to try it out.  Wasn't expecting anything great since I've been to all the dosa restaurants on Devon ave and pretty much thought I've had the best dosas around in the Chicagoland area.  I was pleasantly surprised...this dosa surpassed all the others I've had.  I had the Mysore chatpata dosa and if you like spice, this by far is the best dosa you will ever have.  I definitely recommend this spot if you like South Indian food.

We ordered masala dosa and idli vada combo . Its the worst food I have ever eaten . No salt or taste whatsoever . When we complained they just said so u can add salt as required , but what about the Taste ? Well the prices for their crap food are high and are you kidding me , $3.5 for the mini glass of mango lassi ? Please stay away from this place and avoid being as disappointed as we were .
This is a great South Indian style food place. They have lunch thali with veg or non-veg. Very friendly staff and a clean restaurant.

Unfortunately Yelp does not have an option for 0 stars. This has been the worst experience ever - both food-wise and service-wise. The food is absolutely horrid here. Portion sizes are minuscule and the prices are outrageously high.
Restrooms are dirty and they place chutneys right next to these dirty restrooms. Take a peek at their kitchen as well and I guarantee you won't be able to take the next bite. Hakka noodles are worse than Maggie/Ramen Noodles. Absolutely horrible and no I am not exaggerating. Chettinad dosa costs 12 bucks a pop and it is not even enough for an appetizer. It tasted gross too. Paneer tikka was a half baked watery mess. They didn't even offer a courtesy replacement and laughed off our complaints about the food. Stay far away!!!!
I found this place accidentally when my son was swimming at the meet nearby. Now I drive 20 miles from Lincoln Park just to eat there. Great food (garlic naan is simply fantastic), great service.
Hands down!  Excellent food and excellent service. Price is not bad either......I will either.

Worse.We ordered two chicken biryani, it tasted like spicy tomato curry rice mixed with a few chicken pieces.I found tamarind seeds in the rice.If you're looking for a Hyderabadi style of biryani a big NO to this place.

We ate Paneer Balti, Tawa roti, Vaghar idli and hyderabadi mutton biryani - all four were of very good taste, perfect blend of spice and flavor 

The manager was extremely polite and took personal care of us which was a big plus in making the dining experience pleasurable and special

He gave us complimentary InDian sweet Ghugra which was good too

Their menu is quiet extensive (North Indian/ South Indian/ indo-chinese ; veg and non veg) and I will definitely go back to try other dishes 

They are planning to introduce Gujarati thali and kathiawadi food in few weeks so looking forward to it

Excellent food, great ambience and a wide variety of Indian Cuisines!
Sankalp is one of my favourite indian restaurant chains 
I wish they come up with multiple outlets around Chicago!
Love this place, I go almost every week for the lunch special, non-veg thali.... its awesome and keeps me going back.  Highly recommended!
Staff is very friendly but food is okay at the best.  Run down place.  I would not recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy South Indian food.
Food was fine but the staff and manager act bully with customer!!! Disgusting behavior... Highly unrecommended :(

Simply awesome... Took Chicken Kuttu Paratha.. And Biryani..
My wife became an instant fan of Kuttu paratha..
Wow, I had the veg thali , my guest had the non- veg thali. I have to say the food is tasty , fresh, full of flavor.... Yummy, food is consistently gooood!

This place was great. The food and service was great and it has a friendly relaxed atmosphere. The walls were a little run down, but there were nice paintings on the walls so, you can yell they are trying to make it look nice.
Service was top notch and the food was delish!  Went for a business lunch and will go back again.

Delicious and great quality of food!! I absolutely love their dosas - they will customize per request.  
My husband and I have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed with the taste of their food. 
Couple of negatives: the quantity of food for the price doesn't add up.  I really wish they would give more food for the price. Also, wish they would serve street foods everyday instead of just a few days a week.  
I def. recommend this place to anyone looking for good Indian food.

Very clean and nice place. Service was great and attentive. We went there with three kids and they were fine with the noise my kids make. They even play with my daughter when time allowed.

The food was great! Sambar was to the standard and all appetizers were tasty! I really liked the fact that they accommodated my mom by preparing tasty Jain dishes. 

We couldn't wait but go back in January to try the Gujarati food!
Authentic Taste, Best Quality and Most Delicious food one can have in Chicago. They have very good options in Vegetarian and every option is worth a try.
I am surprised to see dramatic reduction in serving size . Though food quality is still good but you should plan on ordering 2 portions for one meal

Very spicy and horrible tasting food! Couldnt taste anything except chilli in hakka noodles. Manager is extremely argumentative and kept explaining how this was the only taste available in their restaurant. Server did not ask us about what spice level we preferred. Will not recommend this restaurant, especially to tourists.
Great place to eat both South & North Indian food. It's my favorite restaurant in Chicago.
We were in a hurry to catch a plane and got the quickest service you can imagine. Ordered idly and dosa and my parents liked it a lot. Tasty food

Horrible place. It used to be very good when it was a part of sankalp chain, now it been operated by some other guy. Food is bad and service is even bad please dont waste your time and money, only plus point about this place its open all day but i would suggest to go for an fast food instead of coming here.

What a great late night dinner!   Thank you Brij and staff for serving and hosting us! The best samosas, paneer tikka ever, amazing dosas, chutney... and sambar off the chart - had to have one more dish and totally enjoyed the aloo gobi... Plus the absolute best masala tea! What a fabulous way to wind down from a long day at work - the servers are so friendly and kind, and we had an endless treat for the tastebuds!  We will return OFTEN!

Came here with my Indian friend, he loved the vada pav.. in fact he ordered it twice.. chicken dum biriyani did not taste authentic but still tasty.. butter chicken was yummy too.. garlic naan was soft and fresh.. would definitely recommend it.. :)

On the recommendation of our friend, we tried Sankalp last and WOW! I am of South Indian descent and really loved the flavors of the chole batura, dosa medley and malai kofta. The service was excellent, attentive and kind. The owner was very gracious explaining some of the items I was less familiar with and making recommendations. The food is delicious and spicy! The inside is clean, bright and welcoming. Loved that they provide a pitcher of cool water but not icy cold on each table. Also the prices are appropriate for the location and competition. Plus the entire place was full of other Indians which tells you the food is GOOD!

It's perfect place to have a Indian food in suburbs. After a year I move back to Chicago so I came with my family to have dinner here it's fresh management and I order  South Indian food its delicious friendly service I enjoyed my dinner
This is the perfect place for Indian food. Best customer service. Personalized attention to all needs.

Ok, so we were a huge group of 13 guys. We were really hungry and were disappointed to find that there was no Weekend Buffet for lunch. Now, everyone ordered only Dosas all around the table. I had a bite off Masala Idli - which was really good, Chettinad Idli - which was pretty good and the Cheese Fried Idli - which was OK. Friends had ordered the Lamb Dosa - which was OK and the Chicken Dosa - which was really good. Then I ordered the Goan Fish Curry with Garlic Naan - Oh my god, I really really recommend this one. It was really really good - the best Curry I have tasted in recent times I have gone to various indian joints. We also ordered the Mutton Megalu - which was super spicy and delicious ( Indian spicy - so you might want to say MILD for this) and side of Bhatura - pretty big Puri (which is wheat based Fried roti). 

Staff were pretty friendly, but they were short handed - just one person taking orders and going around, one person who was just going around collecting the plates when done. It looked a little fine dining - when plates are shapped like a mini - banana leaf and every time they were bringing new plates for every dish, which was UN-NECESSARY. It was really expensive and the portions were small. Other than that, I would definitely think this place is good and serves good food. (Atleast when I went it did)

I really don't what's all these hype about probably the owners changed and made this once awesome place crappy.

1: Idly, samosa kept as buffet items were overcooked and bad.

2: Heard they used to have some pretty bomb chicken and shrimp dosa now the menu reads just the vegetarian ones.

3: How can u make sambhar taste so bland? 

4: Dosas : Bad and smelly batter with stale fillings.

So what on earth should we pay 13.99$/person comes to 31$ for 2 after tax.

The one star is for service at least they are doing their job well.

Perfect spot when a dosa craving strikes! Upon ordering, we got complimentary papad, but unlike any papad you ever had. The location discontinued their complimentary rasam but the owner made an exception just for our group since we had dined there countless times which was generous of him. He had come to our tables throughout our meal to make sure all the food was okay and even when kitchen was a bit delayed. The mango lassi was done right. We got several dosas for our group and North Indian sabzis with naan & paratha. Everyone was happy with food and service!
Prompt service and tasty food. Went on a weekend and the food tasted fresh. I once had their weekday combo too and it was pretty good for $11.

Do love Sankalp, the best butter chicken, veg dishes and garlic naan. Folks are very nice and always pack the food so it carries out beautifully.  Would have rate 5 stars, however if I order these three items it comes close to $30 which is a bit pricey for Indian carryout.

Not at all recommended because of following reasons:
1. Tawa Rotis - Charged 2.25 and which were heated roties brought from Indian grocery stores for price 10 for @2.99
2. Lacha Paratha - size too small and can be finish in two bites - charges - 2 parathas for 3.50 $
3. Navratan Kurma - Price @11.99 and quantity so less that two people can hardly share.

Too Pricy... Too less food.... 
People who don't like South Indian Food .... should avoid... other wise get ready to either pay more or ready to go to next restaurant after eating here.
This place is amazing!  Great food and a great price, not to mention the owners and employees made the experience that much better. You guys need to try it out.

We went to Sankalp for quick evening bite. We had dosa platter, rava dosa, paper dosa and chhole bhature. The dosas were regular no wow factor. Paper dosa was also underwhelming. Bhatura also was too thick. But sambar and chhole were very good. Sambar had nice consistency, good veggies. We ordered dahi wada in the end. Unfortunately it was disaster. Wada used was medu wada . No masala chaat in it. Restaurant is clean though and food qty is adequate. Will try the thaalis next time.

Service is great. They are super friendly here. You get SO much food for the price you pay. 

You get complimentary soup to start which was too spicy for both of us. I got the lunch special which came with 2 different types of chicken which were moist (one was curried), green beans and rice, yogurt, vegetables, white rice. It was all pretty good. My roommate had the chettinad express which was minced chicken stuffed in a dosa and grilled crispy. It was good but so so spicy. 

Complimentary dessert of a doughnut type soaked in honey. Yum.

Bloated reviews. 

I'm a "southie" born stateside.  I've done the "hotels"  in India that do this type of cuisine.  I'm used to it, my Ma makes it for me often.  This however was sub par at best.  I think it's the "coconuts" bringing their American friends that love it most.  I wish there was an example of the true South Indian goodness here that I could relate.  Closest example would be Udupi Palace on Devon ave in Chicago or this other South Indian favorite up in Lake Forest on route 60 but that name for some reason eludes me at the moment..  Beyond the dislike of their masala dosa, I found the buffet food to be just alright.  Nothing special with a few staple Indo Chinese type entrees.  Obviously they are trying to hit a wide niche of guests.

You would be surprised to know that this is a global chain restaurant and like most chains they stick to doing it the same, never straying from one flavor.  From one South Indian to another.. I wouldn't recommend it.  From one American to another that may not ever travel to South India and discover truer flavors.. I guess it comes close.  You might like it.

If this place was on my usual trek I might stop in during happy hour and sample some other dishes.  Nice looking restaurant setup in a strip mall.  They did a decent job at trying to make it look like a real sit down restaurant rather than like a business that may or may not make it through the next couple years.  I.e. a strip mall eatery.
The chicken biryani was awful. They just served plain rice mixed with a chicken curry in the name of a biryani. South Indian dishes ok. This place used to be good but seems the owners have changed.

Went last night for the first time as we had heard great things about the food...
Very disappointed! Food was very mediocre. Prices were too high for things such the paper dosa ($14). For 4 adults one child and one baby our bill was ridiculous. They even added gratuity automatically. Service was ok. After we are we went to the bathroom which was right next to their kitchen window. Hundreds of fruit flys all over. Quiet disgusting. Atmosphere... There is none. Would not recommend it.

I ate here for lunch for the first time. My experience with Indian foods involves many, many buffets and restaurants. Never have I found one that made delicious food and managed not to make me sick, too. This is partially due to my lactose problem and inability to stay away from Indian food. Since I can remember, eating restaurant Indian food has given me pain and ulcers. I always thought it was the spice, but not after I stuffed myself here at Sankalp. I ordered the combo dossa platter. I can't remember which dossas I ordered, but they were very good. We received two small hot "soups," one refillable, to dip our food in. They were both delicious. I'm not a fan of chutney, but others in my party enjoyed that.

The food was spicy, and though I'm super full, my head isn't spinning, and I'm not stuffing down burps and hiccups for the remainder of my work day.

Sankalp's style is South Indian, and from what I could tell, is less buttery and saucey than dishes at other restaurants I've tried. They are spicey, but not necessarily saucey. I'm judging from the paneer and other fillings I had in my dossas, so I wouldn't know about the other entrees. I really don't need a stick of butter or a pound of cheese in my food and this was refreshingly simple.

Someone who enjoys eating their Indian food doused in heavily flavored sauce may not enjoy this place as much as I did.

Also, the dossas are not exactly "mini" as the menu says. I am not a super eater, but had two dossas left over for dinner.

Really authentic and fresh food. I am really impressed by the quality of both North and South Indian dishes. The Rawa masala dosa was super fresh and the potato filling was freshly made. Sambhar was impressive as well. I also tried Malai Kofta and it turned out to be amazing. I am definitely coming back here to try all the other dishes on their Menu.

I came here with my family. Great food but customer service was really awesome.  Never got treated this way anywhere before.
Great people, I wish them all the success in the world.

All you can eat dosa? How can anyone resist? 

I went with a group of my friends, who are all Indian and know what to order. We had a great time getting different types of dosa and trying each other's out. 

It is true that their idlis aren't very impressive, and although I found sambar to be excellent, my Indian friends said that it didn't taste authentic. 

Go for the dosas!

Sloppy service . Food doesn't taste any good like before. They renewed the place but service has gone down. No more chutney variety served with South Indian dishes. Either too salty or no salt. Texture and temperature can easily reveal that food came from walkin freezer. Stay away.

Went here for lunch for the first time for my first experience with Southern Indian food.  I got the lunch special which was so much food.  It came with soup, some delicious idli, vada, sauces, and then 3 dosas came out which were very big and delicious.  The spinach and cheese was especially a hit.  The service was good and very nice.

Overpriced menu. $11 for small dosa and $15 for small sizzler
Quantity can be compared with kids menu. The sizzler had one chicken drumstick, two tiny pieces of lamb and fish.
Bland taste.
Don't waste your time and money at this place. One of the worst Indian restaurants in chicago area.

Worst restaurant ever! I will never go again. Rude owner and just one waiter to provide service. We were there for dosa night which is 13.99 and the dosa were awful. I would pass on this restaurant and rather go to hot breads for nice dosa. Worst experience of all Indian restaurants.
Loved the food at the original branch. Found the food here to be overly spicy. The decor is old and the feel is a little dingy. Not the greatest dining experience.

I ordered take out last night for the first time here. I figured this was some startup and had no idea this place is a chain of sorts. I totally expected it would be run down in this mall and dead. NOPE!
 This place was PACKED to the rafters on a Thursday. I am pretty new to the Indian food thing, I have to say that even though this place was busy, the guys there were EXTREMELY helpful. I had Malbari Paneer and some paratha...twas heavenly. I got so strung out on this stuff that I returned with the wife this morning. Same great service, same good taste...and what do you know? They have pina coladas and all kinds of refreshing house made soft drinks. I had a mixed up lime soda -slrrrp!

 Me and the wife (Wife and I?) did a repeat on the paneer, had a massive dose 'a dosa...and the ubiquitous samosa with green spicy sauce stuff. 
More joints like this would be so beneficial to our microlocal food scene.

Thanks Sankalp, truly a great place you've got.

 I am an appreciative Indian food rookie.

Great food!  Didn't know what to expect since it was in a strip mall but am so happy we decided to give Sankalp a try!  This place is fantastic!  Will definitely be back. It's genuine Indian food with great service.

I came to Sankalp on the recommendation of a coworker who is from India.  In fact, we came together for lunch.

Sankalp is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking.  As I walked from my car, the predominant aromas in the air were from the doughnut shop a few doors down.  I thought Indian food would be able to overcome that, but I digress.

The seating area was medium sized and held around 20 tables... maybe fewer.  The decor was clean, but nothing fancy.  The layout was dictated by the strip mall unit rectangle that we are all familiar with.
There was incense burning just inside the door, and the smell was too strong throughout the restaurant, but I was distracted from it once I started eating.

Prior to our visit, we were told that there is a lunch buffet, but when you walk in you do not see the usual table full of food.  We asked the waiter and he assured us that the entire menu was the buffet.  This was puzzling and we asked for clarification, but he reiterated that we could order whatever we wanted for the buffet price of $11.  So we sat down and prepared for lunch... and what a feast it was!

I don't know the names of anything I ate because my friend ordered everything for me.  What I do know is that everything came out freshly prepared and delicious.  The portions were huge considering the many items that we ordered.  I did my best to eat everything that was ordered and I felt a little guilty that we had so much food because being a "buffet" I assumed I wouldn't be able to take the leftovers home.  They even included desserts in this deal.  It was unbelievably decadent!

I ate so much food that I could barely move.  I didn't even feel hungry for dinner that night.

I don't know if they will keep this "buffet" deal going as I don't see how they can afford to, but I will definitely be back.
I usually like to eat Indian food in a buffet setting because I like to eat a little of this and a little of that when it comes to that kind of food.  But I think I could get used to eating at Sankalp because I like the fresh cooked aspect as well.  I just wish it wasn't so far from my work.

I ate Indian food for the first time here & it was a great experience. 

The waiter was very friendly & helped everyone at my table figure out what to order since we are Indian-food illiterate.

It is in a strip mall, but the inside seemed clean. There is a little bar with a few stools & Indian music videos playing on the TV. 

I really enjoyed the food & service. I'll be back.

Just had my birthday dinner here. The food was excellent. I don't remember the names of nearly anything we got, but it was all delicious. The 10 of us didn't have much experience with Indian cuisine, and much less when it came to Southern Indian, so we were at the mercy of the staff's recommendation.

I do remember the Cheesy Idli. It was fried, and almost like cheese-fries. Definitely tasty. I got the Mango Lassi for my drink, and that too was quite delicious. It's a bit thick and almost desserty.

I brought my own birthday cake for dessert, and with that we had the Indian Coffee. It was very rich and exquisite. I am a big coffee person, and this variant was quite delicious.

The service was prompt, but at times it took a couple gestures to get our servers attention (note: the place was packed, and there were people waiting 45-minutes to get a table). As I mentioned before, we got a lot of staff recommendations for the dishes we ordered, and each and every item was a *thumbs up.*

One of the criteria I use to judge an ethnic restaurant is the patrons. Almost every other table in the place were Indian, and those people waiting 45-minutes? Indian too. There was one guy sitting at the booth barefoot, sitting cross legged... That was kind of weird.

They do take the restaurant.com gift certificates, and we did use one. It make an already great meal even better.

Other Stuff:
- Bathroom: clean
- Decor: simple
- Space: a bit small
- Price: very reasonable.

I have a feeling this restaurant will be here a long time.

Entering Sankalp mount prospect makes you feel like some shady restaurant. Ambience I rate it poor, there is big need to improve the ambience to attract more people. Lets be honest I am not going to take any guests to this place simply because it fails the look. 
Food - I would give it an average rating. Yes they have some good variety but going for the unlimited dosa night it failed to impress me. The portions are so huge you cannot have more than one dosa. I wish they make the portions small inorder to qualify for unlimited dosa. Appetizers for dosa night rate this as poor. I mean Maggie and corn manchurian with dosa. The Maggie had some indian tadka and spices making it non attractive.
Dosas were good but chutney and sambhar not impressive. 
Service- poor! How many times do I need to ask for chutney and water?!?! 
Overall not impressed with the dosa night I could maybe stop for a dinner once in blue moon, just maybe if I am out of options.
Spicy doesn't mean just add raw jalapeno. Not sure if the chef was changed but our first visit was good that's the reason we went back and disappointed with food.
Great South Indian food! The medu vada and dosa's are to die for! Absolutely recommend it for authentic South Indian food !

I have been to Sankalp a bunch of times for their lunch buffet.  The food is really, really good . The puris are one of the best you can get in any Indian restaurant. The lunch buffet entrees are decent, you get 2 types of chicken, lamb, 3 kinds of veggies and ofcourse puris. In addition  you also get a dosa ( make sure you ask for it)!  3 types of desserts, Rice pudding, kulfi and Custard ( think creme anglaise with fresh fruit) All this delicious food for $11! If you like Indian food and are in the vicinity, you must be mental not to go here.

Our server Caroline was very friendly and knowledgeable about everything on the menu. Relaxing Indian music and very nice decor accompanied and delicious coconut Vegetable Kurma with Chicken Order delicious Mango Lassi. Great place, great service, will return.

I am South Indian and I judge my food very harshly. It has to be just right in order for me to truly enjoy it. This place does have delicious food. I look forward to comin back here. I really enjoyed the rava dhosa with sambhar and coconut chutney. There rasam is also very good. If you are ever sick go drink two cups of there rasam you will be fine. Haha

They discontinued the buffet and we were not impressed with what they offered instead.  We got the non-veg thali, which was spotty.  We were really disappointed in the dosa.  It looked so good but was bland and flavorless--the worst dosa we've had.  The soups were weak.  Service was unfriendly and inattentive.  Meh.

This place is seriously really good.

Great prices. Nice people. 

Tacos and Burritos are amazing. They grill the tortilla and its perfect.

Minus 1 star for no alcohol
Minus1 star for blah food

All these reviews rave about this place so I was expecting great things. Especially with the waitress speaking only Spanish, which at times was confusing but I thought the food would be legit. Bland food. Really disappointed, won't be back.

You literally need the alcohol because there are children with families who seem to not care if their kids are running around screaming at the tops of their lungs. Look I know this place resembles the inside of a fast food joint but there's no play place. You want to let your child run wild take them to McDonald's or chick fil a

So this is really a 3.5 star review.    I'll go towards three stars though this time.
