Food is pretty pricey for the quality you receive. We got the jumbo char dog, chicken pita, small beef, cheeseburger, fries, and onion rings for $27.

The char dog was good in size but not anything special. Cheeseburger was fine except it had a slice of kraft American cheese, not really a fan of businesses using cheap cheese like kraft American. 
Chicken pita was dry but my kids liked the chicken with some ketchup. Fries was meh but what really annoyed me was the order of onion rings. We got our onion ring order and inside was half onion rings half fries.... (the other order of just fries was in another bag so this was not an accidental spill of any sort). If I wanted fries, I'd order fries but I ordered onion rings so I'd expect all onion rings. This is the first time I've ever seen that and I was definitely not happy about the discovery. The beef in the small beef was not your typical beef you'd find or expect. It was slices of beef that were bland and very chewy. Not tender by any means. 

The only upside to this place was the free small cone you receive at the end of your meal. We won't be returning, not because it was that horrible but there's so much better out there.

The chicken wrap my husband and I ate was well seasoned and good although a little peppery. However, when I gave the clerk the $5.00 coupon I saw only $4.50 on the bill.  Supposedly we saved .50 in tax?  Huh?  Also .69 charged for using a credit card.  Are you kidding?  That's not the way to keep a customer satisfied.  Two chicken sandwiches and two cokes for over $20.00?   We won't be back.
This place is ran by kids and way over priced. Food is ok, Portillo's is BETTER.  I would stay away from both locations (Mt Prospect has one)
Nothing here is even decent.  Terrible hot dogs, and the entire dining experience is not good.
Not bad at all. Quality service but a bit slow. Clean. Good food. Needed a quickie dog fix that the ten minutes I planned turned into a 25 minute stop but I will still go back when I'm out that way.

Hmm, where do we begin?

You would think you could give a hot dog joint at least 4 stars and I would like to because the eating area itself is neat! Cool pictures hanging everywhere, old cameras, old artifacts, etc...  that's the 3 stars... but I stopped in driving by for a hot dog.

A Chicago dog with everything but too much of it! I got a salad in a bun with dog hidden below. The amount of condiments made the hot dog cool off too fast.

Supposedly they are known for their cheese for fries, (not that this is normal for me,) but it was served on the side... I don't know, maybe coagulated cheese dip is good for some but I went back to dipping my fries in ketchup if needed.

There are other choices on the menu but for me this is a one-n-done on the dogs!

I thought I would give Photos a try since it is close by and I had a $5 off coupon.  Inside the restaurant is heavily decorated with pictures and memorabilia and they have some tvs for sports games. It wasn't too busy when I went in on a week night. 

After looking over the menu, I decided to go with the veggie burger, fries, and pita chips with humus.  The staff seemed to be pretty friendly.  It did take longer than expected to prepare the food. I would estimate about 10 minutes which seemed like a lot considering it was not busy. 

For the food, the veggie burger was ok, the fries were pretty good, but the pita chips and humus were disappointing. The pita chips were pretty much just crackers.  

On the receipt, I noticed the $5 off for some reason only took off $4.53 and this is before tax was added, so I'm not sure what the deal is with that. All my items were at full price so it seems like it should have taken off the full $5. 

Overall considering the food was just ok, the was a significant wait time, and the fact that the coupon did not give the full $5 off, I personally would not rush back, but if you are looking for a fun place to go for a burger and fries, it is worth checking out.

I've been driving by this place for months and finally decided to stop.  Have to honestly say, I'm sorry I did and wish I had spent my money elsewhere.  Despite the fact that there is always a crowd here - and the menu is quite extensive - I just don't understand the attraction.  The hot dogs and fries I ordered were nothing special, in fact, they were pretty mediocre and tasteless.  Do yourself a favor and find the nearest Portillo's - a much better place to spend your money with MUCH better food.

So I liked this place for the ambience that it presented and really couldn't ask for more. The food was typical of a burger joint, nothing special about the burgers. No magic buns or seasoning on the party. The fries were nothing to rave about. But on the plus side you get a super small free ice cream cone so that kind of makes up for the disappointment. I had a coupon for a free burger when you buy an order of fries and a drink, so I decided to put that to good use. Other than that I wouldn't go out of my way to dine there.

Been here a handful of times prior. Foods been good. But I recently had the chicken gyro platter for the first time and I have to say... It was AMAZING! I definitely will be going back for this. Great flavor, tender chicken and tasty tziki sauce. Great job Photos!

I'll preface this review with this fact - I have never been to the actual Photo's location. We catered from here for a work gathering, so I have no idea what the atmosphere or service is like.

That being said, we ordered some plain hot dogs, cheese burgers, and chicken pitas for a work party. We had everything delivered (they do charge a delivery fee). They came on time, everything was hot and individually wrapped (which was nice). The hot dogs were...well...hot dogs. Honestly, I don't know how anyone could screw up a hot dog. The burgers were ok - they tasted fine, but they seemed like they had been pre-frozen at one point. I like my burgers cooked medium, juicy, seasoned. These were...plain, thin, dry...nothing to brag about. The chicken pitas were really dry...barely tasted like anything. We did order everything plain, so that could be our fault. But it really wasn't seasoned. It wasn't terrible, but I definitely wasn't blown away.

When I looked at the prices (and I wasn't paying for it...so that helps) I thought it was a little much for what we got. A burger was $2.99...a plain burger. Meh. Not terrible...but not great. Not for the quality.

Overall, it wasn't the worst, but I'm not compelled to visit the location to eat, or to order from them again.
Nice place really like the chicken pita or chicken gyros. Getting free ice cream is a nice touch. A little pricey but seem to have a lot of daily specials.

Photos continues to go downhill, while having the highest prices for comparable menus. First, they stopped offering Italian beef (are we in Chicago?). Then they discontinued their 3-5 milkshake happy hour. I went through the drive thru about 2 wks ago...hot dogs were cold and buns were stale and hard. Tried again today (sign says $1 hotdogs...doesn't say one per person, so if you're planning on bringing dogs back for anyone else, beware). Once, again bun tasted stale, and wasn't steamed. They must have switched to a cheaper brand because they no longer have poppy seeds. Hot dog was so-so...may have switched to a cheaper alternative there as well. Asked for pickles on the side and got 1, where I used to get 2 or 3. Clearly they are cutting costs, and the quality reflects it!! I give 'em 6 months. Too bad .. Used to be a great spot in my neighborhood.
My bacon burger had no bacon, and was clearly just a frozen patty, overcooked. Fries were tasteless. Chicken gyros and hot dog were decent but not worth returning for.
All I ordered was a bacon cheeseburger. Waited 20 plus minutes. It was sitting on a counter in the kitchen for 20 mins. Gave it to me cold! Staff did make me a new one but only because I asked.

We have been going here for awhile now and like their hot dogs and now we really like the new jumbo char dog called the Big Kahuna Dog. Very good Chicago Style Dogs. Recently I tried the Cheeseburger and really liked it. Went back already 3 times for the Cheeseburger because I like the plentiful mayo they put on the burger. Yesterday however my Cheeseburger did not have that plentiful mayo and I was disappointed so I will have to mention this next time I order the Cheeseburger. I also miss Italian Beefs ... I assume they dropped these from the menu? Hope they come back again someday soon as that is why I gave 4 stars. Will definitely keep going here.

My coworkers and I decided to grab lunch from photos the chicken gyros looked so gross that it was just thrown out not worth trying and the hamburger had barely any flavor and had way too much mayo that my hamburger got soggy so I couldn't even finish it. Worse then high school cafeteria food. The onion rings were okay but that's about it. It's about quality not quantity.
Good for hot dogs and milkshakes but wasn't impressed with their italian beef.
Had dinner there and it was YUMMY! Employees are very pleasant and polite. My friend had dogs and fries, I had the chicken wrap DELISH! A lot of food for the money and FREE Ice Cream! Will be back

What kind of Midwestern hot dog place 86's their beefs and replaces it with QUESADILLAS!!!!!  After eating here for the better part of 30 years I am sad to say that they have lost my business.  Sure the burgers are good, but i can get a burger anywhere.  Im severely disappointed in this change.
Hot diggety dogs.

I called in a 'to go" order for my coworkers and I.  When I go to the restaurant, there was no line for me to go to get our order.  I was informed that I would have to wait in line with everyone else.  There were 11 people in front of me.  For a while they had two registers open, then I think he was the owner left the register and only one person was ringing.  
When I got to the front and paid there were problems with the credit card reader.  When I got the receipt it did not have an itemized detail, or any kind of detail as to what the order cost.  And to top everything off by this time our food was cold.
I am not sure other than the cheap discounts that they give to students, and the free ice cream how they can expect to stay in business.

Photo's Hot Dogs is a surprisingly large and elaborately decorated Chicago style eatery located in Palatine. Once you walk inside you'll notice a large number of vending machines and skill cranes. The decorations extended to photos (that's why it's their name I guess) all over the wall, a display of antique cameras and even a movie projector. The place is fairly clean but has a very cluttered atmosphere with something to look at everywhere.  

There was a rather significant line upon walking in and a few minutes later I was able to place my order. I decided to go for a hot dog with everything. I also was urged by a friend of mine to try "funnel cake fries" which is a specialty they serve at Photos. Once I placed the order it was nearly 10 minutes before the order was ready. Service here isn't exactly speedy, but in all fairness it was fairly busy though not exactly packed with customers.

The hot dog I received came on a very dry bun. The bun was regular without any poppy seeds and while not hard was not exactly soft either. The sausage itself was skinless and not steamed particularly well as it seemed to have had a lot of the flavor sapped out of it. There was a pickle spear on the hot dog easily as thick as the hot dog itself. To make matters worse it lacked the length so that you would get pickle in every bite and was so sour it overpowered the flavor of the hot dog itself. This pickle was a failure in every way possible. In the 1950s you would expect this pickle to sit in the back of the classroom with a dunce cap on. The application of the mustard and relish was a little excessive. There was no sign of celery salt, at least the onion and sport peppers were well applied. 

My friend and I also split a specialty item here called "Funnel Cake Fries". These are like a funnel cake or french toast but made of potato. Imagine French fries with powdered sugar on them. This wound up making the fries more of a dessert than a traditional appetizer.  These were somewhat thick fries, but if I recall correctly for around 3.00 we only got like 10 or 12 of them. It wasn't like getting a whole order of regular fries served in the same manner. While this isn't something I would go out of my way to order again, it's definitely an unusual way to serve french fries.

Overall I like the aesthetic of the place itself with various vending machines, old pictures and old cameras up everywhere. The food failed to live up to my standards. While the funnel cake fries that I tried were a both unique and good that was a wretched hot dog, and from a place that has the word Hot Dogs in their name,. Because the funnel cake fries were a saving grace and the place has just kitsch enough of an atmosphere to be a draw, I am going to be generous and award Photo's Hot Dogs with two stars.

The chicken wraps were very large and inexpensive, but seemed to be plain and not assembled right. The chicken slices overflowed the top of the wrap, but only after munching a while did we discover the tasty sauce and lettuce set down first at the fold. With that in the bite, the sandwich was pretty good. We have eaten there before and have generally liked the food. Counter service is fast.

The store has abundant coupons, daily specials and teen days. And free ice cream. This store displays a interesting collection of antique cameras.

Total ripoff !!! $11 for Italian beef , onion rings and sm coke ? First off beef was tiny with stail bread and not very good at all . Onion rings 2.95 for 8 onion rings ? Again nothing special there either !!! Place is shithole and total waste of money . Don't go !! Crap food !!!! Fuck you photopulos !!!
Holy crap the turkey burger was incredible. i got a couple of other things too I think but I can't remember anything about them because the turkey burger was so damn good
Not worth it. Just an average burger fries and expensive. Place was not clean and is trying to be like portillos.
Ordered two hot dog special fry and drink. Took at least 15 minutes to get order. Bun was dry, fry super salty. BTW.  the glass  atrium smelled like a urinal.

I had the chicken pita and the chicken was okay but the pita was definitely frozen & thawed (I could taste it). The fries were not salted much, which is fine, but there was no flavor to compensate. Just potato flavor, which was minimal. The chicken quesadilla was okay but not great either. My dad had the classic hot dog, didn't say how it was, though. The service is nice though, decently fast. 

So kinda quick, nice people, mediocre food. Would I go back? Not likely.

So bummed... Heard really good things about their milkshakes and the pictures online look amazing but I was pretty disappointed. Maybe my standards for a "Good" milkshake are just too high... I still haven't found one in Chicago. I'll give you hot dogs Chicago... You know how to cook a bad ass hot dog. But when it comes to the essence of a milkshake... None of you seem to know what you are doing.
There needs to be more ice cream than milk... And definitely whipped cream as an option, just for starters. So sorry Photo's, you've joined my list of disappointing milkshakes!
(But the fries were pretty good)
Worst Italian beef ever! It tasted like they soaked some cold cuts in hot water. Overpriced, terrible food.

Aweful. I've given this place multiple tries. Over priced and the food is not good. I had a Gyro without onions. I swear they put extra onions in my order. The sauce was bad and the fries were old. They messed up my order the last 2 times. They apparently do not care about their customers. This place just needs to go away.

I don't mind throwing hard earned money away because that's what happened at my last trip ever to Photo's.  French fries were awful.  I cannot put my finger on it.  Just plain awful.  I have never been served fresh ripe tomatoes, even in the month of July.  The grilled chicken in the salads and pita sandwiches is minimal and cheap tasting.

The drive-thru employees are friendly.  I stopped going inside because some of those kids working behind the counter look miserable.

I love hotdogs...but Photo's could not seem to get it right. The bun was soggy, dog was just ok. Plus they couldn't get my toppings correct. Fries were also tasteless. I went throught the drive-thru...never ever go through the drive-thru...no only did they mess up my hotdog but they forgot a burger. I called because at this point I couldnt get back to the restaurant.  I was told...are you sure or did forget to order the burger. Come on now...I paid for it and had proof. I felt like I was a thief at this point. So now I was going to drive there just to make a point. I brought back the food I was given and asked for a full refund. Which I was told they could not do because I had left the property before checking my order. Poor service and bland food.

Photo's still has an odd business model - they practically give food away to high schoolers at lunch  (50-70% discounts), raise prices for others fairly often, and steeply, then put out coupons on the Internet that make purchases much more affordable, if you think to bring them.  Seems odd.  The food itself is actually pretty good, but many items are overpriced at "list". With the March increases of over 10% on key items, hot dogs are now $3, Mini Pitas are $3.35 ($4 now) , an 8 in. Italian Beef $7, Chili dogs $3.50, etc.   New paper menus in the holders have just been updated, finally.  Hot dogs are OK, the Chicken Pita can be fabulous, and the fries are great when freshly made.  Soup is really good, but a bit expensive at $4 for a modest cup. If all this isn't a turn off, then enjoy!

They get two stars because the cheese fries are awesome and they have free ice cream. As I child I went to the one in Mount Prospect and they had the car shows and pinball. Great memories but this last visit was miserable. Not going back anymore and that's sad.

Ok photos gets 3 stars versus 2.5 because they were very nice in giving my mother a senior discount. Also, over all very nice staff! Now to the food... Very average at best. I had the Italian beef and it was bland. I had to put extra gardinera to add flavor. If you want a beef sandwich, go to Buona Beef. Over all, nice and clean place with friendly environment. Free ice cram too!

Stopped there tonight to pick up their special beef's and grab 4 polish for the guys from work. Surprise... they stopped selling both about a month ago because their drive up was backing up. When I checked their web site last night and saw the beef special for Thursday night I got all excited. To bad when I got ther I was SOL. Their hot dogs were outstanding, fries good, cheese for the fries - verey bad. I was disappointed.  Don Krist

Would have given this place a better review, but the owner decided not to accept my coupon because the monthly special is a 2-1 chicken pita, and although I've done it multiple times, he wouldn't accept my coupon in addition.

Apparently since he didn't want to give me the good deal I had planned on getting, instead he loses a customer. 

I guess being cheap really pays off... So you saved $2 dollars and lost a lifetime of business. Good job bro. 

It's unfortunate because I liked the food here otherwise and usually was pretty impressed by the deals.

I hate that I have to leave a 2 star review, because the people there were really nice.  the food however, was anything but.  I felt like a gyro and it wasn't on their menu but it was on a paper sign on the door.  so I figured I'd try it out, I mean how bad could it be?  yikes... there was lettuce on it, and the meat was like something you get from the supermarket in the frozen food aisle and not the fresh cut off a spit.  I ate half of it and couldn't take anymore.  so I pigged out on the cheese fries we ordered instead, and that was pretty good actually.  I'm not sure what kind of cheese it was, but it was pretty good.  I doubt, however, that it would be enough to bring me back.

I only like this place because of the seafood items they have.  They offer a wider variety of items for people who prefer fish over meat.  Some of the items include a Salmon cheeseburger, grilled tilapia sandwich, fish tacos, fish quesadilla, and some more.

They also offer a happy hour for milkshakes during the weekdays, but I tried the shake and wasn't too impressed.

I would never recomend this place to ANYONE. First of all, the cashiers have horrible attitudes. It is like their faces are made of stone ... not one smile or change of angry facial expression at all. The food was quick but not what I expected.  The fries were very very salty. The kids chicken nuggets should be worth $1 it's a RIP OFF. The kids burger is also a rip off tasted horrible. the regular cheese burger tasted OK but not worth $5. Then there is the "free" ice cream or is it automatically included in there ridiculous prices for sub par food? The young lady giving us the ice cream also had a bad attitude. I was very unhappy with our visit. We all work hard for our money and it's a rare treat for me to get to take my kids out for lunch so it's very upsetting that I wasted my money when I could've spent less and gotten more food *even better tasting** at a place like Wendy's or McDonalds.

Chicken gyro, jumbo char dog, cheeseburger, French fries, free soft serve ice cream: all fantastic! Fresh! Delicious! And lots of cool pictures of famous people to look at while you're waiting for your food.

I'm giving this place 4-stars for veggie eaters.

When I want a veggie burger on the fly, I usually want one from photos. Their buns are soft, the right size, and they complement the burger very well. When I order it with everything on it, I really get everything. And all the toppings are cut generously and I am pleased. The burger itself is very good--not overcooked or mushy. Just the right texture. It's probably closest to Gardenburger in composition. It's quite tasty.

The fries are good--maybe a little on the thinner side, but the flavor and texture is there. I have also had their quesadillas. They're good if you want a lot of gooey cheese and veggies on a huge tortilla, which, well, heck yes, I do. It comes with a side of sour cream which seems a little on the small side, but is probably an accurate single serving size and I'm just a sour cream glutton. The salsa is homemade and I liked it--could've been spicier for my tastes, but again, that's me.

The only real puzzler about this place for me is the hummus wrap. OK... So I ordered this once, and it was... Strange. I think it was a flour tortilla (trying to remember now) and it was stuffed with lettuce and gobs and gobs of hummus. I mean we're talking, someone dumped a whole tub of hummus into this thing. Now I really like hummus, but I was taking bites and making faces because I was just getting mouthfuls of the stuff. And frankly, hummus is better in moderation. I just imagine this sandwich would be so much more enjoyable with some carrots, zucchini, or red bell peppers thrown in there.

I've had their milkshakes, which are also pretty good. Not amazing, but I'd order another. But the reason they earn their 4-stars from me is the burger. I keep coming back and getting them, so I figured I should give them some love for it!

Hello owner of photos have you ever eaten your Italian beef I love it"not" one of the worst Italian beefs I have eaten your ketchup is cheap and awful and for the quality of food that u sell. Your prices are portilos prices with aldi food. Get better quality food or boy you are going to lose a lot of costomers.

When is Yelp going to add the .5 star rating feature?  I'd give Photo's 2.5 if I could. The food is not that great and their hotdogs would make a grown man cry.  The relish was all wrong, it came with only one sport pepper, no poppy seeds, weird meat. I bought two because A) I was dying of hunger and B) they were a dollar.  It took so long for the food to come out, I actually busted out the book I had been reading. It's really expensive too.  The last time I ordered something here I had to ask my parents to take a second mortgage out on their house. The milkshakes are mediocre.  I got banana malt and it gave me no thought that it was worth ruining my workout.  The customer service is alright, nothing to brag about.  The place is clean.  The decor is somewhat disturbing because there isn't anything that isn't decorated. One thing I really didn't like which is just a quirk of mine; the coupons say something like, "in (owner of Photo's name) we trust," which is totally stupid.  Boring review for boring food.
I like the burger a lot! Didn't try anything else on the menu yet, but the burgers are awesome. Fries could be better, that's why 1 star off. But i'll be back for sure :)
The Mushroom Burger and Chicken Gyros are delicious sandwiches! This is such a great place for families. Really fun and affordable. The kids and I LOVE the free ice cream cones!!!

Photos Hotdogs... /sigh...

Claiming to be a Chicago staple means delivering, at a minimum, decent versions of Chicago's typical foods.

The italian beef is one of the worst I've had anywhere, let alone in Chicago. The hot dogs were fine, but bun and condiments tasted stale. French fries (usually an easy win) were also stale and subpar. The one positive thing I can say is that they did craft a fairly delicious milkshake. 

Despite the tasty milkshake I have a hard time believing that I would return to Photos. There are better places for milkshakes and numerous better options for Chicago foods (see Kostas in the Palatine area).

I had the Italian beef and am wondering if the employees of Photos have ever had an Italian beef because what they're passing off as such is most definitely not what any sane person would expect to get. It's dry, flavorless, and quite honestly not edible. 

Fun fact: the "steak" quesadilla uses the exact same disgusting beef. 

So what is it Photos? Italian beef or steak? It can't be both, but let me assure you it's gross no matter what you call it or how you serve it.

I've never been impressed with the food or the service. The hot dog buns are dry and the dogs are bland. The burgers are decent but nothing special. I ordered one of the new "gyros" and what I got was a bit shocking. They apparently do not have a gyro on a spit. (If you are from Chicago, you know there is one and only one way to serve gyros")... instead, I was served a plate of what looked like pre shaved, warmed up slabs of gyros meat. It reminded me of "pre-cooked bacon" you see in the supermarket, which is something not even I would try...and I've eat gas station food. 
 
I give them kudos for being good neighbors, they do a lot for the community in the way of team sponsorship, and my kids love going there. They are a popular place to go and are centrally located so it is a convenient place to hit after sports. As for the overall experience, I wish they had better quality food.
Ringing a bell for free ice cream is now my new favorite past time. Discounts for students and teachers!
great food.  Have not had anything  bad there,  The free ice cream is great.  Italian beef is better than portillo's.

I used to pick a couple hotdogs through the drive-in on the 2 for $3 Tuesdays and they were ok, and the best thing about that was they DIDN'T come with fries because the grease tubes are bad enough. But we quit doing that when you could get a HUGE dog or polish we could SPLIT WITH a refillable drink for $1.50 at Costco. 
So long story long we had never eaten INSIDE, and picked up a GrouponNOW net net for $5 on $20, less 5% for going through Discover, TODAY.

It kind of reminds me of a Schaumburg Portillos for grade school and junior high school kids on Red Bull. And we enjoyed NOT having kids there and the basic fun energy of the place watching really cute little kids run around who are going to grow up never being that cute again.
Our fish tacos were ok but I don't think it's really a fish taco if it has romaine instead of cabbage on it,  plus cheese? really? and NO tomato; and our greek salad was ok but no peppecinis? I wouldn' t order the veggie humus wrap again, it is basically a LOT of romaine with a little humus, how about some tomatoes, still better than it looked and nice to have some solid veggie choices. The Veggie humus wrap WAS big enough to split.

What I didn't like was that EVERYTHING that we ordered was 50c to $1.50 more than on the on-line menu. When I mentioned it ...the 13 year old at the window said "yeah they ought to change that." 
I think $6.49 for a veggie lettuce/humus wrap is kind of Route 14 highway robbery when you were expecting $4.99.  This might sound really cheap, but our bill was 20% more than the on-line menu. Did YOU raise YOUR prices 20% this year or GET a 20% raise? We didn't.

The tables were clean, the free little ice cream cone was fun, but we are going to stick to Costco for our non-health food and ice cream smoothies. If you do go here, check their website for specials/coupons as this food isn't that good to not get some kind of deal, and don't believe their on-line menu prices. 

Two and a half stars rounded DOWN for faux on-line JACKED menu prices.

There was so much buzz about this place when it first opened up, but now whenever I drive by and the one time I actually went inside, it's completely dead. I guess by now everyone has realized that Portillo's, Gene and Jude's, or even the little hot dog stand at the home depot are way better. Yeah, sure they have that home-town feel with newspaper clippings hung up, but honestly no one I know even goes here anymore because the food is no good.
The service was poor it took over 20 minutes to get a simple hot dog and the hotdog was ice cold absolutely ridiculous I will never eat here again

A solid three stars.  The hot dogs are pretty good.  The hot dog was nicely topped and the bun was fresh.  They have a good vegetarian menu.  Yeah the staff could be friendlier but overall I would stop by when I'm in the area.  Decent spot to grab some lunch.

Did the food taste good? Yes. 
Do I think I paid too much for it? Yes

It was my first visit to Photos. The hotdog came out as ordered and so did the chicken pita. I also ordered a mighty tasty chocolate shake.

This place doesn't call to me to run back tomorrow but if I have a hot dog fix and can't remember where else to get one I would consider visiting Photos again even though the tasty chocolate shake was nearly $5.
Solid hot dog and burger joint with free soft serve ice cream. Avoid the Italian Beef here...

I wish you could give it a 2.5. I had a hot dog and fries and it was OK. You can't really screw up a Chicago style hot dog. The ingredients were crisp and fresh, but it was nothing special. The fries were similar, they were just fries. 

I will say the place has a mammoth menu with stuff like salmon burgers and milkshakes of all sorts. and even has a $1 menu for kids in school. That's pretty neat.

Was really excited about trying out a new restaurant (via he gorupon).  But the experience was not good and i will not go back nor will i recommend Photo's to anyone I know.
The service was awful.  I asked the man at the cash register(big guy, surly, unfriendly, possibly mgr???)  I asked a few allergen questions and the man really acted like i was putting him out.  I'm sorry buddy but you  work in the food industry , someone asking you about gluten shouldn't be all that foreign to you ,AND really if it is , don' let the customer know you could give a shi& about it.   so right off the bat the service was bad, the man did not want to go the extra step, OR step at all to make a customer happy.  The food I ordered was not good either.  I ordered a salad with blue cheese, cranberries and pecans on it.  The salad had no taste what so ever.  Which tells me the ingredients WERE VERY OLD. the cheese tastes awful, that was about the only thing I tasted, was the gross cheese.  So the service was awful ,the food was awful, my husbands food was avg at best and it was expensive.

Dined here many times here over the years with my family and larger groups.  Dogs, burgers, and fries similar quality to other Chicagoland based grills, cleaner, faster than most.  Easy in/out.  They are a loyal and generous sponsor to local youth sports and kids really like eating there.

There is no conceivable reason for anyone to go here.

While the food here isn't terrible, it's certainly not good, and even with the deals they always seem to be running (which seem to me like a cry for help), a bit on the pricey side.

But what really deals Photo's a wicked death blow is that it's located about 100 yards from Hot Dog Richie's, which serves up the same sort of food, but is infinitely superior in every way imaginable. Richie's is one of the NW suburbs best dogs, and Photo's is less than mediocre.

It is sad to see what once was an excellent Chicago hot dog joint decline so dramatically. The Chicago dogs are definitely not up to Chicago standards.  Poor condiments, stale tomatoes, and stale buns--not to mention mistakes on drive-through orders. Skip Photos--go to Portillos.  Don't waste the calories on Photo's inferior dogs.

The Photo's in Mount Prospect used to be a great place to go with the team after a baseball game but all I can say on my last few visits is WHAT HAPPENED?   I have had stale hot dog buns, cold hot dogs and hamburgers so small and thin I can see through them. And at a high price too!  Management should take a field trip to Portillos Hot Dogs and take note on what makes customers come back time and time again.
The best polish! Most places give you stringy grilled onions that fall out with each bite. Not at photos. They grill diced onions to order for the perfect amount in each bite. The best!

I used to go here a fair amount when I went to high school in the area. They facilitated a fundraiser for my high school fraternity and also hung a photo of my half-nude friends and I on the wall. We put up the photo seven years ago and it is still there to this day. 

Photo's offers an extensive menu with pretty good food. The prices are fair if you have a coupon, which are plentiful, or order the daily special. Sunday nights offer $1.50 burgers and I'm pretty sure they have milkshake happy hour every afternoon.

The food is fresh and simple, which is exactly what it tastes like. Most recently I had an excellent milkshake and a chicken pita. The milkshake was great since you have to be trying to mess that up. Chicken was plentiful on the pita and it also had mayo (maybe try a secret sauce), lettuce, and tomato, but it was nothing special in the flavor department.
The gyros isn't so stay away from it.  Good beefs and burgers.  The staff is very friendly.

i really thought this was a chain joint but it really wasn't. only place i know that gives free soft serve ice cream... you can't beat that. 

the day we went, they were celebrating their 20 years of service so all the hot dogs were 20 cent, yes, i said it, 20 cent!!!! The catch was, you had to buy a full price large drink or side item. Which was one, I calculated that a hot dog and a drink runs about $2.50... not bad at all, of course it's cheaper to make your own at home. 

I had the coney island hot dog and I have to say that you can't screw this up. i was disappointed in the hummus, the pita chips were excellent but the hummus was not tasty at all. Don't get it!!

I can't say that i will come back for seconds, but i'm glad that i've tried once.

Not pleased with the customer service.  Forgot part of the drive thru order. Yes i check most of it as we pulled out.  But disappointing  when you get home and a hot dog is missing.  Over priced as well.  Chiggy's up NW Highway is the winner!

Get better processes and controls in place.  :-(

I picked up some Photo's  for lunch today (I was considering Chiggy's or Hot Dog Richy's, but Photo's has a drive-thru & I saw a dollar off coupon in my wallet; any bit helps, right?).  I got a kid's hot dog meal (comes w/ fries & soda for $4, which seemed reasonable), an Italian beef sandwich (Thurs. special $3 instead of the usual $5.50), and a plain hotdog w/ a small cheese fry.  So, you can proooobably understand why was surprised when my total came to 15 bucks. When I asked the girl at the window to itemize my order, she told me that the (very) small cheese fry was OVER $3 & the PLAIN hot dog was $3 too! So basically,  I got the same thing in the kids meal with cheese instead of a drink, but paid 2 bucks more...for cheese.  Maybe I sound cheap, and hey, I probably am (thanks, Dad), but it's hard for me to justify spending $15...no $14 with that AWESOME coupon...on a small bag of junk food.

Oh yeah, the food was mediocre at best.  The fries are way better... well everywhere else, & they didn't even serve peppers on the beef. Weird.  Chiggy's (2 mins away) is the better choice for sure, or if you want the drive-thru, go to Portillo's.

GAG. I first tried Photos in 2004. Ate a cheeseburger which i was not impressed with. More like chewing on rubber with rubber having more taste. Never went back until today... 8yrs later, having had a coupon for $10 off $20 order! I have even lived down the street from Photos for 8yrs and never considered it a place to eat at.  Ordered a beef. GROSSS!!!! It was the worst beef I have ever had. The beef was incredibly fatty and chewy. I've had better beef from EuroFresh just down the road. The fries were hard, stale and old. The cheese for the fries was solid, even when it was warmed. I was NOT impressed AGAIN, nor will I ever recommend anyone to eat here. I always pass by and notice the parking lot empty. Hmmmm... wonder why??

Not quite as good as the hotdog joints we had when we lived on the southside, but probably the best hotdog "joint" I've found up here. I've only gotten hotdogs + fries here, but they have a really big menu that I would like to try

Well, ya kinda feel like Norm from Cheers when you come to this fine establishment.  Even the servers start to remember what you're drinking if you come around enough, and they are very friendly here.  The atmosphere is pretty chill, there are a bunch of TVs around in the dining area as well as the bar, so you can get your game watching/cheering on!  It can get pretty packed on game days/nights, but the wait is never really all that long.  They are hella high tech here with being able to text your phone directly when your table is ready, so in the meantime, you can grab a drink from the bar and start out with some liquid appetizers.  It tastes soooo good once it touches your lips.

Now let's get to the food action right here.  Many people go to the Village Tavern for their Chicken fingers.  These are pretty good actually... Their chicken fingers are deep fried in some proper batter.  I prefer these to be a little crunchy over softer ones, but this will fill you up for sure, and you'll probably need a box if you get it as a meal, because they are really filling.  You'll feel like a turkey on Thanksgiving after chowing down on these chicken fingers and french fries.  I don't often order these, but if you are suffering from a massive hangover, these bad boys might do the trick.

Now, where they really shine is on their burger game.  These are definitely on point!  I think at least half of the time I've went to the Village Tavern, I ordered the Onion Bacon Cheese Burger.  Now this is a big juicy burger with a nice amount of cheese and they go wild with the bacon.  Big thick pieces piled up on top to go with the grilled onions...just toss on a little ketchup, and you will go into burger bliss. 

 Their fries are nicely seasoned and also have a nice crisp to it.  A lot of burger places have great burgers, but when it comes to their fries, it turns out to be absolute weak sauce.  Here at the VTG, the burgers and fries are top notch.  I usually order, a side Caesar Salad as well.  Even that is done up properly time after time.  It's pretty affordable too.  It goes great with a cold brew to say the least!

I've never had the Nachorama, but that would be the next thing I'd wanna try.  It looks like a mountain of nachos, if you order this be sure to bring a big crew in order to erode that massive pile down to a valley.  There's various sandwiches and other dinners as well.  I've never had a bad meal here yet.  My buddy and I have came here a bunch after work, and it usually turns to be out on the cheaper side tab compared to other surrounding restaurants in the Schaumburg area..   Good food and good service at affordable prices goes a long way.

This place is like a blast from the past. Kind of quaint if you squint. It seems they never updated since they were established. It's all good, this place gets packed and they seem like a bunch of locals here. I dig it. 

So I give 4 stars for location (close to my crib), very affordable menu (they have like 10,000 items in their menu), fast and friendly service (although be careful, she gave a couple of suggestions that were totally off), and their batter (they fry everything here and they mastered the art of the batter--- so get everything in the menu that's deep fried)

Chips con queso: the chips are too hard for my liking and the queso dip was too runny and lacks taste. 

Chicken tortilla soup: sooooo good! Meaty, crunchy (tortilla chips), chunky, fresh taste, and has a sweet aftertaste because of the delicious veggies in it. 

Chicken tenders: wowwww MUST HAVE. The batter makes these tenders tasty, tender, and perfect crunch. Get the original. Although I liked the buffalo, I love the original with the honey mustard. 

Chili soup: it's ok. It's not as big of a deal like the server described it. They really pimp their chili though. It comes with green onions, onions, cheese, sour cream, tortilla chips, and of course the chili! 

Chicken parmigiana: I don't know why I ordered this... but I did so here it is: huge tasty chicken breast on top of fettuccine pasta, this needed more pasta sauce and that may have done the trick. But then again, why did I order this??? Unless you're feigning for a huge chunk of chicken breast with mozzarella and sauce on top, skip this. They have tons of items in their menu to choose from.  

Dessert: so to wrap up our heart attack dinner we ordered the deep fried sampler platter: deep fried Oreo, deep fried cheesecake, deep fried twinkies, and deep fried snickers topped with two scoops of ice cream and whipped cream. Also followed by an ER visit to get an EKG and a nitro.

This is a pretty cool pub /bar. The food is decent, nothing spectacular but I want upset that I spent money there. 
Going in with my little ones I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was very family friendly and at the time that we went out was packed with other families. 
All the food looked really tasty and next time that I go back I have to try the nachos

Usually there is a little wait here, the place is always busy whenever I've been there. But I haven't really found anything really great in terms of the food. It's not bad though either. The service seems to turn over a lot, I don't think I've ever had the same server, and they're busy a lot so the service is hit or miss. They do have really good French onion soup, but I think they only have it on Wednesdays or Thursdays. I'll be returning because I have family members who swear by it but it's not my favorite.

UPDATE: Owner contacted me and offered suggestions on what to try on the menu: Ribs, burgers, nachorama and fajitas. Also a gift card, so I'll take his recommendations and update a star. I appreciate great customer service!

First time coming here and my friend raved about their chicken fingers, so that is what I ordered. Nice portion size and the chicken fingers were nice and hot. Their honey mustard sauce is amazing too. We also ordered the full plate of nachos and honestly, there is nothing special about the nachos, other than the fact that it's just really huge. Nachos got soggy after just sitting there for a while, so it was pretty unappealing to eat it. The fries that comes with the chicken fingers are also very good, and I honestly liked it more than the chicken fingers.
Service was ok. It wasn't busy when I went, so I wish our server was more attentive and quick.
I would probably pay another visit here but will explore their menu more

The restaurant was very busy due to the Blackhawks Game, we ordered the potato skins which were really good but then ordered the apple and cherry glazed porkchops which were horrible and well overcooked.... got the Au Gratin potatos which were crappy due to some cheddar cheese dumped on top of a crumbled up baked potato with some chives on top.... little to no flavor either.... French onion soup was really watery needed alot of help with seasoning and better broth...waitress was great but the girls at the check in desk were not nearly ready to handle the crowds..... didn't know how to notify customers when it was thier 
time for a table... please step it up.... this place is slipping and fading slowly....

Hands down, the best chicken fingers in the USA!
After all, it says so on their shirt! ;)

Growing up and going to high school in Schaumburg, everyone knows about the Village Tavern. It's a staple in the neighborhood. 
I used to visit VTG numerous times a month in my high-school days. I've never left hungry and always left happy.

After a few years without visiting, (I moved to Arlington Heights) my friend decided to make tonight a throwback moment. We decided to make the somewhat far drive to check out an old favorite.

We went in around 6:30 and the place was PACKED! This is a normal be used everyone loves it. We put our name in the list and they put us in the app. The app allows you to see from your iPhone your estimated wait and how many parties are ahead of you. Great feature, very much appreciated.

After about ten minutes, we were seated and ordered an ice cold Blue Moon. Keep in mind, Schaumburg police/village require TWO FORMS OF I.D. to purchase and consume. I showed a insurance card and my drivers license with no problem. 

We enjoyed our beer while scanning thru the huge menu. There is something for everyone here. I decided to start with the baked French onion soup. We also each ordered the chicken finger appetizer. 

The soup was served piping hot with a heap of ooey-gooey cheese on top. Perfect, just how I like it. The soup was incredible with plenty of onions. 

Next, on to the world famous chicken fingers. They're world famous for a reason, nobody makes em' like VTG. Crispy and light breading over juicy and tender chicken inside. They serve it with a super secret honey mustard sauce for dipping. The honey mustard MAKES AND ENHANCES the chicken tenders. No ketchup or ranch, stick to the honey mustard! They melt in your mouth and are best eaten piping hot where you are sure to scar the roof of your mouth. ;) 

The service here is superb. Even when swamped, they provide an excellent dining experience. The noise is a bit loud inside, but it's a causal, fun neighborhood spot. The owner knows what he's doing and doesn't need to change a thing! 

So go ahead, throw your pajama bottoms on and kick back with an ice cold beer and a basket of the best chicken fingers known to man!

This place has the best chicken fingers ever , they are the best things I've ever tried. The salad that comes with it is okay not the best thing but when it accompanies the chicken fingers , its worth it. Also the honey mustard dip is great !

My cousin stayed in Schaumburg for his work conference, so I visited him from the city . Went thru Yelp to find good restaurants around that area, and I found this place. He loves American food and beers. This is the perfect place for that!

I ordered chicken fingers since the restaurant is well known for those. Boy, it was hellaaaaa good! So unhealthily crunchy! Haha! Even though I'm on healthy diet, I literally finished my food in less than 10 minutes. You gotta try this dish when you swing by here.  My cousin got a burger and blue moon beer. He said his burger was juicy and fulfilled his craving. 

The service was quick too! The waitress (sorry i didn't catch her name) was too sweet to let us know that the restaurant is not going to serve the food after 11 pm (we arrived at 10:58 pm), and she happily took our orders with no attitude nor rudeness. 

I'm giving five stars and I'm coming back soon for those chicken fingers!

I love the Village.  Everyone raves about their chicken fingers, for good reason.  I get them with 3 sauces - of course the honey Mustard, the Ranch, and the Buffalo.  I also will never pass up their French Onion soup.  But don't get stuck on those two items.  other things that I've had that are awesome are the lasagna (ask for no red sauce unless you like sweet sauce), pork chops, nachos, Mexican pizza, roast beef or beef stew - I can't remember.  I just know it was all good.  If you are a drinker, they have plenty to choose from.  I always have a good experience with the staff as well.  The only thing I can say that I don't like is the wait time sometimes can be long, but using the nowait app helps with that.  You will not be sorry at this place.

Chicken fingers are almost NEVER my choice of food to order. Yet, chicken fingers will be the only thing I will order at Village Tavern. Ever. And I mean it. 

Yesterday was my second visit to Village Tavern. My first visit was two years ago and their chicken fingers have been in my mind ever since. They are so crispy, tender and so juicy! They're also beer battered and don't taste like you're swallowing tablespoons of oil. Aaaaand they come with their homemade honey mustard that is perfect! 

My friend ordered the chicken burrito, I ordered the chicken finger plate and we had fried mushrooms to share. 

Food came out so quickly! My friend really enjoyed her burrito. I was in loooooove with my chicken finger plate! For about $10, you get a choice of a soup or salad (I chose the Chicken Rotini), vegetables upon request (steamed carrots and broccoli--perfectly seasoned and so fresh!), and a form of carb (fries, mashed potatoes, potatoes au gratin, or Spanish rice). 

The fried mushrooms ($6) were amazing as well! I never know whether the fried mushrooms I order elsewhere are fresh or frozen...but Village Tavern's are FOR SURE fresh. They use the same batter as their chicken fingers and they are perfectly seasoned, fresh, crispy, and amazing. I really hate paying money for an appetizer that I barely share with other people at my table. For $6, you can share for sure because they give you huge fried mushrooms and there are plenty to go around. 

My visit last night was superb thanks to our waitress, Caitlin. She was so attentive to our needs. Caitlin noticed that my friend and I were famished. She was so sweet and she put in our order to be rushed and made immediately. What a gem! She was always happy and filled our water/came to check on us at the most opportune times. I most definitely recommend her!

Village Tavern has delicious food, excellent service and seriously so much food for the money you pay. A must try!

Known best for their chicken fingers which are fantastic! 

I've also gotten the pot roast here which was delicious.  

This is a fun atmosphere.  Great place to go to with family or friends!
Bad customer service. Rude waitress. The fish and fries are tasteless. Never coming back again.

Love those chicken fingers obviously! Great service at the bar where we usually sit. Other great eats like the HUGE nachos and the French onion soup. Also best ever deep fried Oreos ever!! Come here and eat like a queen!

Used to love and be obsessed with this place, but nowadays it just doesn't meet expectations. Ordered to go the other day and was left craving more. Their chicken fingers were still good and tasty but extra greasy, not like how it used to be. The wings were completely overcooked and dry, but SUPER spicy. The cucumber bruschetta was tasty but the bread that was served with it was burnt... 

The worst part was the Caesar salad, like how do you mess up a Caesar salad? It was bitter and the dressing was watery. The Parmesan and croutons were soggy and sad. Just disappointing and a waste of money. 

If I go back, I'll just stick with the classics.

Oh my god, these chicken fingers!  Oh my god, you guys.... these chicken fingers!  

We went here on a Monday, it was very crowded, and pretty loud for a weeknight.  I got a philly cheese beef sandwich, and shared an order of chicken fingers with my date.  The sandwich and side of fries was good, but as you might of guessed, the chicken fingers stole the show.  Very tender and deliciously breaded!  We ordered bbq and honey mustard sauce on the side, and they went great with both.  Seriously, if you go here and don't get the chicken fingers you are messing up big time.  I definitely plan on going back, but based on the weekday crowd, this might be a place I avoid on the weekends.

Food was just AWFUL!!!!
I had the baby back ribs, their Saturday "special"
The ribs and the big potato tasted an looked like they were cooked yesterday, the broccoli was tasteless.
My husband had a chicken wrap, he said it was okay.... I don't believe him, he just have this thing that even when he doesn't like the food he will eat it, it is just like he doesn't want the waitress feel bad or something.... and there is also why he took the left overs home, which I throw away the next morning.
WILL NOT BE BACK !!!!!!!

Village Tavern has been established institution for my co-workers and I for several years.  During the summer evenings, this place can get pretty packed so call ahead if you have a large party.  

They have a nice selection of beers and cocktails.  The food is also great and when I was on a diet, their low-cal options weren't that bad as well.  Most people come here for the chicken fingers which are outstanding.  The batter on the chicken fingers is what makes it taste great.  There's a traditional version and a coconut batter, which can be a little crispier in my opinion.  

It's a great place to hangout with friends and eat, and I'll be coming here for years to come.

I went around maybe 10 or 11PM on a weekday - place had decent number of people for weeknight when there were no big games on. The service was good, atmosphere was fine - probably what you'd expect, but the food was bad.

I ordered chicken tenders and fries. The fries were ok, but I did not enjoy the the chicken tenders. They had that soggy, mushy tasted to them.

I have been coming here for years because of the chicken fingers after a friend told me about it and I saw the Chicago's Best episode for it. The batter is amazing and it's an actual cut of chicken tender inside the golden-fried goodness! You have to try it with their "finger sauce" or whatever they call it.  It's just honey mustard, but it's definitely good.

The place is very relaxed and the servers don't rush you, so it's a great place if you're trying to watch a game or kill time chatting with a group of good friends--but maybe not if you're in a hurry. The takeout process is great too!

I haven't been as regular a patron recently because I feel like the quality and value isn't as consistent as of late. My friends and I have commented to each other that the last few times we've gone it seems like the chicken has been getting smaller, but the price has gone up. That said, for a newbie they'd still be very happy with what they're getting for the yum!

Go try it! Why are you still reading this? What are you waiting for?
The skirt steak is absolutely amazing and the chicken fingers is good as ever and great service this evening

We both got a chicken fingers meal and it was so much food! We would have been fine splitting the meal for sure (leftovers were great, though!). We had to wait a bit for a table, which is fine, but there was nowhere to wait - lots of smokers outside and only a small area inside.
Thank you J.R. for encouraging me to try the fish fry once again.  This time it was delicious!  Not at all greasy and very tasty, thanks again!
second place I went to that lied about the time they were open till. IF YOU CLOSE EARLIER, FIX YOUR HOURS!!!!!!! Won't be back because of this inconvenience.

what isnt there to love about this place? been going here for YEARS! we try and make every sunday a village day! love the pot roast and of course chicken fingers. but also, just love this joint in general!

Had another visit to Village Tavern and Grill today.

The last review still stands....love it.

A friend had suggested the potroast and it was delicious today.

Becca was our server.  She was fun and very efficient.  Ask for her!

Very good food!! The best chicken fingers and burgers! The staff is very friendly!!
I'll be back again soon!

A good value, lots of food for the money. Good quality pub food. Very nice wait staff. Lots of TV's but can get a little loud, so don't expect lots of conversation when it's busy. I use the 
"No Wait" app to get in line so the wait isn't so long.

I made reservations for 6 people on a Friday night at 7:30pm and boy am I glad I did! It was totally packed by the time we got there. I think they were saying the wait was 30 minutes for 2 people when we got there- which I wasn't expecting for a pub in the suburbs. Our group was 45 minutes late... but luckily the place was nice and seated the two of us immediately so we at least got to sit down for 45 minutes (although we felt very bad for taking up such a big table). But the server was nice and didn't say anything about it. The place was really big and had a ton of tables and seating. It was hard to find close parking.

I got the Parmesan Shoe Strings Cheese Burger with bleu cheese and on Rye Bread. To be honest, it was just O.K. It's not something I would get again. The fries were also just O.K. But for $8 it was not bad.

My hubby got the Onion Bacon Cheese Burger. He said it was okay. He did like his sweet potato fries though! They looked much more fresh than the regular fries. He also got a lil sumpin sumpin =).

Our friends shared appetizers like the spinach dip, french onion and brocolli cheddar soup, chicken tenders, and sampler platter with mozarella sticks, quesadillas, etc. I think they liked their meals.

This place was amazing. The food was so tasty. The staff was attentive and personable. The nachos were so delicious...though I recommend you stick with the half order. I ordered the half and could barely finish it with my friends. The full order must be huge!
I also suggest you get the chicken fingers platter. They are so good! Especially with the honey mustard sauce. They were both tender, juicy and crispy all at once. And if you get the loaded cheese fries with it you get more cheese then fries!
I finished off my meal with the fried cheesecake egg rolls. Which these were to die for. The mix of cinnamon, vanilla ice cream and cheesecake wrapped in a flaky crust was so yummy. 
And to top it all off my bill wasn't that bad. For the amount and quality of the food you get this place was so worth it! Go here! You won't regret it!

I'm so sad that I'm not closer to this place because I would be here a couple times a week. Got there about 8pm (Friday) and it was busy. We just sat at the bar. We were immediately greeted and given menus.

Now after all the reviews, I already knew what I wanted. I needed a little bit of everything. Cheeseburger, Nachos and Chicken Fingers with their honey mustard sauce. You better believe we ordered all of that and split it.

Okay.. Let's start with the cheeseburger. WOW! They seasoned this to perfection. The taste was honestly unbelievable. I'd easily gain 50lbs if I lived by here. They came with a side of fries. Usually bars have just regular fries and there's nothing special, however, these were awesome! Again, seasoned to perfection.. My mouth is watering while I'm typing this; I may have a problem! lol

Nachos - Fully loaded. We only ordered a half order and that was enough for two people and to take some home, which I did ;) and ate them later! Then the lady asked, 'don't you want to try the chicken fingers with our homemade honey mustard'.. Uhh yaa!! (40 lbs later) They were awesome and the honey mustard was excellent! The reviews aren't lying about this place.

Cozy small town feel, because it is in the middle of no where! Schaumburg is huge! Great service and very friendly people. Can't wait to back!
Super good service. Chicken fingers were delicious! Some of the best I've had. Salad was fresh and crispy. Tacos were huge and the meat was charbroiled to perfection. Highly recommended.

This place was just alright. Chill environment with pretty good music. The food was just okay, huge portions. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip which was served with pita. The pita was delicious but overall the dip is better almost every where else. I had a small salad with Bleu cheese dressing which was good. We also orders the fish fry Platter with fries and hush puppies. It was HUGE. Had plenty to take home, but other places make it more delicious. The other meal ordered was the fried buffalo chicken sandwich, also huge. 

The drinks however were good. I ordered the Snow Cone cocktail and the dreamsicle.. both good, but the Snow Cone was better. If you're looking for a chill place to have a drink I would recommend this place.. if you looking to have dinner, there are plenty of restaurants out there!

First time here, but I have heard about it from many people that are seriously addicted to their chicken fingers with honey mustard sauce.  I happened to stop by for the fish fry.  It was great-not greasy and plenty of it.  

They have an extensive menu with lots of weekday specials.  Service was great, beer glasses were never empty and several TV's which make it even better so you can enjoy great food, cold drinks and your favorite team.

Did I mention their Dirty Turtle Cake--words cannot describe!!

I no its the holidays and lots of people are going out but yesterday it took me over a hour to sit for two and I finally had the famous chicken fingers and they were cold I'll give it to them the honey mustard they rave about was delicious I'm going to try them again and maybe my food would come out hot....

We had a wonderful lunch here today celebrating my mom's 78th bday. Sam the waitress was very patient and attentive to our needs. We all enjoyed are meals and our service. Thank you all for accomdating us.
Awesome chicken fingers, great prices and wonderful service.  I will be back.

Great place to eat and drink. The food is good and 
The waitstaff are very friendly . It's really a great neighborhood hang out.
Best house dressing, best chicken fingers.   Make a RSVP as they are always crowded.  Big bar, plenty of roomy seating.   But, really, go for the chicken fingers and the honey mustard dipping sauce.

We visited The Village Tavern this evening for the first time. Our waitress was Diana and we ordered the "all you can eat fish" and the "corn beef and cabbage". Both were delicious. I had the fish which included hush puppies. The dinner came with an ample amount, but the were so good, I asked if I could get a couple of extra. Diana asked the manager, and after a couple of minutes they delivered a basket of 8 !!! 
I would like everyone know we were impressed with the food and service. The restaurant was clean, not too loud, and the entire staff was friendly and inviting. Yes, we will be back. We were also told that we can see the daily menu specials on Facebook. What a great idea. Oh yes, I give them five stars for food & service!
We love this place great staff great food kind of loud good TVs good prices good menu it's our regular

This place, oh man. Their chicken fingers are literally the best I have ever had. I go here all the time and they are always amazing. If you are going to eat in, this place is packed, all the time. Tuesday nights, Wednesday nights, they do not discriminates on nights they are busy. It is all the time. The parking lot can be tricky. We just order online and do pick and thankfully they have pick up parking. I can't say much for their other food as I have not had it. Amazing!!

Great food and awesome staff. The staff goes out of their way to make sure your experience is good. Whether to watch a game or just to stop in for their "world famous chicken fingers", you will not be disappointed. I make it a point to stop in whenever I have the opportunity. I've never had anything off their menu that didn't hit the spot. Huge portions as well.  Check them out!

See photos. Ordered a salad for $4 plus tax and the description per photo says "Mixed greens with cucumbers and tomatoes," but I got some cheap iceberg lettuce and one slice of cheap tomato and cucumber. Kind of lousy!

Village Tavern is a Schaumburg classic. Known for their chicken fingers and honey mustard sauce. For an appetizer, I recommend the nachos. French onion soup is one of the best I've ever had. Very crowded for dinner, especially on the weekends. Expect to wait at least 45 minutes if you don't get there early enough. Carry out is also an option as they have carry out parking right in front of the restaurant. I'll surely be back.

I have been coming here for over 10 years. This place is a local favorite and known for there humongous nachos (very shareable). Plenty of TV's to catch a game. There is generally a wait but worth it. The jerk chicken wings are FANTASTIC. Try the chicken tenders!

Not a fan of fried food, but LOVE the chicken tenders. I try to trick myself into thinking I am being semi-healthy and get the Chicken Tenders Salad. 
The French Onion Soup is also amazing, but can only get it on Sundays, if my memory serves me correctly. 
Restaurant is a little tight and sometimes the front of the house is less than pleasant.
One of our favorite places to go! We always get the chicken fingers (honey mustard is a must) and the steak house wrap with avocados. Good little local bar, but 2 ID's are required for alcohol.

Our server Dianna R. Was wonderful. Even on a busy Friday night she was on top of everything. The parm shoe string onion cheese burger is good, of course the chicken tenders are outstanding. The prices are very reasonable. The chicken tender kids meal is a lot of food. Great place!

Why are you so far from where I live?
 
I stopped in today right at open (11a), I was across the street getting my car detailed at Action Audio and Detail. Saw they were right there so I decided to spend my 2 hours here. BEST. DECISION. EVER. *** for today.

I was greeted and seated immediately when I came in. Awesome. The feel of this place is very home-y and comfortable, you feel very much part of a family when you walk in just because of the way the employees carry themselves. 

My server Lexi came over smiling and asked if she could help me out, I asked for coffee which was delivered immediately. Nice and hot. 

She helped me since it was my first time here with her menu knowledge making suggestions they were known for, but also making suggestions that weren't advertised all over the place. I ended up picking something I knew I would like but was also special to the house because it had the chicken fingers in it.

DELICIOUS! I loved my food. I didn't eat it all because the portions are abundant and I never finish a meal anyways; I brought it home for my hubby. I paid 13.03 for a big-ass wrap, and loaded cheese fries with bottomless coffee. I feel like my money went very very far today. 

I have never seen a pub/tavern fill for a Monday lunch, but let me tell you by the time noon rolled around this place was 80% full, even the bar. I bet you need to make reservations for the weekend or be prepared to wait a decent amount of time, but they also have a connection with No Wait which can help you with that. 

I have been in the food service industry for 13 years, I have done it all from serving, cooking, hosting, banquets and I have been managing now for the last 4 years. This place makes me want to come work for them, I truly enjoyed it this much. 

Lexi, you were awesome, friendly, attentive, and I couldn't have asked for better service. I haven't found service this good in a long long time (and the strange thing is I feel like I wasn't treated special, my server did not go above and beyond for me, but it appeared that she wanted to be at work, and that she WANTED to serve me and THAT makes all the difference in the world)

Thanks for the great lunch, though you are way out of my way, when I come back out to Schaumburg, you'll be the place I come to.
Give  four stars for nachos  chicken  was not crispy  has it looks to be but it's good

Looks can definitely be deceiving!  Don't let the exterior of Village Tavern deter you from stopping in for some good comfort food.  I came with my girlfriend for a late lunch on a Monday afternoon and we were pleasantly surprised.  Village Tavern seems like a cozy, neighborhood bar that would be packed with regulars on a daily basis.  It has an old school charm to it which I loved.  The food is priced well, tastes great, and portions are huge.  

I had the pot roast which comes with a soup or salad (I chose the beef tortilla soup) and sides of veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.  After I had the soup I was already halfway full since the portion was that hefty!  My entree itself could have fed two people and I was able to only eat about a third of it.  The mashed potatoes were garlicy and delicious, pot roast was tender and flavorful, and the veggies were probably from a frozen bag.  My friend ordered the chicken burrito and the description of the burrito did not lie.  They called it ginormous and that it was.  She was only able to eat half of it and was super stuffed afterwards.

We definitely want to come back and check it out for happy hour with friends (mainly so we can try out more food on the menu since there were a TON of yummy sounding things).  Until then Village Tavern!

Portions are huge we fed four people on a half order of chili nachos, a Chicken Burrito Grande and a pulled pork sandwich with lack luster fries.

Taste was okay.   Sort of bland.  Nachos were soggy and we were there when they were brought out from the kitchen.   The nachos while piled high with stuff but just lacked flavor.  They were skimpy with the cheese and sour cream.  

The Chicken Burrito Grande was good.  It tasted fresh.  I had to add Tobasco Sauce to jazz up the flavor.

The pulled pork's barbeque sauce was so so but I like Sweet Baby Ray's the best and my own second.  The pulled pork sandwich was average, nothing special.

Service was good.  People were friendly and efficient.

Food here tends to be priced high compared to the value and taste.  

They do have ordering on line which is nice.

We've only been here once so I will update my review if our next visit differs.  There are other places right around us though that are cheaper and better value.

Amazingly Delicious!!!The food was great so was the service. Plus they are very very fast at making your food because when my family stop by we were very hungry and exhausted from a long day of work and wanted to eat so we ordered and it took around 5 minutes for all our food to be done and the place was packed with customers not one empty table did I see there Amazing!!!

Chicken fingers rock!!

bar area nice - always has a good crowd

It's almost always packed, but it's for a good reason. Their chicken fingers are their pride and joy and are always cooked perfectly. Whenever I have been there with my family we almost always get the nachos (and always have some leftover to bring home) as well as the French onion soup. Their chicken fingers also aren't the only good thing on their menu, their fajitas come with PLENTY of food and their burgers and wraps are pretty good as well.
Came back with a friend and the food was amazing and so was the service ! :) glad I l gave this place another

Service was sketchy because my server was not very attentive. Luckily The portions were huge. We ordered the beer battered chicken fingers, chili, chicken burrito and buffalo chicken sandwich. If I knew what I know now I'd just had the fingers. My husband enjoyed the chili amd I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken fingers.

Local favorite for a few years now. Great food, excellent service, atmosphere, and good value. Very diverse, kid friendly crowd that's  been the goto for a while. Friday and Saturday are busy but worth it. Games by bar set on free to keep kids busy while waiting for table. All food is good but Friday fish fry stands out! (try the baked fish!) Also recommend fall off the bone rib special on Saturday. Nachos are HUGE!
Chicken fingers are famous. Just an all around great place to catch the game or meet some friends.

I'm a vegetarian and the menu isn't very veggie-friendly. I'd love to see a veggie burger on the menu or something of the like. I ordered a few apps - cheese quesadillas & spinach artichoke dip, they were average. I've heard they have great chicken fingers, however, for carnivores!

(3.5 stars)

VTG earns a solid rating based largely on the strength of its chicken fingers and generally good service.  (And in full disclosure, I've only gotten the chicken fingers here.)  The chicken fingers are covered with a light yet crispy batter that does not overwhelm the chicken meat.  The pieces are pretty big so you'll definitely get your fill.  Plus, VTG does not mess around with that honey mustard; it's the perfect dipping sauce for that chicken!

I've eaten inside and taken out from VTG, and the service has been good each time. The atmosphere inside is typical of the bar and grill restaurant, and the prices are reasonable.
Always solid food! Chicken fingers are exceptional, as well as basically everything else. You can't go wrong no matter what!

I have a love hate relationship with this place. Love the food, hate the service. My last visit was last week later in the evening, around 8pm. I thought it would be a good idea to go later, so it would be less jam packed, and it was. The food was great as usual, and my two friends I brought with had never been and really enjoyed their meals. What was lacking was service from our server. She was nice, but it was really obvious she was exhausted, which she confirmed when she screwed something up and told us she had been there since 1030 this morning. Glasses often sat empty and it took a long time for our food to come, even though the place wasn't packed. Maybe they had a lot of to go orders? Either way, to go will more than likely be my only way I continue to enjoy food from there.

Went in with a party of 6 around 6 pm (dinner rush!!) 
let me just say:

1.  Great attentive customer service (hostess was really friendly- despite the hectic rush of people wanting to go in and out!!).

2. Awesome food/ especially spicy chicken fingers and shrimp baskets, the batter is the best!! and our waitress was also very and helpful.

I will definitely recommend this to everyone and I will come back again!!

This review has no bearing on the service or the food, because we never had an opportunity to eat or drink. Rather, this review is intended to highlight the restaurant's ridiculous policy on serving alcohol. 

This place requires two photo ID's to buy any alcohol. That is such poor business practice. I do Not and never have carried two ID's. Not only that, but they required me to  download their app to receive notification when my table was ready. Bull pucky.

Someone awhile back bought me some of the chicken fingers from here and always wanted to stop here and try them at the restaurant.  So I was in the area today and decided to stop in.  From the name I was expecting a nice and quiet place to eat and have a drink.  First in you are expecting a quiet place, keep driving.  If you want some great food, stop in.

Pulling into the parking lot, I thought we would have a long wait to get a seat, it was packed with cars.  Walked in and got seated right away.  Are server Lexi was there right away and took our orders. And through out the meal she kept tabs on our table and get the glasses full.  We ordered the chicken platters which came with a salad and potatoes.  There was enough food to feed two people from one platter.  The chicken fingers are fairly large and plentiful which included the dipping sauce.  The fingers were hot and nicely breaded.  This place has big screen tv's all over playing different things.

The negatives.  This place is loud, I forgot how loud bars can be, so if you plan on talking during your visit you must raise up your voice a few notches.  When I went to grab the chair to pull it closer to the table, it was full of some sticky substance which had to be washed off of my hands.  The salad that came with the platter was loaded with dressing, it would of have been better if was served in a little cup or dish.

Great restaurant! All the food is exceptional . Gotta get the chicken fingers they are fantastic. 
Fun place to go with family & friends.
Best chicken fingers in the US. The bleu cheese sauce was amazing and I will definitely go back!
The chicken fingers and French onion soup are TO DIE FOR. I mean, oh mylanta.  And the drinks come out strong

First off let me start by saying this is our first time here. We are from Wisconsin.  When we walked in, we were immediately seated by a wonderful hostess/ waitress. We sat down and got our menu's and drinks faster than fast.  I ordered the fish fry, my wife ordered the famous chicken strips. Coming from Wisconsin where there's a fish fry in every restaurant every Friday, I was anxious to see what Chicago had to offer. To my surprise it was the best all-you-can-eat fish fry I have ever had. The fish was flaky and tender while the batter was a golden brown.  It was, I have to say, the perfect fish. My wife had the chicken tenders. She said they really lived up to the reputation of being the house specialty. The portion sizes was unreal. So much food. The side that came with our meals were also above our expectations . Augratin potatos? Not many restaurants serve this as a side option. We eat out a lot and I remember those places that treated me well and had great food. And believe me, I will remember this for a long time...... the Big Bopper out.

Awesome place to eat.   Always busy and food made to order.  Always hot and fresh never have I been disappointed.  My family loves eating here with a broad menu of different food to choose from.   The chicken fingers are to DIE for.

I love this place - the food is very good! I especially love the chicken tenders and the fish fry(come on Wed or Fri to get all you can eat of it). The service and wait is usually pretty slow, but that might just be because of how many people are there since I've never come when it wasn't packed. Overall, id recommend it to anyone that likes good American food and doesn't mind a little background noise.

First timer at this place and I was impressed. I ordered the Friday special of all you can eat Fish Fry. Although I only had one plate it was well worth the price. 

Great service and food came out extremely quick.

Big portions. Solid bar food. Friendly, fast service. Tons of townies. This is the Village Tavern.
