I also like their DC Chicken Salad- it has currants, almonds and apples in it- delicious! I also like their coffee and appreciate that you get free refills on it (and the soft drinks) while you're there. 

Their lemonade is good but it sits out for a long time in ice in front of the checkout lanes and sometimes is warm by the time you get it- disappointing. No free refills on that.

They have an option for half a sandwich and soup which is really popular.

This location is great- at the far end of Streets of Woodfield attached to Maggianos. You order and pay at a counter and then they bring your food to your table as it's ready. They have friendly people working and keep the restaurant really clean. 

When the restaurant is crowded you are sitting pretty close to other people but I've still managed to have some great conversations with a friend here, over yummy coffee and my chocolate muffin. :)

I pretty much love Corner Bakery for just about everything. I love it for breakfast. I love it for lunch. I love it for dinner. 

Similar to a Panera Bread, Corner Bakery offers a variety of salads, sammies, soups, pastas, and breakfast sammies, scramblers, and oatmeal. And of course, they offer a plethora of combo meals ((Everyone loves options, right?!)) My go-to meal is usually the Trio Salad where you can 2 of their specialty salads with a cup of soup and field greens. Or, you can choose 3 of their specialty salads with field greens. ((The D.C. Chicken Salad and the Caprese Pasta are still my faves after several years!))  As for the sammies, my favorites are the Poblano Fresco, California Grille, or Chicken Apple Sausage Panini for breakfast. Yum.

Service is always fast and friendly. Prices are reasonable. And Corner Bakery is always clean - a big plus in my book. 

The biggest downside is the parking lot they share with Maggiano's. It can be somewhat of a nightmare finding parking during Maggiano's lunch or dinner rush. I usually park a little further, avoid the drama, and enjoy a short stroll.

This place is a mix between Panera and Starbucks. They have your baked goods, soups, salads, paninis, sanwiches, and coffee. Their coffee is great- no nasty after-taste. Their espresso is smooth and energizing (I love straight espresso). Everything is clean and tidy, the staff is very friendly, service is quick and accurate, and the ambiance is relaxing. They have enough seats and it isn't overly crowded like a lot of Paneras I have been to. Parking is a bit scarce so you may need to park in a parking lot next door, which is no big deal. A great place for a quick lunch or cup o' joe.
Friendly staff!! I am a nanny and brought the kids I nanny here for a meal, with the staff seeing I clearly had my hands full they went out of their way to help me. It was so appreciated!!!

Went here for the first time. This place is great! Friendly counter people. Right before I went to sit at a table, a worker quickly wiped down the table so it would be fresh for me. The "Sliced meatball sandwich" was super good. I'm definitely eating here again...

I had breakfast here twice on my most recent visit to Chicagoland. The french toast with scrambled eggs dish is excellent. The french toast is like a bread pudding texture and taste. The Farmer's Scrambler is like a scramled omlette with country potatoes. The chef must have been low on potatoes during my visit. Everything tasted great. A nice comfortable place for breakfast. I just wish that they could have turned up the heat a tad.

YUM! the mac n cheese is so good that you know it's bad for you. Not the powdered cheese and yellow #5 kind of bad for you. More like the heavy cream, butter and 5 kinds of cheese bad for you. So rich and yummy :) iAlso the raisin pecan crisps were delicious. Not sure if this is a chain but I'm hoping I can find another  one some day.

My previous experience with Corner Bakery was grabbing a snack on the way through Union Station, in downtown Chicago. We caught an early movie at the AMC (with the big Loews sign) in the same plaza and hit the Yelp mobile app for some local dinner suggestions. The reviews here won us over and we were not disappointed.

The food was great, I got a half sandwich and some excellent tomato soup, and my girlfriend got some pesto pasta. I had a coffee and she had a hot chocolate, both were good. Actually, the hot chocolate might've been more than good, she was still talking about it the next day. The atmosphere was nice enough, the tables were a little closer together than I expected, but not bad.

Delicious food. Service is extremely slow, and sometimes inconsistent. Sometimes even if I call my order in and walk in 15-20 minutes later, I'm still waiting for even something as simple as oatmeal that they just have to scoop. The food is their saving grace.

I had breakfast there today with my husband and a friend. We all thoroughly enjoyed the "Scrambles" that we ordered. Food was very fresh and prepared to order. I was particularly impressed that the staff person at the counter who took our order made a special effort to understand and honor my request for no milk or cheese in my eggs, as I am severely lactose intolerant. Thank you! We'll be back!

My best friend and I stopped here for our last lunch on a visit to Schaumburg last month. We managed to show up during lunch and likely the busiest time of the day. We ordered and found the last two seats in the place, facing the window where talking was awkward. When my sandwich was delivered by the manager he asked how we liked the restaurant so far. My reply was honest, but I tried to joke around about it, I was frustrated by the fact that singles were sitting at tables for 2 or 4 while my friend and I were sitting at the counter meant for singles. Anyhoo, he apologized and I told him it wasn't a big deal, just frustrating. {OBVIOUSLY this is not his fault nor is it the fault of the establishment. It is what it is!!} He left to go get my friend's lunch and when he returned he asked me for my plate. My friend joked around that they were going to put us out back, but he put us at a table that had just been vacated. It was so darn sweet!! I wasn't expecting that but it was so darn nice!! We enjoyed our lunches very much and are both sad that we don't have this establishment near us! The food was terrific, the service was great and even if we had to remain at the counter, I would have been fine. Oh, and an added bonus for me? They had Fresca on the soda fountain!! We'll definitely go back!!!

I like this place.  The coffee is SUPER good. Especially the hazelnut cream flavored coffee.  The food is ok.. good for a nice quick meal.  The Golden Gate scramble was tasty, but tasted like something that came from the freezer.   Wish I'd gone with the baked French toast. The staff seemed miserable and unhappy that they had to serve us and the people behind us.  Oh, well.. 3 out of 5.

Good breakfast options, better than any other fast food out there.There soup and sandwiches have always been good too. I wish there where more corner bakery's and less panera breads out there. Breakfast scrambler for breakfast or a corner combo for lunch, and if you order a sandwich with soup for a $1 upcharge they give you a bowl instead of a cup.

Went in on Friday morning to try the chilled berry oatmeal, yum!!! So good, I will absolutely try it again.  Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I think it's like 520 calories which seems a bit much for the size.  I will definitely be back.
Great service. Very friendly staff. We really enjoyed the mac and cheese. We ordered  the version with the bacon and tomato and also the one from the kid's menu.
Great prices for brunch and food was tasty; I especially enjoyed the truffle hot chocolate. Open, clean decor. Restrooms are inside the  attached Magiano's Little Italy restaurant.

I LOVE me some Corner Bakery. Between the breakfast items (Power Paninis and the egg scrambles are gifts to humanity) and the Monster Cookie...well, let's refer to this SAT-style comparison:

Me:Monster Cookie::Scooby Doo:Scooby Snacks
or
Me:Monster Cookie::Popeye:Spinach
or
Me:Monster Cookie::Cookie Monster:All cookies ever

I enjoy the menu so much, and the staff are pretty nice. There is only thing that truly bothers me: location, location, location. I despise driving to this location. To go here during lunch is a pain because I have to fight my way through Woodfield Mall traffic, Streets of Woodfield traffic, and a parking lot that is never empty because Corner Bakery is inexplicably attached to Maggiano's which ALWAYS seems to be packed. Whatever happened to that whole "recession" thing? Seriously, is that the only place where they could afford the rent?

If they could change locations to a place that is both convenient and part of an area with available parking that doesn't involve a Frogger-like minigame of trying to make it across one or more well-trafficked streets between Corner Bakery and my car, then that would be absolutely lovely and perfect. Until then, I'll have to work for it every time i want a Monster Cookie.

See? They really ARE like Scooby Snacks.

As far as cafes are concerned, the Corner Bakery food and menu are fantastic.   It gets the gold seal for cafes.

The staff is extremely nice and responsive.  Additionally, they'll bring your food out to your table and pick up your plates when you're done.

I can't help but compare this cafe to Panera.  If Panera is a burger , the Corner Bakery is a steak.  The food is that much better at the Corner Bakery.  I will go to Panera and suffer through their mediocre sandwiches so that I can connect to the Internet and get some work done, while I eat.  

In Panera's defense, I enjoy going there, but they don't use the highest quality ingredients.  Corner Bakery doesn't skimp on quality and I think it might be a little cheaper, which is surprising.

3 star Feelin It

Corner Bakery superb job with the banana bundt cake.( killer). Only wish I had some milk to wash it down with. You will be my early morning sweet tooth destination going forward. Hopefully parking is better than what it is at lunch.
Excellent chain, excellent location.  I really like the ham on pretzel!

I have been to many of the Corner Bakeries in the suburbs and in the city, and food-wise, if you have been to one, you've been to them all.   

If I were to review the food at Corner Bakery, I would give it 4 stars - as I have liked every sandwich, salad, soup and muffin on the menu that I have tried, but their fountain soda is terrible...seriously, there is something wrong with their mix - not enough syrup maybe?  Whatever, it's bad.  

However, this is not a review of Corner Bakery's food (or fountain soda) but rather a review of my experience with Corner Bakery catering.  

In mid-December I had a Christmas gathering with my "married friends" and their children out in the suburbs.  We were going to be having our own Christmas dinner and everyone was required to bring a dish.  I was assigned salad and bread.  In an effort to save time and frustration, I elected not to make a salad or bake bread, but rather to purchase these items.  I decided to go with Corner Bakery catering as I have always enjoyed their salads & rolls when I have stopped in for lunch.  

I am giving my experience with Corner Bakery catering 5 stars for the following reasons:

1) Ease of ordering:  I went online, looked up the catering menu available at their Schaumburg location, called to place the order (24 hours in advance) and was finished with the task in about 3 minutes.  

2) Staff:  When I arrived at Corner Bakery to pick up the salad and bread, despite the heavy weekend lunch crowd I was attended to promptly and given my order without any delay.  Everyone was very friendly -the employee who took my phone order, the employee who rang up my purchase, and the manager who greeted me and made sure my order was correct.   

3) Correct order:   Sadly, I have become accustomed to restaurants screwing up orders, and so I always kind of expect that when I receive my order, it will not be 100% correct.  I was therefore pleasantly surprised when I received my order to see everything was exactly as I had wanted it.  

4) Quality of food:  I had chosen the Sante Fe Ranch salad and a basket of assorted rolls.   It was definitely a crowd pleaser.  The presentation was nice and the salad and rolls were delicious.  

I would, without hesitation, use Corner Bakery catering again if the need arose, and recommend it to others.
Good lunch place but always crowded.

Generally, Corner Bakery is my all-time favorite place to eat.  However, the reason I didn't give this location five stars is because it's one of the smaller, more crowded, and less homey Corner Bakeries.  It's still awesome, but the tables seem squished and a bit disorganized because there are no walls anywhere to separate them.  

If you don't know much about Corner Bakery, they've got the BEST FOOD.  The prices are about the same as Panera Bread.  They've got amazing desserts (there's almost always samples) and their California Grill panini is out of this world.  They've got an awesome salad plate, where you can pick out three different types of salads for $7 (pasta salad, fruit salad, potato salad, tuna salad, etc. with green salad free on the side).  They've got breakfast food, huge bowls of delicious soups (especially their cheesy, bacony, hot potato soup)...Corner Bakery ROCKS!
Best karaoke ever! Had so many songs it was ridiculous! Had to get more drinks to help me decide what songs to sing! Great staff/owners! Definitely going back! Could live there if I could!!!!

I love the Hideout.  Every night I have gone in the Hideout whether I go in with a friend, hang out with a regular or hang out with the bartender Dave or the owners Todd & Jen I have a good time.  But I finally got a chance to make a Yelp review and I am astonished that I am not giving my favorite regular bar a 5 star.  I don't know why Dave left and his gf Kim coming out once in awhile as a regular was pretty cool too.  

It's ok he left I'm fine with that but I want to give Jen and Todd some advice.  The new bartender AJ is not cool.  He seriously needs bartending skills.  He cannot make Long Island Ice Tea.  Let alone know what a Tokoyo Tea is.  He dosen't card people he's never seen before.  He is not friendly.  He's ranting it's a dive bar and people are suppose to order beer but there's a wall of hard liquor ranging from flavored vodka to coconut rum.  He seems lazy and doesn't want to take the time to learn drinks and increase his speed.  

Other than that I love the Hideout and all the other staff and karaoke.  Either get another bartender or fix AJ's demeanor and tell him to practice at home.

You have your home, your place of work, and then there is the third place. This is the third place. When you need a place to hang out or a night of fun this is a great spot to go to. A typical experience depends on the day but it ranges from free drinks and ignorant comments from the regulars that will have you laughing durring the day. Spectacular singers on karaoke nights mixed with some brave singers. The beer is cold the liqour is well poured, good memories are made bad ones are forgotten, this is truly a place to call your own.

We had a great time at The Hideout! Super friendly staff and regulars, reasonably priced drinks, and a casual/fun atmosphere. Also, AMAZING karaoke selection with an app you can use to request songs from your phone. Highly recommended!

In the heart of chain establishment hell there is The Hideway. Friendly owners/staff, and an eclectic often eccentric group of patrons this place has every intention of becoming your second home. The vibe is warming, the conversations substantive and the beer is cold. Karaoke is a highlight, all skill levels accepted and always appreciated. Weekends always offer the best experience but good times happen daily. Come in, have fun, be cool to everyone and you'll be treated like family. Especially recommended for travelers to Schaumburg from far away lands. You won't be sorry.

What an awesome night! My friends and I arrived about 7 PM for a few drinks and to wait for karaoke to start. 

Linda the bartender was so nice!  We had some nachos that were greasy and cheesy and delicious. Then Jen the owner took care of us after 8 PM.

By 9 PM the place was PACKED and we karaoked until last call.  Such a fun time - a great crowd, super decent prices on drinks and bar food. 

We loved it.  We will be back!
I love this place, the food is good and drinks well, super good!.... my friends and I arrived about 7 PM for a few drinks and to wait for karaoke to start. Linda the bartender was so nice!

Really really enjoyed myself here! I've been in the area over 8 years and had no idea it was even here!!

Cozy atmosphere and like a classic sitcom, everyone knew everyone. 

Great whether you are new to Karaoke or a pro. Cool bartender and honestly the best drink prices around!

I will be coming back here again for sure!

We had a blast here! I was a tad skeptical when I walked in the bar but we ended up having a great time singing karaoke and chatting with the regulars. It was a great time and I would definitely come back to sing karaoke again. Not too crowded but a FUN crowd nevertheless. It really surprised me, in the best way possible.

I would often frequent this establishment when it was known by another name and I must say that it has improved tremendously.  Linda was the bartender on the day that I chose to visit The Hideout and being from the city I did not expect much, I was wrong.  You can look but will not find a bartender with the social skills/bar tending ability as this YOUNG lady has.  The people are the type that you wish to meet at every bar that you enter.  The music, courtesy of the gentleman called Roger was phenomenal.  If you are there, hope that he is as well and the tunes will be on point.  I would recommend this establishment to anyone wishing to have an amazing time.
Good entertainment if you go with a group of friends, but overall nothing special. Don't go out of your way to go there. Beware of the regulars.
Great little dive bar! Awesome bartenders and super fun and friendly regulars. Karaoke is awesome and they have lots of specials at this hidden gem!
In the midst of all the big franchises this is your  Wisconsin type bar, diamond in the rough, Linda  are bartender was the best, even bought us a drink, couldn't recommend it enough.

Dive bar in a nondescript strip mall in Schaumburg. I was nervous going in, but we did karaoke there on a Friday night. Great, casual, friendly crowd. Good bar food, decent drinks. We had an awesome time.
Had a great time. Great place to hang out. The karaoke is off the charts! Great place to grab a beer on girls night out!
The owners are amazing!!! So friendly and welcoming. Great food great drinks! Best music!!!

Best little dive bar in the area!  Karaoke selection is great (and growing!) and you can use your phone to sign up for songs and save your favorites, using their web app.  Low key atmosphere makes it easy to mix and mingle, by evening's end, everyone in the place is friends.

Don't know what all the negativity is about. This place is on point for Chinese. I order from here for takeout and delivery all the time and it's tasty, fresh and a good deal. Yes, the owners don't speak English perfectly and that doesn't mean they are rude. Nobody has ever been rude with me, maybe you're ASSumming bc of a language barrier. Obviously these guys being around this long says something. I've also had Chinese all around the area and keep coming back here. And will continue. Oh and they're not stingy with the fortune cookies with takeout orders either. 3 in mine! With order of 2 entrees.

Ho Luck how about No Luck,

The service was on par with their quality of food. AWFUL!!! I mean I'm not even sure that the orange chicken came from an actual chicken. Unless you enjoy suffering from an aggresive food borne illness for a couple of days then this is the restaurant for you.  Otherwise, eat at your own risk. 

The customer service was terrible. I understand if English isn't your first language and some people struggle with languages that are not native to their tongue but being a rude inconsiderate jerk is a quality that's universal and it has nothing to do with your learning curve. 

Having said that I will no longer do business where I do not feel appreciated and respected.

P.S. How are they still in business?

I like their Egg Foo Young, but that is the only thing I can recommend as a take out. 
Any older Asian restaurant that Candice has not reviewed in the NW burbs is likely not worth going out of your way for. I like hot, the menu description for the MaPo Tofu says hot, I asked for hot, not hot.

Not a fan of their "spicy hot" MaPo ToFu but if you like it milder their's is not spicy although the menu says it is. Good newz is it's not a salt bomb, also a spice. 
Not a lot of pork or much of anything else in there other than tofu cubes. 
Actually probably a good choice if your partner likes their Chinese mildly seasoned, and you can nuke it up with chili oil if you want or whatever.

Darkish dated interior is seldom crowded and you could have a fairly private "it's not you it's ME" dinner here. 

Reasonably priced, pretty fast, and conveniently located on your rush hour backup near Golf and Roselle. A-OK

First, the guy on the phone was rude as hell. Often expected at a Chinese restaurant. Maybe it's the accent. But I got there a few minutes early and he refused to take my payment until the food came out. He barked at me telling me I was too early. I was about 90 seconds early. Then when I asked for the red hot sauce, that all places give for free, he grunted and pointed to a 25 cent sign drawn in crayon. When I asked for some hot mustard he gave me ONE packet. Anyways, the food sucked. Worst sesame chicken I ever had. It was yellow. All sesame chicken I have ever had in life has been brown to red. The batter tasted raw. Perhaps that was due to the 90 seconds I was early. The meat itself was rubbery. I don't get it. I should have gone by the poor reviews. But I said, "hey it's Chinese food." Well this was indeed shitty food. These ho's are lucky there ain't another Chinese joint nearby.
I've been coming here for years and absolutely love this place. Never have had a bad meal. Owners are nice people and staff has been great.

I have eaten here for 40 years and the food is always hot and very delicious, the owner is kind, the waitress needs a attitude adjustment a bit, but the food is consistently good. Usually get fried rice, beef lo mien and chicken chow mien. It is awesome, ten times better than any Chinese in Rockford (worst on the planet) I don't know what everybody else's deal is but I know this is good stuff ALWAYS tasty and I can say that from experience!!
I order take out from here all the time. The food is good and the prices reasonable. It might not win any awards but this is good Chinese food.

My husband and kids stopped in and had a late lunch early dinner.

We ordered a lot if food!

Won ton was really good can't lie.
Egg rolls were good, we ordered the ones with meat.

The beef broccoli was alright, the kids liked it. 

The beef and gravy was good.

Pork friend rice was alright, I've had much better.

Over all it was filling, service was bad, someone took a crap in the waiters Cheerios.
Definitely not the best Chinese food I've ever had and my wife found a hair in her food one time. Will probably never eat here again.

Ho boy.

I mean... I guess the fried rice was good. That shouldn't be the highlight of my meal, by any stretch of the imagination.

We had a sesame chicken, along with some sort of an egg thing that's covered in brown gravy. 

Now, call me crazy, but of all the palettes of flavor for sesame chicken I was thinking of... "sour" was not one of them. But that's what it was... sweet and sour chicken, minus the pineapples, plus sesame seeds. Very strange. Not altogether offensive. Just... strange.

The Egg Foo Young was all right. I couldn't taste the egg, and the brown gravy was also tasteless. The tastelessness obscured whatever other ingredients were in it. Is that really how it's supposed to taste?

I have more questions than answers after eating here... questions I don't particularly feel like coming back to answer.

omg!!! can i say horrible!!! you dont even understand english!!  told you my address 10 times!! and still dont understand me.... i will not be ordering from you guys cant understand me how you gonna make my food!!!
I wish i could give this place no stars at all. Food is awful! Don't even waste your money, trust me!

Ho Gross! My friend swears by this place, so we ordered delivery. I had Kung Pao Chicken, which was really a box of white rice and cold, slimey, chunks of meat. The food was cold, the texture reminded me of boogers, and honestly there was no flavor. At all. Whatever the slime sauce was made of is a complete mystery! Was very disappointed and will not be ordering from them again.

Really good food!  The beef chow fun was super tasty.  The beef was tender, the noodles just right with bean sprouts & onions.  And you gotta try their fresh smoothies the mango was refreshing and another in my family had the watermelon/strawberry smoothie and loved it as well.  They could use more staff - the one day we went (Sunday), there was only one waiter doing all the work.  All in all, a good meal with less than standard service.
If I could get away with not putting any star there I would. The worst service ever. And the food is gross.

This is the worst Chinese food I have ever had in my life. I ordered Sweet and Sour Chicken because they didn't have Orange Chicken. The chicken was HUGE... Like the size of a chicken breast just breaded and dipped in sweet and sour sauce. It was so soggy and falling apart. My husband got fried rice which is said was bland and was greasy. I would never go back to this place if it was the last place to eat. Don't waste your money... Trust me!! Go to Yu's which is right down the street.

Hahahahahahaha. This place is a joke. It smelled like natural gas when we went in there and we were fearful that someone might lite a match. The food was gross and the waitstaff were cold and aloof.

Worst chinese restaurant Ive ever been to. Stay away!
Great food!! Their egg rolls are amazing! You'll never leave here hungry-their portions are huge!! The workers are very pleasant and always happy to see you. Even the manager will make deliveries!!!

This place has been around forever. Not much of a change of decor or menu besides their prices within 10-15 years. At least we all tested it already. If you're in the area and absolutely must have some Chinese... Well then go... You won't get sick.

Seriously this place has the same decor it had 10 yrs ago (yickes!). A long time ago this used to be a decent Chinese food joint - its definitely gone down hill since. I ordered crab rangoon to go and it was ready in 6 min. Other then that, it wasn't a negative experience but I won't come back here again.

This is an update review.
Tried their Dinner Menu with wife on a Saturday night.
We ordered the Egg Rolls as an appetizer and the were terrific. Loved their homemade sweet and sour sauce.Way better than the junk that comes in those packets. Their Hot Mustard was also made from scratch and has one heck of a kick.

We ordered the General Tao's chicken and their combination Egg Fu Young. Both dishes were plentiful. We couldn't eat it all and had to take a doggie bag home.

Loved the sweet/sour/hot flavors in the General Tao's and my wife loved the gravy laden Egg Fu Youngs (She always tries Chinese Restaurants Egg Fu Youngs First). 

Our waiter was "Aden"? His English wasn't perfect but he was attentive enough and there when we needed him. Kept our water glasses filled.

The decor was old Chinese style, my wife likes this old style and find's it "quaint", I prefer a more updated look so I took a star off for the decor.

Noticed a lot of carryout even though they had a dining room. People seemed to be locals, 

Room was conversation friendly. Quiet.

The drinks were cheap. A friend of mines sometimes goes in just for a drink. I also noticed people ordering carry out were also ordering drinks while they waited for their orders.

The food was generally around $9 or less per Entree.

Like another reviewer said, it was tough to find. In the mall across street from Mazda dealership on Golf, next to the UPS store.

Good Food, Cheap Prices, Cheap Drinks...Nice place for that Chinese Food Fix.
Dang Ho Luck! I had high hopes for this place. They have a full bar which is nice but the service is not so nice & the food suck!
I have gone here a lot.  The food is not bad.  The staff is really mean.  They mainly do take-out, so they don't really need personalities for that.

I love this place! First it's Msg Free and the prices are amazing for the amount you get. My favorite and continues to be is Shrimp with Garlic sauce I always get it super spicy and it's amazing! When you do take out you get cookies and they are delish not to sweet not to bland just perfect to dip in tea.

Ordered beef fried rice to go , it took 20 minutes to get my food which my lunch is only 30 minutes long and when I finally got my rice food was terribly bland, no flavor what so ever. 

Long wait time and food tasteless......will not be returning here

Just went here with my husband. I really wanted to love this place, as it's just within walking distance of our house, but we will never be eating from here again.

It looks like a crappy strip mall place on the inside, but I wanted to be won over, especially considering how cheap the sooner specials are. It took over two minutes from the time we were sitting at a table for someone to come out to acknowledge us- I timed it. The water that was brought out was not cold, and the glasses only half filled. They were unwilling to substitute steamed rice for fried, even for an extra charge, or allow me to order beef & broccoli, even though they had chicken & broccoli and beef & green pepper/peapods- first time I've ever heard someone at a Chinese place tell me no! (This leads me to believe their specials are frozen and reheated.)

They screwed up my husband's order, then asked him if he'd eat it anyway. There were no knives on the table. They brought our food out at different times. I had the orange chicken, the it didn't have the right flavor: WAY too much sauce, and the only place I've ever seen serve with celery and green pepper, not broccoli. My husband had the Mongolian chicken, which was mostly green onions with some v overcooked chicken. The egg rolls and crab Rangoons were so fried as to be uncomfortable to eat.

Maybe if we'd ordered this place takeout I'd be more forgiving, but the food is bland, the ambiance is nonexistent, and the service wasn't good at all, though it was quick.

I've been here twice in a month. The first time it was a 5-star visit with the best Peking noodles I've had since Yu's Mandarin. For those not in the know, these are a Chinese Korean noodle dish with a pork-based black bean sauce. The sauce was rich and the noodles were cooked just right.

The most recent visit the same dish was not quite the same. The sauce was not as rich, a bit watery actually. We also had the Korean version of sweet and sour which was too sweet and the pieces of battered and fried pork were very small. My son also ordered his favorite - orange chicken - and said the chicken was over-fried.

The seating area is small, but most of the business seems to run on carry out. Several folks came in to pick up their orders during both of my visits keeping the very friendly, efficient waitress busy between making sure our group of 7 was doing alright and getting carry out orders ready.

If you eat in, they offer free hot tea with the meal as well as a small cup of coffee
afterwards. Nice touch to stave off food coma!

I'll be back, confident the watery sauce was a fluke.

I always go to China House whenever I'm craving some Korean Black Bean Noodles. Hands down, best Jajangmyun in Chicagoland! The owners went on a brief vacation a few months ago, and my husband and I went through withdrawal. It was pretty bad on our end, but I'm glad they were able to get some rest to make some more kickin' entrees. 

They also have great tangsooyook, a fried battered beef lathered in sweet and tangy sauce with cooked veggies. We often order for pick up - one Jajangmyun and one Tangsooyuk to share. The portions are pretty generous, so we always have a great meal.

We were wanting some good Chinese food...we didn't find it here!  We ordered take-out which was very quick and the prices were reasonable, but the portions were small.  The owner/lady that took our order was very nice.  They must make their own egg rolls because they don't look like the basic ones you get at other places.  They were tasty but not very full.  We ordered hot and sour soup which had barely any taste and no spice at all.  It was almost an egg drop soup with some tofu, no mushrooms, no bamboo shoots or anything.  There were also no heat or spices in the kung pao chicken.  We will not be visiting again, sorry.

Great place; great food; great service. Jjajangmyun and jjampong taste great, these two dishes are comparable to, if not tastier than any of the other higher-end korean-chinese places around the Chicago-metro area. I usually get the half and half to get the best of both for an economical price.

Pros:

+ sweet, friendly woman working.
+ reasonably priced lunch specials: $5.95 for soup, egg roll, rice, and entree.
+ egg rolls were surprisingly good!
+ good somethingandLemon tea.
+ perfect portions!
+ small and quiet.
+ orange slices and fortune cookies after meal.

Cons: 

- cannot substitute tofu for chicken lunch specials.
- vegetables delight is the only vegetarian lunch special option and it was absolutely tasteless. I was confused and disappointed.
- egg rolls have meat in them (is this common? I didn't know that). how ironic that they give me a meaty egg roll with a vegetarian dish.
- the oranges didn't have flavor either. 

The meal probably makes or breaks your experience -- my coworkers/friends/fellow Yelpers enjoyed their meals. I did not. I also have a bit of a cold so perhaps that affected my taste buds. I would consider coming back only for my lunch break, but the the non-lunch specials were kind of pricey and I prefer other places.

China House is amazing - go at lunch time! The lady working is super duper nice and parking is abundant.

They have lunch specials at a great price but their Korean style Chinese food is really where it's it. Problem is the menu is ALL in Korean for this section, no translation. So you have to be Korean or be with someone Korean to decipher what's on the menu. I was telling my friend today at lunch that it's a shame they don't have English translations. I'm sure they would have more business if they did because their Korean style stuff is fantastic!

I shared the Beef Tang Soo Yok (Korean style sweet & sour) with my friend for lunch today...the portion is just the right size for two people to share. The sauce is much lighter in flavor and density than the standard sweet and sour you're used to from Chinese restaurants. It douses all of the meat completely, no skimping on sauce here. The meat is soft and perfectly cooked with perfect breading. The breading is ever so slightly less dense than the normal which makes it feel slightly less fattening. To top it all off, this dish has sliced, soft apples soaked in the sauce. Such a nice surprise and a great way to spice the dish up!

Bring someone Korean and go to China House! Or bring some cool translator that can snap a photo of text and then translate, bam!

For those in the know, Chicago has a lot of Chinese restaurants that are owned by Koreans - China House is one of them. There is a list of common dishes written in Korean that typically aren't listed on the normal English menu. The dishes can be described as Chinese with a Korean influence.  

We ordered the sweet and spicy fried shrimp (kan poong seh woo) and the black bean/peking noodles (jja jjang myun). The shrimp were large and crispy. There was more breading in comparison to other places but it was still good. The noodles were okay but for only $6.95, I wasn't complaining.

Even though Yu's Mandarin and Chef Ping are my favorite places for Chinese Korean cuisine in the area, it was great to enjoy a quiet dinner without the long wait, fancy interior, and added costs. For the two of us, the total bill was only $21.  I'll be back for takeout. 

I know it sounds odd but go to China House and order off the Korean menu for something new.

Food was delicious, jajjangmyeon on point. Waitresss was super friendly and recommended a vinegar and soy mix for our chicken which made for a very tasty combo. Inexpensive but definitely not lacking in taste. Really nothing but a happy experience.

I came here with Laura N. and Alicia K.  for the awesome $5.95 lunch special.  It came with egg drop soup (which was a bit tasteless), and egg roll (yummy and I don't usually like egg rolls!), rice, entree, and a lemon tea (a great way to warm up on a chilly winter day).  We decided to dine in since the lunch special does not come with soup or tea if you do carry out and as I mentioned before these were necessary to warm up!

I ordered the Kung Pao Beef with no peanuts on top.  It was yummy and spicy, but they put a lot of celery and water chestnuts in it so I had to pick some out.  As I mentioned before the soup was lacking so I had to add some salt and pepper to the mix!  I did like that you could order the food without MSG since I get horrible migraines from it!

The interior of the restaurant is definitely a take out place.  It is plain and cold looking.  But as I mentioned before you have to dine in for the soup!  I also was turned off by the fact that there was no bathroom.  Luckily, I didn't have to go... but with tea you never know!  The lady working was super friendly and wasn't bothered by my special dietary requests (ie no peanuts and no MSG).  They do not take Discover Card.  I would probably rate them higher for carry out services!

PROs: Friendly staff, Inexpensive menu, Delicious food, Korean dish available

CONs: Small dining area

The CON is not much a big of a deal because their food is AMAZING! And their customer service is GREAT! I went here mainly for the korean dish and for the price, it's unbeatable. I've ordered take-out and they gave me extra noodles in my order (Jajangmyun) and a hot tea while I wait. I would be glued to their korean tv channel that would be playing on the background while I wait for my order lol.

I would literally drive out 45 minutes just to eat from China House.

Ordered a Combination Fried Rice, Egg Rolls and Large Sweet n Sour soup. Combination fried rice was most rice it lacked flavor and salt. Egg Rolls were super grease was missing meat component and Sweet n Sour soup tasted like water mixed with egg it was disgusting. Worst experience eating Chinese food ever. I'm sad to write this but it's the absolute truth I would stay away or try and be a witness to what I'm talking about.

General Tso's Chicken that I had ordered was just a sticky gloppy mess, was not spicy has it should be either had some egg rolls that tasted like a fried toilet paper tube. Wasn't what I had expected.

Next day General Tso fought back and won that battle...

Non-low price and lengthy wait but they will give you some tea to drink and a couple magazines to read while waiting I don't think it's worth it to to return.

Fate- don't want to go here again. Had stomach ache twice, one after eating meal and one after eating leftover.

Sz8- doesn't mind the shrimp noodles. Didn't get sick from it.

For the non-low price and the extremely long wait (though they have tea & magazines to make the wait more pleasant), don't think it's worth to return.

Since last year this is the only Chinese restaurant I order from! Their food's really good and to top it off the prices are cheap! I also love that they have korean dishes. 

The people that works there are so nice!

I don't go here for the Chinese food, which is your typical variety of choices.  What really stands out here is their Korean style Chinese food, as the place is Korean owned.

Very good jja jang myun (black bean noodes) and probably one of the best places I've been to for beef tang soo yok (Korean style sweet & sour beef - they don't serve it with pork).  The pieces of beef in the tang soo yok are very crispy and the sauce is really good.  The sauce also has thinly sliced apples in it, which I've never seen before.

At the end of the meal they also serve complimentary korean tea or milk coffee.  Prices are reasonable and the Korean/Chinese style food is awesome.

Pro Tip:  The food is much better during the day, since there's a different cook at night.

We've been looking for a new chinese spot because we moved to a different part of Schaumburg and we gave this place a try on NYE before going out. 

The most basic thing one can order - fried rice - was just awful and was very dark. Maybe they burned it a bit? 

The crab rangoons were tiny and lacked crab, cream cheese, and "rangoon"...whatever that is. 

Ordered a few entrees: General Tso's chicken and chicken and shrimp w/water chestnuts. The Tso's was okay - sweet and spicy, and the shrimp in the other meal was doable.

IDK, I just wasn't as pleased with this spot as I was with my old spot, China 1 (check my review). This place doesn't even deliver.

Guess I'll keep looking...

We love China House! Ever since we moved into the Schaumburg area, this has been our go-to Chinese restaurant ever since we were referred there by a friend. It's in a little strip mall behind Village Tavern, since it's kind of set back we never really knew it was there. The food is generally phenomenal. My favorite is the Mongolian Chicken. It is literally the best I've ever had. My boyfriend always orders the orange chicken and he's a pretty big fan of that too. The fried rice is yummy as well. I also love that in addition to the fortune cookies, they also tuck a few almond cookies (my fave!!) and a few veggie potstickers in with your carry out. We have also eaten at the restaurant and they bring you a tiny bowl of fruit after your meal which I think is charming.

I ordered from China House today expecting to come on yelp right after and write a glowing review, but I was somewhat disappointed. The orange chicken was good as usual, but I also ordered kung pao chicken, which was just OK. A little on the bland side and definitely not spicy at all as it should be. I also ordered the egg drop soup which was TERRIBLE. Honestly it had absolutely zero flavor and actually was a little greasy. Just gross. Tonight was the night to impress China House.... you missed the mark and it cost you a star. I have to assume that it was just because I ordered 30 minutes before closing time, because they have never let me down before. I will definitely continue to go to China House, just no more egg drop.

This place is GREAT!!! I found it when I had gone to Marella's Cucina, only to learn it had closed :(
So...I love Chinese, remembered seeing this and decided to give it a shot.
First night, I had Pepper Steak-aka Beef with peppers---but :( no tomatoes.
Delicious, reminded me of Yu's...
But...that night-there was an issue with my leg-asked and learned that they use Oyster Sauce. Now, I have never been "officially" diagnosed as being allergic to any type of seafood...I just have never liked it. And NEVER EVER will!
(had to get that out-for all those who have told me that I don't know what I'm missing or that I'd grow out of it).
But, myyyy, it was good.
I had another taste the very next night-asked the very nice girl about the oyster sauce and she confirmed my suspicion.
Anyway...delicious...
Great service, very yummy food...
Schaumburg DOES have great Chinese Food restaurants...

Ordered egg foo young and tofu family style for carry out. Both were excellent. I appreciated the 4 veggie potstickers on the house. Downsides were the long wait on the day we ordered and the fact that the egg foo young patties were smaller than average. The gravy was different--a dark-colored mushroom-flavored gravy--but I really liked it. Will be back.

When we ordered food from China House restaurant, we expected it to be phenomenal, based on all the wonderful reviews it got.  We were VERY disappointed.  We ordered the shrimp fried rice and orange chicken.  The rice was a major letdown.  It looked and tasted like it had been burnt.  It was dry and too starchy.  The shrimp were also dry, too big, and seemed too chunky when paired with the rice.  

The orange chicken was decent, but the appetizers that came with it, the crab rangoon and the vegetable egg rolls, tasted old and rubbery.  We actually ended up throwing away a lot of our order!  I don't know why the quality of food was so awful.  Maybe we caught them at a bad time?  It's not like we ordered during the lunch or dinner rush.  Maybe they're under new management, different from the one that got all the praise .....

I give this place two stars, a star more than what they deserve, for the "extras" they packed into our order, like vegetable pot stickers and cookies.  They were free and not as bad as the other food, so that's a plus.  

All in all, China House probably has the worst tasting fried rice EVER and their food just seems to be sub par.

Last minute take out order or Sunday dinner.  Pot stickers were fantastic, and Orange chicken was jut right spicey.
I'll be back again.

OK so this is one of the only places open on a Monday which is great the bad part is the food has no flavor which means i will not be eating Chinese on Monday ever!  Ill order Chinese on Tuesday when 7 Luck is open:)

I love Chinese take-out so when I heard this place was cheap, and in my area I knew I had to try it. I got the chicken in garlic sauce lunch special which came with fried rice and an egg roll. The total was $6.60.

The food was just alright and the portion was pretty small. Fried rice was one scoop and the main entre was lacking in the chicken area. Everything was still flavorful though. When I went to eat the egg roll, I noticed all of the grease/oil that had dripped off of it. Upon further inspection, the garlic sauce for the main entre was pretty greasy too. I would have preferred to have an extra helping of the fried rice instead of an egg roll. 

The food was decent but I don't think I would go out of my way to stop here again.

this is my FAVORITE place for jjajangmyun.  I dont really get anything else from here... actually I only come here for the jjajangmyun.  For me, their jjajangmyun is much better than most places around the schaumburg area.  My mom orders catering from here time to time.  I would come here more often if it wasn't so out of the way.

I could really care less about their decor but for the people that care: definitely a hole in the wall place. Very small and poorly decorated with a small crappy tv in the corner always playing some korean game show. 

this place definitely got a special place in my heart.. It was the first place my boyfriend and I came to eat over 4 years ago.. and i got stung by a bee inside o_O
I was VERY unimpressed with the tiny portions for their dinner specials. The rice tasted off and the quality was sub-par. I will absolutely not be returning.

My boyfriend lives in Schaumburg and we're always looking for "hole in the wall" type places.  He's heard about China House from his co workers.  At first he was unsure about the name, he only knew it was on Wise Rd.  So after doing some mapquesting and googling, we found out the name and address.  

This place is awesome.  We will definitely be ordering from here again.  He had their Mongolian beef and he loved it.  It was seated on top of those crunchy white noodles, delish.  I ordered their sesame chicken--which is also spectacular.  That was also on top of those crunchy noodles ( i don't know the name, but they are sooo good!!)  They were so kind to give us 3 cartons of white rice also!

For appetizers, we had their fried potstickers and crab rangoon.  Their crab rangoon is delicious!  Perfect portion of filling to wrapper.  I usually like to dip it in sweet and sour sauce, didn't even need it.  Now for their potstickers, they offer you steamed or fried.  I like mine fried.  But most places will only fry the flat side.  I like crunchy foods--esp potstickers.  This place deep fries the entire thing so it's entirely crunchy!!  That was the dealbreaker.  Definitely going back again and trying different selections!

The worst Chinese food I've ever had! I ordered the egg drop soup, which was totally tasteless, not edible at all. Shrimp with vegetables came with egg roll and a fried dumpling stuffed with meat-both were disgusting. Everything came with greasy fried rice (I asked for steamed). The only edible thing in this meal were the vegetables, too many chestnuts and bamboo for my taste, no enough fresh steamed veggies. Fried egg roll and dumpling were too greasy, and had more fried stuff than anything else. We also received a bunch of sauces and a fortune cookie. Sauces (sweet and sour, soy, mustard) were full of preservatives and other chemicals. Even the fortune cookie was horrible and tasted bad! I never knew that's even possible! Probably because it was made of stuff hard to pronounce, and yes-preservatives! When I read the menu I found out they can leave the msg out per request. That gave me the shivers, eek! We were hungry and had no time to get anything else, so we ate some veggies, shrimp and rice. That meal left a really bad taste in our mouths and a stomach ache later. Waste of money! When you walk in to that place it looks like a dump, and it is!

Let me preface this review with the fact that I am Chinese. When you come to a restaurant like this, you should not expect full authenticity. There are reviews here citing the fried rice as lacking or less than good. Whether or not thats true is the worst litmus test for a Chinese restaurant. I won't really get into why, but believe me, try something else and you will enjoy it.

The General Tso's chicken is so good here. I know; it's not authentic, its covered in sauce and deep fried! How could that be good? Could you just be a little less pretentious you darn foodies and just eat something delicious? It's crispy, tasty, tender, always hot and they give quite generous portions. 

They also have a sweet and sour chicken or pork with a white sauce instead of orange. It's tangier and a bit more interesting. I really enjoyed it. I believe it is the Korean-Chinese style sweet and sour pork. 

One more deep fried goody thats better here than anywhere else. Crab rangoon. Dear God, the crab rangoon is always fried perfectly. Crispy and creamy, not too salty and of course great with sweet and sour sauce. 

I know, I get it, you're thinking this Chinese guy has some vendetta against his own kind. That he doesn't love roast duck, salt and pepper pork, cow liver or chicken feet. But hear me out a little longer.

The noodles. THE NOODLES. I'm telling you man, you want the noodles. If you don't want any of those entrees I said before, you want the freaking noodles. Get anything with noodles. Seriously. Anything. You will love it. You'll think, why would I order fried rice when I can have noodles? Why order anything else? The jajang mein, the hot seafood soup, chow mein. I don't know what else. Just eat it okay? And when you're full and happy and the cute Asian server comes by to clean up give her a smile and a nice tip cause darn it they put good effort in the food and want you to enjoy it.

Also if you really don't know what you want to order just ask! It can't hurt.
Do not order food here. No taste and ingredients missing  from what's stated in the menu, small portion for a large. Worst ever. Stay away!

Nothing here really stands out.  Its good because it has Korean style Chinese food but bad because its only okay tasting.  When I do go here once in a blue moon, its only because its close to my house but usually I find myself driving further to either Yu's or Golden Chopstick for Korean style Chinese food.  Bottom line is, why go here when theres much better.

On Tuesdays they have 5 for $5 hamburgers and half price cheeseburgers. I ordered cheese burgers yesterday and they forgot the cheese on them.  They got everything else right though!  haha. Any how, I called back and got great service, instead of just reimbursing me for the cheese or just giving me a free burger in the future, they gave me 5 cheese burgers to replace the 5 I ordered that they forgot cheese on.  Very happy about this great customer service!  

I am also happy because I asked them to mark the burgers so I know what is what and they made sure I knew exactly which was which when I got my order. Very great customer service here!

Usually have great service. Today my sandwhich felt like salt was poored on it. Nasty. I asked for apples instead of tator tots and they still gave me tator tots. Bad breakfast day.

Usually i get a great breakfast but not today
Been to this location many times, and have always had a good experience. good food, great staff

Usually I go to Sonic and have a great experience, except recently I went in and had a tater tot experience from hell. I went through the drive through and ordered 2 orders of sweet potato tots, a milkshake, and some onion rings. The cashier asked me if I wanted ketchup and of course I said yes.

I get home, open my order, and to my surprise, only white tots!!! And no ketchup! ahhh!

I call them up  , and they tell me they dont even have sweet potatoes anymore. Wow. Why did I not know about this sooner?

I have eaten here before and had pretty quick service through the drive up window. I just went on a Saturday night at 6:30 pm. I ordered a double cheeseburger, tater tots and their boneless wings, They said the boneless wings would take 7 to 9 minutes There were only two car in front of me. It took about 15 minutes. They apologized for the long wait and gave me a coupon for a hot dog and a drink. The food was good.
We literally waited 30 minutes for a shake, blast and cheese curds. We pay otherwise we would of just left
First time here so many yummy options couldnt decide spent 15 dollers ordering all different sides  so good the car hops where so friendly  and nice and the food was great and tasty

Great shakes and icees. They have the half price happy hour when you can get cheap drinks. Tuesdays you can get 5 burgers for $5.95 and the burgers are decent size and they had no issues with me changing what was on each.  Their jalapeo poppers are good.  
We went on a Tuesday during happy hour so we got cheap drinks and cheap burgers!

This Sonic has the joy of being less than a mile from my house.  I have been here a few times, but they have yet to really WOW me.

Especially since they have a drive-thru, yes.  Which is nice.  But they don't ever have drive-thru times.  For example, I just stopped during their "happy hour" to get three milkshakes--one for me and two for the kids, and I was in the line for 15 minutes.  What?!  I would have just canceled my order and left if I hadn't been stuck between the cars.

So the food is A-OK, but the service time is dragging.  It's not actually "fast" food if it's not "fast".

I love going to the Sonic Drive-In for several reasons. First, this particular drive in appears to be well run. They are extremely efficient (we always go to the drive in stations), pleasant, and have always gotten our order right. We enjoy being able to listen to music or read out loud to one another while we eat- and a drive in offers a perfect opportunity for that as you are not going to disturb any other patrons. I also love the Sonic Drive-In because they have more than one sugar free option for soda- I love their Diet Lime Limeade. The burgers are delicious, they have great fries and sweet potato tots- and my husband loves their Ice Cream/icee dessert. We will continue to go to this restaurant when we are looking for a good burger and a quiet meal together alone :) However, it is a fast food joint so your healthy options are limited!

Its official, Sonic is not worth my money.  Every time I have been here either part of my food order is cold, the wait is forever in the drive-thru, and last night when I asked for nuts on my sundae, they acted like I was crazy.  Plus, they were out of fudge so I had to settle for chocolate syrup and they barely gave me any.

I used to remember going to Sonic as a kid and loving every bite... either my palette has evolved or the chain is just not up to par anymore.  

And people who give this place 5 stars for a slushy alone?  That isn't worthy... a good establishment should have good food all around.

just moved to the area, and when i found this place, my heart skipped a beat. Sonic is like the chupacabra of all fast food restaurants! I always saw commercials but never knew where I could find one (other than aurora, and I used to live NW chicago).

I'm a sucker for corndogs, which I always get. I can pair this with a jr. cheeseburger which lets me try a little bit of everything, since these items are on the cheaper side of the menu.  While the food is okay (as is most fast food) the real stars are the drinks

Their drinks are just delish (I love the blue coconut cream slush). They have some really good milkshakes too! I opted for the banana shake with hot fudge mixed in.  Love that they can flavor any soda- green apple sprite? yes please!! This place is perfect for those hot summer days where u just need some refreshments to stay hydrated

Saving the best for last, they open at 6am but serve the full menu ALL DAY LONG! This is so great since I work night shift and sometimes want a hearty meal at 7-8 am.

the chocolate peanut butter shake from sonic is my favorite shake in the world!!!!!!

i also love the footlong chilli dog but i only get it on rare occasions cuz it makes me sick and throw up everytime i eat it ;)

Restaurant Review
Drive thru check! Personally I have had great experience at Sonic in the past especially with the groupon package deal. We ended up getting the bacon cheese burger which was significantly better than McD, tater tots, mozzarella sticks, drinks, and even a banana split. Service is quick and all you have to do is press the button to order more. One piece of advice would be come during the summer months, I can't imagine eating here now that it is starting to get cold.

Pro- Unique dining experience, average price

Con- No dine in seating which makes it difficult in winter months

Hidden deal-
Combo meal deal
Daily happy hour drink specials in the afternoon

Ok I usually don't give reviews on true fast food places (I just don't)  well at least not knowingly. My friend and I just wanted a cool treat as a last hurrah to the summer...it was super late and Sonic was open....

I have never been to Sonic in my entire life and had no interest in ever going but they had ice cream! So on we went....our treats were so/so...

But the 4 stars go to the really nice gentlemen who worked the drive thru! He was funny and awkwardly (when I say awkwardly polite he was like textbook polite but maybe a little socially awkward-like his momma taught him right but he needs a little more time to make the manners his...made it more confusing? Well he was a very nice young gentleman)...he looked like he was fresh out of high school or in high school, he was even more polite when we changed our order when we got to the window to pay...he let us change our order with no issue, no attitude and no problem....


Would I go there all the time, no since I am not generally a fast food junkee...but in a pinch for a quick treat...YES....



Thanks Sonic Drive thru guy :)

First time there. son wanted ice cream so wife and i took kids there for ice cream. I have to say it was really good. Now they need to keep the outside cleaner. to sit there and eat to dirty and really with little work could make it must better and probably would take kids there to eat on nice days but just to dirty.

I really wanted to give this place at least 4 to 5 stars. But i wasn't really satisfied with my meal I had the croissant dog which i was excited to have cause it looked good in the commercial. Once I got my croissant dog it wasn't even in a croissant it was a wannabe croissant bread it didn't even taste like one and they put way too much mustard on the croissant. My nephew had a hamburger and they put too much mustard which is ridiculous how much mustard they put on the burger.

So, I noticed that the new Sonic Drive-In opened up in my town and I was like YAY a Sonic!  I had tried the Sonic brand of food fare at the Sonic in Bartlett and was like "meh" could be better.

Tonight, I decided to try one of their foot long coneys.....mostly for the novelty. :)  Plus, I had tried one of their burgers and wasn't impressed.  I also tossed in a side of their famous cheese tots to see what all the hubbub was about.  Complete my meal with one of their equally famous cherry limeades and that was my meal this cool Sunday night in Streamwood.

Well, the foot long, was....okay.  A bit messy to eat, but thank God for the tray they put it in cause I'd have had it all over my lap if I tried to eat it without the tray!  I'd rather go to Portillo's down the street to get a "great hot dog".  It may not be a FOOT LONG, but at least it will taste awesome! Sorry, Sonic.

The cheese tots tasted like your regular ol Ore Ida tater tots with a slice or two of Kraft American Cheese melted on them.    I kid you not!  Nothing special.....with or without cheese...sorry the power of cheese did not save you little tots. :( Sorry again, Sonic.

When I was all let down I tasted the cherry limeade.....maybe it would lift my already meh experience.....YAY! It did!  Cherry Limeade ROCKS!  I'd totally get it again, though easy on the ice though, half of my cup was filled with their little pellety ice cubes....I was sad there was no more cherry limeade left. :( *sob*

Anyway, it seems like Sonic is "just another fast food restaurant" except their drinks are awesome and they have skating carhops! :)  I will go back, but probably only for the drinks...maybe a malt or a slushie next time?

This review is only for the food.went there on the doller hotdog night.lgot the hotdog with everything no peppers.a ok bun no tomato little mustard onions and relish and a small average hot dog.not very good they did have good service.if I payed full price I would give 1 star.skip the the hotdogs get the drinks only.
Basic functional fast food quality burgers will do in an emergency nothing special. Great Carmel chic malt though and we got our meal in about 2 minutes

Good customer service, friendly staff, and fairly quick, but there food quality has gone wayyyyy down! This used to be one of my favorite fast food restaurants. It always delivered on quality, but after having it this weekend, I think I'd rather go to McDonalds. Sonic, what happened? I'd advise against getting their new pretzel dog, it was dry with no flavor and the hot dog was rubbery.  Their chili cheese fries that used to be oh so delicious were a soggy flavorless mess. =[ so disappointed!

Hmm.  

Hot dogs aren't all that, nor are their burgers.  There are better fast food burgers out there.  At the same time, I like that you can take your time in your car in deciding what you want before you order it.  They have some desert items and like other fast food chains, a value menu.

I guess for late nights of fast food cravings, this is a spot for corn or chilli dogs in the burbs, especially at some weird hour....

At last.... Sonic has arrived in my town. Today marks the inaugural day of Sonic Drive-In in Streamwood. Having opened a few other locations in the northwest and western burbs I was happy despite the 30-40 minute drive to get my fill of their fare. Now that they're closer? Fare thee well toes, I shall miss the sight of thee. My waist shall be laid to waste. My belt? Torn asunder. Oh happy day, thy name be Sonic Drive-In. 

I sit here on my couch, sipping on a cherry limeaid slush and grinning like a damn fool. And why? Because not more than 10 minutes from my house I can go get my tot on. I can get my frito wrap on. I can get my ridiculous chicken on texas toast sammich on but most important I can go get my slush on.

Oh Sonic Drive-In. Delicious little vixen on the corner of Barrington Rd and my dreams.

This is the worst sonic I have been to. There is almost always something wrong with my order or the food is cold; this is on top of horrible wait times. My son also got food poisoning from here. 

It is worth the extra drive to go to the sonic on 59 and Stearns.

If I could eat this food every day, I would. But alas, my waistband is screaming in resistance. Staff is really nice, and food is promptly made. I give 4/5 stars because the parking lot is wonky and will probably be overcrowded come summer.

Definitely one of my faves for their Strawberry Limeade drinks.  What a refreshment!  Their Sonic burgers are good, and we have tried their different styles of hot dogs.  Recommend getting tater tots instead of fries.  The pull-up and order service is great now that you can pay at the stall from your car.  The server sometimes comes to your car on roller skates.  But the other thing we use a lot is the drive thru, when we are on the run.  Fun place to eat.

Ok after all those commercials for their hot dogs - I was finally able to come here. I wasn't too impressed but I think I would visit again. I enjoyed the fries but the hot dogs which I had the Chicago style was ok... it wasn't anything you can't have anywhere else. I enjoy the concept behind it but that would be about it. Superdawg is way better for hot dogs.

Finally had a chance to taste one of their hotdogs...after watching all those commercials on TV...I had to come and see what all the rave was about..I had the chicago style hotdog...it was good...not the best..had a bite of the double cheeseburger and it was sooo yummy...a lil too messy but good...I loved their fries...resonable prices...not bad at all...hmmm might come again...

Great food but a long wait in the drivethru! I went @ lunch and there were only 3 cars ahead of me and it took 20 minutes! One car left.  Be prepared to wait. They will give you a coupon for a free item if you wait long enough. Maybe they need more employees?

Can you say food poisoning?   I have eaten the bacon cheese burgers several time before, no problem. But yesterday I got so sick! I was up all night running to the bathroom. I never had a worse experience at a fast food restaurant. Not going there amymore.

A friend recommended this restaurant and she did not steer us wrong! What a great cute little neighborhood place - loved it from start to finish. It is an interesting mix of classy dining and sports bar. Our waitress was really good - friendly, knowledgeable and attentive without being overly so. We had a nice table by a window and were happy that the music wasn't too loud so we could talk. My husband was happy that he could watch a game on t.v. from our table. The bread was warm and delicious with the olive oil and parmesan cheese for dipping. We started with the special appetizer - deep fried smelts - and they were awesome! Perfectly cooked with a nice marinara sauce on the side. Huge portion - glad the 2 of us were sharing. My husband had the caesar salad and I had the house salad. Both good, although I think I would get the caesar next time. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have risotto, but the entrees we picked were delicious! I had the portobello stuffed ravioli with sun dried tomatoes in a cream sauce and my husband had the spicy sausage rigatoni. We were so stuffed from the appetizer, bread and salads that we took a bunch of our main course home to enjoy later. Wish we lived in the neighborhood so we could come here more often.

Cucina Casale is a fancier restaurant located in downtown Itasca.

I came by for lunch and there were not that many people here.  In fact, we may have been the only table being served at the time.  Cucina Casale has a nice clean interior with white table linings and all the traditional Italian settings.  Bread is served with olive oil and cheese.  The woman serving us took our orders and may have been the only person working at the time.  The traffic may have been slow but the place was kept neat and attention was paid to every detail.  

From what I can remember I believe I had a Ahi Tuna style sandwich.  It was amazing.  I have never had Ahi Tuna served that way.  I wish I had captured the menu as they don't have any formal listings online.  They have a large offering of Italian dishes from pastas to sandwiches to pizza.  Others with me had pasta entrees and they came with a salad and your choice of dressing.  

There is a bar area and the dcor is focused on golf with some loose connections to Chicago sports.  There is one television.  

Overall, Cucina Casale is a nice restaurant for lunch but may be better for a fancy dinner.
After 20+ years, I will never attend Cucina Casale again, without a written apology. !!!!
Amazing food! Highly recommended. We had a private party and the service was amazing. Met the Chef, and now I know what 26 years of experience tastes like. We'll be back!
Just wondering why no web sight or a full online menu . Can't order if don't know what they have .

Great place for a wonderful home cooked meal.  Food is well prepared and portions are good.

People who live in the area seem to frequent the place which is always a good testament to the service, menu, food, bar.  

Not able to get here much as I don't live in the area, but it's my go to place for a decent meal while in town.

Great little Italian place.  Casual enough to go with coworkers for a lunch, but dressy enough for date night.  Small seating area with virtually no privacy, so just expect that to start with.

Warm bread and a house salad were delivered well in advance of the main dish, which was good because we never felt rushed.  Risotto with chicken, mushrooms & red peppers was immensely satisfying.  Quantities of everything were more than enough...no one at our table was able to quite finish their whole serving.  The only thing we needed at the end of our meal was a nap!!!

I did feel sorry for the cute waitress who was working solo...looks like she would have welcomed another waitstaff person on the floor because it took us about 10 minutes to get our check taken care of because she was busy taking orders from new customers that had just walked in.

Overall, a very nice place that we will visit again.  Also - nice decorations for the 2012 Ryder Cup...too bad the US blew it!

It's rare to find a superb, reasonably priced and (relatively) authentic Italian restaurant in the suburbs. This is one of those things. 
It's a shame that this place does not have a web presence or even lists their menu on their facebook page. Thus, I cannot cite the individual dish names that we ordered below.
The starter was a fresh bread dipped in the cheese & olive oil. The cheese wasn't that great but the bread was.
Next we had an appetizer that was similar to a bruschetta but had goat cheese and kalamata olives on a softer bread. Very good choice and very well prepared.
The soup and salad course brought a very large caesar salad for her and a beef tortellini for me. Her salad dressing was a bit too skimpy on the anchovies for my taste but she loved it. My soup could have had a few more actual tortellini and less vegetables but overall was above average.
We both had a mozzarella-rich baked rigatoni. Hers had spinach and diced tomatoes, while mine had sliced filet (which was a the special of the day). I can't believe, nor could the waitress, that I ate my whole plate. This dish was the clincher for me to return to this eatery. The waitstaffs' attentiveness was noted as well, as during conversation she learned of our date night, and brought a baggie of ice with my mrs's leftover dish so it would keep in the car.

I like this place.  It reminds me of the mom and pops on Tailor St.  

I agree with another reviewer that it's not very private.  It's a place you go with 4 people and everyone gets full.  

I ordered the roasted red pepper gnocchi.  It was a little richer than I would have liked, but still good.  I can't say too much on the food b/c I had one entree there.  

I'm looking forward to trying more of their food.  I'll definitely be back.  I live in Elk Grove, so this mom-n-pop Italian place appeals to me.  We usually do Schaumburg and it's mainly corporate restaurants.  This is a nice change of pace.

I'm not sure what has happened at Cucina Casale but last night's meal was not up to par.  We started with an appetizer special; polenta with grilled shrimp and goat's cheese.  The marina sauce was chunky and OK and the shrimp were sizable and grilled perfectly.  The polenta was flavorless.
My entree was the asparagus ravioli.  It was covered in the same marinara sauce as the appetizer.  I was very disappointed in the ravioli as they did not taste homemade at all.  I left a third of my dish and decided not to take it home.  My wife ordered bow tie pasta with shrimp which was one of their regular menu items.  She wasn't impressed either.  The pasta and sauce had an odd flavor.
Although there were only 4 other tables occupied in the restaurant and 2 outside on the patio, the food was VERY slow coming out of the kitchen.  I can't fault the servers for the slow service, I think the backup was in the kitchen.  Additionally, they have "changed their wine service" so they had no wine list.  When I inquired as to whether they had a California red Zinfandel, she said they had one.  When she brought it over, I'm thankful that she said it was $67.  Uhh, no thanks.  So we ordered their house Pinot Noir which is out of a jug and not very good.
I'm not enjoying writing this review but last night was a $93 disappointment for a restaurant that we used to enjoy dining at.
Cute little Italian restaurant. I've been twice and both times the food was good. The dishes are decadent and saucy.

I was left a little confused, here.

The food was great, but we were apparently misinformed about what the restaurant actually is. Or something.

See, we've gotten pizza from Cucina Pizza plenty of times. It's great. Their take-out menu is full of delicious-sounding pasta, sandwiches, appetizers, salads, etc. And the Itasca dining website makes it sound like you can just wander on into the restaurant and order any of their delicious food.

So we stopped in for dinner, expecting it to be a sit-down version of the takeout counter. Apparently, it's not.

We were given fancy menus full of $18 pasta dishes and specials like risotto with filet mignon. There's a place for that sort of dining, but it wasn't what we wanted or expected. So I asked if they had a pizza menu -- the kitchen is the same, after all. We were given a sheet of paper apparently from last year's Octoberfest, with a few sizes of pizza, a list of toppings, and a few appetizers. Not, mind you, the same appetizers as on the pizza side takeout, but fancier things like crostini with goat cheese, calamari and oysters. 

So we went with a large half sausage, half cheese pizza, expecting to get some bread and make it a simple dinner. I don't know if the waitress was too busy yapping with the patrons at the bar -- the only other customers in the place -- or if we just were not apparently worth her time, but it took quite a while to get refills and I had to ask for bread. The bread itself was just fine, good fruity olive oil and a nice garlic-herb butter on the side.

And the pizza is delicious, in my opinion, at the top of my thin crust list. (Oddly, they cut it pie style and not party style like they would at the carryout counter. Whatever.)

But we were sort of disappointed by the highfalutin' atmosphere and the somewhat indifferent waitress who just didn't seem to care about our piddly little order. I was hoping for a place to be able to dine in with their delicious pizza and appetizers, but apparently we'll have to stick with carry out.

Pizza is always great. My family and I love to go in and order a nicer meal once in a while. They always take care of us and the service is very quick! Im a girl scout leader and any time I need a donation they are always willing to help and take care of our requests! Family restaurant thats been in the town for decades, love it! Next time you go have sime gelatto! It's awesome!

Great little Italian restaurant in the heart of Itasca. Great food not too expensive. Drinks are fantastic. The bread they bring is incredible. You definitely need to give this place a try.  Service is right on.

Our friends are regulars here, and introduced us to this place!  Now my husband and I LOVE it.

The drinks are generously poured, the meals are piping hot, and the service is not to be beat!

Good points: Pretty much everything!!
Risotto of the day: Always delicious--always what my husband has gotten
Chicken: Tender and juicy
Farfalle w/ shrimp-HA-MA-ZING.  Might even be better the next day!
Minestrone Soup: Flavorful with big chunks of potatoes and veggies. A+++
Bread and whipped butter comes with every meal
Calamari: To die for!!
Bruchetta: Seriously amazing.  It comes HEAPING with ingredients, and the bread is nice and crispy.  Plus, it's only $3.95!!  I could eat it as my meal, it's that amazing!
Mixed drinks: VERY generous with the alcohol, so be careful if you're the driver!
Ambiance:  Awesome!  They had a live performer yesterday, Vito, who is this funny little Italian guy.  Non-obtrusive and hilarious.  Overall feel of the restaurant is laid-back-romantic :)

Bad Points: Not too many
The parking lot is kinda small
The prices can look high at first, but let me just be honest--I no longer want to go back to Olive Garden after my real Italian experience here!!

If I could give this place no stars then I would!  My sister and I were here for lunch last Thursday during her work-day.  She had been there before and service had always been quick and the food decent.  Our experience was a complete disaster this time however.  We arrived by 1215 and there were probably a total of 10 tables seated with various sized groups.  There was ONE waitress for the entire dining room, the bar, and answering the phone.  We sat ourselves and waited 15 minutes for water and bread.  The waitress dropped the bread off so quickly that we had no time to tell her that we were ready to order.  My sister got the cheese ravioli, so that she could use it to also feed her 17-month old son that was with us, with marinara and I got the "special" chicken risotto.  Both meals came with soup or salad and we both choose salads.  The salad was wilted and had brown pieces throughout that I had to pick off.  There was also only enough dressing for a few pieces of lettuce.  I had to wait another 10 minutes to get the waitress's attention to get more dressing.  People from other tables were getting up from their tables to chase her down for condiments.  My sister had to get back to work by 110PM.  By 1250 we still had no meals.
