We asked the waitress for our food and she proceeded to ask what we ordered.  Then said "Oh that's right" as if she didn't even place our order yet.  Twice she tried to give us another tables food.  Three tables sat after us got their food before us.  Finally, we asked her to just box the food because we needed to leave.  However, it was still not ready even though it was already 1PM.  By 115, with my sister now late to work, we got up from our table to get the waitress's attention and just pay for the side salads we had eaten.  My 17-month old nephew is luckily a very good boy and was only fusing a little even though he must have been starving as we had been giving him animal crackers and bread to keep him appeased.  When we got up to pay for the salads, our waitress plopped our food down in front of us all bagged up and ready to go and handed us a bill for the full cost of the food.  Not having time to fight with her, we paid the bill and took the food and left.  I dropped my sister off at work and took her 17-month son and I back to my home in Mt. Prospect.  We were both starving when we got home.  I opened my $13.00 risotto to find that it was over-cooked, mushy, much much to garlicky and had barely ANY of the ingredients described on the menu.  It was supposed to have roasted red peppers, mushrooms, chicken, and peas.  There were minimal of each and the mushrooms that were there were cut so thin you truly couldn't taste them.  I had to dig for chicken to feed my nephew and I something other than the mushy risotto drenched in garlic.  I ended up eating very little and giving my nephew yogurt instead and throwing out the entire lunch.  The fact that they charged us full price for this experience in which we did not even get to enjoy our lunch in the place we had ordered it is ridiculous!  That is just terrible customer service and the food was gross anyways!  It is obvious that our waitress placed our order much after we had ordered it.  When someone makes a mistake, it would be nice for them to admit it and maybe understand that charging the customers for their mistake is completely unfair.  My sister was barely able to eat her food throughout the rest of her busy day at work.  We paid for a lunch we didn't even get as ordered!

Well, we went for dinner but left a bit hungry.  We ordered appetizers and drinks, and the bruschetta was fantastic.

However, when we ordered our pizza we were told we would have to wait 45 minutes because the cook had too many to go orders.   We had already been sitting there close to an hour.  I cant imagine that you'd tell a diner they had to wait because there were too many to go orders.  Had they offered to buy us a drink, we might have waited - but instead we left.

Quick update...after a couple lunches, we tried dinner here with another couple tonight. The bar was filled with locals...that I know and love!  We literally walked in to find three Itasca-an's that I've know since I was a kid. It's a great place for the locals. 

At 6pm on a Saturday night, we were the only ones eating dinner. Presented again with the delicious, warm bread but this time with a garlic and herb butter. My girlfriend had a Restaurant.com certificate. My hubby realizing that we should really give this local, independently owned restaurant a little more cash told me to order a couple appetizers. Good thinking, hunny!  They were the real highlight of the meal. 

The food:
Calamari was a nice portion with a chunky marinara sauce. Crispy. Really good. 
The prosciutto with roasted red peppers, capers, olive oil and cheese was enjoyed by the guys. I didn't try it, but it was suggested by the waitress and according to the guys, it was very tasty. 
The soup was worth going back for...large chunks of veggies, not mushy, perfect pasta and a smooth broth. 
My hubby went with the penne, a spicy tomato sauce and a side of meatballs. He thoroughly enjoyed it. 
My girlfriend ordered a mushroom and chicken dish. This included potato wedges. The chicken was a hit with the sauce...the potatoes were a flop.    
Finally, my buddy and me both ordered chicken Parmesan (not on the menu). I ordered mine well done. Mine did not arrive well done. The waitress did take it back with my request to throw it under the broiler. When everyone was done eating, my food returned. Well done cheese as requested, mushy breading on the chicken and unappetizing penne with tomato sauce. Truth be told, I took two bites and I was done. It was a disappointment. 

Drink refills were ignored until requested. It was just a rough meal. 

I will likely go back for lunch again and probably pizza. It seems to be what they do best.

I've been to Cucina Casale twice. The first was for pizza. The second was to take a large group out to dinner. The pizza was okay...nothing to write home about. The second time, the meal was expensive and not as good as we would hope.
Long wait for meal and service was mediocre. Food was passable, not recommended.

Okay, here is what the owner of this establishment needs to do, get his/her cheap a** in a car, or hop on Metra since it's right next to his joint, and go to just about ANY pizza restaurant in Chicago to learn how to make pizza!  He would learn that they do not use  guv'ment cheese like he probably does.  He needs to spend more than 25 cents a pound on cheese for his pizza.  I grew up in a crappy little Illinois river town in the 80's and Cucina Casale pizzas taste the same as Sam's pizza in Lacon, Illinois.  Thanks Cusina Casale for ensuring there is no reason to think there is a decent restaurant in Itasca.

My friends PJ and Erin are regulars here and have been telling me how amazing there food was for a long time, and boy were they right!!!!

Their food is amazing!!! We started off with their bread, which was so soft and came to the table HOT and FRESH!!! For dinner I ordered cheese ravioli, and these were the best ravioli I have ever had! They were huge and filled with a lot of cheese, I also got minestrone soup with my meal that was yummy!! I  tried their French fries, which were crispy(a must for me).

The wait staff was very friendly and always made sure we had everything we needed the whole night!

I cannot wait to go back and eat there!!!!

This place was very good.  I had the clam linguine and the white sauce nand I left very happy.  The place is very small but nice.  They offer tae out as well and pizza. I I will definitely be back.  It took a while to get the check be other then that I had a good time there.  I had 2 other friends with me as well and they both enjoyed the food as well.

Have fallen in LOVE with their Margarita Pizza. Find myself craving it! The staff is also very friendly. My only problem is sometimes the crust is a bit soggier than I would like. That's the ONLY reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5. Great pizza. You must try!

Don't bother with this place, stopped going here awhile back when every order we placed for lunch was never ready when we went to pick it up for carry out.  The dine in menu is totally different and you have to know there is a "secret menu" to get basic pasta dishes, how silly.

Very nice little Italian restaurant. I recommend the Calamari, its excellent. Make sure you ask for marinara sauce, because it does not come with the appetizer. Which is ridiculous, but once you try it you will not have a care in the world!

Love this place! Recently moved to the area and it's our go-to for take out when we are in the mood for Mexican food.The ground beef tacos and quesadillas are always delicious. The taco salad is also good. The staff is always friendly over the phone and in-person even when the place is very busy.

Stopped here for lunch with my sister and her husband. Very authentic place. Lunch time saw a fair amount of hispanic patrons which was a good sign. The salsa that came with the chips has some depth and thought given when constructed. Nice! Had the pastor tacos very flavorful with cilantro and nice tortillas. Very modestly priced. Excellent taste and large portions for the price. Sister and hubby enjoyed their lunches. Service was good. Place was decorated rather plainly but that doesn't mean anything. The clincher was the horchata. Just right, no chalky taste, not too much cinnamon or rice taste, slightly thin. Very authentic. Worth ur stop.
The tacos are to die for. I haven't been impressed with the dinner plates so stick with the tacos. But overall great, great food, great service, great prices. We eat here regularly.

I am disappointed as a regular, tonight when I phoned my order I expected the same awesomeness I'm used to. The food lacked flavor and it was not portioned well.  I am not sure if there's a new cook but something has certainly changed....

This has to be one of the best quality Mexican food in Elgin. Surprisingly, good Mexican food is hard to find in Elgin for a good price. We feed 5 people with like 35 dollars (1 steak burrito, 2 steak tortas, 7 tacos).
Love the food here and they are super kind there as well. The service is great.
Great food for a great price.  I usually do take-out but have eaten there as well. Service can be a bit slow but the food is always worth the wait.

Recently opened - your average Mexican take-out place.  They do have a few tables so you can eat there as well.  We called ahead for pickup last night  to give them a try and the food was ready in 10 minutes.

We tried the nachos with chicken, a chorizo gordita & a dinner dish called "Alambre con Queso" - which was steak with bacon, green peppers, onions and cheese - very good & the steak was perfectly seasoned and tender.  The dinner came with beans and rice which were decent, and also tortillas.  The menu did not say it came with tortillas but it makes sense that it would.  Since I didn't know it was included they gave me corn tortillas so if you prefer flour you will want to specify.  The nachos and gordita were also good.

Prices were in line with other local Mexican take-out places.  If you are familiar with the small shopping center at the corner of Chicago St (Irving Park) & Shales - this place is located in the spot that previously housed two different, short-lived, pizza places.  I hope this place makes the cut!
Slow service ever second time I go their their food is awesome but need pick up the paste

What a pleasant surprise. For many years we've passed this diner at the crossroads of Arlington Heights Road and Higgins Road in Schaumburg. In all of those years, we've looked at it, passed it by, wondered if we should go but never did - that is until today.

After stopping at a local market in the same parking lot, we decided to give Rose Garden a try. The reviews looked good, so we went in. When you first enter, you are greeting by their refrigerated display cases showing their wonderful looking cakes and pies. It reminded me of living in Connecticut many years ago where this was standard for all diners. The hostess seated us right away - the place is much larger on the inside than it appears on the outside.

The menu is also huge. Pages upon pages of items from breakfast to full several course meals. Daily specials are listed and extra daily specials are given to you on a separate laminated card. Prices were very reasonable and everything looked good. But I remembered in the reviews I read about how large the portions are. Well, the reports are true. If you order a full meal, be sure to ask for a doggie bag ahead of time.

They serve warm freshly baked rolls first. A la carte at this place means it comes with a cup of soup. (What they refer to as a cup, I call a large bowl.) It also comes with cole slaw and another side - in my case fries. My choice was a small turkey club. The turkey was hand carved, fresh, tasty. The lettuce and tomato were plentiful and fresh. All in all - the food was excellent.

But, food is not all that makes for a good experience. The service was also outstanding. From the hostess to the server to the bussers, all were friendly, helpful and extremely capable.

I don't know what it would be like here on a Sunday for brunch. I imagine it would be crazy with a long line. This is certainly somewhere I am sorry we have not tried in the past, but will certainly go to again.

My 2 lady friends and I come here a couple times a month.  We love it.  We have never had bad service and everyone is always so pleasant.  Even though the Rose Garden Caf is like "any other Greek restaurant" it's not.  Any Greek restaurant always takes longer for greek chicken and it's worth it here. 

We always get our bread basket and iced tea right away.  That ties us over while we read the specials of the day and the large menu.  You name it they have it!  Soup always comes with my meals and I always order the Cream of Chicken.  It's so good and you can buy it by the quart, pint, and gallon.

Last year is the first time I spent holidays without family.  I spent Thanksgiving here with 2 friends and you couldn't ask for anything better.  We had the whole Turkey Dinner without the clean up.

We love the big portions we get here.  We look forward to taking leftovers home.  I ordered pork chops once and was shocked to see 3 huge pork chops on my plate.  I ate 1 and took 2 home.  My friend orders salmon all the time and it practically hangs over her plate.  That gives her 2 more dinners during the week.  

I wasn't too crazy about some of their desserts but I had their apple slice and that was pretty good.

Not good at all.
Cleanliness: 0 ( ants on the table, seats dirty, silverware so old that you will think it was bought in a flee market)
Ambience: 0
Food: 0
Service: 0
Price: not good, with a few more dollars you can go to a decent place.

I was underwhelmed by the 30 minute Athenian 1/2 chicken. It was dry. Besides that, my mother wanted a side of pasta,instead of rice,with her dinner and was told she could not do that. What's the price of a side of pasta? 5 cents? Hope that was worth me never patronizing your establishment again.......

If I dropped down from the sky into the middle of this restaurant I wouldn't know which Greek coffee shop I was at. This has the same bakery case as many of the others.  The food selections are similar, and the coffee keeps coming, just like the others.  One nice thing about this place is the portions are ridiculously HUGE for the money.  I'd go back any time I'm in that area because I like these kinds of places.

I had a fantastic meat lovers skillet with two delicious pancakes. Our waitress was great. We sat there for nearly 2 hours just chatting and they never tried to rush us out. As lunch food was being served it all smelled so good! And all those cakes in the front...hopefully next time if I'm not so stuffed!

1st time I've written a review here but have been here for breakfast, lunch or dinner more times then I could ever remember.
Whenever we're back in Chicago it's a given that if at all possible that it must include a stop at the Rose Garden.
The warm and friendly owners and staff, always consistently great and always what I expect. Many of the staff have been there for years contributing to this no doubt.
They also have a party room for events and meetings up to about a 100-150 guests. My wife and I actually had our wedding and reception here. Food and plated service for our guests was smooth, well coordinated, and delicious.
Rose Garden is a winner!

Once is definitely enough ...

It should have been a sign when the waitress was quick to take away our bread basket when we ordered breakfast (it was evening time). Tip: I'm fine with not having bread when ordering bfast but  wait to see what customer is ordering, THEN decide whether they are  bread-worthy!

Food was mediocre and on the greasy side. I will agree serving size was pretty decent but think I'd rather have a small portion of something delicious than a large portion of something that's just "eh."

People were nice. Room is your typical family style restaurant with outdated naugahyde seats. Unfortunately food was a disappointment.

I am very disappointed and upset with what happened to my daughter and I tonight. We have been patronizing Rose Garden for 20 years. My daughter has had graduation parties there for my grand children! I loved the service and food.
Tonight my daughter and I had dinner there for my birthday. She ordered "from the kids menu" the chicken and fries because she didn't want to eat much.  This is something she always does. Well when it was time for us to leave the waitress came over and said "He (the owner) said next time you cannot order from the kids menu"! She was so embarrassed to tell my daughter what he said! My daughter said then tell him to put it on the "adult menu" I HAVE NEVER GONE TO A RESTAURANT AND BEEN TOLD WHERE WE COULD ORDER FROM ON THE MENU!! I'm angry and very upset over this. The waitress and my daughter were embarrassed! As we paid he stood there by the cash register watching us!! My family has been a customer there too many years to be treated like that just because my daughter ordered from the "kiddie menu"  Well I won't be going back there again and my daughter is taking her business else where for our family parties!! 

What kind of owner would treat his customers like that?! You don't have your waitress/server tell your customers "don't order from kid's menu again!" Where is your class? Take that up discreetly with your servers what your policy is!

Stopped in for breakfast while having my car serviced across the street. Place is clean and service was top notch. Had an omelet with the only positive being its  sheer size. Fairly bland and it really tasted of liquid eggs, so I might have saved on my cholesterol numbers since my taste buds didn't get much. The potatoes were basic hash browns without even a hint of home made which I believe the menu claimed. Basic diner coffee. Five stars for service, 2.5 for environment (a bit warm) and one star for food = 2 stars.
Good food and prices. The service was fast and outstanding. Big portions for a low price.

They have the best cream and chicken of rice soup around.  The prices are just right and they always make sure that the customer is always happy.  I will never have anything bad to say about this excellent family restaurant.  Excellent service, excellent food and excellent experience.  I have been coming here for over 10 years.

They certainly give you a LOT of food. And the menu is enormous. Very hard to choose. 

I don't really like the one free refill policy. That's a little stingy. 

I've had really good sandwiches/gyros here and also mediocre steak and potatoes. Always go with sandwiches and soup in my opinion. The servers are very animated and friendly- very typical of Greek restaurants i think ;) they are enjoyable

We go to Rose Garden pretty often.  As has been mentioned in other reviews, the serving sizes are ridiculously big.  The prices are reasonable and I don't think I've ever had BAD service.  Some of the servers aren't as friendly as others, but that doesn't bother me and I don't consider that bad service.  The food makes up for any server issues.

If you get an omelette, be prepared for the size of it.  It takes up more than half the platter. It's actually funny how big it is.  I've never met one of their omelettes that I didn't like.

As far as the one review about the servers talking about hating kids, I'm not to fond of them either.  Especially when you are trying to enjoy your meal and chat with the people you're with and people don't watch their kids and let them run around or let them just sit and scream.  That's not a server problem, it's a parental problem. Sorry.

I'm happy there are still a few restaurants like this around.  They are getting fewer and farther between.  You can get great soup or salad, an entree that's too big, and side for a good price. Don't hesitate to give it a try!

Pretty good food, the only reason they get 4 stars is depending on who you get the service can be bad.  Some people only give you one refill on pop while other give unlimited for free.  Some servers can take FORVER.  BUT they have the best cream of chicken rice soup ever and almost every day!

Just picked up a large carry out. Realized that I was over charged for every order. Called and was told the reason I was over charged the $.65 to $.85 was because they charge $.25 per take out container. Then claimed that the new menus they just handed me were not their current prices. Paid $12.00 for a ham and Swiss sandwich. Not worth the money!

We stopped in for an Easter breakfast, they were quite busy but still received good service. This is your typical Greek family restaurant, all around good food at a decent price. I was surprised by the portions you do receive, they definitely don't skimp with the food. We all left happy with our food, no problems!
Gave a try TWICe.  Each time service lacking and food mediocre.  Pass it up

Had the rose garden pita club and is was delicious.  This place give you a ton of food for the price. Soup, bread, fries, sandwich,  and free refills. The turkey was fresh and the fries were hot.  I will be back again for lunch

Have been going here for a few years with my fiance. Huge portions, great service and flavored creamer.  Yes,  not just the  usual half and half..I'm talking Irish creme and french vanilla. That's what brings me back. .amongst other things, especially the cream of chicken soup. I think they beat Big Top...and that is a show stopper. Not to mention the bread basket that has crackers and bread sticks galore...andddd Texas toast..fabulous.

Grabbed a quick dinner last night at the Rose Garden Cafe. It looks like a family run business with the family working here. The menu here is HUGE, it took me a few minutes to look over it all. There's something for everyone. I ended up sharing the gyros platter with my dad. The prices here are extremely reasonable. For $10, we were able to have enough for two people. We were too full for dessert, but for an additional $2, we could have had dessert. Service was excellent as well, which is why most people here seem to be regulars! 

Good for: cheap eats, Greek diner

Huge portions.  If you order an omelette, be ready to eat - and you can order them any time of day!   This is definitely an old-school Chicago area restaurant with excellent food and a friendly, familiar staff.  Their soup is incredible and the servers are on point with coffee, water, everything.
Me and my family ate our meals 3 to 4 days a week at this location .We could clearly see the quality of their food going south. We no longer dine at this location.

I am only well versed in their Mediterranean salad w/gyro. They have a really good  mediterranean dressing, choice of creamy or vinaigrette. I usually get both. Gyro meat comes with sauce as well. I feel like the salad portion looks big, but it's a lot of lettuce, I would like a little more topping and a little more gyro meat.  If it wasn't for the dressing, I would probably try something else. A definite pro is a bread basket. Garlic bread, rolls, breadsticks. Holla.
Everyone at the table always seems to like their food, ranges from skirt steaks to fish, and we're all choosy eaters. The servers and hostesses are very nice. I will be back because it's a convenient location and tasty.

Stopped in for a quick breakfast.  The menu was great. Omelettes are wonderful and huge, friendly and prompt service!  Would definitely
 recommend and come back again!
This place is so cute and reminds me of the diners my parents took me when I was a kid. It has a very good feel, food is consistently good, and the prices are great.

I met a friend there yesterday and we had a pleasant lunch.  We needed an 'in the middle' spot from both our homes.
Clean, efficient, friendly, all good... And a coffee pot on the table ... that's worth a star alone!!  Our waitress was a joy, very attentive and enthusiastic.
I haven't been here in years, I'd eaten there dozens of times when I worked nearby and kind of forgot about it.  
Extensive menu made it easy to find something and the cream of chicken soup was very nice !! 
Nice to have rediscovered it.  Only disappointment, I wish they had wi-fi since I often enjoy lunching out and taking care of some correspondences.

I have being living in the area for 24 years now and Rose Cafe has been a Great Place to each over the yrs a few times a Month at least....The Prices are Great and the food is good as well...The only down fall to this Cafe' is the service over the yrs it seems to be getting far worst each time and after tonight I have to say will be my last time for Rose Garden Cafe...I placed my order and 16 mins later still no food I just ordered a Burger the waiter comes by grabs the bread basket and say are u all set I'll get your check..I'm like I'm still waiting for my FOOD !!!...He runs to the kitchen grabs the Burger and brings it back at most it was luke warm at most I was not in the mood to send it back as I have been waiting alreay close to 20 mins now!!!...So ate it and got the bill went to the register and paid (No Tip) the lady at the register asked how everything was I told her the service was Bad she was shocked and didn't know what to say the other lady came by and asked what happened I said the service over the yrs has really gone down hill I Thanked her for many years of service and said this would be my last time coming here as it was time to find something new with better service....So if you are looking for good food and great prices and BAD service this is the place to come to for your meal....Otherwise I think you can find a better place to eat with better service...Over all Rating for this cafe....B for Food / B for Prices / F for Service....

On our adventure to see the Elk Grove Village elk, we stopped here for a quick lunch. I liked that they play Sinatra. Can't beat that with a big stick. The dcor is rather odd. There are lots of statues, figurines and pictures of pudgy chefs in the tall chef hats. Well, it is a restaurant, so ok, I guess.

The food was ok, but nothing special. I had the soup and 1/2 sandwich combo. The soup was shrimp bisque. It was very thick. I added a bit of cream to try and thin it out. The tuna sandwich was ok, but I felt the tuna needed a tad more mayo to tone it down a little. Christopher had a patty melt with chicken noodle soup. The soup was good and the sandwich was large. He said the flavor was ok. 

The women's bathroom was a hoot and a half. It is a large, single stall bathroom, and the entry to the stall is framed by huge gold and white columns. Talk about a throne room .......

I wasn't overwhelmed by Rose Garden Caf, but not for any specific reason. It isn't bad, but I doubt we will ever be back again. If one lives in the area however, it might be interesting to try the breakfast menu.

I would have given this place 4.5 stars if it weren't for the fact that the servers are anything but friendly! I went in with a friend and brought my two sons along. When we sat down I looked over and heard a server say "I don't care how cute they are. I hate kids!" And the entire time we were there she would roll her eyes every time she walked past us. Our server had absolutly zero personality. She never once cracked a smile. We were sitting at a table right by the kitchen entrance. And also right in front of the bathroom. An odd place for a table. The food was very good. I got the creamy chicken and rice soup. Delicious!! I would have loved to make this place a regular choice for my family but due to the cold and unwelcoming atmosphere I don't think I will be returning.

Poor experience  here two weeks go. I went out to lunch with coworkers, and had ordered online 15 minutes beforehand. The waitress was older, and extremely  rude about the fact I had an order waiting already.  The salad was decent, but she forgot my dressing and I had to ask the waitress  who begrudgingly  got it for me. The bread as stale  and hard. This waitress never refilled our waters.the check out is one by one at a csh register in front fo the door-slow, in the way system. I have no desire to return.

Just had my daughter's baby shower!! We had a breakfast buffet, food is great and the service too,! Don't be afraid to ask them if not on the menu! Our tables were all ready just to come in and do all our decorations!!
Thanks Alex ( owner ) & Nicole  thank you

3 stars for broad menu, excellent soup, and very attentive and courteous service - 

Could have been better - we had been on a plane from Florida and met family the for breakfast - 1130am.  Kitchen must have been thrown off by our breakfast order, but one scrambled eggs were undercooked, same for omelette - had to ask for coffee refills 

Not likely to return - too bad used to be a favorite
This place is great.  They have  awesome cream of chicken rice soup. My favorite meal is the hot Turkey with mashed potatoes.   Its my favorite family dining restaurant.
I absolutely love this place. Everything I've had from here is really good and the staff is wonderful. I've had everything ranging from their breakfast, lunch and dinner.

RGC is a long time personal favorite. Their cream of chicken rice soup is without equal in the area and they serve some of the best pancakes I've ever eaten. Staff is friendly and the menu is more than reasonably priced. They do pick up a lot during the lunch hour, even on weekdays, and Sunday mornings can get very busy, so be aware of your timing when heading over. They are quick to accommodate large groups without an issue.

The hubby and I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Rose Garden Cafe!  We only come here for breakfast and its amazing every time!  We recently went this weekend, and I swear they doubled our food portion...which was fine by us!

Their breakfast prices are great for the portions you get!  I always take home leftovers, which is enough for me and sometimes the hubby to eat the next day!

I usually order the feta and spinach omelet (which is delish), but this last time I ordered the Portabella, Cheddar and Onion Omelet (which was the size of my head), and it was so yummy!!!  It came with hash browns and pancakes! So good!  My husband ordered the two eggs with bacon, toast and hashbrown...he somehow got double the bacon he ordered, which was okay with him! (He has a rule: LNBB (leave no bacon behind), so there were no leftovers from his plate!

The service has always been good for us, and it seems like a genuinely nice, family owned restaurant.  There is plenty of parking as well!  

If you want a good, inexpensive breakfast (under $20 for two people), then I would defiantely check out the Rose Garden Cafe!!!

This is my third time eating here. It's hard not to love this place. They give you a basket overflowing with 3 or 4 different types of bread. If you order a dinner you get soup, salad, and dessert included with your meal. Not to mention the menu has a lot of options. Breakfast is served all day. Also the service is outstanding. I am a server myself and I think nikki is a phenomenal waitress. I would give her five stars alone!
Very dirty sticky restaurant. Food is inexpensive and OK but overall condition and cleanness of the restaurant restrict you from enjoying it.
Food is mediocre, and price is basic. Decent place to casually meetup with a friend for brunch.

Pretty standard diner-type place here.  Their menu is gigantic and the prices have always been pretty reasonable considering the He-Man sized portions you get.  The omelets are delicious and huge and my favorite ingredient is the feta (I believe they use imported feta only).

It's pretty typical in every other aspect: busy on weekends, fast service, average coffee.  Ask for the bacon crispy otherwise it'll come out all flippy-floppy which is no bueno for me.
I had the meat lovers skillet and it was great. Plenty of food. They had a lot if things on the menu that I wanted to try. Nice place. The cake in the front looks delicious.

I've been by here many times while I would go to Tensuke market.  The place always seemed to be busy but I never bothered.  I went here for breakfast and it was really good.  There isn't the mega selection of items on the menu, but it is still quite vast.  

I had the bacon and cheese omelette and they gave me the option of cheese (America, Cheddar, Mozzarella).  I had mine made with egg whites and it was quite large.  There were plenty of hash browns and they gave the pancakes on the side.  My friend had the corned beef hash with eggs over easy and really enjoyed it as well.  Along with our cups of coffee, it barely reached $20.  

The service was stellar as the coffee was constantly refilled and our orders were taken in a timely manner and check brought out toward the end.  They also have a basement for a banquet room and they have an elevator so anyone can go there.  There's plenty of parking on the side or in front, so I'll definitely come back for another meal!

I ordered a chopped steak.  Received my order and they gave me a hamburger patty.  Asked for manager and he was very defensive and insisted it was a chopped steak.  Anyone can tell the difference between a hamburger pattie and a chopped steak.   I lost my appetite on his rudeness and they had to the nerve to charge me for what I ate.  POOR  management!  My friends chicken breast was dry and didn't enjoy it.

I'm not quite sure what to think of this place to be honest. 

FOOD: Decent food. Portions are extremely generous and generously priced as well. Although nothing out of the ordinary, its not bad food either. Menu is LARGE, they had everything from Italian to Greek to American comfort foods. This made it confusing what to order since I didn't know what would have been their 'specialty'. I ordered baked chicken and the rest of my party ordered various things which I took a few bites out of. They might have been all homemade but they didn't taste homemade from scratch. It was all very 'satisfactory' to the point where I feel like you could get the same flavors from a pouch or can. 

SERVICE: Really good service. Friendly and speedy. Our waiter remembered everything by heart... extremely impressive for our party of 10! He even went out of his way to make sure we had a specific flavor of creamer for our coffees. 

ATMOSPHERE: This was rather confusing too. I couldn't figure out if I was at Grandma's house or in an Italian home or what. Probably didn't help with the Halloween decorations. Although I do give them props for being festive for Holidays. Slightly stuffy feeling inside but it was okay. 

OVERALL: Almost felt like this place needed to be on Restaurant Impossible on Food Network or something which is why I am a little bit indecisive about this place.
This is a good place to grab a bite for breakfast.  The food is very good and the portions are also good sized.  The place is usually pretty busy but the service is good enough to make up for it.

I wanted to give this place 5 stars and I've been here a couple a of times.  Breakfast is excellent!  Lunch....meh.  for $10 I got a tuna on croissant with soup and fries and a pickle.  I opted out of the coleslaw.  The fries were cold and the croissant tasted days old.  For a $10 lunch I expected more. I could have gone to Jersey Mike's and spent less. I did see that they have kids eat free on Sundays for dinner after 3pm though.  I'll be back as I love their soups I just think they are expensive for lunch and I wasn't impressed.  I'm so longing for a good family restaurant or some new in Elk Grove Village.  Sigh...

Walked in here for breakfast with my 3 year old last Sunday. We got seated right away but the server seem like she was too busy and had to wait for 15 minutes before she greeted us just to let us know that she wasn't ready to take our order. The meat lovers skillet I ordered said on the menu that it came with cheese but what i ended up getting was mostly cheese and it was pretty horrible. Not only did it have too much cheese but also the cook had inserted the core of an onion in the skillet. I pointed this out to the server and she said she would mention it to the manager. Well after leaving my skillet uneaten due to the core of onions it had and all the nasty cheese I approached the manager and she said that I am supposed to eat the core and that everyone loves cheese. She told me that she had been in the business 16 years as the owners and that she did not care if I did not return since she has plenty of people that do. She also threatened me to call the cops if i did not leave because the restaurant was busy and she did not have time for me. This is the worst dining experience i have ever had. Needless to say i will never go back!

What a cute place! I have driven by here so many times and I finally had a chance to stop in. What I call your typical "mom and pop" family restaurant. I had breakfast and it was brought to the table super fast and we were super happy! I'm not out in these parts too often, but it's nice to know I have another place I can add to the list when I want to meet my parents (who are from the burbs) for breakfast!

Rose Garden Cafe is a decent restaurant. I was looking for a local family friendly restaurant and found this place through Yelp, where they have decent reviews.  

During the heatwave of 2012 we stop in and there is little AC in the place.  The manager or owner says the compressors on the roof are shutting down from the excessive heat.  They offered us a seat in the basement where they have a small banquet area.  Very nice of them to do and it was /so/ much cooler down there.  

The service was okay, I don't think the staff was crazy about walking up and down the stairs so much.  

I had Grecian Pork chops which were tender and taste okay, though I have had better Grecian flavor other restaurants.  My wife had the a chop steak with grilled onions.  It wasn't bad, but there was not a lot of seasoning in the meat.  She says the outside was pretty good.  My son had the fish fry.  The batter was so-so, though the fish inside tasted pretty good.  My younger son ate kids ravioli which he really didn't care for much at all.  He did eat all his shrimp bisque soup and bread before, so perhaps he just wasn't that hungry any longer.

All and all, a decent place, we will be back to try new things out and perhaps find a new place to frequent.  The cost of the food was around $13 bucks a meal for al'acarte, add a buck or two for a full dinner.

This is one of those mom and pop diners that has a menu that somehow has everything on it. From breakfast served all day to hamburgers and club sandwiches to steaks and seafood. 

Everything is just kind of alright. The bread service is nice but nothing special. The soups and salads are fine, but nothing you'll rave to your friends about. 

I stick with either a hamburger and fries or some pancakes and bacon. Prices are decent and you get a good amount of food. If you're in Elk Grove Village and you want to sit down and have a decent meal in a nice atmosphere this would be the place to go.

Fast service, huge menu, typical diner food with a Mediterranean slant.

I had the grilled chicken kabob with fries and it was good although the inside of some of the chicken seemed borderline done.

The side salad was good and when I requested a vinaigrette I got bottles of oil and vinegar.

I didn't try the dessert. Pretty standard/average but better than fast food.  I was in town for business and it was not bad.

Rose Garden respects the Greek diner basics.  Crispy hash browns?  Check.  Gorgeous layered cakes?  Check.  Friendly service?  You got it, hon!

The portions are mammoth, and if you are here with the kiddies, you can serve their little pancake appetites with your sides alone.  The skillets could use a little more seasoning, but that is the only real complaint we had at our table for five.  The coffee and the morning love from the great wait staff kept coming, and so did the customers on a busy Sunday morning.  This is a great family place that will serve you up a breakfast to last you all day.

Server was not friendly at all. Felt rushed during order process and felt I was a bother if I asked her for anything "extra". Had an issue with one of our meals, was never apologized to. Sever seemed apprehensive to even take the meal back. I got dessert with mine. Paid the extra $1 to get a slice of Caramel Pumpkin Cheesecake. It caught my eye as soon as we walked in the door. The piece of pie I got was old and dried out. The caramel wasn't even a caramel consistency, it was dried and crusty. When we went to pay, I showed the cashier the slice and she offered to swap it out. Tall, thin middle aged woman with long dark wavy hair who usually runs the register refused to swap out the pie and bc the newer one had yet to be served. I old her the slice I got was old and crusty yet she still refused to swap it out. I told her to keep her extra $$ I paid for the upgrade and that I would NEVER be returning. Horrible Experience!!!! Never again!!!!

Nice atmosphere, we came a little late but they were nothing but happy to seat and serve us. Just my girlfriend and I she went for breakfast that was a Denver Omelet the size of the plate. I went for dinner with the Reuben. Very tasty. Cheddar soup was OK. Nothing to write home about. I was wishing for the chicken rice. All and all not bad. The waiter we had was super efficient and not overbearing. Tasty. We will go back again. Nice menu selection too.

Been here a couple times.  Most recently for Thanksgiving.  My family met here without us one holiday last year, spur-of-the-moment thing, and really liked it.

My wife and I came to check it out a couple weeks back and had great service.  Today, not so much.  Everyone can have an off day.  But it was more than that.

First, the good news: food was very good for this sort of place.  But t was evident early on that our waitress was perturbed and short on patience.  She just gave off a bad vibe.  Immediately we all felt like we were walking on eggshells with her.  She was terse in her demeanor and made us all edgy.  She rushed us to order, about 10 mins after we arrived, and we went with it.

Salads and soup came out, but they'd seated us too close to the table behind.  She broke cardinal rules #1 and #2 of good waiting by first asking who ordered what, and then handing us plates and asking us to pass food around.  Again, we went with it.

So out come our meals a short while later.  We really didn't want to be rushed, but the serving pace was like diner speed. OK.  Again, we took a "let's get thru this" attitude.  Here's where things take yet another turn.

Two of us ordered NY strips.  I ordered mine charred.  Well the waitress wasn't keeping track of the orders, she was just CLEARLY disinterested in the bothersome details. She was still asking "OK, so who ordered this, who ordered that...  So she gave my steak to the other person who ordered a strip.  Of course, I didn't know I was going to get the wrong order until she handed me a plate (YES, she's still passing around plates, only this time they're dinner plates - I nearly dumped a plate of hot juices on my lap).  The mix-up (due to her indifference, not honest error) quickly became apparent.  I sent my steak back and waited about 10 mins to get it back.

The check came so fast, we barely had an hour at our table.  The final insult was when the waitress told me "oh no hurry, I'm not rushing you" BUT THEY WERE STRIPPING THE TABLE AS WE SAT THERE!  Taking all the plates, silverware, etc.  That's a good tipoff that they want you out.  Awful.

Lastly,as if that's not enough, my cousin and her husband had stopped by during dinner just to say hello on their way to their own engagement.  They sat for a minute at an empty booth next to the bus station with my sister in law, and the BUS BOY (I kid you not, the friggin' BUS BOY) gave them real attitude about it.  He was grabbing things off that table, glaring at them.  It's not even like HE was sitting there.  He wasn't.  He was just, well, being a jerk.

I don't think we'd give Rose Garden another shot.  I CERTAINLY would never go for another holiday.  I'll go back to the other restaurants we like, where we can sit for a while without being given the bum's rush out the door or made to feel like you're at the counter at Mel's Diner.

They added a $25 tip.  I would have left it be, but my brother from out of town wanted to give her more.  He hadn't been paying attention to all that was happening.  Later when we clued him in he regretted the extra $15.  So our waitress got $40 for a little more than an hour of some of the most aloof, coarse service I've had at a rstrt in a long time.  Late in the meal her attitude improved, she seemed a little more congenial, but it was too late as far as I am concerned.

We went here recently for dinner and had some great food.  The Rose Garden represents the upper end of the Greek restaurant scale.  

I had the Angus beef stroganoff which was the best I've ever had.  The beef was tender enough to cut with just a fork, and bursting with flavor.  Huge portions I might add too.  

My dining companions had a variety of things ranging from salads to sandwiches. The salads were huge and beautiful.  The bread basket also had garlic bread in it which was awesome, they even brought us more when we asked.  The cream of chicken rice soup was fantastic.

To top it all of the service was great too.  It really was a great dining experience.

What a great place to eat! Warm atmosphere, quiet dining area, great food, polite and friendly staff... I will totally be back!

I came here this past week to catch a quick bite with family. We all ordered breakfast food, and I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered, drinks were served, and then the most shocking thing of all...

A bread basket. Yes, folks, they are masters in the lost art of the bread basket. I used to love when a restaurant would bring that basket over, with the little packets of butter, and you could enjoy some tasty bread before your meal. I have suffered greatly with the disappearance of the bread basket. Thank you, Rose Garden Cafe, for renewing my faith in dining!

Anyway, I ordered the ham and cheese omelet, and let me just say... It. Was. Amazing. I was totally put off of omelets thanks to IHOP and their nasty tasting eggs, but this was very tasty. Lots of ham in there, not too much cheese, and it was served with hash browns on the side and two pancakes. I was so full after the omelet and hash browns, I couldn't even touch my pancakes, but they went home in the typical styrofoam carrying case to nom on later.

The waitress was polite, not too chatty, but not rude. The service was fast, too! We had our food in record time, and it was the perfect temperature. This place is a little out of my way, but I will definitely try to make my way back here soon!

Even though I now live up near the WI border I still have friends bring me food from the Rose Garden Caf when they come up to visit me. Whenever I am in the area I stop by and grab a meal. Soups are always delicious and are the gold standard by which I judge a restaurant. So far I'm still searching for one up here in Lake County that comes close. They make a great turkey club too, one of my other favorites. Portions are huge, Menu is very large, they have great daily specials and always at least two delicious soups to choose from. After hundreds of dining experiences here I can say that I have rarely had a meal I didn't thoroughly enjoy. In fact I have a family member bringing me home some soup and a turkey club tonight. Thanks Chris!

I think the best thing I can say about the Rose Garden is that you get a lot of food for a little money and it's good.  

I also like the hours and they have a huge menu.
not good. I got a roast beef sandwich that had gone bad. And a hot fudge sundae that tasted like mud. We live a few blocks away but will not go back.

I had breakfast here yesterday and it was horrible. The french toast was barely hot, had no powdered sugar on it and seemed like it had been sitting around for a while. I also had scrambled eggs with cheeese which consisted of a piece of cheese on top of the eggs not mixed in and barely melted.

One of the most delicious skirt steak sandwiches I ever had I'm still drooling. The only bad thing I could eat another one Right away!!!!

My wife ordered the bacon cheddar burger  
She said it was fabulous. They cook it over  charcoal just like at home for a juicy homemade taste. 
The French fries have a secret coating to give you a wonderful crunchy and flavorfull taste.

The soup is homemade just super, and they cook fresh whole turkeys Dailey.

I guess I may have to move closer to them.  I rather eat here than at home   Enjoy.

The Rose Garden Cafe is the best family style restaurant around.  Great food, Great prices and a really good wait staff.  We've become Regulars for Thursday nite and Saturday nite. They have Phenominal Lamb Chops !   I had Braised Lamb Shank tonite.... It was better than Greek Town!!!  Once you try it you will  return! The Boss and his hostess Julia always greet you with a smile and make sure you are taken care of like you are part of the family!

Contrary to Annette P's comment as to their service etc I definitely have to disagree with her. I did my party there and they were nothing but accommodating for what I needed and wanted for my party. You definitely do get what you pay for. However, if you are cheap as my guess Annette was and expect things for free when you hardly pay anything for the entire party at all you probably won't get much unless you specify it.  And I never had a problem w/ the owners. My guess is, is that Annette you're prob neither the classiest nor the most well mannered  yourself so treat others as you want to be treated. :)

My quick tip was quick and to the point...it's ok, but their menu items are a step back from better restaurants like Christies on Irving Park. I've been here probably 300 times over the last 30 years...when it was the 7-Stars; but now that I've taken the blinders off I'm starting to enjoy so many other similar restaurants. Their Veal Park was pretty much all I knew from "standard" restaurants; but it's really only, ok. Sorry, but with age (44) comes experience. So-so for the Garden.
Atmosphere was agreeable; place was packed but was still quite enough for conversation and was comfortable. Food was very good. Service was average.

Good Italian American cuisine. Food was plentiful and fairly tasty. I had the tilapia which had good sauce, good fish and a whole lotta peas. Overall, for first dates or family get-togethers, this is where its at.

Unbelievable menu with something for any  time of day or night. Food and service very good and prices excellent too. 
A local place you must try.
Great food, friendly staff. Food Quantity and Quality is A+.

Good ol Rose Garden. Better than a lot of Greek Diners I've been to. We would come here often when my dad lived in Elk Grove. The cream of chicken soup is great. They always have a big bread basket. The staff is friendly and it's usually quick and efficient. I've never had bad food from here but again it's not anything amazing. Come here if you're looking for a hot homestyle cooked meal.

The service for dining in is great. Although I wouldn't  recommend ordering online. The estimated cook time was took much longer than I'd expect and they didn't follow the order notes even after confirming them verbally.

I love cozy family run restaurants such as Rose Garden Cafe. I could tell a lot of regulars come here because many of the waitresses stop to make conversations about specific topics or already know what the diner will order before they even speak. I ordered a cup of cream of mushroom soup and an egg white omelet. My husband had a breakfast special (2 eggs, 2 sausages, 2 pieces of toast). My omelet was huge and I literally had it for breakfast, lunch and dinner the following day. The cream of mushroom soup was clearly home made and quite filling. We noticed the prices for dinner are very reasonable hope to return soon!

Stopped by after a long day, with my sister and I craving breakfast even though it was 3 in the afternoon.  Very happy!  A menu that includes everything!!!!  Breaksfast, lunch dinner, specials, ice cream creations and a case of yummy looking desserts! We both ordered eggs and bacon.  A great looking basket of bread arrived but we did not sample as my sister is on a low-salt diet and I need gluten-free.  However, I almost moaned with delight as I ate the crispy hashbrowns that arrived quickly with our orders.  Perfectly cooked eggs. Crisp bacon. My sister having rye toast.  A caddy of jellies arrived with her toast.  Attentive waiter.  I could not ask for a better meal.

I've been here a couple of times for breakfast and it was good. It came fast and was hot. Had a patty melt for lunch once and it was fine. My experience for dinner has been a little different. Once I had the breaded veal cutlet and the breeding was so hard it was difficult to cut. Another time I had shrimp de Jonge  and I don't think I would ever order it again there. The shrimp was so over cooked they were like rubber. Not good. I'll try them again for dinner but three strikes and it's bye bye.

If you order a dinner, you will not be disappointed. We stopped ordering their hamburgers/cheeseburgers. They are really bad now. Don't eat that ever. They used to be so good, but the last two times, yuck. 

Everything else though is pretty good. Good people, good portions, good prices. Just don't order a hamburger. Don't know why they would change something like that --that is a staple for any restaurant.

This is your standard family restaurant.  The hostess (I think owner) is very friendly.  They serve breakfast all day and have some of the biggest omelets I've ever seen.  The soups of the day are tasty and you can get a sandwich with fries/coleslaw and bowl of soup for a decent price.  It's a great place for lunch as they get you in and out in time to get back to work.  I usually go for lunch every couple of weeks.

This place is a nice diner with a very nice wait staff.  I had the chicken and rice soup which was good and had the open face turkey dinner which wasn't the best I ever had but it was good, especially since I had been craving this.

I work right nearby and only went there once for lunch but based on the recommendation of practically everyone I work with.  Really great cream of chicken with rice soup and great burgers.  Big selection of other sandwiches and salads.  See below and click on menu.

http://local.yahoo.com/details?id=17129926

Like Ritzy's on Algonquin Rd, this place looks like it catered to the senior citizen's crowd. But we never let that stop us. If anything, prices would be cheaper, right?

We've been there twice for lunch, and the clientele runs the gamut from young 'uns like us to business crowd to families and yes, to seniors.

Get the soups even if you aren't full. The split pea soup is hearty, and my husband likes the cream of chicken as well. 

Their portions are huge. We've not been disappointed in too many dishes.

Recommended: Reuben; gyros (sliced really thin and oh, so crispy); split pea soup. Their hash brown is the bomb! Extra golden crispy on the inside, flavorful and tender on the inside.

The wait staff is extremely attentive, too.

Something here for everyone. My family and extended family comes here every week for dinner, and they are so nice and good about accommodating all of us (10+ every time). The servings are large so you have lunch the next day :)

My girl friend and I came here around 11AM on a Sunday and were seated right away off to the room on the right when you first walk in. Neither of us had ever been here. Right off, I feel like the coffee could've come a little quicker. That's just what I'm used to over at the Egg Basket on Barrington Rd, but after awhile, our server came. I ordered my staple breakfast of 2 eggs over easy with sausage and hash browns and went with the pancakes instead of toast. My friend got one of those skillet-cheezy-platters. Food was definitely excellent! Sausage - awesome! It was definitely on par with what I usually get at Egg Basket (which is closer to where I live). Coffee was getting low and I was a little worried I'd have to flag down our waitress, but she came just in the knick of time. A private party began in the room we were sitting in and I think after awhile, our waitress forgot that we were in there. So, we had to go to the cashier without our bill bcuz we'd been waiting and waiting, but then again, we were in no hurry to leave and who really wants to demand a bill where you have to pay money! ha ha! But, no, the front desk woman was very kind and apologetic for our wait on the bill. I would definitely come back here again when I'm in the area, but I live closer to Barrington Road, so most likely won't be back soon, unless I am with my friend again who lives in EGV! =)

I've been here multiple times and have never gone away hungry or unhappy with the service.  Yes it's your standard diner but the portions a very large.  I have eaten in and ordered food as take out and always been pleased.

Pure diner type American food place owned by classic Greek restaurant owners making good affordable hot food fast. 

I've been coming to Rose Garden about once a month for years with my Dad (in his 60's) for breakfast or lunch on Saturdays.  Always busy, but never a a wait for a table - Rose Garden is one of those solid dependable places to get a variety of classic American Fare:

Superior Egg breakfasts including gigantic Omelets.  Try the spinich & Feta it's great!
Wonderful and huge turkey club sandwiches and great crunchy fries.
Like the other review said; cream of anything soup here is awesome.  Just add a little pepper (remember they cater to folks my Dad's age) and a dash o'salt and dip that garlic bread (that come iun the bread basket!) in there and you'll be a happy camper. 

Walk off your wonderful meal by visiting Elk Grove Village's Elk preserve which is located across the street from Rose Garden.

Classic "Greek-style" coffee shop.  Lots of food.  Tremendous variety.  Comfortable seating;  they never rush you, even on busy busy Sunday mornings.  Fair pricing - I'd even say low prices, considering you'll probably take a doggie bag home.  Family restaurant for sure.  Bring the kids AND the grandparents and go home with change in your pocket!
great for breakfast, good for kids. irishman's skillet is my favorite!

Great little Mexican place -- authentic food, friendly service and a relaxed atmosphere.

This has become my local go-to for good Mexican food.  The shrimp cocktail is phenomenal as are the "street-style" tacos.  Great food, great prices, great little place.

Went there for lunch and ordered a taco dinner. The chicken taco was bad and the 2 steaks were ok at best. The salsas lacked flavor and 11.50 is a little high for the area. 
Also, the rice and beans were horrible.

oooooh finally a Mexican joint with an authentic taste!  4 stars for value, fast and friendly service, and freshly made food!  No 5th star because of it's location.  Although this place is less than 5 miles from my house, there's just nothing else in that location that I frequently visit.  Besides the construction on Bode rd is a killer obnoxious waste of time!  Anywho....

Let's talk taco!  The pastor taco is super tasty, I highly recommend.  I also had the steak taco and that was good too but just like all steak taco, it's dependent on it's marinate.  I would skip the steak.  I also got the chicken quesadilla and that was a home run.  It was hearty and full of flavor!  Corn in a cup was delish although it's not enough to share...  don't forget the spicy powder!

I did not dine-in which was a great decision because the ambiance of this place is totally old school.  It can really use a renovation, but I didn't really care because I came in, paid and got back to my house to enjoy this authentic delicious food.  I will most definitely return.

MUST HAVE:  pastor taco

This food will not piss anyone off, but it will not make you think of Mexico either.  Meat is entirely unseasoned, so it's riding on whether the meat itself can drive it home.  Of the three tacos I had (ground beef, chicken, and chorizo) only the chorizo tried to play, and it was a limp attempt at best to arouse satisfaction.  Chunks of cheese heaved on these vessels, as only their corn shells reminded me of the idea of a taqueria.

If I had to pick a word to describe the food here, forgettable would be one.  Passionless would be another.  And disappointment would be a third.  Nice people working here, but the food is a distant second here, and I didn't come for the nice people.

It's been 3 years since finding this fantastic Mexican restaurant and I am so happy to say that absolutely nothing has changed in regards to the quality of food or the incredible prices. It's my favorite place to eat anywhere in the area, including the expensive restaurants!  My family has been eating here on a weekly basis since we found it and I've treated many friends to lunch here as well.  We even had them cater our son's birthday party and every single parent asked where the food was from, parents and kids alike devoured the steak and chicken tacos we had!

After all that time we've definitely settled on our favorite dishes.  I love the steak tacos, $2 a piece (10 cents extra for cheese). The meat is delicious and tender with no gristle whatsoever. If I'm extra hungry or want a small change of pace I'll order the steak quesadilla, which is $6 and comes with tomatoes, sour cream, and guacamole. This is more like a mini-burrito than a traditional quesadilla but the flavor is out of this world.

My wife is a slave to the $6 ham torta, which is a huge sandwich. My two young boys prefer the chicken and tongue (!) tacos, which we get on flour tortillas at no extra cost because their grubby little hands tend to make a mess of the corn.

I've tried a few other things on this menu and I've never had anything that wasn't great, nor have I heard anyone say anything negative about their food in the years I've been bringing people here. Best of all, the thing that really excites me, is that this didn't start out great and slowly decline in quality or increase their prices as so many new mom & pop restaurants do. The only price increase I know of is the additional 10 cents for cheese on a taco, which is not a problem at all for me since the prices are already so reasonable. In fact, there is literally not another place, including the worst fast food, that my family can eat for less money, and certainly not for this quality.

They are also very fast and attentive for takeout. I regularly call my order in and it is ready when I arrive 10 minutes later. 

Recently the restaurant finally hung a new lit sign to be more easily found, and made small updates to the small dining area which include a big juke box. They also updated their credit card system which now allows a tip to be written in as most places do. No more accidentally stiffing the waitress!

One small warning if you are planning to dine in: there are only four-person booths and one or two small tables.  You can make do and cram in about 8 people by pushing tables together but it's pretty tight, so I'd recommend coming with no more than 4 people unless you're willing to split up.

I cannot praise this place enough and I'm so glad that my original review has been so helpful in directing people to my favorite Mexican restaurant.

I was in the area after I had an appointment in Schaumburg and decided that I was craving some authentic Mexican tacos and this was literally the closest spot in site so I decided to get a few tacos to go. Upon arrival, the girls working here were very friendly and told me my order would be ready in like five minutes. I like that, fast and nice service. The place is small and a few small booths so it's really not a shameful place to come and have a dinner for a party of one. But since I was in a rush I decided to do the to go. Their prices are decent and comparable to what's around so I was excited to try their "street style tacos" people had recommended on here.

Okay, so what's nice is they included a little bag of chips for me with a green and red salsa. That's nice for a to go. However, the chips were nothing special and a little cold. So I passed up on those. I have to say they get another star for a very delicious steak taco in which they melted some of their cheese on top, I should have gotten more of those since the steak was juicy but not chewy and full of flavor but not leaking all over the taco. Then I decided to try my go to el pastor tacos and got a few of those since those are usually my taco winners and I was definitely not impressed. They were over salted to the point that I couldn't wait to get home and drink a gallon of water, the sauce they were cooked in was a little overwhelming and kind of poured down my hands as I was eating them. I mean I don't want dry pork pieces but somewhere in between moist and not dripping would have been great. 

Overall, I think the service was fast and nice and the steak taco (as well as the steak quesadilla) both are awesome. However, the al pastor was a little too much for me and I would pass that up. Not sure if I'd be back as it didn't wow me but if you live in the area, it's worth a definite try. But get the steak tacos!!!

Enjoyed the tamales-great value and really delicious. Portions were generous and very fresh. The al pastor taco was not that great but everything else was. Came here because of other yelp reviews and was  pleased with everything.

I was very disappointed in my experience. Waitresses were very nice but the food was a let down. I asked for a suggestion on what the cook does best and eventually ordered chicken enchiladas with green sauce. We were given a small basket of chips and salsa.( I could have made better salsa at home and there hottest salsa was mild at best.) These were taken away and not replaced or refilled. 

The meal arrived quickly but I'm not sure that's a good thing. I was excited to see real corn tortillas but that's where authenticity ended. I'm not sure where this restaurant gets its chicken but it looked like out of a can and the seasoning was no where to be found. Rice was not fresh and beans were meh. I'm glad I ordered a smaller portion because afterwards my stomach felt like it had a rock in it. Prices are decently cheap but if you want good food... I suggest hunting for another place.
Always consistently good food. Good quality steak meat without tendons and fatty pieces you find elsewhere!

Yes - this place is exactly what I was looking for in Schaumburg! I hail from that part of Chicago where Taco Burrito King is the place to go for authentic Mexican food, and Taqueria Los Juanes is just like it! We ordered take-out from here and it was pretty delish. I had a Taco Dinner which included Steak Tacos (I chose the cilantro/onion option and added cheese), rice, and beans. My husband had a Steak Burrito Suizo. Both were what we expected and just what we were hoping for. Greasy, but definitely not sopping, with the right amount of flavor. The menu is pretty large, as well as reasonably priced. They do give you a little bag of chips with some salsa on the side for free, too. The chips weren't too amazing on their own, but they tasted just fine covered in some beans and salsa. The best part about my meal is that I didn't feel crazy bloated like I usually do from such a hearty ( or do I mean salty, greasy?) meal. A win all the way around. I will definitely order from here again the next time I am craving Mexican food (which is always).

Looked very shady late on a Friday night but actually was pretty good.  

Food- The biggest reason this place doesn't deserve a fourth star is because of their chips and salsa.  The chips were decent, but the salsa was awful.  It had no texture, a puddle of juice with a hunk of tomato in it.  From there it gets better though.  For dinner I had one pastor taco and one steak taco.  The pastor taco was flavorful and really good with the sauce they bring for it, same with the steak taco.  I also tried the shrimp quesadilla which was delicious with loads of fresh pico.  

Service- Was decent, not much to comment about.  Food didn't take too long.

First time being here, and it's pretty small, like maybe 15 people and it's crowded. 
Now as you enter, it looks kinda full, and a bit sad. The only thing giving it life are the plants and the alcoholic bottles for decoration.  
Now, I entered the bathroom Asap(had to go) and it's not clean and it's not dirty--it's alright. I mean, it could be a worse right?

Now the place is same in cleanliness, it's not good and it's not bad--it's alright. Tables are clean, silverware; I can see the kitchen, and it's clean-spotless, Floors, clean as well. 

Well food, I had some tacos--lengua(tongue), asada(steak), camarn(Shrimp), puerco(pork), and chorizo(chorizo). Those were my choices for the tacos, but, they came with a double tortilla--not really a fan of that and the tortilla was a bit; errrm, like it tasted a bit over cooked. That goes for the chips that come at the start, a bit over cooked. The food was good, as I mentioned, but the tortillas was eh. 

The service was at top notch, mostly because it wasn't to busy, but she attended us with a smile and a pleasant tone. 

Do I recommend coming? Sure, if you're up for something quick an easy, just see if the tortillas are at notch.
Good food. Average price. Not cheap/not expensive.  Seems to be authentic. Enjoyable. Small place. Ok environment.

This is my first experience with their food and it was quite the treat. Definitely fresh ingredients and a great quantity. 

We had 5 steak tacos for starters and it was a belly buster for the price. They bill by ingredient which helps keep the cost down for those picky people. We also had horchata, which I will go out on a limb and say that it's the best in the Chicagoland area (or at least from what iv3 had) 

What surprised me the most was that free chips and salsa came with our to go.

Definitely give this spot a shot for some fast to go.

Nice little neighborhood Mexican place with authentic food.  

We sat down at an empty booth, and were greeted immediately with menus.  

I went for the pastor tacos and a tamale.  My friend got the chicken tacos.  We also shared a quesadilla.

While the chips and salsa were just meh, I thought the rest of the food was fresh, fast and delicious.  Also, the prices are awesome.  If I lived in the area, I'd be stopping by often.

I do wish they would update the dcor a bit as the inside looks run down.

This is a nice place, really small and compact. The service was friendly and we got quite a lot of food. Got the complimentary chips n salsa, we ordered the quesadilla with chicken, the shrimp tacos and the chicken with mushrooms. Everything was pretty good. We spent less than $10 per plate here so I thought it was well worth it.

Taqueria Los Juanes was quite a surprise for me. Unless you happen to be walking right past it or know it's there, you won't notice it. Not at all a fancy store front and the strip mall it's located in might make one think it'd be better to bypass and look elsewhere... DON'T! This may've been some of the best Mexican food I have had outside of a Mexican home. The flavors were delicious, the presentation appealing, the prices unbelievable (seriously, all of the meals ordered by my party were under $7 I believe), and the restaurant clean.
    I got the steak quesadilla. When I think quesadilla, I think that flat bready thing with some cheese stuffed in the middle and stuff piled on top of it. This creation was far from it (see picture). It was packed with meat and cheese and rolled up into a mouthful of deliciousness with a side of guacamole and sour cream to top it off. It was a perfect portion and even a little too much for me to finish, priced around $6 and some change. My boyfriend got a large chicken burrito: also good; his brother got a dessert: great!
    The service was fine, our waitress didn't really check on us at any point during our meal and almost forgot to get us more chips and salsa, but she was ok. The restaurant, as I mention, seemed clean and orderly though my boys were offended by the "brick" paneling (they're brick snobs, lol, weird I know). There is a TV, of course playing Spanish channels, which is appropriate because this place seems seriously authentic. 
    I'd definitely give Taqueria Los Juanes a try, it is worthy of your business. It's located on Bode near the intersection with Salem. Found in the same strip mall as 7-Eleven, the liquor store, the day care, etc., so there is lot parking (or very walkable from the local apartments/neighborhoods). They do takeout and fyi, there is a $5 minimum on credit cards/debit cards.

I stopped here to pick up carryout before I headed to work. Got the steak quesadilla and 2 al pastor tacos. The steak quesadilla was slightly runny (probably cause it was ready for a little while before I picked it up. The lady said 10-15 mins but it was probably ready in 5) the tacos were loaded with meat and filling as well. I would probably rank this place somewhere between 3 and 4 stars but I gave 4 because it didn't dissapoint, it just wasn't as good as I expected based on the reviews. Either way it wasn't extra oily/greasy Mexican which was good because that's a make or break for me.

after searching for a place we could call our own in schaumburg, this place takes the top honor! not far from where we live (although farther than a few other places), affordable food, and well seasoned. We always get the same thing everywhere we go: steak tacos and quesadillas. Without a doubt, this place blows everyone else out of the water. I usually get 4 tacos and and can't take another bite after the 4th. The quesadillas are packed full of cheese, pico de gallo, and whatever else you want fitted in there. Best part, chips and (delicious) salsa with the meal, complimentary. Love this place. Love it!

My fellow yelpers I came on your recommendation for some "authentic" Mexican food. 

Guacamole - likely prepackaged. Weird tasting. 
Refried beans - likely prepackaged. Bland. 
Quesadilla - not good.  Shouldn't be hard to mess up. 
Cuban Torta - had a sliced hot dog and overly fried egg in it??

I'm a pig and only ate half of my food. That says a lot. 

The only reason they got 2 stars is my wife is sitting next to me. She is the most lovely and beautiful woman on the planet, and also a softie who feels bad about me giving a 1. 

I'd recommend Pancho's Burritos just north of this place on Golf Road.

- walked right in and sat down
- chips and salsa on the table 
- fast service 
- decent decor
- ordered the shrimp quesadillas 
- nothing to complain about with the taste and it was surprisingly light for the style of food
- overall not bad but not too good
Not to many small places that i care to say i like around here , but this one is run by nice people and the food has a lot of flavor. Try the milanesa i cant get enough!
we Ordered chicken tacos, and carne Asada burrito. Both were average, not to much flavor but not completely bland.
As far as Mexican places go in Schaumburg, this place is definitely the best. Try the chorizo, it's delicious. I probably eat here once every two weeks and have never been disappointed.

Excellent low profile place, great service and some of the tastiest Mexican food I have had in a long time. Simple, fresh herbs, homemade classics. The shrimp fajitas and the steak burritos were A+.
We will be regulars here in no time.

S-O-L-I-D
Thank God!!!!  Finally found a good/great Mexican joint in the NW burbs.  Why it is so hard to make solid Mexican food outside of Chicago?  Anywho, this place is great.  Delivers quality freshly made Mexican food.  The steak torta is outstanding.  Tacos are very good.  Quality sauces, extremely fair prices, solid cuisine.

Torta! Torta! Torta!

Oh yea, their salsa served at sit down w/ chips is pretty kick a$$

While stationed in San Diego with the Navy, I got spoiled on authentic delicious Mexican food. Whenever I travel, I always try to find great Mexican food. I found this place on Yelp (thank you, Yelp!). Just as others described, the restaurant is small and simple but very clean and the waitress very friendly. 
The salsa that came with the chips was great, lots of cilantro, just how I like it but not too spicy for those with a sensitive mouth.
I ordered a chicken quesadilla with everything. It was absolutely delicious!!! Simple ingredients but well made and fresh. There were two bottles of sauce left with our lunch. One was a spicy verde and the other looked like a mole sauce but I didn't try it. The verde sauce was very flavorful and nice and spicy. 
The total bill for three lunch dishes and a soda was $24. 
I would go to this restaurant again, without a doubt. It rivals and surpasses my favorite Mexican joints in San Diego and Imperial Beach!

I had a tough time deciding between 2 and 3 stars for this place...   
The place appears pretty clean, but the booths are getting run down - no cushion left, small tears...
Decorated nicely...
Service was slow...  Sat for almost 5 minutes before I was brought a menu...
Ordered a chorizo taco, pastor taco & pork carnita taco.
All 3 tacos lacked flavor!  Pastor & chorizo appeared to have lots of seasoning on them, but those 2 tacos, along with the carnita taco had NO flavor at all!!!
Meat was tender and cooked perfectly, but again it was all SO bland....
For a Mexican restaurant in a largely Hispanic neighborhood, I expected much, much better!
Will not be coming back.

Have to add on - they didn't skimp on serving size...  Meat filled!
The atmosphere is lacking a little, but the quality and price of the food more than make up for the small seating areas.  This is our go to place for tacos when family comes from out of town.

Hidden gem. The Chorizo tacos and Steak Tortas are excellent. I haven't tried anything else yet. The Chorizo tacos and Steak Tortas are excellent. Yes I said it twice in case you missed it. They have really good salsas as well. I enjoy spicier foods and this place makes me very happy. My one gripe is that it is such a small place with limited seating. A lot of customers order carryout.

We were staying in Shaumburg for one night and we were tired and didn't want fancy and Thank You fellow Yelpers for this one. 
We too were surprised by the location and not sure what we were getting in to. We walked in at about 8:00 p.m. and there was only one other table occupied by patrons, but thought oh well, as long as we're here!!!  Why this place isn't packed to the walls with customers is beyond me???
Our waitress seated us and she was cute as a button and explained things as best she could. She was attentive and checked on us often.
I ordered the skirt steak special  called Carne Poblano and my wife had a three way of enchiladas.  Both Fantastic. 

Let me tell you, there is nothing fancy about this little mexican diner, BUT, the food is authentic, fresh, and as tasty a meal as I've had . This is mexican done simple and RIGHT. It's probably a good thing I don't  close or I'd be in trouble.  Everything from the fresh warm tortillas to the cold beer was delicious.  We then spent the next 2 days in downtown Chicago and didn't eat anything as good as this place.
