All in all.........great food, great service, and great price!!!  Thanks Yelpers and Thanks Los Juanes for the wonderful meal.  If we're ever in Shaumburg again, plan on our return!!!

Slammer!!!

I came here for authentic Mexican tacos, and I got them. This place is a hidden gem. 

I ordered 3 tacos: chicken, pork, and tongue, all with cilantro and onion. I also ordered a side of guacamole, and a strawberry Jarritos. The free chips and salsa are a nice touch (and delicious!). The guacamole is fresh, with good chunks of avocado. The tacos are to die for. Plenty of meat, soft tortillas, and filling!  I had to take some home. And the staff is very welcoming and friendly. But know that some of them have a limited grasp of the English language, so be patient. 

An adorable little hole in the wall with delicious food. You need to be here. 

Tip: No lighted sign. Look for it in the shopping center across the street from Salem Ridge apts, between Bode Cleaners and Envimex.  Cash tips only.

A tiny Mexican restaurant in a strip mall off Bode Rd. This is a no frills restaurant with quick service and low prices. I ordered a $7 taco salad with chicken. It was brought out in about 5 minutes. It was loaded with meat, guacamole, pic ode gaol, cheese and sour cream. I had to dig to the bottom to find the lettuce. The chips and salsa they bring to the table is incredible and I filled up on that before ordering and was unable to finish my salad. The portions here are huge! I would definitely go back for a quick Mexican fix.

How are you supposed to find this place?

First of all, it's hidden in a small plaza in the middle of a neighborhood (not off of a main road).

Second of all, they don't have a sign. I mean, they do have a sign in the window, but until you pull into the plaza, I don't think you'll realize there is a taqueria in there.

Nonetheless, if you do happen to find this place, you'll have discovered a gem. I had the pastor, asada, and the chorizo and all three were delicious. Juicy limes, fresh cilantro and onions, and juicy and flavorful meats.

I'm drooling just thinking about this place.

One piece of advice: Skip the tamale.

Lunch for my lady and myself came out to twelve dollars. 12. Yes, one dozen dollars. Perfect if you're on a budget.
Personal favorite, I'll drive past 10 other taquerias on my way there....

So I've been sticking with the stuff I knew I liked at this place but tonight I tried the Pollo en Chipotle. I'm not sure if this is on the menu but they have it on a dry erase board in the restaurant. It is to die for. It's just a little spicier than I usually go for but the flavor is amazing! Not a bad price for what you get either.

Tender succulent chicken enchilada verde. Service is nice and attentive. This place has good salsa, unsalted chips and wonderfully fresh tortillas. It is a hole in the wall but for the price (3 enchiladas, a kid's cheese quesadilla with fries, 2 horchatas, 4 steak tacos, 1 huevos rancheros and a bottled Mexican Coke...$34 plus tip). They seem to have specials everyday such as tostado de ceviche and a mushroom/spinach quesadilla.

The little restaurant is small but super clean, including the bathrooms. Our server asked to clarify if we wanted the dinner or ala carte on the enchiladas because her uncle in kitchen wanted to make sure. When she brought our dishes I thought I accidentally still got the dinner portion with rice, beans and everything else included.

You can't beat the prices and the food is better than a lot of other Mexican restaurants in the Schaumburg area. Afterwards my fiance walked next door to get a $12 haircut. The whole little strip mall has a lot of life and everything you could need (dinner, haircut, liquor store and more).

Kinda hard to find this place if you're using the iPhone Maps App. It directs you into the high school parking lot! 

Came to this place for a quick bite to eat for lunch. Chips and salsa they give you as you sit down for dining are pretty good ! Salsa is homemade , as is the chorizo (Mexican sausage for those not familiar). 

I had steak tacos and my friend had a Chimichanga. Both very great. Recommend this place. Service is good too and quick.

YES! 

Make sure you stay there to eat so you can get chips and their amazing salsa. Best chorizo taco I have found in the area. 

Just YES.
The best tacos I have had in the Schaumburg/Hoffman Estates area. Fast, fresh, and authentic. You will not find a better taco at this price.

I TRIED
- Carne Asada Burrito (5/10)
- Chorizo Quesadilla (4/10)
- Horchata (7/10)

When I was little, I used to spend my entire summers and winters with my cousins, who moved here in the Salem area not long after they immigrated from Korea. They were the only Asians in the neighborhood, but the majority of the demographic was Mexican and Indian. So it's really surprising to me that it's taken this long for a taqueria to open up in this area. While there's competition on Golf Road, and then on Schaumburg Road, by the library, this is a pretty ideal spot!

If you're looking for it, just go into the plaza with 7-11 in it, and look at the windows, because there is no lit sign outside, just some posterboard in the windows. The place is pretty tiny, there're about 7-10 tables or so - think Pancho's Burritos before the expansion. I have eaten in before, and there's a halfway decent lunch crowd, lot of takeout orders, I notice, though. It's been a while since I've had their other stuff, but for my recent pickup order, I decided to get something new from here.

CARNE ASADA BURRITO
Ever since rediscovering Burrito House, I've been wanting to try getting burritos closer to home instead of having to only get'em in Glenview. So, on this particular day, I ordered a Carne Asada Burrito. It's filled with beans, lettuce, rice, and asada steak. 

The key ingredient, steak unfortunately didn't deliver. I think TBK and/or Burrito House use higher heat on their stoves, because they're able to almost get a crisp on their steaks, while not making them leathery. They add a small char to it too for texture and that extra smoky flavor...but not here. The steaks are probably medium well, because they weren't dry, but still a little leathery, and worse, they lacked flavor. The rice didn't really help anything, and the beans sort of collected to the bottom of the burrito and made those bites a bit unpleasant. Certainly not a failure, but not something I'll be trying again.

CHORIZO QUESADILLA
I've been on the lookout for these lately too. Again, Burrito House was able to get crisp and char on the chorizo, but not here. Again, it was just soft, and boring, in terms of texture. The flavors and seasoning were average on the chorizo, but something about the way they wrapped this really hurt the quesadilla. 

I'm used to quesadillas having a fairly even dispersion of meat and cheese around the whole thing. This one, though... imagine taking a tortila (circle) and then folding it in half...like normal quesadillas. Now, put all the meat at the bottom, so it almost forms a purse, and then use the cheese to melt the top of the quesadilla together. So essentially, your bite is going to be EITHER chorizo OR cheese....unless you roll the whole thing up and take one monstrous bite. The problem with this is, no matter how I rolled it, folded it, or even separated and refolded it, every bite was just chock full of tortilla, and way too much of it. Because of the high concentration of tortilla, it sort of dried out the bite, and overwhelmed the flavors with that floury, doughy taste. Chorizo is pretty strong, so you obviously tasted that, but it was hard to tell there was even cheese there. If this is how they fold quesadillas, I'm not getting another one here again.

ABURRIDO (boring)
I really want to like this place, because it's a tiny place, and obviously someone's working hard to keep this place open, but it just doesn't match my style, so I don't know if I will be revisiting anytime soon. Tacos - Los Fernandez, Burritos - TBK or Burrito House, Chorizo Quesadilla - America's Bar or Burrito House.
My husband and I frequently visit since moving up here,  and we are so glad we found this place.   They are always excellent,  and it is very close by our house which is a win for us!

I was searching for more of an authentic taqueria and so glad I found this place!  Have tried so far torta, tacos and quesadilla all wonderful.  The only suggestion I could make is either using a homemade tortilla for the tacos or using fresher tortillas.  Tortillas are either soggy or dry.  Not very appitizing.  Other than that must try!

I finally found what I've been searching for since moving from Texas to Illinois.  This place is amazing.  It's just straight up great Mexican food without any fuss.  Since finding it maybe two weeks ago, we've carried out probably half a dozen times and sampled several different items, from quesadillas to tacos to huaraches (a new one for me).  Everything has been nothing short of fantastic, and anyone else we have introduced to it has had rave reviews as well.  So long, Chipotle.
The boyfriend and I just moved to the area and found this place for some takeout, and glad we did! The fish and steak tacos were amazing!! It's dangerous that they're only 5 minutes away!

This is an out of the way authentic Mexican dive with serviceable burritos, tacos, et al. There are 10 total tables in the place, so don't plan on bringing your class reunion here, but it's a reliable burrito source for those late nights when it's past Los Compadres' hours.

this place is great.....the food is authentic....you can't beat it anywhere around......all the yelpers that are interested in the decor so much......really take the order to go....if it bothers you that much......if your coming here for some  ................REALLY good food  sit down....,,,,order.........and enjoy the ride

Thank you fellow yelp-ers for your reviews - without which, I never would have found/tried this place!!
Its in a small strip mall next to a neighborhood - if you blink, you'll miss it...(trust me, we almost did!!) Luckily, there were two of us in the car - which allowed for one driver and one "spotter" if you will... 
While the inside of this place is small and "nothing fancy", the service is fast and friendly, and the food is AMAZING! We ordered a bunch of different kinds of tacos and I have to say - the chorizo was the best !! Maybe I'm just biased because I loooooove chorizo, but still - very good! The salsa was very good as well - spicy without being overly spicy... All-in-all - don't go here expecting a white tablecloth type of place - more like a fast food, sit-if-you-want, soda-served-in-the-can type of place. But with food (and service) this good, I could care less what the decor was like. 
I wish I lived closer to go here more often, but its definitely worth the trip!

This is my go-to spot for local tacos and authentic Mexican fast food fare.  Conveniently located right down the street from me, this place is off the main street and caters mainly to the Mexican clientele that resides across the street. 

Although there is nothing fantastically spectacular in the food they serve, the prices are right and the portions are on par.  The business if fairly new so the interior is clean.

I've tried a few different menu items but I tend to stick to the basics in places like this.  The tacos are satisfying and always hit the spot for my occasional authentic Mexican greasy spoon cravings (aka drunkeness).

There are other small taco/burrito joints in the area but this place is definitely of higher caliber for the same price.

This place is great, most authentic Mexican food in the area. Service wonderful and it's never crowded.  I wish they had margaritas that's really the only complaint I have.  I would recommend this place to anyone that knows good Mexican food.

I called ahead and ordered food to eat in because my girlfriend only has a 30 minute lunch. They had everything waiting for us and hot when we arrived. Pastor and steak tacos were very good..... chicken was just ok. Ordered the 3 taco dinner.

this place is pretty nice. it's small and way easy to drive right past; I don't even think there's a proper sign up. but the interior is VERY nice, in comparison to most of these "hole in the wall" taquerias. clean, nice wooden booths, etc.


I got steak tacos my first visit and loved them. nicely grilled and not rubbery at all. my second time there, I got lengua tacos which are my favorite. they were in nice big chunks. very tender!

This is a really small, hard-to-find taco joint at a very reasonable price.  If you're in the area, it's a great place to get your taco fix at just $2 a taco. Luckily, I love down the street.

I got all three of my tacos with onions and cilantro. First, the carne  asada, which had a decent flavor, but definitely not the best. Next, the pastor, which was a complete let down. The "marinated" meat was just dull. Last, the chorizo, which was so good and flavorful without leaving you feeling like you ate a fat, greasy sausage. Bottom line, if you want a small, quiet place for tacos when you're near then this is a great quick fix.

Pretty good stuff. I tried a few different tacos.  The chorizo was great according to my gf. I will try those for sure the next time I visit.  The carne asada tacos were not bad but also nothing to brag about. The tacos al pastor were better than anything else in the area. The burrito was small compaired to other places but that's not a bad thing. Most of the time when I order a burrito I end up overeating because I don't want to let the food go to waste. While waiting for my food I saw some dishes that looked and smelled wonderfull. I will definitely have to go and explore the menu some more.

Taqueria Los Juanes is a brand new place that opened up in early 2012 in a hard-to-find spot in a distant suburban strip mall.  I stumbled on the restaurant entirely by accident and decided to try some tacos instead of a pizza slice from next door Old Town Pizza.

The inside is small, with 5 or 6 booths and a few tables, and it seemed like everyone was there waiting for takeout, which I decided as well.  I ordered a chorizo taco and an al pastor taco to go and it only took about 5 minutes.  The tacos both came on two corn tortillas and you had your choice of onion & cilantro or lettuce & tomato as toppings (I recommend the onion & cilantro).  The chorizo was delicious, some of the better spiced pork sausage I've had in the Chicago suburbs, but the al pastor was surprisingly disappointing; it was dry and really lacking in flavor.

The meal also came with chips & salsa, even for carryout, which was a nice surprise.  The corn chips are thin and crunchy, but the salsa was a little overwhelmed by the cilantro.  I ended up dipping a lot of them in the salsa verde and the other red salsa that came with the tacos instead.  Considering the other reviewers have mentioned some really interesting menu items, and that overall the meal was quite cheap and good (especially for Schaumburg Mexican food), I would recommend this little place to anyone in the general area tired of Taco Bell or expensive sit-down Mexican places.

We're really picky about our tacos and have found that you'll find the best ones in little holes in the wall. That's just what this place is and it's great! Like others have mentioned, the chorizo tacos are excellent! They put a lot of meat in them and the price is great. This is our new go-to taqueria.

Terrific food for really cheap. They have some very authentic menu items that you rarely see outside of Mexico City. Try the "huaraches" which are thick, football sized  corn masa tortillas topped with any meat or veggies you like. One of them will fill you up for hours. $5.95 to $6.95 depending on the toppings.

I was really impressed with the asada (steak) which I ordered as a topping on my huarache. Normally at these places the steak is tough or fatty. This place is using really tender skirt steak. It was excellent and tender. 

You don't get hand made tamales everywhere. Mostly you get a mass produced version. But this place makes their own and believe me you can tell the difference. They have two different kinds: stuffed with chicken and green sauce or rajas con queso. Rajas are slices of flavorful poblano peppers, sweet not spicy. Oh and the price? An unbelievable $1.75.


Try the horchata to drink. It is a delicious sweet rice milk beverage laced with cinnamon.

Yes these guys also have the normal enchiladas, tacos, quesadillas, big burritos, and so forth.

yum! after a trip to ikea, me and the husband were looking for some cheap mexican food. decided to take the advice of fellow yelpers and give this place a try. like everyone said, the place is no frills, simple, and clean! our waitress was very sweet and nice. chips and salsa were good. I got the chicken enchiladas suizas with rice and beans and the chicken was sooooo good. my plate was clean as a whistle when I was done. my husband got ground beef tacos and a gordita and said both were awesome. after taking a bite of my enchiladas, he thought the chicken was so good that he ended up ordering a chicken taco too, which was also great. and the prices can't be beat, we got all this food for under $20. this will def be on our list of places to go when we're out in Schaumburg.

Los Juanes is super fast and inexpensive. I used to hit Pancho's a few blocks away but now I only eat tacos from Los Juanes. Tacos al pastor with onions and cilantro is my favorite taco, and Los Juanes is the best in the area. Phone ahead, lightning fast like 10 minutes max every time.

A while ago, I went to this place to get some tacos, ever since then this has been my favorite go to mexican place! The chips and salsa are delicious! My son LOVES it here. He calls it "takyra lo juanie" I always crack up when I hear this and I am glad to bring him here! He usually has the cheese quesadillas with fries and devours all of it! If he doesn't like the food, he usually shows it, so you know that this place it good! The prices for this place is great and so is this food! The service is good, too. My husband and I like it here just as much as my son! If you want to go to a GREAT mexican place, come here!!
haven't found a place in the burbs that makes better authentic mexican tacos!

We moved to Hoffman Estates/Schaumburg area this summer and have been searching for a new favorite Mexican restaurant. This is definitely it. 

Don't be fooled by the location - they don't have a big lit up banner sign hanging up. This little hole in the wall is a hidden gem!

I had 3 tacos: two shrimp and one chorizo. It was authentic and delicious. The kind of tacos you crave. Service was great and our food came quickly. Enjoyed the salsa and guacamole as well. 

If you are in the mood for Mexican food, try this place out! You'll be happy you did.

A diamond in the rough!  The food is authentic, inexpensive and delicious!  While the booths could be a little more comfortable, you forget about that as soon as you get your food!  We will absolutely return.
Chorizo taco was great, guacamole tasty, and horchata was massive, without ice so I had a full cup. Chips and salsa were fresh and tasty.

I am not too big a fan of Mexican food, but after reading a few of the reviews my fiance and I decided to try it out.  The food was amazing and I look forward to going here again.  It also helps that it's right down the road.  Coming from a town where everything is commercial and chain, it's nice to find a little place like this.
This place had awesome food! Hard to find without a lighted overhead sign but totally worth looking for.
The food is good, authentic. Don't get a burrito with just meat and cheese, it's small as hell. Get tacos. Very friendly waitress as well. The place doesn't have a sign so good luck finding it.

Do yourself a favor and go off the main road to find this place. 

Incredible steak tacos. Great tamales, good salsa, good guacamole (though a bit low on salt, but you can fix that!). Reasonable pricing as well. I go to this place once or twice a week for lunch, I can't recommend it enough!

Just found this hidden gem last night. We did takeout and got steak quesadillas, a veggie burrito, and an order of chips and guac. Really delicious, and so far my favorite Mexican place around here. I definitely recommend trying it out!

This is THE place for Italian beef and cheese fries in the suburbs. Make you go to the one in Palatine. As mentioned Prospect Heights location is a DIVE. Fresh crisp fries.  Cheese on the side. Delicious DRY HOT beef. Amazing. It's like I'm back at Forest Preserve Drive and Harlem.

I used to come here back in the day when it was across the street.  I finally noticed the new location when I was driving by on Rt 12. I've been there twice in the past few weeks.  The first time I ordered a hot dog with everything and fries.  The fries are still perfect (when cooked fresh).  The first time they were soggy, the second time they were just as i recalled.  The skinny crisp type that goes well with a hot dog. 

The dog itself was good, but when you order a hot dog with everything you should never ever have to ask for sport peppers on the dog in Chicago.  That's just wrong.  Also, not celery salt?  Are we in Wisconsin?  I was wise to their antics the second visit, but forgot to ask for celery salt.  

I also had a half beef.  The beef itself was flavorless.  I ate about half of the beef and that's it.  It was lunch time on a Friday and about 10 or less cutomers went through the drive through and into the dining area total.  I don't see how they stay in business for much longer without more people coming through.  

Also, their hot dog/fry/.5 beef combo was 7.50.  My order came to 10.70 or so with tax.  I did not add anything to the beef, so the small drink must have been $2.50.  Seems steep for a small pop.  Unless they charged me for sport peppers on the dog?  If that's the case please move to Indiana.  

At least the fries are good!

Let me start off with this, my first job was at this Luke's some 27 years ago when it was located across the street. The food was great and my friends would always comment on the great food.

I haven't eaten there in 15 years so I decided to check it out as I am now working back in the area. Oh how the mighty have seem to have fallen!

I got there just before noon. Walked into a nearly empty place that was void of any life. No music playing and the TVs I saw were either in sleep mode or had Hispanic news playing. The customers were all middle class Americans. Doubt they were watching. The dining room was warm and stuffy. Found their Thermostat by bathroom doors. It was on AC with temp set to 68 but actual temp was 79. Fans are all over dining room but all of them were off. Bathroom was dirty. Slippery floor and ceiling vent had a layer of grime and dust on it.

Staff was 3 line workers, 1 taking drive-thru orders and filling in and the other 2 were taking inside orders and traded off making food and taking orders. I did notice another employee tending to dining room. Took about 10 minutes to get my order. Italian Sausage meal with cheese for the fries.

The food was awful! What happened Torey? The It. Sausage was over cooked and had a taste of chemicals or melted plastic. The inside had a reddish/maroon color. Very strange looking. Would never order again.bBread was nice and chewy but on the dry stale side. Got a side of juice for dipping sandwich. It was so damn hot the container it was in was almost melting. It was also so shallow there was maybe an ounce of juice. Good enough for about 1-2 dips of my sandwich. They did give me a second one with no fuss. If the juice came from their homemade beef, it was sad. It tasted like beef broth at best. Cheese for fries came in same type of container. Same thing, scalding hot and not very much. Standard cheese sauce. Nothing good or great. Wouldn't get it again. Fries were exactly the same as I remember. Good and a lot of them. However, I got mostly runt ends with very little having substantial "meatiness" to them.

In all fairness, I probably could have returned the sandwich for something else but at this point of dissatisfaction and the uncomfortable temperature of the dining room I just wanted to leave. What a complete let down! Gone is the king. Sad to say I would rather eat at Portillo's.

I remember lines out the door and a drive-thru line that never ended. This place truly doesn't care anymore.

Luke's is a great place that we've been going to since before they built this place and partnered with Tore.  The hot dogs are always good and the amount of fries they give are crazy, but good!  At this location they have hot dogs, beef AND pizza.  Plus I noticed today they have chocolate cake and carrot cake!  Maybe next time I'll skip the fries so I have room for dessert.

Delicious Italian beef sandwiches. The "little beef" sandwich was the perfect amount for me. I opted for cheese with sweet and hot peppers, which were well-matched accompaniments to the beef and bread. I also ordered fries, which was a sizable portion, hot and crisp.

The sandwich will automatically be dipped in broth on one side, allowing you to grasp it with the drier side without it falling apart. The broth with the beef made for a juicy, tender, flavorful sandwich.

Service wasn't the most cheery, but the order itself only took a short time to make.

Overall a good place to dine.

I go here once in a while for my Italian beef craving. Currently, it's $9.99 for an Italian beef, large "bag o' fries" and large drink. Peppers are an extra $0.49 and cheese sauce for the fries is $0.65. The soft drinks are Pepsi products.

This place makes a solid Italian beef. Big, juicy, and flavorful. Not the best in the whole wide world, but in my opinion one of the best in the area.

The fries are hot and plentiful. Typically could use a splash more of salt.

Today, my spouse got the Jimbo Mow the Lawn salad. It was terrible. It's like cucumber that tasted like pickles, tomatoes, pepperoncini, cappicola, cheese, green and black olives, iceberg lettuce, and onions. The cappicola was slimy. The whole salad came in huge hunks and you had to cut it yourself. The salad dressing was Ken's Italian salad dressing packets. Granted, you shouldn't go to an Italian beef place for a salad, but if you got one it shouldn't be disgusting. I need something at these places to get my health-conscious spouse to go.

Also, service tends to be slow. Especially through the drive-thru. 

Based upon the roast beef because that's the claim to fame, four stars

I'll go ahead and say I've never had the beef here. (My coworker went with me once and spent a small fortune for the same thing she normally gets at Portillos for less.) What I have ordered is the #13 Schoolhouse Special. It's a HUGE slice of greasy pizza, a HUGE bag of fries, and a drink for something around $6.99+tax. The sauce is really good and the pizza tastes great.

It's easy to get in and out of this place and there's a lot of seating both inside and out.

I have been coming to this place for a year on and off. Overall the place is average at best. I have tried most of the food and nothing stands out besides the fries. Pricier than most similar restaurants. Noticed that during prime lunchtime hours the place is mostly empty. Ill come by if im the area but I would rather go to kostas or even portillos.

This place used to be fantastic. I don't know what happened, but the quality has slipped. 

When I order a Chicago dog with everything on it, why wouldn't you put sport peppers on it? Or at the very least, why wouldn't you ask? 

The dogs and beef were fantastic here. Even the polishes were good. Now? Meh. There are better options for the money.

When you're in Chicago, you'd best bring your best beef... Tore & Luke's is eh...  I just found the beef to be really dry and lacking flavor.  I ordered a combo so I got to try it with the italian sausage and that was pretty decent, but nothing spectacular also.  

On the good side, the peppers they put on the sandwich was super hot, much spicier than Portillo's.  The fries here were also awesome, I couldn't stop eating them and they give you so much!

So this is the 2nd time I've had the beef and have been quite let down by it both times despite the great reviews.  They do claim to be a pizza place, so maybe I'll have to try that out next, but I think I will avoid the Italian beef the next time around.
The food is good.  The Italian beef sandwiches are great along with the hotdogs.  I also enjoy the Italian ice.

The Italian beef is fair at best. If you get a Hot Dog, be prepared for a mountain of basic packaged frozen fries.  Nothing here is Original. After you eat here the first time. You feel like you have eaten in a thousand places just like this place.

This used to be the place for Beefs....sorry to report no longer...Absolutely no flavor and meat quality was mediocre at best. This will be my last time here as I have been disappointed in the past as well. If you want the best Italian Beef you must stick with the best and that's Portillo's. Not even sure this deserves 2 stars....Sad

Why do people like this place?  The Italian sub must be the only reason that they have return customers.  I have been here twice and both times I went through the drive thru &  I had to pull forward to wait for my order (hot dog, cheese burger & fries).  The food does not taste that great and is no better than you can get at the next grease pit. What restaurant doe not have a cheeseburger on the kids menu?  I will try not to be back here.

I wish there was one of these in the city! I grew up in Arlington heights and every time I go home to visit my parents I have to go here. I get their cheese burger and fries and honestly, choose this over portillos (if you are from Chicago you know that means it's good).

They must treat their staff well because it is always the same people there for years which means they are doing something right. 

This place has yet to disappoint me in 10+ years. Is one of my favorite places.

Another bonus? Their pizza is amazing. Bonus #2? They will deliver! I found that out about a year ago. Now if only they opened one of these downtown...life would be complete.
So I want to rate this place high but here's my issue $9.00 for two hot dogs and small drink seems way too high to me! Sad cause they do have good food and drive thur you always wait!!!

Stopped at this place because it was convenient and we were hungry.  Pizza had a strong beer taste to it, our $10.00 Italian Beef was bone dry and not that great at all.  I've eaten better beefs from hole in the wall places.  I'll never be going here again with so many other places to eat at.

Every so often I  drive by here and I get a craving for their Italian Sub   ,  and a bag of fries ,  it has always been a favorite of mine   that being said  I really have not had anything else. so i would recommend  for their subs ,  they have a Butter/oil mixture that they put on these sandwiches  thats  awesome.

This is the place. I have been going here for years! The combo is the best there is. The bag of fries (tell em crispy) can't be beat. I crave the combo with hot peppers and nothing else will do. Their sub is also awesome. Some kind of garlic butter on it makes it simply delectable. enjoy Lukes!
One of the better hot dog / Italian Beef places around. Not the fastest, but usually worth the wait.
Excellent French fries.  Good Italian beef sandwich.  Good Italian sun.  I think it is a good place to eat.

We decided to go to Tore and Luke's for a quick dinner. Right off the bat we noticed it was dead inside. Nothing like a large fast food restaurant on a Friday night at 7:15 on a busy street with no customers. We should have taken the hint and walked out!  I had s combo beef and sausage. The bread was stale. On the parts of bread that were soaked you might not have been able to tell, but most of it was not soaked, dry and no good. My wife had a chicken parm sandwich  wich turned out to have been nuked. Overall very disappointing.

Gave a 3 for 1 reason. Its simple but a big deal in chi. I ordered  2 dogs and a drink. Came with NO fries!!!  Wtf?  I dont really even like fries but still. Should have fresh cut fries in with the dog. Its a simple chi hotdog rule.   Get with it

I was out on "Nursery Row" along Rand Road in Palatine when it was lunchtime. Tore & Luke's caught my attention, being so close to Knupper's on the other side of the road. It looked more enticing than most of the chain places out that way. We came inside to cool off and give them a try.

The place is big inside - cavernous huge - with a high ceiling and plenty of floor space. Overhead, there's a large model of a WW II era fighter plane. There's also a giant deer head, a trophy swordfish and plenty of kitsch from yesteryear in the form of signs, old black & white photos and cars. There's even a multi-shelf glass cabinet with rows of miniature Model T Fords my kids stopped to admire while we waited for our food. 

I'd compare this place to Portillo's in terms of its range of menu items. It's both a hot dog/burger joint and an Italian place with pasta and pizza. After trying things from both sides of their menu, I think they execute both very well. My wife and I both ordered grilled Maxwell Polish while my kids got cheese pizza and a size of pasta. We also got a side of fries. 

Serving sizes are huge. For starters, the side order of fries alone would have been enough for all 4 of us - probably equal to 4 packets of small fries served by a well-known chain with Mc in its name. The Polish sausages were served on thick Gonnella Italian bread rolls, with what I think may have been a bit of butter inside for an even better taste. The Polish was as long as the bread it was served on and quite filling.

The cheese pizza was great too and both my kids enjoyed their slices. The pizza is a medium-thin crust, soft - not crisp, with cheese right up to the edges and a little carmelized on the outer perimeter. The slices are slender but long, which also makes them a generous serving size too. I'd definitely go for their pizza in a future visit if I'm out there again.

In all, it was a pleasant lunch in a spacious and cozy place. Tore & Luke's is definitely worth a visit if you're out in Palatine looking for a good meal.

The pizza is delicious. Even if you're not a fan of thicker crust(I'm not I prefer thin) you'll love it just for the way the sauce is seasoned and the cheese tastes.  I plan to come back to this place in the future. The staff is nice and knowledgeable.

They nail hot dogs.  Italian beef is pretty good.  I love the Italian sub loaded with garlic butter.  The pizza is not impressive,  you can't do it all.  Or at least they can't.  People complain about prices but they obviously don't eat out much,  Luke's is right in line.  The building is nice and they have a bunch of  TVs but they always have them on Telemundo and I don't care about Spanish soaps.  Anyway I have been going to Luke's forever and will keep going.  Last thought,  they have great late hours

Jury is still out for me on this place, hence the 3 star rating. 

Two hot dogs, fries and a drink for $10 is just a little steep for me. I can do the same at Frannie's on River Road for about half as much. Now, part of the reason for the price is certainly due to the humongous bag of fries that comes with the order, which were very good. But I just don't need that many fries. Would have been more satisfied had they given me 1/2 or 1/3 of the order of fries and charged $8. 

The hot dogs were fine - came with the neon type relish which is cool. But in my opinion, it's hard to botch up a hot dog, so I'm not making any Iron Chef declarations here. 

The relatively new location is nice - much better facility though they did sacrifice some visibility from the corner they used to be on. I'll be back and maybe try a beef or combo when I return. That will be more telling of whether or not my star count goes up or down.

Food is always good with a large, diverse menu, but I believe pricing is a little high for this kind of place. Their Italian subs, burgers and hotdogs are really good...Pizza is average but stay away from the beefs. The bread is way too hard and the beef is overcooked and dry and they don't put very much on. Make sure you bring a friend to share your one order of fries... Its huge! The atmosphere is large and well maintained with outdoor seating available.
Awesome Food !  The Italian Beef Sandwich Is Out Of This World ! ,As With The Italian Beef And Italian Sausage Combo !

A few years ago they had a smaller facility down the street but about 2 years ago they built a state of the art facility that is one of the nicest I have seen for a fast food restaurant.  

The Italian Beef is one of the best I have ever had.  The hot peppers on the side are some of the best as well.  They have a lot of other great food as well.  The hot dogs & pizza are a few of my other favorites.  


Not only is the facility state of the art but the drive thru is easy to get in & out of & the parking lot is big & easy to get a parking spot.  


Overall this is one of my favorite places to go for an Italian Beef & I look forward to eating here again.

I love this place! I've been going here since it was a tiny little shack of a restaurant. The burgers, fries and shakes are the best things on the menu by far. The bag of fries are gigantic and the burgers are perfect. But a warning on the fries, they can easily be shared between 2-3 people. First time I ate here, I was shocked when I got my fries and there was no way I was able to finish them and also my burger. So it's best if you can bring someone to share the fries with. The only bad thing is that the food is not very healthy. Get ready to spend the rest of next week working it off. But it's totally worth it. The interior and ambiance is laid back and casual. They also have a nice outdoor patio as well.

This is my second trip here and will be my last. Yes the new building is nice and large with a lot of seating. (very nice outdoor patio as well) Yes there are several flat screen TVs.. however all of that can not make up for the food and the high prices.

We both ordered the Italian beef. 2 Italian beefs, one large fry and 2 large drinks cost $19.38.

Gonella bread.. so that's a good thing. I was surprised at the small serving of beef and how tough it was. Not to mention stringy and bland. Really you are from Chicago how can you not season your Italian beef. At least put some salt and pepper in the gravy. The sweet peppers were mushy and flavorless.  I was surprised that my bread was tearing apart from the juice yet the beef itself was dry, don't know how they figured out how to do that and not add seasoning to anything.  

The fries are good and I would go back for them, if McDonald's was closed and I had to have for face certain death.

Next time I'll drive down Dundee to Portillo's and get the beef there.

Sorry folks, I need to take a pass on this place.

First timer today, this place was hoppin at lunch time! They have many great specials to chose from and reasonable prices! Loved the pizza slice! You get a lot of food for your money. Would come back and would recommend!
damn good place to get a dog.  i love hot dogs and they know how to make them. pizza is heavenly too.  can be a little pricey for a standard hot dog though.

I live right next to Tore & Lukes and finally took a walk here, The inside is really nice. No line People were nice. I ordered a Large Italian Ice and Bag of fries. My total was just under 5 dollars. They had it ready within seconds(but again i didnt order a meal)The Italian ice was SO GOOD! And the fries are totally worth the price. So based on that i would come back. Their pizza also looked AMAZING! 

MUCH better then the other Tore & Lukes by FAR
Real good fast food. Doesn't taste cheap like other places

I can't believe they charge $9.50 for two hotdogs, fries & a drink.  I rather eat at Portillo's or Culvers and get better tasting food for less money.

You need to re-price your items.  Plus that big bag of fries is ridiculous.  Thats like enough for 3 people.  This is why america is overweight!

Better some days and some items than others. . .felt I paid too much for the meal. This one is much newer and cleaner than the other location farther south on Rand. If you are looking for a nicer place to sit and enjoy some usually good fast food and pay a bit more than usual, this is a good choice.

PASS! The location of this place has much potential, but it is best to leave it alone and let it fail. These owners haven't much business in the food industry... I know the menu prices are low, and I understand you get what you pay for, but c'mon. 

Note to owners: When you make a beef sandwich... 1. using bread that is incredibly chewy is a bad idea.. try toasting the bread. 2. using beef that is dry and tasteless is a bad idea 3. hardly putting 'juice' on the sandwich is a no-no. 4. try shredded cheese (melts easier) instead of low quality sliced cheese. 5. when someone orders chicken fingers, try not to include pieces of  fries mixed in the chicken fingers bag.. it leaves the customer wondering how in the world they ended up with pieces of fries mixed with their chicken fingers (are things sanitary? were the employees paying attention? and so on).

My father and i went into Tore & Luke's  for our first time. I was very impressed to walk in to a cozy, air-conditioned, auto themed, and spacious restaurant. The Menu was large and easy to read, i was immediately greeted very pleasantly. I ordered the Mini Italian Beef Combo Meal with fries and a drink. I swore the bag of fries could of just filled me up! They don't rip you off on portion sizes. The beef was delicious along with my father who got a Italian sub. Great place to come for lunch. If you are looking for a great beef but don't want the long lines of Portillio's, Tore & Luke's if your place!

This place is like a Portillo's, except under a different name.  I say that because their menus are virtually identical and so is the quality.  The decor is even somewhat similar (though not the exact same) outside and in.  We ordered the cheeseburgers, fries and a slice of pizza.  The burgers were very good, and the french fries were just like McDonald's, only slightly better tasting and a whole lot more of them.  The pizza was just so-so, and I probably wouldn't order it again, but I'd come back for the burgers sometime.  When we were there, it wasn't very busy (around 2pm on a Saturday), but it still took a while to get the food.  I think that's the difference between fast food and higher-quality fast food like this.  Not only does it taste better, but it also takes a bit more time for them to prepare it.

Not only did they not speak good english, (i could not understand them and they sure could not understand me), They could not even make a chicago style hot dog! THEY ARE A HOT DOG JOINT! I watched as they made my hotdogs in horror! couldnt even remember the celery salt!!! After $10 (for 2 hotdogs a fry and sprite that tastes only like soda water thatyou can get at Tommys for $6 ) and the sinking feeling that I was going to get my food WRONG......IT WAS! Go figure! So PLEASE think twice before coming here!

I used to go to their old location back in the day but didn't visit the current place until the other day.  While walking in I noticed the patio layout, half under cover, other half open air with a nice looking fireplace for warmth during cooler summer evenings, very impressive.  The interior was a lot bigger, open & more modern than the old location, but what confused me was why there were only 3 tables of people at 1pm during the week, which usually isn't a good sign.  As I checked out the menu, I realized why the place was so empty, their prices.  A hot dog, bag o fries & drink meal was $6.85 which is pretty high.  So I opted for the hot dog, small fries & slice of pizza deal with no drink (I got a cup of water instead) which was around $7.75.  The hot dog was a typical Vienna, nothing to write home about, the pizza was decent, didn't taste like it was sitting around, and the fries were alright & plentiful.  I felt I got a good amount of food for the price I paid compared to some of the other combinations they offer.  It's too bad their prices are so high, I'd probably eat here more often if they were lower.

Their Italian beef is very poor quality, Portillos is better not mention we found some hard thing in our sandwich and it was not fat so I had to throw out myItalian sausage sandwich halfway through, scary!  Next my wife ordered the turkey croissant.  The croissant was freezer burned served with one very thin slice of turkey dry and they forgot the mayo even after reminding them twice.  Instead she got a freezer burnt lettuce and tomatoe croissant, very appetizing.  When we tried to take hers back for something else, the guy rolled his eyes at us, grabbed the sandwich out of my hands slammed the window in our face and let us sit there not knowing if he was remaking it, giving us a refund or what.  At this point we were so disgusted with the way they treated their customers  and the quality of the food, we just left.  Yes, out the money and out the lunches.  Do you really think we would have trusted these people to give us something else?  They probably would have spit in our food, no thanks see ya never to go back again.  

We are Italian and make Italian Sausage at home, if they think they can remotely come close to calling what they serve Italian sausage they are sadly mistaken and have a lot to learn!  Waiting for summer to fire up the grill to make some real Italian Sausage.  If I had staff treating my customers this way they would be fired.  Mr. Tore and Mr.  Luke need to go under cover boss to this location!

My friend took me here and said it has been completely renovated. It's much bigger now and it has a drive-thru.

I ordered the #1 (Hot dog, fries, and drink) for about $6.50. Food was great. Can't wait to try their onion rings. Prices were all very reasonable. There were about 3 HDTV's on the walls. Has a party/large group atmosphere.
I love this place! The interior is amazing, my kids love it here! The fries are the best around (in my opinion) and the bag is big enough for everyone to share.  Great Chicago dogs!

I didn't want to drive far and I live right next to here so I decided to get some food after work. Terrible. I got a chili dog and 2 tamales. The chili dog was so bad, i couldnt even eat it. It tasted like it had been sitting out all day. Dry and bland. The tamales werent even warm when i recieved them but because i was so hungry i warmed it up at home and ate some of the tamale and the second tamale was so bad. Totally dry and no taste. All the signs said that their Italian beef is so great but is that all that is good? I wanted to order pasta and it said pasta on the neon lights but when I asked for pasta the guy said they didn't have any. So why have it on the menu?  
Doubt ill be coming back here ever again unless its to try their supposedly best Italian beef ever.
Greasy heaven.  The Italian beef here is top notch.  The subs leave much to be desired though - they're mostly hard bread and lettuce.

I live right next to this place, so I have tried it a lot of times for a lot of different things.  The only thing I have ever really enjoyed is the pizza.  Everything else was pretty bland.  They have very large portion sizes.  I would call them too large.  Also it is too expensive for fast food.  I don't think I will be back there again.

I grew up on the Luke's across the street but I think this is just as good. I find everything to be really good including their pizza surprisingly, however I always go with the italian beef. This is my second choice under Portillo's for italian beef.

I enjoy the HUGE bag of delicious fries (only reason why I gave 3 stars) that they provide with the $6 and up meals but it's not worth it if half of your lunch party doesn't get their food until 20 min later b/c they forgot to put the hot dogs together.  Negative.  Food was Portillos-esque, service was very bad.  Probably won't go again.

Every so often I get into my car at lunch and decide I want,  NO!  I NEED an Italian beef!  Today was such a day and I'm left to ask myself once again, why did I pick this place again?

OK, for whatever reason, I've gotten the #3 lunch special here a bunch of times over the last few months and always leave disappointed.  I'll say the pizza slices look good, but since I always end up here with a beef craving, that's how I base my review- on the Beef/Fries/medium drink combo.

The beef itself is pretty dry.  And not well seasoned either- very plain and cooked almost to death.  I order mine hot & juicy.  The hot part they get right- a nice amount of peppers and veggies, chopped small and spread evenly across the beef.  But the juicy part is totally not good.  First- I'm convinced it's not actual beef juice and probably never had anything to do with the beef until it hit my sandwich!  It's incredibly oily, like they squeezed the giardiniera oil all over the bun, but with no flavor- ewh.  So since the "juice" lacks any real seasoning or beef flavor, it just makes your sandwich a gross greasy mess.  Ok, today there was a faint flavor to the oil.  Are you ready for this?  FISH!  Yup, somehow, my juicy beef had a faint flavor of fishiness.  I'm not sure what's grosser- that or the fact that I was so hungry I ate it anyway!?!

So the icing on the cake is always the price- $7.99 for a beef combo!?!  Yeah- I'm the fool who spent $9.20 w/tax on a fishy, greasy, oily beef today.  At least the beef is really big, so it's not a total rip.  Will I fall for this place's beef lunch again?  No!  But I'll give 'em another shot for a slice of Pizza sometime.
There hot dogs are great and I love their french fries. They have the long skinny ones which are best with lots of cheese!

i've been comnig to tore & lukes for years, my faves are their fries (1 order is enough for 2-3 people) Italian beef with sweet peppers, and the meatball sandwich with mozarella. my boyfriend had the combo, and although he wasn't as excited as I was he still said it was good. I have a portillo's near my house, but I still prefer Tore & Lukes beef sandwiches.

Everything is overpriced to say the least. Decent dog's and love the bag o fries, but that isn't enough to make me want to come back and pay more than other places in the area. With a Portillos down the road I would think they would be a little more aggressive with the prices/specials.

they aight... if you like allen dale shoe string fries like McDonalds... they'll give you a whole lot of em... but the combos are pricey and what you're paying for is the xtra fries... the pizza by the slice when i've gotten it has been kind of soggy and the sausage is about the size of a cherry and its kinda too dense...

First off I would like to start by saying the food is excellent the bread was amazing and the sauce was delightful. 

I feel the price was more than fair and noticed in one review somebody was complaining about the price but for the quality and quantity it seems like a great deal to me. Keep up the good work

I'm a fan of middle eastern / asian food and living in the Schaumburg / Elk Grove area has given me plenty of opportunity to try a lot of different places. Yes, I'm a white guy but I'm not a "gringo" when it comes to Indian.

This place is fantastic. I'm enjoying my first taste now - traditional chicken with veggies and vindaloo with garlic naan and samosas.  The vindaloo is great - plenty of heat but not overwhelming. I can get the heat but also taste plenty of the other flavors. The veggies might be my favorite part - peppers and onions. The chicken is excellent as well.

The naan is great. I like it a LITTLE bit crispier and fresh out of a clay oven, but I'm not complaining. The samosa is crispy and flaky and the tamarind nicely works with the heat of the vindaloo.

Excellent place and fast. In and out in minutes. I'll be coming back again.

Been eyeing this place since moving to the neighborhood. Grabbed the lamb vindaloo over basmati rice. It was excellent. I also snagged a couple samosas. Outstanding. And, the naan bread was also perfect. 

Overall, this place was worth the visit and I hope it stays for a long time!

I have been watching this location with eager eyes ever since I saw the sign for "Tandoori Indian Grill" go up however many months ago.  At last they have opened and it is exactly what I had hoped for and anticipated.  This place is basically the Chipotle of Indian food.  You order at the counter and move along the sequential menu.  First you select the "style" of your meal.  Your choices are naan on the side, rice/biryani, or pieces of naan just thrown in the bowl.  It looks like they will be adding further options beyond these eventually.  After you choose the style of the dish you then pick the bulk of your meal, either a meat or paneer or tofu.  Next you choose a topping - I don't remember all the choices, but I did veggies and hubby did potatoes.  Finally, you choose the curry sauce, bearing in mind whether you like things spicy or not.  If you are a newbie to this sort of food, or just want to try something out first before committing, the staff is very willing to let you sample whatever you need to.

I ordered the lamb biryani, tikka style, with garlic naan.  My husband got paneer in whatever they call their cream sauce and also got garlic naan.  We were both super satisfied with our food.  HOWEVER, remember I said this is the Chipotle of Indian food, not the Alinea of Indian food.  That means, yes, I have had better naan elsewhere, blah blah, but I feel that Tandoori Indian Grill has successfully executed the concept they set out to and I hope they are around for a long time.  Moreover, this place is especially great for folks who may not usually do Indian food, or who are afraid of spicy, such as my husband.  The food is customizable, the place is easygoing and casual, and the staff is friendly and approachable.

In addition to the above named menu items, they also have an Indo-Chinese menu including hakka noodles and some other stuff, if that's more your style.  We'll definitely be back soon to sample the other things they have to offer.

Obviously this place is still super new and not everything on the menu is available yet, but so far we are impressed with the overall concept for the restaurant, the food (in view of the concept), and especially the friendly staff!  Here's hoping that our subsequent visits will continue to build on our great first impression.  Best wishes for success to all involved.  :)

I wish I could give more stars for this place. The food is superb and the employees are very friendly and helpful. I came at a slow time and was contemplating what I wanted so they offered a sample for me. Spicy Chicken Biryani Bowl with mild curry and chickpeas yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaas.

I will take this over any other local fast food place any day. Mango Lassi is now on the menu as well and it is delicious.

Great place for indian food in an american style. I loved the palak paneer! I would definitely come
back to this place whenever am in chicago.

Amazing quick Indian food! I got a chicken tikka rice bowl and it was superb. I was pretty skeptical at first that they would be able to blend everything together perfectly but it worked out well. The tikka curry is bomb, very flavorful with not much heat. I only got the rice bowl and it cost a little over $7 and it filled me up.

My friend got the biryani rice w/ lamb but no curry and a garlic naan on the side, and she loved it. I stole a few bites and the lamb was tender with a lot of flavor. The garlic naan stole the show too, so I might have to mix it up next time and get the traditional bowl instead of the rice bowl. The biryani rice had bits of vegetables like cut peppers and onions and was very flavorful. It costs $1 extra but I think it's well worth the extra flavor. I'm very surprised that their prices are similar to Chipotle, seems like a Lamb bowl will run you around $9 with tax. I can't wait to try more curries eeeeeekk! It looks like they're still working on extra menu items like sides but I can't wait to come back!

Beyond ECSTATIC this place has opened in the area! The food is EXCELLENT and I love the convenience of being able to carry out what usually would be an hour lunch at a sit down restaurant. The garlic naan is incredible and the samosas are on point (the filling is wonderful)! I had the naan pieces with lamb vindaloo and the potatoes - I am not big on rice so the naan pieces were a wonderful addition to the menu! Overall this place is definitely worth the visit, I really hope this says around for a VERY long time!!

Yummmmy. Rice Bowl with chicken & Tika sauce, FAB. 
Only a few tables but great carry out!
Definitely a new favorite. 
Chipotle for Indian food. Very reasonably priced.

The chipotle of Indian food.  The owner was so nice and helpful. The place is small and clean.  The food is delicious. The options are great.  I get the best of my favorite Indian flavors fast and convenient.  I'm already looking forward to my next time to try another combination.

Kind of reminiscent of Chipotle.  One chooses the rice, then meat, the topping, finally the curry.  The curry's tend to be a bit sweet and most are all tomatoey based.  Fortunately the salt level are low unlike most Indian places which was good.  We had both chose lamb.  The lamb is tender, and intended for those who are not really into lamb, as the lamb taste was weak.

Price is good we spent $21 including soda.

I gave it two stars as the food is Indian like, in the same way Chipotle is not Mexican.   So if one is expecting traditional Indian food this is not the place and you most likely will be disappointed.
Delicious Chicken Curry. Very Friendly Staff. Recommend this place for sure. Love the station options which makes your meal more personalized.

A Chipotle concept, to be sure, however it does not work.
Bland meats, subpar sauces, bad prices. Just bad. Go to a real Indian place.
By the way, the portions were horribly small. I was still hungry when I finished.

Was quite skeptical when entered coz mostly the experience with such indian concept does not work. But this was fabulous and staff was really courteous. I would have given 5 stars if the Naans were not like breads else everything was super

I love to see new twist on Indian food and ready the Yelp reviews to give this place a try. Good food but I have serious doubts that the business model can sustain at the current price levels. They need to cut the prices in their current menu by at least $2 to make sense.

Rice, protein, side and a samosas or naan for $9-$10 before tax is too much in current economy where I can get w good meal at chipotle for $6.50. It's a fast food place charging more than buffet prices.

This place is GREAT. Even though it's a hole in the wall, the food is delicious and the options are numerous. Structured like an Indian Chipotle, this place packs big flavor for very reasonable pricing. I tried their chicken tikka with basmati rice, which was to die for. I plan on returning soon and slowly eating my way through the menu.

Great food. Good price for portion suze. Their tamarind churney is so good.
My husband is indian who dislikes indian food and he even thought the food was good!!

Really impressed with the variety of options, and the amazing flavor of the food. I had the paneer with chickpeas, peppers and cauliflower, with the spicy sauce and a side of garlic naan. Delish.

Plus, the owner couldn't be nicer. I'll definitely be back.

It is really rating closer to a 3 now but I would like to see this small business succeed.  The food has been a bit inconsistent our last few visits.  The naan which we enjoyed so much  has often been less fresh and a bit dried out.  The sauces have become a bit spicier - we preferred the slightly milder versions.  There is also too much sauce in proportion to meat.  It would be nice if there was a divider for the veggies too so they do not get inundated by the sauce.  Just a bit of tweaking and more consistency is all that is needed.  The concept is great.

Really impressed!!! I got the plain rice bowl with spicy chicken, chickpeas, and tikka sauce - divine!! Portions were good and prices very reasonable (about $7 for my meal). The guy working was very friendly and offered to sample any sauces that I wanted. He mentioned that they are starting lunch specials soon so I will definitely be back! Great addition to the area.

Five stars for super tasty Indian food on the go. Love the biryani rice bowl with paneer and makhani sauce! The samosas are melt in your-mouth-good. We find the entree portions generous but we also get a side of naan because it's that good. On our last visit they added mango lassis to the menu which was a great compliment to the flavorful meal. This is better than Roti because of the authentic sauces. Try it, you'll like it.

I've been here twice now already and both times were incredible. Great, fast-casual style Indian food. Reasonably priced, fair portions, and delicious options for both meat eaters and non-meat eaters. I will definitely be a regular here.
This is the best Indian cuisine in the greater Chicago-land area. The naan bites are the best. The rice is cooked to perfection and the service is top notch. I wish they had a location in the loop.

As lovers of Indian cuisine we tried to manage our expectations of "take out Indian food". However, we were pleasantly surprised by the authentic taste and well seasoned dishes. Great for a quick lunch option. I wish the portions were slightly larger, but naan, samosa,etc. can be added on the side for additional sustenance. We will be back!!

I found their food to be very tasty, not to spicy but definitely with a kick.  Pros-they let you sample the food, very friendly workers, good prices, nice selection.  Cons-I wish they had family sized portions, for example that I could purchase a large amount for my entire family, also the naan was a bit hard, I assume being new is the reason so not a big deal.  I would come here again.

Fantastic!!!

This place has great food and they were very obliging to my busy 2 year old. That in itself deserves a 5 start rating. Any place that can feed him with a smile is good in my book.

This is like any great pancake house.  They have lots of breakfast and lunch choices, bottomless cups of coffee and they get packed on weekends.  I've been here at least 3 times. I've enjoyed my meals everytime and the service has always been attentive and friendly.

Great little place for some breakfast food !
Most breakfast places are hard to rate because the food is all the same lol however I would say this place is above average with food and service. It's not the best breakfast place in the world but I enjoy it!

This is by far the worst breakfast place I've ever been to.

I met two friends here for brunch on a Saturday morning.  It was packed, and the service was lacking, but my problem was with the food.  My skillet was the greasiest, grossest soaking pile of potatoes and eggs that I'd ever had!  I literally felt ill afterwards.  Some of the potatoes were so shiny and soggy that I couldn't even pick them up with a fork.  Also, their upcharge pricing for substitutions is ridiculous for the suburbs -- $4 to make my two pancakes gluten free?  Really?  For $15 before tip, I had a more expensive and worse-tasting brunch than I'd had anywhere else in the area.

My friend seemed to like her potato pancakes, so maybe the skillets are just not their best item? But I sure won't come here again.  Head on over to Billy's or Wildberry instead if you want a good brunch option for your money.

Underwhelming.  Hash browns boring. Omelette flavorless.  Appeared to be egg beaters instead of egg whites. Couldn't substitute fruit for the English muffin.  
Perhaps their lunch food is better.

As my husband just said, "They give you a lot of food for almost nothing!" This place as an extensive menu; all items are reasonably priced and portions are large! I had a Denver omelette (no pepper, with tomato); it came with pancakes and hash browns. My husband had the biscuits and gravy. Initially I was concerned that meal would not be enough for him, but I was entirely wrong! It was huge (much like my meal). I recommend this place wholeheartedly! Service was prompt and we were in and out in no time even though it looked crowded.

A very good breakfast spot for hungry morning diners. They have lots of seating so you don't have to wait long for a table. Many delicious menu items to choose from. Large portions. A friendly waitstaff ensures you have hot coffee and hot food. I really enjoyed their pancakes and ham of the bone.

Been here a couple of times and must say it's a pretty good breakfast for reasonable prices... 

I'm not too much of a fan of sweet but based on a sampling of their signature pumpkin pancakes... agree they are good... and relieved to note they had swapped out the BAD coffee they were experimenting with the previous visit... so no negatives to note in this review.

They listen to the customers... it wasn't just our table of four that was noting how awful and weak the coffee was... yay.

Service is good and I recommend sharing if you are getting an omelet... otherwise expect leftovers. Not convenient if you are heading out for the day.

I am NOT a morning person, much less a daily breakfast eater - unless of course its breakfast in the afternoon (or evening).  Sure, I'll occasionally drag myself out of bed to meet up with overly perky, energetic & highly annoying "morning" people from time to time....Why? cause I do LOVE breakfast foods (and people)...
More savory than sweet to be honest and Red Apple delivers to ALL who crave BOTH.

I'm a huge fan of this place for so many reasons...they serve an extensive variety of breakfast & lunch items that just tastes fresh and home made..I've
dined in & ordered carry-out countless times..

The restaurant is located on Plum Grove, and you enter via parking lot (located in front of entrance), which can fill up really quick, especially on weekends.  I wouldn't have noticed this place, had other's who worked in the area not mentioned it... I imagine its easy to miss, as I've drove past it many times in the past.

Some favorites -   The oven baked omelets.  DELICIOUS.  Cooked to perfection..I usually get
"My Big Fat Greek Omelet" (sans tomato & onion) w/hashbrowns and it's enormous...fluffy...full of fresh spinach & good amount of feta you can taste...I can never finish this and end up bringing the rest home.  I've also had them substitute egg beaters or egg whites and it's just as delicious and fluffy...I love the hash browns too...crispy and tender.  Not all restaurants can perfect a crispy, shredded hash brown....

Of all the sweet breakfast options here, I have only had the Buttermilk pancakes and they were pretty yummy.   Really tender and soft; not 'cakey'.  I'm picky with pancakes, and these cooks know how to make them.... They have 13 pancake varieties...and they all sound amazing...not to mention a great selection of Waffles, French toasts, Crepes, Skillets, Biscuits & Gravy, Eggs Benedict....(I need to try ALL of these and make up for lost breakfast time...).

Salads and soups are some of my menu favorites & are excellent.  "The Popeye" (fresh spinach, sliced mushrooms, hard boiled egg & crisp bacon) w/a cup of soup...has been my 'go to' many a time...always fresh..THE SOUPS?
Omg, they make wonderful HOME MADE soups here, offering 2-3 choices which vary daily,  Sometimes, I just order the soup.  They'll include 2-3 of their house made rolls in bag, & I'm set..  Cream of chicken w/wild rice is a must get (or Lentil or Split pea...all fantastic, and not "heavy"). Egg Lemon soup is offered on Sundays & is VERY popular, LOVE THIS... The corned beef Rueben is excellent too and the portion is huge...

I haven't eaten anything I didn't like here. It is always consistently good.  They have daily menu board specials that are unique for a coffee shop/cafe...Salmon, Wraps, Paninis' & homemade chili!.
Red Apple keeps it interesting. Offering traditional breakfast & lunch items with out-of-the ordinary eats, you wouldn't expect in a homey, casual diner...

Prices are reasonable, staff is super friendly and accommodating, portions are generous...Food is tasty & fresh and reminds me of home cooking...You could probably walk in with your PJ's on and feel right at home....it's definitely "laxed" here....

Only thing I don't like about Red Apple?  THEY CLOSE AT 3:00...They are popular people... Greek owners & Sam is delightful!....OPEN EVERYDAY..  I recommend stopping in EARLY on weekends cause they can pack in a crowd.....

**Free coffee BEFORE 11AM on weekdays, w/purchase of $5.99 meal**

**Check them out on facebook..They post daily soups & specials HERE**

facebook.com/RedAppleOfPalatine

RISE & SHINE PEOPLE...(I am projecting again....)

Red Apple is not a 5/5 because there could not be a better breakfast/lunch/brunch place, but because even if there was something else worth a 5/5, it still wouldn't be "better". Everything here is fresh, wonderful tasting, and too generously portioned to not feel guilty.

The ambiance and decor is cozy, very home-like, and downright Americana. THIS is the brunch place you bring your out-of-towner friends/family to showing them home-grown, family style, Midwest hospitality. Just go and enjoy, as it is our regular brunch spot!

Don't go there if you are in a hurry. This is a down home restaurant, if you go there a couple of times, they remember you and treat you like family. The owner's are always there working to make your meal experience wonderful. They serve breakfast and lunch. They have plenty of salads for the lite fare and seasonal specialty items. Try the pumpkin pancakes or the very berry pancakes, the grilled pork chops and eggs are my favorite.

Great menu! So many options! Loved it  I took my parents here. My Moms new favorite. 
Im gonna have to take her every time shes in town now. The menu is extensive. 
Ive never seen so many kinds of pancakes! The crepes were delicious and my club sandwich was take home worthy and i don't do leftovers. I definitely recommend this place for anything from a lunch w Mom and Dad or that morning after a Long Late night. Ya .. A++

Great place!  Went there with my mom and we loved the food.  The skillets were great and delicious omelets but the pancakes not really a fan.  Can't wait to go back and try the lunch items!  A new favorite spot for sure.  Will be back!

We are regulars here. The food is consistently very good, the waitstaff are friendly and fast, and the hostess and owners are the nicest people. 

We go once a week for breakfast, and have tried nearly everything on the menu. My husband's favs are the steak and eggs and the special (don't wait, it may not be around forever) southern chicken benedict. I love the skillets and the other benedicts. My daughter likes the pancakes and waffles. 

The fact that we are always there for breakfast makes me a little sad, because their lunches are excellent. You have to try the soup. Any of them. They are excellent.

Moral of the story: try it, you'll like it!

This is a nice place to get brunch! Got here about an hour before closing, and they didn't have a problem with that! I had a Mediterranean Skillet...it had tomato, feta cheese, and onions in it...it was so good and tasty..I'm craving it right now! Haha. I'm gonna take my husband here soon!

Ate here late on a late Sunday morning and the place was packed. We had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. Very crowded small space to wait and the hostess that was trying to manage things and seat people was loud and panicky. 

Got seated and it took another 10 minutes for a waitress to even greet us. We asked for coffee and placed our orders at the same time. Waitress said she'd be back with the coffee, but she never did come back with it! Our food came out quickly by another waitress and we told her we never got our coffee. She immediately sprang into action and got it for us. Our original waitress did apologize for that. She then checked on us several times throughout the meal and also refilled our coffee.

We both had the Denver omelette, hash browns, and pancakes. The food was delicious - one of the best omelettes I've ever had; just oozing with cheese. Not greasy. Hash browns were perfect, being crisp on the outside but not burnt. Pancakes were good, but nothing outstanding. Coffee was mediocre.

I recommend this place for the food, but be prepared to wait for a table and dine in a crowded, slightly noisy, outdated decorated establishment.

Late Saturday morning after running errands calls for a little breakfast. I wasn't sure that I felt like the usual standbys so we ventured a little further north to stop in at the Red Apple. 

This is a pretty large restaurant which meant that even though the parking lot was just about full, we didn't have to wait for our table. Score!  My husband was thrilled that he could watch college football with a choice view right from his seat. 

I really was leaning toward some crunchy almond French toast served with bananas and caramel, but I really am counting my calories and I think that would have put me at the limit until about Tuesday. Instead, I opted for a chicken salad sandwich on sourdough toast. He chose corned beef hash, two poached eggs, hash browns and a side of pancakes instead of toast. My sandwich was really good. I stuck to half and that was plenty. I was surprised to find the toast was buttered, so while it tasted great, the menu didn't provide a heads up on that one. The French fries were very good, but most of those came home for someone else to enjoy. His poached eggs were just right!  

The service was very attentive. The whole visit really was a pleasant surprise. I am confident that we will head in again.

A winner for breakfast on a weekend.  I called ahead to be sure if there was a wait.   No wait, but when I arrived the parking lot was mostly full.   But we were seated without a wait as promised and quickly offered a cup of coffee.  Good experience. 

I took a gander around to see what everyone was having.  Everything looked great and in good portions.   Everyone walking out the door had leftover tins.  

I ordered chicken fried steak with hash browns, over easy eggs and a complimentary side of buttermilk pancakes.  

Red Apple meets all expectations of a consistent good weekend breakfast experience.  Courteous service, good value and portions.  Meets my expectations.  Great times, I found a new favorite breakfast place!

Everyone is comparing this place to wild berry and I'm not sure why. Wild berry doesn't hold a candle to Red Apple! I had the apple French toast and boy was it amazing, like eating apple pie filling on custardy delicious French toast (yummmm) coffee is standard drip with no bitterness and the service is top notch. Our waitress was super sweet and kept our coffee mugs full at all times. Highly recommend for a modestly priced breakfast (without a 45 minutes wait)

Just walked out due to the customer service. Having never been here before I went to the cashier to put our name in & she ignored me but took care of people coming up after me to pay. I had to ask another customer where to out our name in & when I went to the person he pointed to I was told "no you wait". With those customer service skills I am not interested giving you my business because clearly they don't care about the customer.

What a great place!  Have been going here for years - the owners/staff are really friendly and the food is always great (their breakfasts are especially good)
Highly recommended!

Delicious lemon ricotta pancakes and VERY FAST service. Hubby and I came in on a Saturday morning, and there was no need to wait! But for a breakfast place, the windows are closed, so artificial lights are on. I want to see natural sunlight for breakfast!

Always looking for new, delicious, breakfast spots in the northwest suburbs. Came across this one because of the Yelp ratings and they did NOT disappoint. Came in Sunday early afternoon, seated instantly, served quickly with fresh and delicious food. Coffee was amazing. I had a skillet which was baked to perfection. Great prices, great food and friendly service - will definitely come back.

First visit for a Sunday breakfast. The place couldn't have been nicer. Our server was Irina and she was excellent. Our food was delivered fast and was very good. My wife had crepes and I has the Eggs Benedict. Both were exceptional. The owner even gave us a bowl of Greek lemon cream of Chicken soup to take with us. They couldn't have been nicer. Check them out.  We will certainly be back again!

The food is absolutely amazing! I couldn't get over how big the bacon pieces were! Our sever sue was probably one of the least attentive servers I've had in a long time. Can't say I've had anyone walk away while I'm talking to her asking for something. I'm a server I understand getting busy and other tables you throwing you off but that's no excuse for the way she took care of us. Other than that I will be back!

Went in on a Sunday morning. They were super busy and crowed, but we were seated immediately. Very friendly staff and owners. I had the apricot, raspberry, three bread French toast. It was amazing. 3 different types of French toast, crunchy, banana bread and cinnamon swirl. With whipped cream cheese apricots and raspberries, and sliced almonds. Sounds like a lot but it was soooo delicious. My sister got the meat lovers skillet. Super yummy also. If I'm ever in that area again I'd love to try them again

Came here for the first time with my wife after hearing so many great things. We came for lunch, which was pretty good but nothing over the top. We will be back for breakfast soon, everyone in the restaurant was ordering breakfast during lunch and from what I understand it's for good reason.

Great Service, Perfect for a lazy weekend brunch. AnBest part is, it is not overcrowded like some of the places in schaumburg like wildberry cafe. Beat the lines and still retain the same quality of food.

Breakfast has always held an important place in my heart. When you figure that, most days, my training diet doesn't allow food until 11 or 12, it takes on a whole new meaning. 
So when we finally found a weekend day to visit Red Apple Pancake house, we were ecstatic. Finally an opportunity to nosh on all the goodness my Yelp compadres have gushed about.
We were seated almost immediately, at a 4 seater table next to the fireplace. The interior is decorated with a country kitchen feel, but tastefully. You get a warm sense of being home, minus the cooking and cleanup.
Before us was a menu loaded with every combination possible, of fresher cooked goodies. It took us some time to land a decision, what with all the incredible combinations and choices. Skirt steak and eggs, with blueberry pancakes for me, the BF got a Mediterranean omelet with avocado, fruit on the side, and a fresh baked blueberry muffin. (Which was still warm from the oven)
