Food came flying out to the table in a matter of minutes and we dove into the perfectly prepped plates before us. Our waiter was super personable, had us laughing and kept our coffee cups full.
This is how you do breakfast. 
Upon leaving, there was a small line. The hostess apologized and chatted with us before Sam, (an owner) rang us out. Both of them were so polite and happy to have us- it just made the experience that much better. 
Everything about this place will keep me coming back. It has that family feel that other breakfast chains truly can't compete  with. It's how a breakfast deprived girl (me) wants all of her binge breakfasts to be.

Probably the best breakfast place in the area for the money. Breakfast items are consistently well done. Soups are homemade. Overall very happy with the quality of the food. Service usually acceptable and I have been back several times. We have never been here for lunch so I cannot speak to the lunch items. Omelets are large and fluffy, hash browns are crisp, coffee is diner coffee nothing special there. Overall its an old school breakfast place that churns out consistently good food. Other breakfast places in the area are either unacceptable or overpriced.

I want to like this Red Apple location, like really really want to like it.  My friends and I have been going to their other location for years, and I haven't been since we moved an hour North.  I was super excited when I realized that Red Apple has another location which is much closer to us.

There is only 1 thing I get when I go to Red Apple.  In fact, I dream about it.  Their strawberry crepes are out of this world!  I don't get the glaze or anything, just 2 simple crepes stuffed with fresh strawberries.  I'm not sure if they changed the crepe batter across the board, if it's a specialty reserved for the other location, or if maybe the chef was having a bad day, but what I got was an awful eggy mess.  It seriously tasted like I was eating a sweet egg omelet with a few pieces of strawberries strewn about.  It didn't come with whipped cream or powdered sugar this time, and it sort of reminded me of a lunch cafeteria's Monday "mystery meat" special.  I choked down 1 crepe, and boxed up the other one out of respect for what I've had in the past.

Nothing else that we ate was that spectacular either, and with several other winning breakfast places, in the area, Red Apple will be a skip for us (unless we can get to their other location).

We showed up around 11AM on Sunday and, despite the huge crowd, the family that walked in before us AND we were seated immediately. The waitress was prompt. I ordered the French Orchard breakfast and my bf ordered some kind if Berry french toast. Both of us cleaned our plates. I would definitely eat here again. Only negative was a single dirty water glass and extremely over priced OJ. I tried to justify the $4 12oz glass to my bf with the fact there is a plight destroying orange trees in FL.

AMAZE-BALLS! Awesome! What more can I say. Everything is good there.. even the coffee. There's just something about this place. Egglectic cafe used to be my favorite go-to place for bkfst, but I think i've got a new fav! The skillets are amazing..pancakes to die for and everything i've had just makes me keep wanting to go back !! YUMMO!

I've been here a few times. This place makes me happy. I must admit I've only ever ordered the quiche because where else can you find quiche on the daily menu? It comes with shredded hash browns and fresh fruit. The staff has never been anything  but lovely even when I asked to see a certain. sporting event and they had to figure out how to get it on their TV.
The corned beef hash is from a can. Everything is soaked in grease. The service was fast and full of mistakes. And as soon as we got home all three of us hit the bathrooms. Seriously disgusting.

I was seated within 3 seconds of walking in the door.  Placed my order and it was done in 5 minutes.  The Mediterranean omelette was huge and fluffy, and absolutely delicious. This is the first time I have taken home half of my omelette from a restaurant as left overs in over 20 years.  The staff was professional, attentive and polite.  I could not be happier unless it was half price or free.  Other restaurants in the area serve omelettes for $1 cheaper but with 1/3 less food.
I can't wait to go back to try their crepes and pancakes!
Food is good typical breakfast stuff. Nothing outstanding. Service is good. Just too many old people and whiny kids ! Room seems a bit cramped and kinda impersonal.....

We have been coming here since it opened and never had any bad experience here. Both Sam and Angelo are very nice and on top of running this place. Can't beat their nice large Omlets! My wife always orders the Portabella Mushroom Omlet and I get one of the Samplers. Their Bacon has the best flavor and I always order extra side order. We never had a bad soup here either as all their soups are delicious. One item they have had lately for breakfast is the Lemon Pancakes ... excellent!! For lunch the Super Grilled Cheese is our favorite. The one item that I wish they would add to the Lunch Menu is a nice Chopped Steak with grilled onions. They make a great Patty Melt so it could not be much more to make Chopped Steaks too. Also, you cannot beat their home made Apple Pies ... never saw a pie so high and filled with apples as they have (my Mom made them that way). Don't miss trying their Apple Pie! FIVE Stars  for this place!!

We stopped going here about two years ago after being weekly patrons for quite some time.  Our servers cared more about a table of screaming out-of-town soccer kids than us.  We never got coffee refilled, our order was wrong and cold, and took forever to place our order (even though we were there well before the screaming brats with badly behaved parents).  Management did nothing to correct the problem other than taking the coffee off our bill (big deal, we each only got about 4 ounces to begin with).  

I hate it when people complain here but never complain in person about a bad experience.  But we politely complained and didn't get any resolution.  So now I'm telling you about it here.

I am SO GLAD I stopped going to this overrated pit because we have found so many superior restaurants including Gus' Diner and Mr. Allison's to dine at instead.  

Don't give self-centered, rude owners and cashiers your money.
AVOID!

When you go here you feel like family. There is always a wait which is a great sign of how good they are, but they are quick to seat you. Steak and Eggs are delicious and their skillets beat all others I've had. Choose Red Apple the next time you want to go get a great breakfast with your family.

Better than average.  Not as good as a place such as Wildberry but when Wildberry has a wait time that is too long at times,  where we don't have the 40 minutes to wait every time, we default go here as a first alternative as it is also close to Wildberry in terms of location for us.

The only thing they need to improve breakfast-wise is there toast, it's terrible.  That is a huge disappointment when i go to a restaurant and the toast sucks.  They need good bread, such as the kind you get at places like Whole Foods, Fresh Market, Antonio's market in Arlington heights, etc.  you get the point, it's low-end bread they are using so the toast here has no substance or flavor.  It's the kind of toast you find at cheap establishments and these guys are better than that.  So do not know why they skimp on getting a little more expensive bread, especially good multigrain.  When i say better i mean that it needs to be thicker more hearty whole grain bred with either stuff like oats, sunflower seeds, etc on top that you find in higher end supermarkets if that makes sense.  More density.

3.5 stars but rounded up for optimism.

I've had great experiences here and I've had "meh" experiences here. 
The last adventure was more meh. 

Everything felt rushed but also took awhile. It was an odd feeling, especially for breakfast. 

My wife ordered gluten-free pancakes. Their fluffiness made her woeful that maybe they weren't gluten-free but kudos to RAPH if they were :)

It's standard breakfast fare on a pretty big breakfast menu. 
What you see is what you get. 

One day I'll order the apple pancake that takes 25 minutes to be prepared. 
...one day
Food here is always good. Delicious pancakes, perfect French toast, properly made omelettes. Moving away from the area, and sad to be leaving Red Apple behind. I'll be back.

Best gluten-free waffle, heck best waffle, I've ever had! My husband had their regular bacon waffle which he liked a lot. Their apple-maple chicken sausages (4 good-sized ones per serving) were so delicious as well.  On Sunday morning there was a wait for a table and for the food to come out, but it was well worth it. The staff there are very nice as well. I will be back!
Food is delicious and service is great. I've been to several top rated pancake houses in the area and Red Apple is the winner. Big portion size and fresh ingredients. Will definitely go there again!

I've been looking around the suburbs for the last couple months trying to see if I can find any restaurant to make me change my mind about Red Apple being the best overall family/breakfast+lunch type restaurant in the area and I can't really find anything to change my mind. I've tried a lot of restaurants including Mr Allisons, Billy's Pancake House, Dunton House, Egg Harbor Cafe, Cafe Fourteen, Maxfield's Restaurant, Jason's Deli, Wildberry Cafe, Ritzy's Cafe, Walker Brothers, Egglectic Cafe, Denny's, Bakers Square, etc.

Criteria that I look for include food, service, parking, prices, variety, freshness, decor, and method of handling the long lines. Red Apple manages to excel in pretty much all these categories. Food is always in large portions, fresh, consistent, and well planned in execution (although Egg Harbor Cafe wins here). Service is quick and friendly. They try to offer new menu items from time to time and have a decently large menu. Decor is a bit above average although not as nice as Wildberry Cafe. All in all, it's pretty hard not to have a good experience here.

In fact, I was debating whether I should write another review for Red Apple. It's already quite popular and if more people find out about this hidden gem, I'll have a harder time getting a seat on the weekends =p. I'm very impressed though with how well they brace the Yelp community and listen to customer suggestions. They have better coffee now and cut back on how sugary or salty some items were. This makes it pretty safe to order nearly anything off the menu now and be impressed. The one area that could still be improved are the soups since the standards are done well but sometimes some of the new flavors (like pumpkin or yolk with lemon) aren't always that great. If they can make soups as good as Maxfield's Restaurant, then there's really no weakness at all in their cooking.

Once again, for specific items that stood out in my mind:

Philly Steak Sandwich, Strip Steak Sandwich: Delicious, flavorful beef without really being salty. The fries here are great although a cup of fruit goes well also.

Huevos Rancheros: Normally I'm not a big fan of this dish but this is really well done.

Banana Pecan Crepes: Delicious with a great texture and plenty of nuts. Sometimes the crepe is crispy as well, which puts this over the top.

Tiramisu crepes: Not on the menu but I think it's even better than the pancake version. It's a tough one to debate but I'd be happy with either one.

White chocolate pancakes: A surprise for people who don't usually eat white chocolate. A bit better to ask them to go light on the raspberries so that the white chocolate flavor is more prominent.

All omelettes are light and fluffy with a great mix of cheese as well as skillets. Butcher Block and Mile High Denver are my choices with omelettes and red apple special  and vegetarian for skillets.

I liked all 6 benedicts. This is probably the one category of breakfast food that Red Apple wins hands down. Most other places have a hollandaise sauce with an unusual consistency or strange flavor. Red Apple also gets the best texture from their poached eggs of any of the nearby restaurants.

Apple orchard chicken, strawberry fields (if it's strawberry season), and popeye would be my favorite salads.

California and triple decker would be my favorite deli sandwiches.

The muffins they sell in the front are quite good too. It's not as soft as Costco's or as fragrant as Mariano's but it's quite crunchy with nice fresh ingredients inside.

I'll keep looking around to see if any other restaurants can change my mind. I see lots of new construction happening recently so we'll see.
The food here is always good,I always do take out. The service is fast and food is fresh. Pancakes are awesome!
This place is amazing.  They have gluten free waffles and pancakes to die for.  Skillets are great..so much food.  Fast, friendly service...owners are always greeting and helping at the door.

I've been on a search for the best breakfast place in the burbs, and I have yet to find my match. Red Apple Pancake House is good, don't get me wrong (if I could I would give it 3 1/2 stars), but I wasn't wowed. We came here on a Saturday morning. From the looks of the parking lot, it looked like there would be a wait. There wasn't. The parking lot is just awful. We were seated right away and were asked if we wanted anything to drink by 2 people (I have to say, the service was probably the best part about this place). 

The menu is pretty big - they have your standard breakfast and American lunch foods. Pancakes, waffles, omelettes, crepes, sandwiches, soups, salads, skillets, etc.  I decided on an omelette, and my friend got a waffle. We both said it wasn't bad, just not great. The food was a little bland, his egg whites had some yolks in it, and my omelette was a little dry. It just wasn't the wow factor I was looking for.

Would I come back? Yes. Would it be my first choice? No.
Lots of options. Huge portions( I recommend sharing). I ordered the pumpkin pancakes which were really good. The eggs with Chicken sausage were delicious. Definitely worth a try.
Was great food. Was running short on time and they got us our food quickly and was good.
Was very good food. This was the first time I have been here. Specialty pancakes, french toast, crepes, and more. Freshly sqeezed OJ made there was awesome.

Huh...well I guess it's just hit-or-miss depending on the day and the waitress you happen to get.

My friends and I came here on a Sunday around 10 after Wildberry down the street had a 45 minute wait.  Turns out, if we wanted better service and better food, we just should have stayed at the tried and true Wildberry.

Our

Waitress

Was

Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad.    Abhorrent, abominable, appalling, beastly, detestable, disagreeable, disgusting, dreadful, lousy, *obnoxious*.

Shall I continue?

Good points:
Being seated right away
The Dum Dum lollipop I scored while paying.

Bad points:
Everything else.

I don't know what happened since my first review.  What the WHAT?!  I have been back a few times since then, and it has all gone downhill.  

Last time was the worst, though.  We were seated right away, like I said, and about 4 seconds after we sat down, our surly waitress (an older lady who should REALLY understand that waitressing is NOT FOR EVERYONE) slumps over and asks if we're ready.  We were there for less than thirty seconds at this point.

So, no.

We perused the menu for less than thirty seconds, and she comes back AGAIN (so TWICE in less than a minute) and says "So what will it be".

IT'LL *BE* ANOTHER FEW MINUTES.  Chill, woman.

The rest of the meal went exactly like this.  When ordering, we were barked at, snapped at, when I asked for egg whites, it was met with a sigh, and when I asked for the pancakes instead of the toast (which is an option and not a special order or anything), she rolled her eyes and acted like it was this huge inconvenience.  

Then our food took a reeeeeeeeally long time.  Which was fine because we were busy chatting, but other tables who were even seated after we were and ordered well after us got their food earlier.  Oh well!

So then we finally get our food, and she drops off the check with it.  Well, we weren't even near ready to leave (we hadn't even taken a bite of the food), and after that, she just kept coming back and rushing us to leave.  She asked me if I wanted a box while I was MID BITE.  Um...I don't know...why don't you actually let me *finish* my food and then decide??

I don't know about you, but the more someone wants me out, the loooooonger I dwindle.  So my friends and I sat there for a good half an hour after eating, shooting the sh*t, talking about whatever, getting refills on coffee from the busboy, etc.

Our waitress would come by, roll her eyes, and she even said at one point "I DID give you the check, right??".  Yup, we've got it right here, thanks.  We're still not leaving.

My favorite part was when she started taking things off of our table to give to other tables (our ketchup, hot sauce, etc).  

We finally left when she and the manager (I assume) stood right next to our table and said VERY loudly that they needed this room for a small party so let's start moving people out (which seems like bad business to me in the first place--why even seat people in that little room, then??)  So they uprooted people and their meals and drinks just to move to different locations.  SO STRANGE.

Our bill was expensive $38 for the three of us for just breakfast.  And my friend said our waitress didn't even earn the tip I did give her.  

So here is my note to management: GET WAITRESSES WITH BETTER ATTITUDES.  It was not a very good dining experience...
Haven't had breakfast here but I have had lunch. Lunch items were good but the whole menu seemed a little pricey. Tables were kind of sticky as well. But the service was good.
This place is the definition of a hidden gem... Great service amazing food and portions and price is spot on... Gives you that grandma dinner feeling

We are breakfast people and we just moved to the area. This is the best classic breakfast restaurant! We love the service from all the staff every time we go. French toast is perfect, not mushy, not the neon orange, just perfect. Pancakes are great, we get them every time. My husband loves the skillets and corn beef hash. I usually get a Benedict or omelette... The coffee is always fresh and they keep it coming throughout breakfast! Sunday's they have Greek lemon rice soup that is delicious! Highly recommend for a standard, dependable and consistent breakfast place. We usually go 2-3 times a month with our one year old and they are very accommodating with him!

I am a big breakfast person and I wanted to try this place based on great reviews. 

Pros: Great egg white omelet and fluffy pancakes 

Cons: Average/slow service and not the server's fault she was covering ten tables on busy Saturday morning. Server was rushing every time she came to our table. She was like a super woman, taking orders refiling coffee, and bringing orders out. We had to tell her what we needed like hot sauce or ketchup in two tries. If she had just taken 30 seconds to finish our sentence we could of told her everything at once. 

Please hire more help at least on a weekend. 

Coffee although hot it was under par, not to mention no fresh cream is just ridiculous.  

My wife had a skillet with scrambled eggs and it was worse skillet she had to the date. Eggs were dry/ skillet lacked flavor and not to mention potatoes were greasy. 

I will give another try to this place may be it was just bad day. Let you know when i return here with updated review. 

Enjoy 

Krunal

Ridiculously enormous portions of mediocre food. Meh. 

I ordered the blackberry banana pancakes, and asked for a half order (2 instead of 4). Apparently they don't do half orders except on some of their pancakes. ?? Seriously? I can't just order 2 pancakes? Nope. So I get four. I was excited about these pancakes, because they sound amazing. Not so much. I ate 1 and gave the rest to my husband.

He ordered a "3-egg omelette"... what came out looked like 8 eggs. OK, so I know this is America, and people like to eat their weight in food, and most people would probably be excited about the epic portion sizes. But I think it's gross, and nobody needs to eat that much. Anyway, the omelette wasn't great either. 

I had high hopes for this place... They do have a really large menu, so maybe we'll give it another chance and try something different. Overall, though, it was a disappointing experience.

Good, standard brunch spot in the burbs. The Tijuana skillet is my standard order, and has always been consistent.  Generous portions, perfect for sharing.  Decent coffee, but overpriced juices.

Bonus points for being local and not a chain.

Excellent food. Speedy service. The French orchard was to die for! I was extremely impressed at how fast the food was prepared. Quality was definitely not effected by the speedy service either. The prices were extremely reasonable, having more for leftovers! Highly suggest the family diner for anyone!

Went here with my friend, and it was great. Although personally I don't like crowded places, but this just proves how good they are. I love strawberry crepes so that's what I got, and I ordered another thing I forgot, but it was good too. The waiter was friendly and really nice. Although she forgot my whip cream, but she asked if I needed anything and went back to get it for me. 
The thing about busy places is that the food comes out slow, but it wasn't too slow so it was fine. I recommend this place

Shambling into the Red Apple, my then-fiance and I had hoped to try something a bit different and mix it up from our usual weekend flair. Unfortunately, a majority of what we found left us more than a bit wishful that we'd gone to our local Denny's.

The underlying issue with the Red Apple appears to be simply that they've been around long enough to warrant resting on their laurels. Granted the wait to be seated was a mere 15 minutes, but that alone left us feeling like canned tuna amidst an all-too-small, claustrophobia inducing waiting area before being led back to a table swarmed by noise. It seemed off-putting, but would ultimately prove preferable to actually being seated.

Upon sitting down, it wasn't more than a full minute before our server Margaret came to the table. When taking our drink order, she seemed to assume that we'd been one of the many to wait our way into the place before because she made clear an expectation that we order immediately. When we asked for a few minutes to peruse the menu, she actually scoffed at us and walked away. This further added to my chagrin about picking the place.

Seemingly heading to the orange grove out back to pick and squeeze the juice herself, when she finally did bring our drinks, her attitude seemed unaltered. Not wishing to upset our server further, heaven forbid, we placed our order. My fiance placed an order for eggs benedict and I for something mostly akin to a Denny's Lumberjack Slam, complete with waffles and an arrangement of sundries such as hash browns, sausage, etc.

Then we waited. And waited. And continued to wait for a bit. I watched multiple tables that had been seated after us that had ordered less receive their orders faster than us. I felt very much like Margaret was either punishing us for deliberating on our breakfast or the Red Army had suddenly rolled into the Red Apple for brunch. One eternity later, our food arrived.

I looked over my meal and was moderately satisfied that it had been cooked with a degree of competence. As Margaret turned to leave, I asked for additional butter and had her call over her shoulder as she walked away that it was on the table. Silly me. Sorry to have offended you with the inconvenience of being a patron, Margaret. After putting syrup and butter on my waffle, it was palatable, but little more than something I could have crafted with my iron at home. Honestly, I was starting to wish I had.

Disappointingly adding insult to injury, my fiance sampled her eggs benedict. After grimacing, she asked me to try them. The Hollendaise sauce tasted as though it had been simmering for most of the morning, lacking any remote freshness, the poached eggs we solid on the inside, and the English muffin halves was stale. She asked for a bit of my waffle and I happily obliged, of course.

After finishing the waffle and the mediocre sides, we were once again approached by our waitress. She didn't bother to ask if we wanted more juice or water, both of which had been empty for some time, but was more than happy to drop the check on the table. As she walked away, my fiance called out that we actually wanted to order something else. Margaret walked back with the belabored enthusiasm of a scolded child as my fiance wanted a waffle for us to, again, split. 

Finishing the second between us, we didn't bother to have anything wrapped up and took the amended check to the front. As we made our way, it was then that Margaret opted then to try and make friendly small talk, but at that point we just wanted to get out of the place. We settled with the woman at the front and silently exchanged glances as we left.

We haven't since gone back and I sincerely doubt that anytime in the future will see us making a repeat trip to the Red Apple. I understand that everyone and every place is capable of a bad day, but we must have caught both our waitress and the eatery at the same time given the poor first and last impression we had as we left. 

We should've gone to Denny's.

We went here for a Father's Day family breakfast.  We made a reservation as there were 10 of us and they cramped us into a table in a side room when there was a bigger table in the main room.  

The server was very good, very attentive.  Quickly got us drinks and coffee and gave us the perfect amount of time to look over the sizable menu.  We made our order and waited a very short time (for a party of 10) for the food to come out.

Eight of us got our order on the first wave from the server.  Everyone liked what they had.  It was the last two that were a disaster.  We both had omelettes and neither was cooked all the way through.  How do you serve someone a ham and cheese omelette where you can clearly see the cheese wasn't even melted and the eggs were creating a puddle from not being cooked?

I cut into mine and was repulsed to the point of I was off food for the rest of the day.  Add in that the toast I was served had no color what so ever.  It could have just been stale for all I knew.

While they tried to offer me another item, I didn't bother.  They did take it off the bill, but they made no apologies and basically said "Oh well".

I won't be going back.

I've been here twice now and I am gluten free due to allergies. Their gluten free waffles are to die for! I tried the gluten free pancakes and I didn't like them as much as the waffles. I asked my waitress to put strawberry preserves all over my waffles and she got confused. I'm not sure why. I would definitely recommend this place. I wish they were open for dinner too! :)

Came here for the first time today.  Very good sized parking lot and easy to find.  We had 3 people eating breakfast around 11am and were able to get a table pretty easily.  The restaurant is very large inside and has 3 separate dining room areas. 

I ordered 2 eggs, toast, turkey patties, hash browns for about $8
Boyfriend ordered Original Eggs Benedict and side of sausage links about $9 plus extra for the links
Other guest ordered an omlette with pancakes and hash browns

Good:  they were speedy with getting the food out and checking on us routinely

Meh:  the food was just okay, nothing great... I can make better eggs and my boyfriend's poached eggs weren't cooked enough.  The sauce also wasn't too either of our liking.  We've definitely had better at other locations.
This place is awesome!! Food was great. tip: very packed on sunday around church time! Reasonably priced as well.

We wanted to try somewhere new and this showed up on yelp. They have really good pancakes and omelettes. There is a nice mom-and-pop vibe to it. I have been there twice now and I am definitely going to return.

Now I have to say, the wait times can be a BIT much when your sitting at the little bench and see all these tables empty. Our waitress this time was very attentive, however I have had the rude waitress mentioned in other reviews. To say that she THREW my food at me wouldnt be much of an exaggeration. But this past visit was really good. My friend had a HUGE greek omelet that was loaded with feta chunks. I had something off the specials menu called the nutella delight. OH MY GOD! It was amazing on french toast. Basically globs of nutella and a sweet cream. Also drizzles of chocolate and whipped cream. TALK about a calorie bomb but CRAP was it good!!! I was full for the whole day on the sweetness alone! Throw on some fresh strawberries and it was heaven! Prices are fair, for the two of us it was like twenty five-ish. I'd def go back for special occasions.
Highly recommend for any size group. Food is excellent and staff always on their toes. You must try their Pumpkin pancakes. They are awesome and Im not a pancake fan.

I have been here twice.  The second time the service was less than good.  That was unfortunate as its about a mile from my house.  The first time (I met some girlfriends)  was fine, so then I brought the fam the next time.  Only to hear complaints afterward about the service.  :-/

As usual, have to completely agree with Sherwin's more detailed review. After half a dozen great breakfasts they hit it out of the park every time. Five stars.

Quality ingredients, properly prepared, experienced servers and hostesses. Wait is bearable and parking ok. We usually take HALF of our food home. Skillets aren't a grease bomb like most.
As good as it gets in the NW suburbs for a reasonable breakfast. We are fans of their huge baked omelets, seasonal pancakes and HIGH pies...decent rancheros huevos and homemade soups....

We loved this place! Great food, huge portions, low prices, friendly service, and I have never gotten food so fast. Not the fanciest place, but great food! The Californian omelet and meat lovers skillet was delicious. Good coffee as well!

1. Tons of parking; special rooms for private & semi-private parties/meetings/luncheons, etc.
2. The owners and staff are pleasant & congenial.
3. Great variety on the menu; if you happen not to see what you like, the prime chef, who is one of the owners, will try his best to prepare you a special meal if you give him notice.
4. No matter what you select, the food is all great and the prices are very reasonable.
5. Location is centralized, easy to find right off Rt.53 on Euclid.

This was my first time here and I loved the cozy atmosphere.  I stepped through the door and before the group I was with even finished getting inside we were already being taken care of. I ordered fresh orange juice and the waitress said to be careful with the seeds because they literally just squeezed it. It was so delicious! For my dish I ordered the "French Orchard". I highly recommend it. It's french toast with cinnamon apples on top, bacon and any style eggs. They serve free coffee per person with any meal $5.99 or up as long as you get there before 11 am. The waitress kept coming over to check on us and kept refilling our waters and coffee without us having to ask.The place is so cute with their apple theme. Even their clock has apples on it. The staff is super friendly. This place is a must see!

First time visit this past Sunday. 

Have to agree with most everyone on here, the service was quick and the portions are indeed MASSIVE.

I ordered a fairly basic breakfast of two scrambled eggs with hash browns, bacon and an english muffin.

There weren't two scrambled eggs on my plate...there had to have been at least SIX! No lie. The eggs were quite tasty, too. 

Wish I could say the same for the hash browns. They were more of your small potato slices than your usual shredded fare. While they weren't terrible, they didn't taste as good as they looked. The bacon pieces were hefty strips that wrapped around the mound of eggs.

Overall, satisfied and very, very full when finished.

I would rate it at a very good "plastic menu" (as we call it) breakfast place for the Palatine/Rolling Meadows/Arlington Heights area.

This place is across from where I live.  I usually go when I have a friend in town or I am super hungry and don't want to make breakfast.  The food is decent, but some meals are super greasy and the portions are ridiculous.  This is why america is FAT :(  Seriously they need to look into portion control.  Also on a few occasions we had waitresses say they can't do something or substitute things as we have always said we would pay extra for the service, it still seemed like something they just could not input into the computer.  I really don't care, just make it happen.  We are here to enjoy a great breakfast, so to get a good tip, I suggest you figure it out!

The greeter/owner is super nice and always gets the payments done quick and I appreciate that.

I came here on a Sunday morning at about 11am. This place is obviously popular. There was a 10 minute wait to be seated.The veggie omelette with cheese was good. The hash browns were as well. I would definitely return to this place.

Red Apple Pancake House is not to shabby when it comes to your standard brunch fare. There's nothing crazy, fancy, or unique about it. Their menu is comprised of just your good old, standard, breakfast and lunch favorites. ((Pancakes, French toast, crepes, omelettes, skillets, etc. You get the idea)) 

The portions are huge. Actually, they're massive. So I recommend keeping that in mind when ordering. And for the price, it's even better. I also love the fact that they have several healthy dishes with egg whites and veggies, and sides of granola and fruit. My fave is Slim Sarah's Omelette with egg whites, mushrooms, and spinach - served with a fruit cup and dry English muffin. My egg whites were cooked perfectly. Light, fluffy, and not over-cooked. 

For parents out there, I caution you if your kiddos order the chocolate chip pancakes. They are beyond loaded with chocolate chips. And although us adults enjoy such a treat once in a while, my 5 year old nephew who ate them was bouncing off the walls afterwards. ((Hilarious for me, painful for my sister!!))

Service is extremely fast and extremely friendly. They get you in and out fast, and still bring you a quality meal.

Been here many many times.  Love the giant omelettes - especially the Californian, with avocado and mushrooms and lots of cheese.  Potato side is just OK, but that's not why I go there.  Eat a late breakfast and you won't need to eat again that day!  The lunch menu items look great, but I can't stop myself from ordering a darned omelette!  A friend is a big fan of the Alpine - it comes with potato pancakes.  They will substitute within reason.  Ask for the flavored coffee creamers.

The menu is very similar to the Red Apple Pancake House on Schmale Road in Carol Stream, but it's not usually as crowded in Palatine.
Updating to 5 stars since the bathrooms have been cleaned, THANK YOU for listening to your customers.

Our family booked breakfast reservations based on the great reviews posted on Yelp, and I have to be honest, the food was NOT good.  Cranberry pancakes should have cranberries cooked in them, instead they over-cooked regular pancakes and but some cranberries on top. Lame.  We also ordered the "specialty of the house" the baby dutch apple -- awful, just plan awful. You could have made an old Wendy's commercial out of it but instead of "Where's the beef?" it would be "Where's the apples?" Flat, tasteless, and keep digging to try to find any apple slices.  My son had the egg white veggie omelet and he only ate half of it, saying it tasted like scrambled eggs. 

The restaurant is PACKED so I expect the food is outstanding but every plate served at our table was below par. Did the regular cook take the day off? 

On a positive note, the staff is very friendly and the service if outstanding.  Coffee refills were above average and the food comes out of the kitchen fast even though the restaurant was packed -- I just wish the food would have been good.

Have been to this place several times. This is a top-notch operation. The food is always fresh and the service wonderful. Ask for Sue. She Is  most delightful person and always delivers exceptional service

First time visit for lunch. Extensive menu a nothing fancy, but fresh and mostly homemade. Big portions and reasonable prices. Had the turkey burger which came with a cup of soup. Chicken dumpling soup was good, although would have preferred to see shredded chicken instead of Campbell-esqe mini chicken cubes. Burger had fresh avocado. Pretty crowded for a Thursday lunch, which is a typically an indication of a good restaurant. Will visit again.

Eh...It was ok. Stopped in during the week after seeing the yelp reviews. I guess I expected more. It's basically just an average breakfast/brunch place. We both got the breakfast combos. She had pancakes, I had french toast. I think the best part was the sausage. My french toast was a bit dry and her pancakes were ordinary. 

Stop by for breakfast if you're looking for some variety, but don't expect anythign out of the ordinary.

We had high hopes for this place from all the reviews. We brought our out of town friends to this place (mistake #1, don't bring your friends to place you've never been to).  I ordered the Californian omelet and my husband ordered the eggs benedict. Our friends ordered the banana foster crepes and the key lime crepe. We ordered the sampler #1 for the kids to share. The food was just blah. My potatoes were overcooked and charred. My omelet was a green mush mess from the avocados and my pancakes had a dark char on it and not golden brown. My husbands benedict wasn't a traditional benedict. The yolk was soft and not runny and the hollandaise sauce tasted like it was from a packet. Both of our dishes were just not very good. 

Our waitress however was awesome. She constantly made sure our coffee mugs were filled and was always checking to see if we were ok. 

Maybe we ordered the wrong thing, (and there's alot on their menu) but messing up on the benedict and omelet is reason enough for us not to come back.

LOVED It.  We came here based other reviews and I was pleased to find them true.  We were greeted at the door, seated promply and the staff were curteous and quick.   My husband and I both had Skillets that were fabulous, fresh vegetables, large mushrooms, you can tell everthing was fresh.   And the prices were right on.  We will definately be back!

I visited this place for the first time with my family this morning around 11 AM, and we were immediately seated.  In conclusion, we were very impressed and pleased. I ordered a vegetarian benedict, and presentation was very colorful and appetizing. It came with two large eggs, mushroom/onion/spinach saut and salsa, with a cup of three kinds of fresh fruits and hash-brown.  Comparing to Elly's (Arl Hts) vege-benedict, I was impressed by its colorful presentation when it was brought to me.  My family was very satisfied as well. Its very at-home atmosphere and interior made us feel like as if we were there before.

Great overall dining experience.  good service, great food, more unique choices that anywhere else.  We will be going back, used to be loyal Palatine Inn folks, but that place has changed int he past 5 years, quailty of the food and service has gone down while prices have gone up..

I laughed, I even noticed 2 of the waitresses from PI came over to Red Apple, I spoke with one and she said things just werent the same anymore.  Anyway I digress.

Come to this place, the breakfast is great, omelettes are wonderful, fruit is fressh and they are always willing to substitute anything without any hassle.

Keep up the good work guys, I am spreading the word all I can.

Red Apple has really great skillets. They also do potatoes not hash browns for their sides and skillets. This is key because hash browns just look and taste incredibly greasy and inedible. 

Their potatoes are fantastic ... I think they use Lawry's seasoning on them, but am not too sure. 

The waitress was great and the food came out fast. They did mess up one order out of 6 but quickly mended the problem. 

The only negative I can give this place is that the dining room is kinda of tightly packed. I hate having to watch out whenever I walk or have to push my chair back for fear of hitting someone. 

We went on a Sunday morning, 11AM, no wait time. Prices are reasonable and the coffee is good. I will definitely be back when I am in the neighborhood for breakfast. 

Also a big negative ... they need to get faster more efficient, powerful hand dryers in the washroom. It takes a good 5 minutes to dry your hands.
Food was delicious. I ordered biscuits and gravy and it was almost as good as my grandma's cooking. Coffee was good to. Very reasonability priced.
Have eaten here several times and every thing I've ordered has been great!  Their omelets are excellent and portions are huge.  Such a deal that coffee is free with breakfast entrees

Red Apple is one of my favorite breakfast restaurants in the Palatine/Schaumburg/Arlington Heights area.

The food is good and both the wait staff and owners are friendly.

I suggest the cinnamon apple crepes.  The cinnamon apples are made on premises, no canned apple pie filling here.

I love this place! The staff there is super friendly & the food is good. It's not fancy, it's just good American breakfast food. Sunday mornings are usually pretty busy, but the wait is normally only a couple minutes. I've tried a lot of breakfast places, but we always end up coming back here.

WOW!  I was really impressed with this place.  Had driven past it for years and never had the opportunity to stop.  I was really missing out!  Ate there for the first time with my Mom and boyfriend this past weekend.  Cute interior with an apple theme and a bucket of apples for patrons to take when leaving.
1.  The staff is kind and welcoming.  When my Mom comes on her own, the staff walks her to her car, as she uses a cane.  Now that is service!
2.  The omelets were fantastic!  I had the veggie and my boyfriend had the portabella.  My Mom had the Popeye crepes, which were big enough to serve two.  I opted for the yummy thick toast and fresh fruit; and a side of crisp bacon.  My boyfriend had the out of this world pumpkin pancakes topped with a big dollop of cinnamon butter.  The bite I had was heavenly!
3.  We chatted for a long time and were never rushed or hurried.  When we paid, my Mom was given a bag containing an ample serving of soup and a cranberry muffin - as the restaurant was closing for the day.  

It has several flat screen TV's which honestly I could do without.  Many tables contained kids, so this is a good option for families.  Plates are delicious and bountiful and was trying hard to please every patron.

I can't wait to go back!  They have a full menu are open breakfast through lunch.

Stopped here after work, before a dental appointment, and got the "Crunchy French Toast" and a side order of bacon. The place was pretty empty, as it was still early. The servers are VERY efficient, and did an excellent job taking care of me.

The bacon is THICK, and MEATY. Its more like pork belly, but STILL is incredible. I recommend this place HIGHLY!

Come for the wings, stay for the beer!

The wings were great. We tried both the garlic and the hot and they were great! To round out our dinner, we also tried the cheeseburger sliders and the parmesan cheese fries. Those were just OK. With the weather being nice sitting out on the patio was great. They have TVs out there too which is good if you want to watch the game. I'll be back for the wings for sure.

A friend and I popped in here for the first time on Monday around 3.30 PM. We found it clearly by luck and driving buy....The bartender/waitress was very nice and helpful.

They had some Monday specials. Burgers were discounted and half price appetizers and drink specials. 

I had the a burger (choice of 3 different types of buns). It was cooked to perfection and had great flavor. The fries were tasty and my friend had the Mozzarella sticks and the bang bang shrimp. We both enjoyed our food. 

As we were sitting there we saw a lot of people coming in even people with kids. Clearly this place is a well known place for good food good prices and great wait staff. Our waitress was new and did a great job....she was attentive but not annoying :)

I would recommend stopping in if your in the area.

I went back and tried the honey-Sriracha chicken wings.  They were great.  I also had the honey mustard chicken wrap.  That was pretty good too.  Therefore, I'm increasing my review by a star.  Previous entry is below.  My statement on the friendly staff remains true! 

I was completely disappointed in my buffalo chicken sandwich.  The sauce was.... Lacking.  Very strong on the vinegar.  To the point the sauce was watery.

But the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Even though I was incredibly jet lagged and about to fall over in my dinner.  I'd go back and try something other than the buffalo chicken.  If it's better, I'd definitely bump this up to 4 stars.

Every time we come here, the service and food is outstanding. Most of everything is home made and fresh. The staff makes you feel like family and you can tell really cares about the customers. The soups, shrimp appetizer, burgers and wings are out of this world. What more can you expect? Great food, great people, and great service at a great value! Defiantly one of our new favorites!

Went in last Friday 8/26/16 was greeted by a friendly smiling server named Kyle.  We could not make up our minds he suggested the fish fry and it was an excellent choice.  He was very delightful and I think we have a new favorite server!  Prices for the food and beer were very reasonable. Way to go Kyle!
This place has a nice patio area. Kyle was our waiter and was very friendly and attentive. The garlic parmesan waffle fries are great here. Good prices.

Based on the building, I think this bar used to be a funeral home, which makes sense because the food tastes like death. I had the Hawaiian chicken sandwich and it tasted like it was cooked in a cremator. It was just a chicken breast on a bad bun with a slice of cheese. No pineapple or teriyaki flavor. 

The bar did have friendly staff and good beer so that made up for it a bit. But next time I'm in town, I'll just stick with my hotel's restaurant.

I have returned twice since my less than satisfactory experience in December 2013.  The most recent visit was on 9/14/2015.

I've had a burger on both occasions and they were OK, but nothing to write home about.  I just stick with the regular, fresh-cut fries and they are quite good.  "Specialty" burgers have almost become a commodity in the past 10 years.  Where once I would rate Crossroads' burger as very good, in comparison to other pub burgers, they are now just middle of the pack.        
On this most recent visit, my wife ordered the Cobb salad.  When asked, she said it was "OK".

The bartender on this past Monday was very friendly and told us the beer and food specials without asking.  She was very nice.

This would have been a two-star review but I have bumped up another star because A) the bartender was so nice and B) they still have Church Street Beer on tap (Heavenly Helles).  Those factors alone might keep me coming back.

My family and I were here because I had a free birthday entree. First we ordered appetizers boneless chicken wings the server bought us regular he apologized but did offer to take them back.  Then we order the turkey burger in the picture it showed lettuce tomatoes etc. we received ours it came with cheese only. We asked the server he said he was suppose to ask but he didn't.   We order garlic fries they were soggy and gross and the turkey burger tasted like freezer burn.   We were going to order dessert but it wasn't worth it.   This place should clean up or get out....  I gave it two  stars because the drink were the best.
The pizza is excellent and there wings are awesome. Staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cool. Pizza is a must. Good drink specials as well

Our waitress did tell us ahead of time that this was her last day in training...I still don't believe that is an excuse for the overall service received and lack of attention by senior staff. My husband and I ordered shrimp and wings as an appetizer and a small sausage pizza as the entre.  After 45 minutes, my husband had to walk up to the bar and ask for another round of beers and ask about our food. (The waitress never came back after our initial order) my frustration really heightened when I saw people who were sat in the restaurant section much later then us, enjoying their wings...At this point, my husband was told that the reason for the delay in receiving our order was because we ordered pizza...Now I was really confused...we ordered 2 appetizers first?  After all is said and done, over an hour after ordering, we got all of our food at once and we're told we were upgraded to a 14 inch instead of the 12 inch we ordered, because of the long wait.  Seriously. ..the 14 inch pizza she brought was a cheese pizza...We ordered sausage. Very disappointed in the quality of service. I can't blame it all on the trainee, not her fault. Shame on those who were training her.

Crossroads is a local neighborhood bar that my wife and I visit quite regularly. Their specials are very reasonable and the food is one of a kind. Especially their garlic waffle fries ! The bartenders and servers are all excellent, Alan, Hannah and Stephanie in particular are very accommodating. If you're looking for a personable, local bar with great service you definitely need to stop by Crossroads for a bite to eat.

Crossroads is roaring with energy for Blackhawks games or bachelorette parties, as I was part of the latter.

I started off the night with the $3 chocolate cherry martinis.  I chased that with the Blue Strawberry, which basically tastes like college.  If you didn't go to college, it tastes like high school.

We didn't get as many weird looks from the Blackhawks fans as I had expected.  In fact, some congratulated my friend on getting married, another friend got a guy's number, and when I screeched "sports! points! hooray! BALLS!" repeatedly, that was OK too.  When I screamed aloud a personal announcement, the bar gave me a round of applause.  A few even stood.  I checked - the Blackhawks hadn't scored a goal.  They were cheering for me.  That's a first.

Along with the great energy at Crossroads is great food.  Our group devoured the Parmesan garlic fries (waffle style, of course).  The boneless wings were enormous, more like chicken tenders, so don't be like me and overestimate your appetite.  Six were plenty.  The Sweet Dynomite was mildly spicy with a raspberry jam flavor; the parmesan garlic were just as good as those fries.  After the fries and wings though I was in desperate need of a mint.

Service was a little bit slow, but our waitress was friendly and appeared frazzled as she handled many tables - I'm not sure I saw any other waitresses in my line of vision the whole night.  It wasn't her fault, it appeared that Crossroads was really understaffed, especially for a Saturday night and ESPECIALLY during an apparently very important sporting event.

Crossroads isn't a trendy gastropub, but it is a nice neighborhood spot with good drinks and great food.
Alan is great at what he does at this place I will be BACK!!!! Thanks guys. I really enjoyed myself!!!

This place is definitely interesting.  The food and specials are usually good.  It's an oddly shaped building.  You walk in to a hallway, which if you turn left you're in the bar, straight ahead you're in the dining room that had a stage/elevated platform part to it.  There's an indoor-outdoor area and then an actual outdoor area.  I suppose it's nice to have plenty of places to choose your own adventure where you sit.

We've sat in every room at some point.  If you choose the bar be ready for a bar environment.  Bartender joking around and shooting the shit with you, video game poker has come so expect to hear the noise from that behind you.  But hey that's okay, if you don't want that there are 3 other types of rooms to sit in.  We watched the bulls playoffs game in the dining room area one night.  It was good, lots of tvs to view it on, but you could tell the regular karaoke crew was antsy for karaoke to start so we left at half time, not knowing what was going to go on with the karaoke vs bulls.

The outdoor area last time we sat there (which was over a year ago now) seemed oddly set up with what was sort of like a bar that a bunch of guys were at and then we were at a high top table.  The weird set up may have been people moving tables around themselves.  It was nice, nice to have an outdoor area.

I've ate a few different things there, but my favorite is the lightning lou pizza, which is a buffalo ranch pizza.  They were so nice to let me order it as a smaller size than it comes in.  My boyfriend doesn't like ranch but he tried and really liked the pizza.  The ranch kind of just melts into the pizza giving it a really good flavor.  I definitely will be back for that.

I'm sure we'll be back.  It's great when the other local watering holes are already packed for sports that you can always find a seat at crossroads.

In town for business. Stopped here for a couple of drinks and a bite to eat.

The bartender was inviting, and insured that I knew his name, and he mine I quick order. Kudos to "Allen".

Ordered a Reuben. Sandwich was nothing to write home about, but loved the waffle fries!

I noticed that many of the "regulars" ordered the wings, and would assume that they must be a house specialty.

Would return, if for no other reason, for the friendly staff.

09/01/15 @ 2:15pm. Saw the new sign so I thought I would check it out for the first time.  I have been reading other mixed reviews, so I thought I would come in an form my own opinion.

At first glance, definitely more of a dive bar feeling...one of those places you would see on Bar Rescues.  There is a very distinct smell in the bar around the tap area (could have been from the kitchen which is pretty close by)...so I opted for a $2.50 miller lite bottle special.  The customers are a bit "passionate" about their opinions and loyal to this bar.  Some might call them "trailer trash" and I don't believe in that.  Actually one customer struck up a conversation with me explaining the rewards program, which was pretty cool.  Speaking about reward program, I explained that I was new to the area and was offered to be part of their rewards program which can is actually a shared program and is pretty cool.  Then a couple of other regulars come in...good genuine people.  

Overall, I had a pretty good experience.  Cheese quesadilla was tasty, shaved prime rib was good (a bit of fat on it, but nicely flavored) and $7.50 for 3 beers.  Waitress staff is a bit older, but extremely attentive and super nice.  I also saw other waitress' taking time to clean off their menus...which is a nice behind the scenes.  Then the GM Paul walked out of the kitchen and had a bite to eat...seems like a good guy.  The waitress actually introduced me. I will definitely come again, although the the jury is still out on whether I will be going for the 750 points needed to get a free appetizer, 2 entrees and a desert (which is a pretty good reward for spending a couple of bucks).
Came in a few times since my first review. Food good especially wings. Earned me back.

Stopped here with my husband to try it out!  This place is excellent and utilizes local brews.  They have $3 bloody mary specials on sundays too.  We really enjoyed the outdoor seating area, along with the tentative service.  Our server was also bartending, but kept us feeling tended too.  It was a neat place.  Once the weather warms up we will be hitting the outdoor patio again!

Wow....I was in town for business and stopped in for a bite to eat and a drink!! Had a GREAT time!!  The bartenders Alan and Nick made me feel right at home and were verrrry attentive.  I do not write too many reviews and I wanted to share my satisfaction. Wings are top notch! I got to meet a bunch of regulars and was welcomed by all!! I ended up staying for a lot longer than anticipated!!

Highly 
Recommended!!
Food is okay - nothing special ...drinks... Pretty expensive compared to other local bars. Fun place to hang out but that's about it.
Fun hangout spot. Good food. Wednesdays all drafts at 2 bucks!  Pot roast slider app is amazing! Very friendly staff too.

The new brisket/chuck burger at Crossroads is unquestionably the most delectable burger you have ever put in your mouth.  
This is what the Big Kids Eat !!

~ Go Big or Go Home !!

We tried this restaurant for the first time yesterday and I have mixed feelings about this place. The food was good but the service was a bit shabby. The staff is friendly but not very good at informing the customer of pricing  changes. We ordered 24 wings but were not told we couldn't mix the flavors so we were charged separately for each flavor. We ordered the pizza because it was buy one get one free. We ordered the veggie pizza,one with minus one ingredient and the second with 2 plus ingredients. We were charged for each individual ingredient they put on both pizzas. We ordered ground beef because we cannot eat  pork and they put sausage on the pizza without informing us. Drinks were sparse, we had to ask if we could find someone, not offered. So for 24 wings ,"buy one get one free? "Pizza, and 3 sodas,and 3 beers for $83.00 was a bit much to me. It wasn't like we had fine dining or food with actual substance. So for me, I  may not give them a second chance. It wasn't actually a buy one get one if you have to pay for all the ingredients on the free pizza. Either that or they just didn't ring it up right. Best way to lose customers!

Great service!  The food was way above regular bar food. We started with their wings, which were the best I ever had, then I had the ribs wow moist and almost fall off the bone. My daughter had the broasted chicken. We will define fly be back!!

Poor service for lunch today. Crappy fries served with a carelessly built club sandwich. I should have taken the empty parking lot at noon as a sign. I should have JUST LEFT when my water was served with a HAIR IN IT. 

Crossroads needs help. I don't know that area well but there HAS to be better choices. 

Upside? Nice outdoor seating.
I'm here now and I can't ask for anything better. Funion burger with the so good garlic fries and my fav beer. Keep up the great work and awesome dishes. Customer for life.
Had a great lunch with Adrienne as our server.  My friend and I are picky people, but she was more than accommodating and recommended great drinks as well. Will be back for future lunches!

Went there last night for dinner. First the tables on the patio are to tall giving the impression you are a little boy. Very uncomfortable but probably a good idea to have those tables to make the shady customers inside the dark bar feel like the children they are. Food was bland and when I got home got me sick. The waitress was extremely awkward and served people who sat after us before. Plus, they serve food on outside patio while allowing people to smoke. Which in Illinois I'm pretty sure is illegal. This place needs to be out of buisness but won't because of the trailer trash clientele who probably spend their entire government check on booze their.  Steer clear. You have been warned

I've been here a few times with some friends for lunch on Friday's. The wait staff is always on par. I had the chili and it was just ok. Atmosphere is good and the waffle fries and the best I've tasted.

Jan 2014 - Great wings (there is one with a raspberry glaze that I've never had elsewhere - super good) and french fries. The Irving Park is very good. Service is good and everyone is friendly. The place is clean, but not super clean. I've had a few other things on the menu, and the food is ok. Good pizza specials.

Jun 2014 - Sorry Crossroads, but I had to knock the rating down to three stars. My wife and I have been coming here for 3 years, and it seems like the food is just not what it used to be. (Except for the buffalo wings...those still rock) The last three times the bread hasn't been fresh or the chicken is dry. We will keep coming back, just with lower expectations, and it's no longer one of those places we rave about or tell friends/family when they come to visit that this is one of the places they can't miss. 

Still 3 stars though.

Great outdoor patio, including removable window panels during the summer. It can be pretty hot on the "indoor" patio, but the cold beer will keep you comfortable.

The food is a step-up from your regular bar food. The best options are the pizza specials, and the wing deals. There's a dozen or so wing sauces, including spicy, bbq, garlic. YUM!! We've also had the steak sandwich, chicken sandwiches, and burgers, which are great. We usually order the heaping pile of onion strings to share.

Prices are reasonable, drinks are cheap.

-The waitresses always seems pretty distracted, so the friendly busboys bring the silverware, fill drinks, and get the containers.

We stopped by for the dinner. There is everything on the menu you want for the nice simple dinner - wings, ribs, burgers, salads, pizza - it is hard to choose something. We ended up sharing a few dishes just to try different things. 
Burger was done perfectly as we requested, with the pink center, and it was very tasty. Wings were very tasty and hot enough (hot is just a middle of the road - they also can be Wow and Banger Hot - our waitress advised us not even to think about those). Ribs were good. Parmesan garlic fries were to die for - those could've being my dinner by itself. Very good selection of beers. Excellent, very friendly service. 
I would highly recommend this place for a simple tasty dinner.

I checked this place out for lunch during the week. When you first walk in, it smells like stinky beer but after a few minutes you get use to the stench. There's a big bar area when you first enter. Along one wall are some slot machines. As you pass the bar and enter the back area there is a decent size dining room. Service was pretty good. As for food, I had the mini burgers and wings. Both were good. I would go back   again for lunch or happy hour.

Have outside area for folks to smoke eat and drink, well be sure you do not have cigars or maybe even a good old pipe.  We were asked not to smoke the cigars. What's the sense of having a smoking area outside and you are not allowed to have a cigar.  Won't be going back
they lost out on three new customers


Back to owners had the garlic fries for starters, but when advised no cigars we chose to not spend any more money than the almost $60 between the three of us in a little over 2 hours.  Had food week before it was alright nothing to write home about
Good food and drinks. The decor definitely needs to be updated and the bar need more light.

First our waitress was great.  That said...

My friend ordered 24 wings, different 4 different flavors and each flavor was billed as as four separate orders. The wings where smaller then you would typically get at BWW.  Their brosted chicken(that they are supposedly known for) was way over broasted, ribs had no meat(kinda more like a bat wing).  Their cream of mushroom soup was neither creamy nor did it have any mushrooms in it.  They find an excuse to up-charge you for everything. To top it off they serve RC cola. This place is cheap and greedy as it gets. Won't be back.

Stopped in on September 3rd, a Wednesday night around 9:25. Just me looking for a beer and dinner, nothing special. I was told that the kitchen was pretty much closed down, could only get food that came out of the fryer. Ordered wings, part medium and part lemon pepper. Not bad, but nothing to bring me back.

The staff seemed more interested in shouting at their friends across the bar and sharing a shot, so I had to wait longer than normal for another beer.

There was an unpleasant odor; maybe grease, dirty carpet and a hint of mold. Along with the video poker games along the wall, it didn't impress me. Maybe sitting outside in the summer with friends is a better experience, but I can get that anywhere. Not sure I'll return.

Dingy, small, locals only, mostly middle agers. Just some words to describe this location. Walked in with Angela P and the music came to a screeching halt.

We sat at the bar and ordered a couple Blue Moons. I have to admit I felt kinda out of place but after a few swigs of that moon, I was ok.

Ang wanted to try out some sauces so we ordered some chicken strips and six different sauces. The bartender was happy to help us even though she kept spitting out sly remarks, whateves, just get me another Blue Moon. The sauces were flavorful, my favorites were the hot and the dyno-mite, which was made with some raspberry jam. I would definitely go back to try out some different items on the menu.

We signed up for the Cross Roads VIP card which earns you points for food and drinks. We received a free burger voucher just for signing up!! The bartender told us they have a DJ on Thursday nights. There's a jukebox but be warned, if you play the songs from the top 40, some folk will give you the stink eye.
Wings are awesome, service wonderful! Thank you Kim. ( our server ) it's always a pleasant experience.

We got food from here a couple weeks in a row for our Beer O Clock weekly beer & wings fest. We tried the mild, BBQ, Sweet & Sour, hot, Wow hot, lemon pepper, & cajun flavored wings. I hear the Wow are killer! My coworkers kept feeling the burn and I did not dare try them. They were pretty hyped up so they weren't quite as hot as they expected but still killed their tastebuds.

I tried the BBQ wings and the Sweet and Sour. I loved the flavoring on both. And neither was spicy at all which I greatly appreciated...I love being able to try different flavors without killing my mouth on spice.  The BBQ were very good but I think Villa Rosa has a bit better sauce. Also, Villa Rosa's wings have a bit more meat on them. However, I really enjoy their more unique flavors like the Sweet & Sour Flavor as well as the Lemon Pepper.

We also got their cheesesticks which I liked better then most other places. I loved how they were soft & gooey still, not overcooked.

All in all, a good place for wings. I've even had the owners come and deliver us our food themselves and they seemed very nice!

Ok if you are close make sure you go and eat here. The food is great the people  are super nice. The bartender Allen will take good care of you. I was there several times while in  Chicago and he always made me feel welcome  and remembered my name and what I drank.

I'm so disappointed in this place. I live in the area and used to go to Crossroads a lot. Over the past few years, prices have continued to get higher and every time I go now, there seems to be something new and irritating that is on the border of price gouging. The latest was last week when I went and ordered wings. It wasn't a special price wing night or anything so i ordered 18 wings and wanted 3 different flavors. I think this is a reasonable request, it's what Bdubs does, but nope. I was told that they have to charge me for 3 separate orders of 6. Come on. I asked if that was the same if I ordered 24 wings or 36 wings. Yep, you only get the cheaper price if you order all of one flavor. WTF? It costs them no extra time or money to give me a different flavor.I know this sounds silly and nitpicky, but this was my last straw after years of one new cheapskate thing after another. Come on, get it together.
Great neighborhood bar/restaurant,  good food and friendly wait staff. Alan & Anna are the BEST!! Check out Tuesday nights for .55 cent wings YUMMY!!!

Take the place for face value, it's your local neighborhood bar, good food, cold beer, and friendly waitstaff, nothing fancy, nothing trendy, just an old school local bar

Decent drink specials, great thin crust pizza, good wings, good burgers and video gaming pays out!

Great place to come and unwind after a long work week

This place has a little bit of everything.  Restaurant dining, bar dining, semi outside dining, complete outside dining.  Tv's everywhere.  Best wings in the area.  It's not even close.  Catering it also terrific.  Great place to relax and get a good meal.

Crossroads is very meh. It's your standard divey restaurant/bar where all the locals come and hang out. Their beer selection isn't all that spectacular. They do have a few choices for seating: the bar area where it's always busy and bumpin' with locals, the dining area with a stage off to the side (the bar hosts music nights on occasion), and an outdoor patio overlooking Irving Park Road. The outdoor area has two parts to it: an enclosed area with those zipper windows and an actual outdoor seating area. 

The food is okay. I was pretty excited that they had a juicy lucy burger, which consists of putting the cheese INSIDE the meat so that you get gooey cheese with every bite. Unfortunately, my burger was sorely lacking on cheese. I asked for it cooked medium well, which it was, but apparently, the cheese doesn't hold so well when it's cooked that well, so you get less of it. I wish they would have told me that. My bf's burger was dripping cheese. I was so jealous.

Another complaint: I've sat in the dining area a few times and each time it's clearly obvious that they're overstaffed. I'll be sitting there, eating my food, and they'll be two servers watching me, waiting for me to finish so they can have something to do. Really? Sure, it's a guarantee that you'll get what you want when you want it, but it's pretty uncomfortable.

They have a rewards program if you remember to bring in the coupons they send in the mail. They also have food and drink specials every day, so check that out before you go. It was nice coming here a few times since it was so close to my apartment, but it's not a place I would go out of my way for.

We got a menu in the mail from Crossroads this past week and this weekend we decided to place a delivery order with them. We knew this would be from a local bar but some reviews seemed to suggest the food was good. Looking at the menu, and the high prices of their items (Turkey Club Sandwich $9.97, Mozzarella Sticks 8.99..) we were hoping their food was above pub food quality, especially after spending over $77.00 for our groups delivery order. We were sadly wrong and let down.

To start with we ordered their Surf and Turf (1/2 slab of ribs and 6 beer battered shrimp) which came with two sides. The ribs are advertised as "Slow cooked bbq ribs, hand selected baby back ribs, show cooked then char-grilled & topped with their secret bbq sauce". These ribs, while sorta tasty, were never grilled at all, simply cooked and then sauce put on them. The flavor of the sauce was a bit tangy and tasting like store bought hickory, nothing special. The ribs themselves were semi-ok but would have been much better had they actually been char-grilled as they claimed it would be. As for the sides, the salad is simpy a bag type lettuce you would by in a grocery store and not even rinsed off at that it seems. The cole slaw, deadly, smells like paint and tastes worse...stay away!!! This combo dish also came with was was supposed to be 6 beer batter shrimp. What we ended up with were about 8 very small shrimp, like shrimp you would put in a salad, the ones in the 45-60ct/lb bags in the store, and probably pre-battered. They sell just these shrimp alone in a 16ct as an appetizer for $10.79. Even being a part of this rib order, and only being 6, the $20.00 paid for this combo was not worth the money at all. We didn't even get shrimp sauce, not that there were enough shrimp meat to worry about it for.

Now for a bar, you would expect something like mozzarella sticks to be a staple and something you should easily be able to master and make very well, not here though. These appear to be something you would buy at your grocery store, like Farm Rich brand, and don't really appear to be fried, maybe oven cooked, as they are not crispy or melty at all, very soggy in texture and horrible in taste. Definitely not worth $9.00 for an order.

They seem to only have one crust style for their pizza, pre-made frozen from a food vendor, not fresh made. The cheese was good, the sauce was almost the flavor of bad ketchup, and forget the sausage, just plain pork sausage, not Italian. For a bar, this pizza would pass for bar food for those drinking, but you better have a few in you to truly enjoy it.

The only thing we had no complaints on was the Turkey Club Sandwich, except for the price. The sandwich was well made, nothing special, white bread, turkey, lettuce, tomato and mayo. An average good club, but not worth $9.79, especially that it came with no sides.

I will say that the quality of the food is fitting a lower end bar, and this bar seemed a higher grade bar from what we found online and expected a higher quality food. We were sadly wrong. If you are into a good time drinking, this looks like a great bar to visit for drinks, and after a few drinks the food may taste better, but you'll wake up with a hangover from the price you paid for that food for sure. 

If your looking for good food delivered, keep looking, way overpriced and very poor food quality.

Three things:
1) Wings = AWESOME.
2) Beer = NOT.
3) The rest of it = Meh.

**UPDATE**
1) Wings are still awesome. Seriously, they're probably the best thing on the menu so just go ahead and order them now and thank me later. 
2) The beer has improved!! There was a small but good list of craft beers that certainly had not been there in the past. The past two times I've gone they had Hop Stoopid and a Tighthead IPA on tap. Yuuuuuuuum. 
3) The rest of it is still meh. Sometimes service is awesome, sometimes it's terrible. The food is also hit or miss (with all the non wing entrees I've tried). 
4) But one more positive? I'm not big on atmosphere, but that does seem to be improving if you care about that sort of thing. The patio is nice, the place seems cleaner and less divey, even the exterior got a facelift. Keep up the good work, Crossroads!
Bloody Mary's are awesome!! Parmesan fries are to die for!! Wings were not so good but you can't have it all be the best.  It is your local sports bar with decent prices and daily specials.

There's no body to greet us as we enter. So we walk back and fourth down this hallway for awhile than the bartender looks at us and mutters something and I say "here for dinner" so he sits us in the dining room with menus and all. We look through them trying to decide because the four of us were extremely hungry while the waitress takes our drink order. A few minutes later another lady comes over and tell us their kitchen is closed and it's only 8:30! She hands us this late night menu, which is basically all bar food, everything fried besides the mini burgers and pizza.

Okay fine we stayed because we already got our drinks and it was getting late. Our waitress was extremely slow. We had to constantly look for her. Our food took a quite awhile and we had asked for the giardiniera on the side for our pizza, but they messed that up and put it on the pizza what if someone was allergic and didn't realize it was on the pizza?! Yes, we could of complained, but it was already 9:15ish and by the time they take the pizza back and make a new one it'll be 9:45. No thanks.

There food wasn't bad, but the service wasn't great. To try and make it up they gave us a card for a free appetizer on our next visit, if there is one. She even said we tried to give you guys something better, but this is all we have. Wow. Better? How about $$ off our meal or a gift certificate for a next one? An appetizer does nothing.
Pizza is really good. I've had 4-5 different items in the menu and have liked them all. The bar is kinda small and crammed but still nice inside.  Very nice outdoor area to eat.

Ate here twice, with 2 very different experiences. 

I had lunch here one day, a burger and salad, nothing to rave about but no complaints either. Prices were okay, food was okay, service was okay. Better than fast food choices in the area. 

And then...

I came across a restaurant.com certificate for them and thought, why not? They are close to me and savings are savings. So I purchased one. 

Now, I've said it before in other reviews, I really feel that restaurants that participate in discount offers who stipulate "must present prior to ordering" on the offer make me suspicious as to WHY one must present prior to ordering. My suspicions have been validated before (see my review on Bait Cafe and The Shanty, for example) and once again they have been validated dining here at Crossroads.  

Service went out the window as soon as I presented the certificate. Which was fine, really. I go to a restaurant mainly to eat. Rarely do I go for ambiance and never do I go for service. 

What absolutely DID NOT sit well with me is the way my entire meal suffered because I chose to present the certificate. 

The $4.95 House Soup. for example. The bowl is a joke - wide but extremely shallow. I seriously doubt more than a cup-sized portion fits into it. But then to have said shallow bowl only filled about half-way? For 5 bucks? Seriously?

The UP Reuben, for another example. The menu advertises it as "home roasted corned beef, piled high with saurkraut and swiss cheese on dark rye, 1000 island dressing on the side". There was NOTHING piled high on this here sammich. It was pitifully flat with extremely sparse ingredients. You could see the melted cheese on the bread and it looked like there was 1/2 a slice for the whole thing. Half a VERY THIN slice. And the dressing came in a tiny little crock on the side, not really enough for HALF a sammich, let alone the whole thing. I asked for another, and was not told there would be an up-charge for it, but there was. 

The reuben was accompanied by seven, SEVEN, waffle-cut fries. I mean, could they spare them? 

My companion's meal fared no better. The chicken tortilla soup portion was similar, and tasted like something out of a can. The triple decker turkey club was also extremely sparse with the ingredients. Nine waffle-cut fries meant they left only slightly less hungry than I did. 

Would not return here, despite the location being pretty convenient.

I want to like this place but I really dont but I have been back...

I think its funny they advertise they won Wing Fest, Best Ribs, and Bensenville Chili Cook Off but that all happened before 2008 and that is nearing 5 years ago. Its like a 22 year old telling you how bad ass he was in high school but he never actually went to college. Al Bundy?
