The pizza is good, the wings are good, and the garlic waffle fries are good. The daily specials will keep you coming back despite suspect service on occasion.

One time we had great service with 10 plus people and another time I had horrible service sitting at a 4 top.

They do have a sweet patio outdoor section for the warmer months but the bathroom sucks! 

All in all, I am not sure when or if I will be back...

As I work until 9 pm most nights cooking is not always an option.  And living in Itasca further complicates matters because this town is the black hole for delivery service.  Options are at best abysmal.  Crossroads was some place new to try and I was hopeful. I feel because ordering out is more the norm for my schedule than a treat I am qualified to rate fast food.  My surf (shrimp) was so ridiculously sad I wanted to cry.  I had Long John Silvers shrimp a month ago and they were quite big and very good.  I was amazed.  These were small and tasteless with no sauce and they were cold.  The turf was the ribs.  Very small. Average in meat but they never saw a grill. Cole slaw smelled so bad I tossed it.  Salad was bagged and warm. But ok.  I ate someone else's chicken tenders and they are just like IHOPs.  Hard breading, but real chicken meat.  I felt gypped and won't order again. So the search goes on :(

I met the devil at the Crossroads and he offered me all you can eat Crab Legs for $25.95, and so we ate and ate and ate...bucket after sinful bucket, 21 in all!

We were so bummed when we tried to meet at the old North Ave. locale only to find they had closed and so so happy to refind them at the new digs, complete with outside deck for summertime fun!

The service was super friendly, especially considering we were crab chowing hounds, and the libations were fast flowing as well.

The wings are also delicious, as are the burgers.  The Funion Onion burger is my favorite so far, but I haven't tried "The No Makin' Out With You" Burger yet: onions, garlic, and horseradish, sounds awesome though.

Live music on Saturdays (same night as the crab legs special).  Looks like they have a wings special on Tuesday nights, so I'll have to check that out sometime this summer.

Manage your expectations, here. Crossroads is not big on atmosphere. It's a little dark inside, the enclosed patio can be chilly, and, well, it's a bar. (Excuse me, a "tavern and eatery.") 

But the food is good, and so is the service -- usually. The wings are fantastic, nicely crispy-fried with a great variety of sauces. Want something a little sweet and a little spicy? Try the new Dyn-o-mite sauce. I think it had strawberry jam in it. But oooh, that kick added up. Other appetizers (PLEASE, can we ban the word "appe-teezers"?) are tasty but skip the nachos, they're mediocre.

The burgers and sandwiches are by and large very good, and the pot roast sandwich is pretty dang awesome -- their pot roast is almost as good as mine. Pizza is thin crust pub style, tasty but not outstanding. Ribs are good but not quite up to Sweet Baby Ray's down the street. (Sorry, guys.) And their homemade chips and waffle fries are quite good.

The service has always been pretty good, but a little scattered -- our waiter most recently was very friendly, but spaced out on the ranch we requested, and we never got silverware. (Thankfully, we did get napkins.)

Prices are very reasonable, they have some great specials -- including drinks -- and it's a good place to bring a rowdy crowd.

In short, a good neighborhood bar/grill, low on atmosphere but high on service and food.

The only times I have been here has been during my lunch time during the week. They tend to be slow, and if we ever ask to have the check when our food comes (only cause we have 1 hour and our boss is a Nazi about time) we have gotten attitude. And we always do it in a polite manner, never bossy, we just need to eat quickly, that's all. 

The food is always good--thats what keeps me coming back. However, I am a HUGE fan of coleslaw and prefer it over fries. I can opt for that, yet I get a little condiment size portion--BS I say. I swear restaurants should be really aware that you look very CHEAP by giving me that tiny of a portion. 

Your food is great and I have never been displeased--but give your wait staff a reality check and give me more coleslaw.

I went there on Tuesday for their .50 wing special. Tried the Sweet Dynamite and Teriyaki wings. Both were plump and perfectly cooked to a light crispiness. The sweet dynamite wings though were very good while the teriyaki were just passable. 

Atmosphere is a bit underwhelming at this locals type watering hole...but the wings were good enough that I'd come back for the special. Service was pretty good as well.

If you are in the area on a Tuesday...it's worth a looksie.

Planes, trains and automobiles. 

That's what you get if you sit on the deck here. The deck is situated right off Irving Park Road and with the trains nearby and Ohare not far off you get all sort of traffic noise. The weather was so nice out we couldn't bear to sit inside that dark dingy tavern. 

I came specifically for the wings. My wife had a burger. The wings were a big disappointment. Menu tauted these as the perfect wings after 15 years of experimenting in the kitchen. All they tasted like to me was some soggy (not crispy at all) breaded wing doused in Franks Red Hot sauce and vinegar. Did not even bother to take the leftover wings home with us. Waffle fries tasted like they were cooked in with the tortillas and were way too salty. They had a distinct taste of corn chips. My wife said the burger was good but not unlike others we had had closer to home. 

Service was a bit on the slow side. Waitress did not seem to care that we did not like the meal. We had to chase down our waitress to pay our bill so that we could leave to pick up our daughter. 

All in all...would not return here.

After checking into our hotel around 9, we were starving, and this was one of the only places open. It must be THE go to place on Thursday nights, because lots of people were arriving when we got there. (There isn't much to do around this area) Since they were serving food, they get an automatic star, but it was only a limited menu. We got sliders (not that great) , teryiaki wings, coconut shrimp, beer battered shrimp,mozzarella sticks, and fries. The shrimp weren't bad, and the fries were really good. 
We were seated directly in front of the karaoke stage(LOUD), and even though we were exhausted, we got into it a bit. We were lucky to have some really good singers though, because otherwise it would have been a miserable time.

What I like about this place is that is has a bar, a dining room, and an outdoor deck.  So you can choose the atmosphere that best fits you and your group.  I would say the wings are better than Buffalo Wild Wings, they just have that light crispy-ness I'm looking for in a wing.  Beer selection is above average and the burgers are good, but not amazing.

Come here after work to watch the game, or for some of their live music, they have "Reggae night Thursdays" which is pretty sweet.

A message to the owners: GET NFL NETWORK!
I was shocked to find out they didn't have it when I wanted to watch the Thursday night game, had to go elsewhere.  I feel that they loose business because of this.

This place has an identity crisis. Does it want to be a restaurant or a bar? Food is overpriced for what you get (ie quality) and the bar (ie beer selection) is lacking. There are better options in the area. Deck would be nice in summer - too bad it's so close to the road.

I'm giving this review 4 stars based on the wings only. I've never tried any of their other food and I can't imagine it being great. The WINGS however - amazing! Spicy Garlic is our staple. Just the right amount of spicy with lots of flavor as well. I can't really say it tastes too garlic-y and that's probably why I like it. Not that I don't like garlic ( i do!! ), but spicy garlic has never been my favorite wing type  - just not a good mix for me. Something about these wings make them perfect and make my mouth water! 

Nothing amazing with the beer, except for the cheap prices. They always have a special and the pitchers are always ridiculously cheap. This is a nice place to go, relax, and have some wings. 

One word of warning though: If you are a spicy fanatic (like i am) and see the crazy hot wings that have one all sorts of rewards and come with your waitress telling you that you absolutely do not get a refund - only do it if you are prepared to not exactly enjoy these wings. You can SEE the pepper seeds ALL OVER the wings and can't feel your lips for the rest of the night. They have a delish flavor and definitely get your adrenaline (and sweat glands) pumping, but this is something that I will never attempt again. Glad I did it once though!!

1) I think we found a new go-to bar
2) Why have I never been to this place until now?!

I was expecting the worst for Crossroads. Tucked away on Irving Park Road, with a Margaritaville themed patio, late on a Saturday night = high potential of douchebaggery. Boy, I was pleasantly surprised! 

Crossroads had some great drink specials, including a raspberry vodka lemonade for $3.50 that night that was awesome. While we sat inside, the band out on the patio actually sounded pretty good. It wasn't packed, but it also wasn't too empty either.

We ordered some sliders and hot wings off of the late-night menu. The BF loved the sliders, noting that they were actually made to order and were not pre-formed/pre-packaged sliders. The wings were all that they were cracked up to be. They were definately hot, and definately tasty!

We will definately be back!
Interior kind of old looking. Beer and ribs were good and outside eating area nice. Service was very good.

This place was recommended to me by a few people in the area. So I figured I'd give it a shot. I stopped in for lunch one day had a cheap can of beer which is where this place gets its 2 stars from. Everything else about this place is BAD. I had wings and fries for lunch as well. Fries nothing special and the wings were terrible. I don't consider myself a negative person when it comes to bashing something as simple as a wing, but these were awful. Anyways came back at a later date to drink and only that. Again good cheap can beer but nothing else. They use monster for their bombs which is gross. The bartender was drunk and broke a glass on the bar in front of us and no one else that worked their seemed to care. Stayed for another hour regardless and then took off. I'd go back to grab a quick beer but nothing else.

Yes...absolutely wonderful. Great drink specials. Great service. Great food. The wings ARE all they are cracked up to be. The spicy garlic flavor goes into my top 5 list of all time wings (quite possibly the best wings in Chicago). Perfect for a lazy Sunday afternoon on their faux beer garden. Someway, somehow, the owners got this place right and I just wish they were withing reasonable cab distance to my house so I could watch football here. I highly recommend this place for family-bar food lunch or just a "time to yourself" beer, wings, and ball game. My wife and I go out of our way to spend an hour or two here and catch up on our relationship philosophies!

I liked when it was in its old location on North Ave so I'm hater from the start. I've only been to the new loc.2  times.Its ok just a dive pub/bar. A lot I mean alot of bikers hang out there.I was scared to walk out of the door because there were so many bikes lined up.I feared a pee wee herman replay,eek!

They have a patio you can sit on which would be nice in the summer but they let people smoke out there so that ruins it for me there. 

The food is typical bar food we had the onion strings.They were good but greasy.I had a grilled cheese and it was tasty along with their fries and coleslaw. My family enjoyed their meals. No one had a bad meal just nothing to great to yelp about. oh yea the bbq sauce is really good. I dipped my fries in it and it tasty spicy I likey!

Friendly but overpriced food and below average quality.  The hamburger was like $9.50 and you could make better at home.  Burger tasted like the freezer burn ground beef you get at a grocery store.  And the decor is sad and depressing.  Um, how about cleaning, painting and some new tables so you can throw out the sticky vinyl tablecloths?? 
Another rip off suburban joint overpricing food and serving poor quality.  The idiots who like this place need to drive to the city.  For 8 bucks you get a great quality burger PLUS a lot of fries (not the 12 you get here) in every neighborhood in Chicago.  I hate these crap restaurants in the Western suburbs.

SPew....this should be called cross__it.. How are there no recent reviews on how this is the worst pizza ever?! Total tasteless cardboard. Zero exaggeration. And the bartender got the order wrong. The wings are good....but BEWARE the pizza!!! Too thin crust, hardly any sauce, no flavor...$17 dollars for the worst pizza ever!!!!!!!!

For some little locals spot, I was really pleasantly surprised. What it lacks for in looks and atmosphere, it makes up with seriously awesome wings. I would have never noticed the place but my boyfriend insisted that they have the best wings ever and he delivered. Give it a chance.

Visited in the summer. Food was o.k. Service was extremely slow and we were the only couple in the dining area.  The place was infested with flies!!  When I mentioned it to our server, she was like yeah uh huh.. Wow! It's common I guess.

Enjoyed the food and service at Crossroads for years and followed them to Wood Dale when they moved from Elmhurst. The all you can eat Crab Legs on Saturday night's was the main lure for us. I know prices for Crab Legs can be up and down with no fault to Restaurants that serve them but the price more than Doubled- from the hi $20 to low $30 range to $69.95 all you can you eat- was an eye opener. Still enjoyed the Crab Legs minus the sticker shock. The Beers on tap and service from the staff are still very good and friendly. Good crowd and plenty of parking is always a big plus for me.

It's about as good as a Wood Dale bar gets.  The food is good, the drinks are ho hum and there's always an odd collection of Wood Dalions young and old here.  

The wings are superb and they even have ranch wings.  I was told I was the first person to ever order them from my server but it was surprisingly good.  

If you're stuck in the Hood Dale/Bensenville area, your best bet for a decent time is Crossroads.

Great bar grub at a great price!  Service is fast and friendly, and some of their specialty pizzas are to die for!  I always enjoy the prime rib sandwich or the garlic parmesan fries or a burger AND the fact that there's always enough to take home for the next day.  Even if you're not a barfly, give this place a try!

For such a tiny burb that even people who have lived in the metro area their entire lives have never heard of, Wood Dale really has some of the best comfort food in all of Chicagoland.  Between Sweet Baby Rays and Crossroads, if you want a good fattening piece of meat, Wood Dale's your town.

But let's focus on Crossroads.  Its claim to fame is its award winning wings and it is easy to see why they win awards.  From the traditional buffalo style (close to perfect blend of heat and flavor) to the whacked-out (a super spicy sweet concoction that appeared to be made from some sort of berry jam), the wings are always cooked and flavored just right.  I can only think of one other place that has wings nearly this good, and it's all the way in Valparaiso... and apparently also closed.

The rest of the food is pretty standard bar fare, just done really well.  Lots of excellent sandwiches, including a truly delicious pot roast sandwich on an onion bun.  They also do really good pizza in the thin, crispy pub style, which is a nice change of pace from all the uber-Italian choices.

Service is usually consistently good here too.  Our waiter was particularly friendly on our most recent trip.  And not in a "here's a list of friendly statements sent down from corporate" kind of way.

There are Applebee's and Friday's and all those sorts of places in the area, but when I want that kind of food I'd much rather go to a place like this.  Who doesn't want a little bit of comfort food made a little better, at a better price in a much more authentic feeling setting?

I've been beaten by hot wings!  For a fan of spicy flavors, always ordering the hottest sauce at any restaurant (and adding more sauce in the case of 911 at Hooters), Crossroads' WOW wings were too much for me.  
The patio is nice for the summer time, and they have live music often.  The crowd is pretty widespread but teeters back and forth age-wise depending on the day and time.
This place is so choice! There burger is one of my favorites and they always have amazing drink specials.  Try the wings too and ask for the blonde waitress that also bartends she's great

Great place to grab a drink and sit out on the patio.  Our server was very fun and brought out a round of shots with the tray balanced on his head.  I ordered the garlic waffle fries which were amazing.
The wings are amazing!!!! Sweet dynamite!!! I am definately coming back to try the rest of the flavors.

After hearing about the wings at Crossroads,  I thought I would give them a shot.  With Wingtown and B-dubs as my standards,  the bar is set pretty high.  With that said,  the wings at Crossroads are just  OK.  Nothing bad about them, nothing all that good either.   But in a pinch,  they'll do.  This is the first time I have been to Crossroads since they moved from Elmhurst.   The place is no different.  Kinda dumpy. The parking lot is a complete mess and the bar area has this stink to it....  This overwhelming perfumy smell like a urinal biscuit seems to permeate every little hole-in-the-wall bar I go into. I'm not sure if this is from the cleaner they use on the floors or what but it really turns me off to a place.  I'll be back to check out Crossroads other food.

I happened to be in the area today and I was hoping to fill my wing fix.  I came in, but sadly, did not get wings because it is Monday.  They are normally $9.95 for a dozen, and they are good and worth it, but I could not imagine forking over that money when i saw that on Tuesday they are only 45 cents a piece.  But they had a half pound burger for $1.99, and while it wasn't awesome, it was only two bucks (well, each topping is 75 cents and each side is 99 cents to add to it).  Friday they have a fish fry and Saturday they have crab leg specials.
Ate here about a month ago. Wings: greasy outside,dry inside. Ribs: dry and tough. Burger: dry.  If you claim your wings are so great, they ought to be. Really dissapointed.

I've been here a quite a few times to dine, and the food is "okay"...more or less a convenience.  Some items are better than others, and it also depends on the service for overall quality.  I inquired recently about a private event via email and this is the response I got.  "Just so I understand. You want to do this party for the least amount possible but not willing to pick up the phone.  Got it."  So...needless to say, my business will not be going to this place anymore!  Thanks Paul for all your "hard" work at Crossroads.
I personally wouldnt eat here BUT i do go in the summer on some wednesdays because they have bags and its a lot of fun to go with friends and make a fool out of yourself! : )

This is a solid joint , basically a bar with a decent sized  dining room. Their newer building doesn't have the same looks as their last location on North avenue , but it looks alright. I can't say anything here ever blew me away , but I have been back a few times. The ribs are a little too bland , depending on it's sauce too much. The burgers are pretty good , the fried fish , good. A member of my group did not like the meatloaf at all. The fried onion "loaf" was a tangle of fried onions , and was a little greasy but still tasty. The chicken wings were probably my favorite thing here , and they were only good.'
This place is more of a pub first with pretty good food service, at least that was my impression.

Why haven't I reviewed Crossroads before?  

Probably because it is such a hit-and-miss pub.  It was a real Hit at North and Rt. 83.  It was known for All-You-Can-Eat crab legs then.  And I went often, and ate them often.  5 stars......there and then.

The new location started out fairly strong, although the parking lot is smaller.   The menu is different, the atmosphere is pubby.

They pitch their ribs - but they're a bit below average, usually, but not always.

Their nachos range from mediocre to good to great, but not always.

Their burgers are usually something less, but not always.

Pizza is pub pizza.  Salads are pub salads.  

Overall they started in Wood Dale at 4 stars, and are now barely holding onto 3 stars..... you've really gotta try harder in this economy guys.  Because next is two, then one, then gone.

NO STARS because of the kitchen!  Pizza had hair in it. They ran out of pizza topping that was listed on the menu.  Plus, they couldn't tell what the difference is between a triangle cut and squared cut pizza after requesting it three times, they still got it wrong each time.  Even though they never charged us for the pizza, it wasn't worth it.  We left and went elsewhere for pizza.  Crossroads Bar isn't the place to go and eat.

If you want some HOT wings order the wow wings. The server will try to talk you out of it because I guess there are a lot of yuppie eaters who think they like hot stuff but crap their pants when they eat something hot. I usually get an audience from the kitchen when I order them because I have them make them even hotter. The cook told me he damn near choked to death when he inhaled the vapor coming off my wing order. They are good, great, fantastic, and whatever other accolades you can pile on.
You like soup? You must try the tomato artichoke soup. The best soup I have ever tasted. The burgers are great and filling. The beer is always cold and the drinks are strong like they should be. (all you tea toddling yuppies be warned).
Dessert. Chocolate cake. Make sure you got somebody to split it with you. It is a whole friggin cake!!! And delicious too! 
My only bitch it the wait staff. My bill was a little over 50 bucks. I laid down a c-note. The waiter asks if I want my change. A 15.00 tip quickly changed to a 5 dollar tip.  That comment, which has happened every time I have been there is my only bitch about this place.
Best Wings in Wood Dale.........IF THEY ARE THE ONLY PLACE THAT SELLS WINGS IN WOOD DALE!!!!!!!!!!   Skinny hairy wings.  yuck!

Great food! My buddy and I came in for lunch yesterday and were blown away! The hamburger and fries were AMAZING and my buffalo chicken burger was really fantastic! I ordered a salad instead of fries and the salad was a little small and disappointing. Its a bit pricey but the quality is there. Great service too.
AMAZING crab Rangoon! Best of my life. If you haven't tried this little gem, you should. Delicious and worth the trip!!!

I was craving for some Chinese and found this gem hidden right under my nose, just walking distance from where I live. We ordered tofu fried rice (for me) and chicken fried rice ( for my wife). We were surprised by how the food tasted and the quantity  for such a low price. You will not be disappointed. It sates your hunger.

I'm kind of a boring when it comes to ordering chinese food.  I like sides.  My go to meal is usually of potstickers & beef fried rice.  I haven't yet found my holy grail of these in the schaumburg area. 

Potstickers - these were super tiny, but there were a decent number and had good flavor. I prefer larger potstickers with chewier dough that is still has a bit of the crunchy fried texture on the outside.

Beef fried rice - The beef in this was really nice, very tender, and there was a good amount of kick to it.  The veg included were carrots and sprouts.  I would have preferred green onion to carrots, the sweetness is a bit odd to me. 

Egg rolls - these were good.  Crunchy, flavorful.  

Waitstaff were fantastic. 

Everything tasted fresh and was high quality. I'll ask next time if I can have onions instead of carrots in the fried rice, might be my go to chinese spot.

I like the veggie noodles but everytime i ask for tofu in it  when i order carryout they forget to add it. Its pretty annoying. 
Other than that its good. It would be a good carryout place if they got my order correct and not charge me for it since they forgot to add it.

Yum, yum, yummy!  We order every week. The owner is there all the time and remembers everything you like.   Hard working, great food. Have to try the crab ragoons ( her home made sauce is amazing) ... A must try!  #crabragoons,  Kung beef, egg foo young.   Emerging is amazing!
Hidden treasure! the fired noodle is very authentic and yum. Their homemade sweet sour sauce is a must try.

This is your typical little Chinese restaurant that is primarily for take out. The woman working was incredibly sweet! The food was delicious and the egg rolls were the best I've ever had! I'm just sad that I haven't tried Sizzling Wok sooner!

The food was great, and when they say extra spicy they really do mean it. What really impressed me was the woman that works there. You can tell that she is incredibly hard working, and she is without a doubt one of the sweetest people I've had the pleasure of working with for takeout. I gave her a pretty good tip, and she even called me and thanked me when she got back from delivering my food. I will absolutely be going back.

Tried calling this place multiple times to place an order during their regular business hours and nobody picked up.  Even waited an hour and then two hours after we originally had called and received no answer. :(  I was excited to try it.

So far this is my favorite take out place for Chinese food. Tried many lunch combos and they were all good. My favorite is beef lo main. The owner is always pleasant and remembers returning customers. I highly recommend it.

This place has THE BEST egg rolls! Seriously, they are amazing!! And they also have the most friendly, delightful staff. I've never been to their actual store, I just order online. No matter how busy, they always find time to squeeze my delivery in, and they delivery guy/gal is always so pleasant-- I just love this place :)

Just tried this place for the first time. Great food! Good egg rolls, great pot stickers (thin wonton, small but a lot of them), excellent BBQ pork fried rice and the Mongolian beef was delicious. Place your order online and go pick it up! The lady inside is nice too!
This is probably the best Chinese food in Schaumburg. It's a small hole in the wall that makes great classic and mainland dishes.

I used to live right around the corner from this place and would order weekly. It was to the point that the owner knew my voice and my order when I called. It's a hole in the wall and most suited for take out. The food is delicious and reasonably priced and I'm pretty particular about both. The chow main and fried rice had the great wok flavoring and the wonton soup had large wontons and tons of veggies in it. The downside is that a friend once asked to use the restroom there and was escorted to the restroom behind the counter so it was safe to assume that it is the same one the employees use. Went to wash hands and there was no soap....sick and a bummer.

This is a great little mom and pop, hole-in-the-wall Chinese place.  There is a great variety on the menu and what I've had has been great.  I keep going back for the vegetable egg foo young.  Don't expect fashionable decor or even many places to sit down.  You generally just want to order for take-out.  If you come to eat in, calling ahead is good, too, since they make everything to order.

Sizzling Wok is probably one of the better Chinese cuisine spots in the Schaumburg area. It's a small place stuck in a corner with great food. 

If you are an impatient person, I would not recommend it. I don't mind waiting for good food. 

I love their crab Rangoon. Its made with real crab meat, and served with and orange dipping sauce. Plus you don't get ripped off when it comes to the size. I hate it when you order crab Rangoon and it can be eaten in one bite. This is definitely not the case.

The proportions are huge. You could split a regular order between two people, but I like to order just for me and have left-overs. 

The hot and sour soup is savory too!

The food tastes really good! This might be a hole in the wall but it's definitely worth it and very well priced for the portions that you get. It is all fresh and made to order and perfect for takeout.

Huffington Post has been talking smack about us Yelpers using 5 stars when its a hole-in-the-wall.  Here I am doing just that.  Shows what I think about the validity of the writers at Huffington Post!  I was talking about Egg Foo Young with a fellow Chicago ex-pat here In LA.  It started me thinking about this restaurant, which was my favorite little hole-in-the-wall.  This and Yu's Mandarin are my favorites!  It only has a small handful of tables, but they do their best to provide you with good service.  It takes a while to get your food ready, as they prepare your food fresh for you.  None of that sitting in a warming tray crap.  Remember the old Chinese saying "better a man wait for his meal, than the meal wait for the man".  This place had the best in old school Chinese food.  Sure they got Sweet & Sour Chicken (shifts uncomfortably in chair) if you're so inclined (I guess some people still think Panda Express is real Chinese food). It would be wise to order something GOOD though.  Here, let me guide you.  Thanks to "themenudrawer.com" I found a menu to help find the good things I've had there.  
531 Lets start with the egg foo young.  IMO is the best I've had, anywhere.  Its not on the menu, but I ask them to make it combination with all the meats.  Pay the extra money for it.  Its not much, but its worth it. Also, order the large sizes as you get a huge bonus for the price.

 332 Two Delights in Garlic Sauce.  Shrimp & Scallops.  Need I say more?  I ask for it hot.  I pay extra for more seafood.  Its nice that you can tell them how much you want.  Like a dollar more for a few more pieces or three dollars more for a handful more.

Their lunch specials are a great deal at less than $6.  There are things that are not on the menu.  They have a board up with their extra specials.  Chicken with black bean sauce is awesome.  The beef, tomato & green pepper is so good also.  I've had a lot of other things, but I consider these the things I listed as the best.  Now for the piece de resistance.  GET THE EGG ROLL!! Make sure you get the apricot sauce to go with eat.  Eat it and tell me that's not the best egg roll (and sauce) you've ever had.  Go ahead.  I dare you.  The egg rolls themselves are worth the ride out there.

This is a great little Chinese food place.  The quality of the food is really good, everything always tastes great and the owners are super friendly.  I drive out of my way about 20 minutes to eat here and it's always worth it.  It's not much of a sit down place because I think there's only 2-3 tables, but for take out, it's great.

Just tried to order lunch for pick up. It took me 10 min to order Mongolian Beef only because she did`t understand my question "What kind of lunch specials do you have with chicken?". Food is ok, nothing special. I`m not going to waste my time and order anything from them next time.

3 stars for cleanliness, friendly, and fast service. I can't comment on the taste because I'm not a fan of subway. Sorry. 

This place is located in a strip mall surrounding CVS and other restaurants. 

They keep their bread and ingredients fresh here =)

Excellent food and service. 

Staff was friendly and the food was fresh...unlike a lot of places similar to this type of food. The atmosphere is bright and clean looking, ( don't let the outside fool you). 

I ordered the chicken Gyro plate with the salad and fresh cut fries. It came with a honey mustard sauce which is good, but I asked for a Tzatziki sauce and it was given to me at no extra charge. 

Lastly, the only slightly negative thing I can say is that the Tzatziki sauce was too garlicky for my taste, but still very good.
This is my new go to place and need a quick bite for Gyros. Service is top notch, food is very good. I'm a huge fan of their Gyros and Fries. Also its very clean restaurant. Will be coming back soon!

It's been a really long time since I've left a 2 star review - but, I have to be honest, no matter how much I dislike leaving a few stars...

In this case - pictures appear deceiving...

I've been wanting to try Oh My Pita for some time since they recently opened...
It's a new spot in the area, located near the industrial section of town and not really easy to find..In fact, its super easy to miss.  There isn't large signage and its located right next to Mexico 2000 (in a connected bldg.) off of Fullerton...They specialize in Gyros, Shawarmas and Greek sides...A mix of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern...

Walking in, there is ample room to eat-in with many tables & even a flat screen.  You can instantly see the various Spits behind the counter and everything is prepared in front of you behind the glass...Place is cute and looked brand spanking new & spotless...
Owner was friendly and engaging.....

I wanted to try a few things. They offer a few types of Gyros meat: regular, Chicken & Pork.
Shawarma:  Beef & Chicken.  I went with the Beef Shawarma plate (comes w/2 sides).
I've had Shawarma at various Middle Eastern restaurants and always enjoyed it..
Sides:  Greek French fries (thin cut fries topped with feta & oregano and slice of lemon) and
Falafel.  Plus gyros...Friend had the Gyros plate, side of potato salad and falafel.  Ordered a side of Hummus also.  I asked for tahini and tzatziki on the side...

4 cut pieces of pita were included w/my hummus.  All plates came with one fresh pita. Meat portion was generous. .

I dove into my beef Shawarma first....

First bite - very tender, flavor & marinade was different, not like anything I've tasted in the past.  Meat texture was off-putting - odd texture.

Second bite was a mouthful of very fatty and tough meat - total opposite of first bite..
I discretely put a napkin over my mouth and disposed of it..
And that's pretty much how the *bites* went...I either had a forkful of oddly textured tender meat -  OR fatty, tough, inedible meat.  I couldn't eat another bite.  I was done.  The Fat Lady sang...

The Falafel presented itself as such, but texturally dense and uninspired in flavor.
Hummus tasted just like Tahini to me...no lemon or garlic to be found...The Greek fries were ok...crispy w/feta.  Tzatziki was very thin.
Moving on to the Gyro....pretty good, not bad - let's just say it SAVED the meal.  

My friend thought the Gyro was ok.  Said the potato salad was bland.  I had him taste my Shawarma and said it left a strange taste in his mouth - he agreed, the quality of the meat was more than inferior.  This place closes at 6pm.  Had they still been open, I would have brought my shawarma back - it was simply unacceptable.

The last thing I'd want to see is a local business owner struggling...
I can only hope some improvements will be made in the near future...

I'll stick with Stav's gyros in the meantime. ..

This place had not been open too long so when driving by it, I felt it was my duty to check it out.
The location is among factory and warehouses on Fullerton Ave. I am hoping that they will be successful here because the location does not have the best visibility since the location is kind of like an oasis in a desert. Could be a tough go.
Anyway, on to the food. Ordered a Gyros and a Chicken Shawarma sandwich to go. I talked about the place with the fellow who was making the sandwiches about the business and how they were doing, the biz, the location, blah, blah, blah.
The sandwiches themselves were very good. Fresh ingredients and they were not skimpy on them either. The place is nicely decorated and very clean inside. Service was friendly and efficient. Give them a try.

Cheers to All

So a few weeks ago I got a menu from here that was mailed to me and I looked through it and wanted to try it out. My bf visited me last weekend and I said that we should try this place out and OMG this place is delicious. We both got the beef shrawma and I got the Greek fries. They've got other stuff of course but the food was so good. Even my bf loved it. They cook the food in front of you and the prices are really good. This place did not disappoint. I'm def coming back to this place whenever I can.

I had a good chicken shawarma plate from Oh My Pita: Chicken Shawarma with 2 sides (falafel and greek salad - that look exactly like the side of tomatoes, onions, and lettuce that also came on the plate).  It's not like Zaytunes, but offers some differences from the normal Elmhurst/Addison flavors that I have come to know; can only have so much Chicken, rice, and/or greek potatoes.  What stood out was the multiple meats they have on the rotisseries.
Good quality ingredients. Greek fries and beef shawarma were both good. Nice clean restaurant. The owner was super nice.
Very nice workers and great customer service. Fairly new and very clean place. Gyros are a must and Greek fries were the best things I've ever tasted.

Came here twice, fist time was really hard to find if you're not familiar with the area. Nice staff and clean even though they mixed up my order. Not a big deal but rather than making me a new gyro they opened it up, picked the ingredients out that I didnt want into the garbage can, then wrapped it back up again. Gyros are good but both times felt they were too tiny with barely any sauce and was charged for additional. Not worth the drive for me. If you're close then it's fine but order 2 if you're really hungry. I live near a place that makes them way more generous so I won't be going back.
I ordered catering for a large business meeting. EVERYONE loved it!
Food was all good. Wife said it was the best Greek salad she has ever had. A little pricey for what it is but still good
I liked it!  The gyro plate with greek fries and falafel was very good.  The portions were generous, plus the service was friendly and fast.

been here once and the food was really good. gyros was fresh and very tasty place was clean and inviting. really dont have anything mean to say about this place. i will be back in the future when i get the opportunity.

I tried this place out for the first time today and was not disappointed by any means. The beef and lamb gyro was delicious and prepared right in front of me, as the grill and food preparation area are in full view of the restaurant's. The pita was overflowing with tender, flavorful meat, and the tzatziki and vegetable toppings were very fresh. Upon mentioning that I was a first-time patron while checking out, I was even given a free eclair desert that was also very good. Overall, Great food, friendly staff, and very nice interior. I just wish the restaurant itself wasn't so tucked away and more people would be able to discover such a great place!

After coming here twice I decided it's time to leave a review. The beef shawarma is seasoned perfectly with just the right amount of veggies and tahini sauce. The Greek fries are fresh cut fries cooked golden brown, lightly crispy, and topped with a generous amount of feta and oregano, served with a lemon wedge. I got a second one cuz I like extra lemon. The Greek salad is big served with any veggies you want. I had mine topped with gyros which is probably the best gyros meat I've ever had. It's also served it with a pita, so even better you can make a sandwich with your salad. Remember to order a side of tzatziki sauce if you go that route. The falafel sandwich is a must try. It's not your typical falafel but it's to die for. If you live in the area they also deliver.

This is such an amazing restaurant with great food ! Clean restaurant, some of the best gyros and falafel I've ever tried, fresh cut fries were very good. Staff was very nice even offered me a free desert. Will defiantly visit again.

When I rate a place I go off cleanliness, quality of food and staff/owner. My review is 5 stars on all of those!!! I had the chicken Schawarma it was delicious/ flavorful and with white meat! That doesn't happen often and the owner is awesome he came out and introduced himself to us. It was a great experience will definitely be back... Probably tomorrow hahaha
What an hidden gem! You can't go wrong with anything you order here. Everything is homemade.

Capri is a clean and well run operation. Their food is amazing. I had a turkey and cheese sub. They bake their bread in house. It was one of the better subs I've ever had. I like Subway, but this restaurant is definitely better. You get what you pay for in this case. They don't know how to prepare a bad meal. My friend felt exactly the same as I did. Give this place a try. It's not fancy inside, but the food more than makes up for the dcor. Also, there isn't a waiter or waitress to tip which will keep your total cost down!

Above and beyond the mightiest  scrumptious Itilian sub sandwich I have ever eaten.  This is old school fresh premium ingredients on a freshly baked bun. This is  bucket list for a amazing Itilian sub sandwich.
****10 out of 10****

Kind of split on this place. Of course I went here because of all the fuss and they were on Chicago's best. However I have gone two times and haven't been that impressed either time. 

The first time me and my girlfriend both got the Capri special sub, and one chicken noodle soup, all together was like 25$, it was okay nothing great. It was mostly mortadella which to me tastes like cheap bologna. Kind of surprised their is no sauce just a kind of deli oil on the subs. They took about ten minutes to make everything which is kind of slow because their was NOBODY there and it's literally the simplest thing to make. The whole place kind of seemed chaotic and the back end was just bickering at each other. I saw a guy who called ahead waiting for a pizza after he already called it in, that's pretty lousy to make somewhat wait after they made an effort to call ahead.

The second time I went I got a combo Italian beef for my girlfriend and a meatball sub for me. Both the sandwiches were good aside from the Italian sausage being pretty dry, and both the sandwiches were falling apart, I guess was bread couldn't hold them or they just made them sloppy.

The second time, My problem was I called like 30 mins ahead and I had to wait another 10 for when I arrived for a really simple order. The owner and workers were all kind of yelling at each other and cussing which was also kind of unpleasant. I guess I'm not the only one who thinks the owner is kind of a grouch, I belief he may he muttered something rude about me. I can't stand businesses who act like THEIR DOING YOUR A FAVOR  by doing their jobs when your the customer.

I'm not sure maybe I've gone on bad days but they need to get better organized and be more professional. So I probably won't come back.

Their hot sandwhiches are fantastic (my boyfriend got the meatball and I got the Italian sausage) but I was semi disappointed in their cold sandwhiches. Everyone I know raves about their soup but I found it a little fatty

Today tried the Caprese salad and 2 slices of pizza for lunch. Gotta say each pizza slice is equivalent to a medium sized pizza in itself. It's pretty thin, which I like and the kids loved it. My salad was outstanding. It was exactly what I had a craving for. I called in my order, everyone was nice, short wait for my take out and excellent fixings. Yum!

We ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! We made it in right before closing the other night and the manager/ owner was incredibly nice to us and super accommodating.
The food is hands down the best I've ever had! The Capri focaccia is amazing!

Best meatball sub in the burbs! The sauce and homemade bread make it so delicious. Tony is the best, 15+ years of homemade food, you can tell he makes it with love. Highly recommend this place for those who like to find a hidden gem!

Delicious hand-made sandwiches! My favorite is the 4" Capri Special on focaccia bread. They also offer other cold or hot sandwiches, pizza, salads and pasta. 

Located by the corner of Dundee & Rand Road in a little strip mall with a clock repair shop. 

The dining area can hold about 40 people, but I always stop by around lunchtime for a sandwich to go & share while watching the Bears.

Highly recommended!

So i have tried the focaccia sandwiches and some other stuff. This place rocks. It's consistently good and seriously the focaccia bread sandwiches are soooo good. I feel comfortable saying this is the best deli in the area. 

I also tried the italian beef and the italian sausage. both are good, but not the best in all of chicago. they don't put peppers on the beef or at least were out of them. I like mr. beefs for that anyhow. 

The service has never been overly friendly but it's never been straight up rude. 

This place is very much worth your time to go check out. Yelp it up

meatball sandwich
prosciutto focaccia 
turkey and cheese focaccia

hole in the wall vibe
plenty of seating
but not many patrons inside.
great quality meats
meatball the size of a small fist
soft soft excellent focaccia.
the kind of place you keep eating
even though you're already full.
super friendly service.
ridiculous portions.

Still the best of the best! Have I mentioned how amazing Capri is? I also laugh at the people who felt "disrespected" by Tony. Tony is the nicest guy ever. He's a straight forward sorta dude, but people who cry about "What do you want?" statements by a busy business owner are ridiculous. The coddling of children in society...what a world. Best sandwiches outside of the city and maybe even including the city. Bari may be the only better spot in Illinois.
Delicious deli with spectacularly generous portions!
One of the best chicken Parms I've ever had. Terrific sauce, great crusty bread. Everything else we've ever had from here has been outstanding. One of the best lunch spots in palatine by far

The sandwiches on focaccia bread are massive and delicious. The sandwiches definitely make this deli worth checking out. It's a small, no frills dining area since they do mostly carry out. Service is prompt and friendly. I am sure I will be back.

Simply the best Parmesan Chicken sandwich I have ever eaten ,   but the last time there They didn't have any. It was  after the holiday so some shipments didn't come in or the chef was on vacation  who knows   or who cares, so I settled for the Meatball sandwich  which was Just Okay .  
We  order  take out  for lunch from here a couple times a month  and their food is  always very good as per the others here at work
Great sandwiches!  I had a toasted turkey on focaccia bread and it was amazing!  Nice let hidden gem.  Not open very late though
I love Capri Deli , Wonderful Sandwiches, Piled high , Fresh bread made right in house, Great tasting Chicken Soup . Pizza slices are yummy as well , No Sub shop can compare after eating  at Capri

I've been looking for a deli around my work and had seen this place on the Chicago's Best app. The food was good (I'd give it a 3 or 4), but ordering was kind of confusing and I thought it lacked some of the sides I would looking for in a deli. Maybe I missed it, but I was hoping for some good deli-style potato salad or the likes. The portions were large and it tasted good, but I would rather pay less for a single portion. I'd say try it out and see what you think. The food you order will be good.

Went here for the second time and was as thrilled with my sandwich as the first. Their Capri Special sandwich is simply the best I've ever had. As others have said, the 6 inch is more like 8-9" and filled full with fresh meats, cheese and romaine lettuce. The freshness of the lettuce is huge in my book since so many delis use old nasty brown iceberg. I will definitely go out of my way to head to Capris over any other deli in the burbs! Great place.

The food is good here, so you are probably asking why im giving it 1 star, i really wish I could give it zero stars. it started 2 weeks ago, when I went in for a slice of pizza and they were out. I was like how are you out but ok... Now to Nov 25th, I go in and ask if he has pizza today, and he said yes, I said good, cause the last 2 times i was in he didnt have any, so this was his last chance, ( kinda joking voice) he said, what do you want me to do when I get busy and cant make pizzas, ( he had an attitude when he said it) I responded with, well maybe hire more staff, He replied with who the fu*k do you think you are to tell me how to run my business... i was thinking, are you kidding with me, is this how you talk to a customer.. Then he told me to get the fu*k out of his business, his quote was " get the fu*k out of my business you fat a$$.. He said that as i was turning to walk out, then I stopped, he jumped back, thinking I was going to beat him up, then I told him to look in the mirror before you make a comment like that. 

So I guess if you want good food with a side of stupid a$$ then please by all means go here. If not, go find another place to eat, I really hope you go somewhere else.

Tried this place for the first time today and it was amazing! I got the meatball sub with hot peppers and cheese. The hot pepper spread they use is incredible. I was so full but couldn't stop eating (very generous portions, by the way). Will be back again!

Capri Deli is truly worth trying!!! Ingredients always taste fresh and service is always very quick! 

Truly a family run restaurant! Its a great change from all the fast food restaurants surrounding the area! 

I've order various items on the menu and have loved every single one! 

Prices are very reasonable and the serving size is very generous! If your ever in the area I would highly recommend trying it!!! 

Save yourself the time and call ahead if you plan on stopping in during the lunch rush!!!

I think I just had best the sandwich of my life.  Capri special on 4" Foccacia bread.  Simply amazing.  The caprese salad I got was ok, not the best ever, but overall you can't go wrong with this place.

Capri Deli has to be one of our favorite places!  We dine here at least 2-3 times a week.  We travel from Bloomingdale!! When we have large home parties, Capri is our "Go-To" for catering and has been for years!  

The pizza is scrumptious & Italian beef sandwiches are awesome.  The meat is sliced perfectly thin and sits on freshly baked bread.  A really, really good aujus with just the right amount of herbs & spices flavors the lean beef.  It's always a big hit for our home parties.  In addition to the pizza & beef, the sub sandwiches are fantastic, each one using precision cut deli meats & cheeses--- all on top of freshly baked bread & a drizzle of dressing to finish it off-- so good!
Meatball sandwich is outstanding!  Just the right amount of spice flavors the light meatball & of course the red sauce is a perfect match made in heaven!
The salads are phenomenal & if you want to add ingredients or take some off, they have no problems with special orders, they aim to please.
The homemade vinaigrette used on salads is absolutely the BEST tasting one ever! 

I gave Capri Deli 5-stars because the food is fresh & delicious!  Also, because Tony the owner makes us feel at home with his welcoming smile!
Thank you Tony & Staff!  See you soon!

I was in the mood for something new, so my friend and I decided to try out Capri. I'm glad we came!

I love the atmosphere - it has that small, local feel. The whole room smelled like fresh baked bread and pizza (they do bake their bread fresh daily). There are a few tables outside, and plenty inside to sit at. And it is very clean! They have a variety of salads, sandwiches, pastas, pizzas, and soups to choose from, and a few desserts. I decided on the Caprese salad - it was awesome! Light but filling and full of flavor. My friend ordered the corned beef sandwich - I took a bite and thought it was great. Overall they are really cheap and you get a lot for your money. The service was quick and friendly. I have no complaints! I definitely want to come back.

Fantastic, "Typical" Italian food, just like Grandma used to make!  What more can you ask for? We have been dining in, getting carryout and catering for years!  Tony is the best!  From their sandwiches on fresh baked breads, to their salads, to their traditional pasta dishes, you can't go wrong!  They have THE best pizza... I just wish they were open a little later!

We had our Christmas Eve Dinner catered by Capri this year, and wile my extended family was skeptical at first, it has been decided that Capri on Christmas Eve will be our new Tradition!  It is AMAZING Food with Tony's Personalized service!  He treats everyone like they are a longtime customer!  

Can't say enough about Capri... it's as if you are walking into a restaurant on Taylor Street in the city!

**Must TRY the Chicken Noodle Soup!!!**  Who would have thought!?

I love sandwiches and this is by far one of the best, if not THE best sandwich joint. All the bread is good, but that foccacia is soooo fresh and delicious! The dressing they put on makes the sandwich. The capri and Italian are the way to go!

Since finding them on Yelp,  Capri is one of my favorite lunch time destinations.  Possibly the best sandwich shop in the suburbs. I tried just about everything on the menu and have yet to find something I'd say was any less than delicious. Whether you're getting a hot or cold sub, pizza, or pasta, you cannot go wrong at Capri.

I had to find out myself.   

So many reviews on Yelp raved about Capri Deli but it took me this long to finally stop by.    

The owner took my order & he was making me laugh.   I love it when Italians from Chicago have that awesome south side accent.  Then again, I'm a "wanta be Italian."   

They offer Deli sandwiches, Pasta, Pizza & more.    They are located in the first strip mall on the east side of Rand Road (right north of Dundee).   So be careful to not miss the lot entrance.   

I ordered their Corned Beef & Turkey Deli Subs & they were both great.   I opted for the smaller sizes & they were huge.   I will definitely come back to pick up for dinner.   I wonder how their roast beef sub is --  guess there is only one way to find out.

Holy moly! My coworker got us the prosciutto sandwich on the foccacia bread for lunch today and we were both impressed. Omg! Where do I begin? The foccacia is amazing, fresh tomatoes, lettuce, red onions, cheese, oil and seasonings, plenty of prosciutto....  Absolutely delicious. I was very satisfied and impressed with my sandwich. I can't wait to try them out again.
Capri's deli is awesome!!! If you want an awesome sandwich whether it be a sub, or an Italian beef this is the spot.

Ok I don't wanna over exaggerate but I think I just had the best cold sub I ever had in my LIFE. I came here for lunch with my wife, first time for the both of us. I got the Capri special, she got the Italian. I bit into my sub and it feel like my mouth was bursting with flavor. Words can't describe how good that sub was. I WILL be back!

Recently moved to Palatine and found this little gem of a place thru Yelp. What a find! I'm originally from NYC and a bit of snob when it comes to Italian deli's and, I'll tell you, fugetabouit, this place can hang with the best. The bread is on the money, deli meats plentiful and forget the Mayo and muster and stick with the Capri dressing. If you're looking for an authentic Italian deli experience, this place is definitely worth a drive to palatine.

This is the kind if restaurant I've been looking for! A slice of pizza the size of your head! It was so GOOD!! Meatballs sub was amazing. The meatballs are the size of baseballs! The next day I tried the chicken soup! HANDS DOWN, THE BEST CHICKEN SOUP IVE EVER HAD!! The service was excellent! The owner is very nice!! This is my new favorite place to eat. I could eat here everyday!

It was my first visit to Capri Deli & pizza so I wanted to get a classic Italian sub with all the fixings. It was very very good. Were it possible, I'd rate them 4 1/2 stars. I'm enamored with that bread with a crust that shatters when you bite into it giving way to an extremely tender crumb. This bread was very fresh and tasty, but it wasn't perfect. Plusses for romaine lettuce, a healthy amount of good quality meat, a yummy oil and San Pellegrino Aranciata soda. The 6 inch sandwich was 8 inches according to my tape measure app. I couldn't finish it. The place was clean and inviting and the staff friendly.  All in all, I'll have to rate them 5 stars, but I still wish 4 1/2 were possible.

Delicious!  The focaccia bread is killller.  I would eat it everyday if I could, so definitely get some kind of focaccia sandwich!!  It was really busy so I wish I could've taken a little more time ordering.  I ended up getting proscuitto which awesome, but I wish I would've gotten it with some other meats.  Fair prices for some of the best deli-styled sandwiches around.  The only thing is that the owner was a little rude, but he was what you'd expect from a stereotypical Italian restaurant owner.  If you don't know what to order, ask him for suggestions!

Hands down the best deli around!  The pizza is awesome and the sandwiches are absolutely fresh and made to order.  Tony, is the most accommodating person I have ever met.  Just recently Capri catered my son's birthday party.  Not only was the food on time, hot and delicious but Tony made it a point to add extras and remember items I may not have thought of.  This place is a gem and I cannot get enough!

A gem in the Chicagoland area.  With chains dominating the scene today, Capri Deli is a treasure for any community.

The BEST meatball sandwiches in Chicago along with chicken parm that is to die for.  Try the homemade bread, too!

Tony does a great job and is passionate about his business and making great food.

Would like to see an additional location closer to Schaumburg in the future.
Was there yesterday, really enjoyed their sandwiches, delicious ham and fresh bread. Would come again.
Everything fresh, everything delicious! I recommend you try everything on the menu as that is one of my goals. I have never been disappointed. Cannoli is a great way to polish off your meal.

I usually go to Capri deli for lunch a few times a week. The food is pretty good but the owner Anthony is a prick. He has been rude to me on multiple occasions in the store. Which is bothersome because I'm spending my money at his place. Anthony lost my business for ever recently when I called to order a pizza for a work party. He rudely answered the phone telling me to hold. He the proceeded to put me on hold for 15 minutes. After waiting for that long the phone got disconnected. This forced me to call back where Anthony screamed into the phone, "what do you want."  I was shocked at this and told him never mind I will order from another place. He didn't even try to make things right, he instead said good and hung up. I've worked in restaurants and customer service my whole life and this is truly unacceptable.
Great sandwiches. I love their pizza. Close to NY style pizza (thin and crunchy) my favorite and yes pie cut.

a bit pricey, servings are huge 
I came here after a co-worker raved about this place. It's good if you are a meat eater, but more vegetarians spend your $$$ elsewhere.

Just a great neighborhood Italian spot. Do not expect allot inside, it is a sandwich spot, with the best Italian subs and sandwiches around. Counter service. Pizza is great too. They do a big catering business, and that is where they shine. The place is packed by noon every week day for lunch.

It was my first time in here and we felt bad about coming in shortly before closing time.  The owner was very friendly, patient and seemed quite passionate about his food.  We ordered the Capri cold sandwich and it was very delicious.  They load it up with ham, salami and provolone cheese.  We ordered the six inch sandwiches, but they were enormous!  Their oil really adds amazing flavor.  He told us to have a seat and he would not close until we were finished eating.  Of course we didn't take his offer because that's a bit rude to keep everyone past closing time just because we were hungry.  Their windows are completely covered in black plastic so you can't see a thing inside until you're actually in there.  It has plenty of tables to sit down and eat.  They do accept credit cards which is nice.

When looking for a place for a quick lunch in the area, my friend recommended Capri Deli. I wasn't feeling too into a deli for lunch but ended up being a fan. 

Their sandwiches are a bit pricey at $7ish for a 6" but they are different better in quality and ingredients than Subway or other chain sandwich joints. I had ham and cheese, totally solid hero with layers of ham! It really had a lot of delicious meat and I sure do love me some swine.

The guys working here are quite friendly and there is tons of seating.The downfalls for me are the prices and the top 40 music playing just a smidgen too loud. I'd go back but am not falling over myself to get back to Capri.

I'll always remember the day a friend and I randomly discovered Capri years ago. It has since become my favorite lunch spot. I highly recommend their sandwiches, both hot and cold. Tony's bread brings us back constantly. Also, a 6 inch sub here will really full you up.

I've been coming to Capri since I was a freshman in High School which is almost 8 years now. This place is great. Very authentic Italian food, you walk in there and it smells like you're in a new country. The place is small because it's mostly meant for carry out, but they also sell pizza by the slice which is fantastic. 

I always get their pizza because it is different than any other I've had, they make their own bread Daily so you know it's fresh and the seasoning they add onto the cheese at the end is to die for. Their sandwiches are also amazing and have giant portion sizes. Prices are fair and service is quality. I will keep coming here for many years to come.
Once again what a great spot. Just has the chicken noodle soup which is amazing homemade. The bread here is what makes all the sandwiches baked fresh in back so so good!
Finally went here after all the yelp reviews. Got the pizza and meat ball sandwich. The meatball were huge!!! The service was quick and friendly.

Very tasty sandwiches. I reccommend the corned beef sandwich.  Salads are huge and very good as well.  Not imto either of those? Try their pizza, its a huge piece and the sauce and cheese blend in perfect with the crust.
Great food!! Every single thing I have ever eaten there is excellent! I wish they had extended hours but it keeps you wanting more!
It's a mystery to me why anyone would go to Subway or Jimmy Johns for a sandwich when this place exists.

Decided to stop at Capri today for a sandwich - it had been awhile since my last visit and I wanted to see if I would leave with a better impression than I did the first time.

Well, I did!  I ordered a 9" Italian sub sandwich and decided to opt for a combo with chips and a can of soda for $9.75 instead of just the sandwich at $7.95. Now, their prices are a touch higher than most chain sandwich stores, but I can tell you that the size of the sandwich and the high quality bread is where the difference is at. This sandwich was packed with meat and the bread was outstanding. It's been about 6 hours since I ate there and I'm still full.  

Now, frankly the place could use a little sprucing up - it's kind of plain and the prep / cashier area is somewhat "industrial" looking if there is such a thing. But overall, the sandwich was good and I plan to return for more of them.

This place is like a hidden gem. Their foccia sandwiches are just amazing. The 8 inch sandwich is big enough to share or take home and eat later. Quality product continues to excel in their restaurant. The owner has always been there taking my sandwich orders any time I have gone now for the past 4 years! This is a MUST check out food establishment !

I have been coming to this establishment for years. I grew up on Taylor Street and now live in the northern suburbs and believe me I know my pizza and Italian subs. And this place tops them all in service and quality of food. The owner Tony greets me when I come in, as if I was a family member. Whenever we have parties we always cater from Capri deli.

On my recommendation if you happen to be in the area give it a try you'll see for yourself.
Been coming here for years. Food is always excellent and fresh, service is friendly and owner is super nice. Highly recommend catering their food - sandwiches are amazing and so is their fresh bread!

This is by far the best sandwich shop I have found since I moved out here from the east coast!  Today I did the focaccia with the Italian meats and it was 1lb of goodness!  That said, I really can't eat a 1lb sandwich so I did the best I could.  Owner is a super friendly guy and the service is fast and efficient.  It was a huge sandwich for $8!

Our new favorite sandwich shop. 
We recently had friends over for a Hawks game and picked up a variety of sandwiches. Everyone loved them ! Not on the menu is a caprese sandwich which they made up for me. I toasted it in the oven the next day and it was delicious. Their bread is made fresh which is the key to any great sandwich. The owner and employees are very kind.

Came into shop.  Had a turkey sandwich and a cannoli.

Sandwich bread was a little over done, would have liked more oil.  But it tasted fresh.

Cannoli was best I ever had.

I will go again and ask fir extra oil.
I have witnessed the owner threaten to hurt several different people. He is an absolute psychopath and doesn't deserve anyone's business.

I've been coming here for years. My family is Italian and loves this spot. Their sandwiches are fantastic and pizza is pretty good too. It the kinda place you get a craving for and nowhere else will do.

Stopped  in for lunch a couple months ago, ordered the Italian sub. Wasnt crazy about the broccoli  in the sandwich,  and absolutely did not like the long hair that was mixed in with the meat.  Ever hear of hair nets?

I'm Italian and I am used to excellent meatballs....Capri Deli has Italian Meatballs
second to no one , no way ..the product is delicous..  All of his dishes are
top notch.  I recommend CAPRI  without reservations...there is noting at all
in the chicago area that matches his quality .

Jack La Brasca

Legit. 

I've had Capri Deli & Pizza in my 'to try' bookmark pile for quite some time now but got around to giving them a go only just this weekend. I guess I was worried there wouldn't be much beyond pizza for a vegetarian like myself so it was easy for me to skip over Capri time and time again as my hunger pangs called. 

Walking in this past Sunday I was surprised how large the inside was. From the outside, I was thinking it'd just be a small order and go operation with maybe a few 2-tops for people to sit and wait. Pleasantly surprised = me. The dining area (still just counter service but nice to have the option to sit and enjoy with crushed red pepper flakes table side et al.) fits approximately 40 people and judging from the size of their back kitchen, they're equipped to handle large catering orders as well. One thing that wasn't such a pleasant surprise, however, was looking around and seeing that even though there was no one in there dining at the time, every table had table had more than a few crumbs on it. I know there's no dedicated bus service but a wipe down in between diners made the difference in us taking just a few things to go or staying and ordering more. 

As far as the menu goes, it was very tempting to not go back to my old meaty ways. All the spicy Italian slices and deli chat just like I remember hearing when I was younger and my Grandma would take me to pick up her ravioli order from the local Italian market made for a nostalgic visit. For veggie options, you're certainly very limited but luckily, that doesn't mean you have to sacrifice taste. I went with their special caprese salad and the 6" veggie sandwich with all the fixins, as the deli man would put it. I really only ordered the salad because I splitting the meal with another and I was looking for a little more variety than just a pasta or pizza. I was skeptical since I'm not the biggest fan of a lot of oil, or even tomatoes for that matter, but something about Capri told me I was going to leave satisfied with that sucker. And I did. 

The Caprese salad was large and beyond delicious with copious amount of basil (the way to my heart) and Italian spices served with a half loaf of fresh bread and butter for dipping in the pesto remnants. #Win. 

The veggie sub was a decent one as well, but certainly not best I've ever had. I was somewhat disappointed in the veggie factor here as I was hoping when the man at the counter asked me if I wanted to keep the tomatoes, lettuce, oil, and mayo on the veggie sub that it meant those were just the extra little topping options, like on the meat subs, and that there would still be some base veggies that came on the veggie sub. Not the case... unless you count cheese as a vegetable, which my Italian friend told me is the correct way to do it. At least they don't skimp on the cheese with several different kinds all packed together for a not so healthy but pretty darn tasty sub. I just couldn't help but think that if I hadn't opted to keep the lettuce and tomato toppings on my sammie that there would literally be no veggies on my veggie sub. I would suggest calling it a cheese sub unless some base veggies go into it- just seems kind of bunk otherwise.

I would go back again with my meaty Italian friends and family as I know they'd fall head over heals for these hoagies but for me, I just prefer a few more hearty options for my grinder. I'll head back around lent and see if they can do me up a nice pepper and egg or something.

Thank god this place exists in this area.  Best sub sandwiches around and the portions are awesome!  Their pasta and pizza are also great!

Best bang for the buck for lunch.
Have not visited in years when it was part Deli part Market.  I was not disappointed last week. Upgraded from a counter Deli To a sit down Bistro/Italian ambiance. I will be back.

Saw all the great reviews so I had to try this place. I was not impressed. Ordered the Italian sub...asked what came on the sub as far as garnishing...asked for lettuce,  onion,  tomatoes and mayo...Got my sub to go...when I arrived home the sub was soaked in oil no mayo. Their was no one at the deli when I placed my order so there shouldnt have been any reason to mess up my order.

I have been waiting to try this place for years and was unfortunately not impressed. The meatballs were too dense and flavorless. The cheese (extra charge) was sparse and unmelted and added little to the sub. The bread was good, though. 

The Italian sub was good but nothing better than those made at dozens of other area sub shops and Italian delis. 

There were no fountain drinks and all beverages came in cans or bottles without cups, ice, or straws. Napkins were rationed out by staff at one per person. 

For the price ($24), we could have done better for lunch for two.

So good!   Finally a deli with fresh everything that's prepared in house. The pizza is perfectly made with flavorful sauce, the perfect combination of cheese and meat.  Delicious!   The soup is incredibly tasty - we had the chicken noodle and will be back to take home a quart for dinner.  The subs take me back to my childhood deli where fresh bread made daily is loaded with the right balance of meat,  cheese and condiments.  Only warning there, a six inch sub is more like a footlong if you're to compare it to chains because they don't skimp on anything.   We'll definitely be back and can't wait to try the rest of the menu.   Perfecto!

Went back for Chicken Parm sandwich. Excellent! Got the 12" and split it with my mom. We were stuffed. The combination of the baked italian bread with the marinara and the gardinaire make for very savory combo.
Food was good fresh and tasty. The place is clean with a great selection.

First of all Capri Deli is highly overpriced, for some apparent reason they believe they are really special and the prices are fair because, they think they have the best subs in the world..LOL. Another thing is that they are always closed when they are supposed to be open. So many times have i arrived an hour before the closing and then found them closing an hour early...are you serious capri deli are you going to just close that early. In my opinion they are so overrated, their food is very tasteless especially their pizza. I would be happy if something replaced that dump.

Alright,  full disclosure,  I have never had anything but the sandwiches which are totally awesome.  Great meat, cheese and bread. Another reviewer called the owner crazy he's not,  I've worked at several pizzerias and he's just par for course.

I've been a big fan of Capri since the first time I stopped in, and here's why.
The place reminds me of the first place I ever worked.  It was a small storefront deli/pizza joint and that's where I cut my teeth, literally and figuratively on Italian deli food.
Their "Capri" sandwich is the classic Italian sub/grinder I remember growing up as a kid.  Mortadella, Capicolla, Salami, italian dressing, lettuce, tomato, onion and provolone on fresh made bread.. Fantastic!
Their meatball sandwiches are hearty and drenched in their own red sauce.
They offer a 6" / 9" and 12" sandwich and they are generous with the cut.

One of my most pleasant surprises was picking up a fresh uncooked pizza for $7.  Take it home, pop it in the oven at 450 and in about 20min you're good to go.. For $7!!!.. I even deconstructed the pizza bit and slapped additional ingredients on it at home.  Good stuff.

It's not fancy, but it is inexpensive and excellent food.

If you're looking for a bit of Elmwood park in Palatine/Arlington Heights/Barrington/Deer Park, I highly recommend Capri Deli.
Bomb Italian lunch meat for dayyyzz, facasha bread Sami pizza Italian ice.. if they don't have this in heaven I don't want to go

OK...now I'm becoming an "oldie" as I've been back five times in two weeks. They are consistently delicious, portions are VERY generous and the people are very nice. 

I love the 4" focaccia sandwich with everything. I've also ordered the American sub and Italian sub for friends going to Ravinia and they RAVED about both sandwiches. 

Tried the pizza last time and it was also delicious--the crust was thin and had just enough crispiness but was still flexible. 

When you visit, be sure to take a look at the floor leading to the bathroom. Funny surprise.

I was traveling to Milwaukee and I was starving so I found this place on my yelp app and thought I would give it a chance.  I got the 4" Italian sub on focaccia and it was delish.  I think it had mortadella, salami, and ham as far as the meat was concerned.  As far as the 4", I didn't think it sounded that big but this number refers to the diameter of the sandwich so it's quite filling.  I ate half of the sandwich in the car and between that and a bag of chips I was stuffed.  My mom lucked out because she was able to eat the other half when I arrived!

If I'm in the area, I will definitely be back.

We are big fans of this deli. From their salads with the amazing house dressing to the pizza and foccacia sandwiches... I honestly don't think I've ever been disappointed. We even had them cater a birthday party last fall. I would definitely recommend a trip to this place if you are in the area.
We love this deli. We used to go here once a week when we lived closer. The American sub there is amazing!  Their pasta is awesome too. We've never been disappointed!
Caprese on foccacia sandwich was very good.
The best Italian deli anywhere around. If you have one meal here,  you're a customer for life.

Whenever I'm out this way I make sure I stop. Get there before noon or after 1 pm to avoid the line out the door.
Gotta go with Focaccia Sandwich. I do the 4" and split a slice of pizza with someone if I can. The 8" is too big for me to handle. Subs and Italian Dishes are really good as well. Don't let Tony (Eugene Levy)give you a hard time at the counter either...

Let me start off by saying that the owner/manager/guy-who-works-the-register is quite the cranky little fellow but his hoarse high pitched bark is just that. More bark than bite. The place gets absolutely packed during peak lunch hours and everything is made to order so it can get a little hairy at times.

They serve subs, pizza, pasta, and their famous focaccia sandwiches. I fell in love with the focaccia sandwiches and have yet to venture to venture to their other offerings for fear of not being able to have my focaccia and eat it too. If you opt for the full cut then you better bring an extra pair of baggy pants because this sandwich is a two pound intestine demolisher. It's better to share it with a buddy or that random chick you came across on Baldwin on the way in from fiddythree.

It's a smaller family owned business that cranks out quality food as fast as their poor overworked employees can put out and they do an excellent job. Just remember the owner guy is probably not going to be very nice to you. Borderline soup nazi style at times so you better know what you want before you step up to the plate. He hates people on phones and people who ask too many questions.

The place has character from the barking owner to the random faux red terra cotta roof inside the dining area to the name "TONY" spelled out in linoleum tiles in the hallway to the restroom. You can't get more family style than that!

Get the focaccia sandwich. You won't be sorry!

Disclaimer - This review is for pizza and service only. 

Today, Friday April 13th was the first time I tried this place. I picked it out because of all the nice reviews on Yelp. Here are the items that were wrong with my pizza:

1)  My order was wrong
2)  The pizza was not hot but more or less warm
3)  No condiments came with the pizza (no cheese or crushed red peppers)
4)  When I called to inform the business of the issue the man said he would have to wait for his driver to come back because the driver was the only one who had the ORIGINAL ORDER TICKET?

I can tell you the pizza was nothing special...

I had a 12 inch sub and it was very good and fresh. The bread is a little dense for my tastes but still very good. If your in the area stop in. I was there at 1 in the afternoon on a weekday and the place was pretty full and most of the people eating at the dozen or so tables were eating subs. There was a few huge pizza slices scattered in there too.

Capri Deli is just what I have been looking for!

My first time at Capri Deli we got the veggie sub and the caprese salad.  I think both of them had the same, amazing, dressing!  An Italian oil based dressing which alone was enough to have me back.
