The sub was layered with cheese and some veggies - it was very cheesy but how can that be a bad thing?  The caprese salad - a classic tomato, mozzarella, basil, and dressing salad was incredible.  There were tons of juices at the bottom and  the people at Capri Deli know it so they throw in half a loaf of what appears to be home made bread to get all the juices.  Yum!  Yum!  Yum!

A few weeks later I was a family party and the food was picked up from Capri.  I was in shocked how fantastic the eggplant parm was.  Normally it is not something I order out because there is a good chance that the eggplant will be breaded and fired.  Capri Deli's was perfect, the right amount of layers, fresh eggplant (un-fried), a nice layer of cheese on top, all with a fantastic taste!  There was also some garlic bread from Capri - now this is not your butter and garlic powder bread - it is buttery, gooey, garlic-loaded, and amazing!

Inside Capri Deli is a fair large amount of space however there was no one eating in but it was close to closing time.  The staff was very friendly and it appeared to be family owned the way the staff talked to each other.  A few other people stopped in while we were waiting for our food (at 5 min wait) and the staff seemed very friendly to everyone making it a very pleasant place to eat the delicious food they make!  Next on the list, pizza!

Amazed...

I normally don't believe the yelp percentage, but reading everyone else's reviews I figured I'd give it a shot.

I've tried every little Italian deli that I've come across and this place is a gem.  I hold my standards high for Italian subs having an off the boat Italian father.

simply put, it's Italian subs done right. Ample meat without 20lbs of toppings bloating your sandwich and killing the flavor of the meat like most places do and the toppings they DO put on are fresh and delicious, perfectly shredded lettuce and finely chopped tomato in the middle of January was a treat! (not frozen old and tasteless)

I had a soprasatta sub and the #2 focaccia (wanted leftovers), w/ fresh as hell basil & what tasted like homemade mozzarella and roasted red peppers... Let's just say it is so good you don't want to finish it cuz that would mean there's no more...

If you live in the area and you love a good homegrown Italian sub, go there now!

Delicious! Just recently found Capri when searching for a new lunch spot. Amazing sandwiches, great bread, and the service is great. Can't wait to try everything they have to offer. Big servings mean I will always have leftovers!!!!

Skip the chains and check out the Capri. 
The meats are fresh, the service is courteous and the sandwiches taste great. 
Sure, you'll pay an extra dollar or two but you get what you pay for. 
There's a lot of food for your dollar. 
The decor is a bit dated but who cares? I'm there to eat a delicious Italian sandwich and not to soak in whether or not I like the retro-style chairs.
Long and short - it's delicious and worth checking out!

Just wonderful food and service.  It's an italian deli,so vegetarians and veggie lovers go elsewhere. Fresh and filling with pleasant workers who make sure all is well   Old school eating in the 'burns!

Best subs anywhere. 

Really. 

My wife, kid and I come here most weekends to indulge in the best subs we have found anywhere. I credit the baked-on-site bread which is both crusty and doughy and wonderful smelling, and the great Italian dressing Capri uses.

The Italian ice is a fun summer treat, to boot.

Oh! You can buy the bread to go. So, so very good with peanut butter. Buy a loaf, you wont regret it.

Capri Deli has the best sandwiches I've ever had. They bake their own bread every morning, and honestly, it really makes a huuge difference. Actually, everything I've had there is amazing, but there sandwiches are definitely the best I've ever had. Tony is the man.

LOVE Capri Deli.  My family owns a business up the road, so whenever I'm up there visiting I make a very specific point to have a sub at Capri.  First time I went I got the Ham & Cheese sub, and its been so good every time I can't bring myself to try anything else.  Though I will say I have taken many people there, and everyone has said how good it is, not a single complaint.

If you're in the Palatine area, get there and get a sandwich!  Sure, they're capri deli and pizza, but its all about the deli.

Not gonna lie, I was nervous and felt my experience at Honest would be a toss up. I really enjoyed my pav bhaji and mango lassi though! My mom really enjoyed her dosa and the sambhar was incredible. They make everything mild, medium, spicy so there really is an option for any palette. Service was faster than you'd expect for Indian food and the cashier was knowledgeable on the menu items (that's not the case everywhere!). Very convenient location within an all Indian plaza in Schaumburg. Open until 10 which is just long enough post closing of the other stores in the strip. 

Opportunities for improvement would be table turnaround. It was quite crowded during my visit so we had to claim a table as we saw patrons bundling up and subsequently we had to sit at a dirty table momentarily. My dad called the busboy over shortly thereafter but I feel they should be more attentive to the turn around and arrive prior to our settling in. I noticed the same with other patrons' tables. The bathroom was untidy, smelled and was out of soap. 

The food triumphed and I look forward to trying Honest in the homeland later this year after my pleasant experience here in Chicago.

I guess I spoke too good too early.. last couple of my visits here have been very mediocre experience at best.. hate to say this but, bhaji-pav their supposidely claim to fame thing has been very inconsistent..

Guess dipping toes into everything and adding new things to menu isn't really helping them.. recently tried "Indian style" pizza qnd it was awful. Cant just heat up the base, throw in some veggies, amul cheeese and call it indian pizza..  cheese in indian pizza is typically baked as well, its not that diffiult guys.. 

I hope this place wont do the same like every other Indian places.. do everything right in the beginning and couldnt do 1 thing right just within a few months. Although it definitely feels like its going that path, I so hope, wish and pray to be proved wrong..

An exclusive review for downright one of the best Pav Bhaji in the area!! It really is as good as it gets. Authentic taste, great quality and generous portions. 

Typically we order a plate of Pav Bhaji and some extra Pav since the Bhaji quantity is sizeable. I love that they also use cashew bits in the bhaji to amp up the richness quotient. A MUST TRY if you are here. Recently we also had the Bhel Puri which was equally spot on in terms of taste.

Clean interiors, Quick service and Great food all at very reasonable prices. What more can one want?

Wow what a place! I'm surprised to see this place only has 3 stars. From our perspective (11 people in our group), everyone gave a 5/5. 

The food was outstanding, and reminded me of the quality of street food served in india. I had the dhai puri and pav bhaji, which were delicious. I would highly recommend that appetizer/entre combo. 

The service was only very prompt for such a busy establishment, as we received our orders in less than 15 minutes. The man manning the front was super helpful in recommendations, giving us our food and garnishings, and dealing with our large group. 

The restaurant is actually very clean with a very modern look. Most indian street food restaurants aren't as clean in my experience. 

Overall, if you enjoy indian street foods, you'll love this place. If you don't like the spicy tastes, then it may not be for you.

Garbage food they ask u for the tip before u even have tried there food or service. Ordered 2 utappams both of them  un cooked.and when asked thm to exchange it or give our money back said will cook another plate for you. First plate came after 20 mins and 2nd one didnt come for another 30 mins. Waste of time and money. Dont waste u r time and money .

Not worth the money! Quantity is very very less for the price you pay. I ordered 2 pulav's to go - paid ~$16 and the quantity I got was way too less compared to any other restaurant. Most other restaurants would give you this quantity for half the price!! The taste is ok.. Not out of the world. 
They seriously need to re-consider their portion sizes or lower the prices.

I recently heard about this place, so decided to give it a try, we ordered the Pani Puri, Masala Dosa and Bhel Puri. overall the food was delicious, the service was good, the restaurant was clean. the only negative is that its a little over priced

A much better fast food option compared to the places on Devon. Clean interiors, relatively quick service and decent tasting food. Nothing you might mention to your mum back home in India the next time you chat, but not mediocre either. 

We tried the uthappam, plain dosa, masala dosa, curry puri, dhahi puri and pulav. The dosas were just right in terms of batter fermentation. The masala was not authentic. But the chutneys & sambhar made up for it. The chutneys are always a good litmus test of freshness, and the ones served to us tasted relatively fresh, although still cold indicating early prep and store. 

The chat options were good, though I'll admit I am no expert. 

Overall, a good experience and worth a return visit. And did I mention they have fresh sugar cane juice? Brownie points for sure!

I am surprised why only few stars. it's a 5 star pure veg Indian street food.

Awesome delicious Indian food that will satisfy your taste-buds :)
I ordered Pav Bhaji and mix utthapam.

It was the best pav bhaji I have ever had in USA. It just tasted like the Mumbai Pav bhaji back in India.Mix Utthapam was also sooooo good.

This is gonna be my favorite Indian restaurant for street Food.

I have only tried the Pav Bhaji here. It is amazing! I have had the real honest Pav Bhaji in Ahmedabad and this is just as good! They have kept the same recipe and the same taste. Make sure to add cashews to your Pav Bhaji! It makes a huge difference!
Reminds of Gujrat. My parents were here from India and they were tired of bland Indian food from different restaurants. This place reminded them of Gujrat

DON'T BELIEVE THE HATERS!!!!!

This is an absolute wonderful addition to the Patel Plaza offering authentic, fresh vegetarian Indian snack food. We tried a multitude of offerings in the menu and they were all excellent. 

The masala dosa was was well prepared, perfect amount of sourness to the dosa and the potato curry inside was perfectly seasoned and tasted homemade. Even the chutneys were fresh and well prepared. The pav baji (no idea about spelling) was one of the best I've tasted in the US. Almost taste like you were at a roadside stand in Bombay. We also had Pani Puri and dahi Pani and the Pan, also all were fresh and flavorful. 

As far as service, it was quick, friendly and helpful. They provided the meals in a rapid fashion and they were helpful in picking what to order. 

The only suggestion I would have is to turn down the background music, it was a little loud for my liking. 

Overall, an excellent choice for a quick lunch or even afternoon snack. We will definitely be back again.

Driving by and spot this place....decided to come in for a Baji pav. Ordered a Bhabi pav and lassi. Bhaji pav is basically mixed vegetables cooked slowly to give it a nice flavorful and yummy taste.  Mango Lassi was in small cup and literally tasted nothing like mango and basically had no sugar. The Bhaji  pav was ok not good was disappointed. Just wasted $12 couldn't even finish the small portion they gave and now I have to find somewhere else to eat! :-/

The food is amazing! If you love Mumbai style pav bhaji then this is the place. The dosas and chats  are delicious. The best is pani puri, it's awesome. We have tasted everything except the sandwiches and they are all delicious. The pulao is the only thing that's not impressive. The quantity is really small portion and it is not that tasty and too oily for my taste. But it tastes a lot like tava pulao you get on the streets of mumbai and a lot of my friends love it. 
The service is just great, the staff is friendly and helpful. It's really crowded on weekends so be prepared for some waiting. We can't get enough of this place and our friends out of town loved it too.

Went there after a friend said pav bhaji tastes just as it does in Ahmedabad. Maybe. But deeply disappointed with the pav. Just heated with a little butter. Very dry and no flavor whereas I remember the pav itself should be loaded with flavor

Sambhar is seeped in heeng. Extremely pungent. 

And of course, although not the restaurant's bad, but eager people do cut the line without shame

1)  Neat -  Its a new place

2)Food is tasty -  Pav Bhajji -  Excellent -  so is Bhel Puri

3)Order and wait to be served - not bad service 

4)A little overpriced - but the taste makes up !!

Overall -  good place to go as family / friends for some tasty chat evenings !!!

I went there for the first time. We ordered Mysore masala dosa n polau. The dosa was small in size, over oily n the sambar also came in a small to-go kind bowl which wasn't up to the mark means there was no vegetables in the dall. The polau was even not good in taste n too much oily. Overall I didn't like the food and the quantity was also less considering the prices.

If you are an avid fan of the indian chain of this restaurant, then there is no way, you wont like this restaurant !! Still in a start-up phase, sometimes I have heard they have issues with sitting arrangements during weekends, but otherwise - tasting this delicacy and still very similar flavor, you will surely remember your days back in India where you used to stand in a line to get 5 bhaji pavs, 3 pizzas, and 2 dosa at 8 at night for the party of your uncles and aunts crashing at your home during summer vacation !!
Yey, like this place a lot !!

$8 for pulao and quantity is like nothing...too much price they charging.
Food is Ok.

Awesome place for Indian food! Loved the pav bhaji..closest Ive come to finding bombay style pav bhaji in chicago. Really liked the other food items on the menu as well, and its pretty pocket friendly. Would totally recommend this place!

This was my first time at Honest. I came here on a recommendation from my mom. There's a few things I found to be bothersome. For beginners, they messed up our order and brought out the wrong meal. Second, the portion sizes are not what we expected. We paid $30 for our meal and still left hungry. We paid almost $4 for less than 8ounces of sugar cane juice. Totally not worth it. And lastly, my dad almost ingested a piece of plastic in his masala Dosa. Upon showing the lady at the register this, she immediately took it away so that no one else can see it. Honestly, Honest is not worth it.

Definitely the best pav bhaji one could have in the Chicagoland area.  Customer service is fantastic... Chirag bhai is a pretty cool guy and knows the hospitality business!  The food tastes so good and consistently has the exact same flavor.  Two thumbs up if you want to satiate your Desi taste buds!!
I tried the masala dosa, Sambar and chutneys and it was ok. Will come back to give a more thorough review.
I ordered pav bhaji and samosas to go. Pav bhaji was amazingly delicious! Not overly spicy or greasy, and very flavorful! Samosas were ok, and chutneys lacked flavor. I will come back to this place

Worst restaurant in terms of service! 
Can't say about the food because we decided to leave after a 45 min wait for most of our food! 
Small and easy cook menu yet they couldn't meet the expectation we had! 
Had ordered 1 potato sandwich which we were served after 35 mins exact! 
The sandwich was good but don't see why we had to wait for that long to be honest , HOnest! 
When asked about the other order which was masala pav they say 15 mins more which is ridiculous. 
The lady at the counter says the chefs are making fresh mix which I just can't believe..
They take orders after orders both for dine in and takeaways and we did see takeaway guests get their orders well before the dine in guests.
Also from what I seen on other tables the portion size is really small and it's not worth the money spent at all! 
Rude waiters and dirty restaurant in terms of ambience and cleanliness around the sitting area.

This is my place....
Authentic Honest taste..... Loved it...
Was here 3 week back had it and now I had it 3 times in this week visit.
Same taste... Keep doing what you doing and you can beat all indian food chain in USA.....

Just had swaminarayan pav bhaji ( no onion garlic) and to my surprise this is yummy too. I think it's one of the best place to have pav bhaji in this area. I mean had their regular pav bhaji as well and both are very tasty. No compromise on taste. Yummy. Good work keep it up

This is as close to the "Honest" restaurant taste that you can get anywhere in North America. We tried the Pav Bhaji, Pulao, Masala Dosa, Sev Papri and Cheese Chutney sandwich. Everything was tasty. The staff was good and did their best to manage the swelling crowd at dinner time!

The only downside is that they are currently a bit squeezed for space and on a weekend night, things can get very busy with not enough space for people to be seated in.

Overpriced.,small portions and too oily.
Very average good. We tried - 

Pulao - very oily and small portion priced around 8 $ 
lychee icecream - rip-off . for a tiny little portion they charged 3$  and it was just ok .
Honest special sandwhich - this wasnt too bad. 

but overall disappointing.

Got here and was told that there is a 45 min wait... But It took over an hour to get a table. Then we got a table but had to go to the counter to place an order. After placing the order we asked how long it would take and he said 35 mins. Are you serious? Yes. So we got here at 7 and its 8:30 and we are still waiting to get our food. Don't come here unless you're willing to wait for 2 hours to eat. Or be smart and order pickup. I hope the food is actually worth the 1.5 hour wait.

Love it! Ordered Spicy Pav bhaji, masala pav, and reg. lacchi. Pav bhaji and masala pav was five stars but Lacchi, believe me it's a Six stars with Cashew and Raisin. Must stop place for ppl who love to eat Indian fast-food with  great quality and exceptional customer service

Food is ok but quantity is very less according to the price. Need to improve quantity or reduce the price. $ 7.99  get pulav ,  better then go to Chipotle in less then $7.00 and get good food. 

I'm not consider this restaurant for next time.
Absolutely delicious! Will go again n again. cant believe the exact same taste as India!

Garbage overpriced food are the only words that can describe this restaurant. Ordered a aloo matar sandwich, masala pav and lassi. The sandwich first of all seemed like it came out of the freezer as it was cold. Secondly there was so much salt and it was the only thing i could taste. The masala pav again had too much salt which spoilt the entire taste. The lassi was not fresh at all and felt like it came directly from the freezer. This restaurant is not worth the time and money. Also i must comment on the stupid timings... Who would keep the restaurant open just between 3pm and 10pm???

The service is horrible.. me and my friend went there and it took them 24 minutes to get my friend order and 45 minutes to get my order.. imagine when you go with someone and that person finish there food while you are still waiting on your.. if my friend had waited for me then her food would have been cold.. didn't even apologize for that..

I went to this place today. The guy over the counter is rude he missed my order and i have waited almost 20 min. I asked him about my order . he told me that , He can cancel my order since i asked him it is getting late

The food also not worthy for your money. Do not waste your money.

I was given half a cup of tea when I ordered a cup of tea. When I pointed it out and asked, the guy said its full cup pointing to the half filled cup.

I drink coffee/tea frequently at Starbucks / Dunkin donuts, so I know a thing or two about the right quantity. I didn't pay half price but why being served half the portion?

I am not coming back again. 

Looking at other reviews, looks like I am not the only person.

Awesome Dosa, along with exotic sauces mouth watering selection very relaxing spacious overall balanced ambiance .must must mast MASALA TEA.My new favorite stop in the burbs, 30 years in chicago no store on devon can come close to their taste and service.

Delicious pav bhaji and chat items, sandwiches. Veg Pulao doesn't match the taste of india's honest and quantity is also very less. Service should be improved. Overall four stars for awesome food. 
Long way to go if only- they maintain the quality & improve the service.
Restroom was not maintained...sink was lying on the ground and it was very unhygienic. Food quality is ok but service can be improved.
Good place for Pav Bhaji n Dosas. If you like a different flavor of Bhel n Pani Puri this place serves it Gujrat style! Not good for Sev puri though.
One of the best pav bhaji's that you can eat outside India.  Dahi puri and pulav is also very good.  The place does not have a lot of variety - that's one drawback.

A very good Indian vegetarian place. Chat and Dahi poori were really good. Dosa's were not too bad, Pav Bhaji really good too. Probably the best option in the Schaumburg area for Chaat and veg fast food.
Salty and expensive,  i guess going to give benefit of doubt of it being Saturday evening.

This place is rip-off.. Not enough quantity for the price.. Too much masala taste.. The quality and quantity of food not worth the time and price... This is no where near the actual taste of Honest.. Wait time and service is the worse... First time we were there they mixed our order. I would rather go across the street to Hot-Bread and get what my money is worth..
Way too amazing pav Bhaji and pulav. Remind me good old taste of Ahmedabad.

Very oil food. Felt like the oil used was old or reused oil. Extremely over priced for quantity and quality of food. I was very excited to try the place but food quality is very poor and oily. The food I know was prepared fresh but tasted very stale salty and greecy. Would not recommend this place unless they improve the quality of food.

Everything at Brothers is good. Good guys run the place. I usually get the ribs or brisket. Their ribs are special because they only take the rib meat from the best side of the animal. The brisket is nice and tender, made and cut correctly. They have good pricing for the most part. I think the fries are a bit overpriced but I don't care because I don't come here for fries. Just being as transparent as possible about Brothers. Just good stuff. I wish they were open 24 hours sometimes. LOL

I had been here years before but I really could not remember much of this place. Met up with some friends here for lunch. Nothing fancy as far as the atmosphere here. However, everything I touched seemed a bit sticky. 
Ordered Pulled Pork + Brisket sandwiches. I had the pulled pork one. It was pretty good, not the best I ever had but still good. Prices seemed a bit high for what you get since you had a choice of one side with their lunch combo, no drink. I went with coleslaw, which was alright.

I would not make a special trip to come out here by myself. However, if you're in the area, not a bad place to stop.

Cheers

A little overpriced. Second visit our rib tips were overgrilled and dried out.
You get buttered garlic Texas toast (I didn't see any grill marks).

Tucked in the corner of a struggling corner strip mall on Euclid and Quentin road that used to have a Dominick and a Blockbuster. LOTS of parking. Leaning diveish for Palatine, avoid the bathrooms.

I like their sauce and smoke in general, not overly sweet, some citrus notes, so you into burnt sugar will be disappointed. Was more like a diced up baby back rib though, pieces too large and more bone vs cartilage than I want, although I enjoy trying to gnaw the marrow out.  Marrows in but...Bone to meat ratio no bueno.
Won't order the Rib Tips again, need to try the brisket. 
A-OK but I want better.

If you're a true BBQ fan then you may be disappointed with brothers. It's more like grilled meat and not that authentic slow smoked BBQ.

My work ordered from here for a party and we got a little bit of everything from there. Nothing tasted that great. In fact it tasted a little like left overs. The "award winning" sauce was not too my liking, but maybe it's just my taste buds. I wish these guys would smoke their stuff. I think they would really revive themselves by changing their cooking methods. 

Maybe one day I'll try it again, but I won't be recommending it to people looking for true BBQ.  

It's a damn shame too because there aren't many BBQ places around this area.

I consider myself to be a BBQ expert as I have eaten it all over the USA and have had all the different regions styles of rubs and sauce's. This small restaurant in a suburb of Chicago is easily one of the best I've ever had. Ordered a full rack of ribs because they had just come out of the smoker. My lord that was the largest full rack of ribs I have ever been served. Could only eat half of it. What makes Brothers Ribs stand out from the crowd is their own BBQ Sauce. Just the right amount of everything. Not to vinegary, not to tomatoey and not spicy! They sell it by the bottle and in my opinion it's a good investment to get one to take home. Can't wait to go back and try their rib tips and smothered fries.

The food here is absolutely fantastic!  The barbecue sauce you can request by the jar and is the perfect mixture of sweet with just a little spice.  Everything is simple, and has such as "home-cooked meal" feeling to it.  It's so easy to miss though!

This was my first time coming here and I came in here around 2 in the afternoon today when it was pretty dead. I got the beef brisket sandwich with fries and let me tell you, it was damn good. I didn't have time to take any photos of my food though because I gobbled it all up. I'm extremely satisfied with the quality of the meat as well as the friendliness of the guy working behind the counter. I'll most definitely be back when I have a hankering for some brisket again.

I walked and smelled the smoke flavor I usually look for at a BBQ restaurant,  however when I ate the ribs I didn't taste it. Over all the  ribs were tender,the sauce amazing but I didn't get the flavor of the smoke in the meat :(  the baked beans had too much BBQ sauce in them and the Cole slaw not enough mayo. Overall I would go back again but I expected the ribs to taste like how great the restaurant smells. I'm a sucker for smokey ribs.

Hubby and I shared a 1/2 rib plate with beans and cole slaw.  It was excellent. The sauce was not too sweet, not too tangy, just perfect.  They were very meaty and came off the bone with a fork and knife easily.  Beans were really good - but cole slaw was just ok.
We are kind of far from us, but our hair salon is near, so it is going to become a new thing for us to get our hair cut and eat dinner.
Definitely try this place, you can't go wrong. We are excited to try other items.

I was so stoked to try their brisket. Which turned out to be such a let down. At first it looked like shredded roast beef. Tasted like it was previously frozen. The BBQ sauce was pretty good and I really liked the potato wedges. Baked potato looked good. Maybe we will try the ribs next time.

The slogan and decor looks better than the food actually is. Just two plain run of the mills people cooking your food, not chefs or anything. Most of what you get was frozen and they just grill it or deep fry it. I guess prices here is actually fair for a rib place. Red benches as tables, which is cute. Nothing memorable, kind of a late night drunk food joint.

My kind of place!  I found it by accident, and I'm glad I did.  The food was great, the atmosphere the kind I like.  It won't be for everyone, because it's a classic hole in the wall establishment.  And for those people saying it's pricey, please tell me where you're getting good BBQ cheaper.  Their prices are very reasonable.  I had the smothered fries, and it was a meal!  In fact, it will be two meals, as I have a lot of leftovers in my fridge.  I will definitely be back.

This ribs at this place is A-OK.  I gave the place an extra star for its other qualities.  It's a small restaurant that's cozy to dine in.  There are signs, even one in neon lights (so you know they are serious), proclaiming world ribs champions.  If you are ordering these champion ribs, I would recommend calling ahead so you don't have to wait 20 minutes for it to come out.  That's what we did and we didn't have to wait long for the food.  The people working there are really nice and friendly.  Now back to these award winning ribs, they are not the fall off the bones type, which I'm fine with.  They weren't super fatty, A plus.  The sauce was good.  Overall, good ribs, but nothing impressive.  Maybe I was expecting more from the winner of 43 National Rib & Sauce Competitions.  

I also tried the smothered fries (loaded with cheese, pork and bbq sauce) and thought they were a strange combination.  I mean, it's just potatoes and pork after all, but not really my thing.

Here's a fun fact from their website:  They noticed that pigs always rolled over on their left side to play in the mud. This made the left rack of ribs tougher then the ribs from the right side and that little known fact is still true today.  That's why Brothers Ribs only cook the ribs from the right side of the pig.

Someone should mythbuster that.

Parking is easy since it's located in a strip mall.

Overall we weren't that impressed with the bbq here. We had ribs, chicken, and rib tips. Nothing had much of a smoked flavor (not sure if anything was smoked or not). Basically just decent BBQ that you could make at home. It was good but not great. The same goes for the sides. Garlic toast, fries and cole slaw were nothing special. The baked beans were pretty much  swimming in bbq sauce. If your trying to decide between the average burger place and Brothers Ribs, go for Brothers all the way. But I'll be continuing my search for great bbq in the suburbs.

I can't believe I've waited this one to praise this place!

My coworkers and I order from here frequently. We usually get their smothered fries. I'm not sure if this is a side or if it's meant to be a meal but it's good enough to split between 2 hungry people. 

The fries are served underneath a healthy serving of shredded pork, cheese and bbq sauce. The only thing I wish is that the cheese would melt a bit more. their brisket is good too

Went here today with my wife and kid. We were the second customers to walk in the door when they opened at 1pm on a Sunday. The place was very dirty. The checkered tile floors were not washed, walls were scummy and dirty, tables were sticky and still had crumbs on it from the previous night. The bathrooms were really in bad shape, dirty and it looked like something was growing around the faucet in the men's restroom. The doors had scum and scuff marks over a foot off the ground, it was bad. The food was alright. I ordered the tips with a hot link side, the daughter had a burger and the wife a steak sand. The medium cooked steak sand came out beyond rare the first time, but was corrected after notifying the one employee running everything ( he even had to turn down customers because he was too far behind on orders. He told people it would be at least a half hour to get their food)I felt bad for him. I wanted to jump in the kitchen and help.The kids burger was paper thin and nothing worthy to write about.  The pop tasted really weird and moldy like, probably because the spouts have never been taken off and soaked as they should every night. The tips had a good flavor and were really not meaty at all. The hot link tasted like a microwaved Italian sausage. The fries were pretty good and tasted like the fryer oil was fresh. The award winning bbq sauce was ok to say the best. It had hints of clove and was more on the vinegar side and runny. I'm sure it would taste good caramelized on some meat. I can't say I will be back,  but at least I tried it. This place has a lot of potential but it looks like someone has given up on the place and it's just treading water.
Best Ribs in the Area for sure.

This place is amazing! I had the pulled pork sandwich and smothered fries on my first visit. The sauce is perfect! Can't believe I grew up in the area and just now found this place. GO EAT HERE IF YOU LOVE BBQ!

Just a quick update...

I haven't been here in awhile and I had a craving for some rib tips so I headed to Brothers. The tips were as good as they were last time, actually better since there were no dried up burnt bits BUT the brisket was a different story.

I had to ask if the brisket was brisket and not pulled pork. Why? It was pulled brisket and looked just like pulled pork. Stringy and soggy, it lacked flavor and tasted like it had been sitting in a vat of warm water. I'm accustomed to either sliced brisket with a smoke ring or chopped brisket. This allows for the meat to be cut against the grain yielding a soft, flavorful texture. But their brisket was a stringy mess and just ended up stuck between my teeth. Even a ton of BBQ sauce didn't help the limp brisket (ha).

So tips are good but avoid the brisket at all costs. Yeck.

My standard for determining if i like a BBQ joint is the brisket, so thats what i had for my first visit.  I want to go back to try the rib tips because those are a rare find in the area, but...
While i was waiting for my food, i took a gander at the bottle of sauce sitting on the counter.  the first ingredient was high-fructose corn syrup.  Not a good sign for a BBQ joint to have to rely on that stuff in making their sauce.  
Maybe i had eschewed my expectations by looking at what i was going to be eating, but the sandwich was WAY too sweet; not my style of BBQ. No real smokiness to speak of at all.
Fries & beans were nothing special either.  Beans coulda been out of a can, and were also way too sweet.
I likely won't be back.

Really wanted to like this place. Carried out their sampler for lunch. Some of the rib tips were delicious, but others were too dry to even chew. The ribs were marginal. Good texture and sauce but just tasted off. The pulled pork and beef was watery with sauce squirted on top. Not terrible, but you can tell they were trying to save time. Cole slaw and bbq beans were not memorable.

Acceptable eats. Probably will stop in again when its more busy.
No moo

I had their baby back ribs. The dinner for only $1.99 more includes coleslaw, choice of potato, baked beans and one piece of garlic flavored toast.

The full slab portion of ribs was quite ample. The ribs were meaty if a bit on the fatty side. They were quite tasty but in my opinion oversauced. The sauce itself was good, quite sweet and tangy. However I feel they overdid it a bit. Too much sauce overwhelms the taste of the meat itself. This of course is a personal preference. I can't see anybody that would want to order extra sauce here.

A negative is the ribs were not warm enough. This varied within the slab, that is some portions tasted warmer than others. The meat was soft. This is definitely fall off the bone style.

As for the sides, I had the slightly seasoned potato wedges and they were excellent. Definitely made to order, nicely crispy on the outside with a good potato flavor.Their coleslaw was so so. I did not care for the baked beans as I feel the sauce to bean ratio was too high. What they call garlic bread is one piece of white toast with a mild garlic flavor. It was tasty but why not give two pieces?

This is not a full service restaurant. You can dine in but it seems they are oriented towards carry out (and my order was handled well). Once inside the smoky barbecue aromas grab you in a pleasing way. However the interior decor is not appealing. When I walked in at dinnertime there were several dirty dishes laying around. They have a small television which looks like vintage 1975.

Still for the food itself, recommended.
Ordered the Lil' Bit and made it a dinner. The ribs were by far the best part; super tender and caramelized. The potato wedges were really crispy and tasty too.

I've been driving past this place for years but just noticed it about a month ago when I was driving within the strip mall that they are located in. Put it in my mental notes to check it out and when the chance came up on a Thursday afternoon, I gave it a shot.

Good sized menu of many BBQ items, some custom named without descriptions, so one would have to ask to find out more. I looked and decided to order the Pulled Pork dinner special - $1.50 off the regular price on Thursdays. Brothers offers two types of potatoes and my knee-jerk was to get fries, but I asked the guy working the counter what his recommendation was and he said to go with the potato wedges. Glad I did as they were a little different - nice small potato wedges (a lot of them) with a crispy outside and a fairly fresh taste to them. Texas toast was good - I've seen larger sizes, but given the size of the whole meal I received, I had no issues with the portion.

Also came with decent sized cups of beans and cole slaw. Neither of those really stood out - both were just OK. There's room for improvement on both and it would really pick up the quality of their offering.

Now for the pork...  it was served in one of those rectangular paper deli dishes that often hold sandwiches or a very large order of fries. The portion I received was quite large and in my opinion a good value. The BBQ sauce was also pretty good too - I poured a little more on from the bottle that was at the table. But the downside was that there was a little bit of water in the bottom of the dish and overall, the pork was lukewarm at best. Seemed like it might have been in a fridge or freezer and recently defrosted or lightly heated. I also didn't detect much of a smoky or BBQ flavor within the pork itself.

The other thing that was slightly unsettling was that the guy behind the counter (who was very nice and helpful) clearly had a head cold. I know it's hard to find someone to work for someone else when they're sick, but his cold in a foodservice operation makes one wonder if they'll catch it. So far, nothing yet here!!!

I want to give this place another try as they've apparently been here for years and they do have some good elements to their offerings. Wish I could go higher than 3 stars, but that will be determined after visit number two.

Being new to the area, I looked for what I thought was a decent place for ribs.  First thing that caught my eye, was the website--nicely done-very welcoming, gave off that bbq picnic feeling.  Pricing..a bit over priced..but I thought I'd give it the benefit of doubt. Called in my order, went to pick up--uh-oh, completely empty inside..especially on a Friday night (the place should be hoppin) .again gave benefit of doubt..the bagging was terrible, in brown paper bags rolled up.  Had to ask for shopping bag, something to carry out my 5 bags.  Got home, opened up everything, I was starving hadn't eaten all day anticipating some good bbq...the sauce was god-awful! It was extremely acidic..Louisiana hot sauce mixed with a little bit of molasses(maybe). The ribs were dry--not fresh. the.coleslaw--dry must have taken straight out of a bag and spooned into containers. The beans same thing, straight out of a can into container. NO FLAVOR.  The smoked bbq beef had been frozen and had that waterlogged taste. Chicken did fall off bone, but had no flavor,the French fries were seasoned nicely but old tasting. The Texas toast was the best of what we ate, can't mess up bread. This restaurant has a lot of potiental but needs a taste overhaul. I cannot believe any of these reviews as being valid, did they eat what I ate? I am a long bbq fan and have eaten in many,many bbq eateries...I think the owners need to take a road trip and see what real bbq is all about.  As far as their so called :AWARD WINNING SAUCE--No way.  Kentucky BBQ-NO WAY! Take that road trip fellas...straight east on Golf to Emerson in Evanston...follow the smell!

The food is amazing. Try the smother fries. Heaven. The place is a little dark though. It is kind of scary. Especially the pig next to the cashier. It looks like it got broken thousands of times then superglued. The workers are very nice but one guy (who looked like the owner) seamed mean.

I actually think the BBQ here is somewhat decent- the sauce is similar to Russell's BBQ... what is not decent is the owner and his bad attitude. He's rude and really not pleasant!  Every time I have been here he's the same miserable person, his wife occasionally will work the register and she's just as bad! 
On a recent lunch visit this week on a cold winter day- the temperature inside the restaurant was FREEZING and we made a comment about how cold it was and instead of being apologetic, explaining why it was so cold or offering to turn the heat up he respond with- "Yeah its about 50 degrees in here" In a sarcastic tone. - Um OK HAHA very funny... 
Honestly couldn't even enjoy my lunch.  
I'm all about the food and how good it is, but an owner being appreciative and kind to his patrons is just as important!

I've been dining here for ages--love their rib tips and of course their full slab of ribs. The meat quality is top notch here-- fresh, thick, juicy and tender ( better quality than what I've had at JD's Q & Brew and Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ). Their own brand of BBQ sauce is also very good. I wish they had corn on the cob as a side but I can just get that from Popeyes' drive thru. Other than that, though, I'll keep coming back here for my ribs.

Awesome food especially the beast sandwich..... Great prices too .... Wish the fries were the fresh hand cut variety, but I don't go there for the fries it's the pulled pork and brisket that's keeping me coming back again and again

First found this place by surprise, when I was in the neighborhood.  The BBQ ribs and Chicken definitely live up to their claim of fame: several first place awards of various rib cook off.  I'm a french fries enthusiast, if there is such a term, and this place is one of the few places that serves really good fries: crispy yet not oily.

I really like this place for its BBQ boneless rib sandwich. You can get it a la carte for $3.99. For a buck more, it includes French fries and cole slaw or baked beans.

It is automatically served on a Kaiser roll. You can ask to replace it with Texas toast at no additional charge. You can upgrade from the fries to a baked potato for $.50 after 4p.

I really like to dip my fries in their BBQ sauce. I enjoy Lemonade with my ribs. 

The service is good. The size of the restaurant is adequate. There are pigs and accolades all over the place. I'm not sure if what they say is true about the origin of Leftovers but it's a nice thought.

Ive been looking for a place in the burbs with yummy brisket
i shouldve listened to the reviews and ordered ribs, but i tired the brisket instead. not smoked=not good enough for me
but do try the smothered fries! delicious!!! 
it had fries, pulled pork and their scrumptious BBQ sauce! next time i must try the ribs!
Oven baked ribs very average.

This is the third barbeque place I've been to in the Chicago land area, and while they have decent ribs and have won many awards, they aren't the best I've been to. The staff and owners here are really kind, told me they had been there for twenty some years.

THE RIBS are above average, but not great. I didn't expect much coming to a rib place like this, so I think they satisfied me. But it didn't give me that feeling of wanting to come back for more. The GOOD part of these ribs is they are prepared and cooked really well. They fall off the bones just like many other reviewers state. However, that's where the goodness stops. The sauce itself isn't strong enough (in my opinion). After awhile, it doesn't taste like much and it's just "ribs". They aren't bad... but they aren't great. 3 stars

THE GARLIC BREAD is really good. It tastes light and the texture is just right. It comes out crunchy and has a good balance of flavor on there. Having eaten this prior to eating the rest of the meal, it was a good start to the meal. 3.5 stars

THE FRIES are fantastic. They are crunchy and crispy, just the way I like them. There's not much chewiness to them but it's not like it tastes dry. They don't oversalt it and it makes a great balance to the ribs. 3.5 stars

THE BEANS are baked and don't have much of a flavor to them. They seem to be just baked beans. They are better than the baked beans you'd have in your school cafeteria, but they definitely aren't better than ones I've had from other places. They taste just a notch above bland.  3 stars.

THE COLE SLAW is chopped really small and tastes clean and light. I like it for that reason. 3.5 stars.

I paid about $22 including tax for all of the above. For that price, I might come here on occasion, but I wish they had a little bit stronger of a taste to it.

Great food.  Prices are reasonable. The owner is super nice and extremely personable. 

He made sure to get to know everyone in the store and made my experience great.

The ribs here have won a few competitions, and are quite good.

Small dine in area, but I've always done carry out.

Good local joint - located in Regency Plaza, Euclid and Quentin Roads, southwest Palatine - Convenient for lunch - plenty of parking right in front - try the pulled pork sandwich - an easy choice for lunch - 

Also have enjoyed bringing the food back to the house for a family feast - My kids particularly enjoy the Brothers baby back ribs - I like their BBQ sauce - and the wife likes the BBQ chicken - 

So simply stated, hard to go wrong, prices are fair and all the times there I've found the workers are friendly and seem to appreciate your business. 

Good tasting ribs and more  - Say no more -

**service: ok
 
**food:
-smoke: they dont smoke their food or if they do there is no smoke element in their  food. 
-sauce: ok not the best sauce ive had but not bad either.
-meat: very chewy, even hard, it has texture like the meat has been sitting in fridge and
microwaved. really really bad -1.
-garlic toaste tasted like well, garlic toast.
-fries are typical frozen fries.
-beans are typical canned beans.

average $15~25

overall not recommended.
This is a good local restaurant! We ordered the rib tips and would definitely order them again. Good service and you don't have to wait too long for your order. Prices are reasonable.

Pulled pork sandwich YUM!
Ribtips YUM!
BBQ Sauce YUM!

Best ribs I've ever had, hands down.  The crazy chili cheese fries are awesome too (but on the pricier side).  The catfish sandwich was excellent, and I'm not typically someone who would go for that type of thing.  The staff is friendly and eager to please.

I've had nothing but multiple, great experiences here.

Yum, those were some great ribs & chicken! The sauce is perfect and tangy with fall off the bone goodness. The baked beans had some sweet and tangy flavors that added a nice surprise. Portion sizes of the dinners are great and the BBQ sauce really stands out.

First and last time I eat at Brothers.  Ordered 1/2rack of their award winning ribs, slaw, beans, and potatoes. The ribs - tasted like they'd been over boiled, refrigerated for days. They heat them up on a grill.  Terrible way to treat a rib.  No smokiness, no flavor?  The meat was cool in the center and dry throughout YUK!  
The beans - just as bad.  Tasted like S&W canned with their BBQ sauce added in. Completely boring and unimaginative

SO MUCH FOOD! Get the dinner combo...you get the food and fries/beans/garlic bread! 

I usually get a half rib dinner combo and I'm stuffed. I'm afraid to get the full rib because it'll make me want more.

The BBQ sauce they make is spicy with some zing to it. I'm a big fan of their sauce.

So strap on your bib and get eatin!
I've been ordering from them for over a year now and used to love their ribs  and I'm not sure what happened but ribs are just not the same. Lately they are dried out or plain burnt.

The sauce is absolutely fantastic. Poor selection of drinks but that's nothing to worry about. The food is served on a freaking pizza tray! It's massive. I loved the cole slaw, and the chicken was absolutely amazing. The ribs were just ok though and didn't seem like they were really meaty enough. Fries are your standard crinkle cut fries but they give you enough for five people. So what they lack in quality you sure get in quantity. 

The sauce though was great, we should have grabbed some to take home but we forgot and I don't believe they ship. The sauce was worth the price of admission alone and probably the second best BBQ sauce I've ever had.

Wow!  Superb BBQ.  The meat is notably fresh and that makes a huge difference to me.  The BBQ sauce has a very rich, sweet, tangy balance that is hard to beat.  

I've eaten there a couple of times for lunch with friends and I have never been disappointed.  The place is a small hole in the wall kind of place.  The proprietors are friendly and the service fast.  They keep bottles of BBQ at the table to "freshen up" your meal with some more.

I can't wait to go back and get some more pulled pork.  Go there, you will not be disappointed.

Great tasting barbecue (I believe it was called "Grandma's Sauce" or something of that nature).  So it sounds like 2 guys stole their Grandma's sauce recipe and are now striking it rich out in Palatine, IL.

I had the pulled pork sandwich, coleslaw, and fries and it was actually very good (for the $10.19 that it cost).  I saw other people had a half a chicken or BBQ chicken sandwich which all looked good.  You can also buy the BBQ sauce in the bottle which I was thinking about doing but didnt because I must have about 20 different bottles of BBQ clogging the fridge.

Try this place, they have banners hanging from the ceiling saying they've won BBQ sauce competitions but for all I know, they ran them off at Kinko's down the street.

EXCELLENT. i've been eating randomly here for the past year or so as i work down the street. i've had a variety of things, and yesterday i finally had the ribs. just great.

their sauce is VERY good. as for the ribs, they were very tender and came off the bone very easily and tasted GREAT.

fries are whatever, coleslaw is pretty good too despite me not normally liking coleslaw.

everyone that works there is always super nice and friendly. and lunch specials are great. eat good food here now.
Have been eating here for around 3 years and the food is awesome and I never got around to writing a review but The food is so good I had to tell someone!

I am being generous with my three star rating, mainly because the Ribs are REALLY over the top.  Probably some of the best I ever had!  I consider my self to  to be fairly well educated when it comes to smoke houses as I love to smoke meats at home.  I ordered the "Little bit of everything special" to get an overall sampling, as I have wanted to try this place for years. Again, Ribs are awesome! Tasty and tender!  Sauce is good, I have had better sauces tho (Best sauce is Jims Rib Haven in Moline, IL).  The real disappointment here was the beef and pulled pork. Both were flavorless and tasted like soup meat.  Only premier smokehouses can master Beef Brisket, These guys need to work on it.  Go to Brothers for Ribs, Go to T-Bobs in DesPlaines for Brisket!

Pricy..but good ribs.  The sauce is amazing.  Friend likes the baby back ribs.  I do like them....its a cool restaurant...I like the decor.  Kind of freaky farm equipment at times though.  The kid picture is cute.  Good overall food.

My wife and I were in a store a few doors down this weekend to deliver some things to her office and smelled the BBQ cooking and just HAD to try it since it smelled really good. 

We ordered a pulled pork sandwich, grilled chicken (and a corndog for our son). The food was delish! Good sized pulled pork, decent size chicken (although putting a little sauce on during grilling would be nice instead of just pouring it on after cooking), fries were tasty and the sauce was really good. Sweet and flavorful. Glad to see RC as a beverage choice - one of my fave's! 

I would have given this place 4 or maybe even 5 stars BUT... the seating area was, frankly, gross. Layers of dust on shelves, walls dusty, chairs that looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a long time (caked on food, sauce on seats, spindles AND legs, crumbs), floor just gross (needs a good scrubbing, and maybe a coat of wax), the sauce bottles, ketchup bottles and salt an pepper shakers a little crusty. The whole place just felt - dirty. And all this in a nice mall/city. This is NOT some dive location in a crappy neighborhood!!! But it seems like it. 

Really, take a few hours (or a day) and scrub this place down and then keep it up on a daily basis. All of this makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like...ewwww.

Excellent BBQ in the suburbs.....The smothered fries are awesome(shredded pork and BBQ sauce over fries) just try them.....The beast sandwich is awesome as well....BBQ pork sandwich with a hot link....the pork is juicy and flavorful with just enough sauce as it doesnt overpower the meaty flavor. The hot link is just spicy enough, not too much that it burns your mouth. The link has a nice "crunch" when u bite into it..... I had to eat some of the pork off the sandwich just to make it manageable. This place is highly recommended !!!! I still need to try the ribs !!! Been too busy trying their sandwiches ....Brisket sandwich is also a great treat...Think I done for now :)
Pulled pork sandwich with Texas style garlic toast is just awesome!

Not a bad place - great when you need a BBQ fix and don't want to mess about. You can eat there, but I suggest takeaway. Their prices are pretty good and - for example - the rib dinner - you get ribs, a generous portion of fries (or potato), baked beans, slaw and garlic bread...what more do you want - again though - take it home...

I used to frequent the Brothers Ribs at the Mundelein location, maybe its not the same one though? I have yet to visit this new location but I really liked the ribs before. I like ribs that fall easily off the bone and a sauce that is not too tangy nor too sweet. Also I like that you are provided perfect utensils for the rib feast... table garbage buckets, wet naps, and bibs. Awesome. I remember the checkers tables and TVs as if they want you to stay awhile and/or gives you something to do when waiting for the food.  You do wait quite a bit for the ribs to be ready so beware.

I ate here for years while I worked in Palatine.  Their sauce can't be beat and their ribs are fantastic.  Everything else they make is mediocre at best.  One of my coworkers got sick after eating their catfish and blamed it.  I'm not sure it was the fish but never tried it to be on the safe side.

So: get the ribs and avoid the other stuff.  That's about it.  Wow, my shortest yelp ever!

What more do you need from a good BBQ place than tender meat, a great sauce, and plenty of napkins? Brothers Ribs has them all. The place is very small and every time I've gone only one person is working behind the counter, but the other constant is that the food is phenomenal. The half slab combo is an excellent deal. The ribs are tender and the sauce is just sweet enough. The fries are good too. Definitely stop by here if your in the area.

I give it a two because there were two things I liked, the french fries and the texas toast. The ribs were ok not falling off the bone tender. I was not digging the sauce. It was sweet and had a sweet spice like nutmeg I didn't care for.  The beef brisket tasted like roast beef (no smoke) with the icky sauce. Baked beans were too vinegary. Baked potato was eh. I don't eat cole slaw but it looked dry.  Can I just say , No one likes Diet RC. Yuck.  Service was ok but brought sauce when my 6 year old ordered dry ribs.  Too much $$ for not enough food.  I won't be back.

Excellent ribs and rib tips.  Generous serving and the prices are fair.  Service is quick and the people that work there are generally friendly.  I have lived near this place for about two and a half years now, wanting to try it.  Went once about a couple months ago and have been back many, many times.
Great ribs, yummy sauce.  Good coleslaw and great potatoe wedges.  we will definitely be a returning customer!
we rib tips - delicious, and pulled pork - good, but maybe b/c im not a huge pulled pork fan?  their original bbq sauce is excellent!

Delightful!
We were a party of 4.
Started with the local brewery draft and one member had a Riesling that she really enjoyed( 2 choices available, rare to have more than one )
The cheese curds were very good with a 
Nice complimentary sauce.
Here's our choices:
Pulled pork sliders with fries
French onion grilled cheese with gruyere
Smash potato burger with fries
Toasted apple chicken Brie sandwich
All agreed they made the right choices and would all return.
The staff is very young but so incredibly polite and genuine. They worked as a team and we felt so comfortable. The owner (manager) came by to see how everything was. It was an easy conversation since we were all so pleased.
The dining room is small but so beautiful 
with tall tin ceilings and old time lighting.
Boy I wish those old walls could talk.
As we left we received several thank yous from the staff. Again genuine.
Delightful!

Only word of caution:
Not wheel chair accessible. Very tall old time steps.

Located on a corner in downtown Lombard, Babcock's is a genius endeavor.  The interior of the restaurant is like a hybrid of a 1930s farmhouse kitchen and a diner.  The menu is soda fountain meets gastropub.

This restaurant is small, so be prepared for a wait on Friday nights.  I waited about 20 minutes for a party of 2.  There isn't much standing room to wait, so I felt like I was hovering over other diners.  When I walked in, I didn't know where to go, and I certainly didn't appreciate the one employee look at me at least five times without saying something.  If someone walks in with a blank look on their face, especially into a brand new establishment, say something!  I finally noticed that there is a counter with a register and walked over where someone helped me.

Their beers are mostly local, including options from Noon Whistle which is only a stone's throw from Babcock's.  I had the "Fuel Cafe," a coffee stout from Lakefront, a brewery still local to the midwest. 

The food is mostly burgers and sandwiches, but that didn't make it any easier to choose.  I had the French Onion Grilled Cheese with fries.  Honestly, the sandwich didn't "wow" me.  The cheese wasn't melted all the way and the onions were clumped in the middle of the sandwich.  The fries were really good though.  My friend had the smashed potato burger which looked really good.  We also shared the cheese curds which were lightly battered and done really well.  The spicy mustard dipping sauce was an interesting twist too.

So I didn't love Babcock's, but I really did like it enough to consider going back to try the chicken apple brie sandwich, macaroni and cheese, or something else.  The location is a nice halfway point between myself and many friends, so I can see myself going back to try again.

This place is exactly what I've been looking for. We were greeted right away with a big smile. We were there for a late lunch. We ordered at the counter and took a seat. They brought our drinks and food out to us. The menu is wonderful, varied, and casual made with good ingredients. 

We shared a Sweet Potato burger and the smashed potato burger. The sweet potato burger was my favorite... just wish it had a tiny bit more avocado. The fries were awesome! Crispy and perfectly salted. Beer and wine list had a nice variety too. 

We went on a nice fall day and chose to sit outside. The chairs are very comfortable for outdoor furniture. However the inside looks comfortable as well. If you haven't tried this spot, don't put it off any longer... just go.

This place is so cute! I was totally nerding out over the rustic and classy decor. So much so that I took a panoramic video of the place, because I wish my house looked exactly like this.

I met Kate S for lunch and had a great experience here. Located in downtown Lombard on a busy corner, Babcock's has outdoor seating and inside seating. During the day you order up at the counter and they'll bring out your food; at night it's a full service restaurant. 

Their fall lunch menu offers a lot of great options. I decided to go with the french onion grilled cheese with a side of organic mixed greens. This sandwich cost $8.50 and had swiss cheese, gruyere, caramelized onions, and parsley. It was so delicious and tasted exactly like French onion soup! Perfect for a cool fall day. The other option for a side is their Belgium style fries, but I definitely suggest the greens with this sandwich. It's a nice light balance to a very cheesy lunch.

I will definitely be coming back to Babcock's Grove House and can't wait to try out their dinner menu. They also offer beer on tap and in bottles and wine too. Sounds like a relaxing evening to me!

Let me start off my saying I'm sadly unfamiliar with the city of Lombard and all the businesses within it but if it's anything like Babcock's Grove House then Lombard will definitely be seeing a lot more of me. What an adorable restaurant. I fell in love with this establishment even before I had visited for the first time. Viewing the photos and reading the reviews here on Yelp was enough for me to decide that there was a very likely chance of me loving this place - I was right!

Like several other Yelpers and visitors of Babcock's have mentioned, this place is damn cute. The decor is a sort of woodsy chic and I'm obsessed. Before I had ordered my lunch with Jacqueline B. I looked around the space as if I was a kid in a candy shop. The Babcock employees were very friendly and pretty attentive from my experience.

Now enough about the cute space, the food was good too! I had ordered a chicken, apple and brie sandwich with a side of fries. It was pretty satisfying and very nicely plated! Because it had been just a casual lunch (and they didn't have their dinner menus out yet) I didn't dive into their drink menu or anything of that nature. They had a pretty good selection to choose from for just lunchtime though.

One thing that was different for me was the fact that you order/pay at the front counter before you get your meal. I learned later on by an employee that they have a regular "dinner" style menu and serving. I think that means a waiter/waitress takes your order at your table and you pay after you're done eating like most restaurants? I'm not sure. It didn't bother me either way.

I would absolutely love to bring the boyfriend here to grab dinner and drinks in the future. I can see this place being nice for a date night! It's small, cozy and the price range is not bad at all.

Locally sourced fresh food with a 1920's/turn of the century vibe.  Steampunk diner?  Farm fresh speakeasy? While they do have a few outdoor tables, I think the decor inside is much more interesting. And I am not one to turn down al fresco dining!  So,  arrive early and dine in!  Plenty of stools at the bar too! 

As for the food,  I had the sweet potato burger and already went back for another!  Thank you from all of us vegetarians for having some serious non meat options!  We also had the carrot soup with side salad which is super light, but also somehow hearty.  Carrot soup sounds like a winter food but it's actually perfect for summer too.  The turkey burger and chicken schnitzel are also solid choices.  

Our little guy had the mac and cheese.  He was pretty happy about it.  Nice and creamy.  I will caution you to arrive at senior citizen/toddler dinner time (5pm)  if you want to snag a high chair.

Now,  let's talk about the drinks.  Craft sodas like birthday cake flavor (perfect for cream soda lovers),  lemonade and the craft beers!  We had some kind of delicious double IPA on draft.  They also have a special local Lilicia beer named for Lombards beloved lilacs.  It's on the light side. 

And lastly, a note to the genius designer that created and hung the lighting. We love those single bulbs that are hung like octopus arms in the middle of the ceiling.  The cage lights are fantastic too. 

Room to Improve :
1) add a side of fruit or veggies to the kids meals
2) add a high chair or two to the fleet
3) where is the dessert menu?! Dessert please!

Lombard gem!  I came here with my family tonight and was thoroughly impressed.  It's a relatively small restaurant and a bit loud when crowded, but the decor is cute, the service is kind, and the food is amazing!  

Our waitress was efficient and friendly, and the manager stopped by our table several times to check in and chat.  The food was truly excellent.  We split the Bell's IPA Battered Wisconsin Cheese Curds, and then I couldn't make a decision, so I ordered both the Roasted Butternut Squash Hummus and Mrs. Peck's Savory Skillet Mac N Cheese.  My family members also really enjoyed the food they had, and my Autumn Cider Palmer to drink was tasty as well.

I am looking forward to returning!

I drive past this place nearly everyday. Every time I drive by the restaurant is busy with people, dining inside and outside. I had read reviews and I was excited to check them out. 
Last night on my way home from work I decided to stop there for a very late dinner and a glass of wine. I walked in a little past 8 pm and there were a few people sitting at the bar and a few tables were occupied. That late there was no wait. 
I got seated and was given a menu. I was dining alone, something I enjoy quite a bit, and my server must have found that strange since he asked me if I ordering to go. 
I ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and he brought it over right away alone with some water. 
I looked over the menu and everything sounded amazing. I ended up going with the turkey shallot burger that comes on a wheat bun I believe it was. I refused the fries and went with the mixed greens salad that came with a fantastic vinaigrette type dressing. 
My burger was unlike any other burger. It was not greasy at all, it was full of flavor, cooked perfectly and simply delicious. I don't even know how to explain it other than perfect deliciousness. I pretty much devoured my meal. 
The server checked on me a few times, there was also a gentleman with glasses that was walking around and he came over to ask me how everything tasted. He caught me mid bite so all I could go is give him a thumbs up. 
The food was good, the restaurant is trendy and inviting. 
It's been a while since I  enjoyed a simple meal as much as I enjoyed my late dinner here. 
I enjoyed my glass of wine and my meal after a stressful day at the job. 
I can't wait to go back and enjoy more deliciousness.

Babcock's Grove House is a gem!

I believe it opened about two weeks ago. My fianc and I were looking for new places to eat in Lombard, and we were ecstatic that this new restaurant is a 5-minute walk from our house. We've only frequented Babcock's once so far. However, after one visit, we are certain to become regulars. Babcock's has a warm, inviting atmosphere and is located in the heart of Lombard by the Metra station. 

The staff is friendly, courteous, and prompt. I can tell they actually enjoy working for this new restaurant. One of the owners came over to our table and talked to us for quite a while. It felt like home - she seemed to know everyone in the restaurant, and she seemed to know every family and business in the area! 

They had a vast selection of sodas and beers, and their food menu had some unique and delicious offerings. I had the Smashed Potato Burger. It was a 1/3lb burger with cheddar cheese and mashed potatoes on the burger. This burger was fresh, filling, and satisfying! The taste of mashed potatoes, cheese, and the burger together was a mixture I hadn't considered before. 

I asked one of the owners about a breakfast/brunch menu, because Babcock's would be an absolutely perfect Sunday Funday brunch location! She said they had plans to roll one out, and they are still ramping up their employees since they are so new. I am very excited to try that new menu when it comes out!

Overall, Babcock's is a fantastic new restaurant and it will surely become a Lombard staple before too long!

I just want to start off by saying how refreshing it is having somewhere like this close to home! There are so many options for all kinds of people. Vegan, vegetarian and omni. 
I had the sweet potato burger. The avocado was a perfect amount. The garlic sauce was good. My mom had a beef burger and loved it. You get to pick a side salad or fries. The fries are a bigger portion but the home made balsamic dressing was really delicious with the salad. 
The only thing different was that you order inside and they bring your food to your table, kind of like noodles and company does.
Overall everything was really fresh. I will definitely be back for the soups and the caramelized onion grilled cheese! Oh and beer of course :)

Babcock's has already became a popular restaurant in the area. I went on a Tuesday night and there was a wait. To me that meant dinner was going to be good if they were that busy on a Tuesday and they did not disappoint. I tried the cheese curds, buffalo chicken salad and I had a couple bites of my boyfriend's smashed potato burger. Everything was great and tasted homemade. We sat at the bar and the service was great as well. I really enjoyed our bartender, she was super nice and helpful. They also have a good beer and wine list.

Love love this spot. They have a great selection of healthy choices and well done home cooking. Their menu seems to change seasonally. Also, one of the few places in the area with outdoor dining space, which is ideal in the warmer months. Most importantly, amazing, attentive staff!
The Buffalo chicken sandwich is amazing! So glad we have this new place downtown Lombard

Love everything about this place:  location, history, decor and vibe.  Food was quality and beer selection interesting due to local emphasis.  Pretzel appetizer was delicious.  Didn't have room for desert but would love to try next time.  Will definitely come here again!!!

Beautiful well decorated atmosphere. The history of Lombard is shown well throughout.  Staff is very friendly and service is spectacular.  Servers were very helpful and quick.  The owners are awesome.... even checked up on the table and made sure we had everything.  As soon as we finished,  they collected our dishes. 

Food is phenomenal. I had the smashed potato burger with fries. I never finish a full burger but finished the whole thing.  It was so fresh.  Perfect amount of flavor.  So delicious.  I will definitely be back! !

I'm seriously bummed out that i have so far only been here once.

Such a great atmosphere for a local restaurant, friendly staff, and LOCALLY OWNED...gotta support those small businesses, folks!

Met friends for a few beers and food.  Had a Chicken and Brie sandwich, was so very tasty.  The beer selection is also great, again, they are using local suppliers whenever they can, so it makes you feel good about stopping in. 

Looking forward to having the free time to make it back in :)

Based on 1 take out salad, are my thoughts ...   The staff are nice.  The place is lovely and authentic vintage. Seems like they take great pride in what they do.  I appreciate a non-styro take out container (well done).   

No issues except that ...

I wish desperately that they had at least 1 or 2 real comfort food dinner options on the menu.  Example: stuffed peppers,  or beef stew, pork chops, roasted potatoes, baked potatoes, mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes, roasted veggies, salisbury steak, stuffed cabbage rolls. 

I am just not a burger person, and can only eat so many salads.  With Shannon's Deli right across the street, I feel they have more options for me.  There is so little in the way of food in downtown Lombard, and some affordable comfort food would be very welcome.

Love, love, love this place! I've been here many times in the past month or so since their opening. What luck to have such a gem come to downtown Lombard!  It has a friendly, welcoming atmosphere with a mix of modern and historical decor (it's located in the old Babcock's Grove House hotel).

Everything I've tried has been delicious - no joke.  They offer a seasonal food menu with "mostly local" beers. Their salads are nice and fresh, the burgers are nice and juicy, and their beer and wine selection is great. For first-timers, I'd recommend the pretzel and beer cheese appetizer, the green goddess salad, the turkey shallot burger, or the stout pulled pork sliders with chipotle cheese.

They recently added outdoor seating, so you know where to find me for the remainder of the summer ;)

Great lunch spot!

(+) Lunch is counter service. Food is thoughtful but pretty standard. Great beer list, two draft taps (Revolution and another when I was there yesterday). They also offer some craft non-alcoholic drinks and there's a kid's menu. It looks like the menu changes seasonally. 

(+) Ambiance is casual but executed with attention to every detail. It's a great spot for outdoor seating. Very clean. 

(++) Staff is exceptionally friendly, nice, and speedy. 

I suggest this spot for catching up with friends over lunch.

So glad to have this place in downtown Lombard. Given the crowd I saw and the great food we had, I am pretty sure they'll succeed. 

We arrived at 5:40 or so on a Friday, and 45 minutes later the place was full with people waiting. We were seated immediately, back in a corner. I know a historic building has its challenges, but I will say the acoustics back there were a little rough, voices echoed back toward our table. The tables are also quite close together. But who can blame them wanting to fit as many people as possible in?

The menu is not big but this is a good thing. Everything sounds very good. We started with cheese curds. They are clearly homemade and all different shapes. And delicious! The dipping sauce was tasty too.

My husband ordered the beer cheese burger and a fancy grape soda; I had the chicken schnitzel sandwich and a peach tea palmer (with lemonade). My husband said his burger was perfect, and devoured it before I got a taste. My sandwich was also very delicious, and the fries were quite good as well.

Service was a little tentative at times (I think the young woman serving us is new, but she was friendly and competent) but overall good. It's a new restaurant so no harm there.

Overall the food was excellent and the place is charming, and I'm looking forward to returning soon.

This is my favorite restaurant in Lombard for a casual dinner Great burgers and salads, as well as appetizers.  The staff are all young and energetic, eager to please and really seem to care about the patrons and their dining experience. Hats off to the owners for a great local experience.

New local restaurant,   excellent  food and good local beers on tap good and fresh. Been here a couple time and between the food and the beers planning on working my way through the menu!!! Great prices  for excellent food.  Not a place to watch tv since there are none. For date night and family dinner. You wont find any thing better.
NICE JOB BABCOCKS!!!  CHEERS

Fantastic new restaurant and bar in downtown Lombard! They did a great job combining the historic building and the desires of modern diners. Impressive wine list for a restaurant of this size. Kids loved the eclectic selection of sodas. Most items come from local producers. Hand made hamburgers were great. 
Good riddance Cafe 101! DFL rules :)

Lynn was our server and she was absolutely phenomenal! Very bubbly, great at explaining the menu details. 

The Apple Chicken Brie sandwich was to die for!

I highly recommend the cheese curds and of course, Lynn!

We had a nice lunch with friend at Babcock's Grove House.  The bacon and beer cheese burger was excellent, as were the other sandwiches.  Fries were very tasty.  Surprisingly, the coffee was very good also.  Service was friendly and helpful.  Babcock's Grove is not an overly comfortable restaurant but is perfect for a quicker, tasty meal in a pleasant setting.

Gorgeous building, decent menu, worth a visit. Ate there with three people...had the pretzel and beer cheese app, pretzel was huge...cheese was solid with a little horseradish kick.

As far as entrees, had a smash potato burger which was reportedly very good and then split both the chicken, apple brie sandwich and the chicken schnitzel sandwich with someone. Both were good but extremely bland and grandparent-ly safe in flavor. Definitely could use some kind of contrasting flavor...both of them were satisfying but forgetful.

Main problem was, even though it was admittedly a warm day...it was stuffier than hell in there...could use some more air moving around. There's a back corner that's like a sauna. 

Also, no fault of the restaurant, but there were also a couple of blow hards that apparently had mistaken it for the corner bar. Older locals monopolizing a table and the poor server over several beers and loudly regaling her with tales of Lombard past and how many beers they drank and tracked in their phone app over the years. Literally seizing her for 5 minute stretches while they explained how they were drinking "x" beer before it was even available in stores like anyone cared. Don't be that person.

Awesome fresh food and local microbrews (Noon Whistle, Church Street, Two Brothers).  If you don't like local brews, they also have Schlitz in a bottle!  Have passed by  Babcock's since they opened a month ago and have wanted to give them a try.  Stopped in tonight and had a Ferdinand's salad and a Founders porter.   Everything was top notch from the food to the service.  Decor and ambience is great for everyone from couples out on a date to families looking for a reasonably priced meal.  This is now one of my go to local restaurants.

I've been to Babcock's Grove a handful of times now since it opened. My fiance and I are committed to becoming regulars. We're obsessed and want to try everything on the menu. I've been here with him, my parents, and even my grandmother.  Getting my grandmother in was somewhat of a challenge because it's not handicap accessible (however, the owner says they're working on that).  Some other patrons were nice and helped me get her up the steps so it worked out just fine! 

Some food highlights: the Sweet Potato Burger and the Turkey Shallot Burger.  I'm shedding for the wedding, so it's nice that they have some healthy options. The mixed organic greens they have as a side option are also very good. Through other people I've tried almost every other dish on the menu, and noting disappointed me!
