Downtown Lombard needed something like this.... we recently moved from the Lakeview neighborhood of Chicago (land of amazing restaurants on every corner) and this is so cute and hip that I almost think I'm back in the city and not in Lombard. I grew up in Lombard, and am pleasantly surprised with new restaurants and bars popping up. Babcock's Grove embraces its downtown Lombard location and the decorations center around the history of Lombard. 

The owners hit one of the park with this one. Definitely try it if you haven't yet!

What a charming place, from the wait-staff to the decor. The menu is has something for everyone - even for a vegan. Ingredients are fresh and local. 
We started out with delicious craft beef and glass of Cabernet and the roasted beet humus. The burgers are handcrafted from Allen Brothers ground chuck perfectly done. The fries are hand cut and of a large portion. 
Looking forward to going back. Extensive wine and craft beef offering. 
Too bad we did not have room for their signature ice cream floats with there fountain crafted cane sodas. Next time for sure!
Got the cheese curds, chicken schnitzel sandwhich, and smashed potato burger. Yummy well priced food and the service is wonderful! Definitely recommended.

Such a classy yet family friendly place to eat. Customer service comes first only to the excellent locally sourced food which is always fresh and full of flavor. We've worked our way through everything on the menu and love it all...however I am particularly partial to the pork sliders.  The team always makes you feel like family, remembering your name and updating you on specials and menu items. What a Lombard gem. Bring your friends for a great meal, or sit at the bar for a beer and cheese curds. Either way you'll love it all.

New place and glad to have it in Lombard.  They're still learning to improve their service.  (Weird to ask you to pay beforehand).  But, their niceness makes up for a few inconsistencies.  Food is stellar with fresh and local ingredients.  I'd recommend their cheese curds, pretzel, burger, and buffalo chicken sandwich.

Went to Babcocks for the first time tonight based on a strong recommendation. Everything other reviewers commented on
was generally how I reacted so won't rehash what everyone said.

Nevertheless, I do have one comment that might matter to some people. I had their classic burger and it was good, no real complaints. Except the burger was slathered with mustard. I've never had a burger at a restaurant that had mustard on it. It may be a personal thing but I hate mustard on a burger. Possibly my fault if that ingredient was mentioned on the menu - I didn't check.

Best burgers in the area!
All organic! Cool Lombard historical building- liqueur license- we will return!
Phil recommends this  place!
Best food!!!!

While nothing holds a candle to Chicago, there are huge nuisances such as parking and tiny annoyances such as crowding. So, when wanting a slight break from the gritty city, but rather not come face to face with an obtrusive strip mall, Babcock's Grove House is brand spanking new to downtown Lombard and their induction to town is FABULOUS! The talented owners took the old Cafe 101 and brought it up to the standards of super cozy cafe with charm out the wazoo! It probably doesn't hurt that the lilac village has been hungry for someone just like the new owners to dust off the pre-civil war limestone and polish the wood. Every inch is charming and it's so nice to have several months to bask outside, European cafe style, in the middle of the Lilac Village. Lots of seating outside, decent amount of seating inside. This locale is just so darling it deserves a big hug! 

Like European cafes, there's a huge wine list and a lot of local beers available. We weren't in the mood for alcohol, but I will definitely try one of their wines the next time I'm in (which will be very, very soon). 

Food - after all, that's the main reason to come here, and Babcock's has very yummy organic, locally sourced, healthy yet delicious comfort foods. To begin with, on a warm Spring weekday, the best drink is unsweetened iced tea which they have down to a science, for a measly $2.25. One can drown themselves in a sea of refreshing, pure tea, and it'll still cost less than $.10 per ounce. Don't need to go back to Brussels, folks, if that's all you're going for are the fries. Babcock's Belgian fries are to die for and then to return for another order, or 2 or 3. The beer battered cheese curds - my oh my oh my. Wisconsin, step right up in Lombard 'cuz there's a new contest and Babcock's might win. These addicting little critters are wonderful and from the ooh's and ah's from other tables, I think they agree. Amazing, in that everything appears to be under $10, and that includes all the entrees. Portions are more than ample, plated beautifully and there's more than enough on everyone's plate to share.  

The chicken Caesar Salad was delightful and delicious, with a mixture of the tastiest romaine (not bitter); kale (yay!), croutons & lime Caesar to add a scrumptious fresh flavor that's also sneaking in those healthy nutrients. This isn't a typical Caesar salad, yet it hits normal where needed while adding something different that forces me to want to order it again and again. I had a taste of the Smokey Sweet potato burger that is just wonderful, especially for a veggie burger. With bean puree, roasted garlic yogurt, avocado on a sprouted wheat bun that brings all the deliciousness together - that was one amazing "burger." Good for Lombard, since this new gem is gonna make Lombard proud. In fact, I think they already have!

This is the best place to eat in downtown Lombard. For starters, they always have great local beer on tap. The owners operate the restaurant (hostess and chef). Menu is smaller but well put together. Schnitzl sandwich is my favorite!

It's too early for me to give a full review of Babcock's Grove House right now. The menu is in its "training" phase, according to Dana, the manager/owner. Of the two entrees my wife and I ordered, we were pretty pleased with one (the pork sliders) while finding the other one lacking (grilled cheese). The fries were standard, and I found the birthday cake soda to be way too sweet for my middle-aged palate.

But I'm giving BGH four stars. Why? Ally Sheedy in "The Breakfast Club," that's why. Sheedy's character spends most of the movie under a dark cloud; unfriendly, off-putting, rude and crude. Molly Ringwald sees something in her, and suddenly, at the end of the movie, the ugly duckling has become the swan, still a little unsure of herself, but so much more inviting and full of promise. 

On the front door of BGH, it says "Welcome. We're happy to have you." (Or something like that. I didn't take notes.) But it's a complete reversal from the hand-written "closed today" sign that hung here far too often. The terrible (and well-deserved) reputation of Cafe 101 put such a dark cloud here - ground zero of downtown Lombard - that it was hard for me to imagine anything better coming along.

And it took until late May of 2016, but somehow, the sun is poking through. Behold the swan! Watch in amazement as she learns to fly with grace! 

Okay, I'm waxing too poetic, and I'm no poet. But my meal came with a smile. In fact, when I first peeked in the previous day, I saw more smiles at that one moment than I had seen in five prior years of Cafe 101. The dark cloud has lifted. Here comes the sun. Hallelujah!

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner there. The decor is perfect, the atmosphere is fabulous and the food is amazing. The turkey burger is to die for!!  We are so happy to have this little gem in downtown Lombard.  Great work Babcocks!  We will be visiting regularly!

We stopped by last night for a quick bit. Service was good, food came quick and prices were reasonable. The smashed potato burgers were a big hit with the other people at my table. The fries were very tasty, but they need to have a bottle or two of malt vinegar behind the bar. 

We sat outside due to the crowd inside, but from what I could tell the decor is very pleasant. I look forward to seeing how they change up the menu as the seasons change.

I love this place!! Tonight was our first time at Babcock's Grove and we will definitely be back!  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, the service was top notch, and I had the best burger I have ever had in my life- no joke!! My husband shares my opinion on the burgers.  The fries were awesome too and my kids thoroughly enjoyed their banana split sandwiches and fresh lemonade.  On top of all of this, they have a great selection of beers on tap.  I can't wait to go back!!

Great place! The hardest part was trying to decide from the menu; everything sounded so good! I love the decor and history that are on the walls through out the restaurant. The Green Goddess salad was awesome! I loved the dressing!  The Belgium fries, and sauces that came with them, were excellent!  We will be back!

So glad Lombard finally has a great sit down restaurant. Super fast service and friendly staff. The owner is a sweetheart and talks to customers and asks, "how's everything/"how's it going?" Always my families number one place for a quick meal. Sweet potato burger with a salad is the best option for any vegetarian!

Liked the ambiance. 
good to see some serious vegetarian options - i tried the 

sweet potatoes burger- not bad but i think id like some more flavor to it- maybe some extra dressing . 

the butternut squash humus is really good. 
Carrot soup- Delicious. Loved the roasted pecans on it. 

would love to go back there and try their salads. 

good service.

Update- now in business a few months. Still great menu, still great service, and now I am addicted to their french fries. Judging from our frequenting this place, we are in good company because we have run into the same people over and over. The owners seem to know everyone in town and even the mayor was there!  The buzz of this new place seems to have hit the rest of the block because all the businesses seem to be crowded wall to wall with customers.

Food is delicious and reasonably priced, though don't expect huge portions with enough for leftovers to be taken home. I had the grilled cheese with tomato sandwich which wasn't anything spectacular or fancy - just cheddar on sourdough, though it was grilled to perfection. I'd like to see Babcock's "kick it up a notch" by using two different types of cheeses, such as provolone with the cheddar. The side of greens was plentiful, but again, no imagination. Just a small pile of green and purple greens (same variety). It'd be nice to have at least a little bit of cucumber and tomato. The balsamic dressing on the side was very good; nice and tangy. My husband had the evening special: chicken salad on whole wheat. The waiter told us this was the first time having chicken salad on the menu and came back later to ask my husband how he liked it. Hubby gave it a thumbs up. I had tasted a bite too, and it was good. Not saturated with mayo and had a little bit of tarragon. My son had the basic burger and we were impressed to see it was free-formed, not machine-pressed and "perfect". He said it wasn't greasy at all and had great flavor. I tasted his fries and they were amazing - some of the freshest fries I've ever had.

Our waiter was a young man (looking around, I noticed all the waitstaff was very young) who was very courteous and friendly, checked on us just the right amount of times, and refilled our drinks just as they were empty. You could tell he was inexperienced and a little awkward, but that was OK.

As for the restaurant itself...when we first walked in, we were confused as to what to do. You literally walk right into the restaurant. There is no host and no sign that says "seat yourself". There was waitstaff buzzing around, but no one greeted us or showed us to a table. So we took it upon ourselves to find a table in the back of the restaurant. By the time we left around 6:30, the place was mobbed and there were people waiting for tables. This was a Thursday night, so I can imagine it gets very crowded on weekends. The place is small with not many tables. In fact, you have to really squeeze by some of them to get to the back of the restaurant. And, in the back, some of the tables are so tightly packed that the servers were having a tough go with trying to wait on the tightly packed tables and with the customers going to and from the bathrooms, which are right by the kitchen in back of the restaurant, too. Speaking of the bathrooms - meticulously clean, which is greatly appreciated and also a good sign of a clean restaurant! I will be recommending this place to friends and family who live in the area - the positives definitely outweigh the piddly negatives. Food and waitstaff are fantastic!
Great location and it was Muscle Car Sat night; to a worn California family on vacation this was a great Spot; very reasonably priced and bright cheery service; thanks!!

Finally got the chance to check this place out with the wife. The place itself looks amazing. Completely remodeled. Almost gives a vibe as if you're hanging out in a 1920's style speak easy. Lots craft brews to choose from a well as plenty of wine. First thing we ordered were the cheese curds. Hands down, the best I've ever had and that's counting what I've considered to be the "best I've had" up in Wisconsin. My wife got a salad and I got the bleu cheeseburger. Both were amazing. Super fresh and incredibly fast service from the wait staff. We both cleaned out plates. Definitely coming back here many times over.

This restaurant was recently rehabbed to have a feel of the original historic building. It has a nice intimate warm atmosphere. We loved the old pictures of what this historic hotel originally looked like. Excellent service and delicious local food menu! We will be back with our daughter to try the Lilac Float!!!
Great new local spot. Fresh delicious ingredients, great service/staff and tasty beer selection. Caring owner who is mindful of customers and their suggestions. Worth checking it out for sure!

Came in last night on a double date. Even though it was Cruise Night and super busy, we were greeted immediately by the hostess(owner?). She was very welcoming, took our name, directed us to the bar for drinks. 

Booze: Good list of local beer. They have the BEST gluten-free beer, Lakefront New Grist...which made me immediately love this place.  Most restaurants don't stock New Grist and they really should. Wine list was perfect too!

Food: 
Excellent options. Excellent ingredients. There are far too few places in the burbs with a menu focusing on local, organic, quality ingredients. High-five. And prices were perfect. 

Service: you can tell it's a newer place. Our server didn't seem to have lots of experience. Would have like a quicker check-in with us after our food came because we realized we wanted a few more items. But this was nothing major. 

Overall, excellent. Fabulous. Want to be a regular.

We checked this place out tonight and it was really good. We started with the cheese curds, which were really good! I had the chicken apple and Brie sandwich and my husband had the chicken schnitzel. Great beer selection and solid wine list (though I'd add a ros). The food was great, the service attentive and the space beautifully remodeled. So happy to have another lovely restaurant choice in downtown Lombard. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

I can't say enough about how delicious our meal was at Babcock's Grove House!!  The cheese curds and giant pretzel were amazing, and more than enough to split between 4 people.  I had the buffalo chicken sandwich, it was pulled chicken which was a great surprise and wow, it was incredible.  You can really tell the owners took their time, tasting and picking each menu item, it was put together perfectly.  A fun location with great atmosphere, the service was excellent, I will for SURE be back!

There is a lot of buzz at this prime downtown Lombard location that has long been dark but now welcomes guests with its softly illuminated beautiful building. Babcock's Grove House offers a unique, tasty, fresh (no freezer except for the ice cream!), inspired menu with plenty of options for all.  Thus far my family has tried and highly recommend the following:
   * the turkey burger - so moist and flavorful with shallots and portobello mushrooms in the mix - the best turkey burger my husband has ever had
   * my potato loving daughter raved about the smashed potato burger
   * my other daughter can't stop talking about the Babcock's Classic burger 
   * chicken apple salad - yum
   * sweet potato burger - great vegetarian option; huge - didn't need to eat it all, but couldn't put it down!
   * the Green Goddess sandwich has such a fresh unique flavor
   * as tasty as the raved-about fries are, I opted for the organic greens served with an incredible balsamic dressing on the side (and was still able to steal a few fries from my family's plates!)
 
Drinks (all "made in the USA!"): 
   * a very comprehensive beer menu which offers something for everyone on tap or bottled
   * The wine list has a nice selection of varietals all offered by the glass or by the bottle. 
   * unsweetened peach tea is to die for!
   * craft sodas are fun for the kids and sweet-toothed adults (you have to try the Babcock's Birthday cake soda)

Lastly, the staff is plentiful and eager to attend to diner's needs.

It's so nice for Lombard to have another restaurant that not only locals can enjoy, but one that will surely be a destination for people from neighboring communities and beyond. We can't wait to watch Babcock's evolve over time as we taste our way through the menu. Bravo for a job well done!

This place is ridiculously good. I mean ridiculously good. IPA cheese curds were great. The beer cheese burger I had might be my favorite burger in the Chicago area. Beats Kuma, Labriola, DMK. Hand cut fries were awesome. My fiances turkey shallot burger was so perfectly done. A great lighter option. Steve the owner came out and introduced himself and was a great host. So excited this is in Lombard.

Awesome new place in Lombard.
Have the Kale Caesar Salad--it's great!
So nice to have a place like this in Lombard with good, local, wholesome food.
Well done and good luck, we have already been frequent guests.

My 5 year old loves the Nutella sandwich!

Simply put, Babcock's Grove House is excellent.

They have great food and great beer on tap.
I have not had any of their craft sodas, but they sound delicious (and you can make any of their soda's into a float).
They have not been open very long and have already expanded their menu a bit.
Nice mixture of flavors for the burgers and sandwiches.

The owners are extremely nice and responsive and all of the employees are very friendly.

I definitely recommend a meal at this new downtown Lombard gem.

Frank O.
Stopped by on our way back to the city and had an amazing meal! Staff was very friendly and the food was so good! Planning on coming back on our next trip out to the suburbs.
Delicious food, cool atmosphere and great beer! The sweet potato burger and cheese curds were to die for. So glad they are in Lombard!

A great restaurant that just so happens to be in the great village of Lombard! It is a well decorated, relaxed inside with elements of Lombard History throughout and the only thing that is better than the decor is the wonderful, flavorful food and drinks! 

The smashed potato burger is seriously the best tasting burger I have had in years! The homemade  balsamic salad dressing that comes on the side salad is AMAZING. The chicken schnitzel sandwich is fantastic as well. The banana split sandwich is a fun dinner for the kids. Everything is loaded with flavor and you can tell it is made with fresh, local ingredients. The wine selection and local beers on tap are the perfect compliment to the food. There is even a wide selection of Illinois-made soda choices, which is a fun retro addition. 

Everything is reasonably priced and worth every penny. 

We are so excited that this caliber of dinning is offered in Lombard.  There is some outdoor seating and the overall quant size keeps the feeling "small town" and local. The staff is so friendly and knowledgable about the menu items, which only adds to the perfection of this little gem!  We will be eating here often. :)

I really like this new addition to the downtown Lombard restaurant scene. This restaurant has a great ambiance with fun historic photos of Lombard and famous Lombard residents and politicians. There is also a cute bar serving a nice variety of local craft beers. The waitstaff was plentiful and eager to help. I had the smashed potato burger with buttermilk mashed potatoes. It was cooked perfectly and those mashed potatoes were a quirky, tasty addition under the moist and buttery brioche bun. I also tried the buffalo chicken wedge salad ordered by my dining companion. It was spicy with a great twist on the traditional wedge. I really like this place, and will return again soon! I'm happy to see more great places moving into downtown Lombard.

This place is amazing! The food was fresh and delicious, the atmosphere was so relaxing and the staff & owners were very attentive and provided excellent suggestions. Dining amongst the historical atmosphere was just delightful -- we will certainly be making many return trips to try other menu items. Don't miss the yummy cheese curds!

Good food (at least the hamburgers that we had - didn't try anything else yet) + reasonably priced + fun & cozy atmosphere + family friendly = future repeat customers.

It is great to have a place like this to go to in downtown Lombard and we look forward to seeing what else comes on the menu once it fully opens next week.

What a great gem in Lombard! They're still working out a few kinks, being fairly new, and the servers are young and learning, so be patient. But I Love every item I've ever tried! My top favorites are the cheese curds, smashed potato and shepherds pie burgers, and the green goddess sandwich. Hoping their expanded seating gets here before the cold weather, I could eat here every day! My only major complaint is the side of mixed greens. They could REALLY use something more than just leaves. Something as simple as a tomato, cucumber, or shredded carrots would make it feel more substantial.
Awesome new place! Service was quick, even met the owner who was walking around helping out. Food was great (try the smashed potato burger)! We will be back!

We came here on a whim, and we were very pleased! The interior is very chic and cool. We didn't have to wait long to sit outside, despite there not being enough outdoor tables. The hostess was attentive and lovely. Four of us came, and we had the turkey burger, mashed burger, schnitzel sandwich, and blue cheese burger. We all loved our choices; so good! Everything was fresh and seasoned to perfection. I personally had the turkey burger, and it was, by far, one of the best I've ever had. Our waiter was Nile and he was friendly, accommodating, and efficient. I do wish they had a full bar; at least some mixed drinks. Overall, awesome location, cool concept, and great food. We will be back!
Great new spot. Friendly wait staff and prompt service. Carrot soup was particularly tasty. Definitely will return. Loved the local brew selection.
Amazing food, beer and people!! I wish I could take a pic of my food but I ate it all too quick! So good! Will definitely come back here

I love this place! Great atmosphere, amazing decor, nice craft beer selection, delicious food. I am a vegetarian and this place has so many options that are hearty and healthy. I had the green goddess sandwich and mixed greens for lunch and I highly recommend it. I'll be back to try the sweet potato burger and Belgian fries with garlic aioli soon!

I've now been to babcock's 3 times.  My favorite dish so far was the chicken schnitzel sandwich. The chicken apple salad was also delicious, I would recommend both!  It is a little tight inside so I'm looking forward to the expansion.  Great addition to Lombard!

Well, I think the purpose of allowing the owner to comment is to try and win back customers..Maybe some people shouldn't have the ability to write back..I just dropped the couple of stars I did have originally.

I wonder if people will agree that the comments left by the owner were a little condescending. I also feel as if my review wasn't read at all..

A. I do not work at Drytini, Sorry that you assumed that and tried to throw a little sarcastic remark as if you know who I am now.. attempt failed. 

B. I did request the dressing on the side. I said that I was trying to lose weight and my choice is to dip my fork in the dressing. That has zero relevance to anything I already said.

C. I clearly watched the person take it from me and walk toward someone else to hand it to them. Don't lie to try and come back from this. Your silence would have made much more of an impact. Word of mouth, and my mouth especially, is so much more powerful!

Such a Shame.
Wow is all I can say!! The food here is amazing as it the location and history of the building. Great job in adding another place we can go for lunch or dinner!!

Ridiculously good. Fantastic people.  We have gone multiple times and plan on regular visits. The cheese curds are to die for. The hamburgers unbelievable. The chicken schnitzel amazing. Cannot recommend Babcocks highly enough!!!!!!

We were a group of 6 on a Tuesday night. We had to wait just a few minutes for a table and had a wonderful meal. Half had the delicious burgers and I loved my chicken, Brie , Apple sandwich! 
They have done a great job in restoring an old building and the wait staff was very attentive. So excited to have this gem in downtown Lombard!

Love this place! My daughter and I had lunch here one day. The food was so good. The sweet potato burger was amazing. The employees are very friendly and the service was wonderful. Planning on going back soon.
This is my favorite restaurant in the western burbs for a burger.  The meat is fresh, not frozen & gre

Great service, especially for the opening week(end).  Staff was very friendly.  Nice looking decor and finishes.  Food was solid, amazing cheese curds! You can tell the ingredients of each part of the meal is of higher quality than your typical bar/restaurant. Glad to finally have a place like this so close to home.  Only downside would be that it is quite loud and there is limited seating.  Can't wait to return.
Was in town from Cleveland  and found this diamond in the rough. Staff was excellent and burger was great!   I'll definitely be back.   Please give it a try you won't be disappointed.

Delicious!  Yummy cheese curds.  Great atmosphere.  My boys enjoyed the "birthday cake" soda.  I had the Chicken Schnitzel sandwich which was good.  I will need to come back to taste some of the other novel offerings.

Finally was able to try out the newest restaurant in town.  Delicious. Probably best burger I had in quite a while. Also tried the cheese curds.  Well worth it. My only thing is the menu is pretty small. Hopefully they expand on that and this business will be around for a long. Time.  Check it out!

My first time at Babcock's this week.  Great job by the new owners who have clearly put so much heart and soul into creating a special place with a fantastic locally sourced menu.  We went with a group of 8, so we had a lot of feedback and different plates. The good news is that everyone really enjoyed their meals and there were definitely a few standouts including the Turkey Burger and the Green Goddess sandwich. The kids all ordered floats made with various soda flavors and the adults sampled some of the beer selection.  Really unique!    Can't wait to come back and try some more soon!

Babcocks Grove has only been open for two weeks and I have gone three times. It's that good. Great place to bring the family. I have enjoyed the bacon cheese burger, the turkey shallot burger, and the original cheeseburger. Always with the French fries sampler which is served with garlic aioli and Sriracha ketchup. Great service, too. You have got to try this place!
Ordered to go - took forever to get food. During rush plan on it taking up to an hour for you phone order to be completed.
Excellent food. Turkey burger and the schnitzel were fantastic and the sauces are amazing. Get the siracha ketchup for those fries!

Lovely al fresco dining in downtown Lombard. I had the apple, brie, bacon and spinach salad with house dressing ($9) and husband had their sweet potato veggie burger, with peach iced tea. My salad was generously portioned and delicious. If I were serving it I might have added some pecans and/or cranberries, but that's just me. Good service, too. Only reason gave it 4 stars is hubby wasn't wow'd with his selection, though it was good.

their refrigerator was out, so the menu was limited, but it was a really nice meal, anyway. had the burger, fries and a peach iced tea. very friendly place, the decor is lovely, and the food was top notch.

Finally got to check this place out for lunch yesterday. The owners did SUCH a great job rehabbing the place. It is really beautiful (those light fixtures!) and welcoming. It's hardly recognizable from the old place. We sat inside because I wanted to look at all the nice touches, but the outside seating looked nice, too. Next time!  The service was good, very friendly. It's a walk up and order and they bring your food deal. The food was REALLY good. I don't usually love fries, but these are yummy!  Everyone really liked the sandwiches they ordered (cheeseburger sliders, sweet potato burger and green goddess). Our plates were clean!  Can't wait to go back for dinner and try a beer with my meal.

You have to love a business that employees local students/kids rather than... well you know what. 

Anyway, this place has always been great for ice cream, rain or shine, summer or winter. Who doesnt love dairy queen?

I want to say upfront that the kids running the store tonight we're doing a great job. The food itself was very good, as well. 

The reason for the two star rating is for the dilapidated condition of the restaurant. It has been quite a while since I have been in the store. Somebody else in the family has usually been the person picking up and bringing the food home. Tonight, my wife and I decided to have our ice cream in the store.

That was a mistake. The floor of the customer section was absolutely filthy and needs replacement.  The cushions and vinyl covering for the chairs were ripped and in terrible condition. The White painted frames for the chairs were filthy and grimy. Finally, the tabletops are well past the need for replacement.

This the sign of an owner that has no pride in ownership and fine with a sucky customer experience.

I have to wonder when the last time Dairy Queen came by to inspect this franchisee. We will continue to order for carry out, but I will not eat inside this store again.
What happened? New ownership? Filthy tables and disgusting floor and bathroom. Need to clean the place up, time for remodel and new fixtures. Very disappointed in our neighborhood ice cream store!

Ran into the store at 9:58pm (they close at 10pm), i asked "are you guys closed already?", this nice man said no and took my order. I got my favorite yummy vanilla cone, a cheap simple and delicious dessert for the night.

Ok will I risk being a little intolerant to dairy for a blizzard? Yes I will :) the service is young and friendly and they make a great blizzard. 
So good experience bad on my tummy but worth it :)
Great store....lots of local kids employed here. Good service.
First time trying a blizzard...and omg I loved it!!!! I had the banana cream pie blizzard....its so yummy...it was literally eating a pie lol...will come for more =)

Cool place to go for a good ice cream sundae. They have great, creamy ice cream and you can pretty much build your own sundae with all the different toppings they have available. This location is very well kept and has a big seating area, which makes it a good stop not only in the summer, but in the winter as well.

Their sushi is amazing! Variety of sushi rolls to choose from. Go on Wednesday nights and eat in the lounge to receive half off specialty maki rolls. 

I've tried a variety of appetizers and they have all have been excellent. I have yet to try something I didn't like.

2nd time to the wok n fire and it did not disappoint. Got a miso, calamari, and the trio chef plate where you can pick 3 of the specialty rolls and it was YuMtAsTiC! Servers are really nice and we're all over our table with anything we needed. 

The huge Buddha when you walk in is a little scary. I wonder if he got that big from eating sushi at wok n fire...

Awesome service

Sushi sampler - good for a split appetizer or single entree for lunch. Odd with the orange slice as garnish.

Miso soup - bit on the salty side

Seared tuna salad - salad greens are way over dressed, used red delicious, tuna a tad on the salty side but cooked perfectly when asked. A Fuji would really pair well with the flavors

Happy hour has awesome deals here, so I plan on coming back to check that out. The fish is pretty good quality-wise.

It's a bit on the Americanized, but food is good, drinks are good and it has a lounge vibe.

We ordered the crab rangoon appetizer. Tamago and the black Widow roll and Pad Thai with chicken. Everything was very good, the service was very quick and very knowledgeable on the menu. Very good food and very good portions would recommend this to anybody looking for Asian Cuisine.

My family loves going to wok n fire. The fish quality and cuts are actually really good here, despite how Americanized the place seems. I also like the loungey atmosphere and drink/happy hour specials. However, it would be nice if we didn't have to sit in the lounge just for happy hour deals.

At this particular visit, I ordered the crazy roll and inky roll. A glass of white Zinfandel went well with these rolls. Though there were lots of sauce on top of the rolls, they tasted excellent with the sauce wiped off from the top. The cuts of fish are pretty fat and fresh too. 

The service is always pretty good here too. Wok n fire will continue to be a go-to sushi place for our family in this area!

I love this place! Sushi is always delicious and their happy hour can't be beat! I have been to multiple locations and all of them keep me coming back. I won't get sushi anywhere else. You have to try the Las Vegas roll!
My fourth time here. Always came out with a big happy smile and full stomach. Awesome place and food. Great ambience. Tired the mochi icecream and loved it.

The place looks fancy and might be great for a date. Other than that, there was nothing special about the place. The service was ok. The food was ok--I had sushi sampler (I think) and a calamari appetizer and sake.  The sushi pieces were small--compare to other places but again it was a sampler dish. Price wise, I went during some kind of special so I paid half (I think) for some stuff. Otherwise, this place is on the bit expensive side. This could also be due to its location and demographic. Anyways, nothing to brag about. This place is just there.
Tuna poke, yummy.  Good rolls, noodle dishes and entres. 3 rd visit, best Asian food out here.

First off, I had high hopes for this place. It even looked pretty awesome with the nice decor. But, to my disappointment, it was meh. I picked this place because my boyfriend loves sushi, but I'm not a big fan; I went for the wok. The sushi he said was OK; nothing fantastic or anything to rave about. I had sesame crispy chicken and it was REALLY boring. It was not crispy in the slightest and the flavor was pretty bland. I have had better from a hole in the wall Chinese take out place for $6. It was literally chicken with some random celery shavings on top and white rice. The rice was not even sticky; chopsticks were absolutely useless. My meal was definitely no where near worth $15+. Also, the drink I ordered, one of their specialty martinis that was a twist on a lemon drop (my favorite), was pretty terrible as well. It tasted like nothing but vodka. I get that is the point of a martini, but at least a lemon drop has a flavor to it other then rubbing alcohol. It was extremely hard to finish. You may be wondering, "Why didn't you say something and get a new one or something else?". Well, I would have loved to, but we only saw our waiter maybe twice. He was running around to several tables and I never had a chance. I would have given this review 1 star, but considering my boyfriend was not completely dissatisfied, I gave it 2. In my opinion, Wok 'n Fire is overpriced and was not worth it. I will not be returning, sadly.

This place is going downhill and fast, everyone from the girls at the front desk to the management!! I would think twice before coming back in here to eat. Made a reservation for last weekend, but when we got there they could not find our name, not a problem that happens sometimes but we were told the wait would be a little while. We went to sit by the bar and have a drink. When we finally got our table though we asked to speak to a manager, she came by the table but was very rude and had an attitude that seemed like she did not care a mistake was even made. We were not asking for anything free or even being nasty we just wanted to make her aware of the situation so it did not happen to someone else!! Apparently they don't care if it happens again. This is enough to keep me from coming back. You are supposed to feel welcome in a restaurant not like you are a problem child!!

Prefect evening. We made a reservation with open table for 745 however we arrived around 715 hoping to get a seat early. The staff could see we were with our two-year-old son and even offered to bring him french fries and a drink while we were waiting because they understood what it's like to eat with the child. Dinner was amazing the roles were very fresh the sea food was amazing the service was great and the staff could not of been better. It was one of the best evenings we have had out as a family in a long time. I would go back and I would suggest this place

Wok 'n Fire
Sushi - Stir Fry - Bar
South Barrington, Il - 2/15/2016

Although slightly below the normal star rating which is my cut off for restaurants, this restaurant was highly recommended by friends so we decided to go. Initially I tried to book the reservation for 11 people however the cut off online for this evening was seven... When we arrived we were able to move to the bar area and put together three large tables to accommodate our group... Problem solved I thought.

I'm not quite sure this restaurant is able to accommodate large groups as it took forever for the food to come out, and when it did, some of our dishes were cold... Dishes that were supposed to be served hot...

I ordered my dish very light on the onions and scallions but it came out with the same amount as the another dish that wasn't ordered that way. The flavor was just OK and although our server offered to replace the meal with a hot one, I'm always leery about sending food back at a restaurant... Especially out of town restaurants where I've never eaten before...

I did enjoy the hot and sour soup. In the end the restaurant was nice enough to take my entre off the bill but I would've rather paid twice as much money for an enjoyable meal then get a not-so-good meal at no charge.  

It's quite possible that I caught them on a bad night... Perhaps you'll try it yourself and find that you like it... But for me I can cross it off my list as having been there, done that, no need to go back...

Currently my favorite sushi place in the area. Been here about 15 times and have mixed up my order every visit. Current obsession - crab dip. The "pita" chips it comes with are heaven. Love the Antipasto roll, chicken satay. Boyfriend says their draft system is one of the best the best he has ever had. Give this place a try! Amazing indoor ambience, outdoor seating, bar area.

I walked in and was impressed! The decor is great and gives a lively feeling. Our server was very kind and made his "best" recommendations. My favorite items were the chicken lettuce wraps and the Tom yum soup. Everything else went down hills. 
We ordered 4 sushi rolls, one wok dish and one noodle dish, and it's disappointing to say none were good. 
The sushi was not fresh, and rice was too sticky. The Noodle dish lacked flavor and the wok dish was so spicy you couldn't taste anything else. Major disappointment!
I came here hungry & looking for something different to experience. I got just that...from the ambiance to the people & the food. Lots of flavor to everything I tasted...drinks, entre, appetizers.
I love tuna salad and their appetizers. The sushi is good as well. Tuna poke is great!
Great crab Rangoon. Enjoyed sweet and spicy steak, very tender and tasty. Governor chicken was not to my taste, but there are many other menu items I would try. My wife enjoyed the sushi sampler.
Great food!  Had the Ginger wok plate!  Would come back again!  Service was good as well!
Very good sushi,  excellent service! I will definitely comeback.  Can't wait to try everything in the menu.

Great Service, Great Food.   We have eaten at this place about 10 times and it is always consistent food and service.   Great atmosphere in the lounge and more drink specials !  I love the Sweet and Spicy Crispy Chicken.   My wife's favorite is The Black Widow - Maki Roll - simply amazing meal!

My boyfriend and I went on a Thursday night for date night. The service was excellent. We were greeted right away and asked what we would like to drink. The wine came right away, along with the server asking if we wanted any appetizers. One server was training the other and both of them were very pleasant and lovely. The food came fairly quickly and the sushi was absolutely amazing. We had started with two soups and some edamame, which was very fresh. We had ordered several rolls, one of which was the Wok n Roll. It was absolutely amazing! Highly recommended. We also ordered the St. Charles roll, another favorite of ours. The atmosphere felt intimate and comfortable. My significant other and I will definitely go back!
Good cuisine, good atmosphere, music too loud, service good. All good, not great, and that's ok. Always good to know where good can be found.

I visited the South Barrington location of Wok 'n Fire on Friday night and have to say that I'm a little disappointed in a few things.  The food was good - we had the Crab Rangoons appetizer, the St Charles Roll, and the Inky Roll - and our waitress was really nice.  Some other aspects, however, I would change.  For one, I was FREEZING.  So much so that I had to leave my button-down, long winter coat on the entire time.  And it wasn't just me - at all the tables surrounding ours, patrons had their coats on too.  Our table was directly down from the entrance hallway and every time the door opened, a frigid gust of wind would hit our table.  Every time.  They tried to remedy this with a small space heater, but it didn't work.  It was really hard for me to enjoy my meal with my coat and scarf on.  

Wok 'n Fire also offered a few drink specials on Friday.  At first I ordered their white sangria, but, unfortunately, it just tasted like cheap wine.  I switched it out for a mango margarita that was better - but way too much sweet and sour mix.

Overall, I would love to return - I would just do it during the warmer months.

Dine in specials in the bar can't be beat. I'm not a sushi person but I actually enjoyed everything I tried. I loved the non traditional things too. Trying to be a bit more adventurous in my sushi eating and enjoyed everything. Can't wait to go back!!

Wok n Fire is probably my favorite restaurant ever! If you want amazing sushi, this is the place to go! They have a wide variety of traditional maki rolls and also specialty maki rolls, which are kinda pricey, but the sushi is phenomenal and super creative too. Most of the staff is very friendly and attentive, I've only had 2-3 bad servers, but out of dozens of times coming here, 2-3 is not bad at all. Not just the sushi is good though, the wok dishes and even the appetizers are some of the best meals that I've ever had. So whether your looking for a nice restaurant to eat at with your family, or a awesome lounge to get appetizers with some friends, Wok n Fire is the place to be!

In search of gluten free Asian food? Take a hard swerve south and go to the PF Changs in Woodfield Mall instead.

I found this place on the Find Me Gluten Free app and was psyched to see I had another option in the area. I mean, they even had fried rice! But I picked up food on a Saturday night and was super disappointed. The ginger chicken stir fry was alright but the fried rice was flavorless and gross; it didn't even taste like fried rice. I paid just as much as I would have at PF Changs, yet the variety of options was substantially less and the quality of the food was significantly lower. The decor seemed modern, but just stepping up to the hostess stand to get my takeout order I could barely hear anything over the music. Located in the Arboretum, it seemed like this place was trying to be cool and hip but with different food than the traditional American or Italian nearby. Identity crisis? Maybe. Because it sure wasn't Asian. 

Wok 'n Fire, I appreciate the effort, but let's have more follow through now please. Gluten free options are only great if they're edible. I would highly doubt the regular dishes as well given how simple the items were that I ordered, so just in general, steer clear.

I love this place! Sushi is great. Service is fast. Even the managers were walking around and helping out and making sure everyone was happy! You don't see that too often! Haven't tried any of the dishes we always get rolls and try different ones each time! Place is great!
We came here for our girls night out. Good food and good service. We enjoyed the food and drinks. The place is very nice and clean and love the ambiance.

Wow one martini and I feel fantastic. Either my tolerance has gone down sufficiently or their drinks are strong! Delicious drink. I had their lemonade martini with lemonade that they make there. It has an Asian sounding name but I don't remember it sorry. I also had a rainbow roll which was delicious and very filling

I liked the ambience of this place. The food was good for the most part, however, I felt like the variety of sushi wasn't great. 99% of the sushi special rolls have something fried in them, whether it be tempura, completely deep fried, or tempura flakes in them. I wanted to stay away from fried foods and the server said they only have 2 special rolls that don't have anything fried in or on them. Also, mostly everything has jalapeos too. If you're not a fan of spicy food, this may not be the place for you for sushi. It's too expensive for sushi that was mediocre, in my opinion. Also, the server I had came over WAY too often during the meal. He even came over to ask if we wanted anything wrapped up to take home before we finished eating. I might try this place again but not for the sushi.

Pretty cool on the inside in terms of dcor. 

Our waitress hurt her hand and our table was for unattended for a while but the comp us a lot of food. I hope see gets better. 

The food here is pretty good, spice level is good for those that like spicy.

This place makes my top 2 sushi spots! They have the 3 trio deal for sushi and the st.charles is a must! You can also ask for fresh wasabi which is really good too.  Joe was such a great waiter and we never had to flag anyone down. Very attentive waitstaff at this restaurant. The mango magaritas are delicious too and usually on special for $5.  They also offer groupons very often.  The location is great because there is souch to do after or before you eat her.

This review used to say nothing but wonderful things. The sushi is just ok now, before it was magical. Now its just blah.. Maybe the owner chef doesn't make food here anymore. The other main dishes they have are still ok, but again doesn't blow you away like it did for me when we first went last year. Everything is just blah now. Even the service. Servers used to be more personable here. Now they are rude. It was also weird when the hostess used to make us feel special, then she began to act rude. Now we never see her at all. No longer impressed with Wok N' Fire. Too expensive for the quality now, before it was just right... It's too bad because we used to really love this place and we were happy even tipping 30% or more sometimes because we liked it so much...... It's just too bad..
MY FAVORITE PLACE TO GET SUSHI - seriously! The food is amazing and the staff just takes the experience up a notch! By far, the best! :)

Consistently good food. Sushi items are the stars in this place. Wish they offered spicier sushi. 

Kids eat great here. Nice kids menu but also sharing a dish from the main menu works. 

Overall, great family place.

I was craving sushi, but my fiance is not a sushi fan.  After searching for a place near us online that would satisfy us both, we came across Wok 'n Fire.  I'm glad we did!

The service was great and both the sushi and stir fry were excellent!  My only complaint would be that it's a little on the pricey side, but you are eating quality food in a a very upscale area, so I think it's justified.  (3 sushi rolls + kung pow chicken + 2 beers + 2 mixed drinks = $82 + tip)

YAY! One of my newest favorite pan Asian restaurants. I've only tried a few of the items from here, but each of the items were a 5/5. The beef fried rice is excellent and very flavorful. I've also had the orange chicken which was crispy and delicious (definitely try it if you love orange chicken!) and the kung pao chicken, which was equally good. I've also tried the grilled wasabi salmon which I'd highly recommend. It was a thin filet cooked perfectly with a slightly crispy crust. It's accompanied with a small portion of lightly sauted garlic spinach. It's a perfect meal if you want to eat light and healthy. I've dined in twice and both times the food came out quickly and I was greeted by who I assumed to be the restaurant manager. I will be returning and recommending to friends!
Loved the vegas roll. The crispy crunchy not so great....mango cheesecake was good. And crab rangoon was very good too. Great date night place. Will be back.
My bf and I frequent here often. I love the Chicago roll! He loves the spicy ahi tuna. The sweet and sour chicken is also great.

If I would have written a review after my first experience here, I would have given Wok 'n Fire 4 stars.  This last visit left a bad taste in my mouth.  The waiter was pretty terrible.  We ordered drinks.  I ordered a Drunken Pomegranate Ginger Ale and it was pretty bad.  It was overly sweet and tasted flat.  When the waiter finally came back, I told him.  He offered to add soda water to give it carbonation, but I was afraid that would just make it taste watered down.  He then offered to make me a different, so I ordered a Dragon's Milk.  It was much better!

For appetizers, we ordered soups.  I enjoyed my Hot and Sour Soup.  I was disappointed in my boyfriend's Spinach Egg Drop Soup that for some reason has no spinach in it.  I asked the wiater about the missing spinach and he told me there is no spinach in Egg Drop Soup.  I then asked when it is called "SPINACH Egg Drop Soup" then.  That was our whole reason for trying it.  It sounded different.

Our noodle entree the first time was out of this world.  The Signature Sushi Roll we ordered was just okay.  The second time we returned, all the dishes were lacking.  I had to add the red chili paste to all the dishes and I never add spice to my dishes.  Even those that had the "spicy" sign next to them in the menu.  Everything was lacking in flavor this time around.  The Pad See Ewe was bland, so I added soy sauce.  The Curry Wok Dish was bland and definitely not spicy.  The Korean BBQ Dish was also bland.  It did not come with much meat and the chunks of meat were cut huge.  Too big to use with chopsticks.  I had to first cut the chunk into three pieces before they could be eaten with chopsticks.

I asked my waiter about a green bean dish, which was amazing our first time here.  It was our major factor in us returning.  He didn't know what we were talking about.  Finally we found "Wrinkled Green Beans" under sides.  They were okay this time, but not as amazing as I remembered them.

The service took forever and our waiter was missing most the time.  We kept having to ask bus boys and other wait staff when we wanted something, including the check.  Overall, our dinner service took about two hours (and 2 people were an hour late, so I was there 3 hours).

So why didn't I complain more when the manager stopped by?  We were celebrating my grandma's birthday and I didn't want to cause a scene.  Although, I did respond that the food was "okay..." instead of my usual "great" which I think should have tipped her off.  That is why I gave them two stars instead of one.  Well that and because no one got food poisoning and it is a cute atmosphere.  And the birthday banana fritters they give you were pretty good!

It is always disappointing when restaurants start out great and go downhill so quickly.

Been to Wok n Fire many times for Happy Hour. Really enjoy the Crab Rangoon and the Yakatori Beef. Don't bother with the Coconut Shrimp. ALL Coconut and barely any shrimp. It's too sweet and not worth the price at all. Don't miss the Mango Cheesecake...it is delicious! Service is hit or miss...this last time was a miss...but I'll go back. If you use a Groupon expect a little attitude.

This is my 3rd visit here to eat with my husband. This place has become one of our favorites. Below are my reviews on some recent dishes that we've tried: 

Spicy Shanghai noodles- The veggies are fresh, chicken is tender and it wasn't too spicy. I really like it but one thing they could do improve on is not to go overboard with the sauce. Overall, the dish was too saucy and it was overpowering the dish, all the noodles was drench in that stuff. My advice would be to go less on that since the whole dish since it was very well flavored. 

The Spicy Tuna- my favorite maki of the night with big chunk of fish and nice mayo saucing on top. 

The Fantasy- this roll is drier with no sauce so depends on your preference to sushi which one you will like. 

Lunch combo of these two maki are  $13. They also gave us one bowl of  complimentary hot and sour soup. The soup could be more sour. It was too sweet and salty and did not have enough eggs and ingredients. It didn't taste as authentic but it was free after all so we went with it. 

Over all, service is great here. They are very courteous and friendly, will check in often and refilled your glasses. I would recommend it here as a nice place for dinner for date night. There's low lighting with hanging paper lanterns that kind of create a romantic atmosphere (almost). Oh, and check on Groupon, they sometimes have deals here that you can buy. Last time I saw, there was a $15 for $30 deal.

Cool ambiance, but cramped dining area. I was counting how many times someone ran into our table with their hip (it was only twice)
-sushi was good but expensive
-alcoholic iced teas were yummy
-food overall was yummy
-service was great

if i do come back here, i'm coming back for their happy hour, 1/2 regular maki rolls

First time at Wok n Fire and we were very impressed. The service was very attentive and offered helpful suggestions. Food was delivered promptly and every dish was to our liking. 

We started with the lettuce chicken wrap appetizer. This was almost a meal in itself. Appropriate portions of chicken, fried rice noodles and julienned scallions and carrots allowed us to make 5 wraps. Yum!

I had the lunch sushi sampler. The miso soup was well balanced with tofu and seaweed. All elements of the sushi sampler were excellent: California roll, spicy tuna roll and nigiri: salmon, tuna, shrimp. All very fresh. 

My girlfriend had the orange chicken with brown rice. The chicken was moist and tender and fried to a sweet and mildly crunchy finish with a hint of spice and not too much orange. I would probably go with the white rice or veggie fried option instead of the brown rice. 

Overall,  a great experience. We will definitely go again.

Four stars instead of five due to the fact that it is a fast-casual chain restaurant.

Food is rally good here and the service is consistently well above average, even though our favorite waitress, Taylor, no longer works there.  :(

The best deals can be found going there for 'happy hour' - all their appetizers and traditional rolls are half off!
Love all the gluten free choices! I love the brown rice option too. Great happy hour prices - including several GF choices!

I am sad to give Wok N Fire three stars as they used to be by far my favorite restaurant in the area as I love sushi. I used to go at least once a week for lunch or dinner. However, over the last six months or so their quality overall had gone down significantly. The quality of their sushi, drinks, and service has declined to the point that I don't think I will visit again in the future. Also the last three times I have been the bar and the kitchen area you walk past to use the restrooms had an overpowering stench of bleach, not appetizing. I'm not sure if the company changed hands or what, but unless they realize they need to put more effort in like they did when they opened I don't know if they will last.

First off, there is an enormous Buddha statue as you enter the restaurant.  That warrants a star or 2 right there.

Secondly, the sushi is pretty good.  I like the Thai Kick and the Mexican rolls.  They use the ingredients that you would most likely associate with those respective cuisines.  It's not the best, and it's not the worst, but it gets the job done if you have a sushi craving and you're in the area.

Thirdly, the parking is horrible.  The whole parking lot for the Arboretum is horrible.  Whoever designed the parking lot there must have had quite the sense of humor.

I love coming to this asian fusion restaurant. The sushi is really good, and the rest of the menu (that I've tried) have all been consistently winners. I come here almost exclusively for the sushi though. This is also a very family-friendly spot, despite its more upscale ambience. I've also been very happy with the service here. I've been here dozens and dozens of time, and every single time my waiters or waitresses were very friendly, attentive, and super fast.
Honestly just average sushi to me.  Little too spicy on rolls but is very popular in the area.  Would visit if wanting sushi in the area and didn't want to wait for Cooperhawk

Prompt courteous service. Good foor. Reasonable price for thier luncheon menu. Both the wait staff and the manager checked on us to ensure quality.  Very good experience - would highly recomend this for lunch.

Yummmmm me and my friends come in about once a week. You cannot beat their lunch specials it real any of their specials! Every day at wok n fire is a good day. Defiantly check out their website and keep up with their specials. Very clean. Good service. The manager I think has black hair and she's amazing always checking on us and making sure everything is perfect. I would defiantly recommend this place. Things to know most sushi rolls are made with "crab mix" but for a small up charge you can get real crab.
We love this place! Very up to date and classy. Wish they had more seating or deals certain days. Overall great restraunt

Admittedly, I have never really been curious about this place or its offerings. Not sure why. Just never was on the short list of places but I am glad I did! 

My BF and I joined my friend and her husband for midweek dinner. Given the miles between the two of us, we chose this a the meetup spot. Before arriving, I decided to check out the website to have a general idea of what was in store. Lots of sushi along with noodles and rice dishes. I also noticed there were happy hour specials offered in the lounge/bar area. 

When we arrived, they were already seated in the lounge having drinks. Bingo! This opened up the opportunity for 50% maki rolls and $5 cocktails. Our waiter, Evan, was attentive and upbeat. 

Hamachi Roll - 4 stars 

Tequila Jalepeno Roll - 4.5 stars 

Inky Roll - 5 stars!! *** The star of the night. Sounds like way too much going on but it is amazing. 

Las Vegas Roll - 3.5 stars ** not as good as most LV rolls 

Wok Tossed dish/Steak Basil - 3 stars  ** rice, peppers and meat. Basic.  I was underwhelmed and would not order it again.

Wok n fire never fails on putting a smile on mine and my daughters face.   The menu has alot to offer maki  , noodles , amazing specials and cheerful employees who always make you feel at home. Miriam helps to nurture this amazingly cheerful environment which is reflected on how hard David their ninja like busser works and makes your experience seamless.  Justin has a great smile very friendly.

I love this place! The decor and interior is really good. The staff is friendly and gave good suggestion for which sushi to try. California rolls were so delicious. Mongolian beef was made just the way we liked. The service was great and we surely are coming here again.

Pretty good for asian food. Its hard to find good asian fusion only thing is its a little pricey for the servings you get. Has a great variety from sushi, rice dishes, noodles, beef chicken scallops tofu shrimp and cocktails

I went in here yesterday on a Monday for happy hour. Business was a little busier than I believe they had staffed for. I saw the manager Maria greeting some tables to help her bartender and cocktail server and even busing tables to help out her staff all around. Something that is much respected. I also had excellent service from Marissa the bartender. Who makes an incredible cocktail. I'll be back for the happy hour for sure. Insanely good value and service.

Second time going to a Wok n Fire. This one was defiently a lot better then the Addison location.

The drinks are intersting. I really enjoyed their homemade ginger ale + whiskey combos.

We had a few plates of sushi. All were good. The scorpion is the one that is a must have.

Their fried dumpplings are good too.

reasonable prices too.

The service with Andy was terrific.  We came for our anniversary and were pleasantly surprised with how the staff and management made our visit stand out.   The food was delicious and plentiful.  Thank you for a wonderful dinner.

Went for lunch and was not busy on a Monday. 

Tofu Pad Thai was too dry and not enough fish sauce. Chef needs to decide which version of Pad Thai to go with....either with a sticky fish sauce or a tomato base sauce.  Tofu pieces were the right size but not crispy enough. 

My coworker had the ahi tuna salad that had a store bought dressing.   The tuna looked good with seared edges.

Restaurant made ginger ale but needed more sharp ginger notes.

My husband and I try to make it here at least one Thursday evening a month for their happy hour!  1/2 off sushi & appetizers are awesome, and a steal for the level of quality you get here.  

Tip: sit at the bar, better service, better experience.

Great menu with decent wine list and fresh sushi. Enjoy our time when we are there. There is a diverse group of customers so you have families with small kids, couples, girls night out groups, etc.  There's also a mix of non Asians and Asians so you know they cater to everyone. 

Liked that Mondays are half price wine by the bottle.
Overpriced and average sushi, friendly staff but nothing that will make you keep coming back.

Excellent  service and excellent  food! Thai curry noodle dish was excellent! ! The Mai thai was simply perfect in all the right ways! We had the chicken satays, enough for two to share. This place is an absolute  must  when in the Hoffman Estates / South Barrington  area. PS they have a gluten free  menu too!!
Just enjoyed egg roll appetizer and many glasses of cold iced tea; just wonderful! Our server, Jessica, outstanding! The veggies: fresh, crisp, humm good!!!!

We came here with my family for my birthday and really enjoyed ourselves. Everyone's food tasted great and the service was good too. I appreciated that it was child friendly. In fact, my 4 year old wasn't interested in any of the menu items even though he loves Asian cuisine... The manager heard him saying this and had the chef make him a grilled cheese! We'll be coming here again.

Not too shabby.

I came here with a couple of work buddies for food and gossip.  Being a trendy Asian-inspired restaurant in South Barrington, I expected some high prices.  I wasn't starving, but wanted a nibble.  So I ordered a $7 shrimp tempura roll.  The roll was decent, but it was far from the best that I've had.  It was smaller than the rolls that I'm used to, especially for $7.  And the rice was not wrapped tightly.  It was just okay.

In the end, I enjoyed the company of my friends more than the food.  The atmosphere is gorgeous, though.  Lots of twinkling paper lanterns on the ceiling, and a cool dragon bas-relief on the wall.  I'd probably come here again for company and drinks, but not for a significant meal.

We decided to come here for my Aunt's birthday after finding out there was a 2 hour wait at Cooper's Hawk (my family usually goes there for lunch on weekends, so we had no idea it would be that busy on a weekday, but it is the last week of the year..) Any way, parking spaces around the restaurant were very limited so we parked far. There was no wait so we were seated right away, but it took about 5-7 minutes before our server stopped by our table and said "sorry, I'll be right with you." She wasn't as attentive as you would like your server to be throughout our stay. We told her we would be ordering an entre to go and she said "tell me later, it will take about 5-7 minutes to prepare..." She wasn't even attentive with filling our glasses of water.

Then, I think he was a manager? Evan? He attended to our table a lot due to the matter that I had an allergy to seafood. Jodie, our server, said she would check out the ingredients in our appetizers and entres, but nothing appeared out of the blue.. until 30 minutes after we ordered and Evan came back and told me that there was fish sauce already mixed into my mango sauce in my entre. He did discount my entre. But we waited another 15 minutes for our entres to come. The food looked amazing in color and smelled great. It was all delicious, but the time it took, when the restaurant was not packed was apparently not worth it. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is modern and I love the hanging lanterns, but it's super cold in the building! Every time someone opens the door, a huge gush of cold air flows in and even if there door isn't open, there is a breeze!


Not sure if I will be recommending nor coming back any time soon. Very displeased this time around.

Was taken to dinner here so it would not have been cool to complain, BUT not sure that I would return.  The waiter had about as much personality as my glass of water!  I asked for recommendations and he said "um don't know" and then pointed to a few items.  The menu said "get ready for a kick" stating that marked items were spicy. NOT.

Food took forever, spinach egg drop soup did not have any spinach.  Dishes were warm not hot when they arrived.  Meh

We went here at the spur of the moment when another restaurant was booked for hours.  Wok n Fire got us a table right away.  Everyone was great from the hostess to our waiter to the manager Brian who stopped by to visit.  The crispy calamari was the best we ever had due to the wonderful sauce.  My wife had a stir fry dish with shrimp and I had a Szechwan spicy dish with scallops.  Both were fabulous. We will return here again soon.  Looking forward to it.  Don't miss it.

We had dinner w/ a friend here and enjoyed the meal.

We all basically had sushi and were pleased at the quality and flavor. They do it right here. The stirfry, although we didn't have it, looked/sounded delicious as well.

The staff was very friendly and super accommodating to my friend who has food allergies and also spot-on with drinks and water refills.

The restaurant itself is very well done. Great location and the decor is really cool and "authentic."

I can't wait to come back here and have dinner again.

The Arboretum has another great dining option... and I cannot wait to go back.  A group of us girls came here for some Sushi and Drinks and we were all more than pleased.  Ambiance is really neat and pretty... low lighting, tons of Chinese lanterns on the ceiling.  The place isn't overly huge either, but they definitely laid out the room well to get as many people in there as possible without overcrowding the place.

Waiter was attentive and had fun joking around with us when it came to shots (I was being a baby).  He also offered separate checks from the beginning which is super nice cause I hate to ask.

Food was GREAT, as well as the drinks.  Typical sushi prices.. My Spicy Crunch Roll had about 10 pieces for $13.00 and they were the BIG pieces so I left pretty full.  My miso soup ran around $3.95 and it was a really big cup and had plenty of tofu in it, they do not skimp on that at all.  He also asked us what kind of soy sauce we prefer, less sodium or regular.  

We never had to wait long for refills, food, etc.  It was an all-around great experience.

Side note for Yelp though... this is definitely not located in Schaumburg, it is South Barrington.  I have no idea why its listed in the Burg....

This place is delicious. I think it is a little bit expensive, but if you go on Wednesdays and sit in the bar they have ladies night. If you go during ladies night the sushi is half off and martinis are five dollars

This is a great place and I have been here multiple times with family. Sorta looks like a typical PF Changs but I like the friendly service and great menu selections. Prices are reasonable too. Definitely one of my best pics in the South Barrington area for dinner. If you are visiting South Barrington's Arboretum this place is definitely worth checking out.

Went here for our anniversary dinner. The place was pretty empty for a Friday night at 8pm, but maybe everyone was at that i-pik theater or something? Either way, we were sat right away and had a nice waiter. He was pretty knowledgeable of the menu, we'd never been here before. We ended up getting a gyoza/fried dumpling appetizer, it was good but only five pieces? I think six would be better for people to share but oh well. I ended up getting the chicken teriyaki with fried rice, boyfriend has the Korean BBQ with the kimichi rice, and I also got a crunchy roll thing for us to share. The best was the sushi roll, it was some kind of crab salad, avocado, and cream cheese and some shrimp. It did have a weird all mushy consistency, but taste wise it was good. Would def get again. BF said the Korean BBQ was good, and I liked the teriyaki sauce and the chicken was good. BUT the fried rice...meh far from fried rice. Tasted more like weakly browned rice. Would NOT pay again for the up charge to get the fried rice. And it was a measly little scoop. We also shared the ginger apple crisp thing with ice cream. DEF big enough to share. It was pretty good. All in all, the total was around 80 bucks, and 100 with tip. I think I would pass next time, the sushi was good but totally not a good value for the cost. The other food I could get at a Korean BBQ place or Chinese food restaurant and be more satisfied. Quality vs quantity and I'd give this place a solid 2/5.

I was recently at this establishment with my father and even though I must say I really enjoyed the food, i was grossed out at what seemed like a manager walking around with open toed sandals. I don't think this sanitary nor professional. I literally lost my apatite when seen I saw that. It seemed like a place that would have had higher standards.
The food and service is very decent, food came out in a decent time. The management came out, greeted and made sure we're happy with the meal.
Excellent. Food, dcor, staff, and overall experience. I had the beef skewers and the Addison roll for lunch very good.
The Lar Nar with Tofu is delicious.  Also the salmon dinner is excellent.

Went today for the happy hour with a party of 6, was told if we wanted to sit together it would be 30 minute wait, that's fine,  bar was half full. Outside was wide open, but they said they would not honor the happy hour specials.  We said they honored last year , but she would not now. So we left amd spent our 200 dollars at georgois. Great service.

We had the Malaysian Mai Tai, Unagi Nigiri, Bangkok Chicken fried rice and Red Spider sushi roll. All of these were really good. Service was really good too and so were the food portions. Would recommend this place to anyone.

What an improvement over Nozumi! Such a nice, upscale-looking place that isn't snotty and actually has the food to back up the attitude. I went and got carry-out the other night because I was craving sushi and it is the closest to my home (hooray!) I ordered the Yum Yun roll, and two others, I can't remember :(. They were very good! I walked in and ordered with one of the nice hostesses up front and they both spoke to me while I was waiting for my food, which was nice. They offered me water and a seat if I needed it, excellent customer service! Please keep these two young ladies on staff (I don't remember their names, I'm sorry, but they were so nice!) I will keep coming back! I have eaten before on the patio outside and it was lovely!

Love it here!  Great quality sushi rolls at a reasonable price.   Wednesdays from 4-9pm is 50% off specialty rolls...which is truly a fantastic deal.  It's really nice inside. The service is really good.  All the staff have been super helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.  It's super clean inside.  Highly recommended.

Been here many times and the food is EXCELLENT!  Great service and drinks.   THE BEST HAPPY HOUR EVER.  I have never been disappointed and always leave her thinking why don't I come there every day.  As good if not better than Big Bowl and much closer.

Atmosphere is really nice.  Kid friendly.  There is a bad body odor smell throughout parts of the restaurant.  The bathrooms also have a funky smell.  
We ordered sushi off the specials menu and the regular menu.  The sushi was good.  The service was good.

Went to Wok 'n Fire with some co-workers for lunch.  Walking into the restaurant was pretty cool, there were lots of decorative statues and other elements in the restaurant.  In the main dining area there are a bunch of small lanterns that sway as the air moves.  The ambiance for this place is very nice.

We were seated quickly and the waitress was nice.  Ordered Szechuan Tilapia and a Salmon Maki.  Szechuan Tilapia came with large sides as well and was very filling.  However I felt that the flavors of the food was very Americanized.  The garlic spinach was good, however the Tilapia tasted like they just put teriyaki sauce on it and called it a day. 

The Salmon make had extremely thin cuts of fish. I've been to many other sushi places before and never had a cut of fish this thin.  The avocado in the roll was not good. 

If you are looking to satisfy your cravings for sushi or authentic Chinese food I would go elsewhere.

Very good sushi. Got the Inky, Papa's Choice, and one other. Everything was fresh and ready to go, and the presentation was spectacular. Wish I had gotten a picture.

Inky is definitely the best! Would return!!

Superb sushi and cocktails up in this joint! I went with the family and we enjoyed a number of their options. We got 3 rolls, 4 cocktails, and 1 entree. The Specialty Maki Trio was a great deal. You get 3 rolls of your choice at a pretty good discount. We got the inky, rainbow, and tunagi rolls, all of which were very tasty and looked beautiful. Their cocktails were large and strong, and overall the prices on everything were very fair. Dessert was also a winner with the apple crisp and chocolate cake. The staff was extremely attentive as well.

I eat here 2 days a week for lunch. Service, food presentation and quality are spot-on. 

This is the BEST of the 3 locations and their take on fusion sushi is outstanding. 

Can't wait to have an opportunity to have dinner here.

Loved this place the moment it opened. The food is incredible. Environment is sweet. But on more recent visits it just keeps going downhill. 

There was that time where 3 of us were unknowingly served their "drunken" ginger ales. I'm not sure what was worse... Being served them, being charged $7 apiece for them, no apology for the miscue on the server's part, or the fact that we were each given a refill (make that 2 drunken ginger ales apiece) and none of us felt anything from said alcohol. 

And then there is the music. Oh, the music. Last two times in here there has been this atrocious 80s music playing. Loudly. Sounds like the Time Life CDs you buy on TV when you have insomnia. Doesn't fit the vibe of the place at all and makes it really challenging to carry on a serious conversation with a colleague. 

My trips have always been at lunchtime. Perhaps dinner is better. I'm not sure I'll find out.
Great food great service!  I have been here several times and the sushi maki trio is Delish!  The sushi is outstanding!  I love this place.

If your into all types of Asian food then this place is a must. Great service and even better food. A wide variation of food and drinks. On top of all the great food/drinks is an well designed interior.

My wife and I decided to try this place out after a recommendation from a friend. This was our first dinner out that my wife could enjoy an adult beverage (just had our second daughter), so we were pretty excited.  We are avid sushi lovers and have tried many places in the area. 

First, let me state that the decor in this place is pretty awesome. I like how the bar/dining area is separated by a big abacus...pretty creative design move.  The huge Buddha when you walk in is pretty impressive as is the gold dragon in the dining area.

We started off with two saki bombs, which took us by surprise as we're used to cold saki....they use warm.  Different but good!  I tried a bottle of their pear infused saki, which was pretty decent, while my wife had a beer.  For apps, we went with what I would call tuna nachos....good stuff.  We also tried the calamari which was crisp, but the sauce it came with tasted more like ketchup with a little bit of spice, rather than a legit cocktail sauce. Still decent nonetheless.  We then order the 10pc sashimi, red spider and a spicy tuna roll. They were good...not bad, but not really memorable. Just standard rolls, but seemed to be smaller than our regular sushi place. We felt the presentation was pretty substandard and the cuts of sashimi to be a tad conservative with prices how they are. However, it was very fresh. Since we were still hungry, we ordered two bowls of miso and a yum yun roll.   Miso was ok...lots of tofu which I like, but it seemed to be only warm, not really hot which would have been nice.
