The yum yun roll was very tasty...definitely my favorite roll.  We didn't stay for dessert, so I can't comment on that. 

So why 3 stars?  While the food was good, and the ambiance was pretty awesome, we felt the overall experience for the price didn't line up. Our bill after tip was $150, for what I felt should have been a $100 meal. We weren't "wowed" by the food though it was enjoyable. Would I recommend this place.....maybe, but we likely won't be coming back.

This deli has very good sandwiches. The employees are nice, the food is good, and it is an authentic Polish deli. I would definitely go back a second time and would recommend it if you are in the mood for a sandwich.

I love coming here for cheap deli meats and sausage.  Their beef Tatar is pretty legit as well. Raw meat and I've never gotten sick.. So it must be good.


But, this place is tiny. If more than two people are in there it becomes crowded and almost chaotic.  Maybe it is just me as I enjoy my personal space   

My husband adores their soups too. I've never had it as I don't think they're gluten free.

This store is way too small for what is offered and the amount of patrons they have. I have a little Polish in my heritage, but am not fluent in the language, so I find myself guessing at some of the food offerings. Most are delicious, from take home soups; to prepared salads; to the deli meats. They are probably known for the hot food they serve during certain hours.
They need to replace styrofoam containers with plastic that seals since so many food offerings have sauces and no matter how careful I drive home, inevitably there is leaking if not spillage. It would also be nice if they would translate food labeling into English.

As you enter AJB you immediately notice 2 small shopping isles. The fact is, that's one too many for a store slightly larger than a box of wooden matches.

However this match box packs a powerful punch concentrating on homemade soups, a variety of handmade kielbasa and a carry out hot lunch counter. This is not your everyday lunchtime destination...tender baked chicken, kielbasa swimming in a savory kapusta, hand made cabbage rolls, breaded pork chops, crusty on the outside/tender on the inside potato pancakes, cheese and fruit blintzes...I can go on.

AJB needs to get rid of the small grocery isle of canned goods and such and open up the floor plan to accommodate what customers really want, homemade polish food, a focus on specialty deli items and some breathing room to enjoy it! A few small tables to eat your lunch would be a welcome addition to the atmosphere.

As is, the footprint of AJB is a tight fit for customers.The cashier area is tell tale...2 is company, 3 is a crowd!

Amazing I'm addicted everything is just perfect there!!!!from the hot lunches to the deli I couldn't ask for anything better. Prices very fair and easier to get in and out than any major supermarket. I am here almost once a week wether  it be for the soup the hot lunch or the plenty full d3li meats. A great little polish deli!!!!

Shopped here regularly for authentic polish foods and meats. They have a hot buffet which is a nice addition for lunch. Great home made sausage's, hams, pierogi's and other Polish delicacies. Very decent prices.

Since this is the only Polish market I've ever gone to I'll stick with 4 stars - but I love this place!  We come here regularly to stock up on some gosh darned good stuff!

It's tiny, but jam packed with all kinds of goodies.  They make their own pierogies & you can buy them frozen (they have potato, potato & cheese, potato & bacon, meat, mushroom, sauerkraut, blueberry & strawberry - I can't remember if the fruit ones come with cheese, but I think they do) - we've tried them all and love 'em!  The fruit pierogies are great for breakfast.  There's many homemade soups packaged to go, red cabbage, sauerkraut, etc...They also have all kinds of desserts, both in the refrigerated section & with the bakery items.  Yes, the canned goods may have a bit of dust on them, but they aren't expired or anything. ;-)  Plus there are teas, candies, Polish greeting cards & even some beauty & pharmacy items.

Last, but not least, is the meat counter.  I think they have 6 kinds of kielbasa alone!  Plus a variety of other meats.  We recently purchased 4 huge Country Kielbasa links (each about 15" long and at least 1.5" in diameter) for $12.81!  And they are sooooo good!

Any staff working there speak both Polish & English so don't be afraid to ask questions - they are all very helpful & knowledgeable.  Oh, and the last time we were there I saw their sign that they offer a "Hot Lunch" to go...can't wait to try that!
Great service! Found fish there I can't find at the big chain stores! Prices are good.

AJB Polish Deli is one of the best kept secrets when it comes to lunch in Bartlett!

If you have already tried and grown tired of everything else in the area for lunch, you should definitely try AJB's authentic Polish hot lunch for carry out. You basically assemble your lunch (i.e., cafeteria style) from the daily offerings and pay by weight, and the result is always a high quality, affordable lunch that tastes like it could have been served in an expensive European restaurant.

If you are interested in preparing your own lunches at home, then AJB is also a fantastic place for fresh bread and deli meats and cheeses.

Best place to get kielbasa in Bartlett! They have several varieties and it is authentic. My Polish father-in-law makes great homemade kielbasa and when he cannot keep me supplied, I go to AJB.

My review is based solely on this fact as I have never purchased anything else.
Great to have a place like this in Bartlett, wonderful family run place with an amazing selection of frozen pierogies. Go pick up a couple of dozen right now!

Very friendly staff and great selection of bread, cheeses, Polish products, and a variety of meat products.  Their "hot lunch" which consists of various meats, kapusta (Polish dish, similar to sauerkraut), potatoes and other dishes which vary day to day.  It is a great deal and a perfect meal when on the go or if you don't feel like cooking.  Their selection of Polish products is average since the store has limited floor space but most anything you need is available!
The kielbasa and pierogi are amazingly good and reasonably priced.  And bonus, the employees aren't hard on the eyes!

10/10 Absolutely impressed! 

Every time I order I usually have it delivered service since sometimes not in the mood to cook when I come from work plus school or I pick it up. Perfectly fresh vegetables every time and along with the other dinner dishes.

First time, ordered online, Kung Pao chicken lunch special.

Did not get the can of pop that's advertised. Man at the register seemed more interested in what was on his iPhone at the time then assisting me with my order.

The fried rice was disappointing: Lots of rice with a few drops of soy sauce and a half teaspoon of green onions and half a dozen bean sprouts. Slightly chewy, maybe undercooked.

The Kung Pao chicken was also disappointing. While there was a good mix of chicken and vegetables, and the chicken was not overcooked, the sauce was very lacking and not spicy. It really just tasted like it was stir-fried in soy sauce and very little else. There wasn't any sauce to speak of. Two dried chili peppers looked out of place as the entire dish did not have any heat whatsoever.

The egg roll was pretty good. Pork, shrimp and vegetables, no overpowering spice, and not greasy. Only reason this review has two stars instead of one.

Not sure I'll try again.

You know I frequent this place at least once a week, twice they have forgotten by egg roll in the same week!

The fried rice is not fried rice it's rice, soy sauce and bean sprouts. That's it it no egg no protein no and no veggies. Disgustingly boring. 

The hot sauce is all oil and is NOT spicy!
This is probably my new favorite "affordable" Chinese.  Love the Kung Pao Chicken.  Love it.

While the prices and portions are very much on the plus side I was very disappointed in the sweet and sour park, the sauce was so thin it did not stick to my meat. The General Tsos is mediocre but not anything worth having again. The egg roll included in the dinner special includes shrimp but tasted great ...just a heads up for those who cannot eat shellfish that one will be a surprise.

I was craving some take out Chinese and racked my brain with nearby places, preferably one I had yet to try.  I remembered reading Chopstix was a favorite for some in the area, so I drove over to give it a shot.

I walked in to what seemed to be an argument, yet I continued in to browse the menu.  They had many dishes to choose from and it appeared lunch dishes were a great deal.  I noticed a section of steamed options, with sauces on side, for healthy alternative, which was nice to see.  I ended up ordering enough for a small family and was out the door, food in hand, fairly quickly.

Once home, I dug right in.  To my dismay, I was searching flavor in each dish.  Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed.  I'd say all the proteins themselves were fine, but the flavors of everything were simply lacking for me.  The Ma Po Tofu was in a spicy, yet overly soupy, red sauce with peppers and chunks of pork, rather than a grounded pork.  Probably the worst I've had.  The best of the three entree dishes I ordered was the Scallops and Garlic Sauce.  For the appetizers, the steamed potstickers were tasty enough.

Maybe I'll try some different dishes in the future, in hopes that I just ordered the wrong things, but I won't be running back any time soon to do so.  Not because I don't run, which is true, but because nothing was worth going back for seconds.

Okay, so I tried Chopstick as a later-evening dinner with my friends.  I ordered the classic General Tso's chicken while my friends got the Mongolian Three Delight and Lucky 7.  The General Tso's could have been good, the sauce was really nice, but the chicken was really overcooked and almost jerky-like.  

It's hard to describe what this is like, unless you've kept Chinese delivery in your fridge uncovered for a few days and re-heated it in the microwave.  That is what this chicken was like.  It was tough, stringy, and half of it was really inedible.  My friends enjoyed their meals (that's why the get the 2 stars), but they had to eat around the shrimp (also heavily over cooked).

I've had much better chinese in the AH area, I'd suggest Canton House if you want delivery, I've found their food is better prepared and cheaper, while their delivery is free (compared to a $3 fee here).

TL;DR Bad chicken, bad shrimp, over-priced.  You can do better.

Just moved to town so we are trying out the local Chinese food.

I ordered a whole bunch of stuff for 4 of us and they said it would be ready in 10-15 minutes, score, so fast. We did pick up and had to wait a few minutes when we got there. No problem. We were given all our food in a box for easy carrying since there was a lot.

-Orange Chicken- Was great, prob the best I have ever had

-General Tso Chicken- So I thought it was just ok as did my husband, my 2 friends said it was really good. I ended up eating the leftovers and they were not good,  I had to throw them away.

-Sesame Chicken- This was really good, one of the best I have had very succulent chicken 

-Honey pecan shrimp chicken(not positive that name is right)- I didn't try this but my friend got it and really liked it. It looked weird, like a bed of chicken with mashed potatoes on top(there weren't potatoes on it just looked like it) 

-Fried Rice- I got plain fried rice and it was pretty good, I would def get it again

-Egg Rolls- Super good, I was only sad that they didn't pack enough sweet and sour for our big order 

-Crab Rangoon- I didn't try any cause of the sweet and sour shortage but the friends seemed to like it. 

-Egg Drop Soup-Super good, on par with any other good egg drop soup I have had at other places

Overall, very good. I will be going back! :) 
 
All of that food was $47 btw

Great food this evening! 
Holidays can be rough at any business and ordering with in 30 minutes of closing time makes it even riskier but our order was perfect.  Egg food young was light and fluffy not the greasy heavy blobs you get elsewhere.  The Mongolian beef ordered extra spicy was great and the human chicken had perfectly cooked veggies.  Thanks for being there on labor day.

For fast food Chinese this place was great. The wait was short, food was hot, and the portions were huge. It was impossible to eat the entire lunch portion. I think we would have been able to split an order, but that's us. We love good food, but hate to feel too full.  
I thought it was a little heavy on the salt but my wife LOVED that.

This is a small place, just west of Northwest Community Hospital. They have 6 tables inside if you want to eat there, it is casual and peaceful. If you know what you like, tell them, they will make your dish exactly like you want. I am not partial to white rice, so now they serve brown rice. I don't like greasy pan fried noodles, so now they serve rice noodles on the side steamed. If you like seafood, try the Happy Family Seafood dish. Tell them easy on the broccoli and tell them what you like. The owners are always working hard to make your experience delightful.
Great Chinese food. It's fast, fresh and reasonably priced. The portion sizes are huge. I would highly recommend the cashew chicken.

some of the worst Chinese Food I've had.

The chicken in the General Tso Chicken was SO over fried and tasted like it had been sitting out all day. The Springrolls were greasy, and the food just was not good for spending over $20 - I would have been better off with a $5 Hot-n-Ready from Little Cesars.
Great food Great staff   We often sleep outside in front of the place to be first in line

Probably the best Mongolian Beef I've ever had. Great with fried rice and the shrimp eggroll. Great lunch special for $6 bucks. No corners cut, fresh ingredients and just the right touch of fire on the spice. The crew is very nice and friendly, free Wi-Fi and very clean establishment.

Good quality meats and veggies! I was pretty surprised a small joint like this was able to present well cooked foods that aren't overly greasy and gross and heavy! I'm always seeking places that are clean too, while always trying to be healthy. Also, they give pretty ample portions! I'm kinda sad I never checked this place out sooner. Will definitely be ordering from here more often.
Got a lunch carryout.  Chicken Lo Mein and it was enormous.  Tastes pretty good.  Will go back and try other dishes.
Very good and super reasonable.  Every time my sister is in town visiting, she insists on getting take out. The employees are very friendly as well.
We ordered here in a pinch. Our usual place was closed and don't think we would do it again. Meager portions for a takeout Chinese place. Eh

Just tried this place for the first time, and it has to be about the best we have had in the area. Everything was delicious.  We especially liked the egg rolls.  Good fresh ingredients in all the food ordered.  Very reasonably priced and good sized portions.  We will be back soon!

This place is a bargain! Very reasonably priced!  There are typically great coupons in the menu. 

This place has exceptionally fast service. I have never had to wait more than 15 minutes for anything (typically only about 10 minutes after placing an order). 

They gave me a free coke today for no reason! They are super nice here!

I love this place!

The best Chinese food that I have found here in the northwest burbs. The food was fresh and very tasty! The portion size for the price is a fantastic deal! This is the go to place for Chinese good..you can't go wrong with these guys!!!

One of the better take out in the area.  We used to go to south China on AH road next to the weird grill and outdoor patio place but chopsticks is better.  Possible ownership change in past couple of months but food is still good.  Egg rolls are actual egg rolls not spring rolls.  Good portions and tastes good.

Really wanted to like this place but the food was not really good and didn't seem fresh or very high quality at all .... The service was excellent and very friendly though ... Everything seemed old and just warmed up and not made to order , found bits of branches or something in my general tso chicken .... My wife's food was cold and not very flavorful at all

When I saw this place was going to open in town, my first thing was great, another Asian restaurant, just what we need in Arlington Heights.  
Well my boys wanted food from a place two doors down yesterday and I stopped in here for some vegetable fried rice.  A solid fried rice with really fresh ingredients and not buried in soy sauce.  

Today the family decided to get take-out from Chopstix and it was mixed reviews, though all positive.  We ordered egg drop soup, hot and sour soup, steamed pot stickers, beef and broccoli, and sweet and sour chicken.  

I don't eat sweet and sour chicken, though the family really liked it.  The boys and I really liked the beef an broccoli, though my wife didn't care for the beef so much.  Again nice fresh broccoli in the dish, really nice.  The steamed pot stickers are the best we have gotten from any Asian restaurant in the area. The sauce they served with it had fresh garlic in it, nice flavor.  

I had the hot and sour soup, it was okay.  Again fresh ingredients, but it was over thickened (imo) which gave it to much of a gelatin texture, I think the egg drop may have been the same from what I could see.  The boys enjoyed that and said they liked it.  

All and all a good dinner, we surely will be back and I have already told some people at work about it.  It will be interesting on how the food matures as the business grows.  I hope they keep up the good work.

Fantastic! My new favourite go too!!!...first time I ordered so I tried several entrees and apps; all were well done butt the shrimp was exceptional and they offered a complimentary vegetable fried rice that was well seasoned with loads of veggies, best I've had in a long time. Also, the gal who took my phone order was a hoot!

We decided to give Chopstix a try and were highly impressed.  Best service we've ever had for take out, anywhere.  Chopstix was superior today and with very reasonable prices.  Excellent, friendly service which made me feel extremely welcome and that they really appreciated my business. 

I haven't had Egg Foo Young in years and it was delicious.

My wife enjoyed the Pad Thai and their shrimp egg rolls were fantastic!

When I ordered egg rolls they volunteered that there are 2 in our lunch special and did I think that would be enough - that was perfect. Most places would rather take the extra revenue but I love that Chopstix would much rather have my repeat business!  They also surprised me by saying they owed me a couple sodas with the lunch special...  I hadn't noticed that on the take out menu but it sure was appreciated when offered.  The little things in life really do matter.

My favorite sales and service training guru, Jeffrey Gitomer has the best phrase for Chopstix:  "People hate to be sold, but they love to buy!"  I can't wait to go back. 

On an NPS scale of 0 to 10, Chopstix gets a very enthusiastic 10!!

This place is FANTASTIC. Now only is the place extremely clean, the staff is extremely friend. They have a great reasonably priced menu. I love the lunch special and that you can get that for dinner for $2 more. The entire menu is delicious and amazing, I cannot say enough good things. I will continue to have my family and neighbors order from you. Keep the great food coming!
Not bad! Very friendly employees. Food is kind of typical, but I'd say they're a little better than the average take-out place.
Food at this place is excellent. Crab Rangoon one of the best and HUGE!! Portion sizes are very large and for the price it's well worth it. Great carry out Chinese for a quick meal.

Everything was oddly sweet...it was gross. I could have dealt with that though. The breaking point for me was when I tried my vegetarian wontons....there were no vegetables in them.  Nothing. It was just a crispy hallow shell. So upset. I'll stick to China 1.
Great food and really nice customer service. This was our first time ordering and definitely not last! They said 30min for delivery and came a lot sooner than expected, yet the food was fresh!

It is rare to find a Chinese restaurant that does not saturate the food in MSG.  I was happy to discover that they do not cook with it at all.  The service on the phone was friendly, they delivered our order fast and hot and the food was really yummy.  I like flavorful food rather than bland and mild.  The Kung Pao was spicy with a good variety of crunchy and fresh vegetables.  The Mongolian Beef was a great mix of sweet and mildly spicy.  I also enjoyed the potstickers and fried rice.  We will be ordering again.

Saw this place driving by and then got an ad in the paper. We ordered a variety of dinners. Prices are reasonable, but the flavor was ehh. Nothing we had was amazing, but nothing was disgusting. Well.. The egg rolls were a little odd tasting and basically all cabbage. The most disappointing meal we had from here was the orange beef. It had such a strong citrus flavor that it overpowered the dish. I can't say i'd recommend it to anyone, but I also couldn't give it less than 2 stars because some stuff was good. 

Best dishes: General Tso's and Mongolian beef
Worst dishes: orange chicken and egg foo young.

I've tried 9 of the 28 lunch specials. All were excellent except their General Tso's Chicken. It was good but not great.  My favorites so far are the Vegetable Lo Mein and Pad Thai. Portions are huge, generally ready in 10-15 minutes, super friendly, and convenient.
Excellent food the lunch specials are the best deal and the crab Rangoon are so good. The staff is very friendly and the place is clean. Mostly carry out but they do have some tables to eat in.
Pretty tasty Chinese food, very fast service, clean restaurant, nice people, and low prices.

I ordered here for the first time. Liked that they offer many selections in half portion size. The sweet and sour chicken was lacking vegetables in the sauce and only had 5 pieces of pineapple. The sauce was bland and the chicken was not crispy. The egg roll filling was under seasoned. The cashew chicken had a good variety of vegetables and a tasty sauce I wish there was more cashews to balance the dish. The chicken fried rice lacked flavor and a variety of vegetables.

I would give this place 5 stars for their crab rangoon. But I have to take 1 away for the Mongolian beef because the beef was not as tender as some other places. 

The fried rice was greasy but that's fine. It is expected of Chinese fried rice to be greasy. Kids really love it. Could you a little more soy sauce but that's ok. 

The Kung Pao chicken was really good. Very flavorful and the meat was nice and tender. 

The bbq pork was delicious. It reminded me of a Thai bbq pork with rice and red sauce dish. One complaint, leave out the lettuce. The smell of wet soggy lettuce is not that great.

Staff are great. I didn't have to repeat myself gazillion times like some other chinese restaurant. Quick delivery and friendly delivery person. They said half an hour to 40 minutes but they arrived at my house in 15 minutes. Granted I live 2 blocks from them but I was still impress.

For the price that I paid and the amount of food that I get, I will definitely go back.
Recently ordered the shrimp egg foo young lunch special and it was the best I've ever had!

Quick and friendly service! Not much for seating which was not a problem, as most people came for take out during the lunch hour. I ordered the chicken with pea pods lunch special with came with a choice of rice and am egg roll and a soda for less than $7. The place is clean and the food was fresh, great taste, not heavy and digested well. Overall great experience and food! I will be making this a regular lunch spot.

Food is decent but they have a bunch of incompetent fools that work and drive for them. We live 2 miles away and they never find our condo....even though we heard of them because they left menus downstairs. I once had to text them my address and another time I had to drive to a place to meet the driver. The food is OK but not worth the hassle. They need to do better at their customer service. If you order DO NOT get delivery just go and pick it up as you will have to drive either way.

I decided to try Chopstix after it opened so close to me recently and I am so glad I did! The food is delicious and very reasonable, the service is great and the people are very friendly. The place we used to get Chinese food delivered from was mediocre at best so I am excited to have a good place nearby.

I absolutely love this place! I have been coming here since it opened, and have never had a bad experience. Today I came here with my family for my Moms birthday.

First off, our waiter was amazing. He was so welcoming and attentive. He picked up that it was my Mom's birthday from our conversation, and brought her a surprise dessert on the house.

Secondly, I ordered the chefs special: seared duck breast with roasted Brussels sprouts, caramelized onions and candied walnuts tossed in an unagi sauce. When all of my family's food came out and mine didn't, our waiter came right over to tell me there was a bit of a delay, and my food would be out shortly. After some time, the manager came over and notified me that they were remaking my food because it was not up to their high standard, and told me he would pay for my drinks! 

I was so thankful that the staff was taking extra steps to make sure that my meal was as good as it could be. This restaurant always tries to make their dining experience to be spectacular for every customer, and I was reaffirmed of this today.

Service was very poor at 7:00 pm on a Saturday night. They were obviously understaffed by a lot. Many tables sat uncleared and others empty but set while we waited nearly 30 minutes for our 7:15 pm reservation to be filled. 

The front door set up allows freezing cold air to enter the waiting and bar area - this was on Nov 19 - imagine how horribly cold that will be in Jan/Feb! They need to fix that soon...

If you make a reservation ask for the room to the north of the hostess station. That is a much warmer room without the breeze and feels like a dining room. The area in front and to the right of the bar has larger tables that are spread out and it just doesn't feel like a dining area. 

We ordered the chicken wings with Buddha dust (amazing as always, crispy, perfectly balanced sweet and spicy sauce), the popcorn shrimp (not too crunchy, not too soft with candied walnuts and a frisee salad), a true crab California roll which was very fresh, our three entres were the margarita pizza, the bulgogi flank steak with kimchi fried rice, and the pork milanese cutlet. All were delicious, a tie between the crispy breaded pork and the flank steak. For me the pizza crust was a little too soft although it was tasty. A side order of pork belly fried rice came after we were finished with the rest of the meal and it needed salt.

A red velvet lava cake was good but not quite fluid enough and the apple bread pudding was tasty but should have had a crunchier crumble topping on it.

All in all I would say better to go here during the week when they are not quite as busy since the kitchen obviously puts out very good food but the service is lacking on busy weekends.
.

I've been wanting to try this modern place out in the burbs. On a beautiful Saturday, the outdoor seating area was a really nice addition- but so many bees! Obviously that can't be helped, but it definitely made our experience more tense and less relaxed, so maybe opt for sitting inside. 

The brunch menu was available during this time, but the sushi menu was also so naturally that's what I ordered. The earth no ocean roll was very fresh and light- just what I needed this particular morning. We had a little appetizer also- some type of corn fried shrimp dish. This was pretty salty but other than that pretty good. 

The service was slow but very accommodating. I would like to try more sushi rolls at this place soon! E+o provides a great atmosphere for modern dining in this suburban area.

It was my first time here and I was invited to a party of about 20 so it's a different experience than just regular dining I suppose, but the service was good and I really enjoyed the dinner. 
The decor is very nice, clean and modern and the party room was not too noisy so I was able to hear the speaker of the dinner speak clearly. 

The dinner started out with a popcorn shrimp appetizer that was perfectly done and not to overpowering in the breading department. 
Next we had the fried cauliflower with smoked pea hummous that had great flavoring and not too oily.
The Caesar salad and the crispy brussels and kale salad were the best appetizers. 

I chose a ribeye for the main entree topped with a fried egg that was perfectly cooked sunny side up and the steak was done medium rare even though it was a thin slice of beef so this was enjoyed! 

the desserts were a tad on the small side for us to share and we had to request more desserts at the end but between the carrot cake and chocolate tres leches, I definitely enjoyed the carrot cake the best and I prefer chocolate usually. 

I will definitely come back and try this place at dinner time with my hubby.

This place is so nice and clean. It's elegant and casual. We went here for my coworkers birthday, they gave us free cookies and icecream on top and it was delicious! 
I would actually give this a 5 star, but I wasn't happy with my entree. Ordered rib eye steak and it was oily the taste was ok. And they don't fill up water. But overall it was a nice place restaurant with a touch of Filipino cuisine.

Excellent drinks, delicious food, and comfortable seating makes for a happy hour for friends getting together and chatting. There were plenty of seating inside and outside. I really like the high ceilings because it makes the place seem very open and spacious.  I started out with a delicious cocktail. My friends were very excited about the $1 glass of champagne off the happy hour menu. We then moved on to consume a mass amount of food all of which was delicious and made with very fresh ingredients.  Some of the key dishes that I thought were exceptional was the beet salad and the poutine fries. The beets were really fresh and well balanced with the arugula, almonds, and balsamic dressing. And who doesn't love fries smothered in cheese and gravy? I would eat this everyday if I wasn't concerned about my arteries.

This is definitely a great place for happy hour with your friends or dinner with a date. Oh skip the dessert. It was not that great or memorable. Just have another cocktail instead!

E+O...I waited so long to come here!! Finally, I did. I came here for lunch with my friend on a Saturday late afternoon, and it was pretty much dead. To me, that's perfect timing.

I love the decor. Beautiful ocean blues and modern lighting that is really unique. However...the booths...which look appealing from afar, are stained. Real bad. They need to clean those babies. We sat there because they looked comfortable, but later we realized that the stains were not actually part of the fabric pattern...it was just dirty. Turn off.

So out waitress was the hostess...and the bartender...problem. She was obviously not happy about it and voiced it. I get it. I've worked these jobs, it's frustrating. At the same time, if I acted like that at a job now, I would get fired. Her attitude was not great, from a customer prospective. I understand the frustration, but you are letting it out on the wrong person. Needless to say, had the service been better my review would also be better. But her attitude and treatment towards us ruined it.

The food was great. We shared the beet salad and the mac and cheese. The food is downright fabulous. I don't know who is in that kitchen but i'll marry them. That's how serious this food is. I ordered a ginger cocktail and I was not a fan, but I believe that's my fault because I'm not the biggest ginger lover. I was feeling adventurous, so that's my bad.

Their dinner menu is VERY different from their lunch menu. To be honest their dinner menu is more appealing to me. I would come back to try that, just because the food is so good. But the service needs to be stepped up a notch, as well as the cleanliness of those booths.

The food and drinks are realllllly delicious. To be honest I don't quite understand the menu though. Kind of all over the place, but I like that. Make a reservation! I made the mistake of assuming because it's in the suburbs I don't need one, apparently you do or you'll wait for 15-30 minutes. service was okay, nothing i would rave about or complain about. Prices were decent and worth it for the quality of food. Good dining experience and good for bigger groups!

This place was amazing. The previous review written when the restaurant just opened and I think they were still working some kinks out. 

I went here last night and of course I had to order my favorite thing on the menu, the Brussels sprouts and kale salad. It was as amazing as I remembered it and the portion was even bigger!! Tried the popcorn shrimp for the first time. It was another generous portion and the sweet and spicy sauce was delicious. 

We had two of the sushi rolls. The salmon teriyaki which was good, but not my favorite dish of the night. We also had their version of a California roll which had soft shell crab and shrimp tempura. 

For dinner I had the salmon fish with broccolini and mashed potatoes.
Love the sushi! So good! They have an amazing kale salad too that I wish I could make at home. I've also had the squid ink pasta and pork belly in adobo sauce which are both excellent.

Fit for a foodie for sure!

The food is great, esp the happy hour quesadilla...but be prepared as these are literally bite sized morels.

OK happy hour prices, not the best deal in the neighborhood but truly good food, modern setting and great patio.

I've been dying to try this place .. Although we had good company and an overall fun night, we were a little disappointed. 

Atmosphere:
Beautiful, modern decor. Interesting lighting and a city-chic vibe!

Service:
We were greeted wonderfully by the host, and our server Caitlyn was attentive, knowledgable about the menu and a pleasure to be served by.

Menu: 
Fussy! There's a lot to work through before you find the right dish. An overly eclectic menu -- it's all over the place! American, Asian contemporary, sushi, European ... What goes with what? .. Gravy fries & sushi? Brussels & pizza? Huh? I'm hungry !

Taste:
Overall 3.5 .. For the price! $15-22 a dish 

Cocktails:
Scrumptious! Try the strawberry sling & the "bite the bulleit" - strong, and perfectly crafted!

------------------ 3.5 overall -------------------

Date night in the 'burbs and tired of the same old same old, we Yelped our way to this shining light just West of us.  And are we  glad we did.  The ambiance was modern and elegant, yet comfortable.  It had an urban feel without the hour on the Edens/Kennedy in a Saturday.  

The service was terrific-- our guy was cordial, attentive, and knowledgeable.   
Our courses were paced perfectly and the cold to hot suggestion well placed.  

What an amazing menu with "I read your mind" choices to fit your mood.  The food was special here--we started with the spicy tuna on crispy rice and tuna tango roll, then rolled into the crispy Brussels sprouts and kale salad.  The finisher was the Seoul pizza, one of THE best fusion anything I've eaten.  The kimchee was perfectly ripened, the Kalbi was flavorful and lean, and the garlicky wonderment with white sauce, gooey cheese, and perfectly crisp crust was belissimo!

Complimentary valet for an easy experience too.

Excellent food. We had the four course meal.  The first two courses came out too close together. Was a worried we would be rushed but things slowed down and we enjoyed our meal at a good pace.   We started with the "yes please" a very good sushi roll.   One of many signature rolls you should try. The crispy Brussels sprouts and kale was awesome.  We would consider these as a meal next time.  The Brussels sprout arrived with the Hamachi, I expected it to be prepared more like sashimi but was surprised. Dinner was the kalbi, my new favorite and the chicken breast cutlet. Very generous servings and we took home enough for second meals each.

Staff was friendly and attentive. Location is in the heart of mall so parking is free and close by.

Me and my friends went here sometime after lunch so no problems getting seated right away! I like the look and feel of this restaurant! Service was amazing as our waitress was on top of making sure our needs were met accordingly! Food had different flavors with various fresh ingredients making this an interesting Asian-fusion spot; however, I felt the portion for price was abit expensive...We enjoyed all the food we tried: Clam chowder, Not your ordinary caesar salad, +Filipino adobo style pork belly, Argentinean gaucho rib eye steak, Bone marrow and carne asada tacos(need more bone marrow!), Spicy tuna on crispy rice, +Island style tuna poke!

Awesome presentation, super clean and sophisticated. It's kind of a hidden gem in the middle of a quiet suburb. The food is great and the drinks are creative and "trendy." 

The ambiance is neat too, very upscale and modern feeling, I highly recommend it for dinner.

I've been to E+O a couple of times now, and although I wasn't too fond of it the first time I went, I really like it now. The atmosphere, the decorations, the service, and the food are great. 

The last time I came to E+O, my husband and I ordered the roasted duck and dalkon hash, a side of fries, the crispy Brussels sprouts and kale salad, and the popcorn shrimp tempura. I really liked all of the dishes that we got, but my favorite is the crispy Brussels sprouts and kale salad. It is so delicious, and definitely a must when going to E+O.

Had a Groupon for a 4 course meal .OMG good. I followed all instructions on the Groupon and they honored it for lunch even though the manager wasn't going to allow it st first saying it was dinner only.  I pointed it out that it didn't say that anywhere and since I had made a reservation on their yelp site and said I was using a Groupon he let me    The food service were outstanding, the server very helpful. We had Brussels sprouts and kale for appetizer.  Out of this world delicious. The skirt steak beef with rice entree was so tender snd tasty    Fabulous. I'm buying another ASAP and making my husband go.

Wow!  This place really exceeded my expectations.  The parking up front is pretty limited, so you might have to walk from one of the nearby lots.  Inside, the decor and ambiance is very nice, with plenty of comfortable seating.
     They have a great wine menu, with plenty of options.  I'm not huge about sushi, but I tried a salmon teriyaki roll here, and was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it.  I ordered some phenomenal popcorn shrimp with a great sweat and sour glaze.  My date got a Brussels sprout and kale salad.  Both dishes were huge portions, and both were excellent.  
     For dinner I ordered a rib eye with egg, spinach, and baked potatoes.  She got the salmon with mash potatoes and broccoli.  For desert, we ordered the red velvet cake with vanilla ice cream.  I really can't overstate how much I enjoyed this place.  The food was amazing, and the service was wonderful.  I would definitely recommend e+o for any occasion, and I can't wait to go back!

I use to come here all the time. I brought a friend last night to visit since I kept bragging about the cuisine. The food was luke warm. But that wasn't the worst part. We asked for a split bill. The total was $126. The receipts we received were for $63 each. This morning I got an alert from my bank that I was charged $113 on my card. My friend was charged another $63 . I have heard of waiters using your card and doing fraud, before but I never thought it would happen in Mount Prospect. When I called the manager to have the amount reversed . He was very unhelpful, and told me he couldn't do anything at the time, because the receipt he had on file showed I was only charged $63. So I offered to show him proof, and he didn't care. I guess he thought I was lying. So if the server made a mistake he should have told me he charged my card in error and gave me a receipt for a reversal . Instead the manager refused to cancel the transaction and could not explain to me how the $113 was charged since my total bill was $126. I guess I paid for someone else's dinner. The lack of customer service and incompetence is terrible. So now I'm be charged an over draft fee. I have to report my card stolen. Do not go there so your credit card information can be stolen. Then waste your entire day on the phone with your bank and when the establishment does not take responsibility for their employees mistake. 


Well instead of justifying what your establishment did and overdraft an account. You should teach you waiters to inform their customers of such mistakes. Yes there is such thing as human error but clearly you guys don't believe in taking responsibility or the customer is always right. I would have been less livid if I was informed at the table instead of getting an alert from my bank the next day.  Hope you all get some training on customer service because this place surely lacks that from upper management to the waiters.

Came here on Valentine's day with my family. No reservations but came at an early time and was promptly seated by the bar. 

From walking in I was pretty amazed at the space. This is located in a suburban mall and being accustomed to Chicago dining I was pleasantly surprised. 

The menu also surprised me as I saw a lot of Filipino inspired dishes. Just coming back from a month long trip to the Philippines I was a bit fatigued of the flavors so I ordered other menu items. (Next time I am in the area I will definitely try the asian dishes).

The ribeye was cooked a perfect medium rare and served w/ an egg and potatoes. A very good executed take on a comfort dish of mine. 

What stole the show for me was the bone marrow tacos. My first bone marrow experience and I must saw I was impressed. I like to think I am a taco freak but I have never seen it served like this. Very primitive. Just a fat bone stuffed with meet and tortillas on the side. Assemble your own. Absolutely loved the presentation, taste, and picking up the bone to make sure I cleared it. Excellent.

Wine program was good as well. Ordered 2 bottles as the atmosphere calls to have a little wine on your lips. 

This restaurant really took me aback. I have a somewhat snob complex when I think about $$-$$$ dining in the suburbs but I was overly impressed with my dinner here. Will I make the trip all the way out to dine here? Probably not to be honest but if I am in the area bet I will be here for the tacos.
The atmosphere was modern and clean! The food was absolutely fantastic! I highly recommend this restaurant! Perfect for date night!

Amazing food and exceptional service! A little expensive but I think it's worth it. Menu's great, unusual items but creative combinations. Not consistent but not something to cry about. Husband wasn't all that impressed but I'm the opposite. I loved everything we ordered although there are a couple of dishes that I think were absolutely terrific. 

- crispy kale and brussel sprout salad - Like most of the people here, I absolutely recommend this dish. Husband doesn't like veggies but he single-handedly finished this. It's an explosion of flavors and textures, it's unbelievable how they created this. I haven't enjoyed eating salad until I tried this one.

- kalbi and pork fried rice - OMG I can eat this pairing everyday! They complemented each other so well! 

- carrot cake - I loved all the desserts here but this was my favorite. It's not as sweet as you would think and I like that.

With app+main+dessert, it set us back by $100 or $50 per person. It's slightly expensive than I initially thought but like I said, worth it. I look forward to returning again soon!

My review of this restaurant is relevant only to is breakfast menu. The room is gorgeous. Has a city feel to it. Great colors, tvs present in the bar but not the least bit intrusive or out of place. The food, while slow to get to our table in an empty room, was good and creative. Eggs cooked perfectly. Waffle chewy and sweet. The chilaquiles were the disappointment. Very little of the advertised pork belly. The menu does not offer typically traditional dishes although all the ingredients are present.

My lower than expected rating is predominately based on price. For what you get, very costly. My southern hospitality item, one egg over a biscuit on top of a small pork tenderloin was $14. No toast. I ordered a side of tomatoes, $3. Don't think beefsteak. See photo. Very costly. We will try dinner as that seems like the play. There is a traditional breakfast joint in the same strip center. Go there for your giant omelette, this is not the place. Breakfast for four, each with a drink was over $100.
The Dodd are great! I have to back again for another entree. Very recommendable to all my friends and family.
This place is amazing. The food is phenomenal. Alan and Pam are the best bartenders in the business.

I've ate here twice now and my wife and I were both blown away with the food and service. Unlike most restaurants that just bring your food out as fast as possible, feed you then hand you your bill. This place does it right. The atmosphere is nice and chill food is excellent and the service was just as spectacular. The crispy brussel sprouts and kale is a must for an appetizer.

Our group of six came here to try dinner and sat in the high tops/bar area.  This is where you need to sit to enjoy their 50% off weekday specials on specialty drinks (10-$12) and appetizers from 4:00-7:30pm.  Overall, I'd go with a 4.5 stars rating.  Every one of the numerous servings we had were of excellent quality and taste.  We found the appetizers to be quite generously sized, and much more so than the main entrees ($22-$25) and desserts ($8) which were pricy for the smallish portion sizes.  The main entrees' value and maybe the required hightop seating were my only knock-backs from a 5 star dinner rating.  Depending on tastes, one could easily make a dinner of the appetizers.   The specials more than made up for the entree sizes.  The hightop seats have no backs, so in wintertime you will need to check your coats in.  A high top can accommodate a group of eight.  The main dining area was packed.  They had live music (popular mello, like U2) on Friday night and the sound level was thankfully tolerable for dinnertime.  The courses we tried were as follows and are shown in the photos.

Appetizers:
-  Beet salad
-  Wedge salad
-  Pizza romana
-  Mussels
-  Crab toast
-  Disco fries

Entrees:
-  Pappardelle with beef hash
-  Ribeye steak
-  Pork belly
-  Black squid ink pasta with prawns

Desserts:
-  Carrot-pineapple cake
-  Red velvet chocolate cake
-  Mango pudding

Delicious food, great hidden tapas place ! I was very glad to find this place. My husband and I love new types of food and it's hard to find a nice spot to take an infant too (downtown has too many partiers) so this was awesome. You get the downtown vibe without the concern. Love this place

I think this place is neat. Different menu items then many restaurants in the area. Has healthier options. Loved their Kale salad. Enjoy their outdoor seating in the summer.
Wish it was a little less expensive still great experiences here! Went with my boyfriend and with my mom and enjoyed everything.

I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a while. This was my first opportunity to dine here and I was really disappointed.
First of all, the place was so dirty. Floor was sticky, dishes were nasty we had to ask to have them replaced.  Coffee pot that she came to the table looked like it has never been washed. We sat at the window and on the frame of Windows, there were old food particles everywhere.  Yuck!  Maybe you can't see all these nasties if it's at dinner time, but I was there for lunch. 
The lady who served us was very rough, almost like working in a diner. 
Sushi(hamachi maki) smelled old and fishy.
But I must say Kale/Brussel sprout salad was good. 
I'll do a take out next time.

E+O has a great atmosphere, tasty food, and friendly service! I would definitely recommend E+O for a date night or night out with friends. 

I went in on a Friday night with my husband and we arrived a bit earlier than our reservation, so we just sat at the tables in the bar area. It was still really nice and they had live music playing. 

E+O has some awesome small plates (tapas) and main courses. There is a heavy Filipino influence in their dishes. My husband and I ordered 4 small plates; crab cake, crispy brussel sprout and kale salad, chicken sisig, and disco fries. We also placed an order to share an entree of pork adobo, but we were so full w/ the small plates that we had to cancel the order!!! The 4 "small" plates were very filling and tasty! I think my favorite was the crispy brussel sprout and kale salad! It was perfection!!! The other items were good as well, but the sald sticks out in my mind. Oh, and it was warm!!! YUM!!!! 

I was sooo full, but I had to sneak a peek at the dessert menu. And that was a mistake! I ended up ordering the red velvet molten cake. It was good! :) 

Oh, and I had a lychee cocktail to wash it all done...very tasty and I recommend it! 

Overall, a great place to go. They have free valet! 

Enjoy!

I don't even know where to begin.

They have lunch entrees!
Chicken sisig with a poached egg on top with rice is pretty bomb and felt healthier than your average sisig - but still very flavorful.

Duck and Daikon is out of this world.
And that kale and shrimp salad is super good.

Nothing from the entree section really grabbed my attention.

But that dessert though!!!!

Red velvet lava cake is awesome!
And that carrot caaaaake.

Try this place out its so fancy in there too!
It is like they brought a fancy river north restaurant to the burbs.

Love it!

So, almost a year ago now I went with a group of people to E+O and was very dissatisfied with the experience. After I posted my review, I received a very nice note from the manager who invited me to come back and give them another chance.

That chance came this past weekend for a late lunch. We arrived at about 2 PM and the place was not crowded at all so we were immediately seated. While I like having cocktails with dinner and no so much for lunch, I decided to go for a Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary was not on their drink menu but to my surprise, they had a Bloody Mary Bar set up replete with lots of stuff. And, while it was a very good tasting Bloody Mary, it was lacking in alcohol content. I was a little disappointed by this, but not overly so.

My wife ordered iced tea - she is very picky about her tea and does not like any flavored ones that are popular out there. When ordering, she asked specifically about this and was told it was plain iced tea - not so. I think the server should have known. She did make it right by allowing us to send it back and simply get seltzer with lemon.

We did not realized that Sunday was Dim Sum day and you could not order off the main menu for lunch. We decided to go "all out" and ordered two of the Dim Sum plates - Chicken and Chive potstickers and Buddha Chicken wings. The potstickers were okay - nothing out of the ordinary. The Chicken Wings I thought were outstanding (albeit a little sticky), They have some type of shrimp (brine shrimp) in the coating and my wife is not a seafood eater. We did not realize how they were made when we got them so she took one bite and I got to eat them all.

For the meal, we both ordered burgers with fries (you have a choice of fries or salad). The burger is a double patty served with or without cheese, with thousand island dressing and jalapenos. The jalapenos offer a nice touch, and the sweetness of the thousand island was a nice change from ketchup. But, the meat was kind of bland.

I also ordered a sushi roll called "same name but different". I would classify that as outstanding. One of the best maki rolls I've ever had.

The service was good, but not great. With only four tables that had people sitting at them and there were two servers you would think the servers would be all over you. No so.

So, long-winded (sorry) but since this was a follow up, I wanted to be complete in my story. I was a little disappointed in the service and very disappointed with the burger. The Dim Sum were good. The sushi was fantastic. I think E+O is one of those places where you need to know what to order, and what not to order. 

Overall, my experience was better than last time. If you only look at the ambiance and decor, it really is nice. Last time I went, when we sat outside, it was beautiful. The interior is also nice. Reading other reviews there are lots of comments about the appearance. For me, more important than appearance is the food. For that reason I am increasing my previous 2 star review to 3 considering everything mentioned above.

The Brussel sprouts dish, duck, sushi rolls...AMAZING! 
Food and atmosphere just wonderful!

They remodeled the place so it's a lot bigger now. It's in an area that has a lot of restaurants, shopping, and a movie theater as well. What I like about this restaurant is that the menu has all kinds of dishes, even Filipino food. My favorite dish to share with a few people is the crispy brussel sprouts with kale and shrimp salad. It has a tangy flavor but the shrimp makes it delicious. Their clam chowder soup is actually really big too and if you like sushi, they have a good amount of options with 6-8 pieces.

E+O is the closest it gets to city like dining in the suburbs. The menu is exciting, inventive, fresh, and full of organic and responsibly raised meat and produce. Everything we ordered from appetizers to the steak was incredibly delicious, never boring. The cocktail and wine list also impressed me. I can't wait to go back!

Service isn't just bad here. It's nonexistent!

We came in on a Sunday afternoon. Host rushed out from a corner of the dining area and seemed discombobulated. Sat outside. Waited ten minutes to get a server or water (it was 92 degrees outside). When we got a server she was confused and even more so when we tried to order. We order drinks, one order dumplings, one order sushi rolls. Ten minutes later, a different server comes over, asks if we ordered, and if we "remembered the drinks we ordered." Excuse me???

Half an hour passes. We get the food but STILL not the drinks. Hail a waitress and complain. Five minutes later we get the drinks. And then the napkins...ten minutes later...after we asked.

Bonus: food wasn't even that good.

AVOID AVOID AVOID this place. Complete and total garbage. 

Humorous aside: table behind us was having issues with service as well and kept having to bring their drinks back to the kitchen. What in God's name is wrong with this establishment?

(They did comp the drinks though--so they get two stars instead of one).

One and only of the worst birthday dinner we had in a long time at E&O. We have seen better days with e+o, right when they opened up. The Chicken thigh sesame / bone in chicken thigh / sesame teriyaki meal was just awful, they turned it into a teriyaki soup with the chicken swimming in it. The 2nd winner of just awful is the e+o angus burger double patty / french dressing /american cheese / tomato jam /toasted bun / spicy pickles / fries. I could have gone to a dive and received a better burger with a better burger bun, I recommend just take both items of the menu before e+o embarrasses itself even more. The only redemption was (as always) the Small plates hot / Crispy Brussels sprouts and Kale and of course there server (kudos to you, keep it up). Please invest a few dollars in a fresh coat of paint and new tables/chairs/furniture. Keep up what you had when it was open.

As a returning customer I cannot say I am as pleased this visit as I have been in the passed. I came for lunch along with co workers. The waitress was nice and polite. Let me preface by stating there was probably a total of 2 tables occupied besides ours. 

We were asked if we had been before and when half of us said yes, she had given us a breakdown of the menu and her recommendations. 

Service in general was very slow considering the amount of people in the restaurant. I had to ask for my lemon slices two additional times before I received them. We had order roughly 20 minutes after sitting down (not because we couldn't decide) and our food took about another 40 minutes to get. This is rather unreasonable considering the fact that pretty much nobody else was in the restaurant. 

The chef special sliders were pretty good. Only opportunity there was the horseradish was missing from the sandwich so I had to ask for it to be brought on the side which now means I had to put it in the sandwich myself. The tuna tango was fairly small but tasty. (not sure how you share the tuna tango) The Thriller roll was great. 

Overall, poor experience and wouldn't say I would be dying to go back.

So we thought we'd try e+o again after our first encounter and instead of dinner service we tried brunch on Saturday. Girlfriend ordered the biscuits and gravy and it came out of the kitchen in the form of frozen biscuits in the middle and baby food slathered over them which didn't even come close to tasting or lookin like biscuits and gravy. 2 wrongs shame on me

Visited tonight. After waiting over 20min at our table we flagged down a waiter and he took our order. Caesar salad was tasty and that came out early. Then we waited at least 1/2 hr -45 min for our food. Which was mediocre at best. Cold pizza. The waiter was kind enough to take that dish off of our bill. But again we had to flag him down after 20 more minutes for our bill! Until the place gets more wait staff do NOT waste your time being ignored.
The food was delicious, after we waited a lonnnnnng time for it to make its way to the table.  If your in a rush, this might not be the best choice.

Eats and omens?  Epiphanies and observations?  Earth and ocean!

Finally made it over here, and a month later, what still stands out to me is that brussels sprout and kale salad!  Oh my, that was delicious, and me thinks it may or may not also have to do with the fried onion strings in that baby.

Other dishes our party tried were:
- duck confit hash
- pork belly (served over an overwhelming bed of raw, white onions... interesting)
- sausage pizza
- bone marrow taco (had higher expectations for this, as the bone marrow was not fatty melty, but rather fatty gelatinous, which was a detractor)
- chocolate tres leches (so so)
- carrot cake bundt cake with cream cheese frosting

Story on the dessert: our waiter Adam said the carrot cake dessert was LIFE CHANGING.  Like hold on, let's get serious.  That's a big sell.  Our table had a 7 minute debate about whether to order it bc everyone was pretty stuffed at the point this claim was made.  As a champion of all things dessert, I ordered the chocolate tres leches as I am not a huge carrot cake fan, and that completed the table's dessert order.  Adam really wanted us to try the carrot cake bc he sent over a free one!  That was really nice.  It was good, but sorry dude, "we still have to go to work tomorrow".  Read: not life changing.  P.S. Adam's a fantastic waiter: attentive, was prepared with recommendations, and had good energy.

I will definitely be back for that brussels sprout and kale salad!

Fantastic meal, as always. We've been frequenting this restaurant for the last year and it never disappoints. I love that we can have a pizza, sushi, a grilled cheese sandwich, burger, and a steak and all are perfectly prepared. The tempura shrimp and brussel sprout salad are my favorites.
This place is unique and great.  We had 4 people and shared many small plates. Everything was yum!!!

I came with a group of friends for lunch and all 3 of us magnanimously agreed that the restaurant chef must have been going through a depression.  Often times when I'm feeling down, the first thing that goes are my taste buds.  What I will do to compensate with my sudden sterile taste receptors is add more of everything.

3 packs of sugar in my coffee instead of 2.  2 scoops of hot sauce in my fried rice instead of 1.  3 shots of jack in my Coke instead of 1.  E+O may not advertise that they are a rehab center for the depressed but they should.  Because if you are having trouble feeling you will certainly be reminded that you can feel again by the way they spice and flavor their food.  

We ordered some type of disco fries and received a bowl of petroleum cheese with a few manipulated potato chunks.  I ordered a clam chowder soup that lacerated my top layer of tongue it was so salty.  Everything we ordered had such a strong taste, we needed a full pitcher of water to wash it down.  Even their Mac and cheese was salty.  This the place to go if you're depressed and want to be reminded that you are indeed not as dead as you thought.

The service on the other hand was great which is the only reason this place didn't get a 1.

I went to E+O for their mother's day brunch buffet. It was one of the worst and comical dining experiences I've had in a very long time based on the quality of the food, selection of the food, and the service (or lack thereof). I must qualify that I've been to E+0 multiple times for lunch and dinner previously and had a better experience, but this was based on an a la carte menu and not their ill fated brunch buffet. 

Snapshots
- Food was unimaginative and selection was painstakingly generic i.e. I could get the same items and any local diner. Maybe my expectations were misplaced but E+O advertises themselves as infusing a contemporary and asian twist to their dishes. Not true by any stretch of the imagination for this brunch. Plain eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, etc. 
- Food taste was bland, under-seasoned, and just plain bad. Enough said. 
- They are not setup for a buffet model. The line was always 20 people deep, moved at a glacial pace, and food trays were usually empty. 
- In terms of service, I've never had a server avoid eye contact. I tracked our server as he aimlessly walked a lap around the entire restaurant. Didn't seem like he was checking on his tables or delivering food ... he just, took a lap for the fun of it. 
- They automatically charged a 20% gratuity regardless of party size for the brunch. Seems inappropriate for a buffet? Or perhaps I was just hypersensitive because of the preceding dining experience. 

It seems that this was purely a money grab for E+O and the event lacked any planning or imagination. I obviously won't be going back for their brunch or any buffet themed event. Seems like it wouldn't be worth the reputation hit but maybe not?

Who'd have thought you'd find an upscale restaurant in a strip mall in the suburbs??  E+O is a great dining addition to the area and perfect for a date or a dinner with family/ friends.  This was my second time dining at E+O (Earth and Ocean) and I had a much better experience this time around.  The first time I bought a LivingSocial or Groupon deal for a prixe fix menu for two which included appetizers, entre, and dessert.  I don't remember all of the dishes we had the first time we ate here but they had a separate menu for the deal, which was not as impressive as their normal menu.  Service was fairly quick but nothing really stood out to me that time besides liking their outdoor patio.    

As for my second time, I came back a few days ago with a group of friends and had a great time.  Service was spot on and the food was pretty impressive.  I forget our server's name but he was hilarious and very attentive.  I had heard rave reviews about their crispy Brussel sprouts and kale salad (our waiter also highly recommended it), so we ordered 2 of those since no one in our group likes sharing (me included)!  We also ordered the bone marrow and carne asada tacos and roasted duck for the table.  For dinner I split the Filipino Adobo Style Pork Belly with a side of rice with my sister since we were already full from the appetizers.  Sometimes greed has a price (not really because then you have leftovers for the next day ^_^ and who doesn't like leftovers?). 

Appetizers:

Crispy Brussel sprouts and kale salad - YUM, this salad is perfect in texture and taste.  The Brussel sprouts and kale are shredded and cooked to crispy perfection with a nice sweetness making it addicting.

Bone Marrow and Carne Asada Tacos -This dish was pretty disappointing and I'd say pass on it.  I absolutely love bone marrow (I'm Chinese and you grow up eating that) but this bone marrow wasn't that fatty and pretty tasteless.  The carne asada didn't add anything to the dish but rather took away from the bone marrow since you couldn't experience the buttery, gelatinous goodness.  

Roasted Duck - This dish was pretty good but not as spectacular as the kale salad.  The duck came with crispy onions and fried daikon hash which was really tasty.  The duck was shredded but it didn't feel like the star of the dish; it was a bit lost among the onions and daikon but overall yummy.  

Entre:

Filipino Adobo Style Pork Belly - Mmmm pork belly.  Need I say more? I love the fattiness of pork belly even though I know I'll probably have a heart attack (kidding but kinda not).  There's something so delicious about tender pork with a layer of melt in your mouth fat on top.  Some people may think that sounds disgusting but don't knock it until you try it!  This is a slightly sweet dish and comes with grilled onions which I could have done without.  They didn't really add to the flavor or dish in any way.  

Dessert:

Carrot Pineapple Cake with Cream Cheese frosting - Our waiter told us this dessert was amazing and that it would change our life.  We opted to skip dessert but he really wanted us to try it so he gave us one for the table anyways.  This little cake was yummy but not life changing (sorry sir, didn't mean to burst your bubble).  It was served on a sizzling hot mini skillet and topped with a light cream cheese frosting and some cut up fruit.  I loved the texture since the cake had a nice crispy crust and moist center and the cream cheese frosting added the perfect amount of sweetness. 

Drinks:

Strawberry Sling cocktail - This tasted like strawberry juice and was a great summery (I know summer is over) drink. I highly recommend this if you're in the mood for a fruity cocktail.  

Check out E+O for some tasty drinks, relaxed atmosphere, and most importantly good quality food!

I've been here a few times and everything we had was amazing. Bacon Jam Quesadillas, mussels with red curry garlic sauce, Brussel sprout kale salad.... All Delish. Top it all off with the carrot cake. I don't care if you normally don't like carrot cake... Try it... It's the best!

I love going to e+o and ordering plates to share. The last time I went here was for lunch. There were 3 of us and we ordered 3 things: the brussel sprouts, the pizza of the day, and the totally tuna sushi roll. The brussel sprouts are the definite thing you HAVE to get when you go here, the dish is sooo flavorful and even if you hated brussel sprouts as a kid you will realize how much you love them with this dish. The sushi rolls are always really good, although never spectacular in my opinion, but they get the job done. The pizza (really they're like flatbreads) we had wasn't great, it was a white pizza with prosciutto on top. The toppings were really flavorless, but the bread was really what made it good. I'm guessing their other pizzas they offer are tastier, and it's good to know their base is good!

I don't know what the rave reviews are about, but I'm not a fan. I've been here twice and I can't even remember what I got the first time. Clearly didn't leave an impression.. But I remember everything being either bad or just okay. 

During my most recent visit, I ordered a sushi roll and it was really bland. Bland..?! How is sushi bland. Maybe the rice was unseasoned. Maybe everything was unseasoned. Ironically, sashimi in other restaurants are more flavorful than that roll : /

This review cannot even scratch the surface of my disappointment in our experience here.
My husband and I just moved to the area from downtown and we are huge restaurant connoisseurs. After reading the reviews and looking over their menu, we decided this would be a great place to take my brother and his wife to dinner, as they were in town celebrating his 40th birthday. Now, I'll start by saying, aesthetically, we though the restaurant was well done. Great location, setup inside was beautiful, one side is a nice bar- other side is the restaurant. We were sat on the restaurant side obviously, for dinner, in a large booth for the 4 of us. Table was big enough for us to fit comfortably and enough table space to fit all the food we would be ordering. They have a great cocktail menu and their food menu is diverse with a large selection of apps and share plates. We were very much looking forward to trying most of their menu. 
Now, as the waitress approached to take our drink order and go over the menu, we were distracted by the booth at the other end of our row- approximately 50 ft away from our table. The 4 ladies were intoxicated and so obnoxiously loud, we could not hear our server who was standing right in front of us. As we had to ask her to keep repeating herself, I made a comment about how loud they were and to my surprise her response was a roll of the eyes and "I know, they're so loud." Letting that first incident go, we proceeded to order and start with about 5 items from their app menu. As the food was placed on our table we engaged in conversation with each other only to continuously have to pause and wait for the obnoxious table to stop yelling and laughing so loud, so we could hear each other speak without screaming across the table. As our starting plates were cleared, we ordered another round of drinks, as well as large plates to share and again having to repeat ourselves as our waitress could not hear us 1 ft in front of her, because the other table was so loud. At this point I told the waitress how disturbing their voice and laughter was to our table and that we could not have our own conversations due to their volume. Her response this time was "I know, they're on their way out, we just dropped their check." Now, as we received our large plates their voices seemed to not only get louder, but it was literally to the point where my table could not talk to each other because we couldn't hear ourselves let alone each other. We asked for our food to be wrapped to go and ordered a dessert just to be able to sing happy birthday and leave. Again, not able to hear that idea was pointless. By this point, I was furious and demanded that my waitress ask them to quiet down and have respect for the other guests at the restaurant. As we sat there waiting for the check, we heard the manager walk over to their table and greet them. Never once acknowledging how loud they were or that other guests had complained. As we signed our $500 check, we didn't even touch our last round of drinks, left the dessert on the table, and left the restaurant baffled by the lack of concern for OUR dining experience by this restaurant. Not only were my husband and I mortified that WE chose this restaurant but we felt horrible that this was the experience my brother had on his 40th bday! HUGE disappointment. The food was great and we would have definitely been regulars here, but after that experience, we will NEVER come back.

Just moved to the area with my wife was very happy to find a place with excellent food the dishes were all well thought out the sushi was excellent the drinks were great I will be back to try a more diverse variety of dishes my only complaint was the service
Their Social Hour on M-F 5-7 has a decent selection of items for half the regular price. Good food and awesome service. Surprisingly not crowded.

E+O is bright and inviting, and the royal blue suede booths aren't just for romantic dates!  It's a super chic spot for a night out with friends or to celebrate something special.

We arrived earlier than expected, and my friend Sarah S. called to see if we could bump up our reservation.  They did so without any problems.  We soon learned another friend would join us, and our waiter moved us to a large booth without any hesitation.  Service was stellar throughout our meal.

I started my night with a Strawberry Smash, a cocktail with strawberry puree and St. Germain.  The rest of the cocktail menu was tempting, but I had to exercise some sort of self-control.

The food is amazing.  We started with the Proscuitto Wrapped Burrata, which was a "snack sized" appetizer but still delicious.  We then shared the Smoked Pea Hummus.  Honestly I didn't love this dish, but smoke flavor usually doesn't win in my book.  It was still an interesting dish with complex flavors, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to give it a try.  

I was most surprised by the Crispy Brussel Sprout salad.  It was my first time eating brussels sprouts, and all I could think about was that episode of "The Cosby Show," in which Rudy basically wasted 30 minutes of primetime refusing to eat them.  Really, Rudy?  It wasn't that bad, in fact, I really liked it.  It was crunchy and had lots of other ingredients mixed in.

I was doubtful of the Sweet Corn Linguine, because I wasn't sure about the whole idea of corn in pasta.  The sauce was so creamy and buttery though, with just the right amount of pecorino.  Yes, there was corn in the dish, but it totally works, kind of like kettle corn.

We shared some of the sushi rolls, including a featured roll topped with tuna poke, and another with white tuna and spicy tuna rolled into one.  Both were tight rolls with fresh ingredients and overall fantastic.

Somehow, we still had room for dessert, and we shared the carrot cake and an apple bread dessert.  The carrot cake was really crumbly and just OK, but the apple dessert was to die for!

Prices are reasonable; I would recommend ordering a few dishes and sharing with one or two people, especially if you want to really get a good feel for the whole menu.

E+O is a surprising, but welcome, spot in Randhurst that you should definitely check out.

The service is great. Very nice and attentive and helpful. Its just they are making a huge profit over the rip off of food they give you. Some noodles and corn is like 12 bucks and rice and a small slab of steak is like 20, and the food isnt even that good. Great atmoshpere though. More for the rich crowd who have money to waste. Great service, ok food.

In the mood for something healthy and unique a concierge recommended e&o.  I took a quick look at the menu, described my wants and a knowledgeable staff made recommendations that surpassed my expectations.  As I learned more of the concept Chef John told me of his passion for research & the evolutions of cuisines within his style.  The experience matched the intent and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  I was glad to hear he also supports smaller & sustainable sources.  How many establishments strive towards organics?
Kudos e&o!

I've been to this restaurant twice before and I knew I loved it, so I wanted to take my mom and sister there even though my sister is very picky and my mom is difficult to please. Long story short, EVERYTHING we ordered was absolutely delicious. Even though they were both skeptical, they raved about everything. And a funny story...my family has an ongoing joke with my mom that the loves carrot cake even though she really hates it. I won't get into the specifics. But when I asked our server, Alan, what the dessert was, he said the best one was the carrot pineapple cake. As we all laughed, he brought it to our table insisting she give it a try. Well, it was delicious and we fought over who would finish it. Thank you to Alan for being an awesome server. And I recommend e&o to everyone. Ps. The sushi is also great.

I really enjoyed the variety of dishes that we ordered here for our girl's night out. I would highly recommend the dish that comes with the *crispy brussel sprouts* and kale, minced shrimp, sweet chill vinaigrette, peppers, and shallots. It was so good that we ordered two dishes of these!

Here is the rest of what we ordered:

Popcorn shrimp tempura with spicy honey aioli and glazed walnuts. One of the other table favorits.
Disco fries: hand cut french fries with gravy and cheese sauce. A little heavy for my taste, but still good. I do love my french fries!
Linguini with sweet corn cream, corn kernels, scallion, cracked pepper, pecorino. This one was interesting...maybe I'm not used to a sweet pasta dish, but I would prefer a creamy or savory pasta dish over sweet corn...but that's just me. Still worth a try!
Thriller roll: soft shell crab, spicy tuna, mango, cucumber, unagi, wasabi aioli and nori. I'm not sure if I would order this again, but it was a nice balance with all our other dishes.

I think we might have ordered one other dish, but I can't remember what it was...hmm...

I'm coming here again in about a week, so I'll try to update my review with more pictures, especially if I try something different!

This is our second time visiting. First was last year this time and just last night. 
First time rocked and the cocktails, entree's and desert were fabulous. Server was very attentive, explained the menu well, suggested cocktails and deserts.
Last night it failed.
Our server came by asked if we would like water for sparkling i opted for the sparkling and their server filled my wife's glass. She walked away and must have went to the nearest whole foods to get my VOSS sparkling water and then walked away.  Another couple sat next to us and our server came to them explained the menu suggested a wine and came back right away with their wine opened it served it and took their order while we sat drinking our water.
We almost left.
I was jealous of the three tables to my right as their waiter was cool.
Our food was ok
The red velvet molten cake was cold
Too bad

First time here...and probably the last. The food here was okay, although the portions were pretty small for the price. The service, though, was S. L. O. W. Made a reservation for 7:30 and didn't get seated until after 8:00. The hostess said they usually allot 1.5-2 hours for people to eat, but some were staying for up to 3 hours. Fine, whatever, you can't help that.

After being seated, the waitress came by to fill our water glasses. Ten minutes later she asked if we wanted to order something to drink. After that much time we were ready to place our dinner order. An hour later, we still hadn't received our food and were beginning to see why people were staying for 3 hours.
