Based on other reviews I had high hopes for this place, which is why I suggested it to the people I was eating with. However, I just ended up embarrassed that I came up with the bad idea to eat here.

The place has a great vibe and atmosphere. Once we stepped in, we thought that were in the city. So, that was great and rare in NW suburb. I could see it being a great date spot in the suburb. Cocktails were interesting and yummy. However, food just fell flat for me. We had crispy brussel sprout & kale, bone marrow taco, pop corn shrimp tempura, and trout entree (special of the day). I didn't like anything. My partner loved the bone marrow taco. Every tables seemed to order the crispy brussel sprout. I just don't get the concept of deep fried salad, all garnishes were deep fried in that dish. It felt greasy in each bite.. Trout entree was ok. It was so average that i think i can make it myself. 

Again, the ambience & the service was great. And that's pretty much it. I wouldn't go back there again

My first time here was on a date a couple years ago for dinner and it was nice. My date and I were friends with the server and he pretty much ordered for us. We tried a couple of sushi rolls and some sort of appetizer (can't remember). The food was good and the ambiance was great-- very contemporary, especially for the suburbs.

My second time here was recently and for their brunch. My date (same date, funny enough) and I walked in and were the only ones for a bit until a family came in later on. There was a make-your-own mimosa and bloody mary bar. I made my own mimosa and it was alright, my date made his own bloody mary and that was decent. I was pretty annoyed because I told my date I wanted brunch-- french toast, skillets, the usual brunch food. He claimed that they had great brunch here...he was only going off the fact that he had been there before and drank at the bar during their "brunch" and had great drinks. Their menu was just a lunch menu with nothing that was a breakfast/brunch plate. So I was forced to order pork fried rice...it wasn't even good for fried rice. There was nothing unique or special on their take on the fried rice-- the Chinese place by my house makes better fried rice than them. Then, my date said that their red velvet "lava cake" was really good. So we ordered that and it was no damn lava cake--there was nothing in the center that oozed and it was completely overcooked (it tasted burnt). The cake was overcooked, so obviously it was very dry and it lacked flavor. The only good thing was the graham cracker crumbles that the ice cream came served on and even the ice cream didn't taste premium. I was extremely annoyed at this point and didn't mention anything to our waiter about it because I didn't want to embarrass my date, the waiter was really nice, and I knew that once I started to complain about something there would be no stopping and I would probably mention something to my date about how he had made a terrible mistake in picking this place for "brunch" and that he has terrible taste in food and judgement. Needless to say, the car ride back was just silence. I haven't gone out to eat with that date since. 

*My three-star rating is because my first experience here during dinner was good, but don't ever come here for "brunch" or even lunch.

Shockingly upscale for Randhurst, an amazing place to bring a date. It's really classy inside. My boyfriend and I had our anniversary dinner here and I couldn't have been happier. Its a quiet imitate place and the staff is excellent. We started with the bacon jam quesadillas, total slam dunk. I had squid ink pasta and sake (can't remember the brand... Dang) but both were superb. He had mussels and duck hash and both were amazing. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to get gussied up and not wanting to drive all the way out to the city.
Amazing food. Love their Brussels sprout salad and carrot cake.

Go here.  The decaf coffee was excellent.  The Nigiri Tuna's were fresh and a really generous portion.  The Caesar salad is well worth the 7 dollars.  Everything was very reasonably priced for Chitown.  

My only recommendation would be to add some pepper to the Caesar salad, which is more or less an observation as opposed to a critique since I can do that myself. 

Service was on point, without being obtrusive.  I never found myself without silverware or a feeling that I had been left for dead (I do have abandonment issues ;).  

This is the kind of place where jeans AND dressier attire are welcome.  They have a medium sized incredibly well balanced menu to appeal to Tapas, American fusion, and Sushi/Nigiri/Sashimi tastes.  I would have given them five stars, but I reserve that for the dining experiences that boarder on gastric bliss (to be a bit PC).

Kale and Brussels Sprouts salad was the star of our dining experience.  Flash fried with other goodies and Sweet Chili dressing was fantastic. Also had a very good California roll.  The breaded pork tenderloin was tasty and but the braised pork belly was just ok and would pass on It next time.  Had a great dessert with the carrot cake and pineapple dish.  Great looking restaurant and good vibe.  A bit pricey but if you got the cash highly recommend this restaurant.

Staff is wonderful and Orville is the best manager on the planet. They all treat you like kings and provide fantastic dishes that make you craving more. The happy hour options are the best value, but lunch and dinner are great options as well.

Returned several times since my last review and feel their service has gone downhill.  If you are in a hurry this isn't the place to go.  Went for a work lunch last week, they had only 1 server, we stood at door for several minutes and server came over and seated us .  We got the menus and sat, after 20 minutes we left and went to Black Finn.  In her defense she was working hard, they need to hire more servers or will continue to lose business!

Came here with groupon for my anniversary dinner with my boyfriend.
We were in awe of the place - very beautiful and modern. The food is really good! You can tell that they are making food from scratch! Compliments to the chef!
I just have to take 1 star off because the service takes a while. You can see most of costumers in the table waiting and keeps looking at the server for their food. 

My advice is give yourself time to stay here for awhile and enjoy the company of your friends/family. I promise the food is worth the wait. The staffs were nice and friendly as well.

What a great place to eat!  In the Randhurst Village around the corner from the Hampton Inn.  Had their take on a beef stroganoff, which was fabulous.  Their description is: house made pappardelle/beef ragu/sour cream and it was $16.  I would do this over and over, it was that good.  I also had a side of the snap peas and carrots, which were just as good, although a bit buttery...I like my veggies a bit less buttery.  

Had to have dessert so ordered the Red Velvet Cake and ice cream...yummy lava cake with chocolate oozing out when I cut it.  Really, really good!  Had one of my favorite drinks...a sparkling water with lemon.  Highly recommend this place and on my next trip, I am going for the sushi.
It is sad that such a great food spot has such terrible service.  Each of the four of us had an appetizer that arrived at a different
Getting three stars because of ambiance. Lunch experience was not good. The menu is trying too hard to be trendy that the food isn't even good. I had water, salad and 25 bucks later, left starving.

First, let's get this straight, the food is absolutely 4+ star worthy. What brings it down for me is in the hosting. I will admit that one of my pet peeves is illogical table seating. The last evening My wife and I were there, we had a reservation and arrived on time. As they were about to seat us, I asked whether we could have the clearly open table by the window. The host, perhaps inexperienced due to age, replied that he did not know whether it was reserved. Okay, first how about expending some effort finding out (the restaurant was by no means full and several booths existed around the restaurant). He did not. Secondly, even with the preponderance of open booths, he sat as at a cramps two seater amidst of row of them (in my world, seats like these are the worst). Really? I am hearing impaired so this is the worst as background noise provides interference. Fortunately as it was after 8:00, the couples on either side of us left soon. However, no matter how the food is, and it is excellent, I will think twice about returning. There are too many quality restaurants in the area with excellent hosts that will fit the bill. A note to restaurants and hosts, make these type of modern accommodations for diners. The table in question was not reserved and was occupied by 2 walk ins about 15 minutes into our dinner. While in the scheme of things not a great sin, but enough to probably cost them future visits from my family and me. Not to mention word of mouth. Too bad, as seating someone should be the easiest thing a restaurant does.
Good food. Good drink. Not sure what all the hype is about.  Service isn't always spot on but it's always clean in here

Not your average Mount Prospect restaurant. Trendy atmosphere and a unique menu. I'm a fan of the lollipop wings it would be nice to get a few more per order. Had the Chicken wings, chicken cutlet and angus burger. Everything we had was pretty good.

This is my first trip to the Chicago area. We are staying the Randhurst Village plaza in Mt. Prospect, IL. A friend and I decided to try out the sushi at E+O. First, great menu, easy to navigate and plenty of options, including gluten free menus for those needing it. Our server Brian was fantastic, making sure we understood the menu and made suggestions. When the food came out, it's by far the best sushi I've had in a long time! The crab in the California rolls was perfect and of course the "Yes Please" and "Double or Nothing" rolls are the way to go! Thank you for a pleasurable experience, I will highly recommend for their sushi!

A friend took me here last weekend and it had such a nice ambiance and the brussels sprout and kale salad is soooooo good. And that means a lot coming from me because I generally don't like salads. I'm still thinking about it and wanting more. Or at least a recipe!? The only thing I didn't care for was the service. We were there are on a Tuesday afternoon and the place was empty but I guess our waitress was having a bad day. She was just not friendly and seemed irritated to be serving us. That totally ruins an experience for me.
Love, love the Brussel sprouts and Kale salad! Great atmosphere. Very different from other places in the burbs. I love it here!
Horrible service and horrible food. The only thing going for this restaurant is the great atmosphere.

If you want to try new expensive cuisine then come here. 

Came in one lunch and it was nice. I appreciate the interior design and decor to this place. Its modern and fresh looking. My boyfriend and I ordered the spicy chicken wings and spicy crunch tuna roll for appetizers. Both lived up to my standards. They were delicious. I had the chefs special called perfect 10 and it was duck ramen noodle soup with an egg. It was good. Not too exciting or flavorful. Just average. And I was disappointed at the fact that there were only four pieces of duck in the soup... The highlight for me was the ginger soda it came with (I forgot the exact name of it). 
The tango mango tuna roll was okay but my boyfriend did seem to enjoy it a lot. The fish was fresh which is a plus. My boyfriend had some seafood dish which he said was really good and tasty. 

I will have to come back and try dinner because honestly the food was not that impressing. Denise our server was fantastic though. I just didn't see what all the hype was about this place. I have had a few friends come by and try it and I had seen it in Chicago's best but I don't know if its worth the trip for many.

Total: $7-.-- excluding tax and tip, including one glass of wine

P.S. Finding the restaurant is tricky&odd... I suggest to just follow the small mall signs.

We have tried E+O three times and probably won't go back again. The food is good but nothing special. The names and presentation are very pretentious. Both the food and booze are expensive. I am a huge supporter of live music but this place all open with lots of hard surfaces, music in the bar area makes it impossible to carry on a conversation at the other end of the dining room.

Excellent small dish place in a somewhat secluded location. Come here ready to share food with those you bring! 
Start with the bacon jam quesadillas, small enough to eat in one bite but the salty, slightly smoky flavor packs quite the punch. The bone marrow tacos are unbelievable, I absolutely recommend ordering them. Kalbi was also incredible, tender with great flavor and a hint of a spice. The watermelon pork salad was rather bland but everything else we ordered was expertly prepared. 
Lastly, if you have any questions about the menu, don't be afraid to ask the staff! They are friendly, very knowledgeable, and will make any ordering decisions easier by making great recommendations.

I will be coming to e+o quite often! Keep up the good work

This was a bit of a hidden gem. It's in a great shopping center and you wouldn't think something so fancy would be tucked in there! My favorite by far was the brussel sprouts. The atmosphere is very hip and they have a nice secluded private room for parties. I definitely plan to come back here next time I'm in the area. Also, it's one of the few places where I have actually picked up immediately on the great service. Our servers were incredibly attentive.

We went here to celebrate a birthday. Loved the interior. The place was comfortably busy that night. Half the food that we ordered was meh, but the carrot cake was incredible.

Earth salad ($7) - 2 stars. So boring. Pass.

Bone marrow carne asada tacos ($14) - 2 stars. Marrow melted way too quickly. Gone by the 2nd taco, even though we had started immediately at the advice of our waitress.

Squid ink tagliatelle with sea bass ($18) - 2 stars. Bland, forgettable.

Roasted duck and daikon hash ($12) - 3 stars. 60 degree egg. Crispy outside, fishcake/odeng texture inside. Sweet soy-based sauce.

Crabcake ($15) - 4 stars. Half-pounder. Pieces of lump crap meat. We all liked this.

Carrot cake ($8) - 4.5 stars. Highlight of our meal. Reminded me of a St. Louis buttercake. Memorably good. One of my top 3 carrot cakes.

Note - subscribe to their email newsletter, get a $10 off voucher.

Had a birthday lunch with a girlfriend.  We came at the end of lunch and shared 3 plates..the clam chowder (yum)...the kale brussel sprout salad (also yum) and the linguine with corn.  The waiter didn't rush us..was very nice and helped me with tasting for spicy-ness.  Will definitely return for a fun celebration meal!

City cool with the convince of the burbs. 
If you like good food prepared in an innovative way, but the ride to Logan Square takes the wind out of your sails, just come here. 
Been here on a couple of occasions and had several different items.  All were good.

Very nice service, but that's it. Food tasted very greasy with puddles of oil. My wife ordered the watermelon storm and it came out tasting like rum with some red food coloring. Our very nice server offered to get it fixed, but it still wasn't great. It looked so cool, but really disappointed with the food.  Oh, and there was some residue of unknown origin in my wine glass. Go to Truco.

We went to E+O for my birthday. The weather was beautiful and I noticed they had a really pretty out door eating area and there were 4 open tables. We went to the hostess stand to check in for our reservation and I asked if we could be seated outside. I think my words were, "Pretty please, it's my birthday". The gentleman behind the counter told us they don't seat people with reservations outside, which I thought was pretty weird. Then he added, "Besides, if you want to wait for outside it will be another 30 minutes."  We were already 15 minutes early for our 8:15 reservation so we said no. About 10 minutes later another couple without a reservation came in. Not only were they seated before us, but they offered them an outside table which they weren't even sure they wanted. At 8:15 we were seated next to a couple with two small kids.   I don't mind kids, but we were trying to have a romantic dinner and were sitting on a bench that was along the entire wall, so we were right next to them, even though there several tables open. The waitress must have noticed we were less than thrilled because she moved us to a nice intimate table without us asking, which was really nice. Then we ordered drinks. They have a mixed drink that's a play on an old fashioned. When my husband received his drink it was not even filled half way, and that was including the ice!  Our waitress was great, she made excellent suggestions. Try the Brussels sprouts!  Normally I can't stand them, but these were yummy. The deviled eggs were great too. I enjoyed the basil shrimp, nice big prawns, lots of flavor. Dessert was disappointing. The lava cake looked and tasted like a frozen cake they nuked in the microwave. I was excited to see a "city" restaurant come to the suburbs and I have to say I was pretty disappointed

Dined there last night, and frankly I do not know how it can be getting 4+ stars from anyone. It must come from the utter desperation for finer dinning in the bleak area around Randhurst Mall. Walking in, it seems like a trendy hipster dowtown wannabe restaurant trapped in a half empty mall. Leaving, it is all of those, and not worth the visit. 

The drinks are downtown priced. $12-13. The food is downtown priced. The sushi rolls have sparing amounts of fish in them, and maybe that is because the sous chef, who is allergic to seafood was making them. The chicken wings are deep fried, fatty globs of uneatable chew. The kale salad was nice, that kept them from a 1 star review. The short rib was nice, but had no seasoning/salt. Same for the wings. I told the bartender/server this, and he laughed at me and  mocked me, like I had not the experience to critique. With drinks, food, tax and tip, the two of us spent $100. I felt ripped off. 

By the way, the wings at Buffalo Wild Wings in the mall would have been better. We should have gone to Blackfinn next door. 

I predict closed by 2015.

With all do respect to the managements response, and as I read from some other reviews , the chef needs a seasoning tuneup. I think my review of my experience was accurate and to the point. This restaurant is not in the top 100 of Chicagoland eateries. It could make the top 25 of Mt Prospect restaurants though.

I am so pleased with this experience.  Make it a priority!!  

Earlier this week, I made reservations to celebrate our 24th anniversary at E+O.  We had hoped for an evening of great food and a great atmosphere... and E+O delivered.  In fact, they knocked it out of the park.  The food and service were exceptional.  Our service, Esha, was friendly and knowledgable.  We tried everything she recommended.  The brussels sprout & kale salad and the adobo pork belly were insanely good.  I will order them every time!  To top off the great night, the manager stopped by to check in and offer his kind wishes.  Following his visit, our server informed us that dessert was on the house.

Whether a special occasion or not, I am certain E+O will not disappoint!  E+O is now on the top of our list!

I first visited e + o when a demo with the chef, Rodelio, was advertised. Most of the things he cooked were from the vegetable portion of the menu-- brussels sprouts-kale salad; green pea hummus, etc. These were all incredibly vibrant and I continue to order vegetable dishes whenever I visit. I am also very fond of the clam chowder, as well as the duck congee on the Sunday dim sum menu-- a deceptively addictive dish. 

Service is always prompt and professional and the everyone seems to really care that you enjoy yourself. They have frequent specials on lunch and sushi which can make it a very affordable place to eat. It's a nice, comfortable space too.

Was at a Yelp event here a couple years back and have been eager to return, but the opportunity hadn't come up until a few days ago when a friend from HS was coming in and was interested in trying some contemporary American cuisine - E+O was the perfect spot.

I told him to pick any appetizer as I'd eat anything. He selected the crispy brussel sprouts and kale dish, which was the item I'd be least likely to have picked. But I'm glad he selected it as the dish was excellent. Lightly grilled with chopped shrimp mixed in and a spicy yet sweet vinegarette type sauce. I could have eaten that all night.

I had the Filipino adobo style pork for dinner - it was good, but not so good to make it "the reason" to come back. For a night cap, I ordered my usual Grand Marnier. The bartender pulled out two snifters and poured 2/3 shot into one and the rest into another. He dropped the "2/3" one by me and headed back into the kitchen. At this point, I'm wondering what is going on. He comes out of the kitchen with some near boiling water in a coffee cup and the remaining liqueur that I ordered. He says, "Have you ever tried Grand Marnier heated?" I told him no and he offered my a try. He rotated the snifter in the coffee cup with the hot water for about 1 1/2 - 2 minutes. He set the glass down and asked me to smell it first - but not to closely as the alcohol would kind of shoot into my nose. Well, it was outstanding - the fragrance and the deep flavor that the heat added was a whole new dimension. I love restaurant staff that offers new ideas and dimensions - not enough of these kind of people in that industry anymore.

Bottomline is that it was a great evening with the food and venue at E+O helping make a reunion of two HS friends from quite awhile back a nice night. Look forward to returning to E+O - thumbs up all the way!

I don't often write reviews.... but this place really deserves the kudos. 
The service is excellent. Food is delicious, flavorful and so fresh!
If you give this place a try, venture into some of the more authentic dishes. The szechwan asparagus w shrimp is out of this world!
Yume (or as I pronounce it, YUMMY)... you are definitely my new place to be!

Though our food took a while to come out, I have no complaints about the meal we had! Sushi was pretty fresh and not bad, and the Chinese dishes we ordered were tasty. Service was also pretty good.

I ordered the tuna naruto- an appetizer but similar to ordering a sushi roll- which I really liked. Fresh tuna wrapped in cucumber, and especially when ordered with a seaweed salad it's a great combination. I also tried the Bok choy vegetable dish, a Chinese beef dish, and a Chinese fish dish. All were delicious, though a bit much on the sauce portions. However, Chinese dishes are usually like that, so I didn't mind too much. 

Overall a satisfying meal in the suburbs- and this spot has a nice variety of Chinese and Japanese dishes to satisfy all tastes!

So i decided to go to Yume tonight and it was terrible. I did take out..  There were 4 of us eating and we all thought the same thing..  I had to get 4 egg rolls, when i only wanted 2.  Previously they made that exception and gave me 3..    The food tasted funny.  And i mean all of it   the fried stuff tasted wierd...  Egg rolls were not good, probably because of the oil.  Sweet sour sauce was terrible.  Fried rice seemed old.  The wonton soup was really salty...  

It was really that bad..   I hate wasting money on food...  I'd like to bring the food back...  

As i am sitting here my head hurts from the sodium..

I will not be back.

I ordered Yume for delivery (some of my lazy "I'm not going to cook" days). They have both Chinese and Japanese menus. I have not ordered off of the Chinese menu, but I have from the Japanese menu, and it was very good!

There is a $4 delivery fee (minimum of $10). You can order through Yelp. I have ordered multiple sushi rolls. They have a nice variety of nigiri, and maki, both more simple maki, and signature maki. I have had the more simple maki at other places, and it's all about the same. I have ordered the Dragon Maki, Snow Maki, Firecracker Maki, and others, and they are all very good.

The delivery is quick, ordering online is easy, and I feel like the prices are comparable to other places. I have never been to the actual location, so I can't vouch for that.

The crab rangoons are not my favorite, but everything else is good. So I would recommend it from what I know!

Although Yume isn't what I would call amazing it's the best tenant to be in this doomed location in the seven years I've been working in Schaumburg. The interior is much nicer than it used to be, service is much better, but...the food could still use some work. For a long time, ownership was staying the same but they kept reconcepting and/or changing the name. Well, Yume finally has brought new management & ownership to this location! 

I really want to try their sushi offerings but I've been really hesitant because I'm scurred! They have such an expansive menu with sushi just being one of a million offerings...my general thought it it can't be that fabulous then! But, I need to stop being so judgmental (I am who I am) and wait to pass my thoughts until I've actually eaten some of the raw fish.

I've tried their Chinese dishes a couple of times. The lunch specials for Chinese food are under $7 and a good size. It's a great deal and always makes both lunch & dinner for me which is fabulous. I've had the sesame chicken and the sweet & sour chicken. Both were just fine, neither was delicious, but they got the job done. I'll continue to go for their cheap lunch deals. They do 2 mono maki sushi rolls for $9.99 which is a good deal I wish to partake in in the future.

Overall, I'm happy to see this location busy, they've cleaned up a lot and are a decent location. I wish they'd step up the food a bit so it wouldn't be quite so bland and packed a bit more flavor.

I've passed this strip mall a million times but never expected to find this hidden gem.  Yes, I know it is not as well known as Yu's. However,  the food and service here will make you want to return back again. The staff here is highly attentive and quick. I never had to ask for extra napkins, extra napkins, refills...well you get my point. My glass somehow magically stayed full the entire time!     Now that is some service! 

They've a pretty big lunch special menu that has something for everyone. Kinda cool that the lunch specials are valid all week, not just weekdays. The fiance ordered the Yume Beef Tenderloin on my first visit here.  His entree was delicious and full of flavor.  I probably would've eaten the rest of his entree if I wasn't so full already.  My $12 dollar sashimi lunch special blew me away. When the waiter brought out my plate of sashimi it looked like a dish you would see at a 5 star restaurant. The fish was fresh and firm. The quality of the sushi and the presentation was outstanding. 

Honestly, the value and service here is just phenomenal. The servings are a bit big, but the food is delicious. I would probably eat here every week if I lived in the burbs. Quit reading this review and go eat at Yume!

everyone in my party loved this YUME restaurant and their delicious food late last night.  Reasonably priced and large portions served so we can pass around family style.  Try the Japanese non-carbonated soft drink CALPICO they serve as I did - very pleasing different flavor not too sweet.  another yelp reviewer previously pointed out this's a 'doomed location' and unfortunately there is some truth to that in that several oriental restaurant tenants have come and gone at that mall space before over the years.  Obviously they're determined and not reluctant to give it yet another shot.  Good luck to YUME as we want to return here in the long run

We ordered delivery from here. It arrived within the stated time. The chicken teriyaki was delicious and the highlight of our order. The tempura batter is quite heavy for tempura, which I didn't like. The crab rangoons were pretty good. 
The unfortunate part of the order was the sushi. I ordered nigiri because I've had a huge craving for a week now, and I couldn't wait. The order must have been poorly handled or improperly packed; the sushi had tipped over and mixed into the wasabi before getting to me. There was so much of it all over my nigiri that it was inedible (and I don't shy away from wasabi). $5.50 isn't cheap for 2 pieces of salmon nigiri, so I was really disappointed. Please be more careful with your delivery orders! If we do decide to give Yume another chance, we will definitely eat in rather than order delivery.

Coming here every week from now on. 
Had the miso soup, pad Thai and Mongolian beef. 
Anthony the waiter was the kindest, polite. And most friendly person ever!!!!!!

I love walking into a restaurant and being greeted like they are truly glad we are there. That's how I felt when we walked into Yume. The owner, Ken, and our favorite bartender, Jeff, made us feel so welcomed from the moment we stepped inside. Ken was formerly at TL's in Bartlett, so we've known him as a top notch server for quite a while. And we live in Bartlett, so the fact that we happily drove to Schaumburg and plan to do so again will tell you something about our visit. 

I couldn't help it. I compared everything to TL's mainly because the similarities were striking. 

The service...we had excellent service at Yume. My glass was never more than half empty. Plates were cleared quickly when it was obvious we were ready for them to do so. Food was served promptly and did not sit waiting to die again before we ate it. 

The menu...the options were plentiful and yes there were some very similar dishes. So I ordered them to compare. The szechuan dumplings were tastier here as was the Mongolian beef and the philly roll. Let's talk about that philly roll for a second. The ratios in this roll were spot on!  So much so that my husband mentioned it at least twice. It's nice to order a roll that isn't overwhelmingly cream cheesy. 

The space...I found it to be clean which is high on the list for me. We chuckled at the crystal chandeliers as they are overkill, but the bar and the sushi bar look great and it is obvious a lot of care went into doing things right.

The only thing that I didn't flip head over heels for would be the lobster mango roll. Honestly, I think it's me. I don't order lobster basically ever and when Ken suggested I try the roll and it looked so beautiful, I was all in. I liked the sauce and the mangoes, but the lobster wasn't my favorite. I think it was a little too salty for my palate. 

Take a trip over to Yume. It's easy to find with plenty of parking in the lot. We didn't have to wait which was a major plus for us and the service was just as it should be - excellent!  Can't wait to try more things on the menu!!

It's hard to be the new kid at school, especially when the popular kid's been around for decades. Ok, maybe not the greatest analogy, but Yume has some tough obstacles to face. It's in an odd location, it took over the spot of another restaurant (so people may not know that it's new), and people just have a fondness for Yu's Mandarin up the street. But Yume is definitely worth the visit and you may find you have a new favorite Chinese (and Japanese) spot in Schaumburg.

We came here on a Sunday for lunch, and were pleasantly surprised to see they have lunch specials even on the weekend. I went with the Yume Beef Tenderloin. I got a soup, spring roll, rice, a ton of beef and veggies, all for under $10. The YBT is a must-try - crispy peppery beef full of spicy aroma. Just the right amount of sweetness and stickiness, it's not like anything I've had anywhere else. The fiance went with their sashimi lunch special. I tried some of her tuna and found it firm and fresh, and she said she really enjoyed it. We also sampled the Firecracker roll, and it was a great bite for something that could have been too gimmicky.

The service was great and overall the value almost has me wishing I'd move out to the burbs (almost). Heck, we even caught my grandma sneaking a bite of her broccoli - she usually hates veggies to the extent of picking onions out of her noodles, so it's quite the testament to this place. Excited to come back for dinner and try their surf and turf combo, which is basically the YBT but with shrimp.

Exactly at 3 stars for me. The decor is definitely nicer than the previous tenants and the service is very friendly but the higher prices (although portion size is pretty good) and the uninspired cooking prevent it from scoring any higher for me.

Food overall is pretty bland, devoid of texture and seasoning for the most part (not often you can order a szechuan style dish and eat the whole thing without sweating even a drop). The food itself is not actually bad, presented nicely and with good colors --- nothing is really overcooked or unpleasant. But, I'm confused since it's not very Americanized (fried, tons of sauce, very flavorful) but the flavors aren't very traditional either. It doesn't even sit in the fusion category of restaurants like Sun Shui or Pei Wei -- just food that doesn't excel at either and becomes very unmemorable.

Here were my thoughts on specific items:

Egg drop soup - Pretty watery, not a super strong egg flavor and consistency needs to be thicker.

Hot and sour soup - Lacks depth of flavor, was a bit spicy and had a good kick of pepper.

Spring roll - Filled with tons of cabbage, crispy skin but almost tasteless filling.

Vegetable fried rice - Had a decent amount of wok-hay for rice only stirred with vegetables, didn't have excessive amounts of soy sauce.

Crispy garlic shrimp - Not really super tasty for shrimp surrounded with tons of chilis, pepper, and onion, but enjoyable overall. Probably the best dish I tried.

Steamed halibut - Good sized filet, a bit soft on the meat texture and almost no flavor from the ginger and scallions. Depended too much on the soy sauce for flavor but a great deal for the low 7.75 lunch price.

Cumin lamb - Meat was tender, but could've rendered out a bit more fat. Despite being surrounded by tons of peppers, scallions, and onions -- the dish wasn't that flavorful and the cumin and chili oil weren't that noticeable.

Overall, this restaurant was alright -- food wasn't very exciting but it wasn't bad either.

Good place to go if you are in area. Went on Sunday night, was pretty slow, service was spot on. Couldn't have asked more from my server. Seaweed salad was great, very large portion, almost too much. Almost. 

Hot and sour soup that came with deluxe sashimi plate was very tasty. Not so much sour, as it was black peppery. But still tasted good enough devour the whole bowl! 

Only reasons for 4 stars.... The yellow tail sashimi on deluxe plate was off tasting, minerally, little fishy, I only ate one piece. But everything else, tuna, salmon, tako... On the sashimi deluxe plate was excellent. Loved the octopus! Yum. Came here Because of the pics of oysters and clams and uni, sadly they had none of them available :( another reason for 4 stars) There is one TV, so if you are wanting to watch a sports game, hope other customers want towatch same game. I wanted watch playoff hockey, but people were watching basketball. 

Didn't meet the owners, but sushi chefs are Chinese, If that matters to you. I heard no-one speaking Japanese, and I speak decent Japanese. Only heard Mandarin. 

I would deff come back-to-back the service rocked. But don't expect authentic Japanese anything....very Americanized 

Peace

Ok seriously, FORGET Yu's...cuz everything about Yume is 10x better.  I wandered in for dinner on a Thursday evening recently, and ponied up to their small bar setup since I was dining solo.  I asked for them to change the channel to TNT to watch the playoffs pregame show, and they just handed me the remote and said, "go for it."  Something about that small gesture convinced me I was in for a real treat!

I ordered the spicy salmon maki and the basil garlic chicken as my entrees.  Both were absolutely PERFECT!  I know there have been some reviews that talked about the price being too high, but for the quality AND quantity of the food, plus the attentive service, I consider this place to be a bargain compared to Yu's.  Huge portions, plus the staff checking in often enough take sure everything was good.  Even though it wasn't super busy when I was there, they seemed a bit short-staffed but they were ALL over it!

Living nearby, I will be coming back for sure!

I ordered for delivery and also have dined in once and picked up food before. They have a bar inside and regular seating area. Good lunch specials during the week on food/drinks if you dine in or ordering to go. The sushi is the only good thing to me here. They have a great selection of spicy ones! My favorite is the spicy crab. 

The potstickers (spicy), are terrible and a waste of money.They had no spice at all and they were super chewy! Also have ordered the Mongolian lunch special with vegetable fried rice, it had no flavor at all and the rice seemed old or had been sitting out! 

Overall, Delivery/service in general is quick if you are on a time limit. Prices are comparable to other places. If your craving sushi then definitely try them out!
Was there tonight. They just did everything right. And the egg rolls continue to shine! Service was actually too attentive.........but that's just me.  Probably my new favorite eat-in place.

The ambience is most pleasant and clean.   Service is fast, polite, and en point.   

Ordered wonton soup.  The soup base was very well flavored, and PLENTY of wontons.   It was late in the evening so I started to get full on them,...  quickly... 

My date ordered Mongolian Beef.  I had a taste.   Also very good.   Will attach a picture of it. 

For appetizer, we ordered the scallion pancakes.   Can't go wrong with that, either.....   

Overall, a nice place.   Open till 9:30pm - on a Sunday!!!  That's enough to keep us happy...

I was searching for a sushi place nearby my job and found Yume. Ordered crab Rangoon, vegetable spring rolls, spicy tuna maki roll, and red dragon maki roll. I was told it would take 20 minutes. I arrived a little bit after 20 minutes and I was told my order would take only a couple more minutes. I was fine with it, and waited. Within the 25 minutes I waited, I was never updated on my meal, was never offered anything to drink, never received a sincere apology, completely ignored. Heard one girl say to the other after 10 minutes, "where is her order?" And never told me what the kitchen said. Then once the younger girls were out of earshot, the woman making the drinks at the bar, started complaining to the people at the bar about how the younger girls don't know how to do anything and are not good at their jobs. Not professional at all to tell to customers, even if they ask. Once I finally got my food, I left and received a couple "sorry"s from one girl. The younger girls were nice. Once I got home, I realized I did not receive the wasabi mayo I paid for. The only thing that made this whole experience better was the taste of some of the food. Very unprofessional though and I don't know if I would go back.

One, this review is only for the sushi. Two, I'm wavering between a 3 and a 4 here and I just can't  decide so they're getting a 4 because for some reason I'm feeling generous today. Don't get too excited. It won't last. 

Anyway, we stopped in on a Saturday right as they opened (11:30ish) and we were one of 4 or 5 tables sat. That's got to be a good sign, yes? I must say, the hostess and waitstaff were really nice and accommodating of our tiny human which isn't typical at a sushi joint. And speaking of waitstaff? There was also at least 4 people helping tables, bartending, seating, etc. which is also not typical for a sushi place either...I swear there's always one lone server in the weeds the entire visit at most Japanese places. 

As for the food, it was pretty decent and it was suuuuuuuuuper cheap. We got a three roll lunch special each, an order of gyoza, and soup (which I'm pretty sure came with the lunch special) for $38. Granted, it wasn't fancy rolls but rather had regular old maki, but still. I got three spicy rolls: tuna, salmon, and yellowtail.  The rolls are kind of small and the rice is hard(ish) BUT they were fresh, weren't complete mush and mayo (they at least had a little bit of chunks), and tasted spicy(ish). Since I'm a complete sushi snob I wish that they were chunkier and spicier but they were certainly good. I would say that for the Schaumburg area they are on par with Minami and Sake, WAY better than Sushi Yama, and slightly less delicious than Daruma.

We've just found Yume within the last two months and it's now our go to Chinese/Japanese place. My two favorite items are the Boston maki and the Honey Walnut Shrimp. Their shrimp are huge compared to other places with a slightly sweet sauce. The Boston maki was fresh and delicious. You see the sushi/maki made right in front of you. 

Excellent service too.

If you want to try it out, go on a Saturday. They have lunch specials during that time. Another plus is their delivery. Highly recommend.

I ate here for dinner and had the Hong Kong roast duck.  The place is clean and nicely decorated and my server was friendly and prompt.

The duck was disappointing.  The meat was overcooked and kind of mushy.  The duck was seasoned well, and the bed of bean sprouts added nice texture and made the meal healthy.

I left the restaurant disappointed - maybe it was just my dish, but the portions were good sized and I did finish my meal.

This restaraunt is located in possibly the most, IMO, doomed for failure malls in the entire Schaumburg area and the actual location has a rather undesireable past HOWEVER Yume looks like they might turn this around!  :-)

My initial encounter with Yume was a delivery order.  It arrived VERY QUICKLY and everything was done to perfection!  :-)

Thereafter I've been there for dinner and while the atmosphere/decor doesn't seem to have changed much from older days of other, failed restaurants occupying that space, the service and food are both FABULOUS!  

I did notice that the owner/manager seemed to focus on just ONE particular table as opposed to "making the rounds" to greet other guests even though the two times I've been there the restaurant wasn't crowded at all.  It's not that big of a deal but I guess a big enough one that I noticed.

The food is EXCELLENT and the server seemed to wear many hats including tending bar.  

Oddly, the food provided in delivery seems to be superior to that ordered in the actual location.  All are excellent but for some unknown reason delivery food ranks higher, IMO, than the food on location.

In any event, 5 stars from me!

Recently I have been frequenting Tensuke & Mitsuwa for Japanese cuisine, but, they are a bit further away.  Zume is just a couple blocks from my home and offers a great selection of food.  I was reluctant at first to go here because I remember the last 2 restaurants that were in this spot weren't that great (Chinese Garden & Aloha - both had same owners).  This place has a new owner and is much nicer!  The interior has been redone and has a quaint relaxed feel.  I had tempura appetizer (2 shrimp & 5 veggies), egg rolls, & miso soup on my first visit;  all were very good!  The staff was very kind and fast to refill drinks and check if I needed anything else.  All in all, great first visit!  

On my 2nd visit here I had miso soup & tempura appetizer again (they were great the first time, so I had to get them again!  They were again great!), and orange chicken.  The orange chicken was a huge serving and was very tasty!  I admit I haven't really had orange chicken at a good restaurant, more just from the 'fast food' type Chinese places.  So compared to those, this orange chicken was simply amazing!

One nice thing about this restaurant is it basically has 2 menus: one for Japanese and one for Chinese.  The menu is split down the middle; half for Japanese & half for Chinese. It's very easy to navigate the menu and the choices are extensive.

On my 3rd visit I decided to try some sushi.  I started with an appetizer of tempura calamari (First time having tempura calamari and I think I like it more than the standard fried calamari at non Asian restaurants), then had a toro tuna nigiri, & salmon maki.  The sushi tasted great and super fresh!

Prices are reasonable as well.  I would recommend anyone who lives in the area to give it a try!

***Update.  I have now been here many more times.  The food and service are always great!  I have tried a variety of their sushi & cooked dishes and have always been pleased with how fresh and tasty their food is!

I just don't understand how this place got 4.5 star rating. Slowest service I've experienced and the food was horrible. Chinese food was over-seasoned and the sushi quality was 0/5. Would never come back.

3.50 stars (gave it 4 stars due to the service)

I thought the calamari and the scallion pancakes were too greasy. The pancakes didn't look anything like the picture on the menu. I enjoyed the New England clam chowder and the dry chili chicken dinner extra spicy. Very tasty. A little more diced scallions would of been nice. Other plates looked savory and plentiful. I heard the egg drop soup was good. Service was very accommodating and friendly. Prices were reasonable. Overall an ok experience. We didn't order from the Japanese side of the menu but I did see delicious looking plates whizzing by me. I'll have to try their sushi next time.

I'm not yet convinced this place is better than Yu's as was reviewed previously. Perhaps this is so if one orders from the Japanese menu.

IBB(maybe)

located at the former "aloha grill"...they are newly opened...plenty of elbow space between tables...very clean and somewhat newly renovated interior...plenty of parking...best deals are the various lunch specials offered 7 days a week...sushi is good, fresh, and well presented...always order pan fried noodles extra crispy so you don't get them soggy (i always order it this way anywhere when possible)...friendly and attentive staff...generous portion, good flavor, fresh ingredients at affordable prices...you-me eat yummy sushi at yume and you-may bring tumi to-me...now say that 10x

This place is lovely to dine-in. The staff is pleasant and courteous, the sushi and sashimi are delicious and fresh, and the lunch special is available even on the weekends (no substitutions, FYI).

A la carte, the items are somewhat expensive. I'd stick with the two or three roll specials if you prefer maki. I recommend the spicy tuna and the hamachi! I'm dying to try the salmon don. 

Ordering takeout is a bit difficult, which is why I knocked this place down a star. We had a major language barrier issue which resulted in them making an extra roll and having to remove it and re-bag everything when I came to pick it up. Wish they offered online ordering!

This Newly opened restaurant has delicious Sushi & Entree dishes. Stop in for lunch, or dinner to experience Japanese and Chinese Cuisine.
Owner, Ken will insure the freshest quality of food.  You'll give it 5 stars also.

This was my second time trying Japanese, and I was excited to give it a second go!  I had tried sushi before, and unfortunately it was not a great experience.  This time, on the advice of my date, I ordered the spider roll, her thought process being that I may find the cooked sushi more agreeable.  I'm happy to say she was right!  If you are new to sushi or Japanese cuisine, perhaps that may be a helpful piece of advice.
     For an entree, I ordered the Mongolian beef with miso soup, and my date ordered the orange chicken with sweet and sour soup.  The miso soup was very good.  The broth was really salty, which me and my date both enjoy.  The sweet and sour soup was tasty, but a little too spicy for me (I'm kind of a baby with spicy foods).  The Mongolian beef was excellent, very tender, and really tasty.  The orange chicken was quite good as well (probably my favorite Asian dish so far).  It was not spicy at all, but was very flavorful.
     At this point, my opinion on Asian eateries may not be worth much, but if I were you, I'd give Yume a shot.  Especially if, like me, you're new to Japanese.
     Ps, for this only being my third time eating Asian cuisine (Korean, Japanese, Japanese), I have to say I crushed it with the chopsticks.  Literally didn't drop one piece of food.  Begin slow clap now...

I live around the corner and watched this being transformed from Aloha something or other.  It is in the same strip as Udupi (Indian) and Maxfields (family diner).  
I couldn't wait for it to open and give it a try.  I have been to many sushi places in the burbs as well as the city.  This one is right up there with the best of them.
The menu is color coded purple for Chinese and blue for Japanese.
Very well organized and easy to follow.
Service was exceptional.  Refilled drinks, fresh plates between courses and checking back often to make sure everything was going well.

We started with a crab rangoon off of the Chinese menu. 7 or 8 to an order and bursting with filling served with a ramekin of sweet and sour and mustard on request.
My daughter and I split the 3 maki special for $15.95 at dinner.  We chose the smoked salmon/cream cheese, spicy hamachi and shrimp tempura.  There were many other to choose from.  The ones we had were very fresh and tasty.
My sister ordered Mongolian shrimp which came with a choice of three different soups.  The dish was rich and sweet with just a little spice and was described perfectly be our server.

I highly recommend this restaurant and want to keep it around!
If you're headed toward Conant high school for anything, make this a destination and grab a bite to eat!

Everyone wasn't kidding that this place is super awesome!
I got the Firecracker roll with spicy salmon and fresh salmon on top. It was so flavorful, with a hint of richness from the mayo and a fresh but not overpowering citrus flavor from the lemon rinds with which they artfully decorate the roll. Definitely plan to get Yume again. There isn't much sushi in this area that tastes better - only Daruma and the further out Renga Tei.
Let's all support Yume so they can stay in that seemingly cursed restaurant location! Pretty please :3 :3 :D

I ordered carryout chicken fried rice. It was the plainest, blandest dish ever. my egg rolls were undercooked and the soup that came with was very salty and gelatinous. 
I hate to sound negative but it was a very disappointing meal.  The staff was very friendly at least.

I've driven by often but hadn't noticed since the days the place was "Chinese Garden" and then "Aloha". 
We went there yesterday and ordered Crab Rangoon, Orange Chicken and vegetable fried rice for 4 people (2 adults and 2 kids).
The food was outstanding, the prices reasonable, quantity was very good and the quality was great. Service was quick and the place was clean and open, compared to how it was when it was called Chinese Garden. There was a good crowd and we got a nice window booth.
We will definitely visit again. I hope they maintain their quality. They are not well known, they need to invest in marketing, through coupons, or Groupon.

My husband and I decided to eat here this past Wednesday night from the great reviews here on Yelp. I didn't even know this place was here! All I can say is WOW! Both of us started with the Hot & Sour Soup which was very hot in temperature (a must for soup but sadly lacking in a fair number of restaurants) and also had a pleasant spice that built as I ate more and more. My husband ordered the Crispy Garlic Shrimp from the Chinese side of the menu. It had so many huge shrimp with beautiful peppers and onions. It was flavorful (I sneaked a bite!) and just the right amount of heat. I ordered from the Japanese side of the menu. First off I had the Tuna Avocado Sumiso which had huge chunks of the freshest tuna I have ever had over avocado with a beautiful sauce that was just the right amount. I also order the baked mussels which were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside with a nice crab flavor from the filling. I then had two of the signature make rolls. The Red Dragon had beautiful tuna on top and was good but I didn't get any spice from it. The sauce was very good on the side. The next roll was the Fire Cracker. I can say without a doubt that this was the best sushi I have ever had!! It came with thin lemon slices in between every few pieces. It had a sesame chili sauce drizzled on top and the combination with the lemon flavor, salmon and cilantro was a flavor explosion in my mouth. I LOVE this roll!! The only thing better would be more lemon slices to get more of that citrus zing! Otherwise perfection! 

After dinner we decided to try a drink at the bar since they had a nice drink menu. My husband had the Dark & Stormy which had Myers Rum, Ginger Beer and Lime. He said it was spicy and good. I had the Passion Gaga which had Strawberry Nigori Sake, Grey Goose vodka, fresh strawberries and lime juice. So refreshing and delicious. I usually don't like sweet drinks (Hello extra dirty martini!) but this had no extra sugar and was wonderful. 

So excited to have found this fabulous new place. They haven't been there long but the food is so very fresh and inventive. I am looking forward to going back again soon! I can't wait to try the Chinese side of the menu! 

Okay, confession time, went again yesterday for take-out sushi, had another drink while waiting (Pomegranate Martini-wow again!) and the food was just as good and fresh. This place is a must for Chinese and Japanese food in Schaumburg!!

I was so pleasantly surprised with Yume!! Sushi is my favorite food, so eating it as much as I do, I definitely can tell you which is good and which is not so good. Needless to say, I really enjoyed the sushi here! There's a lot of great lunch specials, and all day sushi specials if you want to buy a few rolls for less. Their specialty rolls are delicious, and their homemade sauce has a great tangy taste to it. The interior design is modern, clean, and on the fancier side of casual. Our server was new and seemed a little nervous, but was very nice and informative. They also deliver if you feel like ordering in.  Definitely a new hidden gem of Schaumburg!

Nice to finally have a good restaurant in this location after so many dismal failures.  Went to lunch here with my kids and in-laws and there was something for everybody. Delicious General Tso's for me, salmon for the parents, bento box for my wife, and good kids meals. Decor is nice and fresh as well, and a very friendly staff.  Prices were good too for the lunch specials, plenty of food for a lunch at about $6-7 a person. I'll be back.

We got our order for pick-up. 

The good: 
Sushi was super tasty. We got the red dragon roll and yume roll. Fresh and very good. Came with soy sauce.
Spicy chili oil chicken was very good but too spicy for me (partner liked it a lot - get it if you like spicy - the texture was GREAT too).
Monogolian beef was good.
Food was done quickly and packaged nicely.

The bad:
They only gave us two very small servings of rice. Not nearly enough rice to go with each entree.
No fortune cookies.
The soup they gave us with the entrees was not good. I'm not sure what kind it was (sweet and sour or egg drop or a combo of the two) and I didn't know it came with the meal, but I would have rather had egg rolls or something if I had known it came with. Neither of us ate the soup.

I will be going back here with a friend for just sushi and eating in to see what it's like to eat there. I thought the sushi was really good, and maybe they just don't have their to-go system down yet. Worth a try!

We had the whole family out to Yume for our weekly dinner. We were all very impressed by everything Yume had to offer.

They offer traditional appetizers and others with the owner's added twist. The special clams and oysters were phenomenal. 

Our group tried a wide variety of the menu. While everything was great, some notable main dishes  were the beef tenderloin, the princess Thai chicken, and the red snapper. 

Being with a large group we appreciated that Yume offers pitchers of Sapporo and other Japanese beers. 

Additionally, while serving a large group is never easy, the staff at Yume was great. I can't speak highly enough of our experience. Yume is a must try, affordable, high-quality restaurant that quickly became our favorite.

This place has taken place of a couple of other restaurants. My husband got take out. 
   EXCELLENT!! Best sushi and maki!! Even the misogyny soup was tasty!! Next time we are going back for the chinese

3.25 Stars , 1 star was taken away due to lack of service 3 of the 4 times I've been here

I've been here various times and I do notice one thing they lack which is service.  The food is great.  The sushi is fresh and the Chinese food is really good.  Being Asian we have high expectations of the food and it has been met.  I had called in 3 weeks ahead for a reservation of 14 and requested that the table be set up in the back room since it had more windows and had more lighting.  However when we got there we were setup in the front where it was really dark at 6.30pm.  I ask the manager or hostess that I had requested the table in the back room so they were not sure what to do.  I insisted that I get the tables in the other room and they said they would get us settled in but it took 20 minutes to do this ?  Really a party of 14 ?  You had 3 weeks notice and this is a Saturday with 1 waitress working the entire night ?  We ended up spending 600+ and I am truly disappointed with the poor slow service.  I will come back for the food but it will be either takeout or sometime when it's NOT busy because it seems like they don't have enough staff to service during the busy dinner hours.

Exterior does not reflect the interior. This place is nice and clean. The food was tasty and well executed. The menu incorporates cuisine from Japan, China, and Thaiwan, and more. There is something for everyone. 

The prices are more than fair. I will be going back without a doubt. Great place for a date.

That said, I only got a small taste of what they have to offer. Soup, dumplings, and 2 standard Maki rolls for dinner. I was stuffed. I would order the same items again.  Next time I will have to try one of their specialties. 

Glad I went. Give this place a chance.

Sought out this place for lunch and then went back for dinner within the week.  The service is a good but a little rocky, I'm still giving out an A for effort.  The crispy garlic shrimp was fantastic!  I have only had Chinese dishes but I will definitely be back to try the sushi, the menu is huge!

Decided to try this place this past Saturday.  As other's have said, the service was great.  The restaurant was clean,   We liked the variety of the menu as well.  I had the General Tso's chicken and was pleased to see it came with Broccoli.  So many places have stopped serving it with Broccoli.  If you like spicy, try the Dry Chili Chicken was we had that as well.  Spicy, but tasty.  The spice did not overpower the other flavors so that was nice.  We also order pot stickers, and got 6.  They were HUGE!!.  They could almost be a meal themselves.  The dipping sauce was great was well.

In general, it's not too bad. We ordered scallion pancakes, Szechuan spicy string beans, Yume delight that is a combination of beef tenderloin and shrimps, and 3 sushi rolls including spicy tuna, spicy yellow tail and eel cucumber. They are all tasty but with issues. The pancakes are too oily, the Szechuan spicy string beans are not spicy at all, the shrimps are nice but the beef tenderloin are not in good quality, sushi rolls are a total disaster. Also, all dishes are quite salty. The environment is nice and quiet. The only complaint is that they place a super bright light above each small table, not sure for what purpose.

Last Saturday my mom and I decided to check out Yume. We had been patrons at Aloha and Chinese Garden. In my opinion, Yume far exceeds these two restaurants.

Same location, new owners and staff. The service was excellent. We went mid-afternoon because we had heard that they had lunch specials on the weekend. Their lunch specials are huge! You receive your entree, rice (fried rice if you want) and spring roll. Great lunch prices too. 

We started with the Crab Rangoon, which was good.

I had the Sesame Chicken. It's a good indicator of how good the food may be. Their Sesame Chicken was absolutely delicious. The saw was slightly sweet and not overcooked. My mom got the Mongolian Beef. The beef was so tender and the sauce was super savory. It was much better than Yu's. These dishes were our litmus test to be more adventurous.

Next time we'll try some of the Japanese dishes.
Sushi was great! Very fresh, great service. Tried a few different rolls, liked it a lot! Tried their plum wine, not exactly what I expected but still good.

Absolutely horrible service. Like as in the worst.  Food was good, if you get it in a timely manner. If you go with someone else don't expect to get your meals at the same time. You should also hope that there are off the clock staff there because if not you might not get any service at all.  We watched 2 other tables get up and leave absolutely furious. I promise you that the will never be back and I'm betting we aren't the only ones

I was so excited when I saw this as a new restaurant added to GrubHub... NO. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. First of all, the food was extremely expensive for the quality, the food took over two hours to get here, one hour after promised arrival time and then upon arrival the food was ICE COLD and gross. The restaurant is 1.6 miles away from my place of business... there was NO excuse when I got a text at 4:46 pm ( already an hour after placed order) saying that my driver was on the way... At 5:20 I called asking what was going on and was told there was "heavy traffic in the area" as if I couldn't look out the window and tell that that was a lie. THEN, it still took another 24 minutes for my food to arrive. 1.6 MILES AWAY!!! It was a pretty expensive piece of garbage since the food ended up straight in the trash due to it being cold and gag-worthy. I hope that dining in is better than their delivery service but either way I will never step foot inside or offer them my business ever again.

Great food. Excellent service. Relaxing atmosphere with modern design. If you are looking for authentic Chinese and Japanese cuisine then Yume has just about everything for you. Definitely highly recommended!

This was a great find!  The food, service and cleanliness were 5 Star.  I couldn't have wished up a better waiter!!  The menu includes a very large variety that would meet anyone's demands.  They have a great selection of spicy dishes which are perfect for me!  It's not crowded and also has a nice bar area.  I will definitely be back here!!!

Best variety of Asian food in the area. Large portions , reasonable prices, friendly staff, has replaced Yu's as our go to for Asian food! Highly recommend black pepper beef and hot chili chicken or fish.
Excellent food and service!!  It is hard to find good sushi and this is it. Reasonable prices also.

After eating most of our meals and sharing an appetizer it occurred to us to leave a great review and share a picture of the food we're about to finish. The Mongolian beef, halibut filet and crab Rangoon were excellent, as was the homemade sweet dipping sauce. We're thrilled to have found this place (via Yelp)
Solid across the board. Most importantly, sushi was outstanding. Service was great and the restaurant and bathrooms were nice and clean. Can't wait to go back.

My wife and I have been looking for a good Chinese/Asian fusion restaurant in the area since we moved out this way this past January. When I saw Yume on here, with all the great reviews, I thought I'd give them a call. The guy I spoke with said they Don't use ANY MSG in their food, however it is already in some of their appetizers and soup, which is expected. But NO MSG in their main dishes at all. So, being that it was also my birthday and after a great workout, we thought we'd check it out.

Location: in a strip mall/plaza area, near other restaurants (so lots of parking).
Inside: Bar to the left with White Sox game on, separate tables and booths for seating (nice booths), Sushi bar to the right, bathrooms to the back.

Pros:
-They don't use MSG in any of their food (thought there's already some in some of their appetizers and soups).
-Nice, quiet area for eating
-Paper tablecloths (for creative art)
-I don't know if I was just thirsty, or if the water was just that good, but I was really into it.
-Clean
-The service was very hospitable and professional - kind people.
-The food was SO GOOD!
 --I got the Florida garlic dish with scallops. I can't remember the last time I ate something where the chef knew exactly how to use garlic (I like to sweat garlic). The scallops were also perfectly cooked. It was SO good (I brought some home to enjoy later). Came with rice and soup (see soup note below).
--My wife got the orange chicken, but asked that it be mild (it's regularly spicy here). I don't like Orange Chicken, but I really liked it here. Not too sweet, not to doughy, came with rice, broccoli, and soup.
-The price was reasonable.
-No long wait for the food
-I'd say it's authentic.
-Sox won, Cubs were rained out  :)

Cons:
-All their soups (except one with fish) had MSG. MSG hurts me, so I just opted out of soup.
-MSG in some of their appetizers, also.
-The Garlic dish I got didn't have any veggies in it (the server said he believed there'd be mushrooms, water chestnuts, and maybe other veggies in it).
-No wifi (or not free, anyway)

I still have to try their Chicken & Broccoli (my common test for Chinese food), but from our experience last night, I believe I can honestly say that we've found our new favorite local Asian restaurant.

We ordered take out: Thai princess chicken, pepper beef, sesame chicken and a whole lot of sushi.  Everything was really good for take out. They didn't skimp on the amount of beef or chicken We finally found our go to Thai place.

I was pretty excited when I saw a new Asian restaurant near me getting great reviews.  I was even more please to see the variety - sushi, noodle soups, chinese, thai-style dishes.  

Our first visit went fairly well - tried the cumin lamb and the crunchy prawns for lunch.  The portion was ample, the taste was pretty good (a bit too much cumin and too many red peppers to pick out) with plenty of fresh stir-fried vegetables.  The service was quick and pleasant.

Next we tried takeout and on the whole were pleased with our order (rice noodles with bbq pork, cumin lamb, a spicy thai chicken dish) though everyone in the family liked something different.

The next lunch was not so successful.  Service was very slow.  The basil chicken dish is just awful - dried not fresh basil is used!!

One more try at dinner - let's try a hard to mess-up standby like kung pao chicken.  And now I realized what I don't like about their taste - everything is sweet and the chicken has an odd texture and taste.  

Sorry - it just doesn't satisfy so I don't think we will be returning here much even though it's just down the street.

My boyfriend and I decided to go here on a Sunday afternoon and I was pleasantly surprised by the experience. The waiting staff was quick to seat us and were attentive without being overbearing. I ordered the Sashimi Deluxe and it was very good! The presentation was great and the fish was so fresh. There was a fair amount to share between two big eaters. We also ordered salmon cuts on rice and some sweet shrimp. We ordered the shrimp deep fried and it had the right amount of crisp to it! All in all it was a very pleasant experience. The only thing keeping me from giving it a full 5 stars was the fact that were seated by the bathroom when there were a couple of other seating options available. But there was no bad smell! The whole place was very clean. :)

This restaurant has been completely refurbished. The interior is very spacious and well lit. While the decor is not exceptional the place is laid out well with a bar on one side and the sushi bar on the opposite side of the room. The restaurant menu is very similar to TL Lounge in Bartlett and the food is equally as good if not better. The beef in sizzling platter has an excellent gravy and the beef very tender. The same can be said for the basil chicken. Steamed halibut with ginger and scallions was also superb. 

I was there in a group of 10 and all loved the food and will be returning. The prices are extremely reasonable and the lunches are a real bargain.

We live right next to Yumes so we figured we'd give it a try ! The portions were pretty good sized and the crab ragoon was great! Over all it wasn't anything spectacular and it was kinda over priced .

Returned many of times after the first and been so happy with this place except now ,the service was so bad ,waited at front door for over 5 min to be seated no one around ,they were busy and maybe having growing pains ,took over 5 min after being seated to get drinks also ,the food is great here .
Tried this place with my husband for the first time. Delicious! We did take out but the inside looks great! So excited to have a new Chinese/Japanese restaurant near us!
I had the crab rangoon, pot stickers, beef lo me in, and orange chicken and it was delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Boring food.  I ordered the lunch Kung Pow chicken.  Had lots of dried chilli's but no heat at all.  The sauce actually was a little sweet. It was almost as if it had corn syrup in it.  Proportion of vegetables to chicken was probably 6 to 1. If your a big eater and like bland food, the $7 price is good.  The Hot and sour soup had a good pepper taste but no sour at all.  I didn't like the consistency either.  It was too thick and slimy.  Staff is friendly and service was good.
Good Chinese food and sushi roll. Really good lunch as well. I like their Kung pao chicken and the tempura roll
Chinese & Japanese.  Some of the better sushi we've had the area.  Great food, huge menu, wonderful staff.  Highly recommended.
Easily the best Chinese/ Japanese restaurant in the area. Great food, great service. Why go anywhere else?

Yume is on my top list for dining. My wife and I enjoy going to this new chinese restaurant that we reasonly found. The food was fantastic and the place is very clean. We get to meet the owner Ken and he is a very cool guy! I love the scallop roll and crispy shrimp....

The food tasted very bad..I got orange dragon, red dragon, volcano, pot sticker, and crab ragoon. Didn't enjoy all of it. Compared to minami sushi, rolls were in very small pieces even though it was a special roll and the fish didn't taste fresh at all. Dough on pot sticker was too thick.
New Chinese & Japanese restaurant in Schaumburg. Bright and clean interior. I ordered the orange chicken and sushi set for dinner. It's delicious. Not that expensive as well. Worth going again!
Wonderfully fresh food & excellent, attentive service. Enjoyed an after-cinema dinner. will definitely return.

I am totally confused that people have given this place 5 stars.  My one star is for the service only. Our server was very attentive and welcoming. The food however was not very good. We eat sushi regularly and the fish here was not very good, after tasting one uni my husband was afraid to eat the second. My son tried the tuna nigiri and thought it not very fresh.  We ordered two of the house specialties, the beef tenderloin and spicy crispy shrimp and they were just ok. I really don't know how anyone can put this place is the same class as Yu's.  We will not be returning.
Incredible sushi, even better service! Ken and his staff have it dialed in! Best sushi in the western suburbs!

My husband and I live very close to this restaurant and were wondering how it was given the previous 2 restaurants in that location were terrible.  After reading the reviews on Yelp we decided to give it a try and were very, very pleased.  The dcor is excellent, the staff very friendly and helpful and the food is delicious.  The first time I had shrimp tempura and the portions are generous and the shrimp was done perfectly.  My husband had garlic chicken and again it was delicious.  We went back again this evening and had some sushi, the vegetable low mein and the spicy asparagus with shrimp.  All dishes were excellent!!!  Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.
Really good sushi. The owner was previous server at TL's four seasons in Bartlett Illinois. I have not tried the Chinese side yet, but will next week.

My husband and I love "lunch specials" and since we live nearby, we will be regulars at Yume!  Entrees range from $6.95 to $8.95 and include soup, spring roll and rice.  So far, I have enjoyed the broccoli combo (shrimp, beef and chicken)(twice )and the Mongolian combo. My husband loves the sweet and sour chicken and the mongolian beef. Our friend was very happy with the Bento Box with teriyaki salmon. Lots of delicious food!  They've been in Schaumburg about 3 months and I hope they will be quite successful.
Nice atmosphere, the owner is a very nice guy. Amazing food. High quality sashimi deluxe, very reasonable price.
Amazing food, great service and friendly staff! I recommend this place to big groups and family with kids bc they are so accommodating. Every dish I tried was very tasty.
Delicious dinner.  Owner and staff gracious.  Will definitely return.
Solid buffet.  My gf took me there. I paid.  I was well fed. Good service. Huge variety of all Asian buffet greatest hits..  I'll be back

Date of my visit: 14-October-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

I was in a mood for a buffet for lunch today.  I looked this place up on Yelp! and it looked like it would be either a hit or a miss.

When I arrived, I asked how much the buffet was, before seating down (not that I am cheap, but I ran into an issue with another buffet. I reviewed, where the price was not the same everyday).  The lunch buffet was under $9 (bill came to $9 and change).

I ordered water and upon it arrival, I went to get food.  My first plate was all sushi.  I am not even gonna bother listing what I got.  It was mediocre to average at best.  I was not expecting it to first class sushi, but I was expecting it to be a lot better than it was.  It almost did not taste fresh and tasted stale.

My second plate was cut up hotdogs, BBQ chicken and their version of orange chicken (I think it was called general chicken) and a slice of pizza.  BBQ chicken tasted chewy, orange chicken was a bit over fried and hotdogs were hotdogs...  Pizza tasted old.

Overall, I would not recommend this place, there are plenty of other options in the area.  The only thing worthy noting is the service.  The service was phenomenal, the guy would clean up my table every time I would get up (which was twice, I did get some fruit at the end).  A D+ and most of it for service alone.

Eh not so much. It was fine for a lunch, but I really couldn't see myself coming back, unless it was for the hibachi. One of the sushi rolls I had was good (I believe it was a spicy California roll) but the rest were really not tasty. Making my own stir-fry/hibachi was worth it and I wish I would have ordered that first. The rest of the food was lukewarm, even though we came right at open.

The "seafood" is so low-quality that you really can't get any meat out of it. The work it took to get the meat out of the crab legs far outweighed the amount of meat you actually got. The high point (besides the hibachi) was the ice cream and those sugary donuts.

The service wasn't that attentive. We had to ask for refills on our drinks and flag down our waiter for our check. 

Overall, it was okay and still edible, but I'm not rushing back.

Talk about a hidden gem in the suburbs. This place has it all, tons of options, fresh food and friendly staff. All of this for a flat price you cannot beat. I highly recommend the selection of Chinese food, along with pot stickers, followed by shrimp. All of this fresh and ready to go. Will be coming back again in the near future!

Typically I enjoy this restaurant. I have been coming here for several years and appreciate the effort they put in to their hibachi grill. 

However on the evening of April 7th, 2016 I arrived at 8:58pm. The stated closing time is 9:30pm. I was watching the entire Buffett being closed down and the hibachi being broken down as soon as I arrived. As a result I did not eat a thing. 

It is fine to close during the 8 o'clock hour... Just state this with your posted hours.

I left disappointed. 

I wish I could say that I will be back.  

On a side note, why is the hostess or person behind the cash register always playing on their cellular phone? I have been here about a dozen times the past year and every single time they are always playing on the phone! Please strive for better customer service!

Honest review: this was actually bot so bad as i thought it was gonna be. Most of the time when people think of a chinese buffet they think of an asian mcdonalds meaning quantity over quality. I was really surprised by everything there was no funky smell and it was not really dirty the service was alright but it its never perfect at a Chinese buffet there was a vast variety of food which is good. There was alot of crab alot alot and it was seasoned well and cleaned well but there wasnt alot of meat in it though
The sushi selection is okay nothing special fake crab type of stuff the sashimi is cut nicely the spicy mayo is amaizing i highly recommend it. The hibachi grill i wouldnt the grill was really dirty and the line was really long so i dont think its worth it. The frog legs were really good but greasy that was kinda a big problem another issue was some of the food was cold and i didnt see any oysters at all theres a great selection price is not that bad when u think that u can eat how ever much u want and stay as long as u want id come back cause im cheap
Sweet & sour Chicken was cold and hard. Greasy rice. Chicken & broccoli (chicken didn't seem like real chicken). The sugar donut was sweet potato fries were the only decent thing and I'm not picky

Typical Chinese buffet. You go in, hardly ever greeted with a smile, taken to your table and asked if you want something to drink. The food selection is plentiful and the salad and sushi bar all make going here worth while. It would be GREAT if the employees were a bit more welcoming. Maybe their just tired? I don'k know what it is, but this buffet is still among one of my favorites to go to.

Will never go there again!! Food was not fresh needed to wait about 15 minutes for them to bring and fill the empty trays. What bother me the most is the next to our table one of the employees sat down and eat and she used a plastic fork. She obviously don't think the utensils are clean!! 
Yuck!! Never again!!
