Nothing entirely special or unique about this place. We got there right around the time it opened, so everything was fresh, and not crowded. I'm not sure if I just wasn't in the mood, but I walked around a couple times trying to decide what I wanted. Nothing grabbed my attention! They do have a wide selection though. The sushi wasn't great, but I wasn't expecting it to be either. 

I don't frequent Chinese buffets all to often, years actually. To my surprise, not only did they have the usual white and yellow rice, but they had Hibachi rice. Uh...sweet! Otherwise the food was enjoyable, but nothing spectacular. 

Our server was very attentive and always topped my glass with more water. He was really good about removing our dishes when we were done with them. 

Overall, experience wasn't too bad. Place is well kept and maintained, plenty of options, they have a hibachi grill (which no one manned, perhaps because they had just opened), and well, the kiddos got their Chinese buffet fix.

I don't think I'll be ever coming back here again. The food wasn't all that fresh. But I got over it. What really got under my skin was when we first walked in. I stood there waiting to be seated because the little girl was on her phone texting. And even when she asked me how many people, she still continued on her phone and walked away. So we followed her. As she walked she was STILL staring at her phone. I was surprised she didn't run into anybody. The service was so bad. You have to yell to get there attention just for a refill. They don't even smile. I will have to go back to the Streamwood location. At least they are much more friendlier.

It is what it is a fast food chinese buffet, good for a lunch but cant see going for a dinner. Wide selection of food but when is pizza considered a Chinese item? Overall alright not the freshest cleanest place but its a $8.00 all you can eat buffet...

This buffet is not bad for the price.  The best time to go is right when they open because is not to crowed and not too many kids going back and forth.  My husband likes coming here so I just go with the flow.  It is your usual sushi wanna be plus they have the grill if you want steak or your own stir fry.  I like when they have frog legs.  I limit my amount of food I get here because I suck when I eat at buffets.  Not too bad for the suburbs

This place has really gone downhill.  The food quality is poor at best and I cannot seem to shake the feeling that much of it is re heated....  Take buffets for what they are and inherently food is a bit harder to manage but the quality has really suffered.  The beef is extremely fatty and the  General chicken is awful. If you cannot actually take the deserts out of the plastic trays they came in from the store you bought them from, this shows no care.
The worse Buffett I have ever been too! Food cold drinks awful taste like they don't change the filters of the pop. Wouldn't recommend it !

I give this place four stars because of what it offers with the price, and in comparison with its competitor. Therefore, it is inflated. This buffet offers a variety of food. However, the quality is subpar. The chicken is greasy, the sushi has too much rice, the flavor is ok, but I haven't tried the hibachi. To be honest, I'm trying to get the most protein for the least amount of fat. Yes, I am on a diet. I was here because my family wanted to eat here. If they didn't offer the amount of food that they did, I would've given three stars. Also, a lot of people came on a Sunday evening.

Went here for lunch with some family friends. The selection was wide, but VERY limited for those with dietary restrictions. Many of the veggies were stir fried with meat or in a cheese dish. However, there were some vegan options, but not labeled that way. Mostly guesswork. Their rice dishes were standard, nothing special. Not that ordering coffee from a buffet is the best idea, but it was honestly terrible. Talk about coffee smelling like cat piss. I had some rice, green beans, and a serving of noodles. It was satisfying and second were tempting, but after the food sitting for a while I felt a little sick. Their fruit selection was either warm or out of season and didn't have much taste. 

This place? Nothing special.

P.S: There are kids running EVERYWHERE. I understand that sometimes kids are hard to control, but this was ridiculous.
I hate this place so bad it's fucking dirty and the food is just like fake food I don't tasted and the smell inside is so bad

Having passed by it a few times, I decided to give Hibachi Grill & Supreme Buffet in Glendale Heights a try. I walked in to see a large and very clean looking eatery that was mostly empty. After being seated and looking over the buffet I initially picked a few items and headed back to my seat as no one was behind the counter at the Hibachi to cook anything.

Pretty much every item I tried off the buffet table was lousy, not only that, a lot of it was room temperature or colder. After that initial plate of buffet food, and realizing I wasn't going to eat anything from off the buffet again, I very quickly decided to get the attention of an employee who spoke minimal English to see if they could get someone to man the Hibachi so I could try some of that food. I stood and waited at least five minutes with a plate of to be grilled food waiting before someone came to the grill to cook it. After I got back to my seat I tried the grilled Hibachi food which was alright. There was a decent variety of items to have grilled including shrimp, imitation crab meat, noodles and various other meats, veggies and even mushrooms.

Unfortunately, the Hibachi grill food, while far better than the food sitting out at the buffet wasn't that fantastic either. While this place is well decorated and very clean the food and service were both lousy. After finishing off my plate of Hibachi grilled noodles meat, veggies and seafood I asked someone for the check. This took a few minutes as well.

Overall this particular location of Hibachi Grill and Supreme Buffet was far from supreme. It should be called Hibachi wait and see if we grill your food buffet. Everything about the service was slow, and while the grilled food wasn't terrible it wasn't great. I'm going to give it two stars as at least the prices were reasonable.

My first visit here was after a recent trip to Royal Buffet, which, in retrospect, was a bad idea.  It was like going from first class to economy.  The inside was clean and nicely decorated.  Surprisingly, it was packed with people during a week night.  They have a large variety of food (over 250 items, although I didn't count them all and just took their word for it), all very average and will fill an empty belly but may not satisfy the taste buds as much.  The sushi were ok - thinly sliced on a large rice ball.   I only saw 2 kinds of sushi (tuna and red snapper) and a few rolls when I was there.  There's a part of me that just doesn't trust sushi from a $10 buffet, but I did bring myself to try a couple and I'm still alive.  

I contemplated trying the Hibachi grill where I could pick my own ingredients and they will cook it for you, but I didn't find it appetizing.  I didn't try anything that would make me want to go back and have it again.  The best thing I had was probably the fried banana.  The dessert bar was nicely packed with fresh fruits and pastries.  The salad bar looked good.  For $10 dinner, it wasn't worth it for me since I couldn't eat $10 worth of food from here.  They do offer carry out buffet starting at $4/lb without seafood.

Good for lunch and if you are senior, you get 10% off.  Hibachi Grill was good and filling even if you dont want to have other stuff from the buffet.  Chinese Won Ton soup good.  Most items are typical of Chinese buffets.  The salad bar includes raw shrimp!   The management has coupons but they are mostly for a free drink with the buffet.   Wish they would have Chinese tea of Japanese tea included in the price but ah well....       If you go there on the dinner or weekends, there are a lot of unsupervised kids running around.  Management looks the other way, which is why I dont go there then.

The food here is okay, but I will never come back because the guy working in the front is rude. We walked in and there was no one in the front to sit us. We waited for about 3 minutes and we noticed the guy sitting by the front on his phone the whole time. He looked at us and looked away. We didn't think he worked here. However, later on we saw him back to work and talking to the hostess in front. Sorry cool dude, but I'll go elsewhere next time.

I'm surprised by the negative reviews shown below. I am VERY particular about Asian food because I am of Asian decent and my family has been in the restaurant industry for many years. 
The food here is fantastic! My girlfriend and I took our kids on a Saturday afternoon and the trays were packed with fresh entrees, every dish was seasoned well and the sushi (my fav) was dynamite! We left out of there stuffed.
I found their selection limited but fresh. I didn't any of their specials really stood out but everything was affordable and tasty.
food was decent, prices were good.
I have been to this place twice and I am looking forward to going back! Good service, and the food here is always fresh and delicious! :)
The Chuckie Cheese of Chinese buffets.  Food is average but there are kids running everywhere.   Very noisy & not very clean.

As far as buffets go, especially the cheap ones, you have to compartmentalize a little.  Is this place as good as every 4* place I've ever reviewed.  Probably not.  However, I think it's pretty good and deserves more than 3*.

The price is pretty good.  $10.  Drinks are extra.  They have a lot of food choices, and a lot of variety.  A lot of American food (mozzarella sticks, chicken nuggets, etc).  They also have a sushi bar, while it is not necessarily the biggest cuts of sushi, they taste ok and again there is a lot of variety of rolls and sushi.  Not just salmon and tuna.
They have a hibachi grill which is basically like a mini flat top.  You grab a few veggies and some meat and watch them cook it.

The ice cream is Blue Bonnet ice cream cups which is pretty legit.  Not your watery frozen vanilla flavored ice mush.

Their salad bar is also fresh looking and has a lot of different options.  

I'm not a huge fan of buffets, but this one is probably one of the better ones I've been to.

Parking is non-existent during busy times, like the weekend.

Crowded entrance, no room to progress or sit, food mediocre, service was spotty at best, noise and too many kids made the experience very annoying. 

There are way better options in Schaumburg...
This place is so good, I went here on a double date and the sushi is fantastic!! Only about $12 a person, totally worth it. They also have a huge variety of food for those who aren't too adventurous.

This place has gone to crap!  Not one thing was good.  The food was cold and just plain nasty.  The last time I went I said I wouldn't be back and this time I mean it.  $40 for myself and 2 kids for crappy food?  Never again!

This place was horrific. I was always skeptical about Chinese buffet in general, but this place was the worst. When I walked around the buffet to check out the food, everything looked stale and soggy. When I went to get the hibachi, and was waiting for my food, I looked at the warm sushi station next to it, and saw a small cockroach was sitting on the sushi! Absolutely disgusted, I told staff who just swatted it away like it was no big deal... I then proceeded to try the orange chicken, and found a few strands of hair. I walked out. Absolutely disgusted.

Used to be pretty good buffet, but not anymore. We went there on Sunday( Father's day). The price was higher than on regular Sundays, but it was nothing special about the food. Suchi tasted  weird, it seemed that some products were spoiled. Yuck! We will not be back!

Quality of the food is not that great.. the service was horrible. Server never came to check on us or refill drinks, also had to walk up to hostess stand to pay because he never brought us the check. He was just sitting in the corner booth eating.. also found a piece of hair in the bacon wrapped crab meat... ugh.

Have gone since they opened.   Price goes up and quality down.   Hot sour soup was neither hot or sour,  rather spicy.   Also tasted old.   Sushi selection was light on sushi pieces.   Entree hot bar was OK,  average buffet quality.   For Chinese food one star.   Gave it a star because it is a buffet.

I really like this place! There food selection is huge and they always have coupons out ! This is the first buffet I've been too that is this clean and family oriented since they have a lot of finger foods for the kids. Only downside is during slow business they don't have fresh food since it's sitting out and they don't normally put out fresh food until it is requested or the current one runs out. Other than that no complains !!

We came here for lunch one sunny afternoon. It's a very clean buffet, and the staff was more than helpful. I had a whole bunch of stuff off the buffet (pizza, fries, sweet & sour chicken, fried rice, etc.) and their hibachi chicken (off the grill).

Don't get the hibachi chicken.

I'm not sure if it was even chicken, come to think of it. After it was cooked it was a weird grayish shade that just was not pleasant to look at.

Overall, the buffet was edible and affordable for lunch. Was it the best buffet I've ever been to? Nope. Would I come back? I'm not going to suggest it, but I suppose I would.

Just don't forget your coupons!

There's a lot of selection at this buffet, including sushi if you're feeling adventurous, or just happen to like raw fish (which I do not). There's even a generous selection of American food to appease youngsters who think Asian fare is unappetizing. The place is huge inside and the food is fresh. The prices are extremely reasonable especially if you have a coupon from a flier. Honestly the only reason I didn't give it five stars is no matter now good I just don't care for buffets.

Visited: Late December 2011

We had been receiving coupons in the mail and decided to try this place for a quick dinner last night. First of all, buffets are weird.  This place is called Hibachi Grill & Supreme Buffet. I was not expecting to see french fries and onion rings.  However, I do agree that they have a large selection of food. I just think it was a little too much.  Hibachi lends itself to Asian inspired cuisine in my opinion.  Anyway, a lot of the food looked like it had been sitting out for a while. I did see someone refilling a tray here and there, but most of it probably wasn't that fresh. I like that everything was labeled so you could tell what you were getting. I got some dinnertime shrimp and crab thing that wasn't very good. I also got the sushi. It was decent, but the avocado had started to brown. Service was alright, I think our waiter was named Norris, he was cool. Overall, the food was pretty greasy and cold. I would not go back.

This is an excellent buffet. We went during lunch and the place was packed. I was very impressed with the number of items on the multiple buffet islands.  All of the food was hot and tasty.  It is one of the best Chinese buffets I have been to.   Service was good. Our waitress brought out our drinks promptly and removed our finished plates at the right time.  Based on my first visit today, I recommend this restaurant. They have a party room, also.

I have been to Hibachi Grill probably 4 or 5 times. Each time was better than the last. The hibachi food is great. The clams are very fresh and so are the frog legs. The items in the buffet are 5x better than the traditional buffet. The price is great and you definitely get what you pay for. 

Some of the wait staff can be annoying and sometimes you can catch the male waiters trying to be flirty but it doesn't work. 

The sushi choice is really great as well. I really do not have any complaints about this place. Definitely go to Hibachi Grill, it's great.

Good stuff. I always go to the back wall and load fresh ingredients on my plate, and hand it to the cook at the grill. It is usually the same guy it seems, day or night, but he is awesome at his job. I always throw a buck in his tip jar, he deserves it. I get a huge plate of shrimp and rice and whatever else, freshly cooked, for $11 bucks, not too bad. There are always coupons in the Moneysaver magazine which takes $4.50 of the bill for three or more people. My kids eat from the buffet. I dabble a little bit there, but the food is not nearly as good as having it freshly cooked. Some of it has obviously been on the warmer for a few hours. But mostly not that bad. I wouldn't pay the price for that alone though. The table service is not quite the same as a full service restaurant, but then again these waiters aren't expecting 20% tips. I like to give them about $5 for the 4 of us, but that's just to bring our drinks and clear some plates. They don't take your order or serve your food.

Compare with Forest Park location, this place is lower class.

Not much to see in Sushi and Seafood sections.  The Forest Park location got more variety of Sushi and more choice of Seafood which I don't see much at this location.

Stay away from ribs and roast beef if you want to keep you teeth.  This is a friendly warning, they are not tender.

The price is reasonable, drink is extra, good service, decoration soso but Forest Park is much nicer, the food......terrible.

We will not go back and eat there again, too much dissappointed on food.

Ok, typical Chinese buffet.  Sunday/Dinner prices for under $10 for a buffet isn't bad at all.  Like most inexpensive places, you do get what you pay for.  Would I go here again? For that price, probably.  They even have sushi which most people may like!  The grill/hibachi station is your typical pick veges and meat then let the chef fry it up.  For what this place offers, you can't go wrong to give them a shot.  This coming from an Asian person and chef.  Quantity over quality here folks.  Go hungry and leave full yet slightly dissatisfied but content.  Good luck!

We like it - it has our baby clams & mussels & hitachi grill with your choice of whatever you want grilled to your liking & your sauce... of course ours is garlic..  We are repeat customers.. and we like it  - it's comfortable, enjoyable, and a huge huge variety of all sorts of foods from grilled, baked, fried, all various ethnic styles, etc.! We like it.. and the price - you can't beat it...   Had a great meal there today!  Thank you Hibachi Grill & Supreme Buffet - you certainly live up to it! ... and of course we are steady repeat customers!

Having visited another Hibachi Buffet a while ago, I was curious to try this new place. I am not a fan of buffets but I did enjoy the other location and I always get coupons in the mail so figured, why not?

Visited on Saturday around 5-6pm and the place was packed. When we were seated we asked if we preferred a booth or table and they were able to accommodate our request. They also took our drink order. That is one thing I don't understand about these hibachi buffets, they act like it is a traditional restaurant by bringing drinks and then a check at the end of the meal. Why not have everyone pay before they sit and give customers the ability to get their own drinks? Seems like a set up to generate tips. 

Anyways, this place did have a wide selection but it wasn't very organized. Some sections have Americanized food such as pigs in a blanket and chicken fingers and then BAM, sweet and sour chicken or fried rice. There didn't seem to really be any rhyme or reason as to how the food was set up. Also, a lot of choices weren't even labeled. It was fairly easy to make out what the dishes were but I'm sure others might have difficulty. The labels that were present were pretty messy and just scribbled quickly on a piece of paper. It did appear that a lot of the food was replenished fairly quickly.

There is a sushi area but I am not a fan so I can't comment. They also have a hibachi section which I did have. I do have to note that several areas needed attending to such as the glass by the hibachi selections. They were greasy as though someone pressed their face to the glass, yuck. Also, the floor was pretty dirty/sticky.

They did have an ice cream section along the back wall that had little cups of ice cream. There was a sign that if you took the ice cream out, it was 75 cents.

Pricing is fairly cheap, around $9/adult so you don't feel entirely guilty if you just have one plate of food. Also, there are always coupons floating around, I had a $3 off.

Again, it is a buffet so set your expectations accordingly.
Walked in at 3:02pm and was denied the 3:00pm lunch buffet. So I walked out and don't plan on ever going there. You would think smaller businesses would want the customers, I guess not.

I am going to review this for what it is.  Its a buffet and not a fne dining restaurant. But for the money you will not hear me complain.  Great variety of food. I just found myself trying alttle bit of everything. Most of what I had was pretty good and I am looking forward to going back and trying more. They had everything from sushi and crawfish to beef and chicken.  The sushi was not great but its a buffet and it was better than what I expected. Overall I enjoyed the experience there and will try it again soon!

Alright, check it. We USED to go to this place AT LEAST once a week since it opened. I loved the food. The crappy service was not bad, either. Just crappy, because they didn't speak English very well, and they would take the soy sauce off the table to refill it just as I'd get ready to use it... Anyway, yum, I love the food. I have not, however, been back there since an episode I had there about a month ago. We had a new waiter. His name was Bin. When he gave us our check, we still had a little bit of food left on our plates that we had planned to eat. No big deal, I don't mind having the check, HOWEVER, BIN, you little cork soaker, it is EXTREMELY inappropriate to come to the table FOUR times and rudely say "ARE YOU READY?" as you swing your arms and stare at the check presenter. Finally, after the 4th time, my girl said "NO. WE WILL TELL YOU WHEN WE ARE READY TO PAY YOU." Bin, you A-hole, I'm a server too, I know better than to piss off my guests. I know how to get a crappy tip, and you done got yourself one. When we were ready to pay, we gave you the eye, as you had been staring anxiously at us like a horny coyote stalking a stray cat, and you rushed your skinny Asian buttocks over like a bat out of hell, and proceeded to COUNT THE MONEY AT THE TABLE TO SEE HOW MUCH YOUR TIP WAS! I was appalled. You're an idiot, a prick, and a HORRIBLE server, and I'm thankful that was the one and only time you served me. It's because of you I won't ever be back. Thanks a lot for making me not eat at one of m FAVORITE places ever. I realize I'm almost 34 years old and should just go back and eat there and request to NOT have you as my server, but I'm gonna be a little b!tch about it and never go back. And your boss will know its because of you, because we fricken complained about you before we left. SUCKIT! In other news, you people reading this should really go eat there. It's delicious for the price, and the decor is elegant as hell. Just ask to not be seated in BIN's section. He sucks.
UPDATE: we went back last night! (Thursday, 9/27/12) Bin got fired!! I assume he screwed up royally, or, the owner read my yelp. Either way, food was amazeballs as always, AND, our server, another dude, was cool, nice, efficient, and nice looking. If I were into men, I'd ask him out. It was just that awesome. GO ENJOY!!

My wife and I went for lunch on a Saturday.  Great value and clean for a buffet place.  Soda is extra.  Good but not great selection of food.  They have only sushi rolls but have a good selection.  The service was excellent for a buffet place. Gets very busy around 1 pm on Saturdays so come early for lunch.

I'm still a fan of this place, but I had to take away one star just because recently when we've gone, it just seems like the food isn't as fresh as it could be...We'll probably still go here because the selection is really good, but I just don't think it deserves four stars anymore...
They announced different price on their website than the one in the restaurant(9.59 vs. 13) and don't accept coupons that they issued. Cheaters...

We came, we saw, we tried, we won't come again.  It's seriously cheap and has a ton of choices, but none of them are all that great. Of all the things I tried, nothing capture my interest enough to get seconds. The salad bar and dessert options are both just kind of "meh" and not everything is labeled. Plus, this place is always packed with a huge line, despite available tables. Parking is a pain, too.

I used to come to this place all the time with a group of old friends. The food was pretty good for the price, and it became usual spot for getting together.  I had noticed somewhat of a decline in the quality the past few visits, and after my most recent trip I've decided not to come back. Only about half of the items were palatable, and even then the quality of those that were wasn't worth the $10 that the buffet costs. I wasn't even able to stomach the mushrooms or dressing at the salad bar. The seafood is rubbery, and the sushi "okay" at best. They've gone from being a pretty decent, affordable place, to somewhere I won't be visiting again.

Well, this place is actually a chinese buffet with sushi and grill. In my opinion, their chinese food is not different from other chinese buffet. Sushi is seem to be better. Unlike other places, their sushi are rolled with less rice and more in choices. Grill is not bad either. I got to try only whatever few pieces of meat left to add on my plate. The chef cooked it just right to the taste requested of my medium spicy. This place was so busy for Sat lunch. Parking lot was full. People waited to be seated. Sure to be considered in my next dine out.
The food wasn't very good. Wait staff was rude, & seemed not to speak much if any English. I wouldn't go back.

Excellent for the price... I love this place, they have a great variety of food and the food is great :)  

I love the make your own hibachi, and they have a lot of sushi and other food too :)
This place is great food is good and price is fair lots of choices in food selection i would recommend this place and i will return to feast on the food again

I must admit that the food is actually good, but the only reason I am giving it one star is for the rude staff/management.  They are complete CHEAPSKATES!  We had a coupon for 5 dollars off of 3 buffets and 3 drinks which essentially comes out to free drinks plus a generous 23 cents off.  We had one senior in the group and they couldn't even let us have the 96 cent discount because of our coupon.  In addition, the restaurant was cold so I grabbed one ice cream for my daughter to eat in the car.  They literally chased after me OUTSIDE the restaurant to tell me it would be 75 cents to take it out.  Ridiculous!!!  We won't be back.

A pretty good deal in all. Quality was fair to good. I recommend waiting for the custom stir fry. A great way to explore options you may not dare otherwise. I got to try a variety of sushi; I like some of it. But now I know a bit more about it.

Love this place, been here about 5-6 times and its been great each time. I really enjoy the sushi which makes me feel like I'm getting my moneys worth because when my husband and I order sushi it is around $40 so the price of about $10 each isn't that bad. The only downside its the last 3 times we have been there the waiters that take the plates when you are done are very persistent..which gets annoying and when you pay if you leave any tip less than $8 they ask you if everything was okay and look pretty mad..
i thought everything was bad, to much stuff, food didn't taste like it should, watch your plares, took 3 to get a clean one, old country buffet is way better

I know everyone talks about the pizza, but the PASTA! 

The meat ravioli with the aglio olio (olive oil) is spectacular! The added garlic bread - even better.

Primo not just for pizza - try the pasta!

Love primo.  It's all about the specialty pizzas.  I could eat alfredo till I puke and call back for more.  They make a mean meatball too.  This is really one of like two pizza joints around with a good thin crust za.
This is the best pizza in Chicagoland hands down.They are the only ones who get a New York style pizza right.The menu is huge as well.Great service.Excellent quality!

First time, ordered small pesto and spaghetti marinara with meatballs. Ate inside (3 small tables) on our way somewhere. Pasta was very good, homemade meatballs nicely seasoned, they kindly split the order since we were sharing (I didn't ask). Pizza was yummy next time I plan to request well done since I like my cheese a little browned. Ratio of dough to ingredients was good. Will eat here and order again!

I have moved out of Barrington and miss Primo big time!  Ordered a pie last night and it was amazing of course!  Tom, thank you for calling me to see how my pizza was! It was the bomb! You are fantastic! First Class!

Best Pizza in the area!  Prices are good, pizza is great.
They also have a gluten free menu for those in need of that option.
I love the Heartburn Special!

The pizza here is good - but I am compelled to give them five stars for their thoughtfulness - let me share the story.

I volunteer at a large food pantry with a lot of volunteers. A little less than a year ago, we were planning on ordering lunch. One of the volunteers told a leader that they would anonymously buy lunch for all the volunteers - they ordered pizza from Primo's.

The owner delivered it that day. He saw the volunteers and all the people that we were serving and it really touched him. He told the leaders that he was willing to bring our volunteer team (about 40-50 people) lunch once a month and he'd cover it. Delivery included. He has done that each month since.

Businesspeople that have that kind of ethic deserve and get my business. If you're in their area and have the chance to check Primo's out, I hope you will.

We hired their Portable Over Pizza and it was a great afternoon, thin pizza was one of the best , Chefs were great.
Thanks Primo.

Great pizza, great selection. Very authentic Italian food. Deep dish is a literally a requirement* when you go here. It is quite rare to find a good place like this outside of Chicago. In my opinion, the best pizza place in Barrington and the northwest Chicago area, hands down.

We ordered carry out pizza today. We ordered two gluten free pizzas and one regular (for my husband). I get nervous sometimes ordering from unknown places because of being gluten free. When I called to ask about the pizza, the person who answered told me that he got the crusts from a large gluten free company that starts with "U." If you're gluten free, you know who that is. I totally trust that brand.

The gluten free pizzas were cooked in their own little foil pans so my concerns about cross-contamination were unfounded. The pizza tasted amazing. The whole family ate well, including my little ones. We were very satisfied and will be back. There are three tables in the shop as well as a TV so you could eat there if you had a group of two or three, but they do carry out and delivery so that might be a better choice. Prices were great!!
Amazing pizza. Tom rocks.  Consistently great qualify pizza. Love stuffed pizzas!

Their gluten free gyros pizza is very tasty.  It's also nice because they cook it in a thin tin pan so it's easy to reheat in the oven as leftovers!  I have a gluten sensitivity so I'm not a celiac, so I can't speak to whether they are 100% gluten free.  But the pizza I had was pretty tasty!  I just wished they had other gluten free items on the menu besides pizza (like pasta), but I think the gyros pizza is quite unique and is a great and delicious item!

Plain and simple best pizza ever! Small stripmall establishment with great thin crust pies. Crust is light and crispy, sauce is super flavorful and has the slightest hint of spice and the the pizzas are very fairly priced. Primo Pizza I would safely say is Chicagolands best thin crust, and I'm pretty much a pizza enthusiast.

Great pizza  !!!!   Primo sure fits it.    Coming thru Barrington and needed lunch.   Ran in for a slice and it was fresh, and warm.   Got a menu and will order one to bring home next time I'm going by.   Great find ;-)
Got a delivery of eggplant parmesan and salad.  Delivery was ahead of schedule and food was outstanding.  Was first order. Certainly not the last.

Being gluten intolerant has its disadvantages, a primary one being a lack of good pizza. A friend of mine had us over for a party and ordered me a gf pizza from Primo along with the regular pizzas for the other guests and I have to say it it the absolute best I have tried and there have been MANY. 

Thanks Primo for making me feel like I was eating real pizza, but not actually killing me to do it :) Now, if I can just convince you to deliver to my house 25 miles away in Elmhurst...
Great thin crust pizza.  The sauce is flavorful, the sausage is delicious and the veggies were fresh.  Definitely Barrington's Best!  Friendly Service from Tom the owner.

Absolutely fantastic pizza. My husband and I are new to the area and we stumbled on Primo's after trying to find a place that would deliver to us in Deer Park. Not only do they deliver here, but the pizza is amazing even despite the delivery drive/time. Their thin crust pizza is awesome, as are their toppings. Primo's has definitely upped my bar for pizza!

We called ahead and decided to eat in. When we arrived we got a friendly greeting from Jennifer (a sweetheart) telling us our pizza was ready. We sat at a table and she brought us plates and silverware. The first bite of pizza tells it all. Spot on! The thin crust had a nice crispy texture. The green peppers perfect. The sausage was delicious. The cheese and sauce made it all come together. There are a lot of pizza places out there but not many of them get it right. This place nailed it!
OMG!!!!!   Their Italian beef and cheese is probably the best I've ever had.  Sooooooooooooooo gooooooooooooood!!!!!

Ordered Delivery- lady on the phone was really nice, delivery driver was a bit grouchy though. Delivevey time was very fast as well. Got the Hawaiian Pizza and was not impressed. Tasted like a frozen pizza honestly... not anything exciting
Worst customer service we have ever experienced in our life!!!

This is a great casual place, we usually sit down at one of the tables and eat there. The pizza is great, as is the service. Everyone working there is very nice and they go out of their way to please. 5 stars.
My new favorite pizza place.  Delicious thin crust pizza, great prices too.  I can't wait to try the deep dish and the stuffed!
Favorite pizza place in Barrington, period. I can eat(but probably shouldn't) an entire 14 inch za and side of wings in one sitting. Always have the za cooked on time and everyone is very friendly.
Outstanding pizza. Not a veggie pizza guy, but the Italian Flag could turn me. Meat toppings were also tasty. Salad was fresh and generous.

We used to order Primo all the time. Recently, we've been dissapointed with the taste. We think that they have cut back on the amount of cheese they use and it has made a BIG difference. i suppose they are trying to cut costs but in the end they may find that they are losing loyal customers like us.

Not just great Pizza but a great owner in Tom D.  It is great to know that the owner really cares about all of his customers and always goes the extra mile.   I will keep telling my friends about Primo!  Thanks!

I'm a pizza expert.  Classify them by type of pizza, and have favorites in every category.  I need to try Primo on site for the extra thin crust pizza, as I tried it delivered, and it was just pretty good. Good flavor, but crust was a bit heavy for an extra thin, but that happens when you deliver and let it sit while putting kids in bed.  I really think this place has some potential AND the owner called me to see how things were the next day.  I'll be back here for sure, and will write again.

Below average wings, no sauce, and good salad.

Good stuff for thin crust.  Spicy Italian sausage makes the pie, and it's great for nearby pizza that delivers.

No, it's not Lou's.  Then again, Kamehachi isn't Nick's Fishmarket either - BIG difference between thin crust and deep dish.
This is wonderful thin crust pizza. My family has been eating here for years! Some of these other reviews saying that the food is lame are total hogwash.
I've ordered from these guys for about 8 yrs. Always excellent service... great price... and absolutely GREAT pizza!!! Thank you

You are nuts!  Primo's is fantastic!  Their thin pizza with Nick sauce (spicey) is excellent.

OK...it is not Gino's or Lou Malnatti's, but for local Barrington Pizza it is by far the best.
We Drive All the Way From Cary.......Primo is King!!!
Awesome Pizza!  Huge portion sizes! Fast and friendly delivery.  Family favorite.

Pizza was fair - typical mall tasting pizza.  Living in the city for over 30 years, I've had my selection of great pizza.  For the selection of pizza places in Barrington, it was not too bad.  I prefer JJ Twigs or Vini's for thin crust in Palatine.

The pizza here is really lame.  We used to order it a lot because my stepdaughter liked it, but now that she's in college, we have reclaimed our right (as a Chicagoan) to have Damn Good Pizza.  Do yourself a favor and skip this place and go to RSVPs Too or my personal favorite, Lou Malanati's

Primo's makes outstanding pizza, but it's not the same style as Malnati's.  Their thin crust is flavorful with a great sauce, the stuffed is really tasty, especially a stuffed spinach, and their pan pizza is also very good.  I think most people who rated Primo as only fair are rating not on the quality of the pizza, but what style of pizza they like.

Parking can be a bit tricky here as the parking lot is shared with quite a few other businesses, but today - for me - I parked right out front. 

The atmosphere inside as well as the decor - if that means anything to you were both good! It is much bigger inside than it appear and they even have a small outdoor eating area as well - I decided to eat inside - to stay away from bugs as I hate eating with bugs. However, I did have a fly at my table - that isn't the reason for taking away a star though - at least not on its own.

I gazed through a very decent breakfast and lunch menu and found both selection and price to be very good. Service was also very good - both in speed of delivery after order and in general - the server was excellent!

Food flavor was good, our orders were both cooked to our liking and the only problem I have with this place or ANY place that serves toast is that the butter not be hard. Serving me hard butter to spread on my toast basically shows me that your level of customer satisfaction is lower than my expectation. At home I hate when I find that the butter is still in the fridge - so when I go out - I simply expect them to think ahead more then me - as I'm not in business of preparing and serving food! 

Between the parking, the fly and the hard butter - I rated this place with 4 stars - to me 4 stars is GREAT and I would gladly return! I hope the locals know that they have a really clean place, with great service, decent selection of food at very affordable prices!

This is one of my favorite restaurants! Everything there is amazing. Their soups are to die for! The burgers are delicious. Their breakfasts are something that I crave regularly. Everyone I take there raves about it. I can tell thay they make their food from scratch and it is excellent! 

The service is good. They have a big enough place that you dont have to wait long on weekends if you go during prime time. We are always picking up food for other meals because they close early. I cant say enough good about this place! If you are looking for a quality family restaurant this is it!

After 6 years of writing an not so good review, I was driving by and saw the restaurant was very packed and decided to go in. I dined in, had an omelette and pancakes with REAL potatoes and it was very good. Their pancakes were also very good. Since then, I have ordered take out 4 times. It is reasonably priced and good breakfast. I will have to try lunch to offer another perspective.

I'm always eager to try new brunch places and was excited when my in-laws brought us here yesterday for breakfast. Savoury looks very promising -- a fresh-faced building in a nice shopping strip area with a warm, inviting interior. A large container of organic olive oil sat at the front counter with some empty bottles -- for filling, I suppose.

Well.... beyond the first impression, the visit wasn't off to a great start. We arrived somewhat early to beat the Sunday brunch crowd to see only one couple waiting before us. Great. We put our name in for a table of eight, sat down in the waiting area, and waited. During the next forty minutes, groups of people came in, waited briefly, and were seated. None of the groups were was large as ours, but we did see a couple tables of five or six get seated rather quickly. What! So... we waited. And waited. FORTY minutes. The wait wouldn't be so bad if we were quoted that wait and everyone that came after us also waited, but we were the only ones waiting that long! Ridiculous! The staff was apologetic and nice about the wait, but I was grumbling inside.

Once seated, we were squished around two small square tables. I had the fortune of sitting in the middle where two uneven tables came together. Kind of awkward. For that long wait, we should have had a better table set-up, in my opinion.... sigh.

Our waitress came quickly and took our orders (we had looked at the menus prior to being seated so we could order fast). I ordered a coffee, strawberry crepes (YES! Loooove crepes!), and a side of hash browns. Other people at my table got chicken and waffles, chocolate chip pancakes, and regular brunch fare. Everyone stuffed themselves and enjoyed their meals. My coffee was good, the crepes were delicious (although I had to request whip cream after it was served), and the hash browns were OK. 

Best brunch ever? Nope. But good enough? YES! I am thankful the food was good or the wait would have been worthless. Also, $7.99 for a massive plate of crepes? That's kind of awesome. If I come back, I'm getting the crepes again.

Man, I read some of these bad reviews and I really have a hard time thinking that we have ate at the same place.

Been here twice now, once at lunchtime and the second, Sunday morning breakfast (we had a 15 minute wait).  Both times service was great and both waitresses were super sweet and very attentive.  Our little 8 month old was present and even the bus boys were saying hi to her.  I really liked the family vibe the place gives off.  

Now onto the food.  First time I had the Caprese Benedict.  Loved the basil hollandaise and the garlic ciabatta bread it was on.  My only critique?  I think I would have liked the mozzarella to have been warmer.  Having the super cold cheese with the warm egg and warm tomato just seemed to be a little off.  Otherwise, I loved it.  And my peach mimosa?  Delicious!  Second time I went with a classic, ham and cheese omelet.  Insanely fluffy eggs, really crisp hash browns, and I LOVED that I got to have cinnamon toast.  Does anybody know if their bread is homemade?  The pieces of toast totally seemed like it.  My husband's steak fajita skillet was amazing too.  The steak was really tender and that really impressed us.  Most breakfast places just slop some low grade meat on skillets in hopes to mask it by all the other ingredients.  This was the complete opposite.

I'm hoping they are reading these bad reviews and have made improvements and our meals have been a result of that :)

This currently is my families to go spot for breakfast. When you arrive it can ve a little hard to find parking. We haven't quite figured out what the best time to get here at is. We come in at 8am and usually have to wait 15-25 minutes and if you come after 8 it only it worse.

Every server we've had so far have been very attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. 

Ive had 2 eggs, hash browns, and turkey sausage, a Greek feta chicken wrap and soup. I absolutely LOVE their hash browns, they are perfectly crisp. I wasnt too crazy about the soup I had, minestrone, it lacked flavor and tasted watered down but my wrap was delicious and large, I took the other half for lunch to work. 

Overall this place is great, and I recommend it, just get here early to beat the breakfast rush.

I have eaten here a few times early during the week.  Pretty friendly with a clean look, but dated.  The Foid is not so strong, very average.  I will let you know if I find something good...  I have tried the Eggs Benedict, egg white omelette, pancakes.  Potatoes were the dehydrated kind, no thank you.

My boyfriend and I went here based on the recommendation of his co-worker. I gave her the benefit of the doubt, oh how she failed me.

Parma Benedict: I'm not even gonna lie, I only reason I got this was because there's prosciutto in there. I had thought "you can't really do wrong to prosciutto." The description said "lightly fried" yea yea it's not supposed to be like bacon, but it didn't feel "fried" to me. It was more like "we'll just slap a bunch of prosciutto on here." There were also no basil present in the dish, even though the description said so. One good thing I have to comment on how the garlic ciabatta bread is much much better than the boring English muffin. English muffins tends to get soggy after awhile in the hollandaise sauce, but the ciabatta held up nicely. 

The hash brown that came with it...this, this needed a paragraph of its own. Not because it was so damn good that I have to write a whole new paragraph about it. Ohh contraire people! I seriously thought they forgot to cook my hash brown or they cooked half and thought it wasn't enough and threw in some more. Half of it seemed unfried and the other half was burnt. When you get hash brown, you are looking for that crunchy exterior with the soft potato goodness as you continue to chew, but no. All I got was shitty hash browns. Shitty, just straight up bad.

Nutella crepe: the batter wasn't too thick or too thin for a crepe. I just think it was too much nutella that you couldn't taste the crepe itself. I do like that they threw in the crushed chocolate cookie....but it was like one chunk of cookie and that was it.

I've been coming here since they opened up. The food and service was really good in the beginning but now it seems to be very lackluster. The quality control on their food have gone down - from unripe bananas on pancakes to uncooked potatoes in our hash browns. I have a toddler who has some food allergies and if they don't care about their food preparation it makes me wonder if they are paying attention to my toddler's food. 

Restaurant have two things to focus on - the food and customer service. Do them well and you will have repeat customers. Acknowledged your regular customers, make effort to know their named, they are your best advertisers.

Best breakfast joint in the area. I've been coming here for years now and have never had a bad experience. Parking is scarce and the place usually gets crowded on Saturdays and Sundays. I advise going another day if possible.

Savory has been going downhill since the first time I visited 3 years ago.. if your potatoes aren't basically raw or over cooked then it's something else.. Today I visited and got a Belgian Waffle with bananas, upon first bite I knew something was off. I thought at first it was the flour they used but after a  few bites of just banana I realized that the papery taste in my mouth wasn't from flour but from being served unripe bananas... I'm not sure what your kitchen management has been doing lately but I'm beginning to think he/she has just been catching up on beauty sleep back there. While most people may like how quickly the food comes out I personally would rather wait a few extra minutes for quality food. 

Side note: please don't wheel out a trash can looking storage container full of juice out from the kitchen and refill your bubbly right in front of your full dining room without taking it back and cleaning it first... I am actually concerned with how clean my orange juice I was drinking is.

Another excellent breakfast place! Excellent, affordable place with great food.  I haven't eaten here for dinner or lunch only for breakfast so I can only attest to the quality of their breakfast places. I'll sum it up...

Excellent portions
Excellent quality 
Excellent prices

That's all you need for a great breakfast place.  Coffee is excellent,  the place is clean and the wait staff is very polite. 

Highly recommend.

Never disappoints. Great breakfast place but prepare to wait. We wait a minimum of 20 to 30 minutes every time during the morning rush. I've tried most everything on menu but my favorite is the eggs Benedict, 3 different kinds including pesto one and all very tasty. Food service is fast and the coffee is always got and flowing constantly.

My husband and I had a pleasant experience when we visited Savoury for breakfast one weekend. Sure, we had to wait for about 20 minutes (as you have to do for practically every other breakfast spot - the good ones anyway!), but out server was very nice when we were seated. You know, right away, that this is a family restaurant. The owners and their children and grandchildren could be seen all around the front desk.

I had the Rocky Mountain Savoury Crepe - a crepe filled with ham, bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms, topped with cheddar cheese. It was so good. I also had a mimosa and it was delicious! My husband wanted to try something new so he had the Gyros Skillet, a great choice at a Greek-owned restaurant. The skillet had gyros meat, tomatoes, onions, and feta cheese, topped with two eggs. Also very good.

We did not feel rushed to leave and had a great experience there. Service was good and the food was great. We can't wait to return!

Not bad. Been here a few times. The menu selection is pretty good, but the quality suffers significantly as it gets busier. For example - on a busy saturday late morning, the hash browns were extremely undercooked. 
That said, when it's not too busy the food is pretty good. It's also the only breakfast joint in the area.

Love this place. Any time we have friends or family in town I always bring them here for breakfast and it's loved every time. A great local breakfast joint where you're guaranteed to fill them up before you send them off!
Reallly great food for reasonable prices. Everyone in my party really enjoyed what they ordered from their big and extensive menu. Would come back to this place again.
This place was excellent. The meat lovers skillet was huge and the best I've had.  They also have fresh squeezed orange juice and excellent service.

The breakfast at Savoury is hands-down the best in this area! We've been coming here since they opened, and we've never had a bad entree. I love the bacon and onion skillet, it's simple but it's really good. They have fresh-squeezed orange juice that's amazing! I've also become a fan of their red velvet pancakes. I haven't seen them at any other restaurant nearby, and they're sooo good! 

Why 3 stars? Service! And for the most part, it's not the actual wait staff, it's the family that owns the restaurant (and hold various positions). You would think that after coming here somewhat regularly for the past 8/9 years, that someone would recognize us and maybe say something like "hey guys, how are you?". But no, that has not once happened. They always act as if we're strangers to the neighborhood. 

What's most frustrating is the family hostess. We continue to come back because we know the meal will be good, but we consistently have to deal with someone who acts like it's difficult to greet us, direct us to a table and take our money. I'm sorry, maybe put a smile on your face and remember that it's your customers, like my family, who keep you open. Maybe be gracious, friendly, and welcoming and you'll grow your business even more!

We even had an experience at another breakfast place in St. Charles, got to talking to another family at the next table who now refuses to go back there for the same reason!

As for my family, I always say I'm never coming back, but I'm writing this review as I'm waiting for a table. Expecting the same experience.

I've been coming here since they opened, and I loved their food. I'm not one to talk down on an restaurant. But as an executive chef myself I have to say that the last 5 times I've been here the food quality has suffered from what it used to be. From asking to a sunny side up egg, and receiving a fully cooked egg on my skillet to onions and tomatoes being poorly prepped, and I can't forget the overly cooked potatoes on my skillet. If I was the owner I would sit down the the chef in charge and tell him to get his act together and start caring about the food he's putting out, or let him go and find someone better. There is no excuse the chef should let anything under perfect walk out of his kitchen. If he doesn't care about your food and the quality of what he's putting out, he shouldn't be there.

I never make reviews but I'm so disappointed I feel I need to share. First, we were seated to a soaking wet table that still wasn't clean. We ended up asking for our food to go, I just was not feeling the busy, rushed environment. I wish I would've checked the food before leaving...I got the corned beef hash skillet with over easy eggs, disgusting. My hashbrowns were still basically cold they did not taste cooked at all, the corned beef tasted like cold mashed potatoes that I was scared to eat because they were not cooked, the green pepper was cut so huge. Also, the pancakes tasted like they had grains in them. Last but not least, the biscuits and gravy were soggy. I hate bashing restaurants but this first impression will be my last impression.
Best breakfast place around.  This place and burnt toast are both really good!  The German pancake is so delicious!  Giant but so rich and fluffy.  So good!!!

Food is very good. I was little disappointed with the big pile of dust on the light fixtures and  windows. We visit this restaurant like twice a month 
FOOD *****
Was good a long time ago when they first opened. Now the food is nothing interesting nor special. Same old boring menu. The place feels greasy.

We've come here a few times for breakfast and for lunch and have had good experiences each time! The menu is huge with many unique items! We've always had great service and the food has always been good. It reminds me of Denny's or IHOP but is unique in that it is not a chain. It's a laid back atmosphere and the prices are reasonable.
We're totally a fan of Savoury! Definitely the best breakfast in Bartlett. They have the most creative and delicious eggs Benedict! Totally, totally a fan! :)

Savoury is our go to place for a great lunch. Service is friendly. Food is delicious and affordable. My only complaint is they took Navy Bean Soup off the menu. It was just as good as my mom's. They need to bring it back!

Love the food but we quit going due to the long wait to be seated for breakfasts.  It's a nice family owned restaurant. Would give it 5 stars if we could get breakfast. Please expand !!!  Pancakes are great, veggie omelet and my favorite is the skirt steak and eggs... Mm mm.

Every time we drive in to town we always end up hitting this place, first thing in the morning, for breakfast.

Decor: It's nice inside. Nothing fancy, but definitely not a dump. There are plenty of tables and plenty of booths to accommodate any size group. I'm really a big fan of the entire wall of windows that allows for plenty of natural light.
Bathroom: I did not use the bathroom during this visit.

Staff: Our waitress was friendly and pleasant. While she was not the most speedy (as one would expect when there is almost NO ONE else in the place on a Friday morning) it really was not a big deal. The food came out relatively quickly as well.

Food/Drink: The food here is always great. Everything comes out hot and fresh and cooked perfectly. The taste, of course, goes without saying, wonderful! I always end up getting the two egg breakfast w/ bacon. This time, however, I tried a smoothie. It was good, but a bit small for the price.

Value: I think the prices are right where they should be. You get great quality food for a decent prcie. The smoothie is a bit expensive for the size, however.

Like I said, we always end up stopping in for breakfast and we will continue to do so on into the future.

Really enjoyed a lovely breakfast with my family.  Not too long of a wait and certainly well worth it.  Portion size was large and service was pleasant.  If you are looking for a fantastic Greek style family breakfast, visit Savoury!

Solid place for breakfast and lunch. Very quick service and friendly people. Just moved nearby and this will be my go to breakfast joint. Only downside for me was there is no counter or bar to eat at, which I personally love for a breakfast diner kind of place.

Please note this is not about the quality of any food or beverage there. Unfortunately we never got to try the food. A 20 minute wait turned into 35...which wasn't really the problem as we've all experienced that before. About 15 minutes in, we had a certain number of people ahead of us on their list and when we left they'd somehow added to that number. The hostess was not tracking things well, was clearly stressing out and didn't crack a smile once. It certainly wasn't a welcoming experience. Not sure we'll attempt to go again.

Saturday 11:30 am,, place was packed.. First time customer.. It was so LOUD it was giving me an headache.. Asked to sit outside.. Only 5-tables outside.. 3 were finished eating but no one cleared there tables to push flipping them.. Waited 25 minutes and still no one cleared the tables.. Customers outside were inconsiderate knowing others were waiting.. Poor management not recognizing the poor service outside to flip tables.. Went next door to Tipsi Monkey and had a great breakfast and ate outside..

This place is a little unpredictable when it comes to service, but the food is AWESOME.

We have gone on a weekday and on a weekend, and by all means - AVOID GOING SAT/SUN MORNING unless you plan to wait in tight quarters for over an hour. There are maybe 2 or 3 seats available for you to wait in, and there is no space for waiting. People randomly standing along walls, rubbing elbows with the wait staff as they come by. The people working the register/hostess stand never seem to be the most friendly unfortunately, but the waiters seem to be quite nice. 

Once you do get seated, the pancakes are magical. We love the Skillets too. I tried the Gyro Skillet for my last visit and was very impressed: Hashbrowns, Gyro Meat, Tahini Sauce, Onions, Feta Cheese: YUM! 

So, all in all, if you have the patience to wait for it, the food is good. It is the best breakfast spot in the area, but I conclude that they need to do something different for the crazy wait times. Maybe take reservations? Maybe offer more seating options for waiting? Allow for us to call ahead to add our name to the list? I think a little attention to the customer's discomfort would help tremendously.
Good Local Breakfast Place. The food is good and the service is typically friendly. Only once did we have a poor experience.

Have eaten here dozens of times since they opened. Their breakfasts are the best with wait times as long as an hour on weekends. Their pancakes were voted the Best in the Suburbs and they deserved to win. Owners are always there with a friendly "Hello" and to take care of any mistakes. Highly recommend.

I stopped in at around 11:00 AM on a Monday.  I had a taste for pancakes and I ordered Multigrain.  They had a spice of some sort that wasn't mentioned on the menu.  They looked cooked but actually they were undercooked.  Between the slight spice flavor and the undercooking, they were not to my liking.  I may be too critical here, since I did eat most of it. 

The service was almost okay. Thr server asked how the food was and I said "Just so-so." She walked away without responding. When I paid the bill, the manager did not ask if everything was okay. Seemed like nobody much cared.

I have had better luck here in the past, but I doubt that I will be back.

This restaurant is always busy! That has its up side and down side. The down side is you have to wait for a table, but the up side is good food! Great place for family and friends to enjoy breakfast or lunch. I have never eaten lunch there, but I have enjoyed their breakfast items. The staff is always nice and friendly. Nice local restaurant!

Decent breakfast joint. 

Scored a booth after about a 15 minute wait at 9:30 - on a Sunday - so was pretty happy about that. The orange juice was delicious - tasted like it was probably fresh squeezed.

I ordered the eggs benedict with prosciutto, and was pretty disappointed. The prosciutto just tasted like thick sliced, really really salty ham. It wasn't the thin sliced, delicately cured layers of pork that I adore. And my eggs were pretty much hard boiled, so the whole thing was just super salty and dry. For me, a benedict should be smothered in buttery hollandaise and covered in rich egg yolk when you break through the whites. Not so here. A very modest glaze of sauce and no yolks. Boo. The fruit that I ordered on the side was the highlight for me.

However, my husband's gyro skillet was pretty excellent. Service was slow, but our waiter was pleasant. Might give them another go if I'm in town, but certainly will not go out of my way.

Always very satisfied here and with their recent menu updates....they now have skillets!...things are even better (now the hubby is extra happy!). Had their Caprese Benedict with basil hollandaise today and it was one of the best breakfasts I have had in a long time! The garlic ciabatta type of bread it's served on was a great base. Was concerned I might not like the basil hollandaise but it made it perfect! That may become my new standard at Savory
Good breakfast place but nothing spectacular. The do have an extensive menu of all the standards and the service is good.
Serving sizes are pretty good except the fruit servings are very small. Service is good and atmosphere is great. Just wish they would serve bigger fruit portions.

Savoury was very average.   The vegetable omelet had no vegetable or cheese flavour.  Coffee was very average.  Hash browns were very average.  Bacon was OK.   If you like better quality and a bit of creativity in your breakfast, you'll have to look elsewhere.

Attention Bartlett Residents & Passer-byers!  I am upgrading Savoury to four stars!  They have earned it.

After living in the area for almost a year, I find that we continue to visit Savoury on a pretty regular basis.  The food has now delivered on that "WOW" that I was looking for from my local haunt.  Everyone that I have sent and/or brought in has been pleased with their meals.  

Even going in around 8pm on a Thursday evening, we were greeted by one of the friendly owners and promptly seated.  The food was hot and fresh.  Even the soup was steaming (which is a major plus in my book).  My son continues to stick with his Nutella Crepes and cleaned his plate tonight.  I tried the skirt steak sandwich.  I am SOOOO glad that I did!  The steak was cooked to medium as requested, it was seasoned just right and the onion rings that I ordered on the side came out crispy without being overcooked.  As usual, the rice pudding was the perfect end to my dinner.

Savoury has fine-tuned things and made the entire experience one that I care to repeat over and over.  Maybe I will see you there!

in love with this place!!!  First time here.The food was delicious. I had the tex-mex Benedict. The steak was very well seasoned and the garlic Texas toast was mouth watering. My girls had pancake which I grabbed a bite of and have to say it was fluffy buttery mouth watering delicious!!! My 3 girls all said it was way better than any other pancake house they've been to! Daddy approved too!
Breakfast is really good here. Sometimes though, the host staff acts like we are inconveniencing them.

Love the food here. Best pancakes we have ever had which is refreshing since it's a breakfast place!

Service is inconsistent and my lack experience. However the food is good enough to keep us coming back for more.
Everything here is really good. The service is fast and friendly. Very large menu.(many health conscious items) Can always count on a good breakfast or lunch here.
I had the Parma Benedict, and even though the sauce was a little lacking, the dish was delicious. The waitresses were fast and had a great sense of urgency,a and the food came out surprisingly fast.
Not great. Food was average. Service was poor, and management sucked. We've been here twice, so three strikes and they're out. I've tried to like this place but just can't. One more try.

I've been coming here for years now and have somehow never left a review. Savoury confuses me.  On the weekends there is almost always a wait.  Even at lunch time there's usually going to be a wait. The question is: Is it really worth the wait?  I'd say no. By far my biggest issue would be the service. It's almost impossible to get a refill on your coffee here. Like I swear some of the waitresses avoid eye contact with you so you can't even flag them down for your desperately needed refill.  This is not something that's happened once or twice, it's pretty much every time. There is one nice young blonde waitress who this wasn't an issue with, when we're there we always hope to get her section but we never have such luck. Also, the last two times I've been there I've been served 'burnt' decaf coffee.  As in you could literally smell it in the mug and tasted like tar.  Both times I was told it say in pot too long....why wouldn't you keep it fresh?  I also find the hash browns to be severely lacking.  They are just really boring and plain. The pancakes are really good, it's probably the only real reason I end up coming back here. We recently found a great breakfast place in Elgin though and we've been making the drive there for the better service and great food, even though we are less than 5 min from Savoury.

I came here a few times and had a decent experience, but the most recent visit was horrible.  I was thinking it was a fluke, but looking at the recent reviews of this place makes me think otherwise.  The food was extremely bland...as if they forgot to season it.  The staff members weren't the friendliest bunch and service was a bit slow even though it wasn't that busy.  I probably won't come back here again.

Very good place for breakfast usually pretty packed on the weekends. Servers are usually very friendly. Kids love coming here. 

Been once for lunch, pretty darn good too!

This restaurant used to be a lot better when we moved into the area about 6 years ago. Decent breakfast and a couple good dinner items on the menu (skirt steak and pork chops), but things have gone way downhill since then. First of all, the staff is consistently grumpy and a few times rude, for no reason-- just right off the bat rude. I don't know if that's just their personalities, but don't be in this business if you can't smile (or even fake it). Secondly, they desperately need to upgrade their dining room. Every time we've gone here, the chairs feel like they're going to fall apart underneath us. Thirdly, the portions have gone way down in the past few years. 

The food isn't bad and they have a nice outdoor area. Their skillets are pretty mediocre and I've gotten to the point where I ask for them to leave off the hash browns altogether (they're just dry and bland).

Mainly because of the rudeness, we finally gave up on this place and instead drive out of our way to go to Egg Yolk Cafe in West Chicago, where we're greeted warmly and the food and atmosphere is much better.

The food was great..  We went at 6am on a Friday.  Basically seat yourself.  There was only one waitress but she did an amazing job taking care of everything and everyone. Never had to wait..  Food is priced well.  Portions are hearty..  The breakfast menu looks amazing,  there were so many choices. Most places serve the same things for breakfast.  Not here they have items that I have never seen before.  Red velvet pancakes!  Nice place, I can see it being packed on a weekend.  They have outside seating and a gourmet coffee bar..
Excellent place to take the family, friends and sports teams.  Descent prices, great food, great atmosphere and pleasant workers.

I gave this a second shot since I heard good things about it and all I could remember was how bad the pancakes were. I judge a breakfast & pancake house by its pancakes, right? 

Horrible pancakes. Darn it! Why? I got a veggie skillet with eggs over medium and a pancake. About two bites of pancake was all I could do. They are really heavy and too much leavening (not fluffy). Have you eaten Krusteez? There ya go. Like vanilla wafers meets Bisquick. Even the MSG didn't make me think it tasted good. 

The skillet looked fabulous, but underneath those beautiful eggs was mush. The hashbrowns turned into mashed potatoes. I am not understanding what people see in this place, really. I remembered I had this problem the last time I was here. The b-friend's skillet was also mush.

The two stars are for the eggs cooked correctly, and the really nice atmosphere outside on the patio. Our waitress was overworked so service a bit slow, but she was really nice. Also, the b-friend liked the Blackhawks stuff. SUGGESTION: Eggs, bacon and toast on the patio. No pancakes.

Good for a little place in Bartlett if you're looking for a great breakfast. can't speak for lunch but I assume it's good with a wide variety to select from.  I go there specifically for eggs benedict.  they actually have four options of eggs Benedict.  The eggs are  perfect no matter how you get them and if they aren't they're happy to remake them.   Very crowded at times but worth the wait. They have a few seats outside which is nice on a quiet early Sunday morning. the only problem is that parking can be hard to come by.

Love the service here always! The only thing holding this back from being a 5 is that they haven't quite mastered well done or crispy hash browns. So if you like them crispy ask for them extra extra extra well done.

Food: My aunt and I split our breakfasts
Eggs Benedict--the poached eggs were overdone and the hollendaise sauce was bland. Insert sad face because I love eggs benny.
Southwest Omelet--a delicious dish with chorizo, jalepenos, tomatoes, onions, cheddar and avocado (how they didn't mush the avocado is beyond me!) Soooo good, very flavorful, nice spice.  Very well made. Insert smiley face here.
The omelet comes with a side of buttermilk pancakes--I found them pretty basic, nothing special.  Insert Meh face here
Coffee--weak. Insert really sad face here.

Service:  Our server was friendly, helpful and on point.  I appreciated the host helping us decide which booth would be better for us since we brought le bebe in his baby carrier. 

Setting: Open and modern.  Stone tiles, large windows, comfy seating. 
Conversations carry so it can get a bit loud at times.

My sister lives in the suburbs of Chicago, and every time I go back home to visit, we head here. It's become a mainstay of our visits. When I tell my OTHER siblings "we went to Savoury!" they get jealous. :) 

Tips -- the Kona coffee is awesome - it's fresh, regularly refilled, and tasty. Ask for flavored creamers too - they'll bring you a bowl.

More tips - for your side of toast, get Greek bread. It's almost like Texas toast in size, but has sesame seeds. It's lovely and delicious. 

Last tips -- if you're in a group, get different sides, pancakes, and dishes. Share! Everything is delicious. My little sister always gets Nutella crepes - they are truly wonderful. I try to keep it healthy most of the time and get a griller with egg whites.

Savoury is great. So happy it's become part of the home experience! :)
Ohhh sooo good... garlic bread grilled cheese I get a slice of tomato in it and tomato basil soup and the best pumpkin latte EVER yumm

Came here to meet an already seated, ordered, party of 4.   We came in at the end of the rush.  Wish they had the foresight to re-seat us when we got there, the chairs at the end of the table in front of the bathroom doors was annoying.   

Food was great though, so I'm told, and I cant wait to eat here myself :D
The food was great! The only problem is the service. It took about 15-20 minutes to get our food, even though there were only 4 tables occupied out of the whole restaurant. We will be coming back
Perfect neighborhood restaurant with great food. The French toast and skillets hit the spot. Just expect a wait during peak times,
They have delicious gluten free pancakes!  Woo hoo!
Yeah, very good place for food.  Broad menu; we go here for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

The food is very good.  We have been here several times.  But, Sunday 3/1 I made reservations for 7 people.  Five of our group arrived first.  We were told we could not be seated until everyone arrived.  This was quite uncomfortable while people were entering and exiting the restranut .  I could not understand why not seat us since we made reservations.  I am not sure I'd be back.  The service from the wait staff was fantastic.

Well we finally made it here after wanting to for a year.  First we got there about 9am on a Sunday with five of us...the wait was not long at all, 10 minutes tops.  This was excellent!

We were seated near the kitchen but because of the layout we really didn't hear any unusual noise.  The server took our order very quickly BUT never gave us her name...which was a shame because I would like to thank her by name.  

The food which ran from Chicken Fingers to Crepes to a Country Benedict and two skillet choices, was prepared well.  The pancakes as a side, which were built up a bit were ok...but that was the only let down.  Coffee came often as well as water, and we were asked no less than four times if we needed anything else!

Well done all around and we will be going back....oh there are items that are not on the menu that you should ask about....HINT: Red Velvet Pancakes...looked delicious and will be on order next time.

Stopped by this little gem for lunch after a meeting and was blown away! Very warm and inviting decor and a friendly, helpful and funny staff. I tried the turkey panini which was very good, but the star of my meal was the pickle that came with my panini. It was the best I've had in years! So come for the pickles, and stay for the meal :-)

First time visitor to Savoury this afternoon.  I stopped in on a lark and was not disappointed.  Everything was wonderful from friendly and welcoming staff, to wonderful food.  Pumpkin pancake side dish was to die for with the drizzled "Cinnabon" flavored glaze.  The veggie omelet was very tasty.  The pumpkin latte was the best I've ever had.  The look and taste of the food was appealing overall.  The restaurant was busy with guests.  Was it just me or was everyone in a great mood?  I felt right at home and will definitely be back with friends.  Thanks for making my day!
The Reuben was not right, my skirt steak was great, 86 the reuben  A very expensive lesson...

Went here for a morning breakfast with my girlfriends family.  I love breakfast but just dont have a good appetite early in the morning but this place changed it.

I went with the skirt steak eggs benadict .  When asked how I wanted my steak I said medium not really expecting much since most breakfast places will ask even though they will cook it the same each and every time.  

When I got it and sliced the steak I was SHOCKED.... It was cooked perfectly.... hard to cook out the chewiness in a skirt steak but they nailed it..... I knew a nap was in my near future. My hash browns were cooked well done as I asked and the service was prompt and friendly. 

If youre in the area in need of a breakfast fix I highly recommend
Great breakfast food and owners/ staff are always accommodating. They can get quite busy on the weekends though so be prepared to wait if doing a Sunday brunch.

Not cool, Savoury.

I didn't want to knock this restaurant down to three stars, but they have earned it.  I have been here at least once or twice a month since my initial review.  While they have retained their "ok" rating with me, some things have definitely gone downhill.

Now there are certain things I really do like about them (they take reservations when you have big parties (sometimes we have 9 or 10 people) and they are nice about bringing out extra plates for our kids.

But something I cannot look past is this:  I bought a restaurant.com gift certificate a few months ago with the intent to bring the whole family here for my mom's birthday (a Sunday) this February.  There were NO limitations on this $100 certificate when I bought it.  So you can understand my disappointment when I arrived a couple weeks ago to see a sign on their door saying that "they are no longer accepting restaurant.com certificates on the weekends" starting the previous week.

Wow.  As a business, going forward you can make limitations, but you should have honored the ones that had already been purchased for what the purchaser bought it for.

Poor business practices.

Okay so as busy as this place is all the time I guess I expected more. The sign in the window said they were "nominated" for best breakfast in Chicagoland. I guess that makes sense since anyone can be nominated, but to win is another thing. As far as I am concerned, this place is not the winner.

Nice atmosphere, table service was okay, not great. I had the pancakes. They were just okay, nothing special. My friend had the chorizo quesadilla. It was okay, but kind of lacking on the "stuffings".  Check out would have been more enjoyable if the cashier/hostess had actually acknowledged me instead of yakking it up with two of her co workers who obviously had nothing better to do than to keep her from being courteous to the customers. All in all, not bad, but rather ho hum. I would rather go to the Egg Basket...

The husband and I have been here three or four times now, all on weeknights. We've both ordered different breakfast items for our dinners. The first few times everything has been either great or ok: skillets, pancakes, and toast all perfectly cooked, and service either wonderful or ok.

Tonight's service was again fine, but the food was not so great. We both ordered skillets and the hashbrowns were mushy and barely cooked. Our eggs were perfect, but the ham in my skillet was different than I've had in the past...salty and mushy instead of firm and moist. My husband's pancakes were undercooked and doughy.
