We'll definitely give Savoury another chance, but be aware that it's hit or miss.

PS - Our table was in view of the back area and what I assume was an office or storage area...I wish the owner(s) would keep the area clear of clutter so that it looks cleaner.

This is a hard restaurant to review. I've had two or three breakfasts here, and two or three sandwiches for lunch. I would give it 2 stars for the lunches I've had, but 5 stars for the breakfasts.

The sandwiches have been, by and large, disappointing. The bread has been soggy, the fries cold once and stale the other time, and the ingredients, not all that great.

So when I go here now, I get omelettes or skillets with pancakes. There's a giant sign on the front of the store that claims that Savory was nominated for best breakfast in Chicago. After eating there a few times, I believe it.

The eggs are always cooked to perfection, whether scrambled on the side or in the omelette. With skillets, the hash browns are cooked just right and crispy on the outside. The pancakes have the distinct tang of buttermilk. They use a good quality cheese and wonderfully fresh vegetables in the omelettes.

You may have to season some of the food yourself, but it's better for you to control that part of the dish, anyway.

Definitely visit Savory, and definitely stick with its strength: breakfast food.
Great breakfast food, and we've always had top notch service. I like the skillets the best!

I might be biased coz the hubby knows the owner but i'll be impartial as much as i can. We always go here for brunch if possible, prefers this over Brunch cafe in Roselle due to their portion sizes. Pancakes are substantial, crepes are yummy and for me, i always go for bacon! The service has left something to be desired....
Great service and like the inside, food was good, enjoyed fast and friendly service and i liked the food thought it was good. new morning spot now!
I love this place! The breakfast is outstanding. Hands down the best breakfast place in the burbs.

Kids + us + Savoury = Like!! This place is packed on weekends. We got omlettes, skillets and kids pancakes and all were a hit. The cappuccino was authentic. I am coming back for lunch and dinner menus.

This is mine and my husbands absolute favorite place for breakfast. We come from Elgin to eat here because no matter where we go in town there is no restaurant that matches the quality of food from Savoury! He always gets his skillet (meat lovers). I usually do the make your own skillet and love that they have cilantro, have not found another place that does. I order the skillet and get cilantro, avocado and bacon with pepperjack cheese and it is to die for! Their french toast is great as well as the omelettes. The pancakes are the best we have had, so light and fluffy with wonderful flavor. The service is always really great. We usually visit on a Sat or Sun morning and the earlier you go the better because they get packed! The prices are very reasonable considering how wonderful the food is and great portions. We always end up taking half home. Oh and I almost forgot to mention one of the other reasons we became huge fans of this place. Fresh squeezed orange juice! Need I say more?

My wife and I try to patronize local businesses whenever possible. We live in Barttlett and we hate fast food places, so we were happy to see Savuory open up.

After eating at Savoury on several occasions, I would say that it is good, but not great. We were unimpressed with the quality of dinner, but breakfast is good. The pancakes are particularly good. Too many restaurants serve tasteless dessicated disks and call them pancakes, but not Savoury. Their pancakes are very good.

The service leaves a little to be desired. It isn't necessarily bad, but it feels like the staff is just going through the motions and with little enthusiasm. I don't like a bunch of super fake happiness and flair either, but I am just not feeling appreciated.

The popularity of this place has grown over the years and they are always packed on Saturday and Sunday mornings when I like to go as well.

In summary, I will continue to go back for the pancakes, and keep my expectations low about the service.

I'm surprised to see some of the negative reviews of Savoury because I was under the impression that everyone loved this place. For starters, it's always crazy busy on the weekends, but beyond that, I've always had good experiences eating here. It maintains that family-owned restaurant feel by being just that- family owned. The service is great and I always see the same people working there. The breakfast is killer and the pancakes are some of the best I've had. The reason I'm giving this place four stars though is because their lunch pretty much sucks. Every sandwich I've had here has been bland and dry. Granted, I've only had a few so maybe I shouldn't rule the entire lunch here out. I've had a pretty decent pulled pork sandwich though.
Overall, great staff and if you stick to the breakfast, you'll be fine.

I live in Bartlett so I come here alot. They have there good days and bad days. Recently they have been having alot of bad days.. There veggie omlet has no taste to it- they need to spice it up more. Today I ordered scarambeled eggs and they came all watery- yuck!. Not what I expected. One thing they always have the menu that is tastey is their red velvet pancakes. I never had a bad experience with those. They need to step up their game with their eggs though.

I agree this place is very unpredictable. I had a bad experience and waited almost a year to come back. The last several times I've been there, it's been very good. I'll give it 4/5 stars considering it is what it is. A good Greek dinner.

I've been here for breakfast twice, when it's my turn to visit my friend in her hood. The place is cute, always super busy on Sundays. Coffee is good, food is OK. On both visits we were completely rushed. About one minute after we sat down, our waitress came over and asked us if we were ready. Um, no we haven't evened opened the menu, so let's start w/coffee. Great. As soon as our coffee was served, we were asked if we were ready yet. So we placed our order, food was out in about 7 minutes, and our check was placed on our table before we were finished eating! She must have come back twice to ask if we were done or if we needed anything else. This happened BOTH times we were there. I get you're busy, and by no means did we plan on staying hours to sit and chat, but I thought it was completely rude to rush us through our meal. We'll be looking for a new breakfast joint next time.
The breakfast is the best in the area. Lunch and dinners are good. I am a big fan of the roast turkey dinner and the chicken noodle soup. Just shared a really good sundae with my daughter too!

Best breakfast place in Bartlett or in the immediate area. Everything tastes great. portion are big, and priced reasonably. My 2 favorite things from here are the nutella crepes and the fresh squeezed orange juice. Everything is really good.

This is a breakfast review.  I was in search of yummy waffles- soft with just a hint of crispness (not overly crispy.)  These fit the bill!  They were perfect. I was very satisfied.  I tasted hubby's pancakes- outstanding.  Very friendly service.  Some people are just way too petty and anything short of being bowed to and curtsied to they are just not happy.
UPDATE- I removed a star because they do not offer pure maple syrup, only that fake chemical crap.  I cannot eat that due to its disgusting taste and it ruined my experience.

I like this place for breakfast only. I always get the standard 2 scrambled eggs with white toast and bacon. I tried a BLT once for lunch and it sucked. Where do they get mayo that has absolutely no flavor? As long as I don't get the runs, I'm happy.

I have been to this place a number of times and it is pretty good. I normally get the Southwest Omelet which has a generous helping of chorizo, tomatoes, onions, cheese and avocado. I also tried the Gyro skillet which was surprisingly good, except not too sure if the feta cheese really worked too well with the combination. My comments on the coffee would have to be nothing because they dont really do anything too special, but nothing bad either.

The service was very inconsistent for me. I've always gone on days where it has a nice handful of customers and I would either receive a lot of attention from our waitress or often be forgotten and have to wait an extra 15 minutes to get our check. Also when the busboy cleans up the dishes, I dont think he's aware that throwing the dishes ontop of each other makes a loud noise, because it becomes very loud and annoying.

I really want to like this place since it's so close to  my house but they sure do make it difficult.  I know I'm picky, I'll be the first to admit it, but in this economy they should be a little more aware of their guests' needs and be attentive.

Strike One:  October-ish.  Went there alone since my husband was out of town.  Was treated like an inconvenience by the host staff.  They were busy helping couples and families and didn't seem to want to even acknowledge that I walked in.   Food was good, but who cares about that when you don't feel welcome.

Strike Two:  December.  Decide to give it another shot, this time with my husband.  Again, FOH staff not that friendly - sorry we're inconveniencing you by asking for a table!  Water and tea refills really slow.  Breakfast okay, but again who cares when you don't feel welcome.

Strke three:  husband home sick.  I called to see what soups they had so I could place a take out order.  Person who answered phone tells me the soups of the day and literally hangs up - doesn't say 'thank you', 'would you like to place a take out order', 'screw you', NOTHING.  Hangs up on me!!!

You're out!

Finally got a chance to try the food here after eating at the Ramen place near by several times. 

We ordered Appetizer for Two, Beef Salad (spicy), Ginger Chicken, Duck Curry (spicy). 

All of the apps were good, the Golden Triangle was interesting, and it was a new and different take on a spring roll. I'm a lover of all things Crab Rangoon, and these managed to distinguish themselves from the dozens of others I've had - in a great way. My crab Rangoon disliking companion even said they were "ok." 

For the rest of our meal, our biggest issue would be that our spicy dishes... Weren't. I've had places make a mild so spicy that I couldn't eat it (and I like spicy), and it may be that we're both fairly transparent.... But we didn't get spicy. You may have to ask for extra spicy if spicy is what you crave. 

For the Beef Salad, the beef was really good, warm, not cold, just too many red onions for me (I'm not a fan). My Ginger Chicken was yum, and we loved the rice (and we are picky rice people). I sampled the Duck Curry (smelled amazing), and while I'm not a curry person, it was good. I'll be back to order some of my own.

Cons: The ambiance is forgettable and I prefer the rice at the other place at Dundee/Hicks, but...

Pros: This is our favorite Thai take out restaurant in the NW suburbs! My husband would pick THIS pad thai over that of any place in the area! I am not a fan of pad thai, but I agree that Thai Cuisine knows how to season their food - I haven't found a better Tom Kha or red curry anywhere else. Their noodle dishes are also loaded with veggies!

9/4 Update

Had a couple apps while waiting for the ramen shop down the mall to open.

So I normally don't order satay because I've had to many dry flavorless chicken strips. BUT this Chicken Satay here is really good!!! Nicely cooked, tender, and moist. Perfect! The peanut sauce is good to. Also had the shrimp egg rolls, pretty bland in texture and flavor. Stick with the Chicken Satay!!

=====================
8/29 Update

Had a couple different things today. Pot Stickers which were small but good. Thin wrapper & a clean chicken flavor. TomYum again, damn those white mushrooms! Crazy Noodles had good flavor and the veggies were nice and crunchy. Drunken noodles was too strong for my liking and I could use the noodles a bit more browned. They were ok at best...

======================
Stopped in for a late lunch...

Started off with some Tom Yum soup. It had good oyster mushrooms, ginger, lemongrass, and white mushrooms. I have to say there is no place for white mushrooms in Thai food!! The broth was super good though, and the chicken was nice and tender! Just skip whitey next time...

Had the Pad Thai lunch special w/ spring roll. The spring rolls are not bad, some sprouts, a little fried tofu, & a nice sauce. The Pad Thai had to much sugar in it for me & was over sauced, many Thai spots over sweeten their meals, this is one such spot. Maybe with 1/2 the sauce in the Pad Thai it wouldn't be that bad. 

I know a lot of people like the sweetness but to me it is not what I look for in Thai cooking. 

We went off hours, the staff was very nice and we had great service. I will go back to try some of my other favorites and see how they are.

The best Thai food around! 

The lunch special is out of this world. The food is very flavorful and always fresh. The portion are great and just a good value for your money. The food is always consistent I must eat here at least 5 times a month and would eat here everyday if I could. 

The staff is always warm and inviting they make you fell like family.

Located in a quite neighborhood, Thai Cuisine is a small treasure. The ambience is simple and neat. The food is great. The waiter was very courteous and polite.
Stepped in for an afternoon meal and was thoroughly satisfied. Standout dishes were the Crab Rangoon and their Thai Curry. With good flavour, blend of the right spices and a simple presentation, Thai cuisine got all the basics right in all departments.
If you are craving for Thai, Thai Cuisine is a great choice.

Wow, what a surprise!!! It's a gem in a strip mall. I'll never pre-judge a strip mall restaurant again. We were looking for lunch, read through the Yelp reviews and tried it out. The decor is ok, but the FOOD is why we will be coming back! We started with Thai Ice Teas (very good) and apps if Golden Triangle, Shrimp in a Blanket, and Soft Shell Crab. All apps were fried dishes, but they all had great flavor. By this, I mean even though they're fried, you still taste the ingredients--flavor in every bite! It's not like some places that taste like fried, greasy globs.

We then had two entrees: Yaki Soba w/tofu and Shrimp Panang. OMG!!!! The Shrimp Panang was the freshest, delicious curry I've had in a long time. The Yaki Soba w/Tofu had crunchy veg and great flavor. We picked up a togo menu because I found a new favorite Thai place right in my own backyard!

Overall, the service was great and the food is flavorful, light, and delicious! You won't be disappointed

The best Thai food around in the burbs. 

The food is always full of flavor and the veggies and meat are always fresh. The portions are spot on. 

It's a small family owned restaurant style and the cook is from Thailand. 

I eat here at least once a week for the last 5 years and never a bad experience. 

The lunch special is the best deal around. 

I highly recommend this place for a flavorful, authentic Thai experience.
Excellent food and service , ordered and take out and dined in several time . Perfect experience each time .

I went in to Thai Cuisine really wanting to like it (partly because I enjoy Thai lower-case-cuisine, and partly because this is the closest Thai restaurant to our house), but sadly I don't think that I'll be coming back. The ingredients seemed to be of relatively low quality and/or overcooked and/or under-seasoned (and if you skimp on one of those, you gotta try to make it up elsewhere, folks). I sampled my wife's Pad Thai, and it was oddly simultaneously too sweet and lacking in flavor; and my Crazy Noodles weren't all that crazy...slightly irrational at best.

The crazy noodles' flavor improved a bit after I doused them with two packets of soy sauce (notably, this was the first time that I've had to apply flavor enhancers to food from a Thai restaurant), but I still wasn't at all tempted to down the entire dish in one sitting. (My digestive system did thank me for that.)

I will say, however, that the flavor of my food improved overnight after the morsels had time to absorb the sodium sauce. But my wife's Pad Thai did not fare quite as well. I consider her to be rather a connoisseur of the dish -- and in her words after finishing her leftovers: "This may be the worst Pad Thai I've ever eaten." Sorry, but I'm just going to have to conclude my review on that note. [Sad trombone]
Food was not that good basically swimming in sauce. Cucumber salad was al cucumber a sliver of red pepper and carrot. Could do better other places for the same price.

pad thai - a dish for which is a basic metric... this place is a meh.
it was very sticky and wet, almost a sticky rice dessert consistency.
too red, just peanuts scattered everywhere, tough beef, just a mess.

Came here for a quick lunch.  Got the Panang curry with vegetables and tofu and was very satisfied.  Compared to some other places where they give you a giant bowl of food that could last for days, the portion size here might be considered a bit "small."  However, I was personally very happy with the reasonable size of the food.  It was just enough where I could ALMOST, but not entirely, finish it, and even though the bowl was smaller than average, there was plenty of tofu and vegetables... unlike those places that give you four tiny pieces of tofu floating around in a giant pool of curry sauce.  The Panang curry here could have stood to be spicier, but it was very flavorful and hit the spot.

The amazing $7 lunch special also included a soup, choice of egg roll or spring roll, and rice.  You also get the all-important fortune cookie at the end.  All in all this was a satisfying lunch choice, and I'll be sure to stop back in now and again.

We ordered Thai for Carry-Out on a Wednesday evening.  We ordered the Pineapple Shrimp Curry (comes with rice), Pad Thai with shrimp, and Crag Rangoon.  The total was $29.  Everything was amazing!  I highly recommend the Pineapple Shrimp Curry - the curry is perfect.  Not overwhelmingly sweet with coconut and pineapple and has excellent spice without being too salty.  All that we wished for was more rice!  We had a bunch of leftover curry that we just made rice at home to eat the leftovers with. 

The Pad Thai with shrimp was good!  I have to say that I was surprised at how good the shrimp was.  The Pad Thai was not the best that I've had because it was a little under seasoned, however I did end up eating all of it with a little added spice. 

The Crag Rangoon is another high recommendation.  They are a little smaller, crispy, and perfect tasting.  It isn't just all cream cheese like some places.  

This place is located in the corner of a strip mall so it can be hard to miss, but I will be returning soon! :)

Anyone who says this place is " soo good" has to be crazy.  I came in on a weekday night, the place was dead, one other couple in the place and then my party of 3.  The food took forever to come out.  The pad Thai tasted NOTHING LIKE PEANUT SAUCE and wasn't even spicy.  It tasted like old noodles and ketchup with maybe a little sesame oil in there.  For the price we paid, not impressed at all.  Only 1 person out of 3 liked their dish which was a curry and duck dish.  The menus are dirty and trashy, prices crossed off and rewritten on the plastic cover on the menu.   Take your business elsewhere.  Of the few Thai places in this area, this has to be the worst of them all.  Wish I would have gone to Yelp for this one before hand

My boyfriend and I stopped here for dinner last night. We ordered the appetizers for two and shared that. Everything was crispy and delicious. I ordered the Lad Nar with beef as my main dish and he ordered the 5 Stay Spicy Fried Rice. My dish was flavorful and the beef was so tender and well seasoned. I loved that the Lad Nar noodles were actually pan fried a bit, but still soft in the brown gravy. My boyfriend loved his dish as well; however, his dish didn't come with fried rice, it was white rice. He said he actually preferred it that way because they have you a lot of yummy sauce which soaked into the white rice perfectly. All in all, if was a great place and the food was awesome. Very well priced as well!
I love the Pad Thai my fiance not so much but that is how it usually goes! always fast and fresh

I love this place. They have the best dishes. I love their pad Thai. Their crab Rangoon is also amazing. We dine in and I always see lots of people picking up take out orders. This is a true hidden jem.

You can also BYOB here!
We have never ordered something here we didn't love.  Healthy options and great lunch prices.

Take out of beef pad sieu and drunken noodles with chicken.  Not a fan of ground chicken in dishes so they threw in some regular pieces... because I was ready to ditch it when I saw that in there.

I had asked if they had crazy noodles as well on the call made 5 min before I pulled into the lot... not sure if it was lost in translation... seemed like it was not an option.  Am I rambling?  

Point being, the configuration of these mainstays of Thai for me were unexpected and somewhat unappealing. The taste of the beef was mediocre at best... the drunken noodles were ridic salty.

Standard $9 per entree is not that great a price and had more noodles than medicore beef or bland chicken, more onions and tiny mushy broccoli... I would have given this place another try until I noticed the shallow takeout container deal. 

REALLY?  Shady so shady. 

Too bad, you're super close and would have been a go to place... you can getaway with stuff like this of you're uber cheap or amazingly good... but neither... and overpriced for low value?

Pass.

I was super excited when I called for carry out and found out that they do not use MSG in their food... Score!  They also allowed me to order Tom Yum Soup without mushrooms.  The restaurant was empty when we picked up the food.

I was really disappointed in the food here.  The Tom Yum Soup had flavor, but it was not as spicy as I like it.  It also only had chicken in it.  I know I asked them to hold the mushrooms, but there is usually a little something more to the soup at other restaurants.

I also ordered the Pad See Ewe with steak and was hugely disappointed.  I had such a taste for noodles, but these were tasteless!  I had to add soy sauce to them, just so I could eat them.

Mmm yummy pad se eu!

Small little place in a strip mall, but pretty darn good food.
B
Love the food and the service it is top-notch. I've been coming here for over 10 years you can't go wrong. love it.

I grabbed lunch from here today during my lunch break. It's right next to the CVS I'm in love with and they have some cheap lunch specials! Pad Thai for $6.95 ($7.75 with tax)!? Count me in! I got chicken pad thai and I'm super picky so I requested no bean sprouts, green onions or peanuts...I don't MIND them but I'd rather do without. Plus it came with an eggroll, yay! Also, the person on the phone was very fast and promised my food would be ready in 10 minutes...I made it there in 11 minutes and sure enough, if was ready!

The eggroll was quite tasty! Not the most amazing I've ever had but it was honestly really good. Especially for a Thai place!

I was super happy that they understood all of my requests and there was nothing on it that I asked not be on there. Yay! The chicken is in long strips, nice and moist. The flavor was right on! It was delicious just don't expect a big portion. The lunch portion is perfectly sized for lunch. 

I'll definitely be back!

The first time I went here was for a date & I fell in love! (With the restaurant of course!). He brought some beers and we ordered some dishes to share since i'd never tried Thai before. The food is so yummy & the portions are really reasonable. Especially for the price. This is a great Asian cuisine restaurant if you want somewhere inexpensive & laid back.

If my mom made Thai food when I was growing up, I'd give Thai Cuisine credit for making their food just like she did. Despite homely surroundings that would easily be humbled by trendier or chic restaurants trying to fill this particular culinary genre, the food is just amazing. Really, it's absolutely fantastic in no uncertain terms whatsoever.

Tucked back into a small strip mall flanked by a liquor store and Subway, it isn't difficult to discern that Thai Cuisine is probably in one of the most precarious locations they could have possibly drawn out of a hat. Though being more out of the way than Florida on a road trip to Philadelphia from Maine, the trip, on both counts, is justified solely for the food. 

Walking in, we were quickly greeted and shown to a small table with a window offering us a complete vista view of the entrance to the adjacent liquor store. While my wife and I made small talk, we were quickly brought our drinks and ordered an appetizer round of Crab Rangoon as we quietly deliberated on what exactly we were going to have for our main course of lunch. It didn't take long before we both spied our favorite dish, Pad See-Eiw (spelling per the restaurant). 

The Crab Rangoon was absolutely stellar. In that first solitary moment of sampling, memories of lesser Rangoons attempted to flood my brain in hopes of begging to be compared only to be slaughtered with ninja-like precision of the deliciousness that had just been sampled. The mixture of cream cheese and crab meat, which may have been imitation but I realistically could tell (as it should be), was positively delightful. It was like taking a time machine back to the discovery of the dish and being amazed along with the person who created it, staggered by the flavorful creation their impeccable genius had just birthed. 

All six went down without a word being exchanged between my wife and I. They were so sweet and just downright perfect it was like unicorn tears had been imbued into the very appetizer. The fact that they were just the right price only made it all the sweeter, but I can't recommend these enough. Appetizer or not, they're downright fantastic.

It wasn't long before the emptied plate was cleared to make room for the main attraction. Our Pad See-Eiw arrived out of the kitchen steaming with all the fervor of a bear's breath in the Siberian winter. The smell drifted up mercilessly, staggering us both as the sumptuous smell of dark soy sauce, broccoli, shrimp and egg mixed to create an amalgamated flavor Odin himself would have enjoyed from the halls of Valhalla. It was then we tried our dishes and, god or man, it was perfect.

The noodles, saccharine with taste, just about melted against the egg and broccoli creating something that even now I can still savor in the back of my mind. The shrimp, tails removed and simmered to faultlessness was a spot-on accoutrement to the meal. I'm infinitely happy I opted to have them added to the dish. Hungrily, we ate while trying to enjoy every last bit. My only regret is that eventually my plate was empty. 

My wife, equally enthralled, enjoyed her dish silently. The only communication that ever went between us were nods of approval, punctuated by sips of our drinks. This meal contented us both so completely that we were quieted into docile, absolute enjoyment of our lunch. It was one of few culinary moments I can qualitatively state, was impeccable.

As we received our bill, we were shocked by the cost. Not because it was high, no. On the contrary, it was so low. Considering everything we'd ordered and just how overall pleased we were at that point, my lingering expectation of a pricey bill was cast aside quickly. We settled our bill and began making our way home for a nap, happier than a pair of pigs in mud.

Great food and great prices..  
they have mainly carryout business but the inside is clean and the service is always friendly.  They have very fair prices and they are BYOB :)

I liked it.....been awhile since I had good Thai food...this place was decent enough.

The Thai coffee was also addicting...I had the Beef Pad Thai, and it wasn't too bad at all.  The hostess/waitress was friendly and I asked her about how it was cooked and she answered promptly.

If I am in the area (since I am from Chicago this is a stretch) I would consider coming back.

Pics I took.

Stopped by here again after about a 1 year hiatus. 

Still good food, in fact the chicken pad thai I enjoyed for lunch today was some of the best I have had in awhile.  It's really the definition of "a hole in the wall" - not much atmosphere, but the food is good AND cheap! And... unlike many Thai places that give you what appears to be a lot of food on a very small platter (so when you mix in the peanuts and extras, half of it ends up on the table!), this restaurant gives you a decent sized platter with just as large a portion so you can mix it and enjoy your meal on the plate - and NOT on the table!

I've been searching for some decent lunch options in the area since my office moved nearby, but this place won't be it. Tried the chicken pad Thai and was disappointed. It was extremely saucy and lacked any fresh flavor. Where is the slice of lime and some cilantro? The portions were generous, but it didn't live up to my expectations (which may be high - I've been spoiled by living near Ruby of Siam in Skokie).

Quick place to grab a 3 course lunch as most Thai places in this area are. Average price and value. I was disappointed with the soup. I started to believe I was drinking dirty sink water that had bits of rice and tofu floating in it. It didn't taste bad, but I was hoping for some tasty Tom Yum or Hot and Sour soup!

Appetizer option was either a healthy spring roll or if you're craving for crunch and grease, the egg roll. Most of the lunch item menus are about $7. I ordered the chicken pad thai, that was ok but seems to veer on the sweeter side. I think the one positive was after eating, you don't feel like taking a nap.
Great BYOB Thai restaurant.

Ordered 2-3 times, ordering different dishes each time. It's just OK definitely no more than 2 stars. Trying to find a great Thai restaurant in the NW burbs has been trying after moving here from the city. Lots of Sushi places but where's the good Thai restaurants?! This place is average at best. Wouldn't go back nor order from here again. Sorry.

I've had Gumrai Thai, and this place is way better.  I've been to Thailand and the food here at Bangkok Cafe is authentic and on point.  They are not afraid to make it spicy (many Asian restaurants in America are scared to, because most of us caucasian folks don't understand flavor and real heat/spice, thus creating fear for the owners that the patrons will send the food back.)

We had just moved into the area, and they delivered very fast.  The delivery man forgot a Thai Iced Tea.  We had forgotten too actually...BUT...they remembered w/o us calling and he promptly came back and delivered just the Iced Tea..no questions asked.  That's very good service.

This is probably the best Thai in Palatine. 

Since moving to Palatine, I have been searching for a Thai restaurant that could be my go-to staple. Unfortunately, the town's selection isn't the best. I gave Thai Cuisine a try after trying the other local joints. Thank goodness for Thai Cuisine. My boyfriend and I ordered the Spicy Beef and Green Curry and pork egg rolls for take out. The order was ready in 10-15 minutes. The portions were great. I requested the Green Curry be made extra spicy, and believe me, they did not disappoint!  In addition, they use fresh vegetables (yay!) and not canned or frozen vegetables like they do at another palatine thai restaurant (really?!). They also gave us sides of hot sauce and sweet and sour. The egg rolls were made just right. Not to  greasy and just the perfect amount of crispiness.  I did not have any of the Spicy Beef but my boyfriend stated it was okay. 

I will defiantly be returning to Thai Cusine. The prices are right on par with most of the other local Thai restaurants (between 9-13 for a dinner).
Good food...very quick. I go here very regularly and the food is very tasty and the people are very nice and friendly too
Ordered green curry, five-star fried rice, tom-young-kun soup and pot stickers. Everything except pot stickers was delicious. Pot stickers tasted like frozen ones so I won't order them again.

This place is great. I have only ordered for carry out but food is usually ready in 10-15 mins.  Pad thai is fantastic - and hot sause is great.
Also try the lard nar (wide noodles)... personal favorite is chick and shrimp pad thai noodles. YUM!
Nice little restaurant tucked into a small strip mall.   The food was great and reasonably priced.

I wanted to give one star but i gave an extra because the food is ok, their customer service not fair. We have been ordering with them for a long time but suddenly they are refusing to delivery at our house only 10 mins away 2 roads to take and 2 turns to make. They kept saying they never delivered here but I think they were too busy on a Friday night so they decided to blow off a loyal customer, in my opinion not a good move for business.

I recently moved, but this place was conveniently located across the street from my home; therefore I have been here many times. 

This is a nice little place to have lunch or dinner. At night it's nicely lit and I believe it's BYOB. So if you're looking for a nice relaxing evening with a small group of friends or if you're on a date, this is a nice place to go to get personalized attention and friendly customer service. 

If you like spicy, thick noodles with vegetable dishes try the crazy noodle; you can add tofu, chicken or beef for the regular dish price. 

I also recommend the Pad Thai Fried Rice with tofu; it's one of my favorites. The crab rangoon is good too.

I can't go to this place and not have some Thai iced tea. It is my favorite drink at Thai places that offer it, and it's delicious here!

It's a five star place in my book for the food I've tried, the atmosphere, and quick, friendly service I always get. There is definitely value in being consistently pleased.

Barf.

Rice was dry and taste mediocre.  Spring roll taste like cat.

I think the uncleanliness also exacerbated my dislike.  They have white table cloths that are so old and filthy!  The food stains dripping down were very distracting.  They are also covered by a piece of glass so there is also a lot of food stuck up under it.  

They need to take each of those filthy table clothes off and burn them.  If you were going to have white table cloths at a greasy spoon....WASH THEM ONCE EVERY 10 YEARS!

Never to return...... There are waaaay too many little thai places all over to waste time here.
My favorite place for tom kha soup!

This place had decent food, not anything great. We sat by the kitchen and it was kind of gross, it didn't look like they have ever cleaned in their back area or in the kitchen. The service was unbelievably slow. We sat there for 40 minutes and all we received was our eggroll. It took about 10 minutes to get our tea and then around 25 minutes to get an egg roll. After about 45 min we had to ask them to just put our food in boxes so we could eat it at work.

Our go-to thai place! Everything is fresh, good veggies, not too salty or overly sauced. I've ordered so many things and am always happy: spring rolls, curries, pad thai, noodle and chicken dishes, fish. We usually pick up, but you can eat in as well. Really nice people! Thrilled to have a great little thai place in our hood.

Great little place. Hard to find good Thai food and this is it. You would never know it by the name or the location but step inside and you can feel that it is run by authentic Thai people  

I had the crab Rangoon to start and it was definitely pleasing. Perfect sized morsels of crab and cream cheese stuffed inside of thin wrapping deep fried until it is hot and crispy. Perfect filling to wrapper ratio with the great dipping sauce. I moved on to my benchmark Thai dish of basil chicken. While it wasn't the absolute top version I have ever had it definitely earned its place in the top 5. Great spice mixed with the salty sweet sauce served with fresh vegetables and a side of hot rice. Nothing is better. I also tried their Thai iced tea, and it didn't disappoint either. I'm not a tea fan but for some reason the mahogany color and down right woody flavor of the tea mixed with milk and severed over cold ice is the perfect accompaniment to an overall superb meal

Will definitely be going back.

This is by far the best thai restaurant for 25 miles. I've eaten a LOT of thai, and I can honestly say this is the best one by my house. Everything I have had here puts others to shame. The prices are reasonable, and it is family owned. Service is very good, and they are a BYOB, so don't be afraid to bring a good drink with you to accompany your meal.

Recommend everything. I honestly cannot say I didn't enjoy anything including the random specials they have on the menu. I love their Green Curry. Theirs is the best. There is only one other place that can touch their green curry sauce, and that place is in Evanston. Must try the Tom Yum, and/or the soft shell crab. Also, those 2 cannot be touched by competition. World Class Thai food,  try it for yourself. forget the place on Rand, forget the places in downtown Arlington Heights. This place is king, and no one really knows about it. Don't say I didn't tell you so!!
Great tasting food, reasonable prices, pleasant staff
I couldn't even eat here cause their phone only makes a busy tone!

Thai Cuisine is a small friendly little quaint restaurant located in Palatine. I enjoy stopping in for lunch every so often to enjoy their chicken/shrimp pad thai. They have a great menu serving a combination lunch menu for $7.95. Thai Cuisine is quick to make your meal, so if on lunch break and need to get back to the office no need to worry you are in and out and the food is definately worth it!
ok thai place. there are absolutely much better price for the buck in schaumburg/hoffman estates area.
YUM... the people here are great, and don't mind having you order special. The drunken noodles are AMAZING!!  I get them not spicy, because I'm a whimp like that. :)
Love it!  We go there almost once a week...I'm vegetarian and they are very nice about being sure to give me vegetarian soup with my lunch.  Very friendly staff and excellent food!

Very good this is my staple thai food place. I always get the pad thai tofu. Have also tried the thai iced tea, crab rangoon, and the yellow chicken curry all excellent. Best thing about this place is that they deliver to my house. Other thai places in the neighborhood don't. Highly recommend.

Nice little family owned Thai place if you don't wanna drive far. 

It is never busy, lots of parking. 

Give it a try when you are in the area

I really like this place.  We do carry out from here probably once a month and everyone loves their dishes.  The Pad Thai and Panang Curry are especially good, as are their Crab Rangoon.  Definitely our favorite Thai restaurant in the area.

Have been there for lunch several times now.  Very reasonable lunch specials served with soup and spring roll/egg roll. I like the red curry in particular. Place gets quite busy during lunch but there is only one server so the service can be a bit slow.

Mixed vegetables w/ck & spicy beef entree s are great! First time trying Thai Cuisine it was great. Did take out and it was ready in 10mins didn't have to wait. This changed my mind about Thai food.  Only question was the spring rolls wasn't sure about them.

This is a pick-up only place for me. I've never eaten there, not out of spite, it's just easier to pick it up and go. I must not be alone as I've only seen people eating inside maybe twice. The food is typical Thai. They don't focus on making it look nice, but it tastes great. Not worth going out of your way for, but if you work nearby and just need something new for lunch this is definitely a place to check out.

mmmmm .... if you've been looking for something beyond Big Bowl (and who hasn't) then look no further. Thai Cuisine offers light, delicious dishes stir fried to perfection. With inexpensive offerings and perfectly marked seasonings (mild, spicy, and watch out!) you'll be prepared for a taste sensation. This place is never crowded - but I'm hoping to give them more business, they definately deserve it.
Interior is much less depressing than before and the beer selection is with the times.  They've done a good job upping their game

There aren't many bars in Barrington but the Doodle sure is a hidden gem. 

Since I'm from Barrington, I go here every time I'm in back in town. Even though I'm not a regular, each and every time, I feel at home. The bartenders are awesome. The drinks are cheap. Even their food is good (try their grilled cheese). It's a great place to hang out in Barrington on a Friday night. Thankfully, it's not a shabby, sketchy bar in town where old men would hang any more. It definitely gained back it's reputation from over the years.

I started coming here after I graduated college. It's definitely an interesting crowd. It's mainly middle aged to older townies looking to grab a drink with neighborhood friends. Then, mixed in, you have the young crowd who come back from college. 

The vibe, overall, is really what you make of it. Whether you're here for a drink or two to grab a drink or two with a friend or play darts with a group of people, there's really something for everyone. There's a jukebox to the side to jam out on a Friday night and a gigantic Jenga that's always fun to play tipsy. Just fair warning, if you're a townie like myself, you will probably ALWAYS run into someone you know.

My dad used to get bombed in here, along with many other dads, after coming home on the commuter train. I remember being dragged in here once by my father when I was a boy. Probably so he could pay a off a gambling debt and/or knock back a quick shot. It was pitch black in there, as it was only lit by the red glow of an old neon beer sign. This was the kind of bar that people hid away in, a real salty old dive. Those days are gone. 
 The Yankee Doodle is a fun, small pub serving up a surprisingly good craft beer list. The bartenders are kind, knowledgable, and on the ball. The staff is also not shy with a stiff pour in a cocktail. The interior is almost exactly the same as it has always been, except the lights are on and you are not afraid to touch things.  
 So maybe before taking the train downtown to catch a Cubbies game, or commuting home from a rough day at work, or doing one of the kick ass train-stop-bar-crawls, stop in to this old Barrington watering hole and slam a beer or two in Dads honor.

Great ambience to see some locals and commuters coming off the train. Drinks are fairly priced and you can black out fairly quickly if you pregame the right amount. You might see some hardo's trying to play darts but they are usually cool once you get to no them. You might run into some BHS Alumni so be ready to have some conversations. All in all, great bar, great spot, and great vibes! BarBoys

I like this place but all Tappers are down tonight so 3 stars is all they get from me. Sorry no excuse for this as they have awesome beers on tap when pouring including 2014 Goose BCS FOR $9. All that aside a decent little bar right near the train station in downtown Barrington !!

There are not many bars in Barrington and I wanted to check out a place I had not been to yet, so my boyfriend suggested Yankee Doodle. It is sort of hidden in what seems like a mini strip mall in the back corner of the building, adjacent to the Barrington Metra train station parking lot. 

It is a divey bar and not very spacious. They have jukebox and fireplace (but it wasn't on, which would have been great considering it was such a cold night). Washrooms (at the least the women's) were not very clean. The patrons consisted of both a younger crowed (20's & 30's) and older adults; it was probably a 60/40 ratio.

The beer selection was decent. It's getting to the point where I've tried so many beers that not every bar has ones that I have not had yet, but Yankee Doodle did have a few. I can't remember which beer I ordered, but it was new to me and a special of the day. 

The thing that irked me about this bar was the bartender. She was plain rude. I told her nicely I needed a minute to decide on a beer and when I was ready to order, I looked her right in the eyes, we made eye contact, yet she still walked away & basically ignored me. I continued to look up and right at her, an obvious signal that I'm ready to order. She even took the order of a guy standing next to me, even though I had been standing there before him. I gave up and had one of the guys I was with order for me. Surprise, surprise, she waited on him. Seems like she picks the males to wait on, maybe in hopes of getting a better tip. Luckily, there was also another older male bartender behind the bar, so for the next round, I ordered through him.

Another thing that tainted my impression of this bar was during the last few minutes before the bar closed. The bartenders announced that if everyone wasn't finished with their drinks by time the exact closing time came around, they would collect the drinks regardless if you were finished or not. I've actually experienced this at one other bar, but it seems these people enforced the rule more so. I understand the bartenders probably wanted to get out of there as any employee usually does at the end of a shift, but you have to understand it's a bar! It's one thing to keep announcing that the place would be closing soon or that everyone needs to get out (after the closing time). I've seen many bars do that, otherwise they would have belligerent drinkers sit around all night, but to take paid drinks away is plain rude, in my opinion. 

I really can't see myself ever returning to this bar, mostly because of the rude service. I'd rather drive to another town than to go here again, even though it's probably one of the closest bars to my house.
Hidden gem of Barrington.  Surprisingly large craft beer selection and friendly staff.  Real cozy inside.  Food is alright.  Nothing special.  Fun place to be.

Awesome beer selections. Had some root beer beer last night that was out of control. So delish. Something about this hole in the wall that just makes you feel at home. Probably just became a new favorite part of our stomping grounds.

Barrington's finest.  You say Wool St. is too crowded, McGonigal's is too expensive, the Onion Pub is in the middle of nowhere, and the Blue Heron is on the wrong side of the tracks. But wait what's this a bar in Barrington with colorful people and an open seat always waiting for you? Is this a mirage before my tired no eyes? No good sir you are at the Yankee Doodle "a place where friends gather". Grab a Grolsch, put on the Bob Seger, order up the duck tenders, throw some darts, and get ready for the most fun you can have on East Main St.
Nice little dive bar.   Good tap selection and cheap Martinis.

I love this place. I went here with my mom and stepdad before a movie. They are so friendly and they have a ton of beers! The cocktails are also quite strong and everything is pretty cheap. They have outdoor seating as well so if you are a smoker, you won't have to go down the block to smoke. They have a lot of TVs and they even have an electric dart board that they encourage people to use. I thought it was kind of a dive when we drove up but it ended up being pretty awesome. This place is low key with no frills. This place isn't scary at all. I haven't eaten here so I can't vouch for the food.

The Yankee Doodle is an anachronism!   That's why it continues to exist in an upscale suburb, like Barrington.  You don't find many places like that in the NW suburbs,  

There are, in fact few "just bars" left.  I have spent a couple of afternoons in the place, just drinking beer & BSing.  My brother [who lives in Barr.], his next-door neighbor & I find it to be a nostalgic  s_ _ t-hole, kind of like some of the places we used to frequent in our younger day.

Some call it scary!  I really don't see it that way.  Just different from what a younger generation would expect.  It also is the kind of place you might expect to see a bunch of Harleys parked in front of, though, I've never seen any there.  

Anyway, it's a cool place to infrequently visit - maybe once a year.

Amazing customer service, friendly service, super awesome bartender named Lauren mon-wed nights! The owner is always there inspiring games of darts and telling great stories!! Definately NOT the hole in the wall I've been told it was! Great mix of white and blue collar folk after six. Always great specials and amazing burgers and brats. You get 2 brats for next to nothing and amazing crowd of fun friendly people with whom you can carry a convo ranging from economics to the state of the Cubs :) as a vet i find this a great place. Chek it out!

Pros: Strong, cheap cocktails, decent jukebox, comfortable chairs, smoker-friendly,  down-to-earth, friendly staff. There is nothing "scary" about this place, and if you think there is, you've been hanging out at Wool Street too long. One of my favorite bars ever.

Cons: For some reason they see fit to charge $6 for a Fat Tire bomber for which you could pay $4 at Jewel two blocks away.

Sometimes they play the Cubs game, if you call what the Cubs play a "game".

Who decided the 'Doodle needed sprucing up? Sometime between the death knell of the Bush era and the omnipresent suburban smoking ban, someone decided to do the unthinkable: clean up the Doodle. Why? Who knows, but the bar is been replaced with Corian (Corian? What an odd choice of materials) and there are now far too many light bulbs to see the dregs around you. Gone are the days where a thick smoke of darkness would envelop you as you walked in the door. Still, when you don't need 3 or 4 more drinks, and the clock is on the wrong side of midnight - the Doodle is your final destination. Long live the Doodle.

Be white moss with white moss...this place has brewed up some great town alcholics, and is in no rush to pump out more. Alcoholics have been produced at a young age at this watering hole. Right by the Barrington train station and right next to the liqour store. General area is a great place not to own a car. During off season is the best time to vist as there are less lame high school yuppies...cheers!

Do you want to experience what it would be like to be on a days-long bender without the inconvenience of being gone for days?  Do you want to inhale the equivalent of a pack of cigarettes without the added bother of actually having to light up?  Do you want to wake up the next morning and not really know what the last three hours of your previous evening was like?  Then... "the Doodle" is the place for you!!!  A Barrington institution, conveniently located next to the train station for a not-so-quick getaway, the Doodle is a great place to get a load on before going downtown on the train, or just to hang out and pretend you're the town drunk for a few hours.  Yes, it's dirty, yes, it's scary - but I personally wouldn't change it for the world.

Very friendly staff
Awesome food
Huge portions 
Great price
The best cream of chicken and rice soup
Gigantic menu - perfect for everyone 

Love this place!

Wow I can't get enough of these incredible pancake houses in Illinois! And this place was incredible! We ordered a Polish Skillet as well as a large apple pancake...which takes 45 minutes. But was well worth the wait. It was ginormous!!! One or two people couldn't possibly eat this alone, I took it with me and it's so big they gave you a pizza box to take
it in. Our server Patty was sweet and gave us to go utensils as well as syrup since she knew we were staying at a hotel. This place is a must for breakfast.

First time menu is very extensive salad was good the soup was very delicious I had the chicken noodle. The classic skillet was huge topped with 4 eggs. Server was very attentive went by our table many times to check up on us. Place was clean will be back

We came to Bentley's for a late breakfast after trying to get into another local place, but they were packed. Coming here wasn't a bad idea! They did have a small wait, but it was Sunday, and Sundays are busy. The hostess was very nice and welcoming, and understood our frustration about waiting.

It wasn't too long until we were seated. They have a huge menu (most diners do). All sorts of breakfast items from skillets, omelettes, crepes, pancakes, you name it. They also have lunch and dinner items like sandwiches, salads, soups, etc. I was in the mood for breakfast, so I ordered a skillet with pancakes (the pancakes came with it). On that note, you get a TON of food for how cheap it is. My friend ordered crepes, and it came out as pancakes. They were very understanding and replaced them right away. Overall the food was good. Like I said, it's typical diner food, nothing that will blow your mind, but it is very good.

The service was very attentive, we always had full cups of coffee, plates cleared, food came out fast. No complaints there. I would come back!
Trying crepes this time. Strawberry banana it is! Yummy! Place  is crowded but you are seated at a reasonable time and worth the wait. Come join us!

Another good breakfast at Bentleys this morning. Always good service and friendly staff. Plenty of coffee refills to get you going in the morning. So much to choose from the on the menu. Today was simple senior special. Scrambled egg two sausage and one crepe. Cooked just right. It's always good here.

Located in one big ass strip mall, Bentley's has one big ass menu.  It's like a little book, seriously!  Their soups are delish and they offer at least three choices each day.  Most meals come with soup and not a cup but a big ass bowl of soup.   See the theme I've got going on here. :-)  

I had a veggie wrap and it was great.  Lots of fresh spinach, broccoli, shrooms, tomatoes, onions, a bit of cheese and just enough Ranch to hold it all together.  It was delish.  The fries that came with it (I could of ordered fruit for the same price but come on who picks fruit over fries!) were fresh and hot.  My dining buddy opted for two over easy eggs and yep, instead of two her big ass plate had four eggs!

Waitress was good.  This is not fine dining.  The carpet could probably use a good steam cleaning but our plates and flatware were all clean.  It's a pretty large restaurant so they can accommodate lots of folks even during busy times.

Come here for large portions of hearty diner type food and you'll be happy if that is what you are craving.

I had high hopes for a second chance at scoring this infamous Baked Apple Pancake. I called in 40 minutes ahead and had to emphasize a small. They didn't ask for my name.

We arrived and my +1 put in his order. I got my pancake when his soup came out (fine by me!).

Sooo... is it SUPPOSED to be eggy on the inside? It looked crispy/overdone on the outside and seemed WAY undercooked inside. It was completely dense and eggy. Not sure what part was supposed to resemble a pancake.. or even a cake.

Needless to say I had a little bit, but it wasn't very palletable: the eggy batter melded with the apples.. it seemed half cooked and the texture was almost custard-like. I took leftovers home, so I hope it'll be better with a second nuke in the oven. (Note: the texture slightly improved after another 40 minutes in the oven, but it was still unpalletable with NO flavor. Tossed it.) I can't believe we paid $10 for that thing.

Our server seemed really awesome at first, but she ended up being very inattentive. She never asked us about condiments and coffee refills and of course by the time we remembered to ask her for some, she was nowhere to be found (for looong periods of time). She gave us To Go boxes, but our check didn't come for well over 10 minutes afterward. And, sheyut, we were hell-bent on getting a second coffee refill, so that came after we finally got our check.

The girl ringing out the checks was nice and personable, so that was a plus.

I REALLYYYY wanted to like Bentley's. 0 for 2; just doesn't seem meant to be.

It was so nasty that we went in sat down and got right back up and left. The floor had food, napkins, straw paper pieces, and crumbs on it. The coffee cups had food in them, the table still had crumbs on it and the entrance door was caked with greasy fingerprints. The seats were also dirty. I can only imagine how the kitchen is. I'll pass.
Everything was just mediocre. Not good, not bad, just meh.

Good but not great restaurant.  Food is average and will satisfy most customers.  My wife and I stopped coming to this restaurant though because of a very rude hostess. My wife is slightly disabled and sensitive to temperature changes. The older hostess wickedly snapped at us a little while back because she thought we wanted a booth but all we wanted was a table away from the door and the cold winter drafts as people ventured in. Previously we had frequented this restaurant often but I have since taken my business elsewhere.
Far far better than Dino's! Good customer service from start to finish. Servers are very polite and attentive. Breakfast is very good. Give it a try.

A flashback to the old days kind of place where you pay at the front and have servers who pay attention to you. 

Lots of food at decent prices. You can't go wrong when pancakes can be the "toast" you choose with your meal!

Was in the area and I wanted breakfast. Found this on Yelp. The restaurant is in a big strip mall, plenty of parking. The restaurant is huge and the decor is kind of depressing looking, green carpet and burgundy chairs. The menu has a lot of choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner. 
I was greeted right away and after getting seated our waitress came right over. I order coffee which was ok and I ordered the steak skillet. The skillet was two eggs, hash-browns, cheese, mushrooms and onions. I ordered pancakes on the side. My skillet was just meh, nothing special and the pancakes tasted like they had been sitting out for a while and not fresh. My little one had an egg, pancake and bacon with a side of fruit. Our food was just ok. I would not go back for breakfast but might try them for dinner. The restaurant had quite a few people and it seemed to me like they were regulars because my waitress knew all of them. 
Service was good for just so so

Dined at Bentley's several times and like the family atmosphere. Food is typical Greek and breakfast offerings. Wait staff friendly and food prepared rather quickly. Taste average but but they take care to prepare each meal with consistent quality and care. Nothing stands out to knock your socks off, but a reliable neighborhood place to bring the family to for a decent meal.

Came in for breakfast. Walked out after I took a sip of my coffee mug and wiped lipstick away from my mouth...it was all over the side of the mug.

Yeah, I don't wear lipstick. Absolutely disgusting. Wash your dishes.

All I have to say is I order the Saganaki every single time. I love the food. Very affordable and really pleasant waitresses (most of the time). If your waitress does not do the lighting of the flaming cheese, she is lazy and deserves a lousy tip! They usually do it proper. Everything on the menu is decent and you get a lot of food for your money.

Good place for breakfast. Typical breakfast selections that they do very well. Been here several times, the omelettes are particularly good. Nice and fluffy with a good variety.

Place is clean, large and the staff is friendly and fast.

This is our favorite restaurant in Bloomingdale.  Everything we have tried on the menu is great!  Fine service, a varied menu, clean seating area, and great food.  Pete the owner will probably stop by to say hello.  Did I mention that most entree's come with soup AND dessert?  Great prices compared to other restaurants too.
I have to say, this is a 5 star place, great food and great service. Their breakfast is the best and their kabobs are really good, try the chicken kabob, you'll be impressed.

An experience worth the wait.

A Pancake joint busy on the weekend morning, is typical, a premium breakfast place with delicious pancakes, creeps, waffles, and French toast, like Bentley's is well worth the wait to be seated. 

As a local and long time guest, the food, quality of menu, taste of food, overall service, and rating has always been of premium quality. 

I personally love the scramblers and omelets.

I enjoy coming in for breakfast. The food is very good, prices are reasonable and service is A-1 and quick even on a busy day. 

It is located in the Bloomingdale Lake Street strip mall right next to Dollar Tree and Pivot Point. As a testament of its quality, you will rarely see it empty on a Saturday or Sunday during breakfast hours. But the crowd does not impede your ability to get in and out without compromising the food's taste or temperature.

Bentley's is our frequent spot for a quick bite to eat either in person or carry out. We haven't had a meal that didn't exceed our expectations. Portion sizes are amazing and you never leave feeling hungry. Recommend to anyone in the area.

Good brunch place. I HIGHLY recommend the skillet-especially the Athenian skillet. So dang good, with feta cheese, mushrooms and cheese and home potatoes with a side of fresh French toast and hot coffee. Holy cow, someone had to roll me out of there by the end I was so pleasantly full

Love their food, never had a bad meal.

Omelets are great and so are their homemade soups.

Excellent Reuben Sandwich.

Have visited several times

My boyfriend and I stopped here for breakfast yesterday morning. Our waitress was awesome (tall thin white lady with bracelets). The food not bad. However, they lose major points for serving food on dirty ass dishes! We didn't notice till after we ate a few bites. They had to recook our meals. They're also pricey! So, we decided the next time we're in that area we'll drive down about half a block and check out Dino's Caf instead. The customers were standing outside looking happy as if they had just had a healthy meal served on clean dishes. You could see it all over their faces.

My family came for New Years Eve because they had a coupon that expired that day. They were very dissatisfied and disgusted. My father ordered a full slab of ribs, which arrived in two half slab portions. Well, one of the halves tasted like it was spoiled. He requested a new half or that the price be changed to the half slab. Although he would prefer a new half because he was hungry. 

Well, when they received the bill they inquired as nothing had been done. To which the server replied she spoke to the manager but he went home so they would do nothing, but we should be happy they were using the coupon (which had no restrictions)

My mother complained to the hostess, who had been missinformed that he had spoken to them before he left. 

I'm sorry but any place that serves rotten food for full price and won't replace it is a place that doesnt even deserve one star. Stay away!

I work at a small office very close to Bentley's, and I quickly discovered that of allllllllll the lunch options nearby, Bentley's is by far the best value and quality. For less than $10, I can get a delicious homemade sandwich that is a generous size, fries (or fruit) coleslaw, pickle AND soup! Other places offer a lame sandwich and a bag of chips for the same price, how can you compare?! Our office has some picky eaters, and they always put up with our special orders and paying separately, too. Much appreciated!

This place is awful, have been there a few times recently and disappointed every time.  Staff talks more to each other than the patrons.  People at the front counter ignore people waiting to pay.   Food is sub par and Eggs were cold, not good 
Go to Dino's across the street, at least staff Is friendly there.

Throughout Chicagoland you'll find a lot of Greek style pancake houses. Generally superior to the big chains like Denny's, or IHOP the menu's are usually very similar even if the food isn't. One Sunday morning I was out searching for a new place to grab breakfast and came across Bentley's. I decided to stop in and was very promptly seated and handed a menu.

The inside was fairly spacious with lots of tables set up. It's one of the larger pancake houses I've seen in terms of sheer floorspace. After looking over the menu I decided to try the polish skillet. The skillet I received had some nice pieces of polish sausage in it. Some white mostly unseasoned and flavorless potato mush at the bottom. Cheese, eggs and green peppers in it. The quality of the sausage was excellent, as was the cheese but there wasn't a lot of other flavors working here. There wasn't that much egg, and as mentioned the potato at the bottom was bland. 

With my skillet I had an option of pancakes or toast. The pancakes here were perfectly acceptable, but nothing super impressive. Service was speedy, though a bit impersonal and I was left with a decent meal, but I wasn't that impressed either. Overall I'd say Bentley's is an average pancake house and award it three stars. If you're nearby and hungry you won't be disappointed. But it's not worth going out of your way to visit here either.

I finally tried their sandwiches, omelets, and eggs Benedictine.  All were so good.  The service is still up to par.  If you go there enough, the staff remembers you and what you ordered in the past.  They're all really nice and I have never had a problem with any of them.

They have great breakfast, lunch, and dinner here!  This has been our go-to breakfast place for the last few years, and has the best breakfast in the area.  The only place we like better is Egglectic Cafe in Rolling Meadows - we go there when we're in the Schaumburg area.  Bentley's has great skillets, french toast, pancakes, paninis, wraps, and really all of their sandwiches are worth trying.

This is a family/greek type restaurant. It has a little of everything on the menu. Prices range from $7 - $12. We normally go there for breakfast and our favorites seem to be the skirt steak, omelets, pancakes, & country fried steak. Larger portions and we usually have some going home. Love the big side salads that come with dinner and the soups are my little guy's favorite. Good open faced turkey sandwich. Prices range from $7-$12.

I can't even leave 1 star after my recent experience... Normally I would not post something so negative however after waiting over an hour and having nearly every table (5) around us sit down after my family ordered to see all of them have food delivered before we received anything we all left. Our waitress whom told me that she'd rather be home vs being "here" never stopped by with the exception of us stopping her she told us all to "wait" and "I will be right with you"... I will never set foot in this place ever again and I have family that have been going there for years. Sorry but your lack of attention to your clients and clearly not wanting to wait on my family I bid you farewell.

Standard enormous-selection pancake house, with one exception.

A lifetime of pancake houses, and I have never seen this on a menu.  So logical, but never seen before:  With the omelet you have two choices.  Potatoes or fruit.  And then the standards - rye toast, wheat toast, white toast, pancakes, or - what's this? -  FRENCH TOAST.  I have never had that option.  What a great idea.

Two half slices of French toast with my omelet.  Not a stack of huge pancakes.  But a couple pieces of really tasty French toast.  Why doesn't everyone offer this?

Service was excellent, the coffees and waters were regularly refilled, and everything else was a good pancake house experience.  But every time I order an omelet henceforth I'll be thinking about having French toast with it.

So im writing a review of a place so Christina B can shut her mouth about it already.... Got seated rather quick even though the place was pretty busy at the time. Coffee cup was dirty but got replacement pretty quick. Waitress was excellent. Food was pretty good. Had the chopped steak and eggs over medium with hash browns. Girlfriend had the Bentley omelet. She said was very good. Price was right for amount of food you get. Table was clean and was stocked with creamer. Over all a very pleasant experience.

This is my mom and dad's favorite place to eat. It's a classic diner that caters to the senior citizen population (this is by no means a negative comment--just saying the type of crowd that typically hangs out there). 

They have the standard American/Greek breakfast staples; no panache, no new-fangled fusion foods. And really, sometimes you just need the simple stuff. My dad and I came here for breakfast, and my dad ordered something from the lunch menu accidentally. They were accommodating and made him the monte cristo and chicken soup he wanted.

Out of town and was just driving looking for a place for breakfast. What better place to stop than a pancake house.

Pancakes were absolutely fluffy and the omelettes and potatoes were cooked well. 

Service was spot on. Coffee and water were never empty and our food came out promptly and hot.

This place has the most amazing pancakes. I mean, the syrup isn't anything to write home about and yet I can still gush about the pancakes. Hot, wonderful, belly-filling pancakes. Yum. 

The decor is nothing special, but the staff has always been friendly and the bathrooms have always been clean. I don't really care what the inside of a place looks like as long as it's clean and the food is good. 

I will be going back for more nummy pancakes.

We received our drinks in glasses with dirty rims, an easy thing to spot since we didn't get straws with them. The service was slow and below par. The food was okay but not good enough to take boxes home. The price was a bit much for the quality. Your better off going across the street to Dinos and get the same low quality meal for a much cheaper price.
The service was good here but that's about all that was good. I had a coupon and the manager didn't give me the full value of the coupon. The food was average at best.

Soup. I go here for the soup. And, the fact that my husband and son can get breakfast anytime. They are fans of anywhere that cooks an egg properly. Bentley's does breakfast just right. I enjoy a chicken breast on a croissant with soup. Usually a chicken soup is available and I am a happy girl. The restaurant is clean and bright. 

Sadly their wait staff leaves something to be desired. On our most recent visit, my iced tea glass was empty the entire time that I had food in front of me. Our waitress disappeared multiple times (smoke breaks???) and the owner/manager kept looking at me, but never once made his way to the table. The waitress reappeared when we were done eating and we made our way out quickly. 

Will we be back? Sure. I like the soup.

Just moved to the area and trying out all of the local restaurants. The food here was not very good. Food came fast but cold. Tasted like it was microwaved. Service was good. The staff knows their menu.

I loooooooove this place.   Service was good and the food was Delish.  I went with a friend on Saturday around 1130am.  The menu is huge and so much to choose from.  I will definitely love to go back and will be going back.   Very inexpensive.  For two, our bill was $23.00 and my friend had a take out box but I didn't because I was hungry.  I had the catfish lunch.   My friend and her family are regulars here and never had a bad thing from the menu.

There's a Bentley's right in town!?!?  I used to drive all the way to Wood Dale to have breakfast at Bentley's but now I can cut that drive in half.  I guess it's a good thing IHOP on North closed down or I wouldn't have realized this restaurant was here.  Unfortunately, they are closed at 3pm so I can't have breakfast for dinner.  

This place is bigger than the Wood Dale location and they were packed for brunch on Sunday.  There was about a 1/2 hour wait for a table.  It was worth it, though.  Their pancakes are as fluffy as ever.  The biscuit and gravy was tasty and delicious.  I like that they have flavored creamers for the coffee.  The food was great and the service was great.  I cannot ask for much more out of a breakfast place.
Great food and great service! All the employees seem they take pride in what they do and it shows in the product they produce!

Ha, did you know there is a Bentley's in Wood Dale? Yeah, that's where I wrote my original review, but I meant to review THIS place! 
Yeah, Big loser "L" on my forehead. Boooo! 

Anywho, I love this Bentleys! It's busy, especially on Saturday and Sunday mornings. Snagging a seat at the counter is easy on those busy mornings but just be warned, the cacophony of plates clashing at the busboy station and server to cook conversation behind the counter might upset you if you're looking for a quiet morning. 

There's a huge breakfast and lunch menu but I've always gone for the breakfast no matter the time of day. Portions are huge and everything is very fresh. This weekend I tried the veggie skillet for the first time and it was really tasty. The veggies were crisp-tender which to me is perfect cuz I am not a fan of soggy veggies. 

I've had different breakfast items from the Benedict's to omelets to pancakes/french toast and have never been disappointed. Nothing too, too inventive on the menu--basic breakfasts, but they do not disappoint. A big plus is the single-serving of flavored creamers (International delight) on the table. Coffee is hot and strong and plentiful--service is friendly and fast. I guess we're regulars because when the servers remember that I like regular coffee and hubsbie likes his milk served with his breakfast and not before--wow, those things make breakfast a little special.
This place is amazing wow everything that we had was so fresh and well done that for sure we are going to come back kudos for the chef Gabino and for the excellent service from Cynthia our server :)

Went here last Sunday at about 1:30pm with my husband.  It looked fairly busy but we were seated along with another couple right away who sat down at the table next to us.  My husband and I both ordered omelettes with toast/pancakes and hash browns.  The couple next to us ordered a little before we did and the table behind us (family of 4) ordered just after us.  We waited for a very long time and both tables beside us and behind us got their food (not simple omelettes) before we got ours.  Our waitress said ours would be out shortly and after 10-15 minutes did we finally get our omelettes served by a younger man in a dress shirt.  My husband asked him for ketchup, hot sauce and syrup and he said he would be right back.  After about 15-20 minutes of us pushing our food back and forth on our plates, our waitress comes up to us and asked if we wanted boxes.  I said no, we're still waiting for someone to bring syrup, ketchup and hot sauce.  By that time everyone around us had already finished their meals and were about to head out.  She came back, apologized and thanked us for our patience.  Something tells me she could tell I wanted to go off on her but I held my composure.  Quite a talent I must have.  

Anyway, the food was just blah.  The service was poor although the waitress was nice.  I would go elsewhere if given the choice again.

Went here for breakfast a few weeks back and this hit a home run for me.  The food was fast and tasty. The service was solid. The prices were reasonable.   I'll be back soon.   The potatoes were the best I have ever had.
Nice place.   Good food and service.

I came here for a quick lunch one day while shopping in the area.  It looked like your typical breakfast/lunch place from the outside and I figured that I would get a sandwich and go about my day.  When I sat down and looked at the menu, I noticed a lot of choices - but what jumped out at me was a chopped Greek salad.  I LOVE Greek salad, but sometimes it is annoying to eat because what you get is a salad with tons of huge ingredients on top that you then have to take off the salad and cut into pieces.  I asked the waitress how it was and she told me "excellent".  So I went with her recommendation and ordered up the salad with some chicken noodle soup.  The salad was the best Greek salad that I have ever had with all of the classic Greek salad ingredients: cucumbers, feta cheese, Greek olives, peppers all chopped into bite sized pieces.  The soup was pretty darn good too.  This place isn't close to my house and I don't frequent this area too often, but I will tell you that if I even come back that I will come here for this salad.
This place was pretty good when it first opened, but it seems like over the years the quality has declined.  The Wood Dale location is much better.

Hey, its basically a breakfast shop so if you're looking for some exotic dishes...look elsewhere. But for what they do, they do well. Been there over a dozen times and service has always been prompt and helpful. The breakfast menu is the usual fair with a handful of surprises thrown in...Im a bacon & eggs guy but my wife and son were quite pleased with whatever they have chosen. The food is good, fresh and the portions are plentiful. We've only been there for breakfast, so can't comment on their lunch(dinner?) menu but it is sizable.

food rocks, owners are so nice and they now have everyone's favorite waitress working there, sandi. she did work for dino's for a long time and she finally got outta there and i am so glad she is at bentley's. everyone loves her, dino's sucks and we are now going to be regulars at bentley's btw, the chicken parm. is to die for!!! great food and great service. thanks bentley's and thanks sandi for always making our day or night!! we love you!! julie and jerry

This place seems busy most of the time so I figured it would be good. It was ok, but I've had better. I don't like paying a lot for breakfast and I think this place is a little pricey for what you get. Their skillets aren't nearly as good as the Sandpiper in Bolingbrook.
Pizza Bella has consistently great food! Their portions are very generous. I love their marinara sauce, pizzas, salads, and eggplant parm...delicious!!!

I have now had pizza Bella every Thursday night for the last three weeks.  My go to pizza is the sausage mushroom green pepper and onion. But I recently tried the mac and ronni pizza which has homemade mac n cheese and pepperoni on it. The pizza here is what I consider authentic chicago style. I will keep purchasing from here.

The second worst pizza I've ever had in my life. You know that saying sex is like pizza even when it's bad it's good. Not true.


We came in from downtown Chicago for business via Uber and checked into the Holiday Express at 3PM and there was no place walking distance to eat so we had no choice but to order something for delivery. We were very hungry and had an event to attend later so we both needed to eat.
