I tried one pizza place and they didn't open till 4PM and the owner told me that if I ordered he'd have it to us by 430PM but were so hungry that I said no thank you and looked for the next option which was a big mistake. 

I ordered a Veggie Double Dough Pizza and they told me 45 min to an hour so that was no problem. They still hadn't arrived 90 minutes later, so I called them back and the lady who took my call could not find a record of my order. I had paid by credit card so I thought maybe it was the other place. I called the first option and asked if they opened at 4PM was told yes so I called Pizza Bella again and the lady told me that the pizza went out 9 minutes ago. Felling frustrated, my reply was "that's a long 45 min to an hour." A few minutes later a knock came at the door and it was the pizza.

We opened the pizza box and it was very hot, too hot to pick up so we knew this thing just came out of the oven. Then it was terrible. The dough was over cooked and the topping fell off every piece we tried to pick up. What we did manage to eat was bland and next to tasteless. What a huge disappointment. I told my friend the story of Ohio State Pizza being so bad I could only eat one bite, which I may have spit out. My friend said that he's had better cheap frozen pizzas. With this "double dough" pizza all I really ate were the toppings. I think we had two pieces each. We would have been better off with the vending machine snacks in all honesty. 

For being in the Chicago region I had no idea pizza could be so bad and the service wasn't any better. I guess we're just spoiled living in the city. 

When I posted our experience on Facebook the next day my friends comment was "And the idiocy of their poor service - just ....wow".

Terrible experience with Pizza Bella. It's too bad.

Ordered the angel hair pasta w/ white clam sauce for takeout. Highly regrettable decision. The pasta was way over-cooked and the dish was inedible. I managed to salvage what I could by eating the clams and garlic bread that came with the dish. 

This was extremely disappointing as I've ordered from them a few times in the past and had no complaints. I'm not completely cutting them off yet since I believe in second chances (could've just been an off day or could be related to the fact that I ordered an hour prior to closing time), but I will be wary of my next order.

After being dissatisfied with my last two orders, I feel it is necessary to drop my rating of Pizza Bella. The quality and taste of the meals were way off the standard I have come to expect. Last nights meal made me physically sick and had me up all night. Perhaps the reason for the sub par quality was because both orders were placed on busy Friday nights. I'm not giving up on Pizza Bella and will continue to order from them, but they will have to earn their star I took away back.

We ordered from this place for the first time over the weekend.  The food was great and the customer service was even better.  Tony was very friendly and helpful.  I ate my left over pizza and salad today for lunch and it was just as good as it was over the weekend!
This place has catered numerous parties for us and I stop in every once in a while for a slice. I have never been let down. Great tasting food and great prices.

We have been ordering from Pizza Bella for years and the deep dish pizza here USED to be delicious.  It WAS actually the best in deep dish in Palatine.  I'm not sure if they changed the ingredients, quality of ingredients, or staff?  Unfortunately, this will be the last time we order a deep dish from Pizza Bella.  The flavor is very bland.  Also, the calamari we ordered today was tough and burnt.  We requested the pizza to be cut they didn't cut it.  So disappointed that they have changed the quality.

I have found my new favorite pizza place, and that is saying a lot, let me tell you. We ordered an XL Hawaiian pizza with Pizza Bella the other night and WOW. It was covered in pineapple and Canadian bacon with the perfect amount of BBQ sauce. What is with the other pizza places thinking that we want 5 little pieces of pineapple? It was the most delicious Hawaiian pizza I have ever had. 

Also, the girl working the phone was an absolute delight and made the experience THAT much better. I wish I had gotten her name (Wednesday night last week). She was so sweet and patient and actually knew about customer service, what do ya know! 

I also got the Caprese salad, which was very fresh and delicious. Being Italian, I make this salad on the regular and I appreciate your twist putting cucumber in it. Keeps it fresh although next time I will probably keep it just with tomato and mozzarella. 

Overall this place is beautiful and wonderful. Next time I'll try the pasta. Thank you!
Had lunch today, 1/2 Italian sandwich and Greek salad, doz baked clams, Wife had hot wings and shared clams.  GREAT FOOD!!!!!!!
Tony is awesome. Amazing Pizza slices.

Please don't judge but I was crazy busy and didn't cook for Christmas Eve.  I took a leap of faith and ordered the entire meal from Pizza Bella.  We are Italian and take our food seriously, especially where we go for Italian food.  Well, the food was amazing!  Eggplant Parmigiana was delicious, green beans were scrumptious not over cooked or soggy and were in a delicious marinade. Sausage and peppers, same thing - amazing :) Chopped salad was yummy and oh my goodness their chocolate cake, delectable. I wasn't remotely ashamed about not cooking, PB handled it for me and the entire family was thrilled.
Thank you Pizza Bella for a homemade Christmas Eve meal that was delicious. Happy New Year ! See you soon:)
Good pizza.  Good prices.  Steady improvement.  Sauce is a little sweet but not offensively so -- kids love it.

I really like this place for pizza by the slice :) ~$4 for a nice lunch, sure, why not!

They wrap the crust around a thin layer of cheese, gives it a stuffed crust feel. Cheese has an assortment of spices (rosemary and oregano, I think?) that gives it a distinctive taste. It was nice for a fast lunch! Also came with a soda.

Folks were friendly, service was fast- good experience, all in all.

Pizza Bella is my go to pizza joint when I'm having people over. There pizza is delicious. I usually order a double dough cheese and tomato pizza. Their toasted raviolis are are also pretty tasty. 

Service is fairly fast. I usually pick up though. The employees are a  friendly group. 

Thumbs up :)

Really solid delivery service - definitely above average for speed, accuracy and temperature when it arrives. They pile on the toppings, so be prepared for a loaded pie and leftovers. One of my favorite delivery options in the Palatine area!

Never been a fan. But at the office there was a menu and everyone wanted pizza. Especially after looking at the picture on the menu. It looked awesome. 
so we ordered that exact pizza. Boy what a difference from the menu picture to the actual pizza. The actual pizza looked like it was overcooked and deflated   I have to admit it tasted okay. But. Presentation is part of the meal and. This pizza gets  zero stars. And two for taste.  Take a look at the picture above   Real pizza vs  menu picture you'll see what I mean

Finally ordered delivery from Pizza Bella since moving here 2 years ago. Hubby and I were looking for restaurant to deliver wings.  PIzza Bella did just that.

We ordered on a Saturday night about 6 pm.  Ordered online and made special notes about minor modifications to the items we ordered.  Large chopped salad with both olives and pepperoncini on the side and both the Italian and Creamy Garlic dressing, 10 regular Teriyaki wings and 10 "breaded" Hot (Mild) wings with blue cheese dressing and celery.  Affordably priced and, for a Saturday night the wait would be 1 1/2 hours.  We are in the "red" zone for delivery so there was an additional $3 charge.  To be honest, all of this was fine as long as we didn't need to leave the house! :)

When the order arrived in 1 hour 15 minutes, the wings were hot, (we received 10 teriyaki and 12 hot) the salad was cold and finely chopped and all but the celery were packaged nicely.  In fact, the celery was missing and we never received it.  A little disappointing because I love the celery when I'm eating wings, but I did without.  Plenty of dressings included, both with salad and wings.  Incidentally, large Chopped Salad was more than enough to serve two people a good size entree salad.  The Creamy Garlic dressing was UH-mazing combined with the house Italian (kind of like a think Balsamic Vinaigrette).  Absolutely delicious.  When I ordered the breaded wings, I assumed they were boneless.  THEY ARE NOT.  They are simply regular, bone-in wings tossed in a small amount of breading then deep fried - not bad, per se, just not what one comes to expect when one reads "breaded" wings on the menu. Not bad, mind you.  Just not necessary to our tastes.

All in all, great wings delivered, even to us in the "red" zone, hot and crispy.  The Chopped Salad will be a new favorite with the Creamy Garlic and the Teriyaki wings will be in our next order. Both are really, really good.  I'm very excited about this restaurant and we will definitely order again.  

***Four stars is only because the celery was missing.***

The place is small but the pizza slices are f@%$ing HUGE! I ain't kidding... they do not fit in the styrofoam box they're served in and the weight of the slice literally destroys the thing. EPIC.

I made the mistake of ordering two slices, thinking I was gonna chow down... I did, don't get me wrong but I could barely finish the first slice. I painfully opened the box to the second piece of pie and mustered all the strength I could to rip a piece off and get it to my mouth even though I was ready to puke.

The crust is stuffed with mozzarella and it is a hefty crust to begin with... it's so thick and so heavy. Nice bready taste. They fold this f%$#er over on itself for half the radius and it's all cheese inside. Nom nom nom. cheese... bread... need extra sauce for dipping... nom nom nom.

The meats were nothing to write about but they were accordingly plentiful on the meatlovers.

You could feed 2 or 3 normal eaters on one slice for sure.

The overall pie is meh... better than GIANT SKEEZERS or TRIOMINOES or MAMA JUANITA'S or even JABBA THE HUT for sure, and the stuffed crust and sheer size are winners.

For a slice under five bucks thats about as hefty as a medium pie anywhere else PLUS a free soda... They got the best game in town.

3.5 stars and rounded down to the 3 merely on price. 

We tried this well-reviewed pizza place because they're one of a few places that offers a gluten-free option. 
However, I soon learned that gluten-free comes with a hefty price tag of nearly $20 for a small w/ 1 topping (yikes).

Was it good? Oh yeah. Good crust. The cheese wasn't overly greasy. 
My wife couldn't tell that it was gluten-free! A win!

We also ordered a small 1-topping sausage for my son and I.
The sausage was outstanding. The pizza was also pretty good. 

For 2 small pizzas and it being nearly $40 was a bit expensive for my blood but a good pair of pies overall.

Delivery took forever!! Never again will I order here. 2 hours waiting for delivery. We ordered wings and the pan pizza. Worst wings and pizza I've ever had! Horrible taste. Wings were spicy without being flavorful. Wings were very dry. I didn't realize wings could be that dry. We didn't even finish them and we always finish our wings when we get them at restaurants. Pizza was too doughy and undercooked. Sausage on the pizza tasted rancid. It was very expensive, too! Worst experience with takeout ever. Way to ruin a Friday night

Everytime we order I'm amazed at the freshness of the food...like I ordered it and was served in my own kitchen........doesn't taste like prefrozen crap..cause its not.....i will always pay for what I expect instead of like most... complaining about what I didn't pay enough for...but for some reason baffled...free is many times not appreciated....please don't change your quality...loyal customer

Highly Recommend their Deep Dish Pizza!!
They have a great special on Thursdays and give Lou's a run for their money...
Soooo Yummy :)

Yelpers!  The check in offer is no good anymore!  Take it down PB!

I tried a thin crust last night, it was good, a little above average.

Clocking in a have ready time of just over an hour, 15 minutes over ETA, and a fake yelp check in offer bring it down to 3 stars.

My favorite pizza place in the city and suburbs. They have a creative menu, food is priced right, they make an excellent slice, and the service is outstanding. You can't ask for more! Has become the go to place for lunch for us. They also do awesome catering. We use them for all our work and personal functions.

Oh, Pizza Bella, how I wish I could give all 5 stars!!  

I was very pleased the first time I had pizza from there, but each subsequent time has been a total miss.  I even got a free cookie from checking in on Foursquare!

Now, I like pineapple on my pizza, and every single time I get pineapple my pizza ends up soggy and I can't even lift it!!!  I don't know if they're dumping the can with juice included on there but it ruins my appetite.  I just want the nice, crisp crust to support the wonderful toppings, but it kills it when it's all floppy and even visibly wet!  Very frustrating because then I don't even want my leftovers.... *sigh*

Hmph... I don't know why this happens but it's very upsetting.

Pizza should be simple, like picking a mate should be simple.  You should know what you like, what you are attracted to and what is good for you, but sometimes on your path to the best (pizza in Europe, for example) you slum it.  

You KNOW that you should pass the pizza-per-slice place with no one in it, but you could eat a slice and still walk, so convenience beats taste.  You KNOW you could buy the ingredients at the market down the street and use the pizza stone that is gathering dust in your cupboard, but laziness beats... well, most things. 

For the simple combination of dough, sauce, cheese and toppings, the endless choices and risks are substantial.  So, it was with great hopes and slothful expectations that I called Pizza Bella when the pizza craving hit the other night.

Uh oh, strike one: we live .7 miles away and are somehow outside of their typical delivery range, which means an additional fee.  Baffling and off-putting, I continued.

After that, some balls and fouls (to continue the baseball metaphor): 53 minutes for delivery, but $30 for a salad and an extra large pizza with toppings.

Then, it came.  The food was very good and hot.  The delivery man was polite and pleasant in that oh-most-pizza-delivery-guys-are-pock-marked-17-year-olds-or-scary-middle-aged-gentlemen-and-you-are-neither-of-those way.

I would definitely order from Pizza Bella again.  Call it a second date, if you will.

I had never heard of italian nachos before.  I am sooo glad I got them.  They are delish!!!  Fried pieces of pizza dough topped with sauce and mozzarella. Yummmm.  Fried calamari very good too.  Sad face that my order wasnt resdy when they told me.  I had to wait additional 20 min and wasnt even busy time.

we ordered catering for a family party. The chicken Frances  and chicken piccata were the bomb and the chicken was cooked so perfectly it melted in you mouth   On a scale of 1 to 10 the Ravioli were an 11 and as big as your head . Everything was hot and ready ,perfectly cooked and  the staff were great , helpful and professional . Forget Maggiano's , Pizza Bella is the place to  cater from . Thank you Pizza Bella .

Being new to Palatine, from the city, we didn't have very high expectations of any food establishment but, Pizza Bella was above average.

We did delivery.  The food arrived hot and the driver, although lacking a touch of common sense (called me to tell me he was outside but my doorbell looked broken... I advised him to KNOCK and I then I would have known he was standing out there), was a pleasant enough teenager with manners (and even thanked us for the tip we gave him).

I ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich.  It was large, flavorful and had more than enough cheese on it.  The red sauce makes me want to try their pastas next.  I added fries to make it a combo.  They, too, were hot but weren't anything worth writing home about.

My husband ordered the buffalo chicken wrap.  He was concerned that it would come and not be big enough for him but, was pleasantly surprised by its size upon arrival.  The woman who took our order over the phone advised it was made with their inferno sauce and made sure that was OK.  Typically, nothing is spicy enough for him but, he actually had said this was HOT!  He also made his a combo w/ onion rings and those were MUCH more pleasing to the pallet.  They were large, both in size and portion, and were battered not breaded, which is how we both prefer them.  I was jealous I didn't get the onion rings, instead!

We also ordered two appetizers.  
The fried mac 'n cheese bites, which were also hot & fresh, not soggy like many fried foods are when you order them via delivery.
The stuffed artichoke was very greasy and just didn't do it for me.  Then again, I have yet to find a single restaurant who serves one that I like.  Maybe I need to get over the fantasy of finding one that should taste the way I imagine it should?!

The only turn off was that no salt, pepper, ketchup, utensils nor napkins was included in our delivery which, in my opinion, should be standard.

Overall, we enjoyed dinner and will be back to try more of their items!

Pizza was good.  We ordered thin crust and chicago style stuffed.  Then had decent flavor.  Above average taste fresh ingredients.  The stuffed was a little bready. Over all not disappointed but not wowed either. Price how ever was great.  They have a 6 dollar off coupon with 35 dollar order.  Not bad. Lil brother pizza from the cover of there menu was not really what it looks like in real life but it tasted good.
Great food! Their pizza is so good and you cant beat their lunch special! The staff is friendly and they offer delivery!

They make the kind of pizza I grew up with.   The thin crust pizza is really good and not greasy at all.  The crust and sauce have good balanced flavors; not to sweet or overly seasoned spices.  The homemade Italian sausage is outstanding.  Great flavor and a nice amount of heat and seasoning.  The wings are also pretty good.  My favorite are the BBQ wings.  The pasta is just okay.  

You won't be disappointed with the sandwiches or pizza.  One of the best Italian places in the area for pizza.

I wish I could rate this place higher because the sandwiches are great as is the pizza. The pasta however, or as I could call it-soup. So much liquid in there. Horrible pasta. Delivery is also a nightmare. I get that places get busy but if I want to eat this I need to order 2 hours before I'm hungry. Always over an hour and a half to get to me. Ridiculous. Done ordering from here. A tuna melt isn't worth it

This is our favorite delivery place (this place only does carry out and delivery) and has food better than most sit down restaurants I have been at!  Their oven roasted chicken and roasted potatoes (would recommend going with over the baked potato) are so flavorful and tender!  My son loves their garlic bread too!  I'm gluten free and their gluten free gnocchi with vodka sauce is literally the best gluten free dish I have ever had!  The gnocchi has just the right consistency and the sauce is so creamy!  I don't have celiac disease, just a gluten sensitivity that causes me inflammation and joint pain, so I can't speak to whether it is 100% free of gluten, but I can tell you that it tastes so very good!  Their oven roasted chicken is also gluten free, but not the garlic bread of course!  I also get their greek salad, which has everything I want in a greek salad and good dressing on top of that.  My husband has also ordered their meatballs (which I don't believe are gluten free) and their chicken piccata, both he said were very tasty.  All around, so very glad we found this place!

Another great event!  Thanks Tony and staff for getting our pizzas ready on-time, delicious, and fresh.  We had 3 sets of pick ups set for our multi-pack Cub Scout lock in at the Buehler YMCA the weekend before Christmas.  Everybody was accommodating and friendly in spite of the really busy Saturday evening they were having.  It was a zoo in the back! But there were smiles up front.
Many thanks from Pack 339, Pack 59 and others!!

I personally love Pizza Bella sooo much more than Naps comparing that Pizza Bella cost only a dollar more on their slices. With Pizza Bella, they give you out free drinks but Naps you have to pay. Pizza Bella has CHEESE in their crust which is my FAVORITE part of the pizza and its so much bigger and there are more cheese and meat on the pizza.
We've had pizza, apps, sandwiches, it's all always been fabulous! Hot and quick delivery and a great staff! You won't be disappointed!
FINALLY found a pizza place in Palatine that we like - other than Lou's of course. Great thin crust pizza and very generous portions.

Wanted to give Pizza Bella another chance given all the rave reviews. While I enjoyed the pizza very much, I wasn't wowed enough to up my rating to 4 stars.  One of those times where I wish Yelp allowed for half stars. Solid 3.5 from my perspective - perhaps it's just not my cup o' pizza.

The manager was so nice & generous. We mentioned a coupon we saw online and she honored it for us for a free cupcake. It was delicious; gourmet worthy. Of course, the stuffed pizza was delicious, as well. I love the red, white & green neon lights in the window (especially being of Italian decent.) My experiences here are always pleasant!

The pizza here is better than most. I've tried a few different crusts and didn't care for the double dough but, the thin crust rules Palatine! The customer service at Pizza Bella is a home run! They are courteous, friendly and fun. I grew up in the city and am a harsh critic when it comes to pizza. Pizza Bella did not disappoint my tastebuds. If you live in or near Palatine, Pizza Bella is must try!

Welcome back old fashioned customer service!  After a small mishap with our order, the staff was quick to come up with a resolution.   Over the years we have "wandered" to other pizza joints closer to home, but with our recent excellent experience in top notch customer service and delicious pizza...and least we forget the yummy eggplant parm.......we will be back!  

Bravo Pizza Bella!

I've been going to Pizza Bella since day 1. Tony has done an amazing job building this restaurant by consistently offering DELICIOUS food, fair prices and great customer service. The pizza is hands down the best in the area. Try some of their specialty pies like the "the papa" or their bbq pizza. The usual sausage or pepperoni is always hot and ready for slice at lunch. Their lunch sub/soup combo is a great deal!! Subs are made to order and always have the freshest ingredients.

Great food, friendly owner -- check it out!

I still maintain that the gluten free pizza is great but the delivery service is subpar.  Not only do they take FOR EVER, they also act like you are inconveniencing them.  I'm sorry I just spent $25 on a pizza...show up within a reasonable time and be polite.
Best thin crust pizza hands down bar none!! I always order sausage spinach and ricotta toppings..Customer for life..

I love  Pizza Bella. Love. Best pizza in Palatine. We order from here a lot. We love Allie who answers the phone when you call. I've never had an order not be right. We're big fans of the thin crust here. The pastas and entrees are also tasty. We even ordered from Pizza Bella for our son's christening luncheon. Delivery was prompt and the delivery person even set up the buffet with sternos and racks for us. We had tons of leftovers and were happy to have them as new parents! Our guests were all really impressed with the quality of the food and could not believe the food was from a pizza place. Pizza Bella is our favorite carry out place. I only wish they were open before 4pm on Sunday to order pizza for football season!

The pizza is pretty stellar.  The sauce isn't what I would call "my style", but it's very good nonetheless.  Their calzones are what I would call average.  The amazing part was the Italian Nachos.  Highly recommend those.  For the area, the prices are pretty good, and it beats the heck out of papa johns, dominos, etc... any day of the week.

Not only does Pizza Bella have the best Pizza in town but also has the best catering also. We ordered  a large catering order for a family gathering on very short notice and Tony and the Pizza Bella Crew came through with flying colors. The order was on time,ready for pick up and was the best catered food we had in a long time. The meatballs are a meal in themselves and cooked so well that they melt in your mouth. The pasta and sauce were to die for .Every dish was first class, fresh , high quality and delious. Customer service is A+ .

Mixed Bag.  Pizza last night was off the charts delicious.  Internet order was worked to perfection -- large thin, with easy ingredients throughout.  Tonight's almost identical order was not very.  Someone in the kitchen must have mis-read "easy" for "extra" -- layer of cheese was a half inch thick and there was so much sauce that the edges didn't even form a crust.  Brutal!  It seriously looked like my 5 year old dressed this pizza.  Guess the Friday night cook is better than the Saturday night cook?!  In any case, I'm willing to give Pizza Bella a shot at redemption.  One more try coming up...on Friday night of course!

Pretty solid restaurant for carryout. Nice thin crust and double dough pizza. The ribs are nice and succulent. The wings and pasta were alright. But given the prices of the daily specials and numerous coupons, it's worth coming here. It's nice how they also take online ordering and do follow special directions if given them.

As others have mentioned, you expect nothing out of the pizza joints in the burbs once you've made the transition out here from the city.  This is a real pizzaria...guys rolling dough in front of the customers, etc.  I picked up my first order here because I wanted to see the establisment for myself.  Impressive.  I asked for easy cheese and extra sauce on my pizza.  This sounds like a simple request, but many places get it wrong.  Pizza Bella is legit.  No 5 star rating due to the girl at the register with the 'tude.  She was only nice after I mentioned to her that she forgot my garlic bread.  Not a big deal, as it's all about the food with a joint like this.

The pizza is very good. Each part of the pizza is flavorful: the thin slightly sweet crust, the sauce with real parts of tomato in it, the huge amount of cheese, the generous onion, green pepper, and mushroom... 
Palatine named it the best pizza in the 'burb last year for a reason!
I have also gotten salads from here before which were just as spectacular.
I am yet to find a thin-crust pizza which is as flavorful in my neighborhood of the city.
Each day of the week has really good specials. Take-out only.

Ingredients are fresh & generous portions.  Good if you like sweet marinara (I prefer fresh).  After a couple of tries I've noticed the flavors are either non-existent or too overpowering.  They will adjust if you ask so make sure you ask about the dishes flavors when you order.
Mediocre pizza.  We ordered both the stuffed pizza and one of their specialty pizza pies.  Both had way too much bread!  Lots of toppings & cheese.

When you're stressed nothing makes it go away like pizza...Well...there are other things that make stress go away but this week it was pizza from Pizza Bella.

The thin crust pizza is Yelpworthy. Hot, thin, cracker-like, cheesy-saucy goodness. I can't think of other words but it was just really good pizza. 
On a side note, who orders an Italian beef as a side order? Me... I ordered the Italian beef sandwich just to try it out. It was a bit salty and had a scent to it that stated it wasn't as fresh as I thought.

Pizza Bella - I will only be frequenting you because of your pizza. Your thin, cracker-like crust along with your cheesy-saucy goodness. I hope you have my contact info in your database and begin sending me junk mail because it will only make me pick up the phone and give you a call.

Great and consistent pizza, same goes for the other food they serve

The daily deals are a nice option, especially the wings/pizza deal on Sunday for the games (jumbo wings, even though it's only $.50/wing), Thursday's chicken meal is also great 

Can't go wrong on the menu, best pick up/carry out pizza in the NW suburbs

There are local chains and even national chain pizza places I would not order pizza from since I need it to be gluten-free, but I have no fears ordering a gluten-free pizza from Pizza Bella, because they do it right.  I don't eat this way on a whim, I *have* to eat gluten free and I can tell within about an hour if my food was not prepared safely.  Since I found out Pizza Bella had a gluten-free option and I was able to order from them again, I have never had an issue with my food.  Heck, one night, they even had gluten-free cupcakes available!

Pizza Bella is the place to go for authentic Italian food! I have ordered the Chicken Parmesan sandwich and it is delicious! The chicken is larger that what you would get at other places and it tastes much better. I absolutely love the Alfredo sauce. It is nice and thick and is a great compliment to any of the pasta dishes. When you are looking for a snack, the mozzarella sticks are homemade and the best you will ever have! The pizza bread is a nice size portion and is awesome! I would highly recommend Pizza Bella and if there is something special you want, Tony will not hesitate to make it just the way you want it! How many places do that and get it right? Not many! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed and you will want to try everything on the menu!

Two words: BLT pizza

I've had Pizza Bella during raging keggers and quiet, intimate nights, and it hit the spot every time.

The BLT pizza is loaded with mayo, lettuce, bacon and tomato. For an extra treat, I recommend adding chicken as a topping. It's a fairly thing crust, but the toppings make each slice substantial.

Another delicious option is the Italian beef pizza with giardiniera. It's spicy, tasty and unique.

Good pizza!   Nice, tasty crust with good proportion of toppings, and not greasy.   The delivery was quick, and they didn't threaten to call Homeland Security when I asked for it to be cut like a pie.   Definitely a keeper.

They have a great Sunday night special.  We have a few good pizza places around us but I really do like that their pizza tastes the same every time I order it.  No off days, kwim?  

They gave us the wrong pizza tonight.  So my husband called and they sent a fresh, hot pizza right over, no charge.  Thanks for the wonderful customer service!

How have I lived in Palatine for over 3 years and not discovered this place yet?  We've been settling for mediocre pizzas this entire time - when there was the yummiest pizza just minutes away.  

I'm a thin crust girl - and the crust here rules.  Not to mention, the pepperoni was a little crispy too.  Baked to perfection.  Can't wait to try some of the other goodies on their huge menu!
WOW If your looking eat something healthy and fresh at a very fair price PIZZA BELLA can do it. Veggie Wrap its out of this world!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Fantastic! Everything they make is full of flavor and their prices are extremely reasonable. Even their fried appetizers taste great without tasting oily. And don't miss their tirimisu!

Where do I begin?  With the delectable thin crust pizza- just the way I like it?  Or perhaps the unbelievable ribs- that were cut into smaller portions so that we could offer them as appetizers at our party?  Oh, no- maybe the pasta alla vodka... Let me just sum it up:  Pizza Bella is a hidden gem and I will be using them for all my future parties.   Oh- and to top it all off:  they are very reasonably priced!  It's love...

This was the first time we ordered from pizza bella (after our kids had been raving about it).  Delicious thin crust pizza!  We got the brother pete.  It has mushrooms, sausage, spinach, tomatoes, and fresh mozzarella.  The sausage was very good and the spinach and mushrooms a lot tastier than at most pizza joints. We also liked the sauce and crust (parts). The only negative was that the tomatoes were too juicy and made parts of the crust very soggy. Next time i would order that pizza without the tomatoes.  The cupcake was also good!  We will order from pizza bella again.

Me and my girlfriend both had baked shells here....it was horrible. Over cooked bland pasta, dried out and over seasoned garlic bread. I've had better microwave meals from the grocery store. I would never eat pasta here again and would be unwilling to try anything else here.

Excellent pizza and the fried raviolis are unbelievable! I live in Wood Dale and drive to Palatine for the raviolis. I usually buy a couple of orders for the family and one order for me to eat on the way home. They have even delivered my order to me.
Great pizza. It's hard to find great pizza in the burbs but this is top notch ;)
Amazingly friendly workers, always giving me a reason to go back to work with my head a little higher. Sandwiches are yummy and they always get my order just right :)

Don't bother with online ordering! 
A bunch of coworkers and I did an online order which consisted of 5 sandwiches. We stood there at the sign that said "skip the line online orders and phone orders" for 4 minutes before I had to ask for my online order, which wasn't ready and wasn't being prepared until there were 2 people in the line which was 15 minutes after walking in. The staff all looked very confused as to why we were angry. Despite how the food tastes, I will never go to this location again.
We ordered seven sandwiches and all were perfect, chips cookies and drinks. Great job, tasty good sandwiches, will be back for pickup again.

The sub was great but..... 

First off the food.  I loved the fact that they small deli-like area with fresh cold cuts and cheese just waiting to be sliced for each customer!  The associates at my employer received coupon's for any sub as long as we ordered it "Mike's Way."  I was shocked to be able to use that coupon for any sub on the menu!  That was great.  

Now on to the but... When management forgets that they have other customers and loudly handle rude customers its a huge distraction.  While there a group of teens were doing some horseplaying, the guy behind the counter (which I am assuming was a manager) screamed over "not in here - this is not the gym."  At that point the teens looked embarrassed, put their heads down and giggled.  He then screams... "Keep that in the gym at school!"  All I was thinking was, "sheesh it was over and you're giving me a headache with your yelling."  

It was also freezing cold in their.  Don't get me wrong it was raining, so being a little wet may have played a part, but when i rub my arms and says sheesh... and an employee chimes in and says.. I know its cold in here right, Im like come on!  

Luckily the food was pretty good so I will return one day, it just wont be a priority to do so any time soon.

Sandwiches are good but this location is inconsistent at best. I've been given the wrong sandwich (mixed it up with the person behind me) and apparently they like to lock their doors 15 minutes before closing while they stand around on their phones.
Amazing subs! When ordered "Mike's way", tastes exactly like an East Coast sub--just need to bring grinders out this way!
Pretty generic as far as corporate sub shops are concerned. My only qualm would be the excess amount of lettuce that they put on the sandwiches.. really not necessary.

We were doing some yard work at a friends house, and I was sent out to get food for everyone at the house.  They suggested Jersey Mikes.
So - got a couple of different subs, and they were good.
Unfortunately, it was last fall, so can't remember now in March - but nothing bad rings a bell.

BTW - does anyone know how to post more than one review and visit on Yelp of the same location, or do you always have to just "update" your one and only allowed review ????

My parents went here yesterday to try it out because they got a coupon although they really liked the food the guy that they presented the coupon to very arrogantly gave them back the coupon....and said "we don't participate with this"...however the locations name and address was on the flyer...
I believe it was the owner or manager of the place that was extremely rude! The tall guy there. He treated us like we shouldn't have been there. We will never return here again. What a shame!

Went in late maybe closing time ; Guy at the grill made me a chicken philly sandwich ; the chicken was all black ; So had him clean the grill and make another one.
Cook was courteous despite being late and closing time.
cannot tell the taste as I abandoned both the subs.

I have no clue how I haven't been to Jersey Mike's until this point. They stopped in my office and gave us some coupons for free chips and drink with a purchase of a sandwich a while back and my colleague and I decided recently to go give it a whirl. I'm really glad we did. 

They have their ingredients in a deli case and when you order, they actually cut your meat right in front of you. LOOOOOOOVE IT!!! I hate Subway and places like that for that exact reason. Good call, JM's! You earned my business on that factor alone.

The bread is soft and fresh. They could probably stand to use a more "durable" type of bread seeing as they pile on the ingredients. I tried the turkey sandwich with lotsa pickles, lettuce and tomato along with all the seasonings and some oil and vinegar. It was quite yummy. Fresh and filling. I only ate a half which is why I probably should have ordered their smallest sandwich. Note to self for next time.

The staff here was very friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed my lunch break on this particular day. The staff had a hand in that.  Thanks, guys!

I'll be back again soon.

I am a fan of the Chipotle Cheesesteak. Nice people too! They consistently have a pleasent attitude and tend to joke a lot. I enjoy coming here because of the staff and the food. They also offer Vick's kettle chips. 

I usually make purchases with a coupon because it is otherwise pretty costly for fast food.

Solid bread that is crusty enough on the outside, yet soft enough on the inside.

Freshly sliced in front of your face meats are a plus, and veggies look and taste fine.

Reminds me of Jersey, but not quite the same.  Biggest difference is size and price.  At most "mom & pop" sub shops in NJ you get a larger sub at a smaller price.

But while here, get it Mike's way...he won't do you wrong.

I grew up in New Jersey. In fact not too far from where this chain got its start at the Jersey Shore. New Jersey is the home of the sub and no one can quite compete. The bread is always soft inside, but crusty on the outside. The meats and cheeses are piled on. Vegetables top the meat, then always, oil, vinegar, salt, pepper and oregano.

When you leave New Jersey, the further away you get, the more it all seems to change. First, the bread loses its crust. The weight of the meats and cheeses decline. It just never seems the same.

I admit, I never went to a Jersey Mike's in NJ. Perhaps when you are in the state where people expect their subs to be made a certain way, they do. But, I have been to Jersey Mike's in a few states and my impression has been consistent. While the sandwiches are good, they are not Jersey subs.

First, the bread is large and soft - like a large hot dog bun. I say large because they are very bready. I guess bread is cheaper than meat. So, there is less meat that you would get on a real Jersey sub. The vegetables are fine. And, if you get it made "Mike's way", the oil, vinegar, salt, pepper and oregano are all added. But, they do ask you if you want mayo too. To a New Jerseyan, asking that question is sacrilegious.

There are a lot of places to get subs in and around Chicago, and many are chains - Jimmy Johns, Subway and Quiznos for example. While none of these are indicative of a real New Jersey sub sandwich either, their prices are better.

Me and my friends came here after playing basketball we were greeted by sam who had an astounding personality and enthusiasm. The sandwiches were great and the service was better. Definitely coming back!!!!!

Clean, fast, and courteous. It doesn't matter the time of the day or even the day of the week. The staff here haven't disappointed me yet. Wide variety of sandwiches. Fresh ingredients. You can't go wrong! I'm here all the time and have no problem continuing to support this spot.
Good store ! Clean , fast but just need a little better hospitality . I do like the energy toward getting the guests through the line

This is a new outpost of a Sub shop chain. I have never tried them even though I had known about them.

Anyway, a coworker told me that they recently opened, they were packed with people and they had excellent Subs. That made me want to try them.
Ordered "The Original Italian" and "The Club Supreme". Here is my take on the sandwiches.......
The Italian one, not so hot. The meat and cheese was sliced so thin, I could not really distinguish what they were through all of the lettuce, tomato, and vinegar dressing. I thought that the bread was not Italian enough for me either. I like a crusty bread for an Italian sub and this one was too soft crusted for my liking. The sandwich itself was a messy one. The dressing is definitely applied in liberal amounts as attested by the leakage all over the bag. I was not too impressed with this one.

The Club Supreme was a much better sandwich. It too was messy, but had a much better flavor. I could taste the turkey and the bacon on it.
Bottom line is that in my humble opinion, this is a chain and you can always get better when you go to an independent place for just about anything once you find the right one.

I do not go to any of the sub chains, but thought I would try out this one. OK, I tried it. However, I will stick to other choices, such as Serino's or Alpine or Al + Joe's. They are the real deal. Especially with Italian Subs.

Total rating would be 2.5 stars. Since I can't rate like that, I will give them a 3 because the Club Sub was OK.

Cheers to All

Pretty good for a chain sub shop. The employees are usually friendly and the meat, cheese, and vegetables are fresh. My only complaints would be that the sub rolls are often overbaked and the roast beef can be fatty or too rare. Otherwise, everything is pretty good. The free birthday sub (for Rewards Members) is a definite plus. It helps to offset the rising prices (regular subs are now above $7).
The people working here make it a fun experience.  Big portions (even the mini sandwiches).  I hate tuna, but their tuna salad sandwich is good.

Have been to this location 2 times in the last week. Overall,a very good/tasty sub sandwich. The Club Supreme# 9 done "Mikes Way" with oil, mayo,bacon bits with tomato and lettuce/onion makes my mouth water. Meat is sliced in front of you and the line moved fairly fast on my visits here. Will go back soon

Thanks for opening near my office, long-time fan having grown up on this style of sub in NJ. It amazes me that people are still going to the Subway across the parking lot with JM's and Jimmy John's within walking distance...

I decided to give this place a try after hearing two people mention it within 6 hours. Upon entry I didn't know what I wanted being it was my first time there and I was on lunch around 1:00pm. The young man asked what did I want and I stated I haven't made up my mind. Sarcastically he states, don't worry we're only open until 9. I let that slide because I figured that's just there culture. Once I made up my mind I went with the mini Turkey and again (I guess it's a joking atmosphere) I get the sarcasm saying we're out of Turkey. By now I just want to get my food and leave. Once I did get my sub I wasn't impressed. Mainly due to when I bit into it, the sandwich was ICE COLD. Now I understand...it's a cold sandwich meaning not heated but jeez! I swear I bit into ice! I had to heat it up in order to get some enjoyment. But if I wanted a heated sub I would have ordered one. The sandwich was just ok. I prefer Alpine's or Pot Belly's before Jersey Mikes.

This place rocks some serious subs, I am so glad this is in my neighborhood I grew up in the city with Mr. Submarine on western. And nothing has came close till now .. So worth the wait fresh subs made to order.great friendly service fast and o sooo good

The veggie sub was very good. The process using the slicer made the line move very slowly, and although there was a pile of sandwich cards out of reach of customers, the cashier didn't offer me one. I get tired of Subway, so I probably will give this another try. Do wish they had more vegetarian hot subs.

We were enthusiastic customers at first, ordering several times in a couple of weeks.  But then about a month after they opened the sandwiches would taste different everytime.  Our last order (last as in we probably won't order again) had a blast of Oregano so strong that it ruined the sandwich.

Anyway, we did have a few good meals from here - but the last few weren't consistent.
Best Reuben at around here.  I love this plac

Quick lunch idea. So we can't make up our mind on lunch today. Stopped in front of Seriano's and decided on something new. 

Awesome choice, the smell made me even hungrier. Really friendly service and atmosphere. I asked the gentleman in front of me what was good. He literally said "Everything is good here. I come at least twice a week'

Then the sweet nice older man behind the counter was adorable. Who told me every Monday is half off pizza. 

We got a cheese and sausage pizza brick oven and 2 hot sandwiches.

Yum.... Definitely will be back.    ;-)

****I would have given 5 stars but they didn't have rice balls***

I saw Serino's featured on the Yelp Chicago Burbs' Facebook just this morning. I LOVE sandwiches and wood-fired pizza, so of course needed to check it out! 

Since Mondays are half off pizzas, I ordered TWO (3 hours of hiking gives a girl an appetite, and I love leftovers)! My total was less than $10!

+ Veggie - 4/5
I really enjoyed the unique veggies and the tang from the sun dried tomatoes! I wish there were a few more veggies since it was a tad imbalanced: mostly eggplant and sun dried tomatoes.

+ Verde - 4/5
The three cheeses really lent some great flavor..I just wish it had a teensy bit more. The heaping topping of peppery arugula was so fresh!

The crust was delicious and chewy.

Of course I'll need to try more menu items, but as it stands I'm a total fan of Serino's pizza! I just may be back next Monday to try some others!

Tried the margarita pizza and it was very good. The pizza was mostly crust and could have used a little more toppings (sauce, cheese, pizza) but it was still delicious.

Service was great! I ordered ahead (via Yelp) and my order was ready when I arrived 15 minutes later.

I love this place. MONDAYS are 1/2 off brick oven pizzas.  You can get a pizza for $5 on Monday.

I also love their selection of sides that they have at the deli.

Lastly, they have a variety of drink selections to choose from.  You can't go wrong with this place as their food, drinks and service is by far superior to most places around the area.

Make sure you come early as it gets packed quickly.

Cute Italian deli with lots of seating! Has potential, but the woman working tonight was less than friendly.....I explained I had never been there before and would need a minute to look at the menu. She proceeded to stand there and stare at me until I placed my order....I went with the American sub, yummy sandwich and I like that they put the mayo inside the meat so my bread didn't get soggy! Price was fine for what I got. Fine experience, but nothing to write home about.
The breakfast burrito was the dankness. Local, fresh, fast - I ordered mine to go and looked around the deli while I waited. Nice little spot.

Everything I ordered from pizza to deli antipasti, mermaid salad, olives, all had a great fresh quality to it. I will definitely be back for more!! My highlight was the Sicilian chicken wrap, the flavors were phenomenal! 

The prices are more than reasonable. Very affordable, large portions & great quality.

I need to update my review for Serino's. I live right down the street and have been in here at least a hundred times. I was thinking about this place as I was enjoying one of their delicious pizzas and it dawned on me that I had NEVER had anything from this place that was not excellent. Once again, NEVER.
  Always prompt service, always excellent sandwiches and pizza. Try the Serino panini, or Caprese, or the Italian sub, or anything they make. It's all good.
1/2 price pizza on Monday can't be beat. My fave is the Margherita.
A gem of a place.

Cheers to All

They do a better job than most with their Italian subs! Also a very excellent assortment of pasta. Service is very friendly and fairly quick considering how busy they get, which tells you something. The only real downside is if you go while they are busy, it is tough to find parking!

Ever since the Army Trail Rd. restructuring, the ONLY exit out is West! 
Tricky going back east, but worth t.

This deli is amazing! Super affordable, delicious food, and everything is fresh. I highly recommend becoming a regular here...

Just an example, I got a sandwich on Monday but then my boss bought me lunch... So I saved it for Tuesday's lunch. When I opened my sandwich... My co-workers were like "omg, where is that from?" Once I told them... They jetted out to get subs for themselves. A day old sandwich still looked delicious and btw it was still amazing! 


The only reason I am giving 4 and not 5, is that some of the staff isn't exactly friendly. However, most of the girls are super nice.

After seeing the positive reviews on yelp we decided to swing by and pick up a few sandwiches. They were pretty good, I wouldn't swing through again unless there were some sort of deal or coupon. 

I got the 12 inch Pesano sandwich, the bread was good but tough.

The muffuletta was decent but had a big chunk of olive pit that almost broke a tooth. 

The caprese salad was good but it's so basic I would be shocked if someone messed it up. 

Will maybe come back to try the pizzas as they look very authentic Italian.

What a great place for a quick lunch.  I stopped in after a scenic route trek home from River Forest and I'm so glad I did! 

I ordered the Sicilian Grilled Chicken wrap, which contains chicken, swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato (I ordered without), roasted red peppers, jalapenos, and mayo.  It had to be one of the greatest wraps I've had in a long time! So flavorful, and filling. And it was only $4.99, which was a steal. 

They have a large variety of sandwiches, paninis, and subs, and of course they also have pizza and pasta dishes. There's a deli where you can buy cheese, meats, and prepared salads (pasta, macaroni, etc). They also offer catering.

The food portions are very generous and the prices are extremely reasonable. I can't wait to visit again.

Super disappointed! :/

Menu item not as described! ~Grilled Chicken Caesar (Pita Wrap)

I ordered online and expected it as stated on the website.

The meat is actually not grilled chicken breast, but chicken lunchmeat. The romaine lettuce appeared to be standard shredded lettuce. There were no croutons and minimal tomatoes and olives. The green peppers were there. However, no cheese that I was aware of. And the dressing was very watery and more mayo-like than Caesar-like. 
I was disappointed and will not order from there again.
I got the Serino wrap and Italian Ice and both was delicious. They have a drive through (bonus!) and the inside is a great place to grab lunch with a friend. Will definitely be back.
Had a awesome Italian sub , ate that whole nine inch up. Service was nice and very clean atmosphere.
Very good sandwich. Not busy at all around 6PM but couldn't even get in parking lot at lunch. Will be back to try other things.

I now have a new pizza place. Serino's is excellent when it comes to pizza. I haven't tried anything else. My wife likes the vegetarian and I like the Margherita, we share and I've never had a bad experience. 

The pizzas cost about $10/ea. You can add a bunch of different toppings if you want. The pizzas have that authentic Italian taste to them. If you're looking for Chicago deep dish, go someplace else, but come here if you want flavor and quality.

Although I've not been to Serino for a while I'm going to post this review. I used to work nearby and now that I don't I miss regularly enjoying their awesome sandwiches. My favorites were the Italian sub and turkey sub. Bread was fresh and crusty, and no other sandwich shop around gets anywhere close as far as the bread goes. Topped with their Italian dressing these are wonderful sandwiches and a great value for the quality you get.
